Address: Land South West Of Badgall Cottages Badgall Road Laneast Launceston Cornwall
Description: Self Build Single Storey Dwelling
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  outside of the established and definable limits of any settlement, and does not represent infill or rounding off as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030. The proposal  would  represent a residential unit of accommodation in the countryside where no special justification  has been satisfactorily demonstrated. As a consequence the proposed development is considered to represent undesirable, unsustainable, sporadic  residential development which is beyond any defined development limit eroding the character and appearance of this part of the Area of Great Landscape Value. The development is therefore contrary to policy 3, 7 and 23 of The Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph  79 and Section 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Malibu Cottage Widemouth Bay Bude Cornwall EX23 0AG
Description: Proposed replacement dwelling with variation of condition 2 in respect of decision PA19/03272 dated 11.09.19
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed amendments to the approved development by reason  of the increased scale, height  and mass of the dwelling would significantly increase the visual prominence of the dwelling within a sensitive  exposed location, with a high level of public  experience and as such the dominant visual appearance would  be detrimental to the landscape character and visual  amenity of the Area of Great Landscape Value  and to users of the beach, South West Coast Path and footpath. This is therefore contrary to Policy 2, 12 and 23 of The Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Granary Ruan Minor Helston Cornwall TR12 7NA
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved. Detached single dwelling and garage
RefusalReasons: The proposed development raises direct conflict with the requirements  of adopted policy  in the Cornwall Local Plan as the site is clearly  located in the open countryside where new homes will only be permitted  where there are special circumstances, none of which have been identified in this particular  case.  The proposed development would clearly  erode  the rural character of this location by introducing further built development  that would  result in material harm to the character and appearance of the countryside, thus not conserving  the landscape  character and natural  beauty of the Area of Outstanding  Natural  Beauty (AONB) in this location.  The site is not a sustainable  or accessible location for a new dwelling and the development  would therefore  be contrary to development plan policy and cause material  environmental harm  to the rural character  of the area, contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 79, 108, 110, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 1 Tregunnick Lane Seaton Torpoint Cornwall PL11 3JT
Description: Erection of domestic garage with associated works.
RefusalReasons: The site forms  part of a cohesive,  high quality, residential development,  set back from the road frontage with open front amenity areas. The proposed development by reason of its siting would visually compete with the host dwelling  and introduce an inappropriate and overly dominant feature within the street scene, harming the visual amenity of the immediate surroundings. As such,  the proposal  is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, adopted November 2016, together with the provisions of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, with particular  reference to Paragraph 127.

Address: Land At Goonearl Goonearl Scorrier TR16 5EB
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for construction of two dwellings to round-off the residential developments of Goonearl
RefusalReasons: The proposal for two dwellings outside any settlement  and without any special justification results in an unsustainable form of development in the countryside.  The accessibility of the location in accessing modes  of transport other  than the private car is poor which will result in reliance on private  cars for the majority of trips reinforcing the unsustainable  location of the development.  The proposal  is therefore contrary  to Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030  policies 1, 3, 7 and 27, St Agnes Neighbourhood  Development  Plan policies 1 and 2 and the aims at paragraphs 8 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Lowena Road From Junction At Greenbank To Belfry Memorial Feock TR3 6RG
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling and reconstruction of new dwelling with removal of condition 9 of decision C1/8901797H dated 14/02/1990
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal to remove the parking restriction  under Condition 9 of decision C1/8901797H does not provide  a suitable alternative off road parking  provision for the cottage currently known as Blue Cottage and would  be contrary  to Policies  13 and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 11 and 127 (a)of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.  It is considered that the parking  condition  is still necessary and accords  with the tests for conditions as set out in paragraph  55 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Arwenack Hotel 27 Arwenack Street Falmouth TR11 3JE
Description: Change of use from apartment (Use Class C3) and 12 bedroom hotel (Use Class C1) to large house in multiple occupation (Sui Generis) comprising of 5 flats
RefusalReasons: The proposed change of use from an apartment and 12 bedroom hotel to a large House  in Multiple Occupation (HMO) fails to promote housing to accommodate the needs of different groups  in the community,  including  families, to the detriment of a sustainable, inclusive and mixed community.  For this reason the application is contrary to Policy HM01 of the emerging  Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019 to 2030 (Submission Version July 2019),  Policy 1 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 7 and 8 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 15 Prosper Hill Gwithian Hayle Cornwall TR27 5BW
Description: Conversion of traditional stone barns to three dwellings with variation of condition 2 in relation to decision notice PA16/02770
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed re-development, by virtue of its scale,  form and uncharacteristic domestic appearance, would constitute a discordant element in the landscape that is unsympathetic to the character  of the existing  historic barns, it would fail to promote local distinctiveness and would have an adverse impact on the barns which would fail to enhance their immediate setting.  The proposal as such raises conflict with policies 2, 7, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies (2010-2030), with policy GGP9 of the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Plan (2016-2030) and with paragraphs  127 and 184 of the National Planning Policy  Framework (2019).

Address: Land South Of Home Farm Plantation Troon Cornwall TR14 9JW
Description: Prior approval for the erection of a general purpose agricultural building for the storage of hay.
RefusalReasons: With a proposed footprint  of 30m by 12m, and a ground to ridge height of 5.2m, the size of the building  is considered excessively large in this location.  Given  the large scale of the proposed agricultural building  together  with its siting which is in an elevated position within  the landscape and immediately adjoins a public right of way, the development  proposal  would dominate its setting and fail to conserve  the strong and distinctive characterics  of this sensitive and open landscape. As the area is designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value, where the primary objective  is to conserve and enhance the landscape, the identified harm is intensified. The proposed building due to its siting, scale and external appearance  would have a harmful impact on the landscape and is therefore considered to be in conflict  with policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: Land West Of Canfield Week St Mary Holsworthy Cornwall
Description: Outline application for the erection of a dwelling with all matters except access reserved
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location outside of and behind  the clearly defined urban form of the settlement,  the intrinsic, open rural character  and appearance  of the site and with limited physical  barriers (other than hedgerows  and hedgebanks repeated beyond  this site) to its north  and west, does not round off or infill the settlement. It visually  extends the built form into the countryside eroding the character  and appearance of this part of the Area of Great Landscape Value. In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  it, the proposal represents an unsustainable  and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence  of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 3, 7, 9, 21, 23 and ENV1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraphs 79 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: 6 Coolbeg Close Killigarth Looe Cornwall PL13 2FA
Description: Application for works to trees to reduce heavy branches of Monterey Cypress tree.
RefusalReasons: The tree covered  by the Tree Presevation Order and subject to this application forms a valuable  contribution to the landscape and has high amenity value  for the area. The pruning  proposed  would have a detrimental impact  to said public amenity and to the health of the tree. Insufficient justification or arboricultural evidence has been given as to why the propoesd works  are necessary.  As such the application  should be refused.

Address: The Barn At Rosecare Villa St Gennys Bude Cornwall EX23 0BG
Description: Change of use from B1 office space of Osteopathic practice to C3 residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposal,  given  its limited floor area, scale, materials and appearance, the building  is not considered appropriate to retain and re-use for residential purposes and results  in cramped residential accommodation which would not achieve a good standard of amenity for future  occupants. It also represents a more isolated dwelling  in the countryside and enhancement to the setting is not considered so overriding or to represent special circumstances which would overcome the harm identified. As such,  the proposal is contrary to Policies 7 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016)  and the minimum floor area set out in the Technical housing  standards nationally described space standard, March 2015.

Address: Highcroft Porkellis Helston Cornwall TR13 0LH
Description: Lawful development certificate for a proposed new conservatory
RefusalReasons: The proposed construction of the front extension does not constitute permitted development as it fails to comply with Class A.1 (e)(i) of Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 because it would be located on the principal elevation of the original dwellinghouse. Therefore a planning application is required to be submitted to the local planning authority.

Address: Fairhaven Dobbin Close Trevone Padstow Cornwall PL28 8QS
Description: Proposed extensions
RefusalReasons: The garage and roof extensions  will by reason of their scale, massing, height and proximity to the southern boundary be dominating and overbearing features that will be oppressive to the outlook  and residential amenity of Keston  and Greystone.  In so doing the proposal does not represent good design  and causes conflict with Policy 12 and by extension policy 2 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030

Address: Land Adj To Valley View West End Townshend Hayle Cornwall TR27 6AQ
Description: Proposed dwelling.
RefusalReasons: By reason of the restricted size of the plot which will be predominantly covered by the footprint of the dwelling,  parking and turning areas, the proposal will represent a cramped, contrived form of development resulting in inadequate  outdoor  amenity space provision for future  occupiers.  Such development will result  in substandard living conditions for future residents and fails to promote health and well-being through good design and layout.  The proposal  is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 16 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, paragraph 127 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and supplementary planning guidance in section 5.5 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013.

Address: Land West Of Marlee Treburley Launceston Cornwall PL15 9NS
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved for the erection of two dwellings (access only)
RefusalReasons: The application site is considered to make a positive contribution  to the rural character and setting of the settlement of Treburley. The proposed development of the site would represent further incremental growth of the built form extending the existing  settlement into the countryside, eroding the rural character and appearance of the Area of Great  Landscape  Value. The benefits of the scheme do not outweigh  the development  plan position and the harm to the rural character of the area. The proposed  development is therefore considered to be contrary to policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 and saved policy ENV1  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and guidance  contained  within paragraphs 8, 48, 79, 117 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trebean Fore Street Madron TR20 8SH
Description: Removal of existing garage and store, construction of new garage, store and studio
RefusalReasons: In extending the footprint of the garage/store so as to be in close proximity to the terrace and in significantly increasing the eaves height,  ridge height, and massing of the building, the proposed development would appear as overly-domineering, out of character and harmful in the context of the adjacent historic terrace, and would  fail to preserve the character  and appearance  of the Conservation AreaThe proposed  works would  materially  reduce the existing visual quality and character  of the setting  of the historic terrace and streetscape, and would  be harmful  to the character and appearance of the Conservation  Area. The works are considered to raise design concerns that cause harm and that are not balanced  by other factors acting  in the public interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore  contrary  to Policy  12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and Policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 4.9, 7.3, 7.4, 7.7 and 7.10 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 124, 127-128,  130, 184, 185, 189, 190, 192, 193 and 196-197  of the National Planning Policy Framework.  The proposed development does not accord  with the local planning  authority's statutory duty under section  72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would  not preserve or enhance the character and appearance  of the Conservation Area.

Address: Land West Of Busveal Farm Busveal Redruth Cornwall TR16 5HF
Description: Proposed New Dwelling
RefusalReasons: Paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 defines open countryside as the area outside of the physical boundaries of existing settlements.   The site is outside the settlement of Busveal  and due to the site location  which does not have an existing  defining edge to the north would not constitute infill or rounding off. The development would cause  material harm by extending the built form into the open countryside.  The proposal is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, Policy 1 of the Cornwall  Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 3 Trenerth Cottages Hayle Road Leedstown TR27 6DG
Description: Conservatory to the front of the property.
RefusalReasons: Due to its design, scale,  and front location, the proposed  conservatory  would  introduce an incongruous non-traditional feature to a prominent elevation  of a dwelling  resulting in a development that would be of an inappropriate scale and character to its location generating harm to the setting  and appreciation of the World  Heritage Site. The development fails to take into account the historic context  of the application site and traditional vernacular and would therefore fail to preserve or enhance the appearance of the World Heritage Site. The proposed  development  would  result in less than substantial harm due to the scale of the proposed  development compared to that of the site and wider World  Heritage Site.  The public benefit arising from the provision of relatively minor building  works would  not outweigh  the harm to the designated  heritage asset. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 paragraphs 127, 130, 184, 192, 193, 195, and 197,  of the National  Planning Policy  Framework 2019, Policy HT4 Design of the Crowan Parish Neighbourhood  Development Plan 2017 -2030 successful at referendum 22 August 2019  and  Policies P3 and C7 of the West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013-2018.

Address: Waters Edge Cottage Wheal Dream St Ives Cornwall TR26 1PR
Description: Front Balcony
RefusalReasons: The proposed balcony, due to its design, scale, and location,  would be an incongruous  feature that would have a significant  detrimental impact upon the building itself,  the setting of nearby Listed  Buildings,  and the character and appearance of the Conservation  Area in general.  It is considered that when the front elevation  of the adjacent dwelling No.4 is viewed  in the context of the unspoiled front elevation of the adjacent dwelling  'Tregurtha' to the south, the detrimental impact  and erosion  of such works upon the character and appearance  of the locality are clearly demonstrated.  The proposal  would  introduce an incongruous, non-traditional feature  to the prominent front elevation  of a traditional dwelling  located within  a Conservation Area, which is considered unacceptable. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 24of the Cornwall Local Plan, paragraphs 2, 7, 8, 11, 30, 124, 127, 189-202 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy BE4 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan (adopted  29th December 2016)With regard to Section 72 (1) of Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 c.9, it is considered that the proposal does not preserve the character  or appearance of the Conservation Area.

Address: Land Adjacent Myrtle Cottage Trewedna Water Perranwell Station Cornwall TR3 7PH
Description: Proposed conversion of garage and workshop to residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its open countryside location detached  from any definable settlements, represents an unsustainable form of development in the countryside for which no special circumstances have been demonstrated.  By virtue of its design, in particular the significant increase  in height, the proposed  development would  increase the prominence of the built form in this location, harmfully urbanising the strong rural characteristics of this open and rural landscape.  The proposal therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material  considerations which  outweigh such harm,  the proposal is contrary to policies 1, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies  GQD1, GQD2,  H3, H4 and LL4 of the emerging Gwennap Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2019 - 2030.

Address: Long Island Trevillett Tintagel Cornwall PL34 0HL
Description: Proposed extension to provide a garden room and utility room on ground floor and lounge on upper floor.
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension and enlargement of the dwelling, by reason of the bulk and scale of the extension would dominate and be incongruous to the form, layout and ridge height of the exiting dwelling and is not considered to conserve the scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty or Heritage Coast. It is therefore considered to be contrary to Policy 12 and 23 of The Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 -2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Lower Tregunnon Altarnun Launceston Cornwall
Description: Provide base for and locate static mobile home for relative occupancy.
RefusalReasons: The proposed static  caravan to be used as annexe accommodation, by reason  of its separation (over 100m) from the principle dwelling,  position  outside of the principle dwellings curtilage and lack of clear justification represents a self-contained  residential unit in this open countryside  location. By reason  of its rural location outside  of a clearly defined settlement it does not round off or infill the settlement and visually  extends development into the countryside eroding the character  and appearance of this part of the Area of Great Landscape Value.  In the absence of any special  circumstances  to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic  form of residential  development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 21, 23 and ENV1 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November  2016)  and paragraphs 79 and 170 of the National  Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Home Farm Trebarwith Road Delabole Cornwall
Description: Outline application for the erection of one dwelling with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: In the absence  of an adequate, robust and detailed  noise assessment, which meets the requirements of BS4142:2014 and BS8233:2014,  the application  fails to demonstrate that the impact  of noise from the farm and other noise sources with insufficient detail of the proposed mitigation to determine  that the impact  on the proposed  dwelling would be acceptable. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 2 and 12 of The Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 and 182 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Otterham Park Otterham Camelford Cornwall PL32 9SL
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved (appearance, landscaping, layout and scale reserved, access to be decided) for the erection of up to three dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by reason of its open countryside character, located beyond the established settlement of Otterham Station, is considered to represent an undesirable form of residential development in the open countryside, the site is not considered  to constitute suitable 'infill' or 'rounding off' of the settlement  in this location and the site does not constitute previously development.  This development would result in encroachment  into the open countryside which would be harmful to the rural character and appearance of the locality.  The development is thereby contrary  to policies  2, 3, 21(a) and 23 (1) in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, saved policy ENV1 in the North Cornwall Local Plan Part 1 and Part 2 (adopted  1999).

Address: Gwel An Nans Tolgus Place Redruth Cornwall TR15 1BB
Description: Outline planning consent for the construction of dwelling with some matters reserved, except the point of access
RefusalReasons: Paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 defines  open countryside as the area outside of the physical boundaries of existing settlements, where they have a clear form and shape. In this case, the application site is not considered  to comply with planning policies concerning new windfall residential development  in this area, and is therefore  considered to be situated in the countryside as opposed  to within the Redruth urban area. Furthermore, the site is considered to relate more closely in a physical  and visual sense to the surrounding  countryside rather than the urban area. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; Policy 1 of the Cornwall Site Allocations  Development  Plan Document;  and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Pentreath House Pentreath Lane The Lizard Cornwall TR12 7NX
Description: Proposed development of two dwellings and associated works
RefusalReasons: Due to the site's position in the countryside  beyond the established settlement  limits of The Lizard, it is not well related  to its physical  form and its development for housing would not constitute suitable 'infill' or 'rounding off' of the settlement  in this location.  The development  of this prominent and large gap for two dwellings,  which provides  an important landscape setting to the village,  would domesticate the existing largely rural character and result in significant built form and harmful  urban  encroachment where there presently is none.  It is contended this would be harmful  to the rural character and appearance of the locality  and would not conserve  or enhance the landscape character  and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty (AONB) in this location.   The development  is thereby  contrary  to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy 1 in the Cornwall Site Allocations  Development Plan Document 2019 and paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North East Of Badgers Holt Nance Trink Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: New dwelling
RefusalReasons: The site is an undeveloped  plot of land lying in the open-countryside  at Nance to the south of St Ives. Despite  lying in close proximity  to a small number of residential  properties it is clearly outside of any existing settlement. The proposal  for new open market residential  accommodation would thereby  conflict with policies 1 and 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030)  and with paragraph 8 of the NPPF (2019) which  seek to ensure that new development is sustainably located.  Furthermore, no special justification has been submitted in support of the application that might allow for its support under  policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) or paragraph 79 of the NPPF (2019).

Address: Land At Rosewarne Downs Rosewarne Downs Camborne Cornwall
Description: Construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1.The application  site is not located  at or is well related to the town of Camborne, and the 3 properties to the north of the application site, namely Rosewarne  Mill, Rosewarne Mill House, and Cornacre do not constitute a settlement as it is a low density straggle  of development.  As such the site is considered to be in open countryside and the proposal for a new unfettered  dwelling  does not accord  with any of the special circumstances  in policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.  The proposal would result in the introduction of sporadic unjustified built form into the countryside. The encroachment into the countryside  would alter its character  and appearance thereby  harming its intrinsic  character and beauty. The proposed development  conflicts with the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 3, 7 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 170 of the NPPF 2019.

Address: Pendeen Womens Institute Boscaswell Road Lower Boscaswell Pendeen TR19 7EG
Description: Redevelopment of redundant Womens Institute site by construction of two three bedroomed detached dwellings and ancillary works with variation of conditions 2 and 7 in relation to decision notice PA17/11723
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed brick lintels and quoins, whilst not necessarily uncommon on older industrial/ecclesiastical buildings  in the area, are considered to be harmful and incongruous features on the proposed dwellings, which  would  be out of character  with the prevailing character  of development in the surrounding  area. Whilst the harm is considered to be less than substantial, there are not considered to be proportionate public benefits  which outweigh the harm.  The proposal is therefore considered to fail to at least preserve  the character or appearance of the Pendeen Conservation  Area, and to conflict with the aims and intentions  of S72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings  and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 127, 184, 192, 193 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Former Council Highways Depot St Golder Road Newlyn Penzance Cornwall TR18 5QW
Description: Construction of building for use for net making and storage with associated parking area and service yard. Proposed visibility splay at junction with B3315 (Revised submission following withdrawn application PA18/06684)
RefusalReasons: By reason of its siting  in a countryside  location which is not well-integrated with the settlement of Newlyn  and the consequential landscape harm that would  occur, the lack of an overriding locational and business  need for the substantial development to be situated in this location, and the harm that would be caused  to the historic  boundary wall and trees along the B3315 public highway in order to improve emerging  visibility,  the proposal is considered to unacceptably  harm the natural and historic environments at the north-western  edge of Newlyn, and in a manner which is not outweighed by the acknowledged economic and social benefits of the development.  The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 8, 83, 84, 110, 127, 170 and 197 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Chiverton Lane Orchard Perran Downs Lane Rosudgeon Cornwall TR20 9HQ
Description: Retention of extensions to dwelling, erection of extension to south elevation and change of use of land to domestic curtilage
RefusalReasons: The proposed change of use of land to domestic curtilage, retained extensions and proposed extension is considered to represent an unjustified encroachment into the open countryside.  Such an encroachment of this scale and proportion together  with associated domestic paraphernalia  would  be harmful to the character  and appearance  of the rural locality and the character of the World  Heritage Site. The proposal  would  lead to less than substantial harm to the significance of the World  Heritage site, but such harm is not outweighed  by any public  benefit.  The  proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 184 and 196 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of 1 Godolphin Court Godolphin Court Godolphin Bridge Townshend Cornwall TR27 6AR
Description: Construction of One Residential Dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development raises direct conflict with the requirements  of adopted policy  in the Cornwall Local Plan as the site is clearly  located in the open countryside where new homes will only be permitted  where there are special circumstances, none of which have been identified in this particular  case.  The proposed development would clearly  erode  the rural character of this location by introducing further built development  that would  result in material harm to the character and appearance of the countryside on a site that is highly visible from the adjoining public  highway.  The site is not a sustainable or accessible location for a new dwelling and the development would  therefore  be contrary to development plan policy and cause material  environmental harm to the rural character of the area, contrary  to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  79, 108, 110 and 170 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 14 Meadowbank Mylor Bridge TR11 5SW
Description: Construction of new dwelling and formation of two parking spaces each for existing and proposed dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its scale,  height and proximity to the boundary with No. 34 Bells Hill, will be un-neighbourly.  The development is considered to cause an unacceptable degree  of over-bearing to No. 34 Bells Hill, and also create a sense  of enclosure and loss of light in the mornings to the neighbours rear garden. The proposal  will also overlook the rear garden  of No. 13 Meadowbank from the first floor bedroom windows. The development is considered to be contrary  to Policy 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and paragraph 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land To The Rear Of 9 Mount Camel Camelford Cornwall PL32 9UW
Description: Erection of two 2-bedroom detached dwellings.
RefusalReasons: The positioning of the properties and their proximity to site boundaries  and neighbouring properties are such that they would be overbearing on neighbouring  dwellings.  The dwellings have a cramped and contrived layout that is out of character  with the surrounding properties and which  also results in substandard levels  of private external amenity space, vehicular turning areas, and would  also overlook neighbouring properties. The application  is therefore contrary to policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph  127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: 6 Penally Court Penally Hill Boscastle Cornwall PL35 0HG
Description: Material change of the use of the land for the stationing of a caravan to be used as ancillary accommodation (resubmission of PA19/01151)
RefusalReasons: By reason of its nature, scale, and siting  outside  the residential  curtilage of 6 Penally Court, it is considered that the proposed  development would be physically separated and not closely related to the principle dwelling. The location of the proposed caravan is not in a sustainable location.   The proposal represents unsustainable development in the countryside and the caravan is considered to be harmful  to the character  and appearance of the Conservation Area and AONB. This is therefore contrary to Policy 1, 2 (subsection 1), 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Paragraph 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Lymington Cottage Tarrandean Lane Perranwell Station TR3 7NP
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for proposed new dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic  form of development in the countryside,  extending the built form of the settlement into the countryside  and promoting a reliance  on the private vehicle for journeys to everyday essential services.  The proposed development would  fail to comply with any of the criteria set out in Policy 3 (3) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, nor provide  any special circumstances  to justify  the proposal under  Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030. The proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 2(1), 3 (3), 7, 21, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 78, 79, 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land NNE Of Cemetery Chenhalls Road St Erth TR27 6HN
Description: Construction of new dwelling and private access to estate road
RefusalReasons: The application  site is situated outside of the settlement boundary of St Erth, shown on Map 2 of the St Erth Neighbourhood Plan 2017 - 2030. Furthermore, the site is not considered to be a small gap in a continuous built frontage at the northern edge of St Erth; rather, its development would have the effect of physically and visually extending  the settlement  into the open countryside. The proposal  is therefore  considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies HI1 and HT2 of the St Erth Neighbourhood Plan 2017 - 2030; and policies  1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Peartree Farm Trannack Helston TR13 0DQ
Description: Proposed Agricultural Worker's permanent dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development raises direct conflict with the requirements  of adopted policy  in the Cornwall Local Plan as the site is clearly located in the open countryside where new homes will only be permitted where there are special  circumstances.  In this case, it has not been adequately demonstrated at this stage that there is up to date evidence of an essential need of the rural enterprise  for the applicant to reside  in a permanent dwelling in this location and that the business  will remain  viable in its own right for the foreseeable future.  In the absence  of such justification, the development would clearly erode the rural character of this location by introducing further built development that would result in material harm to the character  and appearance  of the countryside and the site is not a sustainable  or accessible location for a new dwelling.  The development is therefore  unsustainable and would cause material environmental  harm to the rural character of the area, contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 79, 108, 110 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Site East Of Trewindies Trelake Lane Treknow Tintagel Cornwall PL34 0EW
Description: Residential dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location outside of the definable urban form of Treknow and with limited physical barrier to its north and west,  does not round off the settlement and visually extends  the built form into the countryside eroding  the character  and appearance of this part of the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty and Heritage Coast, In the absence of any special  circumstances to justify  it, the proposal  represents  an unsustainable  and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material  considerations  which outweigh such harm, the proposal  is contrary to policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB  Management Plan 2016-2021,  policies 1, 3, 7, 21, 23 and ENV1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016), and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of Stone Park Bude Cornwall
Description: Outline application (with all matters reserved except access) for the construction of up to 2 new dwellings and associated works and landscaping
RefusalReasons: The proposed development lies within a straggle of development  in the open countryside which is detached  from any clearly  definable  settlement, services and facilities. The proposal does not infill a gap in an otherwise continuous built up frontage and does not qualify  as infill development. The proposal  represents  an undesirable, unsustainable and sporadic  form of development  in the countryside for which no special circumstances have been demonstrated.  The proposal is therefore contrary  to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land South Of Creaz An Bre Chegwyns Hill Foxhole Cornwall PL26 7UY
Description: Application for outline planning permission with all matters reserved for the construction of a dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  outside of the established and definable limits of any settlement, and does not represent infill or rounding off as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030. The development therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic  extension of the built form of Foxhole into the countryside to the detriment of the distinctive natural character  and beauty of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context,  the proposal  does not represent sustainable development  and would be contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 170, 184 and 192 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Kelynack Caravan Park Crippas Hill St Just TR19 7RE
Description: Use of part of caravan site for the storage of caravans and use of paddock for seasonal camping with non compliance of Condition 4 (holiday accommodation use) in relation to decision notice PA13/06515
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is in a location where unrestricted residential  use would not be supported. The proposal to remove the holiday  use only restriction  does not represent sustainable development  and would  be contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.  It is considered that the holiday condition is still necessary  and accords with the tests for conditions as set out in paragraph 55 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Little Wild Campsite Balwest Ashton Helston Cornwall TR13 9TE
Description: Change of use of land to extend the holiday season of an established campsite.
RefusalReasons: By reason of its isolated countryside  location  with limited  potential  for access to facilities, services and goods other than by private  motor vehicles  which would necessitate occupants being reliant on unsustainable  travel movements,  coupled with its visual prominence when viewed from the surrounding network  of public footpaths  and highways, it is considered that the proposal would be unsustainably  located  and would harm the rural character of the surrounding, distinctively open and attractive  landscape.   As a result, the development  will result in less than substantial harm to the significance of the Tregonning Hill Conservation Area and will therefore fail to accord  with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because  it would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance  of the Conservation Area.  The proposal is therefore considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies 2, 5, 23, 24 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 83, 84, 103, 108, 110, 170, 194 and 196 of the National  Planning  Policy Framework  2019.

Address: 10 Century Close Helston TR13 8FE
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed use to change conservatory into a sun room.
RefusalReasons: The proposed rear extension is not considered to be permitted under the Schedule, Part 1, Class A(g) of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, as the proposed development, not withstanding the existence of the conservatory, extends more than 4m from the wall of the original dwelling. Moreover General Permitted Development Rights were restricted under Condition 5 of the original planning permission W2/PA88/00165/S19.

Address: Land West Of 23 Gwealhellis Warren Helston Cornwall TR13 8PQ
Description: Erection of a dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: The development  would result  in the loss of an area of public open space  that has not been demonstrated to be surplus to requirements, and no suitable replacement open space has been proposed. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 13, 16 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 97 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.  In addition,  the increase in the built form will have an adverse impact on the street scene contrary to policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010- 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Gears Cottage East Gears Lane Goldsithney Cornwall TR20 9LD
Description: Detached Dwelling, Garage and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The site is outside of the physical  boundaries of the existing settlement of Goldsithney and is therefore open countryside as defined under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The site has a distinctly rural character  which is derived from the narrow width of the unmade access  lane which is bound  by trees and hedgerows and the absence of footpaths along much of its length,  as well as fields to the east, north, south-west and beyond the two existing properties to the west. The introduction of built development  and day to day activity into an area that is currently tranquil would  be harmful to the character and appearance of the countryside. The proposal is contrary to policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Heather Brae Newmill Penzance Cornwall TR20 8UY
Description: Conversion of Barn to Form Dwelling and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The development  proposed  will significantly alter the utilitarian appearance of the building which at present does not detract from this rural landscape.   The building is at present used for the stabling of horses and not considered to be a redundant  rural building. The proposed alterations to the building, by virtue of its design, in particular the raising of the roof and the window openings, result in a building more akin to an urban bungalow. The domestification of the building, which  will be accentuated by the provision of a domestic curtilage and associated paraphernalia around  the building,  will alter and harmfully urbanise the strong rural characteristics of this isolated  and open landscape of high scenic beauty.  Given the inappropriate and unsustainable  form of new housing development in this prominent countryside location, the proposed development fails to conserve  and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty  of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty in this location.   As such,  it conflicts with policies 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030,  Policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty  Management Plan 2016-2021 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Ne Of Ludgvan House Blowing House Hill Ludgvan TR20 8EG
Description: Application for Approval of Reserved Matters in relation to Outline Approval PA17/08019 for two new houses: Access, appearance, landscaping, layout and scale
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of the excessive  level,  height and massing  of the proposed dwellings within the site, coupled with their close proximity to existing dwellings to the south which are situated  on considerably  lower ground and the height of the proposed boundary wall on the south,  the proposal  is considered to result  in unacceptable overbearing and overlooking impacts upon these neighbouring  dwellings, in turn harming  the amenities of their occupants. The proposal  is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010- 2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Stables Caravan Park Pit Lane Higher Fraddon Fraddon Cornwall TR9 6LG
Description: The retention of the building and its continued use for the storage and repair of motor vehicles for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  in the countryside, clearly divorced  from any settlement.  The proposal,  by reason  of retaining the building, surrounding hard standing and access to the site which  includes associated loss of hedgerow, appears incongruous  to its rural setting and thereby harms  the distinctive character and natural beauty of the surrounding countryside.  The  application is, therefore, contrary to policies 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework

Address: 6 Lower Fore Street Saltash PL12 6JX
Description: Re-cladding of frontage
RefusalReasons: The use of cement fibre cladding  on the lower  frontage of 6 Lower  Street,  Saltash is considered to be detrimental to the appearance and character of the Conservation area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to the provisions,  aims and intentions of Policy of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November  2016 and Paragraphs 196 and 201 of the National Planning  Policy Framework (2019).

Address: Land East Of Hillside St Merryn Padstow Cornwall
Description: Outline application for erection of a self-build, custom 3-bedroom house and detached garage/workshop, creation of parking and turning area and the building of a Cornish hedge to separate the plot from the adjoining field. Open a new entrance from the highway on the North of the plot to service the plot and adjoining field, and close-off the existing entrance at the East of the plot.
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  within the countryside, clearly  divorced from anysettlement.  The home proposed by this application would  result in harm to the intrinsiccharacter and beauty of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and withresidential accommodation with poor accessibility to necessary daily services andfacilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainabletraffic movements.  In  the absence of any special circumstances to justify residentialdevelopment in this rural location,  the proposal is not sustainable development and iscontrary to Policies  1, 2,3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies2010-2030 and paragraphs 91 102, 103, 110, 127, 148, 150, 170, 172 and 181 of theNational Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Sweetpea The Grove North Tamerton Holsworthy EX22 6SB
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for existing use as an independent residential dwelling house
RefusalReasons: From the evidence submitted it is clear that the conversion was carried out in 2014 with the applicant moving in in January 2015 and working as a carer to his parents residing in The Grove. Within the evidence there are invoices and letters addressed to the applicant at The Grove but not Sweetpea and it is known that this was not a registered address prior to the submission of this application. There is a lack of evidence within the submission demonstrating independent occupation, e.g. a separate supply of services from The Grove or separate Council Tax payments. The Council considers that based on the evidence provided and on the balance of probability that the building now known as 'Sweetpea' has not been used an independent residential unit from 'The Grove. The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof, to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the building now known as 'Sweetpea, The Grove, North Tamerton, Holsworthy, Cornwall, EX22 6SG' has been used as an independent dwellinghouse for a continuous period in excess of four years prior to the date of this application being received. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Groville Farm Trewalder Road Delabole PL33 9ER
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for the continued occupation of dwelling without compliance with condition 1 (Agricultural Occupancy) of planning application no. CM/48/60.
RefusalReasons: On the basis of the submitted documentation provided and the Local Planning Authority's own investigations the Local Planning Authority considers that the development known as Groville as indicated on location plan 0187-01, has not been used for residential purposes in breach of the occupancy condition attached to CM/48/60, continually for a period in excess of ten years and at the date the application has been made as such the Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be issued.

Address: Trevean Farm Access To Acton Castle Rosudgeon TR20 9PF
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use or development: Confirmation of domestic boundary
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to discharge the Applicants' onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land outlined in red on submitted drawing 001 has all been used for domestic purposes in connection with the residential occupation of Trevean Farmhouse for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such, the application for a Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use or Development is refused.

Address: 15A Little Gregwartha Four Lanes Redruth Cornwall TR16 6LN
Description: Outline planning (with all matters reserved) for up to ten dwellings. Demolition of dwellinghouse and separate annexe
RefusalReasons: 1.Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 does not support housing  development  that physically extends development into open countryside. Paragraph 2.33 of the Local Plan defines open countryside  as the area outside of the physical boundaries of existing settlements. In terms of rounding off, paragraph 1.68 of the Local Plan explains  that rounding off for the purposes of Policy 3 applies  to development  on land that is substantially enclosed but outside of the settlement and where its edge is clearly defined by a physical feature that also acts as a barrier to further growth.  Furthermore,  it is explained that rounding off should not visually  extend building into the open countryside.  The majority  of the application site is part of existing  agricultural fields and while it would  be possible to construct a rear boundary  to the application site to act as barrier to future development, the proposal  would  still appear  visually  as encroachment of development  into the countryside. The proposal would cause an encroachment of built development  with related car parking  and domestic  paraphernalia into the countryside  beyond the settlement  boundary. In this way the proposal would harm the character and appearance of the area. This harm would fail the requirement of the National  Planning  Policy Framework (2019) that decisions should contribute to and enhance the natural and local environment  by recognising the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside. The proposal would not provide  a suitable  site for housing because of conflict  with the policies  of the development plan and the harm to the character and appearance of the area. In particular the proposal would conflict with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 170 which recognises the intrinsic character  and beauty  of the countryside.

Address: Land At The Beach Kuggar Ruan Minor Cornwall TR12 7LX
Description: Residential development of 4 houses
RefusalReasons: The proposal would, due to the scale,  form and mass of development,  fail to conserve or enhance the landscape character and natural  beauty of the AONB  landscape.  The proposal would  be contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 124, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and guidance within  the Cornwall AONB  Management Plan 2016-2021 namely  Policies MD2 and MD9.

Address: Land South Of Penleaze Hobbacott Lane Marhamchurch Bude Cornwall EX23 0ET
Description: Outline planning permission for agricultural tied dwelling (re-submission of Application No. PA18/08410)
RefusalReasons: Based on the level of information provided  and that the proposed agricultural  business on Land at Beeston Farm, Marhamchurch is yet to be established, the application fails to demonstrate that there is an essential need for a full time agricultural worker to live permanently in this specific countryside  location in relation to the proposed agricultural business  at Land at Beeston Farm, Marhamchurch. As such,  the proposal introduces  an isolated rural dwelling for which there are no special  circumstances to justify  it contrary to Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November  2016)  and Para. 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Summers Field Coxpark Latchley Cornwall PL18 9BB
Description: Alterations to rest room to form studio apartment
RefusalReasons: The proposed residential use of the building in this location is considered to be  unsustainable development and would be detrimental to the appearance and character  of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  As such, the proposed development contrary to the provisions,  aims and intentions  of Policies 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, Para. 172 of the National Planning Policy  Framework (2019) and para. 10.5.8 of the Tamar Valley AONB Management  Plan 2019-2024.

Address: Nanfan Barns Churchtown Cury Cornwall TR12 7BW
Description: Conversion of barn to form a single dwelling with annex
RefusalReasons: The development  proposed  will significantly alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of this agricultural building which  is an accepted part of this rural landscape.  The building is not considered  to be a suitably constructed  redundant rural building  that would be considered appropriate to retain  and its conversion to residential use would  clearly not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting.  Such domestification will cumulatively alter and harmfully urbanise  the strong rural characteristics of this landscape of high scenic beauty and recreational value and detract from the character and appearance of the adjoining approved development of barn conversions.   Given the inappropriate and unsustainable  form of new housing development in the countryside, the proposed development fails to conserve and enhance  the landscape character and natural beauty  of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty (AONB) in this location.  As  such, it conflicts with policies  2, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 79, 103, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy  SCW8.04 in the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management  Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land NW Of Trungle Byre Trungle Paul Penzance Cornwall TR19 6UG
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Residential development - up to 3 dwellings (amendment to Application No. PA18/06389)
RefusalReasons: By reason of the site's open and distinctly rural character and appearance, which is considered to relate more in a visual sense to the surrounding countryside as opposed to the built-up area of Paul, coupled  with the north-eastern boundary of the site being a rural hedgerow which is not considered  to act as a sufficient  barrier to further growth of the settlement, the proposal  is considered to visually extend the built form of the settlement into the surrounding countryside, in turn harming its intrinsic character and beauty. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs  8 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North West Of Highview Trebullett Launceston Cornwall PL15 9QH
Description: Formation of a vehicular access, erection of a detached dwelling, a detached single storey garage and installation of a septic tank
RefusalReasons: The site is considered to be outside of the settlement of Higher  Larrick  and is not in a location that would be considered as infilling or rounding off and is therefore situated within the countryside where no special circumstances have been put forward.  The proposal would  result in the intrusion of residential development into the countryside  and harm the landscape character of the Innvy Valley  and Lawhitton Area of Great Landscpae Value.  The proposal is therefore contrary to saved policy  ENV1  of the North  Cornwall Local Plan 1999,  policies 3, 7, 21, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Caroe Bungalow Otterham Camelford PL32 9SZ
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for an Existing Use of land for the siting of an unrestricted residential caravan.
RefusalReasons: Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the stationing of the caravan referred to as 'Unit 2' for residential use, on land at Caroe Bungalow, Otterham, Jacobstow, PL32 9SZ (as shown outlined in red on the Site Location Plan RL2) has been used for residential accommodation for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application being received. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Carn Du Rock Road Rock Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6LD
Description: Works to trees covered by a Tree Preservation Order, namely re-coppice the group of Holm Oak trees
RefusalReasons: The trees covered by the Tree Presevation  Order and subject to this application  form a valuable contribution to the landscape and have high amenity  value for the area. The re-coppicing proposed  would  have a detrimental  impact to said public amenity and would therefore be to contrary to policies 13, 23 and 25 of the Cornwall Council Local Plan 2010-2030 and policy STMNDP  1 of the St Minver  Parishes Neighbourhood Development Plan (NDP) 2017-2030

Address: Clodgy Trewarveneth Street Newlyn TR18 5JQ
Description: Construction of off road parking space
RefusalReasons: In removing a strong,  traditional  and prominent feature of Trewarveneth  Street in lieu of the creation of a modern parking  space, the proposed  works would  result in a harmful reduction in the characteristic sense of enclosure of the Conservation Area; a material reduction in the existing visual quality of the streetscape;  and failure  to preserve the character and appearance  of the Conservation AreaThe proposed removal of a section  of wall and construction of new vehicular  access is inappropriate, out of keeping and at odds with the setting. The proposal would have a significant detrimental impact upon a strong, distinctive  and historic feature of the streetscape that would result in harm to the character and appearance of the Conservation Area. The works are considered  to raise design concerns that cause harm and are not balanced by other factors  acting in the public interest  or benefit.The proposal is therefore  contrary  to Policy  12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and Policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 4.3 and 4.9 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013;  and paragraphs 124, 126-128,  130, 184, 185, 189, 190, 192, 193 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework. The development  does not accord  with the Local Planning Authority's statutory duty under  section 72 (1) of the Planning  (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve or enhance  the character  and appearance of the Conservation Area.

Address: The Old Vicarage Treleigh Redruth Cornwall TR16 4AY
Description: Fell T115 and T113
RefusalReasons: The sycamores proposed to be felled  are in good health and contribute to a significant proportion of the group canopy. It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed  works are not justified due to felling relating  to a future development on the site. Given that planning permission for this future development has not yet been applied for, there is no justifiable reason  for the felling of these  trees and the associated loss of amenity.  These  works  should  be included within a full planning  application as part of the complete scheme which  can then be considered by Local Planning Authority.

Address: Land South Of Sennen Heights Sennen Cove Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Erection of a dwelling
RefusalReasons: By reason of its siting  in a prominent  and exposed position  in the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty which would neither  infill nor round-off the settlement of Sennen, the proposal is considered  to consolidate  the sporadic and low-density built form at this part of the settlement and, above all, to harm the landscape and scenic beauty  of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty, which has the highest status  of protection in relation to its landscape  and scenic beauty. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies  2 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraph 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019; and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Fernleigh 82 Treverbyn Road St Austell Cornwall PL25 4EW
Description: Outline application for the construction of a single dwelling with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: The existing access is not considered suitable for the additional  traffic movements from the proposed  dwelling due to restricted visibility which is considered to be of an unacceptable distance.  The proposal thereby fails to achieve  safe and suitable access in accordance with Policy  27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 adopted  2016.

Address: Sudcott Park Jacobstow Bude Cornwall EX22 6XR
Description: Application for the modification of a planning obligation dated 28/06/2002
RefusalReasons: The Planning Obligation  dated 28th June 2002 imposed  through  planning permission  E1/2002/0164 tying the agricultural workers dwelling  to the farm holding continues to serve a useful planning purpose  in that is ensures the farm remains a viable holding  and prevents a proliferation of new houses  in the open countryside defined an Area of Great Landscape Value.  The proposed  modification  results in the severance of the principal farmhouse from the holding failing  to ensure the farm remains a viable holding and would place undue restrictions on new owners  of the land by preventing  rural worker accommodation where there is a clear essential need. It is therefore contrary to the aims of Policies 2 and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016) and the guidance contained in paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the Planning Obligation should not be discharged.

Address: Chyryn Harris Mill Illogan TR16 4JG
Description: Proposed outline planning with all matters reserved for new dwelling to site.
RefusalReasons: 1.The application site is located outside of the defined settlement  boundary of Illogan as set out in the adopted Neighbourhood Development Plan therefore the proposal fails to comply with the requirements of Policy PH 1a of the Illogan  Parish  Neighbourhood Development Plan (IPNDP). The development would  fail to maintain and enhance the landscape character of the area as a result of introducing built form in the countryside thereby conflicting with the aims and intentions of Policy  PEH1 of the IPNDP and Policies 2, 3 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Polices  2010 - 2030.  The proposal  is for new unfettered residential development in the countryside which does not accord with any of the special circumstances set out in Policy  7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Polices 2010 - 2030.

Address: 78 Upland Crescent Truro TR1 1NE
Description: Oak situated on Trevithick Road side of property. Crown raise to six metres, removal of diseased/ deadwood as necessary and fitting of bat box.
RefusalReasons: When deciding applications for tree works the Council must make a balanced  determination that weighs the issues raised within  the Application against the value that tree has for the wider community.  For this reason  the Council has considered all information  contained within the Application and weighed this against the public visual amenity  value of the tree and in doing  so it has reached the following recommendation:In view of the above, the proposed works to the Oak tree is considered extreme and would  result in detrimental impact on public amenity.   The application should therefore be refused.

Address: Land South West Of 4 Hendra Gardens Launceston Cornwall PL15 7NF
Description: Outline application for the erection of a dwelling with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: The proposal is situated  on top of a spring and open water course  and is within  a critical  drainage area and an area susceptible to surface  water flooding and it has not been demonstrated that the site is in an area with the lowest risk of flooding. Furthermore a drainage  strategy has not been provided  demonstrating that the proposal would  not increase flood risk on the site or in the area. The proposal  is therefore contrary  to Policy 26 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 157, 158, and 163 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Panorama 1 Barnoon Terrace St Ives Cornwall TR26 1JE
Description: Creation of parking space with electric vehicle charging point, extension of front patio and addition of french door
RefusalReasons: In removing a strong, traditional and prominent feature of Barnoon Terrace in lieu of the creation of a modern parking space, the proposed works fail to maintain a distinctive  character of the streetscape and would be of significant  detriment to itThe proposed removal of a section  of wall and construction of new vehicular  access is inappropriate, out of keeping and at odds with the locality. The proposal would  have a significant detrimental impact upon a distinctive feature of the streetscape that currently remains a focal point in the views  from the lower section of Barnoon Hill, which  are reinforced by its elevated position. The works would  allow for significant degradation  of a non-designated heritage asset and are considered to raise design concerns that are not balanced by other factors  acting in the public  interest.The proposal is therefore contrary  to Policy 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Sections  2.6, 2.9, 4.3 and 4.9 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013;  the aims and intentions  of Policies GD1 and BE5 of the St.Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan, and paragraphs 124, 126-128, 130 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 66 St Clements Close Truro TR1 1PA
Description: Proposed conversion of garage to flat
RefusalReasons: The proposed flat does not accord with Cornwall Local Plan policies  12, 13, and 16 and policy E4 of the Truro and Threemilestone  Neighbourhood Plan  because it would  fail to provide a satisfactory living environment conducive to the health  and wellbeing of potential future  residents and existing neighbouring residents by reason  of its cramped and constrained  internal living space, minimal provision for storage, and inadequate outdoor private amenity space.

Address: Little Hendra Boskerris Road Carbis Bay TR26 2NQ
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling and redevelopment of the site to provide 5 no. new dwelling and 1 no. replacement dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The overall layout and scale of the development is considered to be unacceptable as it would fail to integrate  successfully with the surrounding context and would  be detrimental to the character of the area. The proposal would  fail to reflect  local distinctiveness, nor would  it integrate satisfactorily with the built environment, in conflict  with policies GD1, BE12 and BE17 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood  Development Plan (2015 - 2030), policies  1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 130, 131 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of 20 Edgcumbe Road St Austell Cornwall PL25 5DX
Description: Detached split level dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposal,  by reasons  of introducing a new home onto undeveloped land and as the proposed home itself appears cramped when compared to neighbouring properties,  would have a detrimental impact to the street scene  and distinctive character of the area.  The application is, therefore,  contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Swan Vale Rusva Norgowr Falmouth TR11 5GS
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for the erection of two detached dwellings on site of former site sales and marketing suite
RefusalReasons: The existing site, by reason of its undeveloped nature  and in particular when  the temporary marketing building has been removed, makes a positive contribution to the character of the area. The proposed  introduction  of 2 new homes onto this site would result in a loss of the undeveloped character and associated virtues  of the site to the detriment of the character of the area. The application is therefore contrary  to policies  2 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraphs  9 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Pendennis Bishops Road St Ives TR26 2BY
Description: Alterations and extensions to include terrace/balcony
RefusalReasons: The proposed  terrace/balcony,  due to its design,  size and location, results in an unacceptable increase in the intensity  and immediacy of overlooking in relation to the amenity area and south-facing bathroom roof light of the adjacent neighbouring dwelling 'The Cabin'  to the north, and to a lesser extent to the amenity area of the amenity area of 'Ty Bryn' to the west. The elevated position and very close proximity of the large terrace/balcony further allows for a high degree of disturbance in relation to users of 'The Cabin'.The proposed terrace/balcony is located in very close proximity to the roof light of 'The Cabin', and to the amenity area of this property, which currently remains largely private and secluded. The terrace/balcony  allows  for prolonged periods of highly  intrusive overlooking in relation to the bathroom  roof light and amenity area of 'The Cabin', both of which would  otherwise enjoy a high degree  of privacy.  The terrace/balcony would further allow for overlooking  of a significant section of the garden of 'Ty Bryn' which currently remains private,  and would introduce awkward  eye-to-eye overlooking from the garden/patio  of this property  when  enjoying the natural views towards St Ives Harbour.  The proposed terrace/balcony  raises concerns relating to impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring property that are not balanced  by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is considered  contrary to Policy  12 paragraph 2a of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);   Section 2.6 (bullet point 1); Section 4.1 (bullet point 1) and Section 4.11 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013; Policy GD1(a) of the St Ives Neighbourhood  Plan 2016;  the advice  of the Cornwall Council Domestic Alterations  and Extensions Guide 2012 (pg 12 'Balconies');  and paragraphs 124, 126-128  and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework

Address: Trevalgas Farm Stamford Hill Stratton Bude EX23 9EX
Description: Erection of 2no 4 bedroom chalet style dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings are in a rural location not within or adjacent  to the definable urban  form of Poughill and Stratton,  and with limited links to local facilities by safe walking  and cycling routes.  They do not infill or round  off a settlement and visually extend  the built form into the open countryside further eroding  its intrinsic  character. In the absence  of any special  circumstances to justify them, the proposed dwellings represent  an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policy 3 of the Bude-Stratton  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030 (February 2016) and Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraphs 79 and 170(b) of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: Glenhaven Tregonhawke Cliff Military Road Torpoint Cornwall PL10 1JU
Description: Demolition and replacement of existing chalet. (Resubmission of application no. PA18/09283 dated 04/02/19.)
RefusalReasons: The proposed development exceeds  the 10% allowance for the expansion  of the chalets within the Whitsand  Bay Chalet area. This increase in the size of the chalet  would contribute to the cumulative erosion of the characteristic appearance of the chalets  which would increase the visual  impact and result in a detrimental visual impact on the appearance and character  of this sensitive, scenic coastline  and Area of Great  Landscape Value. As such, the proposed development  is considered contrary to the provisions, aims and intentions of Saved Policies W1 and CL9 of the Caradon  Local Plan First Alteration 2007, Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: The Chalet Glen Fayre Roscroggan Camborne Cornwall TR14 0JB
Description: Demolition of dwelling and construction of replacement dwelling
