RefusalReasons: In the absence  of a suitable site-specific  Flood Risk Assessment (FRA), the development does not pass the Exception Test as it fails to demonstrate the proposal  is appropriately flood resistant  and resilient and safe for its lifetime without increasing flood risk elsewhere.  The flood risks posed by the development are therefore  unknown  and the proposal is contrary to paragraphs  160, 161 and 163 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy 26 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land North Of Penwood House St Breward Bodmin Cornwall PL30 4NL
Description: Proposed conversion of disused agricultural building to residential accommodation
RefusalReasons: The development  proposed  will significantly alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of this agricultural building which  is an accepted part of this rural landscape.  The building is not considered  to be a suitably constructed  redundant rural building  that would be considered appropriate to retain  and its conversion to residential use would  clearly not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting.  Such domestification, which will be accentuated by the provision of a large outdoor amenity area around  the building, will cumulatively  alter and harmfully urbanise the strong rural characteristics  of this isolated upland landscape of high scenic  beauty and recreational value.  Given the inappropriate and unsustainable  form of new housing development in the countryside in this prominent location, the proposed  development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character  and natural beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty (AONB) in this location.  As such,  it conflicts with policies 2, 7, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, saved policy ENV1 in the North Cornwall Local Plan 1999,  Policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021 and paragraphs 8, 79, 102, 103, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: 7 Princes Street Bude Cornwall EX23 8AT
Description: Change of use from an office space to a dance school with variation of conditions 3 and 4 of decision PA12/07874 dated 8 March 2013
RefusalReasons: 1 The extended opening  hours and the resulting  additional  noise and disturbance from users and from amplified music would not safeguard the residential  amenity of the occupiers  of adjoining flats above  No's 5 and 9 Princes Street.  As such, the proposal is contrary  to Policy 6 of the Bude/Stratton Neighbourhood Plan 2016, Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 2016 and Section 12 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Crean Mill Quarry Road From Treglyn To Junction East Of Crean Crean St Buryan TR19 6HA
Description: Removal of existing caravan and construction of forestry maintenance building
RefusalReasons: The proposed forestry  maintenance building,  by virtue of its design,  size, scale and siting within a former quarry,  has not been demonstrated  to be reasonably  necessary for the purposes of Forestry.  There is no demonstrated business need for the proposed Forestry  building which would be situated  in an unsustainable and remote setting.  Therefore  the proposed development  is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 5 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 83, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 2 Valley Bungalows Millendreath Holiday Village Millendreath Looe Cornwall PL13 1PD
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the continued use as permanent residential dwelling without compliance with condition 10 of application no. 92/0986/F dated 15/03/93
RefusalReasons: Based upon the evidence submitted by the applicant and the evidence in the possession of the Local Planning Authority, It is considered that on assessment of the evidence submitted that the property known as 2 Valley Bungalows, Millendreath has not been utilised as a self-contained, permanent dwelling in breach of Condition 1 of 92/0986/F (dated 15.03.1993), in excess of 10 years and as such the Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be issued.

Address: Kim's Cabin Marazion By Pass Nursery Plain An Gwarry Marazion Cornwall TR17 0DR
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling and construction of new dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed replacement dwelling, would  be significantly longer  in scale, height and mass when compared  to the existing dwelling on the site.  The proposal  does not reflect the built form in the surrounding area.  The  proposal  would  be seen as incongruous feature that would neither relate to nor reflect the local context which it is situated and harm the character and appearance  of the  area.  The proposal  is in conflict  with  Policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030  and paragraphs 8, 122, 127, 130 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: 21 - 23 Woodland View Lanivet Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5HQ
Description: Felling two trees.
RefusalReasons: The proposed felling of the two trees would result in a detrimental impact to public amenity and is considered unjustified  as the trees do not appear to have significant structural defects to warrant good reason  for felling.

Address: Land Adj. To Higher Hendra Wendron Helston Cornwall TR13 0NR
Description: Installation of a timber chalet for occasional occupation in assocation with equestrian use
RefusalReasons: The proposed development raises direct conflict with the requirements  of adopted policy  in the Cornwall Local Plan as the site is clearly located in the open countryside where new homes will only be permitted where there are special  circumstances, none of which have been identified in this particular case.  The proposed development would clearly erode the strong rural character of this location and cause material harm to the character and appearance  of the countryside on a site that is visible from the adjoining public highway.  The site is not a sustainable or accessible location for a new dwelling and the development would be contrary to development plan policy and cause material  environmental harm to the rural character of the area, contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 79, 108, 110 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 38B Pennygillam Way Pennygillam Industrial Estate Launceston Cornwall PL15 7ED
Description: Change of use to D2
RefusalReasons: The proposal is located within Pennygillam Industrial Estate  which is allocated as safeguarded employment land in the emerging Cornwall Site Allocations  Development  Plan Document (DPD)  April 2019 and therefore the proposed D2 use of the unit is contrary to policy LAU-E4  of the DPD and policy 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 69A Meadowside Newquay Cornwall TR7 2TW
Description: Single-storey extension.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of the lack of adequate associated private amenity space, fails to secure  a good standard of amenity for existing and future occupants. In contrast it would result in the creation of a cramped, sub-standard form of accommodation that would be to the detriment of the quality of the living environment experienced by existing and future occupants. As such, the proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of paragraphs 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies  12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Trebarvah Woon Farm Trebarvah Woon Constantine TR11 5QJ
Description: Change of use of land for the retention of a mobile home used for short term holiday lets and ancillary accommodation to Trebarvah Woon Farm and construction of associated raised timber decked area
RefusalReasons: The proposal for the change  of use of land for the retention of a mobile home to be used as short term holiday  accommodation does not comprise sustainable development by reason of its rural location outside a settlement and thereby promoting a reliance on private transport for journeys to tourist venues and for everyday  essential services. Furthermore, the proposed ancillary  accommodation,  by reason  of its siting, is not well related to the principal dwelling being outside the established residential curtilage. The proposal would  result in diminishment of the natural environment, particularly observed by users of the adjacent Public Right of Way, in conflict  with the aims of Policies 2(1),12 and 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies, which seek to sustain local distinctiveness and character, and protect and where possible enhance Cornwall's  natural environment.The minor economic and social benefits of the proposal would not outweigh the harm to the rural environment. The proposal is contrary to policies 1, 3, 5, 7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 6 Old Chapel Way Millbrook PL10 1HL
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the proposed removal of existing u PVC conservatory including dwarf wall and replace with cavity wall with windows to two sides only and tiled roof to match existing main roof. Existing garden to have minor alterations to maintain access to paved patio.
RefusalReasons: The proposed construction of the rear extension does not constitute permitted development as it fails to comply with Class A.1 (f(i)) Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015. Therefore a planning application is required to be submitted to the local planning authority.

Address: Land NW Of Eastern Lane Eastern Lane Camborne Cornwall TR14 8TX
Description: Request for Discharge of Planning Obligation, the land was originally Public Open Space as detailed on original Section 106 agreement, abandoned and overgrown for 16 years; Reference 2/27/89/00695/0
RefusalReasons: The Discharge of the Planning Obligation  associated with planning permission ref. W2/89/00695/O would result in the loss of an area of Public Open  Space to the detriment of the health  and wellbeing of the local community.  There is a deficiency of open space provision in central and western Camborne and this small site provides a more localised function to meet this need.  The discharge of this Planning Obligation and subsequent disposal of the land as Public  Open Space,  without any replacement or better  provision in a suitable location, would therefore  be contrary to the general aims and intentions of policies  16 and 25 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 56, 96, 97 and 118 in the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Land East Of Ivydene Dobwalls Cornwall PL14 6JF
Description: Use of land for the stationing and residential use of a caravan, together with parking of four touring caravans
RefusalReasons: The stationing and residential use of a caravan and storage of four touring  caravans is considered inappropriate development  for this location and which  have a harmful visual impact on the area, to the detriment of the appearance and character  of the area. As such, the development  on this site related structure/development are contrary to the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Valley View Hornick Hill High Street St Austell Cornwall PL26 7TR
Description: Application for the modification or discharge of a planning obligation relating to C2/08/00545 date of obligation 12 August 2008
RefusalReasons: The Section 106 Planning Agreement still serves a useful planning purpose through the existing property meeting a current local housing need. There is no justification  or evidence to show that there is not a housing need in the local area, or that the property in question  is not affordable to eligible  local people. The application  would thereby be contrary to Policy 2a,, 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030,  paragraph's 8, 11, 54 and 56 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and the Section titled 'Planning Obligations'  of National Planning Practice Guidance.

Address: Managers Dwelling Crooked Inn Trematon Saltash Cornwall PL12 4RZ
Description: Application for the discharge of a planning obligation in respect of decision notice PA13/03126 dated 10th October 2013
RefusalReasons: The dwelling is in an open countryside  location that would  not ordinarily be acceptable for unrestricted  residential development and the proposal  to discharge the Section 106 Legal Agreement has not adequately demonstrated that the agreement is no longer necessary or relevant.   Accordingly the proposal conflicts with Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030  (adopted  Nov 2016)  and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Tregarthen Barn Tregarthen Farm Tregarthen Long Rock Penzance Cornwall TR20 8YH
Description: Retention of existing structural post and proposed extension to balcony
RefusalReasons: The proposed balcony, due to its design and location, would  result in an unacceptable increase in the intensity  and immediacy of overlooking in relation to the rear garden/amenity area of the adjacent  property to the north  (Tregarthen Farmhouse)The previously approved southeast elevation balcony is located such that the garden of Tregarthen Farmhouse remains predominantly concealed from overlooking from users of this structure. In extending the balcony to so as to be close to the southwestern  edge of the dwelling, the intensity and immediacy of overlooking significantly  increases  beyond that of the existing  balcony, and beyond that of the existing first floor southwest elevation openings.  The proposed balcony would raise concerns relating to impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring  property that are not balanced  by other  factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is considered  contrary to Policy  12 paragraph 2a of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Section 2.6 (bullet  point 1); Section 4.1 (bullet point 1) and Section 4.11 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013, the advice of the Cornwall Council Domestic Alterations and Extensions Guide 2012 (pg 12), and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework

Address: Land East Of Escot Treneague Road St Stephen Cornwall PL26 7QB
Description: New dwelling, stable block and sand school
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  outside of any settlement and is within the countryside and the proposed introduction of new dwelling on this site would  result in harm to the intrinsic character  of the surrounding rural setting.  Given  the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030  and paragraph 170 of the NPPF.

Address: Roseville Annexe (Trevilla) Parkenbutts Newquay Cornwall TR7 3HE
Description: Proposed amendment to the dormer window
RefusalReasons: The dormer  by reason of its siting, height, scale, bulk and fenestration  pattern would appear unbalanced, cramped and visually  overwhelming  and would be out of keeping with the roof slope of the host dwelling and other dormers featured  locally.  The proposal  is therefore  contrary to Policy 12 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan, paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies  D1 and D2 of the Newquay  Neighbourhood Development  Plan.

Address: Land West Of Chapel House Well Lane Gerrans TR2 5EG
Description: New Dwelling on Site of Domestic Storage Building
RefusalReasons: The proposed open market dwelling would lie outside of the settlement boundary for the village of Gerrans, as defined by the Roseland Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2015-2030, encroaching upon the open countryside and harming the distinctive character  and beauty of an area that is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty, to the detriment of the setting  to the village. In the absence of any affordable housing provision or any other  special  circumstances  to justify the dwelling in this context, the application is not considered to represent sustainable  development and is contrary  to the guidance contained in paragraphs   8, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019, Policies 1, 2,  7 , 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policies LA1, LA2, CV1, H04 and GP3 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development  Plan May 2015 -2030.

Address: Zion Community Church Fore Street St Ives Cornwall TR26 1HE
Description: Application for a Certificate of Lawfulness of Proposed Works to a listed building to replace the internal door with fire door.
RefusalReasons: The proposed works including the replacement of an internal door with a glazed plywood fire door would require Listed Building Consent as they would be deemed alterations affecting the character of the building as one of special architectural or historic interest.

Address: Morrisons Stucley Road Stratton Bude EX23 8UA
Description: Variation of condition 1 on Appeal Decision App/CV0820/A/04/1145788 dated 15 October 2004 (in relation to 2003/01787) to allow deliveries between 06:00 and 23:00 Mondays to Saturdays; and 07:00 - 20:00 on Sundays from June to August inclusive, and at all other times throughout the year the deliveries will remain as per the current restriction (07:00 hours and 20:00 hours on Mondays to Saturdays and between 09:00 and 17:00 hours on Sundays).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed variation of condition to allow extended  hours for delivery and unloading operations would adversely  affect the residential amenity of the occupiers of neighbouring  dwellings, particularly  the occupiers of Nos. 1 - 4 Alford Close (opposite the service yard opening) by reason of noise and disturbance in the early hours of the morning  and late at night.  The proposal is therefore contrary  to Policies 13 and 16 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and guidance  contained within paragraphs 170 and 180 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: 6 Penally Court Penally Hill Boscastle Cornwall PL35 0HG
Description: Material change of the use of the land for the stationing of a caravan to be used as ancillary accommodation
RefusalReasons: By reason of its self-contained  nature,  scale,  and siting outside the residential curtilage of 6 Penally Court,  it is considered that the proposed development would  be tantamount to the erection of a new residential  dwelling in the countryside,  outside  of the defined limits of any established settlement. The location of the proposed caravan is not in a sustainable location.   The proposal represents unsustainable development in the countryside and the caravan is considered to be harmful  to the character  and appearance of the Conservation Area and AONB. This is therefore contrary to Policy 1, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Paragraph 78, 79, 124, 127 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land Rear Of Rose Cottage North Road Goldsithney Cornwall TR20 9JY
Description: Construction Of dwelling house and associated works
RefusalReasons: The application  is for a two bed dwelling with an absence of parking. Given that the location of the settlement  is such that sustainable transport  options are infrequent and residents would  be reliant on private motor vehicles  to access  service and facilities. The absence of parking would lead to the exacerbation of existing on-street parking issues in the locale of the site and is against the aims contained within  Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan. As a result, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and would be contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and sections  2, 8 and 12 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019 (NPPF).

Address: Land At Merrick Avenue Merrick Avenue Truro Cornwall TR1 1NF
Description: Works to remove T1 - Sycamore Tree covered by a Tree Preservation Order
RefusalReasons: The loss of the Sycamore tree would harm public amenity  value and the character of the street  scene.  It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works are not justified  by the reasoning given in the application, no arboricultural  evidence or justification has been provided to support the loss of the tree, when alternative work could be carried out to improve the relationship of the tree to the surrounding properties and adjacent  highway.

Address: Land Opposite Truro Tractors Cox Hill Chacewater Truro Cornwall TR4 8LY
Description: Replacement of the existing stables into a two bedroom bungalow
RefusalReasons: The application  involves the creation of a new residential unit in the open countryside, detached from any definable settlement containing services and facilities required to support day-to-day  living. The proposal therefore represents an undesirable, sporadic form of development, for which no special  circumstances have been identified,  and which would encourage  use of a private  motor  vehicle, contrary to environmental aspects of the presumption in favour of sustainable development. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: 40 Trevean Way Newquay Cornwall TR7 1TW
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Part demolition of existing dwelling and construction of new 3/4 bedroom dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development of the new dwelling within  the curtilage of 40 Trevean Way would result  in a cramped and contrived form of development which would  be of an inappropriate  scale and layout,  out of character with the pattern of development in the immediate  vicinity and therefore  harmful  to the appearance of the area. The proposal is therefore contrary  to Policy 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Tresournes Farm Tresillian Truro Cornwall TR2 4AP
Description: Proposed farm diversification project to provide three exemplar farm based holiday Eco lodges, new access track and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed development of the site with three holiday  eco lodges by reason  of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable new residential development for which no special justification  has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal  therefore  represents an unsustainable,  undesirable and sporadic form of development that would be harmful to the intrinsic character  and beauty of the countryside.  The development  is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Sea La Vie Green Lane Portreath Redruth Cornwall TR16 4NX
Description: Planning permission required for a detached garden games room.
RefusalReasons: The development  and the precedent it would  set, by reason of its size, design and prominent elevated position  would have a significantly  detrimental impact upon the character and appearance  of the hillside and would be harmful  to the character and visual amenities of the locale, which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty and is within the Heritage Coast.   The proposed development therefore fails to protect, conserve  and enhance the distinctive landscape and scenic beauty of the AONB and Heritage Coast  thereby conflicting  with Policies 2, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 170, 172 and 173 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land And Stables, At Crowan, Praze-an-Beeble
Description: Proposed change of use of redundant stable to a single dwelling and formation of a new access
RefusalReasons: The existing building is a modern timber structure of unremarkable design,  but this reflects its original intended use as a stables which are not out of character  to the rural setting.  The proposed conversion  of the building and resultant domestication of the site would not result in any benefit in visual or landscape terms.  The introduction of a residential use on the site including  residential curtilage to include parking  and other associated domestic paraphernalia  will give rise to a detrimental change  in character  thereby harming the character  and intrinsic  beauty of the countryside.  The proposal  would significantly  harm the rural character of the area and the setting  of the building.  The site is visually isolated from the residential  development within  Crowan,  and would represent encroachment of unjustified residential development into the open countryside  and would  not result in an enhancement of its immediate setting.  The proposal therefore does not accord with the policies  HT1 and HT3 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan, paragraphs  8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land W Of Homer Vinyard Marias Lane Sennen Cove Cornwall
Description: Demolition of existing single storey timber store and construction of new timber single storey dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed  dwelling immediately abuts the narrow byway creating an overbearing presence  and sense of enclosure when  travelling along Marias Lane. The building to plot ratio is out of keeping with the development found in the surrounding built form thus having a negative impact  on the character  of the area which is within a designated area. The proposal  represents  cramped  and contrived development which  harms  the setting of the AONB and Heritage Coast. The proposed development  therefore fails to protect, conserve and enhance  the distinctive landscape and scenic  beauty  of the AONB and Heritage Coast  thereby conflicting with Policies 2, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 170, 172 and 173 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2018.

Address: 49 Porthmeor Road St Austell PL25 3LU
Description: Fell Oak Tree subject to a Tree Preservation Order
RefusalReasons: The Oak tree proposed for removal is significant in the local landscape and provides significant public visual amenity.  Insufficient justification has been given as to why alternative engineering solutions are not viable. As such the works are not considered  acceptable and would have an adverse impact  on public amenity.

Address: 19 Pendennis Rise Falmouth TR11 4LT
Description: Construction of a pair of semi-detached dwellings, with off road parking on land adjacent to 19 Pendennis Rise
RefusalReasons: The proposed development of two new dwellings in the manner proposed  would  result in a cramped and contrived form of development which  is considered to be out of character  with the pattern of development in the immediate vicinity  and therefore harmful to the appearance of the area. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The River Stop The Camel Trail Nanstallon Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5LG
Description: Seasonal siting (April to October) of a catering trailer with associated outside seating area and trailer-mounted generator
RefusalReasons: The submitted red edged site location subject of this planning application, is situated very close to the river bank of the River Camel on a relatively  flat area of a field that borders the Camel Trail within a functional flood plain (Flood Zone 3b). The use of land for siting a catering trailer with associated seating area and trailer mounted generator, is a development type vulnerable to flood risk and is not compatible with this flood zone.  Flooding happens at any time of the year in Cornwall, indeed some of the biggest flood events are from summer thunder storms. This site could flood between 1-1.5m deep, and be very fast moving flood waters. This represents an Extreme Hazard to people and property. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan and guidance contained within the NPPF (February 2019) specifically  paragraphs  155 and 163.

Address: Little Bosvean Shortlanesend Truro Cornwall TR4 9ET
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved: Demolition of existing redundant agricultural building. Erection of single family dwelling and garage
RefusalReasons: The application  site is not within or well related to the settlement of Shortlanesend andtherefore is located  within the open countryside resulting in the undesirable extension and intrusion of residential development into the countryside to the detriment of the rural landscape appearance  and character. The proposal  does not meet any of the special circumstances  for new residential development in the open countryside, is not a sustainable location  for new housing development and does not comply with the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Brighton House Brighton Terrace Morrab Road Penzance Cornwall TR18 4HB
Description: Conversion of former ground floor office to flat. Previously approved under PA13/08661.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would introduce a new residential use onto Flood  Zone 3 which would have a higher level of vulnerability to flooding than the existing use of the site. It has not been demonstrated that the development  would be appropriately flood resistant and resilient and safe for its lifetime  without  increasing flood risk elsewhere and the flood risk assessment has confirmed that a safe access and escape route cannot be accommodated.  Due to the known flood risks posed  by the development the proposal is contrary to paragraphs 155 and 163 in the National Planning Policy Framework  2019 and policy 26 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030.

Address: Sea Breezes Mawgan Porth Newquay Cornwall TR8 4BG
Description: Removal of condition 3 (agricultural occupancy) of C2/89/01541 - Erection of farmhouse and garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The information submitted with this application  fails to demonstrate that the existing dwelling is no longer required in connection with the existing holding or within the wider agricultural  community.  In the absence of an adequate  marketing exercise, the applicants have not shown that the occupancy  condition  is no longer reasonable and necessary to protect the agricultural housing stock and prevent  the proliferation of unrestricted residential  properties in the countryside. The proposal is therefore contrary  to policy  7 in the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 55 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land E Of St James Fore Street Goldsithney Cornwall
Description: Reserved matters of appearance, landscaping, layout and scale following outline approval PA17/11198 (erection of dwelling and associated works)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling by reason of its design would not reflect  the character  of the Conservation Area which is categorised by two storey properties and as such,  any positive  economic and social outcomes of the proposal would be significantly outweighed by the harm to the character of the Conservation  Area. The proposed dwelling does not demonstrate a cultural,  physical and aesthetic  understanding of its location and does not preserve  or enhance the character or appearance of the Conservation Area. The proposal is contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and paragraphs 127, 130, 189, 196 and 200 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Land South Of Ferryside Rock Road Rock Wadebridge PL27 6LD
Description: Erection of dwelling with variation of conditions 1 (approved plans) and 4 (parking) in respect of decision PA18/10352 dated 14.12.18 in order to amend site parking arrangements and the internal layout
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal clearly results in fundamental and substantial alterations to the original approval  and is not considered acceptable as a minor material amendment submitted  under  Section 73 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.  The lack of consistency with the original application warrants the scheme being resubmitted as a full application under Section 70 of the Town and Country  Planning Act 1990 to secure the changes proposed.   The inclusion of the garage  land to the north, which is outside of the original  application site area, along  with the removal of the on-site  parking provision  will also result in the loss of control of the said parking provision as it can no longer be reasonably secured  by a suitably varied planning condition.  Such loss of on-site parking provision will be to the detriment of highway and pedestrian safety in a location where traffic  congestion and pressure on vehicle  parking is particularly  acute in the summer months.  The proposal  therefore raises conflict  with policies 13 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, policy STMNDP 5.1. in the St Minver Parishes  Neighbourhood Development  Plan (NDP) 2017 - 2030 and policies 55, 108, 109 and 110 in the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Tayharr Jacobstow Bude Cornwall EX23 0BN
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Proposed dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location outside of the definable urban form of the Jacobstow  settlement,  and with no physical barrier  to its East, does not round off the settlement and visually extends the built form into the open countryside. It does not infill a gap in an otherwise continuous  built frontage and is not previously developed land.  In the absence of any other special circumstances to justify  it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development  in the open countryside  and, in the absence of any other material  considerations  which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 9 and 21 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 18 Trelawney Avenue Poughill Bude EX23 9HB
Description: Wooden Balcony
RefusalReasons: The balcony has a harmful impact upon the privacy of the neighbouring properties private amenity area rear gardens and affords overlooking into the first floor bedroom accommodation of 16 Trelawney Avenue.  The application  is, therefore, contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; paragraphs 124, 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework amended February 2019 and Section 4 para 4.11 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013

Address: Castle Minor Atlantic Road Tintagel Cornwall PL34 0DQ
Description: Conversion and change of use of part of house to use as mixed use consisting of residential (C3) and wedding/corporate events venue
RefusalReasons: The use of part of the property as a wedding/corporate events venue will significantly increase vehicle  movements across the access from Atlantic Road over and above the permitted use as a single dwellinghouse.  The  access is steep, limited in width and inadequate in terms of intervisibility  and the Public Right of Way section is heavily used by pedestrians, so given the frequency and scale of events proposed, this only serves to confirm the potential  level of vehicle and pedestrian conflict that would occur across  the access to the detriment of highway safety.  Safe and suitable access has clearly  not been demonstrated and the adverse impact cannot  be managed or mitigated through the use of planning conditions.   The proposal is therefore contrary  to policy 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 108, 109 and 110 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of The Chalet Tresarrett Blisland Cornwall PL30 4QF
Description: The proposed construction of a rural workers dwelling and the installation of a septic tank
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  within the countryside, clearly  divorced from any settlement. The proposed  new home,  including its associated domestic curtilage,  would  result in harm to the intrinsic character and beauty of the surrounding Area of Great Landscape Value  and would  introduce accommodation onto a location with poor accessibility to necessary daily services  and facilities which, in turn, would  perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic  movements.  Given  the lack of any special justification,  including sufficient evidence to demonstrate a need for a new rural workers  dwelling on the application site, the application is notsustainable development and is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 102, 148 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Bettys Meadow Trewince Lane Port Navas Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5RH
Description: Removal of a Fir tree.
RefusalReasons: The loss of the fir tree would have a significant  detrimental impact upon amenity value and the character of the area.  It is the opinion of the Local Planning  Authority that the proposed  works are not justified by the reasoning given in the application.

Address: Sea Croft Cox Hill Cocks Cornwall TR6 0AU
Description: Conversion of a barn to a residential dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would  increase the amount of vehicular traffic accessing  and egressing to and from the site, which  due to its acute angle and limited  visibility for drivers exiting the junction with the main road would  increase  the risk of a collision.  Vehicles would need to necessitate dangerous  manoeuvres into or from the highway.  The application,  therefore, fails to provide safe and suitable access and is contrary  to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 - 110 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 21 Church Way Falmouth Cornwall TR11 4SG
Description: Application to build a dwelling in the lower part of existing domestic garden.
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling by reason of its design and siting, would  result in a dwelling that would appear an incongruous feature within  the streetscene and would  represent a cramped form of development with poor levels of amenity for future occupiers. The proposed dwelling  does not demonstrate a physical and aesthetic  understanding  of its location within the existing settlement. The proposal  is contrary to policies 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030,  and paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Derelict Dwelling Old Portreath Road Redruth TR15 3TQ
Description: Reinstatement of Cottage
RefusalReasons: 1.The remains  of the former dwelling,  by reason of their scale, condition and appearance, would require  significant reconstruction, rebuilding and extension  in order to facilitate  a residential  use; without  such work, it would  not be capable of being converted into a habitable dwelling.  Therefore  the development would constitute the erection of a new dwelling in an unsustainable  location in the open countryside, for which no special  justification  has been presented. The proposed  use with associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context is not considered to lead to an enhancement of the setting.  The proposal  therefore  conflicts with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 78 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Tremenheere Sculpture Garden Tolver Water Road Tolver Penzance Long Rock TR20 8YL
Description: Construction of a timber cabin for visiting artists and wedding guests
RefusalReasons: The proposed residential cabin would neither be situated within, or close to, an existing settlement, nor would it comply with any of the special circumstances for new residential development outside of settlements  (ie in the countryside).  Furthermore, owing  to its isolated location within  the Sculpture Garden  and poor accessibility, it would  not be a suitable unit of holiday-type  accommodation.  Finally, there are not considered to be any other material considerations which outweigh  the harm identified above.  The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 8, 79, 83 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Lower Carthvean Farm Trenear Wendron TR13 0ET
Description: Proposed cattery with alterations to access
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would  be located  in open countryside along a track of restricted width to the B3297  and distant from the larger settlements which it is intended to serve. The nature of the proposal would be predominately reliant on the use of private vehicles which taken together with the location would be contrary  to the aims of the environmental objectives of sustainable development  as defined in the National Planning Policy Framework.  Further the proposal  has not demonstrated an overriding locational or business need to be in the location proposed and would be reliant upon a private track that is of single  track width without dedicated passing places and would give rise to potential  conflict and manouverability issues  between  vehicles both along the access track itself and at the entrance with the B3297 resulting in adverse highway safety harm. The proposal is considered to be contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 5, 12, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 11, 83, 84, 108, 110, 124, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Tresheba Caravan Main Road Ashton Helston Cornwall TR13 9ST
Description: Single storey dwelling to replace residential caravans.
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  outside of the settlement of Ashton and the proposed  development does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance  with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 to 2030.  Neither does it accord with any of the special circumstances set out within policy 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 to 2030.  The proposal would also lead to the loss of a gypsy and traveller pitch for which no alternative provision  has been provided to offset this loss; such that it conflicts with policy 11 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030.The development  represents an undesirable  extension and intrusion  of built form into the countryside to the detriment  of the character and appearance of the countryside  and setting of the village.  In the absence  of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context,  the proposal does not represent sustainable development and would  be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 9, 11, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 11, and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Hockins Cottage Spicers Lane Stratton Bude EX23 9DR
Description: Listed building consent to replace 7 no. single-glazed front-facing wooden sash windows with 7 no. double-glazed wooden sash windows
RefusalReasons: As heritage assets  are irreplaceable, any harm  to, or loss of, the significance  of a designated heritage  asset should require clear and convincing  justification  [NPPF p194]. This has not been provided in this case. There is a lack of detail in respect  of the current  windows and their condition and whether repair could be undertaken, and lack of information in respect  of the of details  of the proposed replacement windows,  to be able to fully consider the impacts. From the information that has been provided, harm to the character and appearance  of the dwelling has been identified,  through the introduction of double glazing, and the proposal is therefore contrary to Policy  12.5 of The Bude-Stratton Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017, policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, paragraphs  124,127,  130, 192, 193, 194, 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land To The Rear Of 18 Restormel Road East Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 1EJ
Description: Works to remove Dutch Elm and Ash trees covered by a Tree Preservation Order
RefusalReasons: The loss of the trees would harm public amenity value and the character  of the area.  It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed  works are not justified  by the reasoning given in the application, no arboricultural evidence or justification  has been provided  to support the loss of the tree, when  alternative work could be carried out to improve the relationship of the tree to the surrounding properties.

Address: 31 Copes Gardens Truro TR1 3SN
Description: Fell Ash tree.
RefusalReasons: The tree is question  is a medium sized ash in early maturity. The tree is in generally good health  but has lost some branches in recent high winds. Some of these appear to be dead and some poorly attached. I do not consider that the condition of the tree warrants felling  and the works would  therefore  have a negative impact on public amenity  and the local landscape character.

Address: Land Opposite Two Burrows Tregarthen Two Burrows Blackwater Truro Cornwall TR4 8HN
Description: Proposed bungalow with double garage
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  within the open countryside, The proposed new home, by reason of its character and massing, a would result in harm to the intrinsic character  and beauty of the surrounding  area.  Given the lack of any special  justification,  the application is not sustainable development and is contrary  to Policies  1, 2, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Polic Framework 2019.

Address: The Eyrie Battery Hill Portreath Cornwall TR16 4NP
Description: Construction of two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed development would substantially increase  the amount of built form on the site by reason of the significantly larger footprints, unit 1 being  positioned  to the south east of the existing dwelling Look - Out, where at the moment no building form currently exists, the convoluted method of pedestrian access to each dwelling with the series of steps, and, the increase in building height with the introduction of first floor accommodation. The increase in built form on the site combined with the extant approval for two dwellings at the southern  edge of the site would result in the irreversible loss of green  undeveloped hillside thereby altering the character and appearance of this part of the hillside at Portreath to the detriment of the AONB landscape. The development would  be more visually prominent in the landscape to the detriment  of its openness in this particular  part of Portreath. The effect on landscape character would  be significant  with the development being a prominent incongruous feature. The proposal would  have an adverse effect on the character and appearance of the area, with particular regard to the landscape and scenic  beauty  of the AONB, as such the proposal  fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraph 172 of the NPPF,  and policies GP6.13, MD11  and MD16 of the Cornwall  AONB Management  Plan 2016 - 2021.

Address: 143 Jasmine Way St Merryn Holiday Village St Merryn Padstow Cornwall PL28 8TF
Description: Lawful Development Certificate for existing residential use in breach of condition 3 of application 6/86/1533/OOP
RefusalReasons: Without any substantive or compelling evidence, that is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to support the application over the requisite period prior to the submission of the application I have no alternative option other than to refuse the certificate application. Based on the documentation provided in support of the application, which is not considered to be sufficiently precise and unambiguous , and having regard to other information available to the authority, it is considered that the applicant has failed to discharged their onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, there has been a continued breach of condition 3 attached to planning application 6/86/1533/OOP at 143 Jasmine Way, St Merryn Holiday Village, St Merryn, Padstow, PL28 8TF for a period in excess of 10 years prior to the receipt of the application. As such, the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Land Adj To Barlowena Trewelloe Road Praa Sands Cornwall TR20 9SU
Description: Proposed New Dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposal would, due to the massing of the proposed built form and when  viewed in combination with the permitted alterations to the host property,  result in a development which is uncharacteristic in this location  and when viewed  both individually and cumulatively with other development be of uncharacteristic form resulting in a development of an inappropriate scale, mass and design that fails to recognise and respect the character of the area both in terms of built form and landscape. Further the proposed dwelling  would result in poor residential layout  through bedroom accommodation being served by no window openings. As such the proposal would  be contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs  8, 124, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2018 and guidance within the Cornwall AONB  Management Plan 2016-2021 in particular Policy MD9.

Address: Grebe Cottage Lerryn Lostwithiel Cornwall PL22 0PY
Description: Application for works to trees subject to a Tree preservation Order - Fell 2 Oak trees (T1 and 2) and remove bough from 1 Oak tree (T3)
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to fell 2 Oak trees (T1 and 2) and remove bough from 1 Oak tree (T3) would  have a significant, detrimental impact  to public visual amenity.  The proposed heavy pruning would also leave  a large wound  on the main stem of T3. This would leave the tree open to fungal/disease pathogens which  could  significantly reduce its safe useful  lifespan. These works would not be in accordance with good arboricultural  practice as specified by BS 3998 - Recommendations for Tree Work and would have a negative impact on the their contribution to amenity and the local landscape character.

Address: Trevalsa Court Hotel School Hill Mevagissey St Austell Cornwall PL26 6TH
Description: Removal of condition 5 (principle home occupancy restriction) of decision PA18/04406 dated 04.10.2018
RefusalReasons: 1The removal of Condition 5 from decision PA18/04406 would have an adverse effect on the balance of the local housing market and would fail to strengthen  the local community.  This would  undermine  the sustainability of the Mevagissey area and conflict directly  with the aims and intention of Policy H01 of the Mevagissey Neighbourhood Development Plan.  It would  also be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 2a and 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies: 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 54 and 55 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: The Dene Churchtown Feock Truro Cornwall TR3 6SA
Description: Proposed alterations to existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: The contemporary  design does not conform to the tradition  and setting of the village within the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty  when  viewed  from the public  right of way, Loe Beach, Carrick  Roads and facing shores  from the Roseland. The proposal  by reason of its massing  and extensive flat roof would  be visible from the nearby vehicular  highway  and public footpath and from public viewpoints  and would lead to unacceptable harm on the landscape character on the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The proposal  therefore fails to comply with Policies LS1, LS2 and D1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030, Polices 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, Paragraphs 127, 130 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework, Policies  MD9 and SCC9.01 of the Cornwall  AONB  Management  Plan 2016-2021 and would be contrary to advice contained within  the Cornwall Design Guide.

Address: Cherry Meadow Higher Road Breage Helston Cornwall TR13 9PJ
Description: Application for a new entrance on to A394, by means of splaying of the existing dry stone wall to boundary opposite the vicarage, surface water shaft 100L and 10 x 7m hardstanding area finished of Cornish granite surfacing. Standard farm cattle gates.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would,  through the creation  of a new access  on to the A394 highway, result in the loss of a section  of established hedgerow and flora which when viewed with the rising open agricultural land behind, contributes positively and significantly to the character  and appearance  of Breage  and the Conservation  Area. This together with the resultant gateway and necessary surfacing  would  fail to preserve and enhance the Conservation Area and would result in less than substantial harm to the heritage asset which would not be outweighed by the limited benefits of the proposal.  Further the applicant has failed to demonstrate  that the proposal would provide safe access and egress on to the A394 due to the quality  of plans submitted  and lack of clarity as to the visibility splays achievable.  The development would be contrary  to the aims of Policies  1, 2, 12, 23, 24 and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 108, 110, 124, 127, 170, 192, 193 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018,  Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Area)  Act 1990 and guidance within the Breage Conservation Area Appraisal and Management Strategy notably  pages 22 and 36.

Address: Bude Rowing Boats The Wharf Bude EX23 8LG
Description: Proposal for a mooring on the Bude Canal for a 60ft length (excluding bowsprit) 20ft beam sailing ship to operate as holiday letting accommodation
RefusalReasons: The change of the use of the land for the permanent mooring of a boat to be used for residential accommodation in this location is not acceptable.  The permanent  mooring would adversely impact upon the day to day runnings and workings  of the Canal in this area, disrupting  the movement  of boats, including the craning of boats from this part of the Wharf, the restriction of space  available on the Wharf site available for visiting and local craft and the restriction of other  boats to make a turn or pass.  The proposal lacks the necessary facilities  for permanent siting  and would  adversely affect  the amenities of the area through impacts of residential use with domestic  paraphernalia intruding onto the tow path which will also detract  from the character and openness of this prominent area. The proposal is therefore  contrary  to Policy 2, 5, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policy  22 of The Bude- Stratton Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030.

Address: Land At Agan Trygva Agan-Trygva Prussia Cove Road Rosudgeon Penzance Cornwall TR20 9AX
Description: Application to replace domestic caravan with private house.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by virtue of its scale, height and design would  result in visual harm to the intrinsic  character and beauty  of the open countryside and the character of the designated Area of Outstanding  Natural  Beauty in which the plot sits.  The proposal  is therefore  contrary to policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 130, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Lyndhurst Tresamble Hill Pelean Cross Ponsanooth TR3 7JF
Description: Development of a one storey four bedroom family home
RefusalReasons: The application  site is outside of the built form of Ponsanooth,  and Tresamble Hill is not considered to constitute a settlement. The NPPF and CLP indicate that the overall  purpose of the planning system is to achieve  sustainable development of which there are three dimensions; environmental, economic and social. Assessed against these dimensions, it is considered  that the dwelling would  cause environmental harm by virtue of its inaccessible location and its effect on the character  and appearance  of the area, this is because the application  site is not substantially enlosed and would  not constitute infilling, rounding off, previously developed land or accord  with any of the special circumstances detailed in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan. Future occupiers of the dwelling would  be reliant on private vehicles  in order to access even basic services  and would contribute  to a pattern of development  that would cause environmental  harm as a result of increased  car journeys. The proposed development is contrary to Policies,  1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and  27 of the CLP and paragraphs 7, 8,  10 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Land South West Of Dizzard Farm Coast Road Bude Cornwall EX23 0NX
Description: Erection of a yurt to accommodate provision of counselling, psychotherapy and mindfulness on a part time basis and for storage
RefusalReasons: The proposal introduces an isolated  and sporadic form of development which  erodes this open, undeveloped area of sensitive coastal landscape designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Heritage Coast. In the absence  of any overriding local need, economic or social  benefit, the harmful impact upon landscape character  means the development  is contrary  to the guidance contained in paragraphs  170, 172 and 173 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2018, Policies 2(1) and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), saved  Policy ENV1 of the North Cornwall District Local Plan - April 1999 and Policy PPW2. 04 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016 - 2021.

Address: Moorfield Barns School Road Praze An Beeble Camborne Cornwall TR14 0LB
Description: Construction of a single storey dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, due to the siting, form and appearance of the dwelling, would appear cramped and contrived within the context of its rural setting on the outskirts of Praze An Beeble and fail to positively contribute to the character and appearance of the area and promote local distinctiveness. Further  the intended  layout  would fail to function well due to occupants  of the proposed property relying on a sole access via the parking and turning space serving the existing barn conversion generating the potential for conflict through ad hoc parking restricting access  and the relationship failing to preserve  the amenity  and privacy of occupants of the resultant properties both currently and in the future. The proposal would  be contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 70, 124 and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Moonbay Chinese Restaurant Mawgan Cornwall TR12 6BE
Description: Re-submission of Refused Application No. PA18/00446 dated 18th April 2018 for the construction of seven dwellings, one for manager's accommodation for the Zucchini Italian Kitchen and six as holiday accommodation on site of former camping site.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would constitute unsustainable  development on land in the open countryside where new housing development would  cause harm to the rural character of the area with no overriding special  justification. The proposed accommodation would result in future occupants being dependent upon the private vehicle given the distance to services and facilities and accessibility  by other transport  modes.  The proposal does not accord with the special circumstances set out in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph  79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018. The proposal  would result in an encroachment of housing development of a regimented close knit layout which  combined with its scale would  be at odds with the open and rural character  of the open countryside in which it sits, which is deemed harmful to its character,  appearance and intrinsic beauty. The development is therefore  in conflict  with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 83, 108, 110, 124, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Land Rear Of Rose Cottage North Road Goldsithney Cornwall TR20 9JY
Description: Construction Of Dwelling House and Associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling by reason of its design and in particular  its eaves height and roof pitch would result in a dwelling that would dominate the street  scene  and be at odds with the existing properties either side. It does not demonstrate a cultural, physical and aesthetic understanding of its location and does not preserve  or enhance  the character or appearance of the Conservation Area. The proposal is contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and paragraphs 127, 130, 184, 189, 196 and 200 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: 23 Riverside Avenue Newquay TR7 1PN
Description: Proposed removal of roof and conservatory and construction of first floor extension with extension to rear and front porch. Roof to incorporate sky viewing window for telescope
RefusalReasons: The development,  by reason of its size, design  and prominent elevated  position  would have a detrimental impact upon the character and appearance  of the hillside and would  be harmful to the character and visual amenities of the locale. The scheme is found to conflict with the aims of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019 section  12 Achieving well-designed places, paragraph  127 points  a, b, c and d the Cornwall Local Plan 2010 policy 12 Design 1 a, b and 2 b as well as the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan Policies D1,  D2, G2 c and LE4.

Address: Land North Of Mount Stamper Cottage Scredda St Austell Cornwall
Description: Variation of condition 10 in respect of application PA14/06276 (Change of use of land to No 1 Romani Gypsy Pitch and associated works including 1 No mobile home, 1 No touring caravan, 1 No day room and hard standing) to change the size of the dayroom
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed day room, by reason of its scale, design and massing,  will harm the intrinsic character  and beauty  of the surrounding countryside.   In the absense of robust justification for this harm, the application  is not sustainable development and is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030;  the Cornwall Council 'Gypsy and Travelling Communities Strategy'  and the DCLG 'Planning  Policy for Traveller  Sites'.

Address: Land At Vicarage Hill Mevagissey
Description: Residential development comprising 26 units.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would introduce built development onto an undeveloped green field within a prominent position  within an Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty (AONB). The proposal, therefore,  would  cause harm to the distinctive natural qualities  and scenic  beauty of a sensitive part of the AONB  landscape  and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 9, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; policies D1 and EG1 of the Mevagissey  Neighbourhood Plan; and paragraphs 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trinity Lodge Penstowe Road Kilkhampton Bude EX23 9QT
Description: Re-submission of Refused Outline Application PA18/00818 dated 12th March 2018 for a proposed new dwelling with associated access
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location outside of the definable urban form of Kilkhampton does not infill or round off the settlement  and visually extends the built form into the countryside  eroding the character and appearance of this part of the Area of Great Landscape  Value. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify  it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development  in the countryside  and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1, 2 and 2(B)) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016),  Saved Policy ENV1 of the North Cornwall  District Local Plan 1999 and paragraph 72 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Barn And Land Adj To Whyb An Awel Black Rock Camborne Cornwall TR14 9NX
Description: Convert existing storage building into a dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The application  site is outside of the built form of Troon and Four Lanes and is not considered to constitute a settlement. The NPPF and CLP indicate that the overall  purpose of the planning system is to achieve  sustainable development of which there are three dimensions; environmental, economic and social. Assessed against these dimensions, it is considered  that the dwelling would  cause environmental harm by virtue of its inaccessible location and its effect on the character  and appearance  of the area, this is because the application  site is not sustainable previously developed land as stated in Policy 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan. Future  occupiers  of the dwelling  would  be reliant on private  vehicles  in order to access  even basic services and would  contribute to a pattern of development  that would cause environmental harm as a result of increased car journeys. The proposed development is contrary to Policies,  1, 2, 21 and  27 of the CLP and paragraphs 7, 8, 10 and 79 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2018.

Address: Land North Of Constantine Car Park Constantine Bay Padstow Cornwall PL28 8JJ
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved: Proposed construction of up to 4 dwellings
RefusalReasons: The development  of this greenfield site for up to 4 dwellings would  domesticate the existing largely rural character of the area on the edge of the settlement, resulting in significant built form and harmful  urban encroachment where there presently is none and result in the potential for further incremental growth.   It is contended this would be harmful to the rural character and appearance of the locality and would not conserve  or enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  (AONB) in this location.   The development is thereby contrary  to policies  2, 3, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, saved policy ENV1 in the North Cornwall Local Plan Part 1 and Part 2 (adopted 1999), policies  MD9 and CSP4.03 in the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  Management Plan 2016 - 2021 and paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 in the National Planning  Policy Framework 2018.

Address: 34 Falmouth Road Truro TR1 2HX
Description: Re-submission of Application No. PA17/06419 dated 6th March 2018 for the Construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: The dwelling proposed by this application  fails to respect the historic pattern and character of development in the area by introducing a dwelling into the extensive, undeveloped garden area of the host dwelling.  The proposal  would  introduce  an incongruous form of  development to the detriment of the special character and historic appearance of the surrounding Truro Conservation Area.  This harm to the conservation area is not outweighed  by the public benefits associated  with the proposal  and the application is, therefore, contrary to Policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, the Truro Conservation Area Management  Plan 2010, Policy C1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood  Development  Plan 2015-2030, paragraphs 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2018 and Sections 66(1) and 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Wainhomes SW Ltd Swanvale Sales Office Penhale Road Falmouth Cornwall TR11 4HB
Description: Erection of 2 no. detached dwellings on the former site sales and marketing suite (outline with all matters reserved)
RefusalReasons: The existing site, by reason of its undeveloped nature  and in particular when  thetemporary marketing building has been removed, makes a positive contribution to the character of the area. The proposed  introduction  of 2 new homes onto this site would result in a loss of the undeveloped character and associated virtues  of the site to the detriment of the character of the area. The application is therefore contrary  to policies  2 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraphs  9 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Primrose Vale Cottages Rilla Mill Callington Cornwall PL17 7NT
Description: Discharge of planning obligation dated 20.02.1991 pursuant to decisions 90/0557/OUT and 91/00112/FUL and subsequent deed of variation dated 26.01.2006 under 05/01213/VS106 to allow reversion of buildings to holiday units
RefusalReasons: The proposal would result in the loss of 6 affordable dwellings to holiday-let use in a location of evidenced affordable  housing need, without  robustly evidenced justification or secured compensatory mitigation measures.As such the proposal is in direct opposition to the major thrust of central government and local policy to increase  dwelling numbers and to house all sectors of the community,  in conflict  with Policy 2a of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2016 and paragraph 59 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.    Accordingly this application is refused as the obligation continues to serve  a useful  purpose.

Address: Land Adj To 22 Fore Street St Just Cornwall TR19 7LJ
Description: Construction of Four, One Bedroom Apartments & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: By reason of the uncharacteristic  increase in the built density and usage  of the site, which would result in a net gain of five additional units (taking account of extant permissions) in contrast to the detached single dwellings in the immediate surrounding area, coupled with the lack of off-street parking provision in a small town with existing on-street parking pressures,  the proposal is considered to fail to take account of the character and function  of the surrounding  built environment. Furthermore, this harm is not considered  to be outweighed by the economic and social benefits of the proposal. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 12, 13 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 8, 117 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Land West Of 8 Smithfield Drive Latchbrook Cornwall PL12 4TW
Description: Create a garden.
RefusalReasons: The site comprises an area of green infrastructure and forms a prominent, verdant part of the planned, landscaped  entrance to the Latchbrook  estate, as evidenced on Drawing 123/001 of Reserved  Matters application 88/01160 approved 26th June 1989. The proposed development  by reason of the erosion of this verdant, visual amenity would  harm the character and appearance  of the area, impairing its effectiveness in forming a green buffer which contributes significantly to the character and appearance of the entranceway to this residential area of Saltash.  As such, the proposal  is contrary to Policies 12 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030,  adopted  November 2016, together with the provisions of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019, with particular reference to Paragraph 127.

Address: Land East Of Wesley Road Cubert Cornwall TR8 5HB
Description: Outline application for residential development of up to 30 dwellings with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: The proposal,  by reason  of introducing 30 new homes and associated infrastructure onto the undeveloped field, will result  in harm to the distinctive natural character and beauty of the area; harm to the setting of the nearby Grade II Listed 'The Vicarage' and the non-designated  heritage asset 'Lantern  Cottage'; and in the loss of Best and Most Versatile agricultural land.  In the absence of robust justification to outweigh this harm, including  addressing a clear and demonstrable local need for affording housing, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary  to policies 1, 2, 7, 9, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 170, 196 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Penleaze Hobbacott Lane Marhamchurch Bude Cornwall EX23 0ET
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved for the Construction of an Agricultural Tied Dwelling
RefusalReasons: Based on the level of information provided  and that the proposed agricultural  business is yet to be established, the application fails to demonstrate  that there is an essential need for a full time agricultural worker to live permanently  in this specific countryside location in relation to the proposed agricultural business.  As such, the proposal introduces an isolated  rural dwelling  for which there are no special circumstances  to justify  it contrary to Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November  2016)  and Para. 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Land East Of Trepenty Parkyns Lane Lanjeth St Austell Cornwall PL26 7TN
Description: Detached dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its siting, design and bulk, would  introduce a building that appears  cramped within its setting to the detriment of the character of the area and a building with overbearing/oppressive harm on the occupiers of the neighbouring dwelling 'Fairdene Meadow'.  The application, therefore, is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 2, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 124, 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: 48 Eastcliffe Road Par PL24 2AJ
Description: A new bungalow at the rear of 48 Eastcliffe Road, Par, Cornwall, PL24 2AJ
RefusalReasons: The proposal would introduce a new home,  including its access and egress, onto Flood Zone 3 and there are alternative sites with a lower level of flood risk which exist to provide for the single home proposed by this application.  The application, therefore, would result with an unacceptable risk to people  during the event of a flood and is contrary to Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 155, 157, 158, 159, 160, 161 and 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adjacent To 179 Charlestown Road Charlestown St Austell Cornwall PL25 3NN
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for a dwelling
RefusalReasons: The mature trees along the northern boundary of the application  site and a mature oak tree on the northern  boundary on land to the immediate west of the application  site form part of a group of trees which front Charlestown Road that, individually and collectively,  make a significant contribution to the natural beauty and character of a surrounding area which is designated as a Conservation  Area.  In the absence  of information to demonstrate otherwise, the proposed new home,  by reason of obtaining access  from Charlestown Road, will result  with the loss and/or harm to the trees fronting Charlestown Road to the detriment of the distinctive character and natural beauty of the Conservation Area.  Indicative information submitted  with the application shows  access into the site at a location which would result  with the felling of a mature  ash tree on the northern boundary of the application site and harm  to the mature oak tree on land to the immediate west.  The benefits associated with the proposed introduction of a new home within a settlement do not outweigh this harm and the application, therefore, is not sustainable  development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan, paragraphs  8, 170, 184, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990.

Address: East Castick Farm North Hill Launceston Cornwall PL15 7NU
Description: Listed building consent for temporary re-covering of traditional outbuildings to make safe
RefusalReasons: The proposal,  by reason  of its failure  to re-use the salvageable slates on the main heritage asset (East Castick Farmhouse) and the duration of the temporary period  being  akin to a permanent consent, would fail to conserve or enhance  the designated  heritage assets and their setting,  eroding the significance  them and resulting in harm contrary to policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraphs 132 and 134 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 2 Grove Parc Tywardreath Highway Par Cornwall PL24 2RF
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for proposed private residential house on a garden plot
RefusalReasons: The proposal would introduce a new home,  including its primary  access  and egress and garden amenity,  onto Flood Zone 3/3b and there are alternative sites with a lower level of flood risk which  exist to provide for the single home  proposed  by this application.
