The application, therefore, would result in an unacceptable risk to people during the event  of a flood and is contrary  to Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 155, 157, 158, 159, 160, 161 and 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trevarne School Hill Mevagissey PL26 6TG
Description: The proposal is to convert the original loft space into a 2 bedroom open plan kitchen/dining lounge apartment with external access including change from pitch roof to flat roof
RefusalReasons: By reason of its bulky design and massing, the proposal would appear out of character with adjacent properties resulting in harm to the street scene and to the intrinsic character and beauty of the surrounding AONB. In addition, the bulk, mass, glazing and provision of a balcony would be overbearing on and result in overlooking of neighbouring properties. Given the lack of robust special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policy D1 of the Mevagissey Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan, Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 130 and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Land Formerly A Part Of Lestowder Farm Land North Of Penare Boathouse Pennare Manaccan Cornwall TR12 6ES
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for to confirm commencement of works for erection of a bungalow approved under W2/59/09946/F
RefusalReasons: Based on the documentation and evidence provided in support of the application and having regard to representations and contradictory evidence received against the application and other information available to the Authority, it is considered that the applicant has not discharged their onus of proof, to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, a trench to contain foundations for the 1959 bungalow planning permission referenced 9689/W at Land formerly a part of Lestowder Farm, Land North of Pennare Boathouse, Pennare, Manaccan was dug prior to the expiration of the planning permission. As such the application for a Certificate of Lawfulness in respect of a material operation commencing a development under Section 56 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) is refused.

Address: Beach Dunes House Ramoth Way Perranporth TR6 0BY
Description: Demolition of house and garage and construction of replacement dwelling and swimming pool
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reasons of it siting and massing,  would  introduce overbearing harm  to neighbouring property  of Kerensa to the south and No 1 Beach Dunes House to the north-west.  The application, therefore, fails to safeguard the amenities of the said neighbouring  properties and is in conflict  with the aims and intensions of Policies  1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Tom Tom Manor Longdowns Penryn TR10 9DL
Description: Retrospective application for conversion of existing dwelling into 3 Flats
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed development would result  in an increase in the number  of vehicles using the existing access which has restricted emerging visibility  to the west. A safe and suitable  access cannot be achieved and this would result  in an unacceptable impact on highway safety. The proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the NPPF 2018.

Address: Land To The North Of Roseworthy Hill Camborne Cornwall TR14 0TR
Description: Proposed coffee shop with drive thru (to be developed alongside the wider mixed use retail and petrol filling station development) associated parking, access and landscaping arrangements
RefusalReasons: Policy 4 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 states retail and other  main town centre uses outside defined  town centres must demonstrate the application of a sequential approach to site selection, where the proposals exceed the applicable  threshold, show there is no significant  adverse impact on the viability and vitality  of, and investment within, the existing centres.   National Planning Policy  Framework  Paragraph  90 states that where an application  fails to satisfy the sequential test or is likely to have significant adverse impact on one or more of the factors stated in paragraph  89 of the National Planning Policy Framework, it should be refused.  The application fails to satisfy  the sequential test and therefore is contrary to policy 4 and Paragraph 90 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Play Area Comfort Wartha Constantine TR11 5AZ
Description: Proposed construction of single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1.The development would  result  in the loss of an area of public  open space that has not been demonstrated to be surplus  to requirements, and no suitable replacement open space  has been proposed. The proposal  is therefore  contrary to Policies 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 97 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Former Laundry Room Vicarage Hill Davidstow Camelford Cornwall
Description: Change of use from Former Laundry Room to Holiday Accommodation including a single storey extension and an increase in height of the roof
RefusalReasons: In the absence  of adequate noise and odour assessment,  the proposed  holiday  let , by reason of the close proximity to the neighbouring stable block buildings and associated commercial operations  at Talls Trees  Arena, would fail to protect the living  conditions of occupiers of the holiday let from unreasonable noise,  odour and disturbance and would  fail to achieve a good standard  of amenity for future occupants.  Furthermore,  permitting  such a situation would also fail to protect  the existing Tall Trees Arena  equestrian  business from having unreasonable restrictions put on them because of changes to neighbouring land uses.  As such,  it is contrary to Policy 12 (2) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016)  and the Core Principles and para. 182 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land WSW Of Trevanger West Tolgus Redruth Cornwall TR15 3TN
Description: Construction of two affordable dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposal  would  be a clear encroachment into the open countryside which surrounds West Tolgus thereby changing its character  and appearance to the detriment of the visual amenities  of the area. The delivery of two affordable units do not outweigh  the identified  harm and consequently the proposal fails to respect the intrinsic character and natural beauty of the countryside as required by Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and  170 of the NPPF 2019.

Address: Beach View Trenance Mawgan Porth Newquay Cornwall TR8 4DB
Description: Demolition of dwelling and construction of a replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed new home,  by reason of its siting and massing, would  erode the openness and rugged appearance of the site to the detriment of the distinctiveness and character  of the area.  The application is, therefore,  contrary to the aims and intentions of polices 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Section 122d of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2018.

Address: Land At Mill Pool Rilla Mill Cornwall PL17 7NT
Description: Proposed single storey dwelling with mezzanine, associated parking and demolition of existing garage
RefusalReasons: The proposal introduces a more vulnerable use into Flood Zone 3 and fails to demonstrate there are no other reasonably  available sites in the settlement  or the wider  Community Network Area for residential infill or rounding off development. It is therefore contrary to Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the guidance contained within the National  Planning Policy Framework  (2019) with particular regard to paras  155-158.

Address: Land East Of Freedom House Par Moor Road Par Cornwall PL24 2SQ
Description: Outline application (with all matters reserved) for a four bedroom detached property with a double garage
RefusalReasons: The location of the proposed dwelling is divorced from the built form of any identifiable settlement.  The proposal, if permitted,  would create an additional dwelling  which would fail to accord  with the housing growth strategy identified in Policy  3 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and a new accommodation with poor accessibility  to the necessary services and facilities of the nearest  towns and villages, generating unsustainable traffic movements through the over reliance on private  vehicles  as a mode of transport.  This conflicts  with the objectives of enhancing  active  travel patterns, improving access to public transport,  and encouraging a modal shift away from private motor vehicles, in the interests  of reducing resource  consumption, air quality improvement and maintaining highway safety  conditions.  In the absence  of any special  justification, the proposed dwelling would not constitute sustainable development and is contrary to Policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 16 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, Connecting Cornwall  2030 and the aims and intentions  of paragraphs 8, 91, 102, 103, 108, 110, 127, 148, 150 and 181 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North West Of Lostwithiel School The Brambles Lostwithiel Cornwall
Description: Construction of 5 new residential units.
RefusalReasons: The application  site is undeveloped land in the countryside, located outside of the development boundary defined within the Lostwithiel Neighbourhood Plan.  The proposed introduction of new homes onto this land would  harm the natural beauty and distinctive character of the area which is within an Area of Great Landscape Value.  In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development  in this location, such as an affordable housing  led scheme, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policy HH2 of the Lostwithiel  Neighbourhood Plan; policies  1, 3, 7, 9, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan; saved Policy 14 of the Restormel Borough Council Local Plan; and paragraph 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 55 Halsetown St Ives Cornwall TR26 3NA
Description: Conversion and extension of former studio to form a one bedroom single-storey dwelling including alterations to existing access (revised)
RefusalReasons: The development  would lead to an increased volume of vehicular traffic  using the sub-standard access junction onto the B3311 public highway and would unacceptably increase the likelihood of a highway safety issue, due to a vehicle exiting  the junction  and an approaching vehicle not having adequate distance from observing the exiting vehicle to prevent,  stop and avoid collision. Although the existing visibility splay would  be improved  slightly the gains  in terms  of highway safety would be minimal and the development would thus fail to provide safe and suitable  access to the site for all users  and would  have a significant adverse impact  on the local road network.  As such the proposal does not accord with policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030), policy  GD1 (e) of the St Ives Neighbourhood  Development Plan (2015-2030) or with paragraphs 108, 109 and 110 of the NPPF (2018).

Address: 8 Upper Polmear Par Cornwall
Description: Use of flat roof as a balcony amenity area
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is a rural exception scheme, where the expectation  is for on-site provision of affordable housing, intended to meet local affordable  housing need.  The proposal involves modifying the planning obligation insofar  as it relates  to No. 8 Upper Polmear to change that dwelling from an affordable  home to an unfettered open market home, which would  reduce the number  of affordable homes within the scheme to less than 50%,  which would result  in the overall development  no longer being affordable housing led. Furthermore, the absence of a mechanism  to adequately  secure the provision of affordable housing, for which  there is evidence of an identified need, would  mean that the affordable homes within the scheme would no longer be restricted  as affordable homes enabling them to be disposed of on the open market,  thereby reducing the affordable  housing stock in an area of identified housing need. The proposal is considered  to be contrary to Policies 2a, 6, 8, 9 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 8, 9, 59, 61 and 62 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Carbis Bay Holiday Park Laity Lane Carbis Bay TR26 3HW
Description: Removal or variation of condition 20 (occupancy restriction) attached to decision PA15/10302 dated 29.09.17 (Full application for 34 dwellings and associated works)
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of the policy tests for the use of planning conditions as set out in paragraph 55 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018, the applicant has not satisfactorily demonstrated that removal of the occupancy condition  would  be acceptable, and the condition  is therefore still considered to fulfil a planning purpose.  Insufficient evidence has been submitted  in order to fully assess  the impact of policy H2 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood  Plan 2015-2030.    The removal of condition 20 from decision PA15/10302   would have an adverse effect on the balance of the local housing market and would  fail to strengthen  the local community. This would undermine  the sustainability  of the St Ives area and conflict directly with the aims of Policy H2 of the St Area Neighbourhood Plan 2010-2030. It would also be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 2a and 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies: 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 11, 54 and 55 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2018.

Address: Wreckers Charlestown Road Charlestown St Austell PL25 3NJ
Description: Listed building consent for proposed oak framed extension to property
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority  has acted  positively and proactively in determining this application by identifying matters of concern  with this proposal. On this occasion, the issues are so fundamental that it is not possible  to negotiate a satisfactory way forward due to the harm that has been clearly identified  within the reason(s) for refusal.The proposed oak framed extension and glass balustrade on the  boundary walls would have a less than significant harmful  and detrimental impact upon the fabric and setting of the Listed Building  and on the character and appearance of the World Heritage Site, and will not enhance  and preserve  the character of the Conservation Area and that harm would outweight any public benefit visually  and economically.  Therefore being contrary to Policies  12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 Adopted  Nov 16, and paragraphs   8, 124, 125, 126, 127,185, 189, 192, 193 and 196  of the National Planning Policy Framework 19. The proposals are also considered to be contrary  to the aims and intentions of the Charlestown Conservation Area Character  Appraisal and Management plan.The proposed work will not accord  with the local planning authority's statutory  duty under sections 16 (2) and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990 because it would  not preserve the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building and would not preserve and enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.

Address: Wreckers Charlestown Road Charlestown St Austell PL25 3NJ
Description: Proposed oak framed extension to property
RefusalReasons: The proposed Oak Framed extension and glass balustrade on the  boundary walls would  have a less than significant harmful  and detrimental impact upon the fabric and setting of the Listed Building, and on the character and appearance  of the World  Heritage Site, and will not enhance  and preserve  the character of the Conservation Area and that harm would outweight any public benefit visually  and economically.Therefore  being contrary to Policies 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 Adopted  Nov 16, and paragraphs   8, 124, 125, 126, 127,185, 189, 192, 193 and 196  of the National Planning Policy Framework 19. The proposals are also considered to be contrary  to the aims and intentions of the Charlestown Conservation Area Character  Appraisal and Management plan.

Address: The Barnyard Illogan Churchtown Illogan TR16 4QZ
Description: Construction of 13 holiday units and associated works.
RefusalReasons: Paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan defines  open countryside as the area outside  of the physical boundaries of existing settlements. The site is outside of the settlement boundary in the Illogan Neighbourhood Development  Plan. Policy PEH1 of the said Neighbourhood Development Plan states  that any development in the open countryside outside of defined settlement  boundaries should maintain and wherever  possible, enhance the landscape character  of the open gaps between  settlements.  The substantial increase in the built form, despite the existing vegetation would  have an encroaching  and domesticating effect on the countryside which does not reflect the character  of the surrounding area. The proposal would  harm the character  and appearance of the surrounding area contrary to Policies PH3 and PEH1 of the Illogan  Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016-2030, policies  1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 84 and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: St Kew Farmshop And Cafe St Kew Highway Bodmin Cornwall PL30 3EF
Description: Construction of a treatment room
RefusalReasons: 1 The development  if approved  would constitute  unsustainable  development by reason of its rural location for which no justification has been demonstrated and would not be widely accessible by a range of transport options and would therefore be heavily car reliant. It would  therefore  fail to meet policies 1, 4 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 which seek to maximise accessibly of community facilities  for everyone and to protect the countryside  for its own intrinsic value  respectively  and the guidance within the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 which particular regard to paragraphs 8, 108 a) and 110 a) and b).

Address: Sea Craig 4 Carrick Way St Mawes TR2 5BB
Description: Construction of a replacement dwelling house with separate garage and residential amenity space without compliance with Condition 2 in respect of decision PA16/01630 (Appeal decision APP/D0840/W/16/3158470) dated 26.05.17
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed replacement dwelling, by reason of the inclusion of excessive external glazing on the southern  elevation which  fronts onto Carrick Way, would  constitute an unacceptable  form of development  on this visually prominent site and would fail to respect and relate positively to the established character  of the street scene along  Carrick  Way and the wider context of this section of the village of St Mawes  which lies within the South Coast Central section of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty. The proposal, in terms of the extent of environmental harm, would  be contrary  to the aims and intentions of paragraph 127 of the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019, Policies  2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, Policies  LA1, CV1(i) and GP2(iii) of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2015-2030 together with Sections  2.9 and 4.9 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013 and Policy MD16 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty Management Plan  2016-2021.

Address: An Skyber Trebarvah Farm Trebarvah Lane Trebarvah Rosudgeon TR20 9NG
Description: Replacement balcony
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed balcony,  due to its design,  scale and location,  is a dominant, imposing and obtrusive  addition that is inappropriate in the context  of a publicly visible elevation of a traditional barn conversion  located in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The proposed addition would have a significant  detrimental impact  upon the appearance of the converted barn which retains much of its traditional character,  and would  allow for significant degradation  of a non-designated heritage asset.  The proposed works would raise concerns relating to visual impact, that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is considered contrary to Policy 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Sections 2.9, 7.3 and 10 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013;  the advice of the Cornwall Council Domestic  Alterations  and Extensions Guide (version 4) (pg 6 'Design principles/What is context?'  and pg12 'Balconies'), and paragraphs  124, 127, 128, 130, 172 and 197 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2 The proposed balcony, due to its design, scale and location, would result in an unacceptable increase in the intensity and immediacy of overlooking in relation to the western amenity  area and west-facing windows of the adjacent property to the south (The Old Carthouse)The proposed balcony is located  in very close proximity to the western amenity area and windows  of The Old Carthouse, and allows for highly intrusive overlooking, most particularly  in relation  to the amenity  area that would  otherwise enjoy a relatively  high degree  of privacy.  The proposed  balcony  significantly increases the intensity  and immediacy of overlooking so as to be of clear and significant harm  to the living conditions of the occupiers of this property. The proposed balcony raises concerns relating  to impact  upon the occupiers of neighbouring property that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal  is considered contrary to Policy 12 paragraph 2a of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016);   Section 2.6 (bullet  point 1); Section 4.1 (bullet  point 1) and Section 4.11 (bullet  point 1) of the Cornwall Design Guide  2013; the advice of the Cornwall Council Domestic Alterations and Extensions Guide (version  4) (pg 12 'Balconies'); and paragraph 127 (bullet  point f) of the National Planning  Policy Framework

Address: St Dominic Park Harrowbarrow Cornwall PL17 8BN
Description: Application for Certificate of Lawful Development for use of land edged red as a caravan park and use in conjunction with caravan park as access, egress, vegetation, amenity/recreation areas, garages, parking and manoeuvring areas, ancillary buildings and fixed infrastructure including sewage treatment plant.
RefusalReasons: 1 Insufficient evidence has been provided to conclude that the hatched black areas of the site identified on Plan Ref No. LPA1, dated 21/6/2019 have been used continuously as a caravan park for a period of 10 years, as set out in Section 171b(2) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Address: Long Orchard Barkers Hill St Stephens Saltash Cornwall PL12 4QB
Description: Proposed single storey sunken dwelling within residential garden of Crannog House
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling do not represent sustainable development as set out in Policy 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, adopted  November 2016 ; it would fail to promote local distinctiveness and would erode  the valuable visual, tranquil  and verdant  gap between Forder and Saltash  which would neither  preserve  nor enhance the special appearance and character of the area causing harm to the Conservation  Area; contrary  to policies 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030,  and paragraph  200 of the 2019 National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 36 Devoran Lane Devoran TR3 6PD
Description: Proposed new garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The introduction of a garage  in isolation along this undeveloped area of greenery results in a development that is at odds with its surroundings by reason of its utilitarian form, isolated from any near buildings that would  provide an acceptable urban  context.  It disrupts the natural boundary between  the built up area of Devoran to the west and does nothing to respect  the distinctiveness of this boundary in this semi-rural  location, to the detriment of the appearance of the location. As a result  the proposal  is considered to constitute a poor quality form of development which would fail to conserve or enhance the area contrary to the aims and intentions  of policies  12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy H1 of the Feock  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017 - 2030 and with paragraphs 127, 130 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land E Of Woodlands Trescowe Road Goldsithney Cornwall
Description: Certificate of lawfulness proposed use: To live on site at Trescowe Stables in a static caravan for the duration of the bulids. Caravan to be lived in by the applicant and her family.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is for the stationing of a residential caravan to be occupied by the application and her family whilst constructing the dwellings approved under Decision Notice number PA17/07197. The applicants do not currently reside on the site and have an alternative address. Further to this the construction work will not be carried out by the applicants themselves. It has been suggested within the application documents that the applicant wishes to reside on site to project manage, order and receive materials and be present for security purposes to help with the build. The test for whether a structure places on land has a sufficient degree of permanency is whether it is judged to be 'operational' development in terms of Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) in relation to its size, permanence and physical attachment. In terms of caravans, these tests have become overlain with the importations from caravan related legislation. Any structure which falls outside of the portability and dimensional criteria of the definition of a caravan in the Caravan Sites Act 1960 and 1968 and the Amendment Order 2006, or has a sufficient degree of permanence through physical attachment to the ground or to the main services, will involve operational development. Notwithstanding the above and in the absence of any details to determine whether the proposed caravan is operational development or a use of land, the independent use of a caravan for residential purposes constitutes development. The development is not permitted development under the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 4, Class B of the Town and Country Planning General Permitted Development (England) Order 2015 (as amended). In conclusion planning permission is required.

Address: 40 St Clements Close Truro Cornwall TR1 1PA
Description: Proposed conversion of dwelling into two, one bedroom flats including external stairs and privacy screen to the rear.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed flat would not provide a sufficiently high quality of accommodation  as required by Cornwall Local Plan policies  12, 13, and 16 and policy  E4 of the Truro and Threemilestone Neighbourhood Plan because it would fail to make a positive contribution to the character of the area owing to the need for an unsightly tall privacy screen  and the poor quality of the shared communal private amenity space.

Address: 34 Tywarnhayle Road Perranporth TR6 0DX
Description: Replacement of existing workshop/store with a two storey, two bed dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The development, by reason of its increased, proximity, height and massing  would result  in an over development  of this restricted site creating a development that has an overbearing and dominant  relationship with the adjoining property known as 35 Tywarnehayle  Road which would be harmful to the established residential amenities  of the said property.   The proposal  is therefore contrary  to the  requirements of policies  2, 12, 13 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and conflicts with the aims at paragraph 127 ( a and f) of the National Planning Policy  Framework. 2 The proposed amenity space  that is intended to serve the new dwelling  is located  on elevated ground and in close proximity to existing windows in the rear of of the adjoining dwelling known  as 34 Tywarnhayle Road and has the potential  to create unacceptable levels of noise and disruption and loss of privacy to the occupants of No. 34.  The proposal is therefore  considered contrary  to Policies  1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2015-2030 and paragraph 127 (a and f) of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 3 The proposed development by reason of its design and layout provides  access  directly onto Tywarnhayle Road which by reason  of existnig on-street parking creates a narrow street  throughout  most of its length.   The existing parking arrangements are restricted  in depth  and width of each of the spaces this combined with on street  parking would create  tortuous manoeuvring issues for vehicles entering  and leaving  the site contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030.

Address: Trevarno Farm Treverno Road North Roskear TR14 0AX
Description: Construction of a 3 bedroom dwelling house
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its open countryside  location detached from any definable settlements, services and facilities,  represents an isolated,  unsustainable dwelling in the countryside  for which  no special  circumstances  have been demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents  an undesirable and sporadic form of development  in the countryside  and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127,  170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of Gwavas Lake Farm Gwavas Lane Newlyn Cornwall TR18 5LH
Description: Construction of Self Build Sustainable Dwelling, Attached Car Port, Landscaping, Access and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The site lies in open countryside and the development  would therefore conflict with policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 which only permits the development  in such locations where there are special circumstances, none of which  apply in this case.  As such,  the proposed  development does not accord  with Policy  1 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 as it is not considered to be sustainable development due to its location in the open countryside.    In addition, the proposal would  not accord with policy 1 of the Cornwall Sites Allocations Development Plan Document as it would not constitute a windfall  development  as defined in the said document  and paragraph 8 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019. 2 Given its rural setting in the open countryside, the construction of a dwelling, together with its widened  access parking  and external  domestic paraphernalia normally associated with such development, would  lead to unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the area.  Whilst the site is not within  any designated landscape area and that enhanced landscaping could soften  the urbanising effects of the new dwelling, the encroachment  of built development into the countryside  would  nonetheless have an adverse impact on the character  and appearance  of the area.  Accordingly, the proposed development would  conflict with policies 1, 2,12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030. Together  these polices require new development  to maintain, respect and enhance Cornwall's special character including  the impact of the development on its landscape.  Similarly, it would not accord with Paragraph 127 of the revised National Planning Policy Framework 2019 which seeks to ensure development is sympathetic to local character including  the surrounding built environment and landscape setting.

Address: 7 Trelawny Road Menheniot Liskeard Cornwall PL14 3TS
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for the proposed conversion of garage and internal alterations
RefusalReasons: 1 The works proposed in the Lawful Development application would constitute a material change to the appearance of the property and would therefore fail to accord with condition 4 of 91/00827/F. For this reason, the works cannot be lawful and the certificate is refused. Planning permission must be sought to undertake the works.

Address: Land Adjacent Chygwyn Sampys Hill Mawnan Smith Cornwall TR11 5EW
Description: Proposed dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its scale, layout, mass and height, together  with its associated residential  paraphernalia, will introduce  an incongruous feature in the streetscene, sitting  forward of the building  line which  would be out of character with the area, and harmful to the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, contrary  to Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 122 (d and e), 124, 127, 130, 131 and 172 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 2 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its siting and height, will be overbearing in relation to No. 1 Carlidnack Road, Mawnan Smith,  resulting in an un-neighbourly  relationship, contrary  to Policy 12 (2) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and advice  within  paragraph 172 (f) of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Morvah Lower Chapel Street East Looe PL13 1AT
Description: Replacement of vertical sliding sash windows with UPVC wood grain effect vertical sliding sash windows and replacement of front door with Composite GRP wood grain effect door
RefusalReasons: 1 The installation of UPVC  window(s)  and composite door by reason of the modern, unsympathetic design and material fails to take account of the historic context of the application  site and surrounding traditional vernacular  and would  fail to preserve or enhance  the character  and appearance of the Looe Conservation Area.  The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, the guidance within the Looe Conservation Management  Plan 2009, notably section 5.1, section 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide  2013, paragraphs 8,  124, 127, 192, 193, 194, 196 of the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990.

Address: The Oyster House Port Navas Constantine TR11 5RL
Description: Demolition of a house and annex and construction of a replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The development  is situated in a highly prominent elevated location overlooking Porthnavas Creek and within the Area of Outstanding  Natural  Beauty (AONB) and is visible in close views from the public  highway adjacent to the site and in middle and longer distance views  from the south, south west and east, including from Porthnavas  Creek. It is considered that the design  and appearance  of the proposed development  is not sympathetic to local character, including  the landscape character of the AONB in this highly sensitive  and prominent location,  and the character of the local built environment,  and fails to promote local distinctiveness, by reason of its starkly contemporary  design, including its box-like angular form with strong horizontal emphasis mounted on a stone-faced plinth, flat roofs, expansive areas of glazing  on the southern elevation, which taken together is considered to be out of character with the majority  of the existing built environment  in the immediate vicinity. When  viewed from the adjacent public highway  the development would  appear as a stark contrast to the more traditional forms and designs of the buildings in the immediate  vicinity  and would be out of character in the streetscene to the detriment  of the character  and appearance  of the area and harmful to the natural beauty of the AONB. The expansive glazing on the southern  elevation is also likely to result in reflections during the daytime and light pollution when the building is lit internally  during  hours of darkness  to a greater extent  than is the case with the existing situation due to the significantly increased amount  of glazing,  which would  adversely  affect the natural  beauty of the AONB. It is considered that the proposed development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape  character  and natural beauty of the AONB. The development  is therefore considered to be contrary to Policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, and the advice in paragraphs  127, 170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019, and advice contained within  sections 2.9, 2.10, 7.3, 7.7 and 7.8 of the Cornwall Design  Guide  2013,  and the aims and intentions of Policies MD16 and CC7 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural  Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 In the absence of the results of adequate bat emergence  surveys  it is not possible to fully assess any potential impacts of the development upon bats, which are European protected species, that may be present and/or on any bat roosts and to understand what mitigation measures  may be necessary in order to address any potential adverse impacts upon bats and/or bat roosts. The development is therefore  considered to be contrary to Policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, and the advice in paragraphs 170 and 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, and advice contained within section 5.2 of the Cornwall Planning for Biodiversity Guide  2018.

Address: Land North Of Lynden House East Hill Blackwater Cornwall TR4 8HW
Description: Construction of a bungalow and garage and alterations to existing access (re-submission of PA18/08030).
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement. Whilst  it is acknowledged  that the site comprises garden land, the site itself comprises an undeveloped parcel  of land bordered by hedgerows and has three undeveloped 'edges', which contribute positively to the rural character of this part of Blackwater.  The proposed  scheme would detrimentally harm the character and setting of its surrounding countryside  and, in the absence  of any special justification, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary with the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 48, 79, 117 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Flat 5 15 Woodlane Falmouth TR11 4RD
Description: Proposed part removal of garden wall and formation of vehicular parking and turning area
RefusalReasons: 1 The creation of a parking space, which includes the demolition of a 3m section  of historic boundary wall, will cause less than substantial  harm to a heritage asset, failing to preserve or enhance the character of the Falmouth Conservation Area. There is no overriding justification  provided  by the applicants and the Council do not consider that there are any public  benefits which outweigh the harm identified. The application  is contrary to Policies 2, 12, and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 189, 193,194,  196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019,  and Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990. 2 The proposal to create a parking  space and turning area, by way of its siting  and close proximity to trees subject to a Tree Preservation Order,  would  have a significant adverse impact  upon the health  of the trees that are considered important to the character and appearance of the area.  As such,  if approved, the proposal would  be contrary  to Policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 170 (b) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Morwenna Cottage B3276 Between Treator And Harlyn Bay Road Windmill Padstow PL28 8RY
Description: Widen existing entrance.
RefusalReasons: 1 The access for which permission is sought does not provide adequate visibility to vehicles egressing the site which represents a risk to the safety of road users.  Accordingly safe and suitable access has not been demonstrated and the proposal conflicts  with Policy 27 of Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and parapgraph  108 c) of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land To The Rear Of 62 Clinton Road Redruth Cornwall TR15 2QG
Description: Demolition of existing hairdressers salon and construction of two apartments and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would, given the scale of built form proposed relative to the size of the plot within  which it would  sit, together with the introduction of large patio openings with Juliet balcony, large gable apex window, window openings of horizontal emphasis  and materials  not typically found in the area such as Eternit cladding,  would appear  cramped and at odds with the traditional pattern of built form and materials  found  and fail to reflect  the character  and local distinctiveness of the area whilst being out of context with the historic  buildings found nearby  within the World Heritage Site. As such the proposal would be contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 11, 124, 127, 190, 192 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and sections  2.6, 2.9, 4.8, 7.3, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013. 2 The proposed development would, due to the scale of built form proposed and proximity to neighbouring built form and the openings which serve its living space, result in an adverse loss of outlook, sense  of enclosure, overbearing  impact and overshadowing upon occupants of the residential unit at 152 Falmouth Road. Further, the proposed layout would  result in the occupants of the first floor unit passing  the bedroom opening of the ground floor unit to access the first floor unit resulting in overlooking or a sense  of being overlooked, through the movement of people in close proximity to the window opening. The proposal  would therefore result in adverse amenity  harm to neighbouring property and fail to function well both in the short term and over the lifetime  of the development contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 124 and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and section 4.11 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013.

Address: Managers Dwelling Crooked Inn Trematon Saltash Cornwall PL12 4RZ
Description: Alterations and variations to extant consented managers dwelling (under construction) and associated works without compliance with condition 5 of application no. PA13/03126 dated 11/10/13.
RefusalReasons: 1 The dwelling is in an open countryside  location that would  not ordinarily be acceptable for unrestricted residential development  and the proposal to lift the occupancy condition  has not adequately demonstrated that the condition  fails the tests of need or is unreasonable.  Accordingly the proposal  conflicts with Policy 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 (adopted  Nov 2016) and paragraph 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Jalna Lower Town Farm Trewidland Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4ST
Description: Erection of one agricultural dwelling with variation of condition 5 of Decision Notice 5/79/0369/9 dated 4th June 1979 to allow removal of the agricultural occupancy restriction
RefusalReasons: 1 The application fails to demonstrate that the existing agriculturally tied dwelling is no longer required in connection with the functioning of the existing farm holding. Furthermore in the absence of a marketing  exercise, it has not been shown that the agricultural  occupancy condition is no longer needed to house  a farm worker from within the wider agricultural  community.  The proposal is therefore contrary  to Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016) and Sections 5 and 6 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Steep Acres 1 Poldhu Close Carbis Bay St Ives Cornwall TR26 2SJ
Description: Variation of condition 1 in respect of approval PA18/09977 - regarding obscure glazing to the upper part of the windows PA19/01416.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed variation of the obscured galzing, which is subject to Condition 1 of the planning permission granted under decision notice number PA19/09977,   will have a harmful impact  upon the privacy and living conditions of the occupiers of the neighbouring property  at 11 Polmennor  Drive through  allowing overlooking from the use of the development. The application  is therefore in conflict  with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and  paragraph 127  of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land NE Of Ludgvan House Blowing House Hill Ludgvan TR20 8EG
Description: Submission of reserved matters (access, appearance, landscaping, layout and scale) following outline approval PA17/08019 for two new houses
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of the excessive  level,  height and massing  of the proposed dwellings within the site, coupled with their close proximity to the existing dwellings to the south which are situated  on considerably  lower ground, the proposal is considered to result in unacceptable  overbearing  and overlooking impacts upon these neighbouring dwellings, in turn harming the amenities of their occupants.  The proposal is therefore  considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 By reason of the excessive  level,  height and massing  of the proposed dwellings and their proximity to the Grade II-listed  The Old Inn, situated on lower ground to the south-west, the proposal is considered to unreasonably  tower above  and compete with the setting  of this listed building,  particularly in views from the B3309 public highway, in turn harming its significance  as a former  public house. The proposal would therefore fail to at least preserve the setting of this listed building. Furthermore, whilst the harm  caused to the setting of the listed building would be less than substantial,  the public benefits of the proposal would not outweigh this. The proposal  is therefore considered  to conflict  with the aims and intentions of S66(1)  of the Planning (Listed Buildings  and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs  127, 184, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Chy Mor The Wharf St Ives Cornwall TR26 1LP
Description: Proposed balconies and alteration from windows to double doors on south elevation
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed installation of a first and second floor balcony and first and second floor double  doors,  by reason of the modern and unsympathetic use of materials and design fails to take account  of the historic context of the application site and the surrounding traditional  vernacular  and would fail to preserve of enhance the character and appearance of St Ives Conservation  Area. The proposed development would result in less than substantial harm due to the scale of the proposed development  compared to that of the site and wider Conservation  Area. The building works  necessary to construct the balcony may be considered to result in some public benefit by way of employment and associated benefits to the local economy. However, the public  benefit arising  from the provision of relatively minor building works  would not outweigh  the harm to the designated heritage asset. The development  fails to comply  with Policy GD1 and Objectives A and B of the St Ives Historic Core in the St Ives Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2016, Policy 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 127 and 193 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Ivy Cottage Access From Chapel Road To Piggery Higher Fraddon Fraddon TR9 6NQ
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed use - no changes to the building are proposed at this stage. Any building work would be reserved for a separate planning application. This application is only to establish the legalities of the buildings use class.
RefusalReasons: 1 On the basis of the evidence submitted and in respect of the relevant tests, namely on the balance of probability, it is considered that the use of building as a former Water Pumping Station is Sui Generis and not B1 as the applicant has requested. Therefore, this certificate is recommended as a refusal due to a water pumping stations not being within a B1 use class.

Address: Oakland Swanpool Falmouth TR11 5BD
Description: Loft Extension to form upper storey.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its design, appearance,  bulk, massing  and scale would result  in development  that is harmful  to the character  of the area and the streetscene and would result  in harmful overbearing impacts to neighbouring properties,  in particular Morva  Lyn, Swanlea, Little Ships  and Smugglers, and overlooking of Smugglers,  Morva Lyn and Swanlea. The proposal  is therefore  contrary  to Policy 12 (Parts  1,2) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 122 (d,e), 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Fernlea Cottage Access To Rosemellyn Cottage Roche PL26 8LB
Description: Proposed Garage Conversion to Holiday Cottage and Associated Works.
RefusalReasons: 1The proposal would  introduce a new home, including its access and egress, onto Flood Zone 3 and there are alternative  sites with a lower level of flood risk which exist to provide  for the single home proposed by this application.   The application, therefore,  would result with an unacceptable risk to people  during  the event of a flood and is contrary  to Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  155, 157, 158, 159, 160, 161 and 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.  2 The proposed new holiday accommodation, by reason of its isolated  rural location outside of a settlement and which is not accessible by a range of transport modes results in an unsustainable form of new tourism provision within  the open countryside and, without justification,  erodes the character and appearance of this rural location. The special circumstances required to adhere  to Policy  7 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 have not been demonstrated.  As such, the proposal is contrary to Paragraph  79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policies 1, 2, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and Policy A1 of the Roche Parish Neighbourhood Plan 2017.

Address: Land Adjacent To Penarwyn Hosue Pentour Cornwall St Blazey PL24 2JT
Description: Outline application for construction of new dwelling with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal to develop the site with a single dwelling  by way of its cramped nature and close proximity to trees subject  to Tree Preservation Orders located on and adjoining the site (including their root protection  areas) would have a significant adverse impact  upon the trees that are considered important  to the character and appearance of the area.  As such,  if approved, the proposal would  be contrary  to Policies  2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted 2016) and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of percolation  tests relating to the proposed  drainage  system  and ground conditions  in a Critical  Drainage Area, the Local Planning Authority are unable to confirm that the suggested drainage  systems would enable or replicate natural ground and surface  water flows and decrease surface  water run-off. The proposal would  therefore be contrary to Policy 26 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted  2016).

Address: Land Rear Of 78 Albany Road Park Road Redruth Cornwall TR15 2JF
Description: Construction of Bungalow and Associated Works (re-submission of Application No. PA18/04109)
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is situated in Redruth (Extension 3) Conservation Area and Camborne and Redruth Mining District World Heritage. The application is not accompanied  by a sufficiently robust heritage impact assessment  and therefore  the impact  on these heritage assets cannot be assessed and is contrary  to policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 189, 190 and 192 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal would  create a cramped and contrived form of residential accommodation that by virtue of its plot size, elevated  position  and prominent location (next to the southern  entrance of Victoria Park) would  look at odds with the surroundings, which predominantly consist  of 2-storey traditional terrace  dwellings with long rear gardens and small  incidental outbuildings towards the rear boundaries. The proposed  dwelling  would introduce  a new form/pattern  of development that if repeated would  proliferate the erosion of the character of the designated Conservation  Area and Outstanding  Universal Value  of the World Heritage Site in which  it is located. While the proposal would potentially result in less than substantial harm to the significance  of the designated  assets the public benefits would not outweigh  the harm created. The proposal would therefore fail to accord with paragraphs  8, 127, 130, 192, 193 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) 2019 and policies  1, 2, 12, 13 and 24 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030. 3 The proposed development does not accord with policy  12 part 2 of the Cornwall  Local Plan and paragraph 127 (f) of the National  Planning Policy Framework because of unacceptable overlooking, overshadowing and overbearing of the rear windows and private  rear garden of the adjacent properties known  as No's.76 and 78 Albany  Road.

Address: Havrak Bodmin Road Goonhavern TR4 9QF
Description: Construction of a new single storey detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from Goonhavern.  The proposal does not represent rounding  off under Policy  3 of the Cornwall local Plan but , rather, would result in the undesirable extension and intrusion of residential development  into the countryside and that would  be prominent to the detriment  to the distinctive natural  beauty and character  of the surrounding semi-rural  countryside.   Given  the lack of any special justification, the application  is not sustainable development and is contrary to policies  2, 3, 7, 12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 2 The proposal by reason of its scale, massing,  orientation and use of extensive areas of glazing fail to respond  positively  to the local character  and distinctiveness in this semi-rural location and as a result  the proposal  is considered to constitute  a poor quality form of development which would fail to conserve or enhance the area contrary to the aims and intentions  of policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  and with paragraphs 124, 130 and 170 NPPF 2019 3 The access proposed  by this application is constrained by poor visibility to the west for drivers exiting  the site onto the adjoining road.  In the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise, safe and suitable access to the development for all people is therefore not provided and the application is contrary to Policy  27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 and 109 32 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2012.

Address: Land At Swanpool Road Swanpool Falmouth Cornwall
Description: Residential development of 28 dwellings (including 11 affordable homes), provision of access, landscaping and associated works with variation of condition 2 (approved plans) of decision PA14/12058 (Appeal Ref: APP/D0840/W/15/3129840) dated 16/05/2016 to allow substitution of plans
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed changes to units 16 to 22 occupy a prominent position  on the site adjacent to the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty and overlooking Swanpool an important local amenity and nature reserve.  The proposed changes will have a significant adverse impact  on the character of the area and the development due to the increased mass of the units and design and so would be contrary to policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2016), advice in the National Planning Policy Framework, paras 124 and 127 and policy MD9 of the AONB Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land North West Of The Countryman Nance Trink Cornwall TR26 3JQ
Description: Self build retirement bungalow. Alterations to the access
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of any established  settlement  and does not represent infill or rounding off as defined  in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The development  therefore represents an undesirable form of development  in the open countryside  which would lead to visual harm  through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. Given the existing undeveloped nature of the site and the contribution that it makes to the wider countryside, the development would  have a detrimental impact on the character and appearance of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  In the absence of any special  circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 78, 79, 127, 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and Policy  MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land Adj To Penrose, West Of Church Of The Annunciation Main Road Ashton Cornwall TR13 9SR
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved except access and layout for the erection of up to 5 dwellings and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the settlement  of Ashton  and the proposed development  does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance  with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030.  The development represents an undesirable  extension and intrusion  of built form into the adjoining countryside  to the detriment  of the character and appearance of the countryside and setting  of the village.   Furthermore,  given the scale and siting of the proposed development no affordable  housing has been provided  as part of the development. In the absence of any special  circumstances  to justify  residential development in this context,  the proposal  does not represent sustainable development  and would be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 9, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 8, 11, 77 and, 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure it, the proposal fails to provide; affordable housing for which there is an identified need and the future maintenance of on-site public  open space.   The proposal is therefore  considered to be contrary  to policies 9, 12 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and guidance  contained within paragraphs 8, 77 and 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Sun Valley Holiday Park, Pentewan St Austell PL26 6DJ
Description: Lawful Development Certificate for a proposed use (S192) in respect of the siting of caravans for the purposes of human habitation including as a persons sole or main place of residence
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the evidence submitted and history of the site the Local Planning Authority consider that the proposed use for human habitation as a persons sole or main residence is not lawful and any change of use would require planning permission.

Address: Higher Drift Drift Lane Two Waters Foot Liskeard Cornwall PL14 6HH
Description: Lawful Development Certificate for a Proposed Use for the Placement of a shepherds hut on private field for holiday letting, non permanent moveable structure with independent facilities
RefusalReasons: 1 On the basis of the submitted documentation provided and the Local Planning Authority's own investigations the Local Planning Authority considers that the intended use of the shepherds hut for holiday lettings would constitute a change of use requiring the benefit of planning permission.

Address: Rame Barton Military Road Torpoint Cornwall PL10 1LG
Description: Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for Proposed Use for stationing a mobile unit (caravan) within the curtilage of the house.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed siting of the caravan is not considered to be within the curtilage of Rame Barton or to have an intimate connection to the residential use. In addition, the Whitsand Bay Article 4 (1) Direction restricts the erection or placing of moveable structures on land. Planning permission is required.

Address: Land South Of Delmere Farm Trevelmond Cornwall
Description: Erection of five detached dwellings, the formation of a new vehicular access and the provision of an internal road
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030 (adopted November 2016).  The  development  represents  an undesirable intrusion of the settlement into the countryside which would erode  the character and appearance of the village and would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the countryside. In the absence of any affordable  housing provision or any other special circumstances  to justify  residential development in this context,  the proposal does not represent sustainable development and would  be contrary  to policies 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016)  and paragraphs  8, 124, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 19 Maple Close Callington PL17 7HY
Description: Two storey rear extension.
RefusalReasons: 1 The extent  of projection and height of the proposed development, and its resulting massing in addition to that of the existing  gable end of the application  property, would lead to significant  loss of daylight/direct sunlight, oppressive  sense of enclosure and invasion  of privacy to the occupants of the nearest neighbouring dwelling, no. 17 Maple  Close,  as a consequence of an unacceptable degree of overshadowing, overbearing  impact, and direct overlooking from the new first-floor window. As such, the proposed  development is contrary to the provisions, aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the National Planning Policy Framework, with particular reference to paragraphs 8, 127, 123, 122 and 117.

Address: Land South Of Carne Farm Carne Hill Trewoon Cornwall PL25 5TJ
Description: Outline Planning Application (all matters reserved) residential development (3 indicative)
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, outside of the Settlement Boundary for Trewoon as designated in the St Mewan  Parish  Neighbourhood Plan, and the proposed introduction of new homes onto this land would result in harm to the intrinsic character and beauty of the surrounding  area.  The proposal  is thereby contrary  to Policy 1 of the St Mewan  Parish Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2016-2030 adopted  4th June 2018;  Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 adopted  2016;  and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Cothelstone Dunder Park Polzeath Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6SX
Description: Extend the existing first floor balcony area to the south west of the dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 Whilst the prevalence of balconies within the streetscene is accepted, what is proposed here projects significantly and legibly  beyond a relatively consistent  building line toward  the public  highway.  By reason  of its height,  scale, projection and appearance  this is considered to be incongruous causing dishamony  in the streetscene and thereby  harmful  to the character and appearance of the area.  This harm  is particularly  pronounced when viewed  from the neighbouring property at Sundown where  the need to provide 1.8m privacy screening in close proximity to the boundary further accentuates  the incongruity  through  the provision of a overbearing  structure that impinges  on the currently open outlook from the ground floor windows and amenity  area of that property.    Accordingly it is considered  that the proposal conflicts with Policy  STMNDP 2.7 part (IV) of the neighbourhood plan and CLP Policy  12  part 1.a, b and part 2.b.

Address: Land North Of Dolphin House Poundstock Bude Cornwall EX23 0AU
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved for the construction of a single detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location outside of and behind the clearly  defined linear  urban form of Bangors and with limited physical  barrier  to its north, does not round  off or infill the settlement  and visually  extends  the built form into the countryside eroding the character and appearance of this part of the Area of Great  Landscape  Value  and Heritage Coast. In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  it, the proposal represents  an unsustainable and sporadic form of development  in the countryside  and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 21, 23 and ENV1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and paragraphs  79 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of adequate ecological  and associated aboricultural surveys,  the application fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance  habitat and biodiversity. As such, this proposal  is contrary to Policy 23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November  2016)  and the aims and intentions of Paragraphs 118 (b) and 170 a and b) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Rear Of 31 Boscaswell Village Lower Boscaswell Pendeen TR19 7EP
Description: Affordable housing-led residential development of 6 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of the erosion of an undeveloped gap in the built form which affords a rare and important view of the distinctive surrounding landscape from the Carn Ros area of Boscaswell, coupled  with the extension of the built form of the settlement into the exposed and largely unchanged  landscape, the proposal  is considered to fail to recognise  and respect the character, sensitivity and capacity of the host landscape, and to fail to conserve and enhance  the landscape and scenic beauty  of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty. The proposal is therefore  considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2, 9, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019;  and policies  MD9 and WP7.10 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 By reason of the extension of the built form of Boscaswell into the surrounding smallholding landscape,  coupled  with the significant  change  to the built character  along the northern  edge of Boscaswell, the proposal  is considered to harm the setting of the St Just Mining District World Heritage Site, and to fail to at least preserve the character and appearance of the Boscaswell Conservation Area respectively. Whilst the cumulative harm arising is considered to be less than substantial, the public benefits of the proposal  in terms of the provision of 3no affordable dwellings is not considered to outweigh  this. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of S72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990;  policies 1, 2, 9, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 184, 192, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Burnwithian Burnwithian St Day
Description: Erection of self build energy efficient dwelling, garage with new access and associated external works (re-submission of Planning Application No.l PA18/01267 dated 9th May 2018)
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the established  and definable limits  of any settlement, and does not represent infill or rounding off as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. The development therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic  extension of the built form into the adjoining countryside, with no logical barrier to further  growth, which will lead to the erosion of the character and appearance  of the natural environment, as well as eroding  the gap between  the historically separate settlements  of Burnwithian and St Day. The land currently forms  an attractive rural setting,  offering expansive views  over the natural landscape  to the west; the reduction of this significant gap between the separate  entities of Burnwithian and St Day would cause material  harm  to the amenities of the area. This impact is exacerbated through the significant massing of the property  and extent  of the proposed site which fails to demonstrate  an understanding of the surroundings. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and would be contrary to policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 170, 184 and 192 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Little Music Mount Hawke Truro Cornwall TR4 8DJ
Description: Proposed Rear Extension to Annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed annexe  accommodation, by reason of the siting, form and massing  will not appear  as an ancillary structure subservient to the existing dwelling and is tantamount to the erection of an independent dwelling  in an isolated countryside location. The scheme is considered to result in the erosion of the open countryside and significant harm with insignificant public  benefit to the natural, rural character of the secluded  area negatively impacting  upon the visual amenities of the valued landscape, which is a designated  World Heritage Site. The development  is therefore considered contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79 and 127 the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Wheal Ellen Engine House Mount Hawke Cornwall TR4 8DJ
Description: Restoration, Preservation and Conversion of Wheal Ellen Engine House and associated works (re-submission of Application No. PA17/08780 dated 25th July 2018
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its prominent and isolated  valley location, within the context of a wider mining landscape, which includes other engine houses, chimneys and ruins of the same industrial period, the proposal would fail to maintain  the significance of its outstanding  universal value  and authenticity and integrity  of the World Heritage Site, due to the degree of visual change to the building  and associated curtilage by the introductions  of such items as curtains, lighting, parked  vehicles and other domestic  paraphernalia. In addition, the level of public benefit associated  with the proposal  does not offset the identified  harm. Therefore, having special regard to Section 66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 the proposal  is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies  1, 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 11, 79, 130, 184 and 189 to 202 of the National  Planning Policy Framework (February 2019).

Address: White Owl Barn Carncrees Farm Carn Stithians Truro Cornwall TR3 7AW
Description: Erection of 2no. log cabins for use as short term holiday accommodation.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would introduce new holiday accommodation into the open countryside and due to the isolated location future occupants  of the development would be reliant upon the private vehicles to access services, goods  and facilities. The proposal  for two holiday  lets, regardless of a condition restricting its occupancy  would represent an unjustified dwelling  in the countryside thereby  giving rise to sporadic and unsustainable development. The proposed development  therefore does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 79, 83 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Wheal Ellen Engine House Mount Hawke Cornwall TR4 8DJ
Description: Listed Building Consent for the conversion of Engine House to Dwelling and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed conversion,  extension and associated works by reason  of the nature of the works  involved  would result  in harm to the significance of this designated heritage asset and its setting. The harm to this Grade II Listed Building (known as Wheal Ellen) is considered to be at the upper end of less than substantial. There is also a lack of detail in respect  of the proposed  works to be able to fully consider the impacts.  The benefits of bringing  the site into a residential use do not outweigh the harm identified.  Under the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990 s. 16(2) the Local Planning Authority is required to 'have special regard to the desirability of preserving the building or its setting or any features of special  architectural  or historical interest which it possesses'. As heritage assets are irreplaceable,  any harm or loss should  require clear and convincing justification  [NPPF p194].  This has not been provided. In addition, the level of public benefit associated  with the proposal  does not offset the identified  harm. Therefore the proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010-2030 and paragraphs  193 to 196 of the NPPF (February 2019).

Address: Watery Lane House Bodiniel Road Bodmin Cornwall PL31 2UE
Description: Lawful Development Certificate for construction of swimming pool enclosure, including mezzanine level as ancillary accommodation, plus associated surface water drainage soakaway
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development will require planning permission because it would not accord with The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 Schedule 2 Part 1 Class E.1 (c) Therefore, the proposed works will not be lawful development under this certificate and will require the submission of a planning application. E.1 Development is not permitted by Class E if- (c) any part of the building, enclosure, pool or container would be situated on land forward of a wall forming the principal elevation of the original dwellinghouse.

Address: Bealswood Cemetery Road Albaston PL18 9AJ
Description: Construction of 5 dwellings and extension to existing dwelling (Resubmission of application no. PA18/09224 dated 26/11/18).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal - by reason of the narrowness of the width and steepness of the incline of the curved section of the internal access  road closest to the highway, together with the poor visibility  available  to drivers seeking  to egress  - would fail to provide  a safe and suitable access  to the site. As such the proposal  fails to accord with Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.

Address: Derow 4 Kelliwith Feock Cornwall TR3 6QZ
Description: Construction of a detached double garage and store
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the loss of an Oak tree which  is protected by a Tree Preservation  Order and considered to have a high level of public visual amenity  value.   It has previously been determined under application number PA17/05930 for tree work that the loss of the tree would be unacceptable and there is no overiding justification in the removal of the tree as part of this proposal.   The loss of the tree would  have a detrimental impact  on the character of the street scene and surrounding Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty and would  not be in accordance with Policies BIO1,  BIO2 and LS2 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development  Plan, Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraphs 8c, 12, 47 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework.

Address: Moorstone East Calvadnack Carnmenellis Redruth Cornwall TR16 6PW
Description: Proposed conversion of two barns to a single dwelling with linking extension and conversion of further barn to a detached annexe and associated works, including the siting of temporary caravan during the build period.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would, through the residential use of the buildings  and subdivision  of the field to create domestic curtilage  together  with the associated paraphernalia, result in significant  change  to the character of the area and harm to this open and historic landscape consequently failing to enhance the immediate setting.
