The scale of the proposed  development is so substantial  that it is considered that the granting of permission would  prejudice  the community-led Neighbourhood Plan process by determining decisions about the scale and location of new development around the town. Planning applications must be determined in accordance with the development plan unless material considerations indicate  otherwise.  In this case the material  considerations  in respect  to accessibility  and landscape impacts are such that a departure from the development plan is not justified at this time particularly as the Council  is able to demonstrate an up to date development plan based on a 5 year land supply position (as required by the NPPF) and in addition  this is supported by delivery rates, consents  and completions for the town which demonstrate  that the local plan targets will be met. The proposed development  is contrary to Policy 1, 3, 4, 5 and 7 of the adopted Cornwall  Local Plan and guidance  contained within  paragraphs 2, 12, 15, 86, 90 of the National Planning Policy Framework and the long standing fundamental of the UK planning system  namely utilising a plan led approach  to development. 2 Due to the failure to demonstrate safe, suitable  and desirable  pedestrian and cycle movements from the site to Wadebridge across the A39, it is considered that residents and those working at the site would  be likely to rely unduly on the use of private motor vehicles to access  the services and facilities. This would be in conflict  with the social  role of sustainability,  as well as the environmental role, which seeks to move to a low carbon economy and less reliance on the private  motor vehicle.  There is considered to be limited physical or functional  relationship with any established settlement and whilst  other  uses have been incorporated into the scheme there are no delivery mechanisms  for such uses, which unless the wider masterplan area is delivered are unlikely  to come forward  sufficient to aid internalisation  of trips for new residents  and existing residents  of Bodieve. It is considered therefore that the development is not sustainable and contrary to Policies  2, 3, 5 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan, the aims and intentions of paragraphs 8, 91, 102, 103, 108, 110 and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework and guidance  on accessibility limits  in Manual for Streets 1 and 2 (DETR). 3 The site relates to the open countryside and is significant  in terms of both landscape character,  visual  amenity and also has a high value  in creating  the natural extent of the visual setting of Wadebridge and is productive agricultural  land.  The A39 currently forms a strong edge limiting  the spread  of the built up DATED:  31 January  2019 Louise  Wood  -   Service Director Planning and Sustainable Developmentarea of the settlement.  This site breaches this clearly defined edge and much  of it is prominent in the surrounding landscape. Development  within the southerly parcel will be highly visible, lack any settlement context and would  erode the separation between Bodieve and Wadebridge.  This  harm is not outweighed  by the benefits of the proposal in its submitted form and is therefore  considered contrary to Policies  2 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan and saved policy  ENV1  and the aims and intentions of paragraphs 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework. 4 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the long-term provision of affordable housing, open space, educational  infrastructure, air-quality mitigation for which there is evidence of an identified need, and on and off-site highways works, the proposal is considered to be contrary  to paragraphs 8, 62, 91, 94, 96, 102, 103, 105, 108, 127, 181 of the NPPF, and CC Document - Guidance on s106 Planning Obligations for Education Provision  (April 2012) and Cornwall Local Plan Policies 8, 13, 16, 27, and 28.

Address: Land Off Antron Way Antron Way Mabe Burnthouse TR10 9HS
Description: Proposed residential development of 27 dwellings including access, estate roads and landscaping
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  result  in a substantial increase in the built form on prominent rising land and would cause unacceptable  harm to the character  and appearance of the countryside.   It is considered the benefits of providing affordable  housing  do not outweigh  the identified harm.  The proposal  is therefore  contrary  to policies 1, 2, 12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 124 and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018. 2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of affordable housing, off-site financial contributions  to deliver improvements  to mitigate pressures on education, open space provision and Falmouth  and Helford  Special Area of Conservation, the proposal is contrary  to policies  6, 9, 12, 13, 16, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2130 and paragraphs  8, 34, 56, 64, 92 and 96 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2018.

Address: Treetops Trewince Lane Port Navas TR11 5RH
Description: Conversion and extension of single storey boathouse to provide living accommodation at first floor level with ancillary/storage areas below
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal introduces a more vulnerable use into Flood Zone 3 (i.e. a residential use) and fails to demonstrate  there are no other reasonably  available  sites in Flood  Zone 1 in the settlement of Port Navas or the wider Community Network Area of Falmouth and Penryn  for residential  development. It is therefore  contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 3, 12 and 23 and of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and the guidance contained within  the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 with particular  regard to paragraphs  155 - 163.

Address: Land At Creek Vean Pill Lane Feock Cornwall
Description: Demolition of existing garage structure and erection of new dwelling house
RefusalReasons: 1 The new building proposed by this application, by reason on its siting, scale and massing, will introduce a new physical feature to a currently undeveloped natural setting.  It  will also result with felling and/or harm to mature trees, including  encroaching into the Root Protection Area of two Monterey Pines (T1 and T3) and a Sessile Oak (T5) and the felling of a group of Leyland Cypress  (G2) and a Sessile Oak (T5).  The application  will, therefore, harm the distinctive natural qualities and beauty  of an area which is designated  as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty  and is contrary  to policies BIO2 and LS2 of the Feock  Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017-2030,  Policies  1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, paragraphs  170 and 172 of the NPPF 2019 and British Standard BS5837 (Section 5.3). 2 The proposal will directly  result with additional traffic  movements onto the priority T-junction between the C101 road and the single vehicle width of the U6069 road.  This junction is constrained by poor emerging visibility.  In the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise, a safe and suitable  access  to the development  is therefore not provided and the application is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 The application fails to comply with the habitat  directives in that there is no overriding public interest  for the proposed permanent loss of a bat roost together  with the disturbance of bats.  The application is, therefore, contrary to Policy 23 (3d) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030,  the Conservation of Habitat and Species Regulations  and Circular  6/2005. 4 The proposed building, by reason of its siting, scale and massing, will introduce less than substantial harm to the natural setting  of the Grade II* Listed Building  'Creekvean'.  The public benefits associated  with this proposal do not outweigh  the identified  harm to the heritage asset and, therefore, the application is contrary to Policy  HE1 of the Feock  Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017-2030, Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019 and Section 66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings  and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land South East Of Dodbrook House Millbrook Cornwall PL10 1AN
Description: Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal introduces a more vulnerable use into Flood Zone 3/Functional  Floodplain 3b, but fails to demonstrate that there are no other reasonably available sites in Flood Zone 1 within the settlement  or the wider Community Network Area for residential  development. It is therefore  contrary  to Policy  26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and the guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework 2018,  with particular  reference to paras 155-163.

Address: Land West Of Highfield Bungalow Middle Taphouse Cornwall PL14 4NE
Description: Change of use of land to a private gypsy and traveller caravan site consisting of 1no. mobile home and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The siting of the proposed mobile home by reason  of its visual impact will cause less than substantial harm to the significance  and setting of the Scheduled Ancient Monuments (two bowl barrow burial  mounds;  listing number  1003077)  sited to the east and northwest  of the site.  The less than substantial  harm is not outweighed by the public benefits of the proposal.  Furthermore,  the application does not include  a geophysical survey to provide evidence  for survival (or absence) of any buried  features  within the development area to enable  the Local Planning Authority to understand the significance  of the impact that the proposal may have on any buried  remains.  The development is therefore  contrary to Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted  November 2016) and Paragraphs  8, 184, 189, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development has failed  to demonstrate (in relation to sufficient  visibility splays or separation distance from the crossroads junction) that the proposed access  onto the C708 is safe and suitable.   The intensification  in use of a crossroads junction  with an accident record, by the uplift in trips (approximately 5%) associated with the application, would give rise to additional safety concerns.   The proposed  development  is therefore contrary to Policies 11(4) and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016) and Paragraphs  8, 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Lyndhurst 66 St Nicholas Street Bodmin PL31 1AG
Description: Demolition of part of wall to create a second pedestrian entrance from St Nicolas Street and installation of a highway barrier at the roadside
RefusalReasons: 1 The application fails to demonstrate any detailed measures or evidence  to show how the creation of a pedestrian access to the school  site in the location proposed would maintain a suitable  pedestrian  environment, manage associated increased parking  pressure  on the highway network or safeguard  visibility for vehicles emerging  from the adjacent residential  property.   Accordingly, it is considered that a safe and suitable access onto the highway  network has not been demonstrated and as such would be prejudicial to highways safety  conditions in conflict with the aims and intentions of policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Stores The Warren Polperro PL13 2RD
Description: Listed Building consent for the conversion of fishing store into holiday let accommodation.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of the design and the amount of alterations proposed  would result in an unsympathetic and harmful form of development which  would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the host grade II listed building (L'teglios  Fish Cellars). The proposal is therefore contrary  to policy  15 of the Polperro and Lansallos  Parish Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017 - 2030,  policies 12 and 24, of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, paragraphs 124,127, 130, 192, 193, 194, 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Stores The Warren Polperro PL13 2RD
Description: Conversion of fishing store into holiday let accommodation.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of the design and the amount of alterations proposed  would result in an unsympathetic and harmful form of development which  would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the host grade II listed building (L'teglios  Fish Cellars)  and the Polperro Conservation  Area. The proposal is therefore  contrary  to policies 1, 7 and 15 of the Polperro  and Lansallos Parish Neighbourhood  Development Plan 2017 - 2030, policies 2, 12 and 24,  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted  November  2016, paragraphs 124,127, 130, 192, 193, 194, 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Sections  66 and 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Koh I Noor 3 Higher Lidden Road Penzance TR18 4NZ
Description: Erection of carport.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed position of the car port towards the edge of the footway would be entirely at odds with the established pattern of development on both sides of Higher Lidden Road. The flat roofed  car port would be a prominent  and incongruous feature in the street scene by reason of its siting  and design and would , if permitted, be significantly harmful to the character and appearance of the area. The development is contrary to policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning policy  Framework 2019,  and the refusal would also accord with paragraph 130 of the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019 due to poor design.

Address: Carbis Bay Holiday Park Laity Lane Carbis Bay TR26 3HW
Description: Removal or variation of condition 21 (occupancy restriction) in respect of decision PA15/02691 dated 29/09/2017 (outline application for up to 49 houses)
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of the policy tests for the use of planning conditions as set out in paragraph 55 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018, the applicant has not satisfactorily demonstrated that removal of the occupancy condition  would  be acceptable, and the condition  is therefore still considered to fulfil a planning purpose.  Insufficient evidence has been submitted  in order to fully assess  the impact of policy H2 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood  Plan 2015-2030.    The removal of condition 21 from decision PA15/02691   would have an adverse effect on the balance of the local housing market and would  fail to strengthen  the local community. This would undermine  the sustainability  of the St Ives area and conflict directly with the aims of Policy H2 of the St Area Neighbourhood Plan 2010-2030. It would also be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 2a and 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies: 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 11, 54 and 55 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2018.

Address: Land Adjacent To Trelyn Mile Hill Porthtowan Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Erection of a single dwellinghouse within domestic garden
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the established  settlement  of Porthtowan and does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 nor is the site in question capable  of being considered to represent previously developed land.  The development therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic extension of the built form into the adjoining countryside which would  lead to visual harm through the erosion of the character  and appearance of the natural environment. In the absence  of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context,  the proposal  does not represent sustainable development  and is contrary to Policies 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Tehidy Mill Farm Tehidy Mill Roscroggan Camborne Cornwall TR14 0JB
Description: Barn conversion/extension and change of agricultural to domestic curtilage
RefusalReasons: 1 The development  relates to a site within Flood Zones 2, 3 and 3b; Planning Practice Guidance  and the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019 advise that a site-specific flood risk assessment is required  for all developments  in such areas. In this case, an appropriate flood risk assessment has not been provided. As such, it has not been demonstrated  that the development, which will introduce a more vulnerable use, is suitably safe from flood risk; neither  has it been demonstrated the development  would  not impact  upon flood risk elsewhere. The proposal is therefore considered contrary  to policy  26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 155, 163 and 164 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of Wadebridge Primary School Gonvena Hill Wadebridge Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission for the residential development of up to 300 homes with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan states that the delivery  of housing,  retail and employment growth in main towns will be managed through site allocations  in order to ensure that growth  is genuinely plan-led. The application site is not an allocated site for development,  does not constitute  windfall under Policy 3 nor the exceptions for residential development in the countryside under Policy  7. The scale of the proposed development is so substantial that it is considered that the granting of permission would  prejudice  the community-led Neighbourhood Plan process by determining decisions about the scale and location of new development around the town. Planning applications must be determined in accordance with the development plan unless material considerations indicate  otherwise.  In this case the material considerations  in respect  to accessibility  and landscape impacts are such that a departure from the development plan is not justified at this time particularly as the Council  is able to demonstrate an up to date development plan based on a 5 year land supply position (as required by the NPPF) and in addition  this is supported by delivery rates, consents  and completions for the town which demonstrate  that the local plan targets will be met. The proposed development  is contrary to Policy 1, 3, 4, 5 and 7 of the adopted Cornwall  Local Plan and guidance  contained within  paragraphs 2, 12, 15, 86, 90 of the National Planning Policy Framework and the long standing fundamental of the UK planning system  namely utilising a plan led approach  to development. 2 The proposed development would further increase traffic congestion on the road network, specifically at the junction of Bodieve  Road/Gonvena  Hill/St Matthews Hill.  The applicant has failed to secure  appropriate mitigation for deliverable improvements within the transport network within the foreseeable future in advance of the likely timeframe of the proposal being  occupied.  The resultant residual congestion is considered  to be severe  for the purposes of the NPPF and which would severely inconvenience road users and have associated environmental impacts.  The proposed  development  is therefore not considered to be sustainable development and would therefore be contrary to saved policy DVS5 of the North  Cornwall District Local Plan 1999, Policy 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan and paragraph 109 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 The site is considered to be countryside and is significant  in terms of providing positive landscape character, visual amenity  to and from the setting of the AONB.  The  proposal would represent  substantial new residential development  into to this locally important  green buffer and would accordingly result in harm to the intrinsic landscape  character,  the setting  of the AONB, whilst  the degree  of harm cannot be fully assessed due to the application being  outline,  policy requires great weight to be attributed to preserving the setting of the AONB. Given the location of the proposal  site and its conflict with the development Plan,  the impact would not be outweighed  by the benefits of the proposal  in its submitted form and is therefore considered contrary to Policies 2, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan and saved policy ENV1 and the aims and intentions of paragraphs 172, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework.  4 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the long-term provision of affordable housing, open space, educational  infrastructure, air-quality mitigation for which there is evidence of an identified need, and on and off-site highways works, the proposal is considered to be contrary  to paragraphs 8, 62, 91, 94, 96, 102, 103, 105, 108, 127, 181 of the NPPF, and CC Document - Guidance on s106 Planning Obligations for Education Provision  (April 2012) and Cornwall Local Plan Policies 8, 13, 16, 27, and 28. 5 The proposed residential development  would  be in close proximity to the commercial premises of Daftons, the submitted  noise reports  illustrates that housing in this location  will experience an unacceptable level of noise from this business which cannot be mitigated.  The proposed development would  therefore result in an unacceptable conflict  of uses which will have a detrimental impact  upon the living  conditions  of future occupants.  The proposal  is therefore  contrary  to policy 16 of the CLP and paragraph 127 of the NPPF.

Address: Land To The North Of Laity Farm Bridge Redruth TR16 4QG
Description: Retention of existing agricultural polytunnel, erection of a further polytunnel, and the retention of existing ancillary implement shed and rest room
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal relates to a site within Flood Zones 2, 3 and 3b; Planning Practice Guidance and the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 advises that a site-specific flood risk assessment  is required for all developments  in such areas.  No site-specific flood risk assessment has been provided with the application in hand. As such, in the absence  of the required assessment,  notwithstanding the proposal is for a less vulnerable use, it has not been demonstrated that the site is safe from flooding, and neither has it been demonstrated  that the development will not impact  upon flood risk elsewhere. The proposal  is therefore  contrary to policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 155, 163 and 164 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Ivy House The Lizard Helston Cornwall TR12 7NQ
Description: Lifting of condition 2 of PA18/11129 Retention and completion to previous approved application PA17/10022 approved 5.08.2018.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed lifting of the planning condition to retain  the roof light as fixed closed with obscure  glazing would result in the occupiers of the property having  the opportunity for significant levels of overlooking  and therefore  would  have unacceptable adverse impact on the residential  amenities of the occupants of neighbouring properties.  The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 28 Pendarves Street Beacon TR14 7SQ
Description: Proposed demolition of existing garage and replace with 2 storey garage and hobbies room
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed building would constitute a visually dominating discordant feature which would appear  at odds with the character  of the host dwelling, established  streetscene and would substantially infill an open gap harming the character  of the historic terraces. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 124, 125 and 127 of the National Planning  Policy Framework (2019) 2 The proposed building is considered to comprise a cramped form of development which would result  in an overbearing impact  upon the amenities of the host and neighbouring dwelling including a loss of privacy harmful to the residential amenity of the neighbouring  property to the west. The proposal  is therefore  contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  124, 125 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019)

Address: The Old Vicarage Chiverton Cross Blackwater Truro Cornwall TR4 8HS
Description: Permission in Principle for proposed erection of two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  result  in two dwellings in the countryside outside of any settlement and would have an adverse  urbanising effect to the detriment of the rural character of the location. The proposal would therefore represent an unsustainable form of development and conflict  with Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 policies  1, 2, 3 and 7 and St Agnes Neighbourhod  Development Plan policies 1, 2 and 7 and the environmental sustainablility  aims at Section 2 and paragraph 170(b) of the National Planning  Policy Framework to protect the intrinsic value  of the countryside.

Address: Agricultural Buildings Adjacent To 4 Coswinsawsin Lane Coswinsawsin Lane Carnhell Green Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Construction of single dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: 1 The site consists of undeveloped/agricultural land lying to the immediate  west of a disused barn in the open-countryside off Coswinsawsin  Lane to the west of Barripper. Despite lying in close proximity to a small number  of residential  properties and former agricultural buildings  the site is outside  of any existing settlement and the proposal for new-build open market residential accommodation would thereby conflict with policies 1 and 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) and with paragraph 8 of the NPPF (2019) which  seek to ensure that new development is sustainably located.  Furthermore, no special justification has been submitted in support of the application that might allow for its support under policy  7 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) or paragraph  79 of the NPPF (2019). 2 Notwithstanding that no details have been submitted  in respect  of the site access the only access  to the site from within the red line area would be through the proposed undercroft of the approved  barn conversion (known as House 1) to the east of the site. This would result in the occupiers of the proposed dwelling having to pass through the curtilage/private garden area of that property in order to access the dwelling. This arrangement  is considered unacceptable as it would lead to a poor standard  of residential amenity that raises  conflict with policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which  requires all development to protect individuals and property from unreasonable  noise and disturbance and with paragraph 127 of the NPPF (2019)  which requires development to function well and add to the overall  quality of the area.

Address: 47 South Street St Austell PL25 5BJ
Description: Revision of application PA19/03949 - Changed original proposal from a three bed to a two bed house with small increase in floor area.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed new home, by reason of its scale, form and siting, is shoehorned into the plot which would lead to a building that appears  cramped and at odds with the prevailing character  of the area, particularly in light of its elevated  position. The loss of undeveloped space and subsequent replacement with the proposed new building  would result  in harm to the intrinsic character of the area, detrimenting the existing aesthetic of the street  scene  and the Conservation Area. The application is therefore contrary to policies  1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016; paragraphs 127, 193, 194, 196 and 200 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019; and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land To The Rear Of 11-14 Pydar Street Truro Cornwall
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for proposed use or development to confirm a valid commencement has been made under PA15/01360 and PA18/07374 and permission remains extant for the development of 12 apartments
RefusalReasons: 1 The works evidenced and described in this certificate application are not considered to be a 'material operation' under Section 56 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 and therefore this certificate application must fail.

Address: Lydford Carnkie Redruth TR16 6RZ
Description: Construction of 5 detached houses and garages with garden amenity area
RefusalReasons:
1 The application site is not considered to represent infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030.
The development represents an undesirable extension and intrusion of the built form into a historic countryside setting to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside and setting of the Listed Buildings and World Heritage Site. The proposal would therefore fail to preserve the character and special interest of the listed buildings and World Heritage Site, leading to harm which would not be outweighed by any public benefit. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal represents unjustified development and would be contrary to policies 2, 3, 7, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 130, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: Land South Of Ashcroft Buller Hill Buller Downs Cornwall TR16 6SS
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for a new single storey detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement. The proposal, through  the introduction of the new dwelling, would  result in harm  by virtue of its poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance  on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. Given the lack of any adequate  justification,  the application  is not sustainable development and the proposal fails to meet the criteria set out in Policy 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and does not meet the criteria  of the PIP Amended Order  2017.

Address: Polperro Bay Cottage The Warren Polperro Looe Cornwall PL13 2RD
Description: Conversion of part of domestic outbuilding to self-contained annexe and holiday accommodation.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its siting, scale and design would  represent a new residential  dwelling which would result in an unsympathetic and harmful form of development  which  would  fail to preserve  or enhance  the character and appearance of the Polperro Conservation  Area, the South Coast Eastern Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  and the Gribbin  Head to Polperro Heritage Coast.  The proposal is therefore contrary  to policies 1 and 7 of the Polperro and Lansallos Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017 - 2030, policies 2, 12, 23 and 24, of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, paragraphs 8, 124,127,  172, 192, 193, 194, 196 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Chez L'ouest Cury Helston TR12 7BS
Description: Variation of condition 4 in relation to Application Reference No. PA18/05313 dated 21.09.2018 for Proposed New Dwelling with integrated annexe and retention of temporary caravan during building works to allow the caravan to be retained for a further 12 months
RefusalReasons: 1 The variation  of condition 4 from decision PA18/05313 if approved, would  grant the applicant a further 12 months  to reside on the site in the caravan. No meaningful start has been made on the construction  of the dwelling  and as the caravan has been on site for over 3 years   it is considered that no sufficient justification has been given for its retention on site. There is no development occurring on the site such that in this context the caravan  appears prominent and visible from public  viewpoints along the highway such that it appears out of place and detracts from the character  of the local area such that it would be in conflict with policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Cottage The Square Townshend Hayle Cornwall TR27 6AQ
Description: Retention of a vehicular access serving a parking space
RefusalReasons: 1 The constructed  development  does not provide a safe and suitable  access  for vehicles because  the proposed vehicular  access from the classified highway  leads to a parking  space that is not of a size to allow a vehicle to turn onsite.  This would result  in any vehicle attempting to enter or leave this access having to reverse into or out of the site onto the carriageway to the detriment of other road users and against  the advice contained in paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted  22nd November 2016).  The refusal of planning permission would also accord with paragraph 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Penrose Marquees Road From The B3285 At St Georges Hill To Cross Coombe Airfield Higher Trevellas St Agnes TR5 0XS
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed change of use of storage building to 5 residential dwellings
RefusalReasons:
1 The proposal does not constitute permitted development because the applicant failed to provide sufficient information under prior approval application
PA19/01499 to enable the Local Planning Authority to establish whether the proposed development complies with noise limitations applicable to the development in question, contrary to condition P.2 of Class P, and paragraph W 9 of Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (England) Order 2015.

Address: Land Rear Of Lamorna Glenside Gardens Lanner Redruth Cornwall TR16 5TW
Description: Construction of new two storey 4 bedroom dwelling and garage on garden plot.
RefusalReasons: 1 The access arrangement  proposed  to serve the scheme onto Pennance Lane is constrained by poor visibility to the left for drivers exiting  onto the adjoining road, with a speed cushion  in isolation not considered sufficient  to reduce speeds adequately and causing conflict with cyclists  and motorcyclists  and the junction arrangement. In the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise, safe and suitable access  to the development for all people is therefore  not provided and the application  is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.  The refusal of planning permission  would also accord with paragraph 109 of the NPPF. 2 In the absence of sufficient information to support the application where there is considered to be residential  amenity  impacts, it has not been demonstrated that the proposal would not unduly impact the occupiers of existing neighbouring  dwellings in regards to overbearingness, overlooking  and unreasonable loss of privacy. The proposal is therefore considered  to conflict with the aims and intentions of policy  12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 124, 125 and 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  (2019) 3 In the absence of sufficient information to support the application where there is considered to be present  flooding concerns, it has not been demonstrated that the proposal would minimise,  reduce or where possible eliminate flood risk on site and in the area. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions  of policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs  118 (b) and 149 of the National Planning Policy  Framework (2019)

Address: Tremoan Cottage St Mellion Saltash PL12 6RH
Description: Outline application for the construction of additional holiday unit (together with demolition of two existing stable blocks)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would introduce new holiday accommodation into the open countryside and due to the isolated location future occupants  of the development would be reliant upon the private vehicles to access services, goods  and facilities. The proposal  for two holiday  lets, regardless of a condition restricting its occupancy  would represent an unjustified dwelling  in the countryside thereby  giving rise to sporadic and unsustainable development. The proposed development  therefore does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 79 and 83 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of The Old Merrymeet Chapel Merrymeet Liskeard PL14 3LP
Description: Outline application for the construction of single dwelling and garage (and continued use of land for stationing of mobile home during construction period)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location detached  from the clearly  defined built form of Merrymeet which is located  to the north  side of the A390, does not round off or make  use of previously developed  land within or immediately adjoin  the settlement, and visually extends the built form into the countryside eroding the character and appearance  of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify it, the proposal  represents an unsustainable and sporadic  form of development  in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016).

Address: Dudley Cars Dudnance Lane Pool Redruth Cornwall TR15 3QT
Description: Permission in principle for proposed erection of up to 5-9 dwellings.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site forms part of a larger allocated site that seeks to bring forward office/commercial  space and a health  centre.  The provision of housing  on a key part of the site is likely to prejudice delivery of a comprehensive scheme and delivery of the office/commercial  space and health centre.  it would  therefore be contrary to policies 2, 2a, 3 and 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and policy CPIR-E7  of the Draft Cornwall Site Allocations DPD 2019. 2 It has not been clearly demonstrated  that South Crofty Mine would be able to comply with the conditions  of its mineral permissions attached  to decision  notices  PA06/01298, PA10/04564  and PA10/05145, especially  in terms of noise limits, without restricting its operating capacity.  Therefore  the mineral resource and infrastructure could  be subject to unacceptable detrimental  effects  and the proposed development  could suffer  unacceptable  adverse impacts as a result of the mining operations. The proposal would therefore  be contrary to policy MS1 of the Cornwall Council  Minerals  Safeguarding Development Plan Document, December 2018 and policy 18 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030. 3 Due to the shape  of the site, limited access points  and existing uses in the vicinity it has not been demonstrated that the site could accommodate the number of units proposed  in a manner that would  provide a high quality development for this important  road frontage, provide future occupiers with a satisfactory standard  of accommodation  and not result in unacceptable  living conditions due to noise or other  forms of pollution.  It would  therefore be contrary to policies 2, 12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030.

Address: Langweath Lodge Old Falmouth Road Truro Cornwall TR1 2HN
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for proposed development for 6 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposals would  increase the number  of vehicles utilising the substandard junction to the north of the site onto Arch Hill and require pedestrians to cross a busy dual carriageway via an uncontrolled  crossing over the Morlaix  Avenue arm of the heavily trafficked Arch Hill roundabout  to gain access into Truro resulting in an unacceptable  impact on highway safety  contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraph 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a satisfactory indicative layout for the proposed development,  arboricultural survey  and report the Local Planning Authority is unable to establish whether the proposed development could be accommodated  satisfactorily on the site without causing unacceptable harm to visually important  trees, including  the mature sycamore and oak protected by Tree Preservation Order C1/CK271,  contrary to policy 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Vine Cottage Annexe Cadgwith Ruan Minor Helston Cornwall TR12 7JU
Description: Lawful Development Certificate for Existing Use to prove property has been sub divided and used for holiday let.
RefusalReasons: 1 The Local Planning Authority does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to discharge the Applicants' onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land outlined in red on submitted drawing no P2.1 has been used as two holiday letting units for a continuous period in excess of 4 years prior to the date of this application. As such, the application for a Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use or Development is refused.

Address: Land South Of Curlews Road From Holywell Beach To Junction At Sea View Lane Holywell Bay TR8 5PP
Description: Construction of five dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the definable limits of the established settlement of Holywell,  and does not represent an acceptable form of infill or rounding off as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. The development therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic  extension of the built form in the adjoining countryside, which would lead to visual harm  through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify  residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary  to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The application site currently contributes to the rural landscape adjoining the settlement, sharing  characteristics with the coastal dunes setting. The proposed  development, taking into account the significant  massing  and contemporary form with a high proportion  of glazing, which does not demonstrate continuity with the form of adjacent and nearby  properties, would be a prominent visual intrusion (notably from the public  right of way to the west of the site), harming the existing natural characteristics  of the area, and eroding the landscape setting.  The proposal is therefore  contrary to policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South West Of Tre Pol Pen Ventongimps Callestick Cornwall TR4 9LH
Description: Proposed new underground self-build starter home and dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of any established  settlement  and does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 2030 because Ventongimps  is a low density straggle of dwellings with no clear definable  boundary  and is not part of a network of settlements and is not in reasonable proximity to a larger village  or town with more significant community  facilities and the proposed development would result  in unsustainable development detrimental  to the rural character and appearance of the area. In the absence  of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context,  the proposal  does not represent sustainable development  and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, and paragraph  79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Woodview Charaton Road Pensilva Liskeard Cornwall PL14 5RQ
Description: Proposed conversion of redundant agricultural barn into dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of any special justification, the proposal would create an unsustainable new dwelling  in the open countryside  in conflict  with the spatial strategy of the development  plan. In addition such a 2-storey dwelling through its introduction  into an attractive, predominantly undeveloped locality would  degrade the rural character of part of the Lynher Valley  Area of Great Landscape  Value. As such the development conflicts with Policies 2, 7, 21, 23 (1, 2 & 2(b)),  CL8 & 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the advice within  paragraphs 79 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Off Barbican Hill East Looe PL13 1BH
Description: Demolition of derelict outbuilding and redevelopment of the site to provide four dwellings, access, parking, landscaping, gardens / courtyards and associated infrastructure.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the loss of this green  space and due to the design,  scale and sitting  of the dwellings,  would result in an unsympathetic and harmful form of development  which would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Looe Conservation  Area. The proposal is therefore contrary  to policies  2, 12 and 24, of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016,  paragraphs  8, 124,127, 192, 193, 194, 196 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and Section  72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land North Of Azure St Merryn Padstow Cornwall PL28 8NF
Description: Outline application for the erection of 9 dwellinghouses (appearance, landscaping, layout and scale reserved)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  deliver  open market housing  that projects into and erodes the natural undeveloped character of the open countryside  which is designated as an Area of Outstanding  Natural  Beauty without directly  satisfying a local need.  The proposal does not accord with the spatial strategy  pursued by this Council in the development  plan and accordingly the proposal fails to comply with the development plan provisions contained within policies 2, 3, 7, 9, 21, or 23 and saved policy ENV1.  The limited economic and social  benefits of the development including the delivery  of housing  to support  the role and function  of the settlement, the construction jobs that would be created, do not outweigh the environmental harm nor the conflict with the development plan and the proposal  is not considered to represent  sustainable development. 2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the off-site contribution to affordable housing and educational  infrastructure, for which  there is evidence of an identified need the proposal is considered to be contrary to CC Document  - Guidance on s106 Planning Obligations  for Education Provision (April 2012) and Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 policies 8 and 28.

Address: Higher Worthyvale Farm, Lowen Bos Camelford PL32 9UA
Description: Application for Certificate of Lawful Development for an Existing Use namely occupation of dwelling in excess of ten years whilst not complying with agricultural occupancy condition.
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, it is considered that the applicant has not discharged their onus of proof, to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability the dwelling has been shown to have been continuously, for a period in excess of 10 years, been occupied by a person not solely or mainly in agricultural or forestry employment. As such that Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be granted.

Address: Land At Grenna Lane Grenna Lane Perranwell Station Cornwall TR3 7LL
Description: A single-level, 300 square metre single-family dwelling on the edge of the Carnon Valley scrubland
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is located  within  the open countryside  outside of any established settlement, does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and would result  in unsustainable development detrimental  to the rural character and appearance of the area. In the absence  of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context,  the proposal  does not represent sustainable development  and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and paragraph  79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a suitable Flood  Risk Assessment and Percolation tests carried out to BRE Digest 365 standard the Local Planning  Authority is unable to establish whether the proposed development can be satisfactorily drained in accordance with the relevant  requirements  of policy 26 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010- 2030.

Address: Orchard Terrace Trewidden Road St Ives Cornwall TR26 2BX
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling, construction of six residential dwellings, car parking and associated development
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal by virtue of the siting and layout  of the residential properties off Bishops Road would give rise to a cramped and contrived form of development  which would have a detrimental  impact  on the character  and appearance of the area.  Introducing  the built form in this area would reduce the openess  of the prominent site and would be contrary to policy  BE11 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan which seeks to retain  the existing relationship between plot size and building size.  The three properties and parking  areas would  fail to integrate successfully into the wider locality introducing a significant visual intrusion into this largely  undeveloped  frontage.  The proposal is therefore contrary to policies GD1 and BE11 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2015-2030, policy  12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan and paragraph 127 of the NPPF 2019. 2 The development  as a result  of its cramped and contrived layout would  fail to provide adequate private  amenity spaces to serve  each of the three units off Bishops Road.  It would fail to secure  a good standard of amenity for future occupiers who will be occupying  the properties  as their principal residence under policy H2 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development  Plan.  The application is therefore contrary  to policies  12 and 13 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, Paragraphs 124 & 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy GD1 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030.

Address: Higher Burthallan Burthallan Lane St Ives Cornwall TR26 3AB
Description: Conversion of barn complex to form 3 artist studios and live-work unit
RefusalReasons: 1 The access to the site is along a narrow, constrained, unmade  winding track (which is a designated Public Right Of Way) that is considered unsuitable  for the level of traffic  movements that the development would be likely to generate. The proposal is thus considered unsustainable  and contrary to policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) and paragraphs  84, 108 and 109 of the NPPF (2019) in that it fails to demonstrate that safe and suitable access for all people  and that it would not cause a significantly  adverse impact  on the local road network that could be managed or mitigated. It would conflict with policies GD1 (e), OS7 and T1 (c) of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan (2015-2030) in that it would adversely affect an existing Right of Way/footpath  and with paragraph 110 of the NPPF (2019)  in that it does not give priority to pedestrian movements, address the needs of people with disabilities, minimise  the scope for conflict  with pedestrians and vehicles  or allow for the efficient delivery  of goods and access by service and emergency  vehicles. It would also conflict  with policy  RA4 of the Cornwall AONB  Management  Plan (2016-2021)  in that it would  negatively impact on the accessibility of the Right of Way network  within the AONB. 2 Policy 5 (1) (c) of the Cornwall Local Plan  allows for proposals for new employment land and uses in the countryside  where they are of a scale appropriate to their location or demonstrate  an overriding locational and business need to be in that location such as farm diversification.  The existing  property consists of a number of disused semi-derelict  buildings  that do not form part of any active  farming enterprise and no supporting  evidence has been submitted to demonstrate that the proposed business venture  could  not be more sustainably accommodated elsewhere  within  the locality, particularly in the nearby  urban  area of St Ives. The proposal therefore  fails to accord with policy 5 and also policies 2 and 21 of the aforementioned Cornwall Local Plan, with policy MD15 of the Cornwall AONB Management  Plan (2016-2011) and with paragraphs 8 and 83 of the NPPF (2019).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          3 The applicant has submitted a Structural survey/report that advises in respect of proposed residential accommodation  (annotated  'kitchenette' on proposed site plan (ref:16023/13 Rev B)) that the building is very overgrown  and access  to it is limited and where visible its stone  walls are generally in a very poor condition.  In respect of the adjoining building (annotated  'managers living accommodation') on the aforementioned drawing the structural report gives no details as to the condition of that building.  Having regard to the lack of information in the structural report in respect of these clearly dilapidated structures it is considered that it has not been adequately demonstrated  they are capable  of conversion without extensive  rebuilding. The proposal  thus conflicts with policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which allows for the re-use of suitably constructed redundant buildings for residential purposes  that are considered appropriate to retain.  The preamble to policy  7 advises that the appropriateness of buildings for conversion  will depend on their structural  soundness and the IDOX/ability to convert  the building without  the necessity of substantial demolition  or substantial rebuilding operations. 4 The design and scale of the development, particularly  in respect of the increased/extended roof form and light spill, is such that it would  significantly increase the prominence/presence  of the site in the public domain  to the detriment of the character and sensitivity  of the wider rural landscape, which is a designated Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  (AONB). The proposal  would  as such fail to promote local distinctiveness  or conserve and enhance the wider setting of the site or the designated landscape and would  not accord  with policies 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030), with policies GD1 (b), BE10 and OS1 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan (2015-2030), with policies  CC7, MD9 and MD15  of the Cornwall  AONB Management Plan (2016-2021) or with paragraphs 79, 127, 170 and 172 of the NPPF (2019).

Address: Land North Of The Half Acre Carnon Valley Carnon Downs Cornwall
Description: Construction of a single dwellinghouse on previously developed builder's store land
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located clearly outside of and does not relate to any established or clearly definable  settlement, and therefore cannot be considered against the provisions  of policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030. The proposal therefore represents  an unsustainable  intrusion  of sporadic housing development  into the open countryside, in a location which will not encourage sustainable modes of travel, with future occupiers likely to be highly dependent  on a private  motor  vehicle. Additionally,  the introduction of a new dwelling will further erode the prevailing rural character  of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify residential  development in this context, the proposal therefore raises direct conflict  with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030,  policies H1 and D1 of the Feock  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning  Policy  Framework  2019. 2 The application does not demonstrate that a safe and suitable  means  of access  can be achieved to serve the site, with insufficient visibility demonstrated.  This is of particular concern  given the increase in vehicular movements to and from the site that can reasonably  be expected to result from the development. The application is therefore  contrary to policy  27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 108 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 The development  relates to a site partially within Flood  Zone 2, and wholly within  an area identified  on Council  mapping  as susceptible  to surface water flooding; Planning Practice Guidance and the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019 advise that a site-specific  flood risk assessment is required for developments  in such areas. In this case, an appropriate flood risk assessment has not been provided. As such, it has not been demonstrated  that the development, which will introduce a more vulnerable use, is suitably safe from flood risk; neither  has it been demonstrated the development would  not impact  upon flood risk elsewhere. The proposal  is therefore considered contrary  to policy  26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, policy SC1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017 - 2030 and paragraphs 155, 163 and 164 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Barn Coosebean Lane Truro Cornwall TR4 9EB
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed conversion of barn and use as dwelling house (C3) following appeal decision APP/DD840/W/18/3217830 (PA18/08021)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed change of use would not constitute permitted development in failing to adhere to the requirements of Class Q , Section Q.1 (i) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015, as amended, as the applicant has provided insufficient information to enable the Local Planning Authority to establish whether the proposed works required in the building operations for the change of use would go beyond what might be described as reasonably necessary and therefore planning permission is required. In accordance with Section W.-(3) of Part 3, Schedule 2, of the Town and Country Planning (GPDO) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), it is considered appropriate for the Local Planning Authority to refuse the application.

Address: Garages Rear Of 6 Trenoweth Crescent Penzance Cornwall TR18 4RY
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Removal of Garage/Shed and Construction of Dwelling House
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of a new dwelling  within the curtilage of the dwelling known as no. 6 Trenoweth Crescent would  lead to a cramped and contrived form of development that would be out of keeping with the existing strong building lines in the surrounding area. The surrounding terraced dwellings with good sized front and rear gardens are an important  part of the character in the area. The provision of a dwelling in this plot, together with the existing property and remaining curtilage to serve it, would result  in two properties which would  be at odds with the established character and appearance of the area and would fail to respect its form and traditional pattern of development.  The proposal  is therefore considered to be harmful  to the character and appearance of the area and contrary to policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8 and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: 25 Polmor Road Crowlas TR20 8DW
Description: Proposed Extension and Alterations (to accommodate elderly family member)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed  works, due to their scale and design,  fail to remain unobtrusive in the street scene and the setting, and result in an overly-dominant and imposing development at odds in the context of the surrounding built environment. The works further result  in the provision  of inadequate  off-road parking. The proposed development  is considered to be of a design that fails to take the opportunities available for improving  the character  and quality of the area.The proposal  is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies  1, 12 (paragraphs 1a, 1b and 2b) and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Sections 2.6 (bullet  point 1), 2.9 and 7.4 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013; the advice of the Cornwall Council Domestic Alterations and Extensions Guide  Version  4, 2017 (pg 6 'Design principles/What is context?' / Layout;  pg 7 'Scale',  'Building form',  'Proportions), and paragraphs 102, 124, 127, 128 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework.  2 The proposed works, by virtue of their scale and location  relative  to surrounding property, would result  in harm to the occupiers of the adjacent property known  as 27 Polmor Road by way of overbearing  and loss of light. The proposed development is considered to be of a design that fails to take the opportunities available for improving  the character and quality  of the area.The proposed  works are therefore considered  contrary to Policy 12 (paragraph 2b) of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 2.6 (bullet point 1) and 4.1 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall Design Guide  2013; the advice of the Cornwall  Council Domestic Alterations and Extensions Guide  Version 4, 2017 (pg 5 'First considerations'), and paragraphs  124, 126-128  and 130 of the National Planning Policy  Framework.

Address: 7 Halt Road St Newlyn East TR8 5LL
Description: Demolition of front boundary wall with garden re-profiled to form new off-road parking for one vehicle.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is considered to constitute a poor quality form of development as the use of the proposed development would  result in unsafe and unsuitable  access arrangements  which are contrary to Paragraphs 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.  This refusal also accords  with Paragraph 109 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 which  seeks to prevent development which  is considered to cause harm to highway safety. 2 The proposal would  result  in the loss of a non-designated  heritage asset, in which the public benefits do not outweigh the harm to the wall which  is considered to contribute positively  to the amenity  value of the area; contrary to paragraphs 184 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan.

Address: Land West Of Hillcrest Cottage Trenerth Road Leedstown Hayle Cornwall TR27 5ER
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use as dwelling (class C3)
RefusalReasons: 1 Based upon the evidence submitted by the applicant and the evidence in the possession of the Local Planning Authority, It is considered that on assessment of the evidence submitted that the property referred to as 'The Building, Land West of Hillcrest Cottage, Trenerth Road Leedstown, Hayle TR27 5ER (as described in the applicant's submission (ref 2303/JK dated 29th July 2019))' has been used for residential purposes since its construction in 2015 and as such fails to accord with the provisions of section 171B (3) of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 in that it has not been utilised as a self-contained, permanent dwelling in excess of 10 years and as such the Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be issued.

Address: Land Adj To Moorfield Barns School Road Praze An Beeble Cornwall TR14 0LB
Description: The construction of a single dwelling (revised)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, due to the siting, form and appearance of the dwelling, would  appear cramped and contrived  within  the context of its rural countryside setting outside of Praze  An Beeble and fail to positively contribute to the character and appearance of the area and promote local distinctiveness principally through the domestic fenestration proposed.  Further  the intended  layout would fail to function  well due to occupants  of the proposed  property  relying on a sole access via the parking and turning space serving  the existing barn conversion generating the potential for conflict through  ad hoc parking  restricting access  and the relationship failing to preserve the amenity and privacy of occupants of the resultant properties  both currently and in the future. The proposal would  be contrary  to the aims of Policies  HT1 and HT4 of the Crowan Parish Neighbourhood Plan 2018-2030, Policies  1, 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 70, 79, 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Pennare Farm Shortlanesend Truro Cornwall TR4 9DG
Description: Change of use of a farm building (barn) to create a childcare nursery. The structure will remain with additional doors and windows. A portable toilet building/structure to be installed to the exterior of the property and plumbed into existing water works and septic tank.
RefusalReasons: 1 In order  to achieve the visibility  splays proposed to create  a safe junction with the public highway a significant  amount of trees and hedgerow will need to be removed which is considered to have a major  urbanising effect and detrimental impact on the character of the area. The relocation of the hedgerow will not overcome the harmful urbanising effect  on the location.  The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy  23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The proposed childcare nursery  is in an unsustainable  location  away from any settlement and reliant on private  motor  transport. The existing access from the public highway provides inadequate visibility at the junction to the detriment of highway safety whilst the access  from the highway to the site lacks passing places which  contributes towards the poor standard of access and accessibility.  The application  is not considered to represent sustainable development and is contrary to the guidance contained  in paragraphs 8, 108 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies 1, 5(1) and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land East Of Pen Tregrahan Botallack St Just Cornwall TR19 7QJ
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Erection of an affordable self-build dwellinghouse and a domestic annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development represents an extension into undeveloped,  open countryside beyond the built form of Botallack.  The site is not allocated for residential development via a made  Neighbourhood  Plan, is not previously developed land and does not represent infill or rounding off development. In the absence of evidenced need for affordable housing in this location, the site is not supported as a rural exceptions site for affordable housing. The proposal  therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic  form of residential development in the countryside which  would  result in harm to the intrinsic character and beauty of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.   In the absence  of any other  material considerations which  outweigh such harm,  the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs  79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 Insufficient information has been submitted to enable an assessment of the impact on the proposal on the setting  of the Botallack and Truthwall Conservation Area and the Outstanding Universal  Value  of the St Just Mining  District World  Heritage Site.  It therefore cannot be fully determined whether  the proposals would conflict with the aims and intentions  of S72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990;  policies 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, Section 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies P3 and C7 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining  Landscape  World  Heritage Site Management  Plan 2013 - 2018.

Address: Land Adjacent To St Ive Village Hall St Ive Cornwall
Description: Removal of barn and shed and erection of a 1 bedroom bungalow
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its restricted  width and poor visibility at the access point with the highway, it has not been demonstrated  that a safe and suitable access to the site can be achieved for all users.  This would exacerbate an existing hazardous situation for pedestrians and drivers, thus the proposal is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), Paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Government guidance in the Manual for Streets.

Address: Yew Tree Cottage The Green Lane St Erth Hayle Cornwall TR27 6HS
Description: Retention of Existing Caravan for Incidental Use to Main Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 By virtue of the siting of the caravan outside of any defined settlement  and not within the residential curtilage of a dwellinghouse, the proposal gives rise to an unjustified residential development  in the open countryside  where new residential units are only permitted in special circumstances.   Furthermore it does not represent infill or rounding  off as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030.    The principle  of the development  is therefore unacceptable and considered contrary  policy HT2 of the St Erth Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017-2030,   policy 7 of the CLP and paragraphs 78 and 79 of the NPPF. 2 The development  represents an undesirable and sporadic  extension of the built form into the adjoining countryside, which has an adverse impact  on the character and appearance of the surrounding rural environment.  The design and appearance of the static  caravan  along  with the residential  use of the land and associated paraphernalia  fails to respect the visual  amenities of the area contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Coach House Lamellion Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4JU
Description: Use of existing staff accommodation as residential dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The information submitted with this application  fails to demonstrate that there is no longer any need for the staff accommodation to serve  the existing Residential Care Home  known as Coombe House. In the absence  of any compelling justification it has not been demonstrated to the Local Planning Authority that condition 6 of planning decision  90/01351/F is no longer necessary,  relevant to planning and to the development to be permitted, enforceable, precise and reasonable in all other  respects.  The proposal is therefore  contrary  to policy  7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016 and paragraph 55 and 79 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019

Address: Redundant Barn A Pencrennow Farm Reen Cornwall TR6 0AL
Description: Conversion of a barn to a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The existing building is not suitably constructed  or suitable  to retain as a dwelling requiring significant alterations to the predominantly  corrugated steel structure utilising only the skeletal frame  and replacement  of the existing walls and roof. The resulting building would also be harmful to the rural character of its immediate setting and would result in an unfettered  new dwelling  in the countryside contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Cornwall  Local Plan policies 1, 2, 7 and 12 and paragraphs  8, 78, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Land Adjacent The Croft Trevaunance Road St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0NB
Description: Permission in Principle Application for erection of one dwellinghouse on a disused tennis court
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal falls outside and is not adjacent to the Settlement  Boundary  for St Agnes and would extend development beyond  the current  built-form of St Agnes  to the detriment of the rural character of the area contrary to policies 1 and 7 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030.

Address: Land SSW Of The Cottage Castle Gate Ludgvan Cornwall
Description: Retention of 3 shipping containers used for storage, a Glamping unit vintage coach (seasonal use only), Double decker bus converted to cafe (seasonal use only) and a Marquee, used in conjunction with double decker bus cafe (seasonal use only) Seasonal use covers approximately 4 - 5 months per year.
RefusalReasons: 1 The open aspect  of the site and its prominence  in the public domain is such that the use of the land for the proposed  purposes would  result in the siting of highly visible conspicuous features that form uncharacteristic and discordant elements  within the local landscape, giving rise to unacceptable harm to the rural context and visual amenities of the area, which lies within an Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty (AONB). The proposal  would as such fail to promote local distinctiveness or conserve  and enhance the landscape  character  of the site or that of the wider designated landscape and would not accord  with policies  1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030),  with policy  MD6 of the Cornwall AONB  Management Plan (2016-2021) or with paragraphs 127, 130, 170 and 172 of the NPPF (2019). 2 Policy 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030)  allows  for new business uses in the countryside where they are of an appropriate scale or demonstrate an overriding locational and business need to be in that location such as farm diversification. The development of new high quality sustainable tourism facilities and accommodation are supported  where they would  be of an appropriate  scale to their location and provide a well balanced  mix of economic, social  and environmental benefits. The existing site does not appear to form part of any wider active  farming enterprise  and no supporting  evidence has been submitted  to demonstrate  that the proposed business  venture is necessary or economically viable, nor has It been demonstrated that the development would  have any local community benefits or that it has any particular  cultural  relevance to its location.  Having regard  to the above factors  and the visual harm to the character  and appearance of the natural environment the proposal therefore fails to accord  with the aforementioned policy 5 and also policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030), with policies  MD6 and MD15 of the Cornwall  AONB Management  Plan (2016-2011) and with paragraphs 8, 83 and 84 of the NPPF (2019).

Address: Land Adjacent The Bungalow Newquay Road Buckshead Truro Cornwall TR1 1TQ
Description: Proposed construction of two 3-bedroomed dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of any established  settlement  and does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify  residential development in this context,  the proposal  does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030.

Address: Bissoe Cottage Bissoe Hill Bissoe Truro Cornwall TR4 8SX
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for a new dwelling in the grounds of Bissoe cottage- approval sought for matters of access, layout and scale
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located clearly outside of and does not relate to any established or clearly definable  settlement, and therefore cannot be considered against the provisions  of policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030. The proposal therefore represents  an unsustainable  intrusion  of sporadic housing development  into the open countryside, in a location which will not encourage sustainable modes of travel, with future occupiers likely to be highly dependent  on a private  motor  vehicle. Additionally,  irrespective of details yet to be confirmed,  the introduction of a new dwelling  will further erode the prevailing rural character of the area. In the absence  of any special circumstances to justify  residential development in this context,  the proposal  therefore raises direct conflict with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land Rear Of Kei Wei Rinsey Lane Ashton Cornwall TR13 9SF
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for development of rural exceptions housing scheme
