RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  result  in a substantial increase in the built form on prominent land and would cause unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the countryside.  It is considered the benefits of providing affordable  housing  do not outweigh the identified harm.   The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 9, 12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 98, 124, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal would  generate an increased number of vehicular  movements from the site generating manoeuvrability  issues and potential conflict with vehicular and pedestrian users of the public  highway. The development  would  therefore  conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-230  and Paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Kilhallon Shutta Road East Looe Cornwall PL13 1BJ
Description: Construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling would result  in the loss of this green space and by reason  of its design, scale and sitting  would  result in an unsympathetic and harmful  form of development which would fail to preserve or enhance the character  and appearance of the Looe Conservation  Area. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24,  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, paragraphs 8, 124, 127, 192, 193, 194, 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990. 2 In the absence of engineering  land stability report which confirms  that the proposed development  is appropriate for its location  and can be built and safely occupied without adversely impacting on the stability of the public highway and the application  site, the development  is contrary  to paragraph 178 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Rear Of Penhallick Row Penhallick Road Carn Brea Cornwall TR15 3YL
Description: The residential development of land with parking and open space (outline with all matters reserved)
RefusalReasons: 1 Paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 defines open countryside as the area outside of the physical boundaries of existing settlements, where they have a clear form and shape. In this case, the application site is not considered  to comply with planning policies concerning new windfall residential development  in this area, and is therefore  considered to be situated in the countryside as opposed  to within the Pool urban area. Furthermore, the site is considered to relate more closely in a physical  and visual sense to the surrounding  countryside rather than the urban area. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; Policy 1 of the Cornwall Site Allocations  Development  Plan Document;  and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The application site occupies a prominent position in the local landscape, in-particular when  approaching from Whitcross  Hill to the north-west,  and provides  a pleasant transition from urban to rural as one leaves the Pool urban area. A development of the site is considered to erode  the prominent, natural backcloth provided to the urban  area by the site, in turn failing  to recognise and respect the character, sensitivity and capacity of the landscape  asset, as informed by the 'Redruth, Camborne  and Gwennap' Landscape  Character Area Assessment and the 'Carnmenellis' Area of Great  Landscape Value. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, and paragraphs  8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 By reason of the site's positioning within the direct  setting of, and in-between, prominent listed buildings and non-designated heritage  assets which are synonymous with the area's mining heritage  and which contribute to the Outstanding Universal Value of the Camborne  and Redruth Mining District  World Heritage Site, the proposal  is considered to erode  the appreciation  and understanding of the assets, and to in turn fail to preserve the listed buildings  and their setting and the authenticity  and integrity of the Outstanding Universal Value of the World Heritage Site. Furthermore, the submitted  Heritage Assessment has failed to demonstrate otherwise. Whilst the harm to the heritage assets would be less then substantial,  the public benefits of the proposal in terms of the provision of additional  residential units in an area with low strategic  demand is not considered to outweigh  this harm. The proposal  is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of S66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990;  policies 1, 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 184, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 4 In the absence of sufficient ecological assessment of the application  site where there is considered to be reasonable  likelihood of protected species  being  present, it has not been demonstrated  that the proposal  would  at least conserve and protect, let alone  enhance, the biodiversity  interests of the site. The proposal is therefore  considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017 (as amended); policies 1, 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs  170 and 175 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019; and Cornwall  Council's Biodiversity Supplementary Planning Document.

Address: Land Pt OS 5700 At Little Lanhargy Bray Shop Cornwall
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for use as a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in submissions in support of this application, representation received questioning the veracity of the application, and the Local Planning Authority's own investigations and regard to other information available to the authority, the Council does not consider that the evidence provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous, nor relates to a long enough period of time to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the subject chalet, on land at Little Lanhargy Farm, Bray Shop, Callington, Cornwall, PL17 8QJ (as shown in red on submitted Location Plan 2019-38-ED-XX-XX-DR-A-PL-1001) has been in continuous residential use for a period of at least ten (10) years prior to the date of this application being received. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Land And Buildings Off Marsh Lane Marsh Lane Hayle Cornwall TR27 5HX
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Demolition of Existing Agricultural Buildings, Construction of replacement Dwelling and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling would not constitute infill development or rounding  off in line with Policy  3 of the Cornwall Local Plan but, rather, would  introduce residential development in an unsustainable location within  the countryside.  Furthermore it would have an incompatible use with the adjoining industrial site at the detriment to existing businesses at the site.  The development is therefore  in an inappropriate location and contrary to the provisions of policy  SD1 of the Hayle Neighbourhood Plan 2014-2030, Policies  1, 2, 3, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Polices 2010-2030  and paragraphs  78 and 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Cambridge Barn New Portreath Road Redruth TR16 4QL
Description: Replacement dwellings for properties known as Unit 1 and 2, Cambridge Barn
RefusalReasons: 1 The scheme by reason of its siting, size, scale and bulk, is at odds with the characteristic rural setting. The scheme  introduces a residential built form which  would result  in the loss of the natural sloping green hillside which  rises behind the development  below and which  forms an important distinction between the natural beauty  of this hillside setting above.  The replacement dwellings are not broadly comparable  in size, scale and bulk of the existing dwellings and results  in a scheme that does not respond  to its landscape setting  and will inherently blemish an otherwise natural, sloping countryside setting. The proposal  would  therefore be contrary to Section 12, paragraph  127 and Section 15, paragraph  170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and the guidance within  the Cornwall Design Guide.

Address: The Range Road From Eastern Green To Roundabout East Of Godolphin Villa Long Rock TR20 8JQ
Description: Advert Consent: Externally illuminated Totem Signage
RefusalReasons: The sign will because of its height and width  will appear as an intrusive  and discordant  feature which will have a significant adverse impact on visual amenity.  As such it would be contrary  to policy 12 of the Local Plan and paragraph 132 of the NPPF.

Address: Land South Of Glebe Cottages Ladock Truro Cornwall TR2 4PG
Description: Erection of a single, detached residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development does not provide  an appropriate level of off-street parking, taking into account  the accessibility of the location in terms of public transport and proximity to facilities  and services. The proposal, if permitted would therefore likely lead to an undesirable increase in on-street parking to the detriment of road safety where  there are existing pressures. Furthermore,  this harm is not considered to be outweighed  by the economic and social benefits of the proposal.  The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019 and policies 1, 2, 13 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030. This refusal also accords  with Paragraph 109 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 which seeks to prevent  development which is considered to cause harm  to highway safety.

Address: Treravel House A389 Between Greenlane And Padstow Road Padstow PL28 8LB
Description: Retrospective application for the siting of 6 static caravans for seasonal workers accommodation
RefusalReasons: 1 The development  if approved  would create  six dwellings in the open countryside for which no functional need exists for their siting in this location.  It would therefore be contrary to the principles of sustainability  embodied in policies  1, 2, 7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 that seek to protect the countryside from inappropriate development  and locate development to areas accessible to services by a range of transport  options and the guidance within  the National Planning Policy Framework - 2019 with particular  regard to paragraphs  8, 79, 103 and 108. 2 The development  due to its siting within  the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty is considered  unjustified  with no attempts  to respond to the landscape character through sensitive siting,  design or use of materials. It sits in a compound  that extends into the adjoining  field and detracts  from the undeveloped qualities of the area failing  to conserve or enhance the character and appearance of this nationally designated  landscape for which the highest level of protection exists  and for which there is no overriding  identifiable local need to justify this harm. It would therefore be contrary  to policy 23 (a) of the Cornwall Local Plan - 2010-2030, the guidance within the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016 - 2021 with particular reference to Policy  MD9 and the guidance within  the National Planning Policy Framework - 2019 with particular  regard to paragraphs 170 and 172 which attributes  great  weight to the need for development to conserve and enhance the landscape character.

Address: The Old Lifeboat House Wharf Road St Ives TR26 1LF
Description: Balcony to restaurant frontage.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal by virtue of the projection of the balcony beyond  the building  line would interrupt  views within the Conservation Area of the designated  heritage assets.  The  development fails to take account  of the historic context  of the application site and the surrounding traditional vernacular  and would  therefore fail to preserve  or enhance the character and appearance  of the St Ives Conservation Area.  The proposed development would result in less than substantial harm due to the scale of the proposed development compared to that of the site and wider Conservation  Area.  The public  benefit arising from the provision of relatively  minor building works would not outweigh the harm to the designated heritage asset. The development  fails to comply with Policy GD1 and Objectives A and B of the St Ives Historic  Core in the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016, Policy  12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 127 and 193 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Capensis Tresevern Croft Goonlaze Stithians Cornwall TR3 7AR
Description: Proposed New Dwelling in rear garden
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  lead to a cramped form of development that would fail to provide continuity with the existing built form. The generous sized plots with sizeable rear gardens,  particularly  to the west,  are an important part of the character of the area and create a sense of spaciousness.  The provision of a dwelling within  this already  smaller sized garden would  result  in a cramped  form of development which,  together with the existing property and remaining curtilage to serve it, would  result  in two properties  which would fail to respect  or enhance the character or appearance  of the area. The proposal  would  appear overly intense and at odds with the immediate  surroundings and would  fail to promote local distinctiveness, leading  to harm to the landscape character. As the area is designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value, where the primary  objective is to conserve  and enhance the landscape, the identified harm is intensified. The proposal is therefore in conflict with policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Boscundle House Boscundle St Austell Cornwall PL25 3RJ
Description: Permission in Principle for Infill Development on Previously Developed Land to the north of Boscundle House
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement.  The proposal,  through the introduction of the new dwelling, would  result in harm  by virtue of its poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance  on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements.  Given the lack of any adequate justification,  the application  is not sustainable development and the proposal fails to meet  the criteria set out in Policy 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and does not meet the criteria  of the PIP Amended Order  2017.

Address: Steeple Lodge Steeple Lane St Ives TR26 2AY
Description: Retention of Detached Garage (with amendments to design relating to PA12/09175)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works, due to their scale, height and location,  would  fail to remain unobtrusive in relation to the street scene and the setting, and would result in an overly-dominant structure at odds in the context of the surrounding  built environment. The proposed  development is considered  to be of a design  that fails to take the opportunities available for improving the character and quality of the area.The proposal is therefore contrary  to the aims and intentions of Policies 1 and 12 (paragraphs 1a, 1b and 1e) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 2.9, 7.3, 7.4 of the Cornwall  Design Guide  2013, paragraphs  124, 127, 128 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework,  the aims and intentions  of Policies BE6 (a-d) and GD1 (a and c) of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan, and the advice of the Cornwall Council Domestic Alterations  and Extensions Guide 2017 (page 6 'What is context?  / Layout',  pg 7 'Scale',  'Building form', 'Proportions, pg 12-13  'Garages' and 'Outbuildings'). 2 The proposed  works, due to their increased scale and height,  would result  in significant harm to the occupiers of the adjacent  Treloyan Cottage by way of overbearing, loss of outlook, loss of light, and loss of privacy.  The proposed development is considered to be of a design that fails to take the opportunities available for improving  the character and quality  of the area.The proposed works are therefore considered contrary to Policy 12 (paragraphs 2a and 2b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Sections 2.6 (bullet point 1), 4.1 (bullet  point 1) and 4.11 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; the aims and intentions of Policy GD1 (a) of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan, the advice  of the Cornwall  Council Domestic Alterations and Extensions Guide  2012, (pg 5 'First considerations'), and paragraphs  124, 126-128 and 130 of the National  Planning  Policy Framework.

Address: Laurelin Altarnun Launceston Cornwall PL15 7SN
Description: Custom Build Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is located  within  the open countryside  where new dwellings are only permitted in special circumstances.  It is not considered that there is up to date evidence of an essential  need of the business for the occupier  to live in that location. There are no special  circumstances  to justify the dwelling  and the site is therefore not a sustainable location  for new housing development,   the development is contrary to development  plan policy  and would  cause material  environmental harm to the rural character and appearance  of Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, contrary  to policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 79, 127, 130, 170, and 172 in the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: Penmount Poughill Road Poughill Bude EX23 8NZ
Description: Proposed alterations to existing bungalow. Including raising the roof to create a two storey dwelling with room in the roof and proposed single storey rear extension.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extension and enlargement of the dwelling, by reason of the increased height and mass,  location of openings and diminished distance to the side common  boundaries results in a discordant feature within the street scene, a cramped form of development,  and issues of overbearing,  overshadowing and loss of privacy harmful to the residential amenity  of neighbouring  properties to the east and west (known as  'Kiltrasna 'and 'Hillside') and the character of the street scene. It is therefore contrary to Policies  2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 Â¿ 2030 and para. 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Little Trevilla Trevilla Hill Feock TR3 6QG
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal to develop the site with the introduction of a single dwelling would result in a poor standard of amenity  for future  occupiers by reason of the excessive shading and domination by existing trees and landscape structure located adjoining the south and eastern boundaries that are considered important to the character and appearance of the locality.  In  addition  to this there would  be the associated pressure for future  crown reduction or felling of the trees that would  erode the established verdant character of this rural hamlet located in the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty.  As such the proposal would be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies  BIO2, LS2 and D1 of the Feock  Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017-2030,  Policies  2, 12, 13 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and Paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Rickards Cottage Lower Metherell Callington Cornwall PL17 8BJ
Description: Outline application for the renovation of the cottage, reconfiguration of the building and the erection of 3 additional dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site forms part of a larger parcel of agricultural  land and does not constitute infilling or rounding off.  The site is not enclosed or contained  on its northern site boundary by a long standing  and enclosing boundary feature and the development  would represents an undesirable intrusion of the settlement  into the countryside which would  erode the character and appearance  of the village and would be detrimental  to the character and appearance  of the countryside.   The proposal does not represent sustainable  development and would  be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). 2 The application submissions fail to demonstrate how the proposed access,  parking and turning arrangements could successfully  operate in practice in light of the number of dwellings proposed and given  the narrow nature of the access  drive and the position of Rickards Cottage and a neighbouring  outbuilding  and boundary wall.  In the absence  of such information, the proposed development fails to demonstrate a safe and suitable access  and is contrary to Policies 13 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Trenow Farm Kenegie Hill Gulval Penzance TR20 8YN
Description: Conversion of agricultural building to form dwelling, installation of septic tank, formation of parking, change of use of land to domestic curtilage.
RefusalReasons:
1 The application building, being of nissan hut style design with brick walls and asbestos roof is of unremarkable and utilitarian design. As such the design reflects
the original agricultural use which is not out of character to the setting and is generally accepted as part of the rural landscape. The proposed conversion of the
building including introduction of new glazing, creation of a domestic curtilage, car parking and other associated domestic paraphernalia will give rise to a detrimental change in character thereby harming the character and intrinsic beauty of the countryside. The proposal does not provide any benefit in visual or landscape terms and it would not result in an enhancement to the immediate setting. The site is visually isolated from the residential development within Gulval, and would represent encroachment of unjustified residential development into the open countryside. The site is not immediately adjoining the settlement of Gulval, and with no pedestrian links to local facilities due to the lack of footway on the B3311 the dwelling would be dependent on the private car. The proposal therefore does not accord with paragraphs 8, 79, 103, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.
2 The access to the application site is constrained by poor visibility for drivers
entering the site turning right from the adjacent highway. The proposal has failed to
demonstrate the proposed access to serve the dwelling would be safe and suitable for
all people, including pedestrians. The proposal therefore fails to accord with policy 27
of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 and 109
of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Original Backpackers 16 Beachfield Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 1DR
Description: Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed Use for Change of use from C1 to Use Class C4
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed change of use from C1 to C4 is not one permitted via The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as Amended) and as such a lawful development certificate for the proposal is not issued and a full planning application will be required.

Address: Land North Of Westlands Helebridge Road Marhamchurch Bude EX23 0HZ
Description: Proposed new dwelling with detached garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal represents an unsafe and unsuitable access with very limited visibility and therefore has an unacceptable impact  on highway safety.  The proposal is therefore contrary  to saved Policy 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2016 and paragraph 108 and 109 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of up-to-date and appropriate evidence, the proposal  fails to adequately demonstrate how the development would impact  upon any species  protected by law both during and post implementation of the proposed scheme. In the absence of such information the Local Planning Authority is unable to assess whether adverse harm would  be generated with respect to any protected species and hence the development  is contrary  to the aims of policy  23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Between 30 And 36 Mount Wise Newquay Cornwall TR7 2BN
Description: Construction of 7 town houses and associated site works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  be out of character with the pattern and form of development in the area, and would be likely to appear  prominent within  the streetscene. The development  would result in the site having a cramped appearance which would visually  contrast  with the character  and appearance of the area. There would be conflict with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Policies G2 and D1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan which seek good design. 2 The proposal would  not provide acceptable living conditions for future occupiers.  The future occupants would have inadequate levels  of amenity space and privacy. The proposal would conflict with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan and the advice in the Cornwall Design Guide  2013. 3 The proposal would  fall within the 'recreational catchment' for the Penhale  Dunes SAC. There is no mechanism in place to ensure  the necessary mitigation towards the Strategic Access Management  and Monitoring for Penhale  Dunes SAC. The proposal would  therefore conflict with Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan.

Address: Countybridge Fishery Goonhilly Downs Helston Cornwall TR12 6LQ
Description: Proposed eco holiday chalets. Resubmission of PA17/09613
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would fail to accord with policies 1, 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030.  It would  also therefore be inconsistent with policies MD6 and MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2011-2016 and the guiding principles for the South Coast  Western  section of the AONB Management Plan at SCW8.18.  The proposal  would  harm the landscape and scenic  qualities of the AONB, the conservation  of which are afforded  great weight in paragraph 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.  Furthermore, the proposal would be inconsistent  with the paragraph 127 of the NPPF 2019 as it would not contribute to conserving and enhancing the natural environment. It would also be inconsistent  with paragraphs  83 and 84, which indicates that sustainable rural tourism development should  respect  the character of the countryside.  In addition, it would  be inconsistent  with paragraph 170 which  seeks  to ensure the development contributes  to and enhances the natural local environment by amongst other things, protecting and enhancing valued landscapes. 2 In the absence of any firm evidence to demonstrate that there is an identified site specific  need for the proposal in this location which could  not be met in a rural service  centre, the generalised benefits to the local economy arising  from the proposal would not outweigh  the inherently  unsuitable location of the site to serve the proposal on account of its location in terms of access to local services and facilities.  As a result, the proposal would  be inconsistent with policies 5, 7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 11, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 to achieving development in locations which are sustainable in transport terms and encouraging alternative  means  of transport to the private car. 3 Insufficient assessment has been provided to appraise the biodiversity value  of the designated site.  It is therefore impossible to assess whether there would  be any adverse impact  on the CGS, SAC and SSSI.  The applicant  has not demonstrated how the residential use of the site would be integrated with the conservation, protection and where possible  enhancement of the biodiversity  of the important  ecological  and geological features.  It is therefore concluded  that the proposal would be inconsistent with policy  23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and would not accord with paragraphs 170 and 175 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land South West Of Lynwood Lodge Lynwood Lodge Mousehole Lane Mousehole Cornwall TR19 6TR
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved: Detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 Due to the size of the plot, the proposed dwelling would result in a dwelling being built a short distance from the existing dwellings to the south-west and north-east creating a sense of enclosure. Due to the confines of the site, the proposed dwelling would  have a poor standard  of residential  amenity to serve  future occupants due to the positioning  of existing dwellings either side of the site. The existing two storey dwelling to the north-east would appear as a dominating structure overlooking and overbearing on the proposed dwelling. The standard of residential amenity  for both the existing  dwellings and the proposed dwelling would fail to comply with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.  2 The proposed access provides unacceptable levels of emerging  visibility resulting in an unsafe and unsuitable access for future occupants. The proposed development therefore fails to comply  with Policy  27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 3 The proposal would  introduce new residential development onto Flood Zone 3b. It has not been demonstrated that the development would be appropriately  flood resistant and resilient  and safe for its lifetime without increasing flood risk elsewhere and the flood risk assessment has not demonstrated  in enough detail that a safe access  and escape  route can be accommodated. Due to the known  flood risks posed by the development the proposal  is contrary  to paragraphs 155 and 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030. 4 The overriding character within the surrounding area is defined by dwellings having a strong frontage presence in the street  scene and as such the proposal would result  in a dwelling which  is unrelated  to the main layout  of the built form.  The proposal would fail to make a positive contribution to the character of the area and would  result  in an incongruous and uncharacteristic form of development out of keeping with its surroundings within  the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The proposal  fails to comply with Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Park Villa Garages St Andrews Terrace Park Road Ponsanooth Cornwall TR3 7HB
Description: Demolition of existing domestic garaging and miscellaneous storage buildings, construction of four dwellings, internal access road and alterations to existing vehicle access onto Park Road without compliance with condition 3 in respect of decision PA17/03022
RefusalReasons: 1 Due to the existing characteristics of the adjacent highway, the submission, approval and provision of a fully detailed speed cushion/hump highway scheme on Park Road is considered necessary  in the interests of highway  safety in accordance with the aims and intentions  of Policies 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Kilcummer Tregeath Lane Trewarmett Tintagel Cornwall PL34 0EA
Description: Conversion of barn into a single story dwelling by utilising a large proportion of the structure.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is located  within  the open countryside  where new dwellings are only permitted in special circumstances.  The existing barn is not appropriate to retain or suitably constructed to enable its re-use without a significant level of structural work. There are no special  circumstances  to justify the dwelling, the site is therefore not a sustainable  location for new housing  development and the development is contrary to development  plan policy  and would  cause material  environmental harm to the rural character and appearance  of Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, contrary  to policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 79, 127, 130, 170, and 172 in the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: Land Adjacent Summer Tides Trevaunance Cove St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0RY
Description: Demolition of Garage and erection of Self Contained Holiday Unit
RefusalReasons: 1 Contrary to the requirements of policy 12.2 of the Cornwall  Local Plan and advice in paragraph 4.11 of the Cornwall Design Guide  2013 the proposed  holiday unit would result  in unacceptable loss of privacy and residential amenity for residents  of the neighbouring  dwelling "Summer Tides" by reason of its close proximity and elevated position relative to the existing dwelling, and associated loss of privacy through perceived overlooking. 2 In the absence of requisite reports  on ground  conditions  and ecology  it is not possible to establish  whether  the proposals would meet the requirements of CLP policies 16 and 23 in terms  of potential impacts on ground conditions and ecology.

Address: Land South East Of Roodscroft Hatt Cornwall
Description: Provision of palisade fences and construction of storage and parking areas
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal represents development in the open countryside  without sufficient  justification and fails to recognise the intrinsic value and beauty of the rural landscape. The scale and form of the development would  result in an industrial style development  that would appear incongruous  and out of character with the surrounding rural area, negatively  impacting  on the visual amenity of the area and would erode the appearance of the setting  of the Tamar Valley  Area  of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  As such the development conflicts with policies 1, 2, 5, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic policies 2010-  2030, adopted  November 2016, together  with the provisions  of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019, with particular  reference  to Paragraph  127. 2 The proposal fails to demonstrate in highways terms that a safe and suitable access can be achieved and that the development  would not cause a significantly adverse impact on the local highway network.   The development is therefore  considered contrary to the requirements set out in policy  27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan, adopted Novermber 2016, and Section 9, in particular  paragraph 108, of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: The Old Chapel Helford Helston Cornwall TR12 6JX
Description: Single Storey Stone Out building to Existing Rear Terraced Garden
RefusalReasons: 1 The scheme by reason of its siting, design, form and appearance, is at odds with the characteristic  rural setting.  The scheme introduces a built form which would result in the loss of the natural  sloping  green space  which rises behind  the traditional linear pattern of development  below and which forms an important contribution to the natural  beauty  of this waterside setting. The siting of the building is considered  to lack justification given other  viable  siting  options and neither preserves  nor enhances the character or appearance  of the Conservation Area or the natural  beauty  of the landscape which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB).  The proposal would  therefore  be contrary to the National Planning Policy  Framework in particular Section  15, Policy 12, 23, 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan, the aims of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management  Plan 2016-2021,  and guidance within  the Cornwall  Design  Guide.

Address: 1 Bay Cottages Higher Fore Street Marazion TR17 0BA
Description: Three replacement windows to the front
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed double glazed windows,  by reason of their double  glazed  panes and design would appear as modern fixtures which materially dilute and degrade  the buildings historic  and architectural  character, thereby  undermining the integrity and authenticity  of the listed building.  The proposal therefore fails to preserve the fabric, character and special interest of the listed building,  leading  to harm which would not be outweighed by any public benefit. The proposed works would therefore be contrary to the Council's duty as local planning authority to preserve  the listed building  and preserve or enhance the character  or appearance of the Marazion  Conservation Area under Section 66 (1) and Section 72 (1) of the Planning  (Listed Buildings  and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 1 Bay Cottages Higher Fore Street Marazion TR17 0BA
Description: Listed Building Consent: Three replacement windows to the front
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed double glazed windows,  by reason of their double  glazed  panes and design would appear as modern fixtures which materially dilute and degrade  the buildings historic  and architectural  character, thereby  undermining the integrity and authenticity  of the listed building.  The proposal therefore fails to preserve the fabric, character and special interest of the listed building,  leading  to harm which would not be outweighed by any public benefit. The proposed works would therefore be contrary to the Council's duty as local planning authority to have special  regard to the desirability of preserving listed buildings  under Section 16 (2) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Policy  24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Morvah Cottage Lane From Junction West Of Hill Head To Morvah Cottage Portloe TR2 5PT
Description: Hedgerow removal notice to make two access points to land, each 4m long.
RefusalReasons: 1 The hedgerow in question is considered to be important as it has existed for over 30 years and meets criteria 1, 4a and 5 (a and b) of Part II of Schedule 1 of the Hedgerows Regulations 1997. It is also noted that the hedgerow is in close proximity to a building used for a bat roost. The removal of any section of this hedgerow will have a significant adverse impact on the historic and natural character of the area, which is not outweighed by any clear benefit. The removal of the hedgerow would erode the landscape beauty and character, negatively impacting on the experience for users of the public bridleway. The removal of the hedgerow therefore fails to comply with policies 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies LA1, LA2 and LA5 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030 and paragraphs 170, 175 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Gwel An Powdir Buckshead St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0XW
Description: Outline planning permission (all matters reserved) for single residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of any established  settlement  and does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and would result  in an undesirable and sporadic extension of the built form into the adjoining countryside to the detriment of the rural character  and appearance of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies  1 and 7 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood  Development Plan and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Eales Barn Saltash PL12 6PG
Description: 3no. new dwellings within the residential curtilage of Eales Barn Carkeel
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site forms part of a larger parcel of agricultural  land.  The site is not enclosed or contained  on its northern and half of its western  site boundaries  by long standing and enclosing boundary features and the physical and logical boundary of the settlement in this location is clearly defined and represented  by the existing stone wall which defines the northern boundaries of Eales Barn and Carkeel House.  The development represents an undesirable intrusion  of the settlement into the countryside which would erode  the character and appearance of the village and would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the countryside.  The proposal does not represent sustainable development and would be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). 2 As a result of the siting of the proposed dwellings, together  with the proposed  placement of windows, the development would adversely impact on the living conditions of the occupiers  of Carkeel House and Eales Barn,  causing loss of privacy and overlooking to the rear gardens and north facing windows serving these dwellings.  The proposed  development would  therefore  be detrimental to the living  conditions currently enjoyed by these occupiers and as such,  the proposed development  is contrary  to Policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted  November 2016). 3 The application submissions fail to demonstrate how the proposed parking and turning arrangements could successfully operate without vehicles  being forced to reverse the length of the driveway and onto the public highway  in light of the narrow and restricted nature of the private access  drive and the siting  of the neighbouring garage and parking  court associated with Eales Lodge.  Such manoeuvres would be detrimental to highway safety.  The proposed development is therefore  contrary  to Policies 13 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Land North Of Trewidland C Primary School Trewidland Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4SJ
Description: Construction of one infill dwelling with detached garage, including minor alterations to existing access to highway. (Infill between two houses approved under PA15/01192).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of this Rural Exceptions Site with an additional open market dwelling would take the provision of open market units on the site to 66%, which goes beyond  the 50% maximum for open market units set out within Policy 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan.  The site would no longer provide an affordable housing led development,  undermining the high need for affordable housing within the County  and conflicting with Policy 9 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted  November 2016). 2 The site is located in a rural area, divorced and isolated from nearby  services, amenities, employment and public transport links.  Future  occupiers of the proposed dwelling will be mainly, if not solely  reliant on private vehicles  to go about their daily lives.  The proposed development of the site with an open market dwelling would not outweigh the fact that the site is not sustainably located, where the development would  fail to contribute towards minimising waste and pollution, would fail to mitigate and adapt to climate change and would fail to support  the move  to a low carbon economy.  The proposed development is therefore  contrary  to Policies 1 and 2 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted  November 2016) and Paragraph 8 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Trethiggey Cottages Little Trethiggey Quintrell Downs Cornwall TR8 4QR
Description: Demolition of a double garage and the construction of a new dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed ccess does not achieve adequate visibility and the proposal will generate additional  traffic movements which are not considered capable of being  undertaken in a safe or suitable  manner.  Given  the third party ownership  preventing an improvement of the visibility, the proposal thereby fails to achieve safe and suitable access in accordance with Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Section  9 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development, by reason of the lack of adequate  associated private amenity space, fails to secure a good standard of amenity for future occupiers.  Instead the dwelling would represent a cramped,  sub-standard form of accommodation that would  be to the detriment  of the quality of the living environment experienced  by future occupants. As such,  the proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of paragraphs 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019,  and policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land North Of Wheal Peevor Sinns Common Redruth Cornwall TR16 4BH
Description: Change of use of land for dog daycare facilities and the erection of an associated storage/shelter/accommodation building
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of the prominent  position of the site within  the landscape, coupled with the undesirable  intrusion of built form and associated activities,   the proposal is considered to harm the setting  of the Wheal Peevor  World Heritage Site, and would fail to sustain or enhance the setting  of the Wheal Peevor  former  mining complex by undermining the significance of the designated Scheduled Ancient Monument,  and the three Grade  II Listed  engine  houses. The level of public benefit associated with the proposal does not offset  the identified  harm. Therefore, having special  regard  to Section  66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990 the proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 11, 79, 130, 184 and 189 to 202 of the National Planning Policy  Framework (February 2019). 2 The Noise Impact Assessment does not provide a sufficient site specific assessment for the Authority to assess the potential  noise impacts of the proposal in accordance with BS:4142 (2014). Therefore, the proposal is considered contrary to policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and section  15 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Forest End Pendarves Estate Pendarves Camborne Cornwall TR14 0RT
Description: Certificate of lawfulness application for 2 static caravans (re-submission of PA18/06361)
RefusalReasons: 1 That the stationing of two static caravans for residential use on land at Pendarves Estate, Pendarves, Cornwall TR14 0RT (as shown outlined in red on the Site Location Plan received 13 May 2019) constitutes a contravention of the requirements of an enforcement notice in force and the use cannot be considered to be lawful having regard to Section 191(2) (b) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: The Caravan Carthvean Trenear Wendron Cornwall TR13 0JL
Description: Lawful Development Certificate for Existing Use for siting of caravan for residential purposes
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the caravan has been used for self-contained residential accommodation for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: 47 South Street St Austell PL25 5BJ
Description: To build a new two-storey, three-bed detached house with parking within the curtilage of 47 South Street.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed new home, by reason of its scale, form and siting, is shoehorned into the plot which would lead to a building that appears  cramped and at odds with the prevailing character  of the area, particularly in light of its elevated  position. The loss of undeveloped space and subsequent replacement with the proposed new building  would result  in harm to the intrinsic character of the area, detrimenting the existing aesthetic of the street  scene  and the Conservation Area. The application is therefore contrary to policies  1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016; paragraphs 127, 193, 194, 196 and 200 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019; and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990.  2 The proposed new home, by reason of limited floor space, fails to secure  a good standard of amenity for existing  and future occupants. In contrast it would result in the creation of a cramped, sub-standard  form of accommodation  that would be to the detriment of the quality of the living environment experienced  by future occupants.  The application is therefore contrary  to policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and Paragraph 124 & 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Polstraul Trewalder Delabole Cornwall PL33 9ET
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for a proposed live/work unit
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed live / work unit, by reason of its open countryside  location detached from any definable settlements, services and facilities,  represents an unsustainable residential  and employment  use in the countryside  for which no special circumstances  have been demonstrated. There is no overriding justification for a dwelling  to be within that location for the business  to be run from the proposed  location. The proposal therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic  form of residential  and employment  development in the countryside  and, in the absence of any other material  considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016)  and paragraph 8, 11, 79 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: 4 Kenwyn Street Truro TR1 3DJ
Description: Advertisement consent for 5 no. fascia signs powder coated folded aluminium panel with vinyl graphics; 2 no. fascia signs powder coated folded aluminium panel with halo illuminated letters and 1no. panel mounted projecting sign with pelmet illumination
RefusalReasons: The proposed adverts,  by reason of their size, siting, materials and illumination would have a harmful impact  on the visual amenity of the area, including the setting of Truro Conservation Area.   The application  is, therefore, contrary  to Policies  2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030,  paragraphs 127 and 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy C5 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan.

Address: Gyllngvase Tennis Courts Queen Mary Road Falmouth Cornwall TR11 4DP
Description: Temporary siting of a tennis coaching building associated with tennis club facilities associated with St Michaels Resort. Maximum consent period sought will be 3 years from consent.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its design, form and appearance,  is considered to result in a significant adverse impact  upon the character  of the area and fails to preserve or enhance  the character and appearance of the Falmouth Conservation  Area contrary  to Policies  2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030,  Policies DG4, DG6 and DG7 of the emerging Falmouth  Neighbourhood Development Plan, advice contained within  Sections 2.9, 2.10, 7.3, 7.6, 7.7, 7.8 and 7.9 of the Cornwall  Design  Guide 2013, advice contained within  Sections  12 and 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, and advice contained within  the National Design  Guide 2019.

Address: Tregatherall Farm Boscastle Cornwall PL35 0EQ
Description: Outline application (with all matters reserved) for a single storey, 3 bedroomed bungalow
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling is located within the open countryside  within the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty where there are no special circumstances to justify  a residential dwelling within  this location.  The proposal  would therefore be contrary to national and local planning policies.  In the absence of any special circumstances to justify  the dwelling in this context,  the proposal does not represent sustainable development  and would  be contrary to the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies 1, 3 and 7 and 21 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2016.

Address: Land West Of 3 Green Meadows Camelford PL32 9UD
Description: Outline application for the construction of 6 dwellings with some matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings represent an extension into undeveloped,  open countryside beyond the built form of the settlement of Camelford. The site is not allocated for residential  development  via a Site Allocations DPD or made Neighbourhood Plan and does not represent infill or rounding off development. The proposal therefore represents  an undesirable  and sporadic form of residential development in the countryside which  erodes the character and appearance of the area and, in the absence  of any other material  considerations  which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies  1, 2(1d)  3, 7, 21 and 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November  2016)  and paragraph 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal has failed to demonstrate the proposed access to serve  the dwellings would be safe and suitable , including for  pedestrians and refuse collection vehicles.  The proposal therefore  fails to accord with policy  27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 3 The site is more than 0.1ha  and the application is not accompanied  by a ecological assessment and therefore the impact  on any protecteds pecies cannot be assessed and is therefore contrary  to policy  23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  175 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South West Of Oak Ridge Little Polgooth St Austell Cornwall PL26 7DD
Description: Siting of a log cabin for holiday use
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement.  The proposal,  through the introduction of the new holiday  dwelling, would result  in harm to the natural  beauty and distinctive  character of the surrounding countryside  and in new accommodation  with poor accessibility  to necessary daily services  and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle  and unsustainable traffic movements.  Given the lack of any adequate justification, the application is not sustainable  development and is contrary to policies;  2, 5, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 adopted 2016.

Address: Units 5 - 6 Miller Business Park Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4DA
Description: Change of use from vehicle repair workshop (Class B2) to bus garage (Sui Generis)
RefusalReasons: 1 There is insufficient information to demonstrate that the proposed access is safe and suitable. The proposal would therefore be to the detriment of highway safety, contrary to policy  27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Flexbury Hall Poughill Road Poughill Bude EX23 8NX
Description: Erection of single dwelling house on land south west of Flexbury Hall
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal has failed to demonstrate the proposed access to serve  the dwelling would be safe and suitable for all peoples, including pedestrians.  The proposal  therefore fails to accord with policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development as a result of its cramped and contrived layout and height would  have an adverse effect on the visual and residential amenities  of the occupiers of dwellings known as Nos.6 and 7 Cedar Grove, in particular, through loss of privacy and overlooking, and by being overbearing on both the neighbouring properties and on the future occupants  of the proposed  dwelling. As such the proposal  is contrary  to Policy 12 of The Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Camborne Retail Park Trevenson Road Camborne TR15 3PS
Description: Proposed variation of Condition 1 on Planning Permission PA18/05073 dated 14/1/2019
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed introduction  of a proportion of convenience  (i.e. food) retail,  in conjunction with other  existing and consented retail schemes, would have a cumulative materially  adverse  impact  upon the vitality and viability of Camborne town centre contrary to Policy 4 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030 and advice contained  within paragraph 86 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Poldhu Sandy Lane Harlyn Bay Padstow PL28 8SD
Description: Demolition of dwelling and erection of a replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its scale, bulk and design and in particular its scale and relationship  with Sandy Lane,  results in a cramped  and incongruous  form of development which would lead to an uncharacteristically  dominant feature in this locality and would be harmful to the established  character  and appearance of the area.  As such the application does not constitute high quality  design and is contrary to the aims and intensions of Policies  2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 128 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South East Of Cornerstones Kilkhampton Bude Cornwall EX23 9RY
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the continued use of yard and shed for vehicle and material/tool storage in connection with agricultural garden fencing business.
RefusalReasons: 1 Based upon the evidence submitted by the applicant and the evidence in the possession of the Local Planning Authority, the comment received from the Parish Council, and the third party representations received providing evidence to the contrary of the application, it is not considered that on the balance of probability that the applicant has discharged an onus of proof the Land South East of Cornerstones, Kilkhampton has been used for a vehicle and material/tool storage in connection with agricultural fencing business for a period in excess of 10 years. As such that Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be granted.

Address: Trevilgan Farm Mawgan Helston Cornwall TR12 6BE
Description: Outline permission with all matters reserved construction of a single dwelling for an agricultural worker.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of the site with a residential  dwelling  by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced from nearby services, facilities, amenities  and employment,  would represent unsustainable new residential development for which no special  justification has been adequately demonstrated.  The proposal therefore represents an unsustainable,  undesirable and sporadic  form of development that would  be harmful  to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside  and the landscape setting of the surrounding area.  The development  is therefore  contrary to Policies 1, 2, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy E3 of the Minerals Local Plan 1998.

Address: Lower Spargo Cottage Rose Valley Mabe Burnthouse TR10 9JF
Description: Conversion of agricultural building into self contained habitable unit
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its open countryside  location detached from any definable settlements, services and facilities,  represents an isolated,  unsustainable dwelling in the countryside  for which  no special  circumstances  have been demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents  an undesirable and sporadic form of development  in the countryside  and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030  and paragraphs 8, 79, 127,  170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a bat survey  it is not possible  to fully assess  any potential  impacts of the development  upon bats, which are European  protected species, that may be present and/or on any bat roosts and to understand what mitigation measures may be necessary in order  to address any potential adverse impacts upon bats and/or bat roosts. The development  is therefore considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and the advice  in paragraphs 170 and 175 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019, and advice contained within section 5.2 of the Cornwall Planning for Biodiversity Guide  2018. 3 In the absence of a Phase 1 desk study it is not possible to identify any potential contamination risks that may be present  on site where there is a proposed sensitive/vulnerable end use, where the protection  of human health is particularly important.  The development is therefore  considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies  1 and 16 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 178 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Mannshone Penwarne Road Mawnan Smith Cornwall
Description: Outline application for residential development with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site would not normally be released  for housing development, other than as a Rural Exception Scheme under  Policy 9 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. Policy 9 requires developments to be clearly  affordable housing led and the affordable  homes would need to meet local needs.  Based upon the available  data, which  includes the Council's HomeChoice housing needs register,  there is insufficient housing need within  Mawnan  Smith  Parish  to justify releasing this site. The registered  housing need will be met by existing developments in Mawnan Smith. On the basis of registered  need and the number of homes currently being  delivered in the area an affordable  housing  led development under Policy 9 cannot be supported  without  additional  evidence of housing need in the Parish. The application would  be contrary to Policy 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and the aims and intentions of paragraph 77 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The application fails to demonstrate that the proposed development can be satisfactorily accommodated on the application  site in a manner that would not result in adverse visual impact and harm  to the rural character  of the area when viewed from Penwarne Road, because of the relatively  exposed situation of the site on rising  land above the level of the road and by reason  of the size of the scheme and the higher density of development in comparison to the existing residential development to the north.  The proposed  development  would  be contrary to Policies  2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030; and the aims and intentions of paragraphs 122, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 In the absence of a mechanism  to adequately secure  the provision  of on-site affordable homes,  on-site public open space, a financial contribution towards education infrastructure, and a financial contribution towards mitigating the impacts of recreation  activities on the Fal and Helford Special  Area of Conservation, the proposal is considered to be contrary to Policies 6, 8, 9, 13, 22, 23 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030;  and the aims and intentions  of paragraphs  92, 94, 96, 170 and 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of St Anthonys Cottage West Looe Hill West Looe Cornwall PL13 2HJ
Description: Outline planning permission for the construction of a dormer bungalow with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, as a result of the siting  and layout of the proposed dwelling, the small  size of the plot and the proximity of the dwelling to the site boundaries would overlook the rear gardens and rear facing windows of the properties to the south,  namely  Rose Cottage and Little Owl Cottage, resulting in a loss of privacy thereby  harming the living conditions  and amenities enjoyed by the occupants. The proposed  development  would therefore be contrary to policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). 2 The proposed dwelling would result  in the loss of an undeveloped garden and would intensify  the built form of modern dwellings  above the traditional properties fronting onto West Looe Hill. The further erosion of green spaces within this part of Looe would harm the character and appearance of the Conservation Area which would not be outweighed by the limited benefits of the scheme, contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Gwellheans 1 Alma Place Redruth TR15 2AT
Description: Change of use of building from offices (B1.a Use Class benefitting from a prior notification decision to convert into 7no. residential flats) to 12 bedroom house in multiple occupation residential use
RefusalReasons: 1 The number of proposed bedrooms in the size of the building  would  create  a poor living environment  for the future occupants contrary  to policy 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 -2030 and paragraph  127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.  In addition the proposal if permitted adds to the imbalance of the community by not providing an adequate mix or balance  of housing contrary  to policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 -2030 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 as a whole.

Address: Land East Of Mevagissey CP School Mevagissey Cornwall PL26 6TD
Description: Proposed cross-subsidy residential development comprising 7 dwellings (4 affordable), access and landscaping. The proposals include associated driveways, car parking and private gardens
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  introduce built development into an undeveloped green field within a prominent position within an Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty(AONB)   and in an area identified  within the Mevagissey Neighbourhood Plan as a prominent ridge or skyline above which development should not protrude.  The proposal, therefore,  would cause harm to the distinctive natural qualities  and scenic beauty  of a sensitive part of the AONB  landscape and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030; policies D1 and EG1 of the Mevagissey  Neighbourhood Plan; and paragraphs 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 At the time of issuing the decision  an agreed mechanism to secure the provision of affordable housing, and off-site financial contributions for education infrastructure, which there is evidence of an identified  need, and 25% accessible homes (Building Regulations Approved Document M4 (2): Accessible and adaptable dwellings) had not been signed,   the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 9, 13, and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan, , and CC - Guidance on s106 Planning Obligations for Education Provision  (April 2012). In accordance with paragraphs 34, 54 and 56 of the National  Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land South Of Noels Meadow Noels Meadow Mount Cornwall PL30 4DG
Description: Outline application for the construction of 5 detached dwellings with all matters reserved except access
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the settlement  of Mount and the proposed development  does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance  with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030.  In the absence of any affordable  housing provision  or any other special circumstances to justify residential development in this context,  the proposal  does not represent sustainable development  and would be contrary to policies 3 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016.

Address: Land North Of Barn Park Whitecross Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 7JD
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for residential development.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of introducing new homes  onto an undeveloped field, would harm the distinctive natural beauty  and character of the surrounding Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty.  In the absence of demonstrable benefits to outweigh  this harm, such as addressing a high level of local affordable  housing need,  this proposal  is not sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 9, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: The Haven Plaidy Lane East Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 1LF
Description: Demolition of an existing dwelling and construction of a replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application fails to demonstrate the proposed dwelling  and its occupants would be safe for the minimum design life of 100 years from coastal erosion without the need for a replacement or encapsulation of a sea wall which would  be contrary to the 'No Active Intervention' policy  of the Shoreline  Management Plan 2 Policy  Unit 3.3 (Plaidy). Furthermore  the applicant has in any event failed to establish that he is able to carry out any significant  acts of repair or enlargement  to the existing sea defence which is fundamental to the safety of the proposed  dwelling and future occupants. The proposal would  therefore  fail to accord with policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraph  155 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and paragraph: 026 (Reference ID: 7-026-20140306) of the National  Planning Practice Guidance  2019.

Address: Vose Farm Holiday Cottages Access To Vose Farm Tregony Truro TR2 5SH
Description: Full planning for 60 hard standing pitches with electrical hook-ups, two amenity blocks and a reception/office building. Plus infrastructure of an on-site road system.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site falls beyond the confines of any identifiable settlement  and falls within an isolated rural location with no access  to public transport or services and facilities. The introduction of 60 hard standings associated infrastructure, 2 amenities  block and a reception building would introduce  built development into the countryside  which would  appear incongruous in its setting  due to its scale and would have a detrimental impact  upon the intrinsic  rural character of the area. The application  is not considered to represent sustainable development and would be contrary  to policy 2,5, 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 170 of the NPPF 2019. 2 The application site is located within an isolated  rural location accessed via a road network which is largely single width in nature, lacking passing places and with poor intervisilibity  due to carriageway alignment. The introduction of another 60 caravans onto this road network without additional passing places or road improvements would result  in traffic conflict. It therefore concluded that the applicant has not demonstrated a safe and suitable  access and the proposal  is therefore contrary  to Policy 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Church Farm Radnor Road Radnor Cornwall TR16 4AT
Description: Partial demolition, extension, reconstruction and change of use of existing redundant mill and outbuildings to form 7 No. dwellings with 7 No. domestic garages, associated external works and installation of a domestic sewage treatment plant.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, as a consequence of the amount of demolition  proposed and re-building  required,  with the addition of new first-floor elements  is tantamount to the construction of new dwellings in the open countryside  for which no special  justification  has been provided in planning terms. The conversion of building A into a dwelling  would include large amounts  of glazing and in conjunction with the development being  proposed it would  lead to a domestification of the site which would  be adversely harmful  to the character  of the countryside location. The proposal does not provide any benefit in visual or landscape terms. New residential  curtilages  would be established which would  include car parking and other domestic paraphernalia in this rural location which would result  in a harmful impact on the character and appearance of the countryside. As such, the proposal fails to accord with the provisions,  aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Merlin Golf Club Access To Merlin Golf Club Mawgan Porth Newquay TR8 4DN
Description: Proposed construction of ten holiday units
RefusalReasons:
The application site is located in an open countryside location where occupiers of the proposed new homes would have poor accessibility to services, facilities, amenities, and employment without reliance on trips by private car.  This conflicts with the objectives of enhancing active travel patterns, improving access to public transport, access on foot, and encouraging a modal shift away from private motor vehicles, in the interests of reducing resource consumption, air quality improvement and improving public health.  The application is therefore not sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and the aims and intentions of paragraphs 8, 79, 91, 102, 103, 108, 117, 148 and 150 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.  

The proposed development, by reason of introducing 10 new homes onto the site, will harm the distinctive nature, character and beauty of the surrounding Area of Great Landscape Value. This is in direct conflict with Saved Policy 14 of the Restormel Local Plan and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 5, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Churchtown Farm Tresmeer Launceston Cornwall PL15 8QT
Description: Outline application with some matters except access reserved for erection of 6 self-build dwellings and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings represent an extension into undeveloped,  open countryside beyond the built form of Tresmeer. The site is not allocated  for residential development via a made  Neighbourhood  Plan, is not previously developed land and does not represent infill or rounding off development. In the absence of evidenced need for affordable housing in this location, the site is not supported as a rural exceptions site for affordable housing. The proposal  therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic  form of residential development in the countryside which  erodes the character and appearance of the area and, in the absence  of any other material  considerations  which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies  1, 2(1d)  3, 7, 9, 21 and 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraph 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of an off-site financial contribution towards  education  and affordable housing provision, the proposal  is considered to be contrary to guidance  contained within  Policies 8 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November  2016)  and paragraph, 54 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 As there is a possibility of disturbance  to bats (a European Protected Species) the application has been assessed against the Conservation  of Habitats and Species  Regulations 2010 derogation tests.  In considering  the proposal, the Local Planning Authority are not satisfied  that there are no 'satisfactory  alternatives' to the development  of this particular parcel  of land and that the development is not in the interest  of public health  or public safety or for 'other imperative reasons of overriding public interest'   .
