As such,  the proposal fails to meet two of the derogation tests and would have an unjustified  impact on a protected species  in this instance contrary  to the above mentioned regulations. As such the proposal is contrary to the provisions of Paragraph 174 and 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 23 (3(d.)) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016).

Address: Trescowe Stables Trescowe Road Goldsithney Cornwall
Description: Erection of four miniature horse stables and feed room, and new field entrance.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed building is not considered to be reasonably necessary given  there is an existing building available on the land and as such the development represents an unjustified form of development  in the open countryside contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 83, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 It has not been demonstrated that an adequate means of access  can be achieved  without having an adverse impact on the visual amenity of the area and a detrimental impact to protected  trees and as a result  the proposal is considered to fail to protect the area contrary to the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and with paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the NPPF 2019.

Address: The Cardinals Hatt Hatt Saltash Cornwall PL12 6PJ
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved for the construction of a hotel comprising of 56 hotel rooms and leisure facilities, including associated parking with appearance and landscaping reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  result  in a new, freestanding hotel in an out of town location removed from population  centres,  not easily accessible other  than by private car.  In addition, through  its scale and massing it would  appear as a conspicuous, incongruent feature in the still largely rural landscape,  in a manner  that would fail to conserve and enhance the natural beauty of the Tamar  Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  As such the development conflicts with Policies 2, 3.4, 4, 5.3, 23 & 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2016 and the advice within paragraphs 86,127,  170 & 172 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019. 2 No mechanism has been secured to ensure that the proposed development would make adequate provision to mitigate its impact on the Tamar  Estuary Special  Area of Conservation  and the Plymouth  Sound Special Protection Area. As such the proposal is contrary  to Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the guidance within paragraphs 1-10 of the Appropriate Assessment section  of the National Planning Practice Guidance, as updated on 22 July 2019;  and it would contravene Council  Directive 92/43/EEC on the Conservation of natural habitats  and of wild fauna and flora (known as the Habitats Directive).
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Lower Trewedna Farm Trewedna Lane Perranwell Station TR3 7PQ
Description: Conversion of barn to form dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would not result in the reuse of a suitably constructed disused rural building  which is considered appropriate to retain by reason of its rudimentary construction, and if converted, it would  not lead to an enhancement to the immediate  setting due to potential  loss of oak trees who's value has not been established in accordance with a survey carried out to British  Standard 5837,  the introduction  of domestic paraphernalia within the open countryside and its increase roof mass, contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 78, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: 50 Trefusis Road Flushing Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5UB
Description: Construction of boathouse building to store boats with annexe accommodation for holiday use above (amendment to approval no. PA16/05628)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed introduction  of residential accommodation on the foreshore will harm the natural,  distinctive and sensitive qualities  of the surrounding area, including the Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty and Special Area for Conservation.  The application  is, therefore, contrary  to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Little Trerank, The Lodge Access Road To Little Trerank Roche PL26 8EU
Description: Retention and completion of dwelling with amended height/siting
RefusalReasons: 1The proposed dwelling,  be reason of its siting, massing  and height,  is prominent  in the landscape to the detriment  of the distinctive natural beauty of the surrounding countryside.  The application is, therefore,  contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan; Polices A1, G1 and H2  of the Roche Parish Neighbourhood Plan and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The proposed dwelling,  be reason of its siting, massing  and height,  has harmful overbearing impacts to the occupiers of the dwelling  to the nearby north-west, named 'The Cottage'.  The  application is, therefore,  contrary to policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan

Address: Brenton House Land West Of Green Lane Farm Coombe St Austell Cornwall PL26 7LP
Description: Permission in principle for proposed single two-storey eco residential building with a separate single-storey double garage.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would represent housing in the countryside which would not relate well to an existing settlement,  would not be conisdered as previoulsy developed land, would be in an unsustainable location  and would  harm the character of the open countryside. The proposal would not represent infill or rounding off, does not fall within the special circumstances listed  within  policy  7, and would increase building  density which would  be out of character  with the surrounding area and divorced from services and facilities.  The proposal  therefore would be contrary  to policies 3, 7, 9 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan.

Address: Land North East Of The Lamb And Flag Canonstown Cornwall TR27 6LU
Description: Construction of Five Open Market Dwellings & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the loss of a community facility for which there is no clearly substantiated  evidence that there is no longer a need.  The proposal is therefore  contrary to Policies ED 8 and HT 2 of the St Erth Neighbourhood Plan, policy  5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 83 and 92 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The site is within a Designated  Rural Area where, under both national  guidance and policy 8 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030,  the threshold for the provision of affordable  housing is 5 dwellings.  Taking the entire  developable area of the planning unit, within  the applicant's ownership, the development conflicts with policy 8 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 as no affordable  housing provision  is proposed.  The development  would therefore not meet the local housing needs of the local community and would therefore not be a sustainable form of development.  The proposal  also conflicts with policy HI 1 of the St Erth Neighbourhood  Plan March 2018 and paragraphs 62 and 63 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Lidl Foodstore Priory Road Bodmin Cornwall PL31 2AA
Description: Advertisement consent for 1no. free-standing non- illuminated billboard.
RefusalReasons: The proposed advertisement, by reason of its position, size and prominence, would  have a harmful impact on the visual amenity of the area, including  the setting of the immediately adjacent  Conservation  Area and nearby Listed  Buildings.  The proposal is, therefore,  contrary  to Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127 and 132 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land To The South Of 13 Joan Moffat Close Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4FG
Description: Outline application for the construction of 4 affordable dwellings (2 x 2-bed and 2x 1bed) with all matters reserved except access and layout
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is contrary  to the housing policies set out in the Liskeard Neighbourhood Development Plan and Cornwall Local Plan and would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  development  in this location and the constrained means of vehicular access to serve the development, the proposal is not sustainable nor secures  a satisfactory quality of development. As such this proposal is contrary  to policies  NP1 and H1 of the Liskeard  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 and Policy  3 subsection  1, policy 7, policy  12 subsection  1 and policy 23 subsections  1 and 2 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted  November  2016 and paragraphs 8, 124, 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Lamb & Flag Inn A30 Between Whitecross And The Lamb And Flag Canonstown TR27 6LU
Description: Conversion of Existing Former Public House to Form 5 Apartments
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the loss of a community facility for which there is no clearly substantiated  evidence that there is no longer a need.  The proposal is therefore  contrary to Policies ED 8 and HT 2 of the St Erth Neighbourhood Plan, policy  5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 83 and 92 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.   2 The site is within a Designated  Rural Area where, under both national  guidance and policy 8 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030,  the threshold for the provision of affordable  housing is 5 dwellings.  Taking the entire  developable area of the planning unit, within  the applicant's ownership, the development conflicts with policy 8 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 as no affordable  housing provision  is proposed.  The development  would therefore not meet the local housing needs of the local community and would therefore not be a sustainable form of development.  The proposal  also conflicts with policy HI 1 of the St Erth Neighbourhood  Plan March 2018 and paragraphs 62 and 63 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Land NE Of Fir Tree Cottage Wheal Rose Scorrier Cornwall
Description: Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved: One residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The access proposed  by this application is constrained by the lack of width to allow two cars to pass along Green  Lane and poor visibility to the right for drivers exiting Green  Lane onto the adjoining road. In the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise, safe and suitable access  to the development for all people is therefore not provided  and the application is contrary  to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.REASON: In the interests  of highway safety  in accordance with Policy 27 of the adopted Local Plan

Address: Land Off Tregenna Lane Camborne Cornwall TR14 7QU
Description: Reserved matters application to construct 94 residential dwellings, including affordable homes, open space and associated infrastructure following the outline approval PA15/01794
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed surface  water drainage system  using a mix of pumping off site and infiltration is considered to be unsustainable. It would therefore be contrary  to policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030  and advice  in paragraph 165 of the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Land West Of Trevoole Farm Botetoe Hill Trevoole Cornwall TR14 0RN
Description: Change of use of land to a 2 no. pitch Traveller pitch site including 2 no. mobile homes, 2 no. dayrooms, 2 no. touring caravans, 1 no. septic tank, hardstanding, and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development located  within an area of open countryside  will result in a sporadic  and unwarranted  form of development  that would have a detrimental visual impact upon the character and appearance of the countryside and its intrinsic character where the unsustainable  and inaccessible  location away from any defined settlement and community  and infrastructure facilities would result in a poor form of development that would  also be likely to perpetuate  social exclusion experienced  by Gypsies and Travellers  contrary to Policies 1, 2, 7, 11, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030,  Policy HT4 of the Crowan Parish Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2018-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127,  of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and advice contained within  Planning Policy for Traveller Sites notably paragraph 25 of Policy H and guidance within  Planning Practice Guidance  in particular the content at sections titled 'Design' and 'Natural Environment.

Address: Land South West Of Southwinds Redmoor Road Callington Cornwall PL17 8EJ
Description: Outline application for up to 10 dwellings with all matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 It is considered that the adjacent  Redmoor mineral resource  and infrastructure would be subject to unacceptable  restrictive  detrimental effects and that future occupants of the dwellings of the proposed  development would suffer unacceptable adverse environmental impacts (vibration, noise,  odour, particulates) as a result of adjacent  mineral  operations. As such the proposal  fails to accord with Policy  MS1 of the Cornwall  Minerals Safeguarding Development Plan Document  (2018), Policies  13, 16 and 18 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2016) and paragraphs 205 and 206 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019. 2 It has not been demonstrated that the site is suitable for the proposed development taking account of any risks arising from mining-associated land instability and that future residents would be protected  from such risks.  As such the proposal fails to accord with Policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraphs 178 and 179 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 No suitable  Section 106 legal agreement has been secured  to ensure that the proposed development  would make adequate provision  to mitigate its impact on community infrastructure and services, in particular  with regards to affordable housing, education and ecology.  As such the proposal fails to accord with Policies 9, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.

Address: Treravel Farm St Ervan Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 7RS
Description: Replacement of a large forage store building with single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The development  if approved  would comprise a new dwelling  in the countryside for which none of the special circumstances as contained in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan would be met. It would  therefore  fail to meet the principles  of sustainability embodied  in Policies 1, 2, 7, 21 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 that together provide  an overarching  approach to the sustainable delivery of growth and location of development  and the guidance contained in the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 with particular regard to paragraph 79.

Address: St Merryn Park St Merryn Holiday Village St Merryn Padstow PL28 8QA
Description: Retention of Multi-Use Games Area
RefusalReasons: 1 The retention of the Multi Use Games Area (MUGA)  if approved would cause on-going harm to the residential amenities of the neighbours at Foxglove Crescent in particular the closest neighbour at number 106 Foxglove Crescent in terms  of noise and disturbance that has to date been found to be at unacceptable  levels  and for which, due to the proximity  there are no suitable mitigation measures that can be employed to make this impact  acceptable. The harm is therefore overriding and unacceptable  and would be contrary to policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and the guidance in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 with particular regard  to paragraph  180 (a).

Address: Land At South Crofty Dudnance Lane Pool Cornwall
Description: Application for outline planning permission for up to 99 residential dwellings with all matters reserved (except access) and full planning permission for an internal residential access road.
RefusalReasons: 1 It has not been clearly demonstrated  that South Crofty Mine would be able to comply with the conditions  of its mineral permissions attached  to decision  notices  PA06/01298, PA10/04564  and PA10/05145, especially  in terms of noise limits, without restricting its operating capacity.  Whilst  additional  noise assessments  have been provided, these do not adequately  address the potential impact on the proposed development  from the extant mineral permissions  and the data supplied does not address the noise arising  from within the mineral planning permission from sources  such as New Cook's  Kitchen Shaft or the associated  winder house equipment.  Therefore the mineral resource  and infrastructure will be subject to unacceptable detrimental effects and the proposed development would suffer unacceptable  adverse impacts as a result of the mining operations. The proposal would therefore be contrary to policy  MS1 of the Cornwall  Council  Minerals Safeguarding  Development Plan Document,  December 2018.

Address: Land To The North Of Roseworthy Hill Camborne Cornwall TR14 0TR
Description: Proposed mixed use development comprising three A1 retail (food and non-food) units and petrol filling station (including A1/A3 uses); associated parking, access and landscaping arrangements
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, in this out of town centre location,  would have a significant  adverse impact on the vitality and viability  of Camborne Town Centre.  The applicants have failed  to provide sufficient information  in order to allow a full assessment of the net level of job creation.   The proposal wold be contrary to policy 4 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 85, 86, 89 and 90 of National Planning  Policy Framework 2019. 2 The construction of a mixed use development on this site would  clearly introduce an undesirable and sporadic  extension of the built form into the adjoining countryside which would lead to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance  of the natural environment.  The proposal  would  there therefore be contrary to policies  1,2,3,7,9 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 provides that, for the main towns  in Cornwall, retail development will be managed through  the Site Allocation Development  Plan Document in order to ensure that growth is genuinely plan-led.  The application site is not an allocated  site within the council's Site Allocations  Development Plan Document and the scale of the proposed development  is so substantial  that it is considered that the granting of permission would prejudice the planning process by determining decisions about  the scale and location of new development in and around  Camborne.  Planning applications must be determined in accordance  with the development plan unless material considerations  indicate  otherwise.  In this case by reason  of its location,  the proposal would be contrary  to the Council's Site Allocations Development Plan Document,  further to the requirements for delivering sustainable development that reflects  the vision  and aspirations of local communities through Local Plans set out in Paragraph 154 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.  The proposed development  is therefore  contrary to Policies 1, 2, 2a and 3 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and guidance  contained  within paragraphs 2, 11, 16 and 17 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the long standing fundamental of the UK planning system namely utilising a plan led approach  to development.

Address: Land East Of Salon Vanilla Greenwith Road Perranwell Station Cornwall TR3 7LT
Description: Outline consent for the construction of one two bed and one three bed affordable dwellings with all matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 In order  to provide a safe vehicular access into the site, the proposal  would result in the loss of a significant length of roadside hedging  which visually contributes to the rural local character and appearance of this approach into Perranwell Station village, contrary  to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal extends development beyond  the built form of the settlement into open countryside and cannot be regarded  as 'infill' or 'rounding  off' residential  development and does not fall within the definition of previously developed  land as set out within Policy  3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030. Whilst acknowledging  the proposal has been submitted  as a rural exception  site, in the absence of a mechanism  to secure the long-term  provision of affordable  housing the proposal  is considered to be contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 2, 2a, 3, 7, 9 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and guidance contained  within paragraphs 8 and 62 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj War Memorial New Road Cawsand Torpoint Cornwall PL10 1PD
Description: Construction of dwelling, access to highway and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would erode the visible green open space between the walls of the Scheduled  Monument Cawsand Fort above and the roofscape of the village below, diminishing  the drama  of the battery's  historic setting and harming the exceptionally appropriate and prominent  setting of the village's Grade II Listed  First World War Memorial and the relationship of both of these heritage assets with Listed Buildings in Garrett Street  below. It would thus have a significant  detrimental impact on the setting of valuable heritage assets in the vicinity and consequently would fail to preserve or enhance  the appearance and character of the Kingsand/Cawsand Conservation  Area and the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty within which the Conservation Area lies. As such, the proposed development  does not accord with the provisions,  aims and intentions of Policies 1, 3, 12, 23 and 24, of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030, Objectives and Policies 5, 6 and 7 of The Rame Peninsula Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030, the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019, with particular reference to paragraphs 7, 8, 170, 172, 184, 189, 192, 193, and 194, and Policies  CC1, CC13, NH7 and KH11.05 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land North Of Sea Winds Ramoth Way Perranporth Cornwall
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for a residential development of up to three dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is more than 0.1ha  and the application is not accompanied  by an appropriate ecological  assessment  and therefore  the potential impact  on protected species and the wider  impacts  upon the Cornwall Wildlife Site and Penhale Dunes SAC cannot be reasonably assessed.  The development is therefore conisdered to be contrary  to the aims and intentions of policy  23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Old Mine Lane St Anns Chapel Cornwall
Description: Outline application, with some matters reserved, for construction of 21 dwellings to include a minimum 50% and maximum 100% affordable housing including 2 Lifetime Homes units, depending on viability to be determined at reserved matters stage. Formation of new access road and footpaths, public open space and play area and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is located wholly within the World  Heritage  Site boundary,  and would  directly impact upon the outstanding universal  value (OUV)  through  harm caused to specific OUV attributes; namely  change to the extent  and form of the village of St Anns Chapel, and views  from,  and of, Hingston Down Consols Mine.  World  Heritage Sites are considered  to be heritage assets  of the highest  significance  and great  weight is given to the asset's  conservation irrespective of the level of harm.   It  is not considered that the harm identified  can be mitigated nor is it outweighed by the public benefits of the proposal.  It is considered that the development will not, by reason of its location,  maintain the character  and distinctiveness of the World Heritage Site landscape contrary to Part 16 of the NPPF 2019 , Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 adopted 2016 and Policy  C7 of the World Heritage Site Management  Plan 2013-2018. 2 A Section  106 legal agreement  has not been entered  into to secure the necessary affordable housing, public  open space and Special Area of Conservation contributions. The proposal  would thereby be contrary to Policies 3, 9, 13, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 (adopted 2016) and the advice within the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Boscundle Manor Boscundle St Austell Cornwall PL25 3RL
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for the erection of a 4 bedroom dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed siting of a new dwelling in this location  is considered to be harmful by virtue of the loss of trees and green  space and the creation of a new access in the historic stone wall boundary wall, which are features which contribute positively to the setting of the listed building. The presence of a new dwelling in this location would erode the setting and undermine the primacy  of the grade II listed Boscundle Manor.  The proposal would therefore  fail to at least preserve  the setting of this listed building. Furthermore, the harm caused  to the setting  of the listed building  would not be outweighed by the public benefits of the proposal. The proposal is therefore  considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of S66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings  and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 127, 184, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North West Of Chy An Delek St Ruan Ruan Minor Helston Cornwall TR12 7JS
Description: Construction of single storey dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposal is located outside of any defined settlement, such that it is located  within the open countryside where new residential units are only permitted  in special circumstances; the proposed  development  does not represent rounding  off in accordance  with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030 such that it is considered that the proposal does not comply with any of the special circumstances of policy 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030 and would harm the rural character of the area which is within an Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty; due to the proposed residential use and associated domestic paraphernalia and is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Haven View 2 Higher Port View Saltash Cornwall PL12 4BU
Description: Reduce Crown by 3-4 metres and a 20% thin throughout tree to Sycamore Tree - T4 - subject to a Tree Preservation Order.
RefusalReasons: The tree covered  by the Tree Preservation Order and the subject of this application makes a valuable contribution to the amenity of the local landscape.   The reasons given for seeking to undertake heavy  pruning to this tree do not comprise clear and convincing evidence  necessary to justify the magnitude of works as proposed.   The proposed works would therefore degrade this amenity contribution contrary to Policies 1, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Gaia Farm Edgcumbe Penryn Cornwall TR10 9EJ
Description: Prior notification for the erection of a general purpose agricultural building to replace temporary structures.
RefusalReasons: With a proposed footprint  of 30m by 10m, and a ground to ridge height of 5.5m, the size of the building  is considered excessively large in this location.  Given  the large scale of the proposed agricultural building  together  with its siting which is in an elevated position within  the landscape, the development proposal  would dominate its setting and fail to conserve  the strong and distinctive characteristics  of this rural landscape. The proposed building  due to its siting, scale and external  appearance would have a harmful impact on the landscape and is therefore  considered to be in conflict with policies  1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Tregartha Flushing Cove Gillan Manaccan TR12 6HQ
Description: Coppice 2 Sycamores
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposal to coppice two Sycamore trees is not justified on arboricultural  grounds as there are no safety reasons, significant arboricultural defects or disorders present  within  the trees. Many other adjacent trees are approaching the end of their safe, useful expected life spans giving more weight  to the retention of these two trees. The proposed works would have an impact on the local landscape setting with the loss of the branches and foliage  of most of the two Sycamore trees causing significant  detrimental impact  upon the amenity of the local landscape.

Address: Rosudgeon Villa A394 Between Helston Road And Carters Downs Rosudgeon TR20 9QE
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed development of a two storey rear extension and replacement of dwelling roof covering
RefusalReasons: The proposed rear extension to the dwelling and roof alterations would fail to comply within permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A.2 (a) and (c), Class A.3 (b) (i), Class B.1 (f), Class B.2 (c) and Class C.2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). This is because the site is situated in a World Heritage Site. The proposed roof lights to be installed in the side elevations are not shown as obscure glazed. In addition, it is not possible to ascertain if the roof lights to be installed in the side elevation of the original roof are 1.7 metres above floor level. As such planning permission is required.

Address: Land South West Of Kenningstock Cottage Advent Camelford Cornwall PL32 9QP
Description: Conversion of outbuilding to dwelling house, together with erection of an extension and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its open countryside location beyond  any settlement represents an unsustainable location, the appearance and scale of the existing building provides very limited  visual merit and is not considered to be appropriate to retain and the conversion  would not lead to an enhancement  to the site or the immediate setting, therefore the proposal would not accord  with the special circumstances for housing in the countryside.  The proposal would erode the natural landscape character of the wider AGLV. The proposal therefore represents  an undesirable form of residential development in the countryside which would not contribute to the achievement of sustainable development and in the absence of any other material considerations  which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 2 (1.d),  3, 7 (3), 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030.

Address: 4 Raven Close St Anns Chapel Gunnislake Cornwall PL18 9FQ
Description: Works to tree covered by a Tree Preservation Order, namely reduce height and spread of Sycamore tree (T1) as shown in accompanying photograph.
RefusalReasons: The tree covered  by the Tree Preservation Order and the subject of this application makes a valuable contribution to the amenity of the local landscape.  The tree in question  is part of an historic hedgerow and was intentionally retained as part of the landscape  scheme for the surrounding  development.  Its visual amenity and contribution  to the local landscape have been recognised as worthy of protection by the Local Planning Authority.  It would not therefore  be appropriate to permit tree works  that would degrade this amenity  contribution,  and which furthermore  are not justified, nor in accordance  with British  Standards and industry best practice.

Address: 8 And 9 Jubilee Place Camborne Cornwall TR14 8DE
Description: Removal of Section 106 Agreement in respect of decision PA02/00922/F dated 31.10.05 for the erection of two dwellings
RefusalReasons: The local planning authority is satisfied  that the Planning Obligation will continue  to serve a useful planning  purpose because it ensures that the affordability  of the properties remain where there is a current need for such accommodation. The Planning Obligation therefore accords with Government guidance set out in Paragraph 56 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Planning  Practice Guidance.

Address: 6 Pendarves Road Falmouth TR11 2TW
Description: Proposed garage and associated site works
RefusalReasons: The proposed garage, by reason of its scale and mass, in combination with its siting, will be a dominant structure and will over-develop the lower part of the site, resulting in an incongruous feature in the streetscene and failing to reflect local distinctiveness, contrary to Policy 12 (2) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030,  emerging policies DG2 and DG4 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2019 to 2030 (Submission  Version 2019),  and paragraphs 124,127, and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trebean Fore Street Madron TR20 8SH
Description: Construction of garage, store and studio as re-submission of PA19/07377.
RefusalReasons: In extending the footprint of the garage/store so as to be in close proximity to the terrace and in significantly increasing the eaves height,  ridge height, and massing of the building, the proposed development would appear as overly-domineering, out of character and harmful in the context of the adjacent historic terrace, and would  fail to preserve the character  and appearance  of the Conservation AreaThe proposed  works would  materially  reduce the existing visual quality and character  of the setting  of the historic terrace and streetscape, and would  be harmful  to the character and appearance of the Conservation  Area. The works are considered to raise design concerns that cause harm and that are not balanced  by other factors acting  in the public interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore  contrary  to Policy  12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and Policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 4.9, 7.3, 7.4, 7.7 and 7.10 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 124, 127-128,  130, 184, 185, 189, 190, 192, 193 and 196-197  of the National Planning Policy Framework.  The proposed development does not accord  with the local planning  authority's statutory duty under section  72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would  not preserve or enhance the character and appearance  of the Conservation Area.

Address: 28 Chycoose Parc Point Devoran Truro Cornwall TR3 6NT
Description: Proposal to crown raise oak
RefusalReasons: The proposed works are not in line with industry best practice and the current  British Standard 3998. The works  would result in a negative impact on the physiological and structural  condition of the tree as well the ongoing contribution to amenity  and the local landscape  character and therefore  the proposed works are refused.

Address: Land Adjacent To Lavender Cottage Bray Shop Cornwall PL17 8PZ
Description: Change of use of land to residential garden
RefusalReasons: The proposed change of use and visible domestication of the site land would extend the settlement's existing  developed envelope further  into the open countryside  to the detriment of the appearance  and character of the rural landscape to which  the land currently contributes,  and could give rise to pressure for further development of the site which would not be justified. As such, the proposal fails to accord with the provisions,  aims and intentions of Policies 23, 22, 1, 2, 3 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and National  Planning Policy Framework 2019, with particular reference to paragraphs 7, 8, 170, 175 and 117.

Address: Land At Menerdue Farm Carnmenellis Cornwall
Description: Prior notification for details of proposed agricultural building
RefusalReasons: The application  form and supporting information indicate that the building would  be used in part as a lambing  shed. The proposal  would thereby be used for the accommodation of livestock and be within 400m of a protected  building. As such the proposal would not constitute  agricultural permitted development  as it will fail to accord with Criterion (i), Class A, Part 6, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country  Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended). The application  is therefore refused.

Address: Seworgan Farmhouse Seworgan Constantine TR11 5QN
Description: Extension of a farmhouse with an improved entrance elevation; a two story side extension to the west and a garage at the rear, north of the house with variation of condition 2 of decision PA18/08268 dated 05/11/2018
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed amendments to the approved development, by reason  of the addition of timber cladding and changes to window design,  would  fail to respect the character of the dwellinghouse and would be incongruous features that would harm the character and appearance of the surrounding area due to the prominent location of the dwelling. Therefore, the proposal is contrary  to Policies  1, 2 and 12 of The Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 124, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 2.9 and 7.8 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013.

Address: Pencoose 11 Wellington Plantation Penelewey Feock TR3 6QP
Description: Crown raise 2 Turkey Oaks from approx 8m to approx 15m.
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to the trees would not be in line with industry best practice and the current British  Standard.BS 3998 - Recommendations for Tree Work. The works would have a significant negative impact on the physiological and structural condition  of the trees, causing long term and lasting deterioration of tree vitality, thereby creating a lasting  negative impact to amenity and the local landscape character

Address: Roskorwell St Keverne TR12 6PR
Description: Conversion of Barn to Form Single Dwelling
RefusalReasons: The development  proposed  will significantly alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of this barn with its timber cladding and lack of fenestration that clearly relates to this rural landscape.  The building is not considered to be a suitably  constructed redundant rural building  that would  be considered appropriate to retain and its conversion to residential use would  clearly not lead to an enhancement  to the immediate setting on a site that is widely visible from the nearby  public highway.  The extensive glazing and raised balcony proposed in the conversion will fundamentally alter the perception of the building  such that it will be recognised as an incongruous residential form that will harm the strong rural characteristics  of this landscape of high scenic beauty and detract from the character and appearance of the adjoining approved development of residential barn conversions.  Given the inappropriate and unsustainable  form of new housing development in the countryside, the proposed development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty  of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty  (AONB) in this location.  As such, it conflicts with policies 2, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 79, 103, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies MD9 and SCW8.04 in the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: West Heath St Breward Bodmin PL30 4NY
Description: Outline Planning with some matters reserved for erection of a dwelling
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  outside of the established and definable limits of St Breward, and does not represent infill or rounding  off as defined by Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030. The site is considered to represent an undesirable  form of residential development in the open countryside.  By reason of the rural location of the site and its close physical relationship to the open moorland, residential development is considered to be detrimental to the landscape quality of this area that would erode  the landscape character of the wider AGLV. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context,  the proposal does not represent sustainable development  and would be contrary to policies 1, 2 (1.d), 3, 7, 12, 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Woodend And Blossoms Feock Truro Cornwall TR3 6QW
Description: Works to trees subject to a TPO to cut back branches overhanging the boundary lines.
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to the trees would not be in line with industry best practice and the current British  Standard.BS 3998 - Recommendations for Tree Work. The works would have a significant negative impact on the physiological and structural condition  of the trees, causing long term and lasting deterioration of tree vitality, thereby creating a lasting  negative impact to amenity and the local landscape character

Address: Ennestreven Farm Trannack Road Sancreed Penzance Cornwall TR20 8QW
Description: Prior Notification for an agricultural building to provide general agricultural storage
RefusalReasons: With a proposed footprint  of 30m by 18m, and a ground to ridge height of 6.7m, the size of the building  is considered excessively large in this location.  Given  the large scale of the proposed agricultural building  together  with its siting which is in an elevated position within  the landscape, the development proposal  would dominate its setting and fail to conserve  the strong and distinctive characteristics  of this sensitive and open landscape. As the area is designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value  and an Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty,  where the primary objective is to conserve and enhance the landscape, the identified harm is intensified. The proposed building due to its siting,  scale and external appearance would have a harmful impact on the landscape and is therefore considered to be in conflict with policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Villa Rosa 17 Boscawen Road Falmouth TR11 4EN
Description: Proposed extension above existing ground floor extension
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension, by reason of its 'top heavy' and dominant design, would fail to respect the host dwelling and would be an incongruous feature that would  harm the character and appearance  of this prominent location, which is adjacent to the Falmouth Conservation Area. The proposal is in conflict with Policies DG2, DG4, DG6 and DG8 of the emerging Falmouth Neighbourhood  Development Plan 2019-2030 (Submission Version July 2019), Policies 1, 2, 12, and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030, and Paragraphs 124, 127, 130 and 189-202 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Rear Of Capensis Tresevern Croft Goonlaze Stithians Truro Cornwall TR3 7AR
Description: Proposed new dwelling in rear garden
RefusalReasons: The proposal would lead to a cramped form of development that would fail to provide continuity with the existing built form. The exisiting  generous sized plots with sizeable rear gardens,  particularly  to the west, are an important part of the character of the area and create  a sense of spaciousness.  The provision of a dwelling  within  this already  smaller sized garden would result in a cramped form of development which, together  with the existing property and remaining curtilage to serve it, would result in two properties which would fail to respect or enhance the character  or appearance of the area. The proposal would appear overly intense and at odds with the immediate surroundings and would fail to promote local distinctiveness, leading  to harm to the landscape character. As the area is designated as an Area of Great Landscape  Value, where the primary  objective is to conserve and enhance the landscape,  the identified harm is intensified.  The proposal is therefore in conflict  with policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Fenwick House Dunmere Bodmin PL31 2RD
Description: Outline planning (with all matters reserved) for the construction of 2 dwellings
RefusalReasons: The application  site is clearly divorced from any settlement with poor accessibility to necessary daily services  and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle  and unsustainable traffic movements.  In  the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  residential development in this rural location,  the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2,3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 91 102, 103, 110, 127, 148 and 150 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Roscarrick Perrancoombe Perranporth Cornwall TR6 0HZ
Description: Felling of Monterey Cypress tree
RefusalReasons: The Monterey Cypress tree proposed for removal is significant  in the local landscape and provides significant public  visual amenity.  Insufficient  justification  has been given as to why alternative  engineering solutions are not viable. As such the works  are not considered acceptable and would  have an adverse impact  on public  amenity.

Address: Land NNW Of 24 Gurnick Road Faugan Road Newlyn Cornwall
Description: One pair of semi detached dwellings (no 1 and 2)
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would  if permitted result  in an unduly  cramped site, which  would not represent the character or layout of the area and would  have an adverse impact on the residential amenity of occupants of the existing and proposed dwellings in terms of overlooking.    As a consequence the development is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 12,  13 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: 14 Lower Fore Street Saltash Cornwall PL12 6JX
Description: Proposal to reduce/pollard main crown of Lucombe Oak (T1) Crown lift Yew tree (T2). Remove overhanging branches from Yew tree (T3).
RefusalReasons: The trees covered by the Tree Preservation Orders and subject  to this application form a valuable contribution to the landscape and have high amenity  value for the area. The pruning  proposed  would have a detrimental impact  to said public amenity and to the health of the trees. Insufficient justification or arboricultural evidence has been given as to why the proposed works  are necessary.  As such the application  should be refused.

Address: Koh I Noor 3 Higher Lidden Road Penzance TR18 4NZ
Description: Proposed Car Port (variation to previous design )
RefusalReasons: The proposed position of the car port towards the edge of the footway would be entirely at odds with the established pattern of development on both sides of Higher Lidden Road. The flat roofed car port would be a prominent and incongruous feature in the street scene by reason of its siting  and design and would  , if permitted, be significantly  harmful to the character and appearance of the area. The development is contrary to policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning policy  Framework  2019, and the refusal would also accord with paragraph 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 due to poor design.

Address: Barn Adj. St Aubyn Farm St Aubyn Trefula Redruth Cornwall TR16 5ER
Description: Proposed conversion and extension of existing redundant former agricultural barn to form a single dwelling unit, construction of a detached double domestic garage with garden store, installation of a packaged sewage treatment plant and formation of two new vehicle accesses
RefusalReasons: The development  proposed  would  significantly  alter the traditional  and distinctive appearance of this agricultural building which  in its present state responds positively to the rural character  and appearance of the open countryside  in this location.  The proposal, by reason of its increase  in height and overtly  domestic appearance, would  result in building with a greater visual presence  that would no longer  be read as a subservient addition to the domestic farm, instead appearing as a large and incongruous building that fails to maintain a harmonious relationship with the adjacent  Farmhouse. The provision  of the domestic curtilage and the detached garage extending out into the adjacent field would harmfully  suburbanise the strong rural characteristics  of the landscape, encroaching the built environment into the open countryside. The proposed  development fails to enhance its immediate setting  which is a prerequisite for the conversion of historical buildings within the open countryside,  as stipulated by policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030. For these reasons,  the proposal fails to preserve the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside contrary  to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of An Jue Green Farm House Trevalgan St Ives Cornwall TR26 3BJ
Description: Conversion of redundant agricultural barn to a single dwellinghouse.
RefusalReasons: By reason of the substantial building operations required to bring the existing  building into residential use, the utilitarian form and inconspicuous positioning of the building which is not considered to detract  from the character or appearance of the surrounding  agricultural landscape, and the proposed  conversion and associated works which are considered to harm and domesticate  this distinctly rural, open and windswept  landscape,  the proposed development is not considered to make  use of a suitably-constructed  building which is appropriate to retain  and would lead to an enhancement  to the immediate setting. Furthermore, the proposal is considered to fail to at least conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty within which it sits. The proposal  is therefore considered to constitute unjustified and harmful residential development in the open countryside, and to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies  GD1 and OS1 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2015 - 2030; policies  2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs  127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019; and policies MD9 and WP7.05  of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Pengwins Tresowes Ashton Helston Cornwall TR13 9SY
Description: Construction of 4 bedroom dwelling with additional garage/workshop and ground mounted solar power array
RefusalReasons: Due to the site's position in the countryside  beyond the established settlement  limits of Tresowes Green, it is not well related to its physical form and its development for housing would not constitute suitable 'infill' or 'rounding  off' of the settlement  in this location.  The development of this site with a substantial detached modern  dwelling and garage/workshop would  result  in a harmful urban intrusion  into the countryside  to the detriment of the strong rural character of the location.  The development therefore  fails to suitably  integrate  with the natural environment and will result in material  harm to the landscape setting of the small  settlement of Tresowes Green.  The proposal  is thereby contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy 1 in the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019 and paragraphs 127 and 170 in the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: OS Field 3294 Grade Road Ruan Minor Cornwall
Description: Conversion of Redundant Agricultural Barn to Form Single Dwelling
RefusalReasons: The development  proposed  will alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of this isolated agricultural building which is not considered to be a suitably  constructed redundant rural building that would be appropriate  to retain for conversion  to residential  use.  The development set out would clearly not lead to an enhancement  to the immediate setting and such domestification  of the building and its curtilage will cumulatively alter and harmfully urbanise  the strong rural characteristics of this landscape of high scenic beauty and recreational value.   Given  the inappropriate and unsustainable form of new housing development in the countryside, the proposed development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape  character  and natural beauty  of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) in this location.   As such, it conflicts with policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs  8, 79, 103, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy  MD9 in the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management  Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Trevean Farm Rosudgeon Cornwall
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use: Confirmation of domestic curtilage
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to discharge the Applicants' onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land outlined in red on submitted Plan 1 has all been used for domestic purposes in connection with the residential occupation of Trevean Farmhouse for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such, the application for a Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use or Development is refused.

Address: 12 Boswedden Terrace Road Between Cape Cornwall Street And Upper Praze St Just TR19 7NF
Description: Proposed replacement porch to front elevation.
RefusalReasons: By substantially  increasing the depth  and the width of the porch, and by including a high proportion of glazing  to the principal elevation and roof, the proposed extension will appear overly-domineering  and inappropriate in the context of the host cottage, and would materially reduce the visual quality/character of the historic terrace  and the streetscape, and would  be harmful to the Outstanding Universal Value of the World Heritage Site. The proposed works raise concerns  in relation to design and the historic environment that cause harm,  and that are not balanced by other factors acting  in the public  interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore  contrary  to Policy  12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and Policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 4.9, 7.3, and 7.6 - 7.9 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 124, 127-128,  130, 184, 185, 189, 190, 192, 193 and 196-197  of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 1 Wellington Place Penzance TR18 4SR
Description: Installation of a detached timber garden room
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would  introduce a garden room within  the front garden of no. 1 Wellington Place, forward of its principal elevation. Wellington Place is a traditional terrace with distinctively  narrow front gardens and the appearance of the terrace  coupled with the historic layout makes a positive contribution to the significance  of Penzance Conservation Area and the setting of the Grade  II Listed Building.  The provision of an outbuilding in the proposed  location would  obstruct views of the principal elevation of the traditional terrace, appearing as a prominent  and discordant feature within the historic setting. For these reasons, the proposed development would not preserve or enhance  the setting of the neighbouring Grade II Listed  Building and Penzance Conservation Area, and no public  benefit has been identified  as to balance  the identified harm to the significance of these heritage assets. The proposal  therefore  fails to comply  with Sections 66 and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990, policies  2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 184, 190, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 7 Tara Vale Crantock Newquay Cornwall TR8 5SR
Description: Replacement of existing stone wall with a slatted fence.
RefusalReasons: The fence, due to its location,  would appear  as a harsh, solid structure  which is intrusive in the streetscene and does not respect the character  and appearance  of the immediate  surroundings.  The proposal is therefore  not in accordance  with the aims and intentions of Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019 and Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030.

Address: Merry Meadows Farm Bowling Green Bugle St Austell Cornwall PL26 8RN
Description: Retention of a hardstanding area and sheds for agricultural purposes; use of a mobile shepherd's hut as a temporary agricultural worker's dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The application  site sits outside of the defined settlement  boundary for Bowling  Green and would  not represent  infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 to 2030.  The proposal would physically extend the built envelope  of the nearby settlement into the adjoining  countryside to the detriment of the landscape character, where the development would  reduce the relatively green  gap between the village and the nearby  town of Bugle, harming the landscape setting of these settlements, representing an intrusion into the undeveloped countryside.  In the absence of a functional need and necessary  evidence being  provided that the buildings and shepherds hut is justified to be on this land, or any other special circumstances to justify the development as a whole  in this context,  the application is not considered to represent sustainable development and would be contrary to the guidance contained in Paragraphs 8, 11, 78 and 79 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019 and Policies 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land To The West Of New Road St Hilary Penzance TR20 9EA
Description: Change of use of land to 1 no. Traveller site including 1 no. mobile home, 1 no. touring caravan, 1 no. polytunnel, and 1 no. shed
RefusalReasons: The proposed development located within an area of open countryside will result  in a sporadic and unwarranted form of development  that would  have a detrimental  visual impact upon the character and appearance of the countryside  which is designated  as a World Heritage  Site and was once part of a mineworkers small holding, a key attribute, and the unsustainable  and inaccessible  location away from any defined settlement and community and infrastructure facilities. The development is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 7, 11, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019 and advice contained within Planning Policy for Traveller Sites notably paragraph 25 of Policy H and guidance within  Planning Practice Guidance in particular  the content at sections titled 'Design'  and 'Natural Environment.

Address: Land West Of Kenley Vale Higher Condurrow Condurrow Camborne Cornwall TR14 9AL
Description: To build 3 bungalows as detailed
RefusalReasons: Due to the site's position in the countryside  beyond the established settlement  limits of Higher Condurrow, it is not well related  to its physical form and its development for housing would not constitute suitable 'infill' or 'rounding  off' of the settlement  in this location.  The development of this prominent  and large gap for three dwellings, which provides an important landscape setting to the hamlet, would domesticate the existing largely rural character on the south side of the highway and result in significant  built form and harmful  urban encroachment where there presently is none.  It is contended  this would  be harmful to the semi-rural character and appearance of the locality and the development therefore fails to suitably  integrate with the natural environment and will result in material  harm to the undesignated landscape setting of the small  settlement  of Higher Condurrow.  The development is thereby contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy 1 in the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019 and paragraphs 127 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 3 St Clements Terrace Mousehole Cornwall TR19 6SJ
Description: Retention of railings (in lieu of block wall)
RefusalReasons: In proposing  railings and a gate of an overtly modern design,  material  and finish  that are inappropriate in the setting, the proposed works  materially  reduce the visual quality of the streetscape and fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Conservation AreaThe uncharacteristic  smooth, wiry and insubstantial appearance of the railings are at odds with the setting,  which  together with their failure to be set in the original granite plinth raises  design concerns that cause harm to the setting and that are not balanced  by other  factors acting  in the public  interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10, 4.3, 4.8, 4.9 and 8.6 of the Cornwall  Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 124, 126-128, 130, 184, 185, 189, 190, 192, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework. The proposed development does not accord with the local planning  authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed  Buildings  and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990 because  it would not preserve or enhance  the character  and appearance  of the Conservation Area.

Address: Pennti Ros Lower Trefreock Port Isaac Cornwall PL29 3SR
Description: Sustainable live to work extension to a garden room
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  within the countryside, clearly  divorced from any settlement.  The home proposed by this application would  result in harm to the intrinsic character and beauty of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and with residential accommodation with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements.  In  the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential  development in this rural location,  the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies  1, 2,3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 91 102, 103, 110, 127, 148, 150, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: The Stables Roundhayes Farm Crackington Haven Bude Cornwall EX23 0LF
Description: Replacement windows and erection of conservatory over existing decked area
RefusalReasons: The extension of the dwelling and alteration  to the window frames, by virtue of their siting, design, materials and colour are considered to have a harmful impact on the cohesive character  and appearance of the host dwelling,  surrounding  development and wider context.   As such the proposals  are contrary to policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030; ENV01 of the North Cornwall  Local Plan Part 1 and Part 2 (adopted 1999) saved policy and paras 124, 127, 128, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Sse Of Heather Brea Road From Trye Valley To Entrance To Mill Downs Newmill TR20 8UY
Description: Conversion of Barn to Form Dwelling and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The development  proposed  would  significantly  alter the appearance of the site which at present does not detract from this rural landscape. The domestification  of the building through the proposed residential use and the provision of a domestic curtilage and the associated domestic paraphernalia  that would result around the building, will alter and harmfully urbanise  the strong rural characteristics of this isolated  and open landscape of high scenic  beauty.  Given the inappropriate and unsustainable form of new housing  development in this prominent countryside  location, the proposed development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty  of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and the distintive  qualities of the Heritage Coast  in this location.  As  such, it conflicts with policies  1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management  Plan 2016-2021  and paragraphs  8, 79, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: 50 Polvillion Road Fowey Cornwall PL23 1HG
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling and construction of three dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by reason of its design and siting would represent inappropriate development which lacks legibility and does not reflect the local vernacular. The siting of plot 3 would  be out of character  with the prevailing pattern of development and would  represent cramped development which would  not suitably protect private amenity for future occupiers due to inadequate  separation distance. The proposed development  therefore fails to achieve a high quality sustainable design which maintains the character of the area and is therefore  contrary to policy 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Section 12 of the NPPF 2019.

Address: Land Adjacent To Little Norton Stoke Climsland Callington Cornwall PL17 8QF
Description: Stationing of 2 shepherd's huts for holiday accommodation.
RefusalReasons: The proposed change of use of the land and development introducing two Shepherds  huts to be used as holiday  accommodation  does not comprise sustainable development by reason of its rural location in the open countryside, divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities and thereby  promoting a reliance  on private transport for journeys to tourist venues and for everyday essential  services.  The shepherd huts and associated paraphernalia  would  not be appropriately located and would  not provide a balanced mix of economic, social  and environmental benefit  and therefore the proposal  represents an unsustainable,  undesirable and sporadic form of development that would be harmful to the intrinsic character  and beauty of the countryside and Area of Great Landscape Value  in conflict with the aims of Policies 2(1),12  and 23 (1)(2)  (2b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030.  The minor economic and social benefits of the proposal would not outweigh  the harm to the rural environment. The proposal is contrary to policies 1, 3, 5, 7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 83, 110, 127 and 170  of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 16 Kenstella Road Newlyn TR18 5AY
Description: Conversion of existing ground floor building, Erection of single storey extension and juliette balcony
RefusalReasons: The proposals by reason of design, height and close proximity  in relation to the attached  neighbouring property (no 17) would have an unacceptable impact  upon the residential amenities of the occupiers/future  occupiers of this property through an overbearing relationship and sense of enclosure. As such it would be contrary  to Policy  12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), Section 2.6 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall  Design  Guide 2013, the advice of the Cornwall Council Domestic Alterations  and Extensions Guide 2017 (pg 6) and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: 1 Sparnon Gate Old Portreath Road Bridge Redruth Cornwall TR16 4JB
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for use as garage and 1 bedroom living accommodation
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to discharge the Applicants' onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the Garage 1 SParnon Gate Old Portreath Road, Bridge, Redruth, TR16 4JB has been used as a separate residential dwelling for a period in excess of 4 years prior to the date of this application. As such, the application for a Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use or Development is refused.

Address: Land North Of Wheal Friendly Wheal Friendly Lane St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0SR
Description: Construction of a boardwalk to protect historic mine structures from footfall
RefusalReasons: The proposed boardwalk is within the Cornwall and West Devon  Mining  Landscape World Heritage Site and within the setting of a Grade II Listed Building  which is of high significance to the Outstanding Universal  Value of the World Heritage Site, thus great weight is given  to the conservation of these  heritage assets in accordance with Section 16(2) of the Planning (Listed  Buildings and Conservation Areas Act 1990). The proposed boardwalk would  formalise a walked route  over curtilage listed mine structures where it would not have been possible to walk when the structures were intact. The boardwalk would therefore be an inauthentic addition  to the location and detracts  from the ability to understand the former building layout and thus detracts from the contribution the ancillary mine structures make to the significance of Wheal  Friendly mine and thus detracts from the Outstanding  Universal Value of the Cornwall  and West Devon Mining Landscape World  Heritage Site. The proposed boardwalk  would for the above reasons also detract from the setting of Wheal Friendly Mine which is a Grade  II Listed Building. The proposed benefits  of the scheme to not outweigh the less than substantial harm identified thus the proposal is contrary  to the requirements for heritage conservation set out at Section 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework; the proposal also conflicts with Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and Policy 11 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development  Plan

Address: Lower Mushroom Farm Tresavean Lanner Cornwall TR16 6AL
Description: Demolition of redundant building and construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: The application  is submitted on the basis that the application building could be changed  to residential use under Class Q of Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country  Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), and that the proposed replacement of this 'fallback'  scheme would  result in a clear visual enhancement to the character and appearance of the area. Notwithstanding that a formal submission under this legislation has not been submitted and determined, it is considered that the submission has not clearly demonstrated, on the balance  of probability, that had the prior notification process  been followed  first, an approval under this legislation would likely have been issued. The proposal is not considered to comply with any of the exceptions for new residential development in the countryside, set out in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, and therefore  it is considered to represent unjustified residential development in the countryside, in conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs  8, 11 and 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Wheal Friendly Wheal Friendly Lane St Agnes Cornwall
Description: Listed building consent for the construction of a boardwalk to protect historic mine structures from footfall
RefusalReasons: The proposed boardwalk is within the Cornwall and West Devon  Mining  Landscape World Heritage Site and within the setting of a Grade II Listed Building  which is of high significance to the Outstanding Universal  Value of the World Heritage Site, thus great weight is given  to the conservation of these  heritage assets in accordance with Section 16(2) of the Planning (Listed  Buildings and Conservation Areas Act 1990). The proposed boardwalk would  formalise a walked route  over curtilage listed mine structures where it would not have been possible to walk when the structures were intact. The boardwalk would therefore be an inauthentic addition  to the location and detracts  from the ability to understand the former building layout and thus detracts from the contribution the ancillary mine structures make to the significance of Wheal  Friendly mine and thus detracts from the Outstanding  Universal Value of the Cornwall  and West Devon Mining Landscape World  Heritage Site. The proposed boardwalk  would for the above reasons also detract from the setting of Wheal Friendly Mine which is a Grade  II Listed Building. The proposed benefits  of the scheme to not outweigh the less than substantial harm identified thus the proposal is contrary  to the requirements for heritage conservation set out at Section 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework; the proposal also conflicts with Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and Policy 11 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development  Plan

Address: The Cabin Bar View 6 Treeve Lane Connor Downs Hayle Cornwall TR27 5BN
Description: Replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: The site of the proposed replacement dwelling is considered to form a relatively large gap in-between  a sporadic collection of dwellings/buildings in the countryside, which  contributes positively  to the rural character  of the area. To develop the site as proposed is considered to result in the consolidation of the sporadic built form, to the detriment of the landscape character of this attractive, if undesignated landscape. The proposal is therefore considered to fail to recognise and respect the landscape character of the local landscape, and to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies  2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Old Mine Lane St Anns Chapel PL18 9TF
Description: Formation of swale in conjunction with application reference PA17/02859 (outline application for up to 21 dwellings)
RefusalReasons: The site is located  wholly within the World  Heritage Site boundary, and would  directly impact upon the outstanding universal  value (OUV) through harm caused  to specific OUV attributes; namely ground works without justification  that would cause disturbance to buried archaeological features and would erode the rural landscape character  of the area. World Heritage  Sites are considered to be heritage assets of the highest  significance and great weight is given to the asset's conservation irrespective of the level of harm.   It is not considered that the harm identified can be mitigated  nor is it outweighed by the public benefits of the proposal.  It is thereby considered that the proposals would be contrary to Part 16 of the NPPF 2019,  Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 adopted  2016, and Policy C7 of the World Heritage  Site Management Plan 2013-2018.

Address: 75 Glendale Crescent Mount Hawke Cornwall TR4 8UH
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed use for development construction or single storey rear extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works will not be lawful development under this certificate  and will require the submission of a planning application.  This is because there was a planning restriction on the original application C1/SA25/1407/91 which removed permitted development rights. The condition  stated:Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Development Order 1988 (or any Order  revoking and re-enacting that Order)  no development falling  within Class A Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the said Order  shall be carried out without the express consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Address: Polstangey Praze Road From Junction South Of Polstangey Bungalow To Polstangey Bridge Ruan Minor TR12 7LS
Description: Change of use of recreational paddock to mixed use of recreational paddock and the stationing of two shepherds huts for additional holiday accommodation to support the existing letting business.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of the site for two holiday letting units by reason  of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced  from nearby  services, facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable new residential development for which no special justification  has been adequately demonstrated.
