The proposal therefore represents  an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic  form of development that would  be harmful  to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside  and would  neither  conserve or enhance the area which is designated  an Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  . The development is therefore  contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: South Beer Boyton Launceston Cornwall PL15 8NW
Description: Proposed barn conversion including extension and associated septic tank, drainage field and landscaping.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling is not considered to be located in a suitable location for new housing development and does not represent 'rounding-off'; the conversion and extension with large domestic garden would cause harm to the character an appearance of the area and would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate  setting; and the building is not older than 10 years.  The scheme conflicts with policies 3,7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Fairhaven Dobbin Close Trevone Padstow Cornwall PL28 8QS
Description: Proposed extensions. Revised design following refusal of PA19/07778
RefusalReasons: 1 The garage and roof extensions will by reason  of their scale, massing, height and proximity to the southern  boundary be dominating and overbearing features that will be oppressive to the outlook  and residential  amenity of Keston  and Greystone.  In so doing  the proposal does not represent good design and causes  conflict with Policy  12 and by extension policy  2 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030

Address: Land East Of Vicarage Gate St Erth Hayle Cornwall TR27 6FL
Description: Permission in Principle for construction of between 4 and 6 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site does not fall within the settlement  boundary of St Erth, shown on Map 2 of the St Erth Neighbourhood  Plan 2017 - 2030, nor is it situated on an allocated  site for residential  development in said Plan. Furthermore, owing to the physical characteristics of the site and surrounding area, the proposal is considered to extend  building into the open countryside rather than round-off  the settlement of St Erth. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of Policy HI 1 of the St Erth Neighbourhood Plan 2017 - 2030, and policies 1 and 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Blacksmiths Trenant Cross Duloe Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4PS
Description: Proposed single-storey extension to dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extension as a result of its size, scale, form and position  would fundamentally alter and harm the simple modest character of the existing building, representing  and incongruous  addition that would  be harmful  to the host building  and the character and appearance  of the wider Area of Great Landscape Value.   The proposed development is therefore  contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), saved  Policy CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan First Alteration 2007, and Section 12 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of Carnyorth Industrial Estate Carnyorth St Just Penzance Cornwall TR19 7QD
Description: Construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development represents an extension into undeveloped,  open countryside beyond the built form of Carnyorth.   The site is not allocated for residential development via an adopted  Neighbourhood Plan, is not previously  developed land and does not represent infill or rounding off development.  The proposal therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic form of residential  development in the countryside which  would  result in harm to the intrinsic character and beauty of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.   In the absence  of any other  material considerations which  outweigh such harm,  the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs  79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 Insufficient information has been submitted to enable an assessment of the impact on the proposal on the setting  of the Outstanding  Universal Value of the St Just Mining District World  Heritage Site.  It therefore cannot be fully determined whether the proposals would conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Section 16 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and policies C2 and C7 of the Cornwall  and West Devon Mining Landscape  World  Heritage  Site Management Plan 2013 - 2018. 3 Insufficient evidence has been provided to demonstrate that the site is suitable for the proposed  use.  In the absence  of this information,  it has not been adequately demonstrated that the potential  risk of contamination on site to the health of future residential  occupants of the proposal  cannot be adequately mitigated, contrary  to policies  13 and 16 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 -2030 and paragraphs 178 and 179 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of 3 Swelle Cottages Poundstock Bude Cornwall EX23 0DW
Description: Conversion of outbuilding to dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the established  and definable limits  of any settlement, and does not represent infill or rounding off as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. The proposal  would  represent a residential unit of accommodation in the countryside  where no special justification has been satisfactorily demonstrated, the proposed  building  is not redundant or disused and is less than 10 years old and would  therefore  not be appropriate for conversion  to a dwelling under  Policy 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.  By reason  of its location,  not adjacent to any defined settlement, the application site is not considered to be sustainably located and would not accord with Policy 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan. No special justification has been adequately demonstrated  to outweigh the harm of this proposal  to the character of the open countryside. The development  is therefore contrary  to policy  1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 21 of The Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, adopted November  2016. 2 In the absence of adequate information regarding the potentially  contaminated  land, it is not possible to assess the impact and effects  on the proposed residential development in respect  of the safe occupation of the building  .  Consequently the proposal is contrary  to paragraphs 178 and 179 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted  November 2016.

Address: Boskednan Farm Access To Boskednan Boskednan Newmill TR20 8XX
Description: Certificate of lawfulness proposed use: Placement of Caravan/Log Cabin within the residential curtilage of the property for ancillary purposes
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed siting of the caravan is not considered to be within the curtilage of the dwellinghouse known  as Boskednan Farm and therefore  planning permission is required.

Address: Caravan South Of Goodern Manor Farm Kea Cornwall TR3 6EB
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of a mobile home as permanent residential accommodation
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the caravan has been used for self-contained residential accommodation for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: Land North Of Burridge Farm Morwenstow Bude Cornwall EX23 9HS
Description: Construction of 2no x 2 Bedroom and 1no x 1 Bedroom Subterranean Holiday Lets with associated Car Parking and Amenity Space
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed three holiday units, by reason of their isolated countryside location, divorced from settlements with from nearby services,  facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable  development for which  no special  justification or local need has been adequately demonstrated.  The proposal therefore represents an unsustainable, undesirable  and sporadic form of development that fails to conserve and enhance the landscape and scenic  beauty of the Hartland Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty and Heritage Coast. The development is therefore  contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, POlicy MD6 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of adequate ecological  survey, the application fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance habitat and biodiversity. As such, this proposal is contrary to Policy  23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016)  and the aims and intentions  of Paragraphs 118 (b) and 170 (a) of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 The proposed development fails to demonstrate:  safe or suitable pedestrian connection with any local facility; that the access  and access track can accommodate the increase in associated vehicle movements; access arrangement detail in respect of visibility from the proposed  access; or detail in respect of inter-visible  passing over the route back to public highway (to show vehicles meeting in conflict can pass without length reversing manoeuvres).  As such, the proposal fails to demonstrate safe and suitable  access for all modes, and the proposal is considered to be unsustainable in transport terms contrary  to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016).

Address: Steamer Quay Lower Kelly Calstock Cornwall PL18 9RU
Description: Domestic extension to existing property
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal - by reason of its scale, and, in cumulation with the host building its utilitarian, repetitive appearance - would fail to assimilate sympathetically into its historic and landscape context. As such it would materially harm: the Outstanding Universal Value of the Tamar Valley Mining District of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site; the character and appearance of the Calstock Conservation Area; the settings of the adjacent listed buildings; and the natural beauty of the landscape of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. These harms are considered to outweigh the benefits of the scheme. As such the proposal fails to accord with Policies 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016; paragraph 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework February 2019; Policies C2 and C7 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013 – 2018; and Policy 10.5.8 of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2019 - 2024.

Address: 54 Trethannas Gardens Praze An Beeble TR14 0LJ
Description: Lawful development certificate for proposed garage conversion into bedroom
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed conversion of the garage into a bedroom is not considered to be lawful development;  this is because  condition 3 of the original decision notice  for the development  of the estate,  PA84/00340/F  dated 25.09.1984,   requires  that the garage shall be maintained in use as a garage and shall not be used, adapted  or converted  in any way, for any use domestic or otherwise without express consent of the Local Planning Authority. Therefore  a planning application  is required to be submitted to the local planning authority.

Address: Land W Of The Jays Road From Kennards House To Trebursye Farm Tregadillett Launceston PL15 7EU
Description: Outline Consent with some matters reserved for the construction of up-to nine dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is located outside of the village of Tregadillett; the proposal would not constitute rounding off of the settlement,  nor infill development within a built up frontage, development  of previously  developed land and is therefore considered to be countryside where there would be visual harm to the character  and appearance of the area.  The scheme has not been submitted as rural exception site development  and does not offer a minimum  of 50% on-site  affordable housing provision.  The proposal is contrary to Policies 3, 9 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 adopted  2016. 2 The proposal fails to demonstrate that access  to serve the site would  be safe and suitable. An access  arrangement  plan to include  clearly annotated visibility  splay sight lines/distances (Y) from a 2.4m set back (X), to be designed to observed road speeds with justification offered,  should have been  provided. The proposal is thereby contrary  to Policy 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 adopted  2016.

Address: Braeside Access To Lower Boscadjack Trenear TR13 0HH
Description: Conversion of single garage and outbuilding into a holiday let.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would introduce a new unit of holiday  accommodation into the countryside  where, due to the isolated location, future occupants of the development would be reliant upon the private vehicle  to access services, goods and facilities required on a daily basis. The proposal for a holiday let, irrespective of a condition restricting  its occupancy, would represent an unjustified residential unit in the countryside, thereby giving rise to sporadic  development in an unsustainable location, with no overriding reason  to support development in this context. The proposed development  therefore  does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030, and paragraph 83 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Higher Penhole Farm Cottages East Taphouse Liskeard PL14 4NP
Description: Outline application for construction of two additional holiday cottages with all matters except access reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the construction of two new dwellings in the open countryside to provide holiday  accommodation, which would, in this rural countryside  location, represent unsustainable,  sporadic new residential  accommodation where no overriding  justification has been submitted. The proposal is therefore contrary  to policies  1, 2, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016 and paragraphs 8 and 83 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adjacent Miners Arms Car Park Mithian St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0QF
Description: Demolition of redundant farm building and erection of single storey holiday cottage for short term lets with change of use of land to associated amenity space
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed holiday  letting dwelling would be located on the edge of Mithian  village which is a settlement that does not benefit  from public  transport links and the nearst bus stop is not within a safe and convenient  walking distance. The development would thus rely on private  transport  and thus fails to maximise  the use of sustainable  transport modes contrary to policy  5(3) and 27(2) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and contarry to Policy 19 of the St Agnes  Neighbourhood Development  Plan. 2 The proposed holiday  letting dwelling is outside the Mithian  settlement boundary and does not propose  affordable housing thus is contrary to St Agnes Neighbourhood Development  Plan policies  1 and 2 which set a clear direction  for development of housing within the Parish.

Address: Land South Of Engelly Road Goonhavern Truro TR4 9NN
Description: Permission in principle for proposed development of a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the definable limits of the established settlement of Goonhavern,  and does not represent an acceptable form of infill or rounding off as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. The development therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic  extension of the built form in the adjoining countryside, which would lead to visual harm  through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify  residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary  to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Cottage Hannafore Road West Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 2BY
Description: Replace Juliet balcony with full size balcony and change two sliding patio doors to three panel bi-fold doors
RefusalReasons: 1 The balcony proposed would result  in an unacceptable  increase  in the intensity  and immediacy of overlooking in relation to the windows in the north  west facing  rooms of the adjacent  property to the south of the site known as 'The Follies'.  The balcony would  also have an overbearing impact and increase the sense of enclosure to the amenity area of No 6 which is sited directly below the proposed balcony.  The proposed  development  would therefore  harm the living  conditions and level of amenity currently  enjoyed by neighbouring residents  and as such the proposal would  be contrary  to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016),  Section 2.6 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013, the advice of the Cornwall  Council Domestic  Alterations and Extensions  Guide  2017 (pg 6) and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Between 30 And 36 Mount Wise Mount Wise Newquay Cornwall TR7 2BN
Description: Construction of 6 town houses and associated site works (re-submission of application no. PA19/04983)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  be out of character with the pattern and form of development in the area, and would be likely to appear  prominent within  the streetscene. The development  would result in the site having a cramped appearance which would visually  contrast  with the character  and appearance of the area. The proposal would be conflict  with Policy  12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2016 and Policies G2 and D1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan which seek good design. 2 The proposal would  fail to provide useable and functional  outdoor amenity spaces  suitable for family dwellings of this nature. The proposal  would therefore conflict  with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the Cornwall Design Guide  2013.

Address: 2 And 4 St Thomas Road Newquay TR7 1RS
Description: Demolition of existing bungalows and formation of residential development of 8 dwellings and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The current development proposal seeking  demolition of existing  bungalows and formation of residential  development of 8 dwellings and associated works is assessed by the Local Planning Authority to be an overdevelopment of the site. This overdevelopment is comprised of a cramped form of layout with an unsatisfactory orientation  of housing and living  conditions within  the site in relation to each other, and in relation to boundaries and neighbouring properties; introducing a dominant scale and height of development within the street  scene along St Thomas Road that would have an unsatisfactory relationship to neighbouring properties leading to loss of privacy and amenity; car parking provision that does not provide the minimum  standards on plot required; and overall creating a form of development  that is assessed as out of character  of the established pattern  of development  including taking account  of most recent permission for part of this red line site. This current  proposal is therefore in conflict with Polices  2(1), 12, 13, 16, 21 and 23 of the Adopted Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and Policies D1; G2 and H4 of the Adopted  Newquay Neighbourhood Development  Plan; Paragraph 122 and Chapter 12 of the NPPF (2019) and the Adopted  Cornwall Design  Guide 2013. 2 The current development has not provided percolation  test results,  carried out to BRE Digest 365 standards with plan of trial pit holes and supported  by photographs of the investigation to demonstrate how a sloping site within  Flood Zone 1 can provide a satisfactory means of managing surface  water runoff from the site; and attenuate against  impacts off site especially  to St Thomas Road and properties situated  below  on the north side of St Thomas Road located at a lower level. This current development  therefore conflicts with Policy  26 of the Adopted Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and Chapter 14 of the NPPF (2019).

Address: The Old Cottage Antony Torpoint Cornwall PL11 3AL
Description: Rear extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The existing building comprises  a simple two storey dwelling of traditional character and appearance  which contributes positively to its setting  and surrounding area.  The proposal by reason of its scale, form and design would  appear a dominant and incongruous addition and would detract from the original  proportions and appearance of the existing building resulting in a loss of character and would also adversely affect  the character and appearance of this part of the Area of Great  Landscape Value. As such, the proposal  is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030,  adopted November 2016, Policy  5 of the Rame  Peninsula  Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017  together  with the provisions of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019, with particular  reference to Paragraph 127.

Address: Field At Bokenver St Martin Cornwall
Description: Change of use of a 9350m2 part of the site to mixed use agriculture, forestry, tourist accommodation camping and facilities. Regularising the siting of: one camping pod (10.8 m2) existing, a composting toilet (1.6 m2) existing, a shower (3.3 m2) existing. The proposed siting of two camping pods (2 x 10.8 m2), a shepherd's hut (10.8 m2), six camping pitches, a composting toilet (1.6 m2), a shower (3.3 m2), extended hardstanding (85 m2 and 3 x 11.5 m2).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed new camping facility in the open countryside by reason of its scale and location would result in an unsuitable and sustainable form of new tourism  development which  would erode and be harmful  to the intrinsic character  and appearance of the countryside and the Area of Great  Landscape Value. The proposal is therefore contrary  to policies  1, 2, 5, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, saved Policy  CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan 1999 and paragraphs  8, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Rear Of 51 Penpol Terrace Penpol Sidings Hayle Cornwall TR27 4FQ
Description: Construction of single dwelling on land to the rear of 51 Penpol Terrace- Hayle
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of the siting, scale and layout  of the proposed  dwelling within  an existing garden,  the proposal  will represent a cramped, contrived form of development resulting in restricted amenity space for future occupiers.  In addition, the dominant structure will result  in an overbearing impact on the neighbouring residents along with overlooking of neighbouring garden areas. Therefore the development fails to promote health and well-being through good design and layout and is therefore contrary to policy  SD5 of the Hayle  Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2014-2013,  policies  12 and 16 in the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030,  paragraph 127 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and supplementary planning guidance in section  5.5 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013. 2 The proposed development of the site with a single  dwelling would result in the loss of an existing historic  garden plot associated with a dwelling which is considered to erode the historic character of the area.  The proposal would be seen as an incongruous feature that would  neither  relate to nor reflect the local context in which it is situated and would therefore  fail to preserve  or enhance  the character and appearance of the Hayle Conservation  Area or the Outstanding Universal Value  of the World Heritage Site.  Whilst  the harm to the heritage asset would be less then substantial, the public benefits  of the proposal  in terms of the provision of an additional  residential unit is not considered to outweigh this harm.  The  proposal is therefore contrary to policy HB1 of the Hayle  Neighbourhood Plan 2014-2030, policies 1, 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 184, 189 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Shangri La 4 Winsor Estate Pelynt Looe Cornwall PL13 2JY
Description: Outline application for construction of a dwelling and vehicle access with all matters except access reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The visibility sight lines proposed  are substandard based  on actual road speeds, and cannot be achieved as they overrun third party  land outside the control of the applicant.  Furthermore,  the application fails to demonstrate that acceptable driveway gradients can be achieved or that parking and turning can be provided to enable vehicles to enter and exit in a forward  gear.  The application therefore fails to demonstrate that a safe and suitable access to the development can be achieved and is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 and Paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land And Buildings South Of Old Portreath Road Redruth TR16 4QG
Description: Proposed construction of two dwellings following demolition of existing barns.
RefusalReasons: 1 The replacement  dwellings are not broadly comparable in size, scale and bulk of the existing dwellings and results in a scheme that does not respond to its setting and will introduce a built mass which inherently overwrites the sites legibility and rural setting. The proposal would therefore be contrary to Section 12, paragraph 127 and Section 15, paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and Policy 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and the guidance within  the Cornwall Design Guide.

Address: Land South East Of Sportsmans Close Sportsmans Close Launceston Cornwall PL15 9DW
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved except access for the erection of up to thirteen dwellings, provision of pedestrian access points and footpaths, provision of a tree planting area and the possible provision of a play area
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not located within the settlement of Treburley and its location and scale of development does not constitute   rounding off nor utilise previously developed land.  The settlement  is considered suitable  for housing  on a rural exceptions basis where housing development is responsive to local circumstances in reflecting  local housing needs  and is affordable housing led; however the scheme  does not provide minimum  required affordable housing, or any viability assessment and would provide  a greater number of affordable dwellings than is shown to be needed  . The scheme  would create further incremental growth and expansion of the village into open countryside.  Although  the proposal offers  social and economic benefits through  housing  delivery  including affordable  units on the edge of this village location (which are positive material considerations  supported within  the NPPF) these  do not outweigh or justify a departure from the spatial  strategy set out in the Development  Plan. The proposal is therefore  not considered  to constitute sustainable development as defined by the Development Plan as it conflicts specifically with Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9 and 23  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030,  adopted November 2016; and Policy  Housing 1 of the post referendum Lezant  Parish  Neighbourhood Development  Plan  2019 - 2030 (Feb 2020). 2 Insufficient information has been provided to establish whether  there is a safe and suitable vehicular  and pedestrian access  . The scheme is contrary  to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, adopted November 2016. 3 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure it, the proposal fails to provide affordable housing.  The proposal is therefore considered to be contrary  to policies 9, 12, 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030,  adopted November 2016

Address: Verde Limone Road From Carne Grey Cottage To A391 Roundabout Carn Grey St Austell PL25 3TB
Description: Construction of holiday accommodation, parking and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement.  The proposed  new holiday accommodation, by reason of its character and massing, would result  in harm to the distinctive  natural character of the surrounding  area by the introduction of new built form and would  be accommodation with poor accessibility to necessary  daily services  and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance  on the private  vehicle and unsustainable  traffic movements.  Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable  development and is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, and 83 point c of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Off Goonown Lane St Agnes
Description: Erection of polytunnels, a shed for agricultural use and a composting toilet
RefusalReasons: 1 Contrary to policy  27 of the Cornwall Local Plan a safe and suitable  access  to the site of the proposed  development cannot be achieved owing  to the lack of emerging visibility onto the U6073 presenting a danger  for emerging vehicles  as well as a situation where  two vehicles meeting  in the lane could  result  in blind reversing manoeuvres onto the U6073.

Address: 31 Atlantic Close Widemouth Bay Bude EX23 0AP
Description: Proposed two storey side extension with balcony, terrace and store
RefusalReasons: 1 The design of the proposed  extension on the front of the property does not respect the scale of the property and would  result in an overlarge visual element on this part of the building. As such the proposal would  ,  if permitted, result in an incongruous and over-  prominent addition within the street scene harmful to the character and appearance of the surrounding area .  As such it would be contrary to Policy  12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016)   policy ENV01 of the North Cornwall Local Plan Part 1 and 2 (adopted 1999) paras 124, 127, 128, 131  of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 2 The extension by reason of its size, design  and location in relation to the neighbouring property  to the north  (no. 32)   would have an unacceptable  impact  upon the residential amenities of the occupiers/future  occupiers of this property through an overbearing  relationship. As such it would be contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016)  policy ENV01 of the North Cornwall  Local Plan Part 1 and 2 (adopted 1999) paras 124, 127, 128, 131  of the National Planning  Policy  Framework  2019

Address: Land South West Of Vicarage Stables Chiverton Cross Blackwater Cornwall TR4 8HS
Description: Permission in Principle for the construction of up to two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  result  in up to two dwellings in the countryside  outside  of any settlement and would have an adverse urbanising effect to the detriment of the rural character of the location. The proposal  would  therefore represent an unsustainable form of development and conflict  with Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 policies  1, 2, 3 and 7 and the environmental sustainablility aims at Section 2 and paragraph 170(b) of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  to protect the intrinsic value  of the countryside.

Address: Land Rear Of Chy Kerenza Prospect Row Ashton Helston Cornwall TR13 9RR
Description: Application for Permission in principle for the Construction of a single dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 It is acknowledged that the site comprises garden land, however the site itself comprises a predominately undeveloped parcel  of land which contributes positively to the rural character of this part of Ashton. The proposal would increase the built form and fail to preserve the character  and special interest  of the World Heritage Site, leading to harm  which would not be outweighed by any overriding public benefit  contrary to policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. In the absence  of any special justification to warrant  residential development in this context,  the proposal  is contrary with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 117, 127, 170 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South West Of 8 Todda Close Bolventor Launceston Cornwall PL15 7FP
Description: Construction of three houses with sewage treatment works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would extend built form into prominent land designated as an Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty and does not represent rounding off of a settlement or provide a rural exception site for affordable housing; contrary to Policies 3, 9 and 23  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Land At Comfort Wartha Constantine Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5AZ
Description: Revocation of Section 52 agreement in respect of decision 2/06/84/00297/0 for erection of eight cottage style dwellings
RefusalReasons: The Section 52 Agreement still serves a useful purpose  in protecting  against the loss of an area of public  open space which has not been demonstrated to be surplus to requirements, and no suitable replacement open space has been proposed.  As such the retention of the Agreement would meet the tests set out under paragraph 56 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.  Furthermore the proposal is contrary to Policies 13, 16 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 97 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North West Of Peacehaven Boscaswell Downs Pendeen Cornwall TR19 7EE
Description: Application for Permission in principle for proposed residential development (up to 3 dwellings).
RefusalReasons: 1 Previously  developed land (PDL) is defined as "Land which is or was occupied  by a permanent  structure, including  the curtilage  of the developed land".  It also states that where the remains of the permanent structure  or fixed surface structure have blended into the landscape it is excluded from the definition of PDL. The LPA considers the site does not meet the definition of PDL and in any event has blended into the landscape. It is considered that the site is not immediately adjoining the settlement of Pendeen and therefore  does not accord with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. Notwithstanding the above the site comprises  an undeveloped parcel of land which contributes  positively  to the rural character of this area which is designated as being within a World Heritage Site, a Conservation Area, a Heritage Coast and an Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty and lies between the settlement of Pendeen and the coast to the south. The proposed development would not represent a suitable location for housing having  regard to local and national policies, with particular regard to the effect of the proposed development on the character and appearance  of the area. The proposal  would  increase the built form and fail to preserve the character  and special interest  of the World Heritage Site and Conservation Area and the landscape and scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty, leading  to harm which would not be outweighed  by any overriding public  benefit contrary to policies 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 172, 184 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. In the absence of any special justification to warrant residential development in this context,  the proposal is contrary  to the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 8, 117, 127, 170, 172, 184 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed  Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land NE Of The Pond Leat Road Boscaswell Downs Pendeen Cornwall
Description: Application for Permission in principle for a single dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 Previously  developed land (PDL) is defined as "Land which is or was occupied  by a permanent  structure, including  the curtilage  of the developed land.".  It also states that where the remains of the permanent structure  or fixed surface structure have blended into the landscape it is excluded from the definition of PDL. The LPA considers the site does not meet the definition of PDL and in any event has blended into the landscape. It is considered that the site is not immediately adjoining the settlement of Pendeen and therefore  does not accord with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. Notwithstanding the above the site comprises  an undeveloped parcel of land which contributes  positively  to the rural character of this area which is designated as being within a World Heritage Site, a Conservation Area, a Heritage Coast and an Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty and lies between the settlement of Pendeen and the coast to the south. The proposed development would not represent a suitable location for housing having  regard to local and national policies, with particular regard to the effect of the proposed development on the character and appearance  of the area. The proposal  would  increase the built form and fail to preserve the character  and special interest  of the World Heritage Site and Conservation Area and the landscape and scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty, leading  to harm which would not be outweighed  by any overriding public  benefit contrary to policies 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 172, 184 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. In the absence of any special justification to warrant residential development in this context,  the proposal is contrary  to the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 8, 117, 127, 170, 172, 184 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed  Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Pengenna Pasties Pengenna Atlantic Road Tintagel Cornwall PL34 0DD
Description: Construction of retail unit with residential accommodation above on site of former garage / store building
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its scale,  diminished distance to common boundaries to the north and east, results  in an overly cramped form of development which  introduces issues  of overshadowing, overbearing and loss of outlook which  would be harmful to the residential  amenity of The Haven to the immediate east. As such, it conflicts with Policy  2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016)  paragraph  127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a suitable and adequate Phase 1 contaminated land report, the application fails to demonstrate that future occupants  of the dwelling would not be detrimentally  impacted due to previous uses of the land and is therefore contrary to paragraph  178 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: Land South Of Arnewood Creed Lane Grampound Cornwall TR2 4SH
Description: Proposed new dwelling and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  due to the excessive scale and massing  relative to the plot, will result  in a dominant  addition  to the street scene, which  does not provide a commensurate  degree of accompanying  private amenity space.  Furthermore, given the scale and proximity to the adjacent  unit to the north, the development will result in unacceptable overbearing and overshadowing  impacts to the occupiers of the neighbouring unit known as "Arnewood", creating  an oppressive and enclosed environment. The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Two Hoots Carkeel Saltash Cornwall PL12 6PH
Description: Change of use of workshop (general industrial class B2) to dwelling (dwelling house class C3).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would increase the amount of vehicular  traffic  accessing and egressing to and from the site which  has a substandard access point due to its limited  visibility  for drivers  exiting the junction with the A388, observed speeds in excessive of the 40mph speed limit and the position  of the access in the context  of the existing highway  arrangement, which would all contribute to an increased risk of collision and reduction in highway safety to both occupants and members of the public. The proposal also fails to accommodate pedestrians  and offers no footway or safe crossing facility. The application, therefore,  fails to provide  safe and suitable access and is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 - 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Pedar Clubworthy North Petherwin Cornwall
Description: Erection of an agricultural livestock and storage shed, together with associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed building and its large scale within  a small parcel of land is not considered to be reasonably  necessary for the purposes of agriculture as no trade or business currently exists that would  require a building  in this location;  contrary to Policies  2 and 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016. The introduction  of a 5.8m high building  would  neither  protect nor enhance Cornwall's natural  environment contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Land North Of Trewithian Poundstock Bude Cornwall EX23 0DS
Description: Proposed residential development of 5 dwellings and new access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings represent an extension into undeveloped,  open countryside beyond the built form of Bangors. The site is not allocated for residential development via a made  Neighbourhood  Plan, is not previously developed land and does not represent infill or rounding off development. The proposal therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic form of residential  development in the countryside which  erodes the character and appearance of the Area of Great  Landscape  Value  and Heritage Coast, in the absence of any other material  considerations  which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2(1) 3, 7, 9, 21 and 23 (1) of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraph  79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Glencoe Vean Goonearl Scorrier TR16 5EB
Description: Change of use and extension to existing ancillary accommodation to form detached residential C3 dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The development  proposed results  in a new dwellinghouse outside  of any established settlement, in an unsustainable, inaccessible location  in the countryside, which would promote an associated  over-reliance  by occupiers on a private vehicle.  There are no identified special circumstances to outweigh the harm caused from development  in this context. The proposal  is therefore  contrary to policies 1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies 1 and 7 of the St Agnes  Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2018 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 79 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: Whitsand Bay Hotel Finnygook Lane Portwrinkle Torpoint Cornwall PL11 3BU
Description: Change of Use of current Hotel (C1 use) for the creation of eighteen one and two bedroom apartments (C3 use), gym, hair salon, games room and pool with associated alterations to a Listed Building (Grade II) with variation of condition 3 of application no. PA18/08163 dated 10/04/19
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed variation or removal of Planning  Condition  No. 3 of application  no. PA18/08163 dated 10/04/19  is not accepted  as it would  add to rising house prices within the local housing market and the continued uncontrolled growth of dwellings used for holiday accommodation/second  homes giving rise to unsustainable local communities and erosion of local facilities .The condition remains necessary,  relevant  to planning and to the earlier development permitted; and should be retained in full in accordance with the Rame Peninsula  Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017-2030  (Adopted 21st June 2017)  Policy 1: New Housing - Principle Residency.

Address: 10 Rosewin Row Truro Cornwall TR1 1HG
Description: Proposed removal of wall below windows to create opening for the installation of french doors
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development fails to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of this part of the Truro Conservation Area by reason of its design and location, and is considered to represent less than substantial harm to the significance of a designated heritage asset that has not been justified through public benefits, in conflict with the aims and intentions of Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy C1 of Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030, and paragraphs 189, 190, 192, 193, 194, and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and together with advice contained in the Cornwall Design Guide 2013 and Truro Conservation Area Appraisal and Management Plan 2010.

Address: Land West Of 66 Treverbyn Road St Ives TR26 1EY
Description: Erection of a Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellinghouse  by reason  of its siting and relationship to the neighbouring properties would give rise to an overbearing impact  to the properties to the south east resulting in a significantly diminished unsatisfactory outlook for the occupiers of these  properties.   In addition,  there would  be significant overlooking  of the proposed rear garden to serve  the proposed dwelling from the existing property to the south west.   The proposal  represents  poor design in terms of layout, the poor relationship between neighbouring properties gives rise to a poor level of amenity and substandard living environment for all occupiers.  The proposal  therefore  fails to accord with policy  GD1 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan, policy 12 of Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 2 The modern  contemporary design of the proposed dwelling would be at odds with its surroundings and would neither relate to nor reflect the local context  in which it is situated.  The development would therefore  give rise to adverse harm  to the character and appearance of the area and would be in conflict with policies GD1 and BE10 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood  Development Plan (2015 - 2030),  policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 130 and 131 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Kilminorth Woods The Millpool West Looe Cornwall
Description: New access pontoon and associated landscape works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed pontoon and associated landscape works as a result of its design, siting and scale would constitute a prominent, incongruous and harmful form of development which  would erode the intrinsic character and appearance of this attractive wooded estuary setting within an Area of Great Landscape  Value  and surrounded by Ancient  and Semi-Natural Woodland. The development is therefore contrary  to policy  14 of the Polperro and Lansallos  Parish Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017 - 2030,  policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, Policy CL9 - Areas of Great  Landscape Value, of the Caradon Local Plan 1999 as saved by the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 Insufficient information has been submitted to demonstrate that the application would not impact unfavourably  upon biodiversity  and protected species. The proposed development  therefore fails to comply  with policy  14 of the Polperro and Lansallos Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017 - 2030, policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016 and paragraphs 170  and 175 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land To The East Of Pendethys Trelill Bodmin PL30 3HY
Description: Outline Planning Permission for two dwellings with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  deliver  open market housing  that projects into and erodes the natural undeveloped character of the open countryside  which is designated as an Area of Great Landscape  Value and provide constrained  non-vehicular accessibility to services  and facilities to future occupiers.  The proposal does not accord with the spatial strategy pursued by this Council in the development plan and accordingly the proposal fails to comply with the development plan provisions contained within policies  1, 2, 2a, 3, 7, 21, or 23 and saved policy ENV1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030.  The limited economic and social  benefits of the development including  the delivery  of housing to support the role and function of the settlement,  the construction  jobs that would be created, do not outweigh  the environmental harm nor the conflict with the development plan and the proposal is not considered to represent sustainable development.

Address: The Stables Golberdon Road Pensilva Cornwall
Description: Erection of an agricultural dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 1. Application submissions  offer no special justification for the proposed agricultural dwelling in this open countryside location,  demonstrating  neither functional need nor financial sustainability for permanent living on this smallholding. As such, the proposed  development  fails to accord with the provisions, aims and intentions  of policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and Part 5 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019, with particular reference to Paragraph  79.

Address: Land North East Of Nanscarne Nanstallon Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5LG
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for a new dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is located outside of the confines of any settlement and is considered to be the countryside for the purposes  of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.  The development would therefore  not constitute infill or rounding off for the purposes of Policy 3 of the CLP. The proposal does not accord with any of the special circumstances for new dwellings in the countryside  listed in Policy 7 of the CLP. It would, therefore, conflict with Policies  3, 7, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and saved Policy  ENV 1 of the North  Cornwall District  Plan which seek to ensure that development proposals can be considered  sustainable development by ensuring that development  protects local distinctiveness  and the character  of the area and does not extend  development into the open countryside.

Address: Sennen Rise Mayon Farm Sennen TR19 7AD
Description: Construction of two dwellinghouses in the garden
RefusalReasons: 1 Mayon Farm is considered  a farmstead intrinsically linked to the countryside and not a settlement.  The proposal does not represent  rounding off under Policy 3 of the Cornwall local Plan but, rather, would result in the undesirable  extension and intrusion of residential development  into the countryside that would be prominent to the detriment  to the distinctive natural  beauty and character  of the surrounding semi-rural  countryside.   Given  the lack of any special justification, the application  is not sustainable development and is contrary to policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal by reason of its scale, form and use of extensive areas of glazing and positioning of large velux windows on the north  east elevations fail to respond positively to the local character and distinctiveness in this farmstead formed predominantly of traditional barn conversions  and would result in unacceptable overlooking impacts, particularly  from plot 1 upon the neighbouring  dwellings known as 1 and 2 Mayon Farm. As a result  the proposal  is considered to constitute a poor quality form of development  which would fail to conserve or enhance the area and would cause unacceptable  residential amenity impacts contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 130 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Field Candron Water Gweek Helston TR12 6TX
Description: Temporary retention of residential use of land by stationing of caravans, storage container and therapy workspace, personal to the Applicants and construction of replacement structure to provide living accommodation
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is located  outside  of any defined  settlement,  such that it is located within the open countryside  where new residential units and new business enterprises are only permitted in special circumstances.  It is considered that the proposal does not comply with any of the special circumstances and would not maintain the character of the area within  an Area of Great  Landscape Value  due to the proposed residential use and associated  domestic paraphernalia  and is therefore contrary  to policies  1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 83, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Lantern House Lower Kelly Calstock Cornwall PL18 9RY
Description: Improve an existing, small-scale domestic dock and its immediate functional surrounds
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would encroach on the inter tidal foreshore  which is important for the functioning of the estuary  and has significant  nature  conservation value.  The information submitted  with this information fails to demonstrate that the proposal will not have an adverse impact on the integrity  of the Plymouth Sound and Estuaries  Special Area of Protection,  the Tamar to Tavy Estuary Site of Special Scientific Interest or the Tamar Estuaries Sites Marine Conservation Zone.  The  proposed  development  is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted  November 2016) and Paragraphs  170 and 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Skyburriowe Mill Cottage Skyburriowe Mill Garras TR12 6LP
Description: Conversion of former mill to form 1 bedroom holiday let
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works, by reason of the significant  extension and alterations to the building are considered  to be substantial in scale; harms  the intrinsic small scale and character of the host unit and is considered  to represent development far beyond a conversion. The resultant residential  use would  fail to conserve the character and appearance of the existing building which is of simple  traditional  form and style whilst leading to a proliferation of paraphernalia and domestication that would erode the rural character and would not conserve or enhance the area which is located in open countryside outside of any settlement such that it represents an unsustainable form of development. The proposal is therefore contrary  to policies  1, 7, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Bowls Barn Castle Road Ludgvan Penzance Cornwall TR20 8HD
Description: Retrospective change in use of a former stables and workshop to a mixed use as a timber frame manufacturing and assembly workshop, domestic and commercial storage, and stabling for the keeping of a recreational horse
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would have potential to result in an intensified  use of the existing access onto the B3309  public highway/Castle Road, with emerging  visibility looking north-westward being  significantly constrained by an existing stone bank.  Furthermore,  it was observed during  site visits that vehicles travelling south-eastward  along the public highway - which benefits from the national speed  limit at this point - often do so at relatively high speeds. The proposal is therefore considered to fail to provide  safe and suitable access to the site for all people and, fundamentally, to result in a severe residual cumulative impact in highway safety terms, in conflict with the aims and intentions  of Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development would be situated  in close proximity to existing residential dwellings to the north-west, the closest of which ("Bowls Farm House") is positioned around 8 metres from the western corner of the application building at its nearest point.  Furthermore, it is considered that conditions could  not reasonably mitigate the adverse noise effects  of the development whilst meeting the six tests for conditions, set out in paragraph 55 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.  The proposal is therefore considered to fail to protect people and the environment from harmful  impacts such as noise pollution, in conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies  12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, and paragraphs  170 and 180 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: 5 Tyringham Place Tyringham Road Lelant TR26 3LH
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for sub-division of site to form new dwelling plot with parking space and parking space for existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The large rear gardens to the rear of Tyringham Place form an important part of the Conservation Area and is recognised  as being  part of the older properties within the settlement of Lelant and within the Historic Core Boundary  as identified in the St Ives Neighbourhood  Development Plan.  There are a number  of rear gardens of similar  lengths and widths along the terrace. The addition of further fencing, parking  spaces  and additional domestic  paraphernalia  associated with the separate residential  unit would result  in two smaller  plots with very formal separation  which would substantially alter the grain of the long rear gardens seen along  Tyringham  Place and is considered  to harm the character  and appearance of the Conservation Area which would not be outweighed by the limited benefits of the proposal,  contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted  November 2016), the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 as a whole, in particular Section 16, and Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land North East Of Old Rose Cottage Higher Fraddon Fraddon Cornwall TR9 6NL
Description: Proposed erection of a dwelling house with attached garage
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of robust evidence  to demonstrate otherwise  or suitable mitigation the future occupiers  of the proposed dwelling would  likely suffer  a poor standard  of amenity  from noise due to the close proximity of the site to Penare Pig Farm, Fraddon Anaerobic  digester plant and the A30 highway.  The proposal is, therefore,  contrary  to policies 2, 12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph  180 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Hillside St Breward Bodmin Cornwall PL30 4NA
Description: Proposed demolition of the commercial storage building, the erection of a dwelling and the installation of a septic tank
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located in the countryside outside  of and detached from any definable settlement and associated services  and facilities.  The proposed dwelling would  constitute  sporadic  and isolated development in the countryside which would not constitute infill, rounding off or redevelopment  of previously  developed land within or immediately adjoining  a settlement and for which no special circumstances  have been demonstrated.   In the absence of any other  material considerations  which  outweigh the extent  of conflict with housing  policies, the proposal represents an unacceptable  form of development in an Area of Great Landscape Value and would be contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November  2016)  and paragraphs 79 and 170(b) of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019. 2 The submitted Ecology Report  advises that further survey  work will be required in order to ascertain the necessary mitigation/compensatory measures  to safeguard protected bats which currently roost within the building. In the absence of this subsequent survey and a detailed  mitigation strategy, and having regard to the precautionary principle,  the Local Planning Authority cannot fully assess the impact of the development on protected  species  nor secure apporiate mitigastion/compensatory measures. The proposed development is  therefore contrary to Policy  23 (parts  3., 3.(d), and 4) and 25 (parts 1., 2., 3., 4., and 6.) of the Cornwal  Local Plan 2016 and paragraphs  17, 109 and 118 of the NPPF 2019 and the Conservation  of Habitats and Species  Regulations 2010.

Address: The Stables Folly Farm Cottage Trowan Lane St Ives Cornwall TR26 3AE
Description: Conversion and Extension of The Stables Office Building opposite Folly Farm Cottage to form a Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is considered to be situated in the countryside  and it has not been demonstrated that the existing  building  is of a construction which could support the proposed  conversion  works without requiring substantial rebuilding,  thereby being tantamount  to the erection  of a new dwelling  in the countryside. Notwithstanding this, the proposed development,  by reason of its significantly increased scale and massing  and distinctly domestic appearance, is considered to fail to conserve or enhance the immediate setting; rather,  it is considered to harm the landscape and scenic  beauty  of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The proposal  is therefore considered  to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies GD1 and OS1 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030; policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019; and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land West Of 7 Tywarnhayle Road Perranporth Cornwall
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved (appearance and landscaping) for a self-build dwelling (revised scheme to refused appn. no. PA18/03853 with a reduced size building)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of the siting, bulk and scale of the southern end wing of the proposed new dwelling, would result in harmful overbearing impacts to the occupiers of the neighbouring property at Number 5 Tywarnhayle Road. The application is therefore not sustainable development and is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Polices 2010-2030 - adopted 2016.

Address: Mark Of Friendship 5 New Street Millbrook PL10 1BY
Description: Proposed change of use of public house to three dwellings, external alterations, and demolition of outbuildings to the rear.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed conversion of the pub would result in the loss of a valued community hub to the detriment  of the social cohesion  and sustainability of Millbrook. The application has firstly failed to convincingly demonstrate there is no need for the pub and secondly,  failed to demonstrate  the pub is not viable  or that adequate facilities exist elsewhere in the locality.  The resulting social harm from the loss of the community facility would not be outweighed by the benefits of the scheme,  therefore failing  to represent sustainable development, contrary  to policies 1 and 4.4 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Land South Of Trelyn Tuckingmill Lowertown Cornwall TR13 0DB
Description: Proposed affordable self-build dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located in the countryside, outside  of any settlement, with the new home  proposed  in this location resulting in an undesirable extension and intrusion of the built form into the countryside  to the detriment  of the character  and appearance  of the countryside.   In the absence  of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context,  the proposal  is contrary to policies 2, 3, 9, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 11, 12, 127, 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 A Section  106 legal agreement  has not been entered  into to secure the necessary affordable housing. It is therefore considered that the scheme is not affordable housing led and furthermore also fails to reflect  the identified local need as the affordable dwellings are proposed to be for sale. As such the proposal fails to comply with policy 3 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 77 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 The proposed dwelling and associated works, by reason of its scale,  bulk and design results in an incongruous  form of development which would  lead to a dominant feature  in this locality and would  be harmful  to the established rural character and appearance of the area.  As such the application  does not constitute high quality design and is contrary to the aims and intensions of Policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 128 and 130 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019. 4 The submitted information does not incorporate the necessary visibility  splays which are essential in the interests  of highway safety to ensure that an acceptable vehicular access can be implemented.

Address: Land West Of Tredar Trewint Altarnun Launceston Cornwall PL15 7TG
Description: Outline application for Proposed local needs affordable dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed local needs affordable dwelling  would  represent unsustainable new residential development in the countryside  that is not well related  to the settlement of Trewint; and would not maintain  the character  and distinctive landscape quality of a large, undeveloped   field  within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The development  is therefore contrary to Policies 9 and 23  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Thornlea Wesley Road Pensilva Liskeard Cornwall PL14 5PA
Description: Outline application for construction of single detached dwelling house with all matters reserved except access.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of the site with a single  dwelling would result in the loss of an existing historic  garden plot associated with a dwelling  which is recognised as being a surviving historical  component of the former industrial settlement of Pensilva  and would therefore  harm the authenticity and integrity of the Outstanding Universal Value of the World Heritage Site. Whilst the harm to the heritage asset would  be less then substantial, the public  benefits of the proposal in terms  of the provision  of an additional residential unit is not considered to outweigh  this harm. The proposal  is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 184, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of A390 Threemilestone Threemilestone Cornwall
Description: Comprehensive development comprising class A1 foodstore, non-food retail units, restaurants, new site accesses, car parking, landscaping and associated works including Environmental Impact Assessment
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed retail development  which is situated in an out of town location would result  in an adverse impact on the viability and vitality of Truro  City Centre  which has seen a continued  increase in vacant units, a decrease in footfall and lower trading performance  in recent  years and in the time since the previous  retail development on the site was permitted; it also proposes no form of town centre mitigation or protection.  The applicant has not provided sufficient  evidence or safeguards  to enable the Local Planning  Authority to conclude that the scheme would not be harmful to the City Centre of Truro  and as such the proposal would  be contrary  to the aims of Policy  EJ2 of the Truro  Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030, Policies 1, 2 and 4 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  85, 89 and 90 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a suitable mechanism to mitigate the harmful effects  of the development towards the Truro Sustainable  Transport  Strategy, safe pedestrian access across the A390 to Threemilestone and local employment  access opportunities, the proposal is contrary  to the aims of Policies E4 and T1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030,  Policies 1, 2, 12, 27 and 28 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 11, 91, 124, 127, 108 and 110 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Off Polurrian Road Polurrian Road Mullion Cornwall TR12 7EN
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for residential development of up to 25 residential units including vehicular access, internal roads, landscaping, open space, drainage, infrastructure and all associated development. Approval sought for matter of access.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would, through the loss of an open field to the South of the main extent  of built form comprising Mullion  and a consequent extension of the built form of the village boundary, result in the loss of agricultural foreground setting of Mullion when viewed from the South,  in particular  from Ghost Hill and Public Right of Way 221/38/3, fundamentally changing the relationship between  the settlement and the wider AONB landscape.   The impact of which is also experienced when travelling along Nansmellyon Road southwards where the application site combined with the surrounding open nature  and long range views experienced mark a clear experience of transition of leaving the settlement.  For these reasons the proposal is considered to fail to conserve and enhance the AONB landscape and is contrary  to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 11, 124, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a suitable mechanism to mitigate the harmful effects  of the development to provide  affordable  housing for local persons  in the locality in perpetuity the proposal would be contrary to the aims of Policy 8 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 11, 59 and 64 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 In the absence of a suitable mechanism to mitigate the harmful effects  of the development towards education contributions for Mullion School,  towards open space improvements  either  on site or off-site to St Mellans Park and/or  Mullion Gardens and towards  measures  to reduce recreational impacts upon the Fal and Helford SAC, the proposal is contrary  to the aims of Policies 1, 13, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 11, 91, 94, 96, 170 and 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Moor End Altarnun Launceston Cornwall PL15 7RR
Description: Outline application for the erection of 2 'drive-thru' fast food and drink restaurant premises with all matters except access reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  not provide safe and suitable access to the site for all vehicles/people and would cause a significantly  adverse impact on the local and strategic road network  that cannot be managed or mitigated; contrary  to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, adopted November 2016, paragraph 109 of the 2019 National  Planning Policy Framework  and DfT Circular 02/2013 paragraphs 9 and 10.

Address: Land Off Eddystone Rise Liskeard Cornwall
Description: Construction of single dwelling and provision of parking space
RefusalReasons: 1 The creation of a detached dwelling within the land off of Eddystone Rise would result in a scheme that fails to reflect the prevailing pattern of development in the local area, namely that of detached or semi-detached residential properties with modest rear gardens. The proposal would appear as a cramped form of development which would be out of keeping with and harmful to the character of the area and which would conflict with Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, paragraph 23 of the Design section of the Planning Practice Guidance 2015 and section 4.10 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013. 2 The vehicular access to the site, through an existing garage forecourt, is undesirable and would cause vehicular and pedestrian conflict within a confined area. A safe and suitable access to the development has not been demonstrated and the application is therefore contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016) and Paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Kaduna House Road From Junction North Of Rowes Garage To Trispen Hill Trispen TR4 9BA
Description: Proposed extension with increase in ridge height to form annexe above existing garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of its excessive height and mass together  with its proximity to the boundary with the main road, leads to an over-dominant proposal that fails to respond  positively to the local character  and distinctiveness in this semi-rural location and as a result the proposal  is considered to constitute a poor quality form of development which would  be contrary to the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policy 3 of the St Erme Neighbourhood Development Plan. 2 The siting of the external  steps on the South East elevation of the existing garage would lead to an unacceptable  impact on the amenity of the occupants of the dwelling to the immediate  south of the application site, in terms of overlooking onto their front, private amenity  area as well as potential noise and disturbance created when  accessing the annexe, which is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 60 Wellington Road Camborne Cornwall TR14 7LQ
Description: Parking area at the property
RefusalReasons: 1 The Local Planning Authority has acted  positively  and proactively in determining this application by identifying matters  of concern with this proposal. On this occasion, the issues  are so fundamental that it is not possible to negotiate  a satisfactory way forward  due to the harm  that has been clearly identified within  the reason(s)  for refusal. 2 The proposal would  not permit a vehicle to enter,  turn within the site and exit onto the highway in a forward gear and the access  on the north of the site would be sited in close proximity to a multi-spurred junction. The use of the proposed  development would result in unsafe and unsuitable access arrangements  which are contrary  to Paragraph108 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019 and Policy  27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.   This refusal also accords  with Paragraph 109 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 which seeks to prevent  development which would have an unacceptable impact on highway safety.

Address: Aurigny Trewartha Veryan Cornwall TR2 5QJ
Description: Replacement dwelling and replacement garage
