RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed replacement dwelling by reason  of the height and massing  associated with the enlarged two-storey form,  would represent a significant  visual intrusion in this rural fringe  context of the existing small hamlet settlement, harmful to the established  landscape character of this section  of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty, contrary  to Policies  2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030,  Policies LA1, CV1, GP1, GP2 and HO8 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2015-2030, Policy MD16  of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Beauty  Management Plan 2016-2021 and Paragraphs 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed replacement dwelling, with the adoption  of a large,  two-story  form in close proximity to the boundary with the neighbouring dwelling, would  represent a dominating and overbearing form of development that would be harmful to the established  residential amenities of neighbouring  dwellings, contrary to Policy  12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy CV1 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2015-2030, Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019 and Section 4.11 of the Cornwall  Design Guide 2013.

Address: Land At Mousehole Lane Mousehole Penzance Cornwall TR19 6TT
Description: Outline Planning Permission with Some Matters Reserved: Two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal does not represent an infill site and would result in the significant  urbanisation of the site, which  would be harmful  to its character and would  fail to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The proposal is therefore  contrary  to Policies  1, 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy 1 of the Cornwall Site Allocations  Development  Plan Document 2019, paragraphs  8, 127 170 and 172 of the  National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019 and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Tremorna Cottage Helford Helston Cornwall TR12 6JX
Description: Listed building consent for Demolition of existing single storey outbuilding and construction of a single storey extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The construction of the proposed  extension, by virtue  of its design,  positioning and size and resultant small amenity area would materially dilute and degrade  the buildings historic  and architectural  character, thereby  undermining the integrity and authenticity  of the listed building.  The resultant amenity space  would provide  a substandard level of residential  amenity that would  conflict with policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposal therefore fails to preserve the fabric, character and special interest of the listed building, leading to harm  which would not be outweighed  by any public benefit. The proposed  works  would therefore be contrary to the Council's duty as local planning authority to have special regard to the desirability of preserving listed buildings under  Section 16 (2) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990, Policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Tremorna Cottage Helford Helston Cornwall TR12 6JX
Description: Demolition of existing single storey outbuilding and construction of a single storey extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The construction of the proposed  extension, by virtue  of its design,  positioning and size and resultant small amenity area would materially dilute and degrade  the buildings historic  and architectural  character, thereby  undermining the integrity and authenticity  of the listed building.  The resultant amenity space  would provide  a substandard level of residential  amenity that would  conflict with policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposal therefore fails to preserve the fabric, character and special interest of the listed building, leading to harm  which would not be outweighed  by any public benefit. The proposed  works  would therefore be contrary to the Council's duty as local planning authority to have special regard to the desirability of preserving listed buildings under  section 66 (1) of the Planning  (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because  it would not preserve the special architectural and historic interests of the listed  building,  Policy 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land On The North Side Of Lake Lane Liskeard Cornwall
Description: Resubmission of refusal PA16/09328 to allow for the re-plan and plot substitution of phase 7 of development site to allow for the erection of 45 dwellings and associated works (part of larger site that already benefits from approval 07/01820) with variation of condition 2 in respect of decision PA17/05618 dated 23.03.18
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed reconfiguration of the layout results in a cramped form of development which  appears  utilitarian in its form and is dominated by parking  and therefore fails to achieve a high quality design. It is therefore  considered that the proposed development is contrary to Policy and H9 of the Liskeard Neighbourhood Plan 2018  and Policy 12 of the CLP and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: The Wharf House Wharf Road Penzance TR18 2JY
Description: Listed Building Consent: Retention of Replacement Signage and Associated Lighting to Business Premises
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed signage and associated  lighting by reason of size, materials  and colours appear  as modern fixtures that detract from the historic and architectural  character of the listed building and undermine  the integrity and authenticity of the listed building. The proposal therefore fails to preserve  the character  and special interest of the listed building,  leading to less than substantial harm which would not be outweighed by any public benefit contrary to paragraph 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and in conlflict  with the Council's duty as a local planning authority to have special regard  to the desirability of preserving listed buildings under Section 16 (2) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas)  Act 1990, Policy 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2010-2030 and Section 16 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: The Wharf House Wharf Road Penzance TR18 2JY
Description: Advert Consent: Retention of Replacement Signage and Associated Lighting to Business Premises
RefusalReasons: The proposed signage and associated lighting  by reason of its size, materials  and colours appear as incongruous features that are inappropriate in the context of the shop frontage and character of the surrounding area. The proposal  therefore fails to preserve or enhance  the character  or appearance  of the Conservation Area, leading to harm to the visual amenities of the surrounding area which would  not be outweighed  by any public benefit. The proposed advertisements  are therefore  contrary to the Council's duty as a local planning authority to have special  regard to the desirability of preserving or enhancing the character or appearance of the Conservation Area under Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, policies 12 and 24 of the CLP and paragraphs 127, 132 and Section 16 of the NPPF 2019.

Address: 1 King Street Truro TR1 2RA
Description: Advertisement consent for changes to existing fascia signage and replacement of existing projecting sign with a new hanging sign in a different position
RefusalReasons: The proposed signage,  by reason of its inappropriate siting and materials  would  have an unacceptable and harmful  impact  on the visual  amenity of the area, including  the setting of Truro Conservation Area and the nearby Grade  1 Listed Cathedral. The proposal therefore fails to preserve  or enhance the character or appearance of the Conservation Area, leading to harm to the visual amenities of the surrounding area which would not be outweighed by any public benefit. The proposed advertisements are therefore contrary  to the Council's  duty as a local planning authority to have special regard to the desirability of preserving or enhancing the character or appearance of the Conservation Area and building's listed, under Section 72 (1) of the Planning  (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990, policies 12 and 24 of the CLP and paragraphs 127, 132, Section 16 of the NPPF 2019 and Policy C5 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan.

Address: Land Off Tregenna Fields Camborne Cornwall
Description: Full planning permission for 23 dwellings, including affordable housing, landscape, access and associated infrastructure.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed design  would result in a form of development that fails to reflect and respond  to the existing surrounding development due to the mix of house types, layout and density.  It would be out of character  due to the poor relationship between  the established dwellings and the new development resulting in an unacceptable  visual impact.  The site is not allocated for development and the Council  has a five year supply of housing  land.  As such there is no justification or need to develop the site.  It would therefore be contrary to Policies  1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, advice in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, paragraphs 124 and 127 and Policy 1 of the Cornwall Sites Allocation Development Plan Document.

Address: Land South Of Porthtowan Farm Chapel Meadow Porthtowan Cornwall TR4 8FB
Description: Erection of a 3 bed Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  result  in a cramped  form of development which  would be out of character with the surrounding  dwellings and be detrimental  to the visual amenity of the street scene contrary  to policies  1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Greenhill Stables Delaware Road Drakewalls Gunnislake Cornwall PL18 9AS
Description: Erection of a single dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is not considered 'infill' development  as defined in Policy 3 of the Local Plan, and is otherwise considered residential development in the 'open countryside' for which no special  justification has been provided  as specified in Policy  7 of the Local Plan, and is therefore considered unacceptable residential development in this landscape and historic  setting.  As such, this application fails to accord  with the provisions,  aims and intentions of Policies  3, 7, 1, 2, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 adopted November 2016 and the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019, with particular reference to Paragraphs 170, 189, 192, 7 and 8. 2 This application has not been accompanied by a Heritage Impact Assessment (HIA) or Heritage Statement  (HS) providing sufficient information to enable a proportionate assessment of the proposed development's  potential  impact(s) on the Outstanding Universal Value (OUV) of the Tamar Valley  World  Heritage Site (WHS). As such, the application fails to accord with the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies 24, 12, 3 and 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 adopted  November  2016 and the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019, with particular reference to Paragraphs 189, 192 and 8.

Address: Former Bus And Coach Depot Lansdown Road Bude Cornwall EX23 8BN
Description: Full Planning Permission and Conservation Area Consent for the demolition of existing buildings and the development of a 70 bed budget hotel, including bar and cafe, with associated car park and access works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its prominent corner plot position, scale, roof design, and the height, massing, and appearance of the Lansdown Road elevation,  results  in a contrived,  discordant and overbearing form of development out of character with the intrinsic  scale,  rhythm  and more pedestrian scale of properties along Lansdown  Road. The design fails to promote local distinctiveness and fails to conserve  or enhance the special character  of the Bude Conservation  Area.  As such, it is contrary to Policies 15 and 23 of the Bude-Stratton Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030 February 2016, Policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) and paras, 127, 192 and 200 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.   2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of an off-site financial contribution towards  the Bude Transport Strategy to mitigate highway impacts, the proposal is considered  to be contrary to guidance contained within Policies 27 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and paragraph,  54 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Land North Of 37 Boscoppa Road Boscoppa Road St Austell Cornwall PL25 3DS
Description: Erection of a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dormer bungalow by reason of its height and relationship to the neighbouring properties known as 23  Laura Drive and 37 Boscoppa Rd, would introduce significant built form onto the plot and have an overbearing impact  on these neighbours,  to the detriment  of neighbouring  properties and enjoyment of their amenity  areas.   The application  is, therefore, contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 3, 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Land West Of Glendaragh Silver Hill Perranwell Station Cornwall
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved for the Proposed development of a detached house (Site A) (Access, Layout and Scale only)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its layout, scale and access arrangements in close proximity  to 'Glendaragh' (a non-designated  heritage asset) would harm the setting and character of 'Glendaragh' contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraph 195 of the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019. 2 The proposed development, by reason of its layout, scale and access arrangements in close proximity  to 'Glendaragh' (a non-designated  heritage asset) would erode the predominately  rural character and appearance of this part of Silver Hill to its detriment by shoe horning a new dwelling between 'Glendaragh' and the adjacent western boundary in close proximity to the public  highway, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 3 The proposed development, by reason of its layout, scale and access arrangements and its siting in close proximity to well established protected  western boundary trees is likely to result in unacceptable levels of overshadowing to the future occupiers/users of the proposed dwelling  and associated garden and on going pressures to lop, top or fell the said trees. In addition, due to their stature the existing trees would  have an overbearing impact on the occupiers/users of the proposed  dwelling and their private external amenity space, contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 21 Goonown Road Goonown St Agnes TR5 0UX
Description: New house on land adjacent to 21 Goonown Lane St Agnes
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not considered to represent  infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy  3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 to 2030. The development  represents an undesirable  extension and intrusion  of the built form into a historic countryside  setting to the detriment  of the character  and appearance of the countryside and setting  of the Listed Buildings and World Heritage Site. The proposal  would therefore fail to preserve  the character and special interest of the listed buildings  and World Heritage Site, leading to harm  which would not be outweighed by any public benefit. In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  residential development in this context,  the proposal represents unjustified development  and would  be contrary to policies 2, 3, 7, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 130, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: 1/3 Fore Street Fowey Cornwall PL23 1AH
Description: Change of use from office premises to domestic and link to existing one bedroom flat to form a new two bedroom flat (existing restaurant at ground floor to remain)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  introduce a new residential  unit, including its access and egress, into Flood  Zone 3 and there are alternative sites with a lower level of flood risk which exist to provide for the single home proposed by this application.  The application,  therefore, would  result with an unacceptable risk to people  during the event of a flood and is contrary to Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  155, 157, 158, 159, 160, 161 and 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.  2 Insufficient information has been provided regarding the internal alterations,  including finishes and services, which  are likely to have a detrimental impact  on the building resulting in less than substantial harm to the Grade II listed building. No justification  as to the public benefit of the proposal or that all reasonable efforts have been made to mitigate the extent of the harm to the significance of the asset has been submitted  that would outweigh the less than substantial harm to the listed  building  from the internal  changes.  The proposal  is therefore  contrary to policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 184, 19, 193, 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 1/3 Fore Street Fowey Cornwall PL23 1AH
Description: Listed building consent change of use from office premises to domestic and link to existing one bed flat to form new 2 bed flat (existing restaurant at ground floor to remain)
RefusalReasons: 1 Insufficient information has been provided regarding the internal alterations,  including finishes and services, which  are likely to have a detrimental impact  resulting in less than substantial  harm to the Grade II listed building. No justification as to the public benefit of the proposal  or that all reasonable  efforts  have been made to mitigate the extent  of the harm to the significance  of the asset has been submitted  that would outweigh the less than substantial  harm to the listed building from the internal changes.  The proposal is therefore  contrary to Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030,  Policy 8 of the Fowey Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraphs 184, 19, 193, 196 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Main Beach North Coast Holiday Cottages New Portreath Road Redruth Cornwall TR16 4QL
Description: Use of holiday let as an unrestricted dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is located in an open countryside location where there is poor accessibility to services, facilities,  amenities,  and employment. In the absence  of any special  circumstances to justify allowing an unrestricted open market dwelling in this countryside  location,  the proposal does not represent sustainable development  and would be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  78 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 (NPPF).

Address: Land North East Of Trevarner Mill Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6HJ
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for proposed development of a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, divorced from any settlement. Residential  accommodation on this site would  have  poor accessibility  to necessary daily services  and facilities  which would perpetuate over reliance  on the private vehicle  and unsustainable traffic movements.  In  the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  residential development in this rural location,  the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2,3, 7, 9, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 91 102, 103, 110, 127, 148, 150 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 2 Manor Crescent Falmouth TR11 4LD
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for proposed one bedroom bungalow
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed construction  of an attached  dwelling  on this small sloping triangular shaped side garden  to 2 Manor Crescent,  is likely to result  in a discordant, incongruous and cramped  form of residential accommodation, in terms of providing designated parking  and private external  amenity areas  for the host and proposed  dwelling by introducing physical boundaries  on site, thus giving the site a cramped appearance, which would fail to respond  positively  to the local character or add to the overall  quality of the area. The development therefore fails to accord with the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy DG4 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030 and paragraphs 8, 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Glencoe Vean Goonearl Scorrier Redruth Cornwall TR16 5EB
Description: Retention of existing unit as a dwelling following completion of adjacent C3 dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The development  proposed results  in a new household  outside of any established  settlement, in an unsustainable,  inaccessible  location in the countryside, which would promote an associated over-reliance by occupiers on a private vehicle.  There are no identified special circumstances to outweigh  the harm caused from development in this context. The proposal  is therefore  contrary to policies 1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, policies 1 and 7 of the St Ages Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land And Buildings Adj Midway House Idless Truro Cornwall TR4 9QS
Description: The conversion of a redundant stable building to a single dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: 1 The building  is not appropriate  to retain and its conversion to residential use would not lead to an enhancement to its immediate setting. It is also in very close proximity to existing buildings on a working farm and as such any potential  future residents would be likely to be exposed to noises  and odours  detrimental to their health  and which could lead to complaints that would  be harmful to the successful operation of the farm. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable  development and is contrary  to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7, 16, 21, 23, and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 9, 78 and 79, 102, 103, 108 and 148 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trevidic Cottage Access To Hendra Lodge From Coombe Road Coombe St Austell PL26 7LG
Description: Use as unfettered dwellinghouse (without holiday condition)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of its countryside location detached from any definable settlement, would  represent an unsustainable dwelling in the countryside  for which no special  circumstances  have been demonstrated.  The proposed unfettered dwelling would have poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance  on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements.  Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable  development and is contrary  to Policies  1, 2, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs  8,79,103 and 110 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of Hillcrest Cottage Trenerth Road Leedstown Hayle Cornwall TR27 5ER
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use for use as class 3 dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the evidence submitted by the applicant and having regard to other information available to the local planning authority, it is not considered that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicant's onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the building referred to as 'Shed 1' on the aerial photograph dated 19/04/2015 on Land West of Hillcrest Cottage, Trenerth Road Leedstown, Hayle TR27 5ER (as shown within the area outlined in red on the 1:500 Block Plan ref :2303.01 and annotated 'dwelling') was substantially completed on the land in February 2014 and subsequently used for storage purposes, and that the conversion of 'Shed 1' to provide residential accommodation was completed in April 2015. This fails to accord with the provisions of section 171B (2) of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 in that the change of use of `Shed 1` to use as a single dwellinghouse has not been proven. Furthermore, it is apparent from the Council's own records that `Shed 1` lacked kitchen facilities in April 2019 and, therefore, did not have all the facilities reasonably required for day-to-day private domestic existence for the whole of the claimed residential period. On the basis of the evidence supplied, the Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be issued.

Address: Trevithick Shutta Road East Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 1HW
Description: Alterations to access ramp to house
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed removal of a section of retaining  wall and formation of steps would  facilitate the creation of a parking  space which  would be constrained in width and hard up against another  retaining wall, resulting  in parked vehicles  causing an obstruction to the highway known as Shutta Road.  The proposed steps would also result in pedestrians  having to step directly  out onto Shutta  Road without adequate visibility for approaching traffic. The proposal would therefore fail to ensure highway safety  for all or maintain effective traffic  circulation, contrary to policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). 2 The proposal would  fail to preserve or enhance the Looe Conservation Area through the loss of a section of retaining  wall which are important and distinctive features across the town that provide a positive contribution to the significance of the Conservation Area. Its loss, and the subsequent  presence of a parked car, would contribute to the incremental erosion  of the character of the Conservation Area. The proposal does not provide any public benefits  and therefore  fails to accord with paragraph 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, and policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Land Adj To 1 Higher Borad Lane Higher Broad Lane Illogan Redruth Cornwall TR15 3JL
Description: Erection of a dwelling, new vehicle access and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of it's form, siting  and the location and shape of the plot, does not respect  the established pattern,  form and layout of development in the locality, and does not promote continuity with the existing built form. Conversely, the development  will result in a discordant, incongruous and cramped form of residential accommodation,  which fails to respond positively to local character or add to the overall quality of the area. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North West Of 7 Tregrehan Mills Tregrehan Mills St Austell Cornwall PL25 3TL
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for proposed development of a single dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is located in the open countryside forming  part of a wider undeveloped landscape/rural area between  two parts of the settlement and the proposed  residential development would not constitute infill or rounding off of the settlement and does not meet the definition  of Previously Developed Land referred to in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.  The principle of a dwelling in this location is thereby  contrary to Policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 adopted 2016.

Address: Land To Rear Of 1 Grenville Road Truro Cornwall TR1 3TJ
Description: Demolition of garage and construction of self-build dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its form,  siting and the location of the plot, does not respect  the established pattern,  form and layout  of development in the locality,  and does not promote continuity  with the existing built form. Conversely, the development  will result in a discordant, incongruous and cramped form of residential  accommodation,  which fails to respond positively to local character or add to the overall  quality of the area. Furthermore,  the close proximity of the proposed unit to the adjacent  existing property to the south will result in overbearing and overshadowing impacts to the future occupiers of each unit. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, policies E4 and H1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Lower Scadgehill Stibb Bude Cornwall EX23 9HN
Description: Proposed agricultural building
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of a demonstrable essential business need for the proposed  building, the scheme represents unsustainable  development and visual harm within an exposed and predominantly verdant setting designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value, and adjacent to the Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty; contrary to policies 2, 5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, adopted  November  2016.

Address: Unit 3 & 4 Cambridge Barn New Portreath Road Redruth Cornwall TR16 4QL
Description: Reposition of approved extended dwellings known as Unit 3 & 4 Cambridge Barn (PA18/09260) and reposition of existing access track.
RefusalReasons: 1 The scheme by reason of its overall  visual  impact, is at odds with the characteristic rural setting. The scheme  does not respond to its landscape setting but result in a prominent  arrangement which would  overwrite established landscape features and detrimentally encroach  into an otherwise  natural,  sloping countryside setting. The proposal would therefore  be contrary  to Policy 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, Section 12, paragraph 127 and Section 15, paragraph 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the guidance  within  the Cornwall  Design Guide.

Address: The Barn Holwell Farm Stoke Climsland Callington Cornwall PL17 8NA
Description: Agricultural storage shed for housing tractor, ride on mowers and associated plant, will also be used for storing animal feed. The proposed building will not have any water, gas or electrical supplies
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed building and its large scale within  a small parcel of land is not considered to be reasonably  necessary for the purposes of agriculture as no trade or business currently exists that would  require a building  in this location;  contrary to Policies  2 and 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016. The introduction  of a 144sqm and 4m high building in this location would generate  a visual  intrusion  within  its Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty setting, where  great weight  is given to its conservation; contrary to Policy  23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted  November  2016.

Address: Land Adjacent To Glenside The Valley Carbis Bay St Ives Cornwall TR26 2QD
Description: Erection of a dwellinghouse with associated parking.
RefusalReasons: 1The proposal represents a cramped form of development which  if approved  would constitute  a discordant feature in the landscape that would  be harmful  to the character and visual amenities  of the area, it would, by virtue of its density be out of keeping with existing patterns  of built development in the locality and would not promote local distinctiveness.  The development would not effectively incorporate trees which make a significant contribution to the character of the landscape and would not provide  adequate provision of usable  external  amenity areas to the detriment of the amenities of future occupiers of the proposed development.  The proposal therefore conflicts with polices 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030),  with polices GD1, OS3 and BE12 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan (2015-2030)  and with paragraphs 127 and 130 of the NPPF (2019). 2 Notwithstanding the submitted details, it is considered that insufficient evidence has been provided  in regards  to surface  water disposal  to demonstrate that drainage of the development  site can be adequately  achieved without increasing flood risk elsewhere. In the absence  of this information the proposal  is considered contrary to the aims of policy 26 of the Cornwall  Local Plan (2010-2030) and paragraph  163 of the NPPF (2019).

Address: Land Adj To Piskey Laden Gwallon Lane Marazion TR17 0HJ
Description: Construction of Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The cramped siting  of the proposed dwelling in relation to other built and approved development, along  with the overall introduction of additional  built form in the semi-rural  setting would fail to respect  and enhance the quality of the location and would compromise the character of area, in conflict with policies 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 130 and 131 of the National Planning  policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At St Just St Just In Roseland Cornwall
Description: Engineering works to form new field access with associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The removal of a significant section  of the existing boundary hedgebank  adjoining the B3289  to form the new access and associated visibility  splay requirements, in combination with the substantial engineering  and excavation  works within the adjoining agricultural field to form the access track, would have a significant  suburbanising and harmful  impact  to the established  rural character of the area, causing harm  to the natural qualities and beauty of the rural setting and context  to the village of St Just in Roseland and the wider landscape which  lies within  the designated Cornwall  Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty.   The proposal therefore fails to accord  with policies  12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies LA1, LA2, CV1 and GP2 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030 and paragraphs  127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 together  with Policy MD9 of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Carnmenellis Hill Farm Calvadnack Carnmenellis Redruth Cornwall TR16 6PW
Description: Conversion of two barns to a single dwelling with linking extension and conversion of further barn to a detached annexe and associated works including the siting of temporary caravan during the build period.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would, through the residential use of the buildings  and subdivision  of the field to create domestic curtilage  together  with the associated paraphernalia, result in significant  change  to the character of the area and harm to this open and historic landscape. Consequently, the proposal  would  fail to enhance the immediate  setting and as such,  the special qualities and attributes of this historic  rural landscape would be harmed contrary to the aims of policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 79, 124, 127, 170, 192 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a suitable structural survey report, the Local Planning Authority is unable to ascertain  as to whether the existing  buildings are capable of re-use in accordance  with the aims of policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Store To The Rear Of 60 Edgcumbe Avenue Newquay Cornwall
Description: Conversion of store to a self-contained, one bedroom studio dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the lack of associated private amenity space and severely limited outlook, fails to secure a good standard  of amenity for existing and future  occupants. In contrast  it would result in the creation of a cramped and sub-standard form of accommodation that would be to the detriment of the quality of the living environment  experienced by future  occupants. As such, the proposal is considered  contrary to the aims and intentions of policies  12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Section 12 and in particular paragraph  127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: Public Car Park Mousehole TR19 6PR
Description: CCTV security and security lighting to existing public car park
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site can be viewed from several  public vantage points and due to the open character of the site, this proposed alien feature would be prominent and visually  intrusive. Notwithstanding the existing  CCTV security and security lighting, additional  CCTV security and security lighting  will add to clutter resulting in detrimental impacts  to the visual amenities of the area which are not outweighed by any public benefits. The proposed development conflicts with Section 72 (1) of the Planning  (Listed Buildings  and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management  Plan 2016-2021,  policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 170, 172 and Section 16 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South East Of The Dolphins The Parade Mousehole Penzance Cornwall TR19 6PT
Description: Outline Planning Approval (all matters reserved) for construction of a self build sustainable dwellinghouse and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 Any form of development of the site would  fail to reflect the density of the neighbouring-built form thereby representing  development which is unsympathetic to the local vernacular style.  The proposal  is therefore  not in keeping with the character of the surrounding area and any form of development within the application  site would be harmful to the visual amenties by reason  of its cramped and contrived form which  is not outweighed by public  benefits. The proposed development  conflicts with Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990, Policy  MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021, policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 170, 172 ,193,  194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Glynford Lezant Launceston Cornwall PL15 9NA
Description: Application for Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed use namely Installation of Solar Panels adjacent to house
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed siting of the solar panels is not considered to be within the curtilage of the dwellinghouse known as Glynford; the siting is within 5 of the boundary of the curtilage; it proposes more than one stand alone solar; and the surface area exceeds 9sqm; therefore planning permission is required.

Address: Lower Trewedna Farm Trewedna Lane Perranwell Station Truro Cornwall TR3 7PQ
Description: Conversion of barn to form dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would not result in the reuse of a suitably constructed disused rural building  which is considered appropriate to retain by reason of its rudimentary construction, and if converted, it would  not lead to an enhancement to the immediate  setting due to likely future  pressures from occupiers to fell, lop or top existing boundary oak trees covered by a Tree Preservation Order, and the introduction of domestic  paraphernalia within the open countryside and its increase  roof mass, contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 78, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of 66 Treverbyn Road St Ives TR26 1EY
Description: Construction of dwelling (resubmission of previously refused PA19/09490)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellinghouse  by reason  of its siting and relationship to the neighbouring properties would give rise to an overbearing impact  to the properties to the south east resulting in a significantly diminished unsatisfactory outlook for the occupiers of these  properties.   In addition,  there would  be significant overlooking  of the proposed rear garden to serve  the proposed dwelling from the existing property to the south west.   The proposal  represents  poor design in terms of layout, the poor relationship between neighbouring properties gives rise to a poor level of amenity and substandard living environment for all occupiers.  The proposal  therefore  fails to accord with policy  GD1 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan, policy 12 of Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 2 The modern  contemporary design of the proposed dwelling would be at odds with its surroundings and would neither relate to nor reflect the local context  in which it is situated.  The development would therefore  give rise to adverse harm  to the character and appearance of the area and would be in conflict with policies GD1 and BE10 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood  Development Plan (2015 - 2030),  policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 130 and 131 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Old Manse Access Track To Vounder Vean Jubilee Place Pendeen TR19 7SB
Description: Loft conversation with dormer
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dormer by virtue of design,  size and position  would  appear as a large and obtrusive addition to the roof of the property, which would  dominate the roof space appearing conspicuous  and excessive  in the Conservation  Area and World Heritage Site.  The proposed works  fail to have regard for the local vernacular or to reinforce local distinctiveness,  and the development is considered to be of a design that fails to take the opportunities  available for improving the character  and quality  of the area.  As such the proposal  would  fail to preserve the character of existing dwelling and the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The proposals would lead to less than substantial harm upon designated  heritage assets that have not been balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposed development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would  not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016); Sections 2.9, 7.3 and 7.7 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013, paragraphs  8, 127, 170, 172, 192, 193 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019, and the advice of the Cornwall Council Domestic Alterations  and Extensions Guide 2017 (pages 10 and 11).  The refusal of planning permission also accords with paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 due to poor design.

Address: Elsynge Worthy Hill Trebetherick Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6SG
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for existing development for conversion of garage to a bedroom
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the garage has been used as a bedroom for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: Ground Floor Flat The Loft The Valley Porthcurno Penzance Cornwall TR19 6JY
Description: Certificate of lawfulness proposed use: Existing garage to be integrated into dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed external works would result in a material change to the appearance of the building contrary to paragraph 55 (2) (a) (ii) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. The property is a flat that does not benefit from permitted development rights for this particular work. Therefore the proposed works are not lawful, and planning permission is required.

Address: Land Adjacent Burleigh Croft Silverwell Blackwater Cornwall
Description: Erection of 2 storey dwelling on former brownfield horticultural site
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly being  outside of any established settlement.  The proposal does not represent rounding off or infill under Policy  3 of the Cornwall  local Plan but, rather, would result  in the undesirable extension and intrusion of residential  development  into the countryside and that would  be prominent to the detriment to the distinctive natural beauty  and character of the surrounding  semi-rural countryside.  Given the lack of any special  justification, the application  is not sustainable development and is contrary  to policies 2, 3, 7, 12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 The proposal by reason of its scale, massing and excessive, unarticulated form, would fail to respond  positively to the local character and distinctiveness in this semi-rural location and as a result the proposal  is considered to constitute a poor quality form of development which would fail to conserve or enhance the area contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and with paragraphs 124, 127, 130 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Woodview Charaton Road Pensilva Cornwall
Description: Proposed conversion of redundant agricultural barn into dwelling (resubmission of PA19/07540)
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of any special justification, the proposal would create an unsustainable new dwelling  in the open countryside  in conflict  with the spatial strategy of the development  plan. In addition, such a 2-storey dwelling  through its introduction  into an attractive, predominantly undeveloped locality would  degrade the rural character of part of the Lynher Valley  Area of Great Landscape  Value. As such the development conflicts with Policies 2, 7, 21, 23 (1, 2 & 2(b)),  CL 8 & 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the advice  within  paragraphs 79 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Local 3 Baytree Hill Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4BE
Description: Variation of condition 2 of application no. PA18/05951 dated 23/08/18 (Listed Building Consent for change of use of first and second floor of existing A1 shop into two residential flats).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed internal alterations will result in the further loss of irreplaceable historic fabric that is important  to the significance of the building.   The loss of this historic fabric has not been justified in a clear and convincing manner and will result in less than substantial  harm to the significance  of the heritage asset that is not outweighed by the public benefits of the scheme.  The proposed  development is therefore  contrary  to part 16 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Sanderling Road From Upton Lodge To Sennen Cove Lifeboat Station Sennen Cove TR19 7DF
Description: Creation of balcony, bridge and rear extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed projecting balcony  on the north  elevation and the precedent it would set, by virtue of its design, siting  and use of materials would  appear prominent and inappropriate  in the setting, and would materially  reduce the visual quality of the streetscape.   The proposed works fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Area of Outstanding  Natural  Beauty.   The proposed works  raise design concerns that cause harm to the setting and that are not balanced by other  factors acting  in the public interest or benefit.  The proposal is therefore contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and 23 (paragraph 2a and 2b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November  2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10, 7.3 and 7.8 of the Cornwall  Design Guide  2013;  and paragraphs 124, 127, 128, 130, and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.  2 The use of the proposed balcony on the north elevation, due to its design and location, would result in an unacceptable increase in the intensity and immediacy of overlooking  in relation  to window and main entrance/staircase  of the upstairs flat situated above  Little Bo CafÃ© to the immediate west.    The proposed balcony would raise concerns  relating  to impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring  property that are not balanced  by other  factors acting in the public  interest.The proposal is considered contrary  to Policy 12 paragraph 2a of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016);  Section 2.6 (bullet  point 1); Section 4.1 (bullet  point 1) and Section 4.11 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall Design Guide  2013,  the advice of the Cornwall Council Domestic Alterations  and Extensions Guide 2012 (pg 12), and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Kilmartin Millendreath Looe Cornwall PL13 1NY
Description: Outline application (with all matters reserved) for construction of split level dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its constrained and cramped layout which lacks sufficient  parking  and external amenity  areas has failed  to demonstrate that a dwelling can be provided  on site. Overall this application represents a poor quality form of development which is contrary to policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and paragraph 5.5 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013.

Address: Land And Building South East Of Innis Lakes Innis Moor St Austell Cornwall PL26 8YH
Description: Conversion and extension to former stable building to residential dwelling. (Revised submission of withdrawn application no. PA19/05702).
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement.  The proposed  new dwelling,  including its associated domestic curtilage, would result  in harm to the intrinsic rural character  of the surrounding  area and introduce accommodation  onto a location  with poor accessibility to necessary daily services  and facilities which,  in turn, would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements.  The building proposed  for conversion  is not of suitable construction to provide  living accommodation without  substantial  new building works; the building is not considered to be worthy of retention and accordingly the proposal  fails to provide special justification to allow a new home  in the countryside.  Given  the lack of any special  justification, the application  is therefore  not sustainable development and is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Goonreeve Packing Shed Goonreeve St Gluvias TR10 9AY
Description: Conversion of building to three dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement.  The proposed  new dwellings, which  for all intent  and purposes  tantamount to the construction of three new contemporary  designed dwellings in the open countryside,  resulting in unacceptable harm to the intrinsic character  of the surrounding rural setting. The proposed new homes with poor accessibility to necessary daily services  and facilities would  perpetuate over reliance  on the private vehicle  and unsustainable  traffic movements.   Given  the lack of any special justification, the application  is not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 9, 78 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Jubilee House St Stephens Hill St Stephens Launceston Cornwall
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for Residential Development (minimum of 3 dwellings - maximum of 5 dwellings)
RefusalReasons: 1 The site comprises an undeveloped steeply sloping green finger of land which contributes positively to the character and appearance of this area which is partly designated as being within a  Conservation Area and partly within flood zone 3. The proposed  development would  not represent a suitable location for housing having regard to local and national policies, with particular regard  to the effect of the proposed  development on the character and appearance of the area. The proposed amount  of development  would  increase the built form and fail to preserve the appearance,character  and special interest of the Conservation  Area, leading to harm which would  not be outweighed by any overriding public benefit. In the absence of any special justification  to warrant  residential development in this context, the proposal is contrary  to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs  118 (b), 127, 170, 192 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land East OF Cuttivett Landrake Cornwall PL12 5AW
Description: Variation of conditions 2 and 3 of Decision PA19/03193 dated 19th July 2019 Demolition of existing property and construction of replacement dwelling, provision of garden amenity space and vehicular access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed reintroduction of an opening on the first floor (which was deleted from an earlier proposal), located in the south  elevation of the proposed dwelling through the provision of a Juliet balcony would result  in overlooking to an area of private and enclosed  land serving the adjacent  property, Trefula Noweth, which  would erode the privacy enjoyed by the occupants to the detriment of the neighbouring occupants'  well-being.  The proposal  therefore  results in an unneighbourly impact and fails to secure an appropriate  standard  of amenity,  contrary to policy 12.2a if the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016)  and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Morvah Cottage Portloe TR2 5PT
Description: Change of use of land from agricultural use to amenity land, ancillary to the use of Morvah Cottage together with associated landscaping. Retention of hedgerow opening and access track to form alternative vehicular access to Morvah Cottage.
RefusalReasons: 1 As a result of the change in use of the land, combined with the access,  track and associated domestic paraphernalia, the development would  have a significant suburbanising impact to the rural character of the area, causing harm to the natural qualities and beauty  of the setting, which is a designated  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The impact  will be particularly keenly felt from the adjacent public right of way, from where the access  point and track will be clearly visible, negatively  impacting upon the character and experience for members of the public using the public right of way. The proposal therefore fails to accord with policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, policies LA1 and LA2 of the Roseland  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030 and paragraphs  122, 127, 170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Rosevidney Barton Road Between Lane To Tregilliowe Farm And Gitchell Lane Rosevidney Crowlas TR20 9AZ
Description: Erection of four detached dwellings, two with integral garages and two with separate car ports
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed designs do not appear  to be justified by the existing buildings  in the immediate  area nor draw on themes  of agricultural buildings either in terms of building form or grouping.  There is nothing distinctive  about the design or layout which is typical  of the form of development  that could  be found in an urban or suburban location.  It would extend the built form beyond the existing yard area and result in a development that is not well designed for the location and area and increase the visual impact  of the development.  Overall  it is considered that the proposal would have unacceptable impact on the character  and appearance  of the area and is not well designed in its own right.  It would therefore be contrary to policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policy LUD7  of the Ludgvan Parish Neighbourhood Plan, advice in the National Planning Policy  Framework, paras  124, 127, 130 and 170 and Cornwall Design Guide 2013. 2 The proposed dwellings will because  of their siting and redevelopment  of the farmyard be within  the setting of the listed building.  The proposed houses would  replace the existing  agricultural which while substantial are appropriate in an agricultural context.   The proposed  houses will be more prominent and do not reflect the agricultural context  due to their size, siring and design and so would harm the setting of the listed building.   The public benefits  are slight and do not outweigh the harm.  The proposal will would  therefore  be contrary to the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 c.9 para 66, policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2016), policy  LUD7 of the Ludgvan  Parish Neighbour Plan and advice in the National  Planning Policy Framework, paras 11, 189, 190, 193 and 196.

Address: Land At Fish Strand Hill Fish Strand Hill Falmouth Cornwall TR11 3BD
Description: Purpose built student housing with a mixture of studio rooms/cluster rooms and town house rooms, associated amenities spaces and staff office (application PA16/10836 appeal decision APP/D0840/W/17/3177902) with variation of condition 5
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed variation of the restriction on occupancy  of the student apartments would result  in an unacceptable increase in disturbance  to the living conditions of existing residents as a result  of inadequate car parking  provision available for residents of the development outside term times.  Specifically in removing  the restriction on occupancy only to students  of the universities it would not provide the necessary  level of control  over residents' parking outside term times and would compound existing car parking problems  in the area to the detriment of the amenities  of local residents and businesses  contrary to policies 1, 16 and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan and paragraphs 8 and 9 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Meneghy Road From Merricott Farm To Wheal Rose Chilsworthy PL18 9PB
Description: Demolition of existing stone outbuilding and construction of new single dwelling with associated access and parking
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the settlement  of Chilsworthy and the proposed development  does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance  with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.  The development represents an undesirable  intrusion of residential development into the adjoining countryside  to the detriment  of the rural, undeveloped nature of the area which forms part of the Tamar  Valley  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposal would also erode the rural nature of this section of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape  World Heritage Site which has not been accompanied by an appropriate Heritage  Impact Assessment.   In the absence of any affordable  housing provision  or any other special circumstances to justify residential development in this context,  the proposal  does not represent sustainable development  and would be contrary to policies 1, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), the Tamar Valley  AONB Management  Plan 2019-2024 and the Cornwall and West Devon Mining  Landscape World Heritage Site Supplementary Planning Document May 2017 .

Address: Land Rear Of Grenville Gardens Grenville Gardens Troon Cornwall
Description: Outline planning (all matters reserved) for four dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is outside of the physical boundaries of the existing settlement of Troon and is therefore open countryside  as defined under  paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030. The site has a distinctly rural character and forms part of a larger field.  It also lies within  the Camborne and Redruth Mining  Districts  of the World Heritage Site with a number  of significant  features readily visible in the immediate  area.  The introduction of built development and day to day activity into this open highly visible area would extend the built up area into the open countryside  and would be harmful to the character and appearance of the countryside, the setting of Troon  and the WHS.  The proposal is contrary  to policies  2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 11, 124, 127, 170, 189, 193, 194 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019, and policy C7 of the World  Heritage Site Management  Plan 2013 - 2018.

Address: Land Adjacent To Castle Hill Road Lostwithiel PL22 0JW
Description: The proposal seeks to provide a well-considered four-bedroom home.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site proposed for residential development is located  in the open countryside and not on previously developed land, outside  of the designated Lostwithiel Neighbourhood Plan development  boundary  and within  the Area of Great  Landscape Value  where the principle of the proposed residential  development is not acceptable.  The  proposed  dwelling would  by reason of it siting  and design appear isolated  and discordant with the undeveloped valley side and be a visually intrusive feature unrelated to the character and appearance of the area.  The proposal would  cause harm to the landscape  features and characteristics of the Area of Great Landscape  Value and is not considered a suitable site for residential development.   The proposal would be contrary to policies;  Policy HH2 of the Lostwithiel Neighbourhood Plan 2019; and Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 adopted 2016 and Saved Policy  14 of the Restormel  Local Plan 2001. 2 The application fails to comply with the habitat  directives in that there is no overriding public interest  for the proposal and there would be a disturbance to foraging and commuting  bats.  The application  is therefore  contrary to policy 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 adopted  2016,  paragraphs 174 and 175 of the NPPF 2019,  the Conservation of Habitat and Species Regulations and Circular 06/2005.

Address: Land And Buildings At Barnfield Gweek Helston Cornwall TR12 6UB
Description: Conversion of existing outbuildings to form a residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the open countryside, divorced  from any settlement. The proposal results in significant  rebuilding of the subject  building as a result of the deterioration of existing fabric,  as well as an extension. The scheme would change the character and appearance of the modest  rural structures, introducing an urbanising  domestic form and associated paraphernalia which would be to the detriment  of the surrounding rural environment, and the setting  of the adjacent listed  heritage asset; also creating  a new home with poor accessibility to necessary  daily services and facilities, which would perpetuate over reliance  on the private  vehicle and unsustainable  traffic movements. Taking the above into account,  the application is not sustainable development  and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 7, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 79 and 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Gears Lane Goldsithney TR20 9LB
Description: Outline application permission (all matters reserved) for the construction of three self build dwellings for family members.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is outside of the physical boundaries of the existing settlement of Goldsithney and is therefore open countryside as defined  under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030.  The site has a distinctly rural character and forms part of a larger  field.  It also lies within the Tregonning and Gwinear Mining  Districts of the World Heritage  Site with a number of significant features readily  visible in the immediate area.  The introduction of built development and day to day activity  into this open highly visible area would  extend the built up area into the open countryside  and would be harmful to the character and appearance of the countryside, the setting of Goldsithney and the WHS. The proposal is contrary  to policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 11, 124, 127, 170, 189, 193, 194 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019, and policy C7 of the World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013 - 2018.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Fothergill Mount Whistle Road South Tehidy TR14 0ES
Description: Proposed New Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The introduction of a dwelling at this location is considered to result in a cramped form of development which has a detrimental impact  upon the low density character of the area and setting of the dwelling known as Fothergill.  The proposal is contrary  to policies  PH3 and PH4 of the Illogan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan and Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs  11, 12, 127, 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 6 Churchtown Road Gwithian TR27 5BX
Description: Construction of replacement dwelling following demolition of dwelling and detached chalet (resubmission of recently withdrawn application PA18/11470)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal will result  in the total demolition of a non-designated heritage asset which makes a positive contribution to the character, appearance and significance of the Gwithian  Conservation Area and the setting of the nearby grade II*listed  Church and would result in less than substantial harm to the identified heritage assets  which  is not outweighed  by public  benefits.   The reason  of flooding is not considered  to be sufficient justification for the loss of this undesignated heritage  asset as flood mitigation  methods could be put in place to overcome this. The proposal  therefore fails to accord  with policies 1, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030,  policy GGPP6 of the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016-2030, the aims and intentions of paragraphs 189, 192, 193, 194, 196 and 197 of the NPPF 2019 and Section 72 (1) of the Planning  (Listed Buildings  and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 2 The proposed replacement dwelling, by reason of its form,  height and design would fail to respect the setting of the nearby listed  buildings and would fail to either preserve or enhance the established character  of significance  of the Gwithian Conservation Area.  The proposed new design does not represent a positive contribution to local distinctiveness and creates harm by eroding the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.  It is therefore is contrary  to policies 1, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030,  policy GGPP6 of the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2016-2030, the aims and intentions  of paragraphs 8, 127, 189, 192, 193, 194, 196 and 197 of the NPPF 2019 and Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas)  Act 1990

Address: Land South East Of Evergreen Lodge Back Lane Canonstown Cornwall TR27 6NF
Description: Construction of 5 dwellings with garages on vacant field
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is a large,  undeveloped field situated in-between two, distinctive linear areas of development  in Canon's  Town, which, together  with further undeveloped/open land to the south-west  and north-east,  is considered to contribute positively  to the semi-rural character  and setting  of the settlement. The proposed  development could  not therefore  be considered to reasonably provide a symmetry or completion to this part of the settlement  in terms of infilling or rounding-off;  rather, it would  facilitate  incremental growth of the settlement into the open countryside,  to the detriment of its character and setting. The proposal  is therefore considered  to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030. 2 By reason of its splayed and suburban layout which is considered to be at odds with the distinctive linear  patterns of development  in the immediate and wider area in Canon's Town,  the proposal is considered  to fail to clearly consider the existing context, to promote local distinctiveness  and to provide continuity  with the existing built form. The proposal is therefore  considered to harm the character and setting of the settlement,  in conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Trehane Budock Water Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5BZ
Description: Change of use of summer house to holiday let.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the creation of a new holiday unit where occupiers are likely to be dependent upon the use of private transport and there is no substantive evidence to demonstrate that additional holiday accommodation in this particular location would provide support for facilities and services at the nearest settlement of Budock Water and contribute to tourism in the locality. The combination of the separation distance from Budock Water and its limited services and facilities by either an unsuitable narrow public right of way which is unsurfaced and unlit or the public highway, would not be attractive routes for either walkers or cyclists. As such the proposal would not represent accessible or sustainable rural tourism accommodation contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 23 Riverside Avenue Newquay TR7 1PN
Description: Proposed first floor extension, plus balconies to rear and front porch
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its size, design and prominent elevated position, which  would be visible from the South West Coast Path, would  have a detrimental impact upon the character and appearance  of the hillside and would be harmful to the character and visual amenities of the locale. The proposal would therefore conflict with Policies H1, H2, D2, G2, LE1 and LE4 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019 and Policy  12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.

Address: Baba Restaurant Promenade Penzance TR18 4NP
Description: Outline Application with all matters reserved for part-retention of existing restaurant and construction of coffee shop, cafe and bar on ground floor with holiday lets and owner's accommodation above.
RefusalReasons: 1 Insufficient information has been submitted with the application to fully assess the proposed  demolition and stability of the building.  In addition, it has not been demonstrated that there are wholly  exceptional circumstances justifying the partial demolition of the building.   Whilst the proposal would  provide some wider social and economic benefits,  these are not collectively sufficient  to outbalance the identified  less than substantial harm to the non-designated  heritage asset.  The proposal therefore does not comply  with policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  189 and 197 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The site lies within Flood  Zone 3 and the proposal relates to a  more vunerable use.  The application fails to demonstrate there are no other available  sites at a lower risk of flooding than the proposed site.  It has not been clearly  demonstrated that the requirements of the Sequential Test have been met.   The proposed development  conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 155, 158 and 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Broadmoor Farm Stoketon Cornwall
Description: Reserved matters application for Phase 1, which comprises: the construction of 430 dwellings, public open space, landscape planting, pedestrian, cycle and vehicular links, 2no. substations and associated infrastructure. (Details following outline application PA14/02447 dated 13.10.2017)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, principally by reason of:its cramped  and over-intensive layout; its car and parking-dominated nature;its insufficient  provision  of pedestrian/cycle routes away from cars;its failure to incorporate  existing green infrastructure assets;the failure of its housing  provision and distribution to be tenure neutral;the poor level of residential amenity, including lack of privacy,  that would be provided for some of the private gardens;its failure to respond  to local character, or to be otherwise locally distinctive;  the inadequacy of its approach to the issues of climate change  and biodiversity;and its harmful impact on the setting of a listed building  would  represent poor design and fail to create a successful,  well-integrated, sustainable, socially cohesive place.As such the proposal  conflicts with paragraph 1.15 and Policies 1, 2,12,16,23 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016,  and the advice  within:the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 (in particular paragraphs 91,92,102,104,106,108,110,118,127,170,175 and 192);The Cornwall  Design Guide 2013 (pp 21,23,43 and 44);The National Design Guide 2019 (pp3,15,20,24,25,27,35 and 36);and the Building Better  Building Beautiful Commission's report 'Living with Beauty' 2020 (pp32,45,46,106).

Address: Land South Of Nanstallon Sewage Treatment Works Nanstallon Bodmin Cornwall PL31 2QX
Description: Change of use (retrospective) from agricultural to residential, to include construction of a yurt on a raised platform.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement.  The proposed  change of use to residential  including the provision of a yurt would result in the erosion of the undeveloped  natural character of the landscape and lead to a form of residential  accommodation with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which  would  perpetuate over reliance on the private  vehicle  and unsustainable traffic  movements.   In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify residential  development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary  to Policies 1, 2,3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs  91 102, 103, 110, 127, 148, 150, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The proposal would  introduce new residential development onto Flood Zone 3b. The applicant has failed  to provide a comprehensive  site-specific  appropriate flood risk assessment  and it has not been demonstrated  that the development would be appropriately  flood resistant and resilient and safe for its lifetime neither has it been shown  that a safe access and escape route can be accommodated. Due to the known flood risks posed by the development  the proposal is contrary  to paragraphs 155, 163 and 164 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019,  paragraphs  30-32  of the Flood Risk and Coastal Change Planning Practice Guidance 2014 and Policy  26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Crenver Farm Drym Road Praze An Beeble Camborne Cornwall TR14 0PA
Description: Certificate of lawfulness existing use of land for siting of one residential caravan.
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the siting of a residential caravan, on land at Crenver Farm, Drym Road, Praze An Beeble, TR14 (as shown marked in yellow on the Site Location Plan received 4 June 2019) has been continuous for a period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application being received. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Beechwood Farm Pelean Cross Ponsanooth Truro Cornwall TR3 7JD
Description: Demolition of existing barn, removal of static home and construction of new house
