RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of any established  settlement  and does not represent infill or rounding off as defined  in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The development  therefore represents an undesirable form of development  in the open countryside  which would lead to visual harm  through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment and  Area of Great Landscape Value by reason  of the urban form of development and associated domestic paraphanalia  together with the significant loss of existing hedgerows to provide  a satisfactory visibilty splay.  In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  residential development  in this context,  the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary  to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 78, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Former Paradise Cove Hotel Alexandra Road Newquay TR7 3NA
Description: Development of 7 terraced houses on the site of the former Paradise Cove Hotel.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the loss of tourist accommodation, in the form of the holiday villa development  scheme that has been implemented, and undermine the contribution that the site with the implemented consent for holiday accommodation  would make to enhancing the stock of tourist accommodation and thereby  the contribution to the visitor economy,  contrary  to Policy E3 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019-2030,  Policies 1 and 2 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and Objectives 3 and 4 of the Community Network Area PP8 Newquay  and St Columb Community Network Area of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies Sections  2010-2030. 2 There is a reasonable likelihood that the application site and adjoining maritime cliffs forming part of a County Wildlife Site and Priority  Habitat support protected species, including European Protected Species, which would be harmed by this development (including by works  associated with relevant cliff stabilisation).  However, in the absence of robust information,  including sufficiently detailed and robust ecological evidence/surveys  with detailed ecological constraints, opportunities, information and plans, the impact of this development to the habitat and species cannot be fully understood  or taken into consideration.  When taking a precautionary  approach to safeguarding biodiversity, the potential  adverse impact of this proposal on protected species  and habitats  is therefore  unacceptable and contravenes  Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy HB1 of the Newquay  Neighbourhood Plan 2019-2030,  Paragraphs 174 and 175 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019, Circular 6/2005  and the Conservation  of Habitats  and Species  Regulations.

Address: Trefellyn Penelewey Feock Truro Cornwall TR3 6QU
Description: Application for tree works: works to trees subject to a tree preservation order (TPO) Application: felling of Turkey Oak tree (T1), proposed replant of a Sessile Oak within 2m of the existing Oak. Reduction to the south side of a Beech tree (T2)
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to T1 and T2, which are both of high amenity value, are not justified by the reasoning given in the application  due to a lack of evidence  or compelling justification to support the proposed works  to (T2) and loss of the tree (T1) and the consequent adverse impact on the visual amenity of the location.

Address: 21 Chirgwin Road Truro Cornwall TR1 1TS
Description: To fell Weeping Birch tree subject to TPO
RefusalReasons: The tree covered  by the Tree Preservation Order and the subject of this application provides a high level of amenity to the locality being visible  from the public highway.  It is considered that the damage to the drive is minimal and does not justify  removal of the tree. There is also insufficient evidence to show that the birch is directly causing the damage to the driveway.  The proposed works would therefore degrade this amenity contribution contrary  to Policies  1, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land South Of Trevorrick Cottage St Merryn Padstow Cornwall PL28 8PP
Description: Outline application (with all matters reserved) for small-scale rounding off of the hamlet of Trevorrick (up to 2 dwellings)
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  within the countryside, clearly  divorced from anysettlement.  The dwellings proposed by this application would  result in harm to theintrinsic character  and beauty of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural  Beautyand would  provide residential occupiers poor accessibility to necessary  daily services andfacilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainabletraffic movements.  In  the absence of any special circumstances to justify residentialdevelopment in this rural location,  the proposal is not sustainable development and iscontrary to Policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies2010-2030 and paragraphs 91 102, 103, 110, 127, 148, 150, 170 and 172 of theNational Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 11 Trewirgie Road Redruth TR15 2SX
Description: Proposal to fell Sycamore (T1);
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the tree is of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contributes to the character of the local landscape. It's health and life expectancy are sufficient to warrant  its long term retention. There is insufficient justification for the removal  of the tree and clear and convincing evidence to justify  its loss has not been submitted. Its removal  is therefore considered to result  in a detrimental impact upon the public amenity of the local landscape.

Address: Fairview Bicton Road St Ive PL14 5RF
Description: Conversion, partial rebuild and change of use of redundant outbuilding and building remains into residential dwelling and the erection of independent garage/store with covered parking.
RefusalReasons: The proposal is located within the open countryside where new dwellings are only permitted in special circumstances. The existing structure is not appropriate  to retain or suitably constructed to enable  its re-use without a significant level of structural work. There are no special circumstances to justify the dwelling, the site is therefore not a sustainable location  for new housing development and the development is contrary to development plan policy and would cause material  environmental  harm to the rural character and appearance  of an Area of Great Landscape Value, contrary to policies 1, 2, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 130, 170, and 172 in the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019 and saved Policy CL9 of the Caradon  Local Plan First Alteration 2007.

Address: Vine Cottage Road From Waterloo Plantation To Junction At Camelia Cottage Four Turnings Feock TR3 6QN
Description: Works to Trees namely - Oak T1 - removal of branch - Beech T2- 15% Crown thin - Oak T3- Fell - Oak T4 -Fell - Beech T5- Fell - Beech T6- Fell - Beech T7- Remove middle branch - Oak T8 - Fell - Oak T9- remove lower branch and reduce top branches by 2m - Oak T10- Fell - subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to trees T1 and T7 would not be in line with industry  best practice and the current British Standard.BS 3998 - Recommendations for Tree Work. The works would have a significant negative impact on the physiological and structural condition  of the trees, causing long term and lasting deterioration of tree vitality, thereby creating a lasting  negative impact to amenity and the local landscape characterThe proposed works to T3, T4 and T8 are not justified by the reasoning given in the application  due to a lack of evidence or compelling justification to support the loss of the tree.

Address: The Well Field Trewen Hill Trewen Launceston PL15 8QF
Description: Custom Build Detached Dwelling and Car Port (resubmission of withdrawn application PA20/03681)
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling is in a rural location not within  or adjacent to the definable  urban  form of the Trewen settlement. It does not infill, round off or use previously developed land immediately adjacent to a settlement and visually extends the built form into the open countryside further eroding the intrinsic character of the wider Area of Great Landscape Value  (AGLV). In the absence  of any special  circumstances  to justify it, the proposed dwelling  represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm,  the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November  2016)  and paragraphs 79 and 170(b) of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Chy-An-Lyn 12 Trevemper Road Newquay TR7 2HR
Description: Application for works to a tree subject to a tree preservation order - Felling of a Macracarpa (T1).
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed  works  are not justified by the reasoning given in the application  due to a lack of evidence  or compelling justification to support the loss of the tree.

Address: Bunnel Vean St Martin Helston Cornwall TR12 6DD
Description: Discharge of Section 106 agreement dated 7 July 1992 in respect of decision notice W2/91/00609/F
RefusalReasons: The local planning authority is satisfied  that the Planning Obligation will continue  to serve a useful planning purpose  because it ultimately  restricts  the occupation  of the development granted  planning permission as a low-cost  dwelling  in perpetuity  to qualifying persons with a local connection.  The Planning Obligation therefore continues to be necessary to make the development acceptable  in planning terms and the removal of the Obligation  would result in an unfettered open market property in an isolated rural location; contrary  to policies 3 and 7 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraph  79 in the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.  The Planning Obligation therefore accords with Government guidance set out in paragraphs 54 and 56 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and the Planning Practice Guidance.

Address: Penny Cottage Summer Lane Pelynt Looe Cornwall PL13 2LG
Description: New vehicle access to front garden (vehicle parking)
RefusalReasons: The proposed vehicular access  onto a Class B highway  would  be detrimental to highway  safety by reason  of the restricted visibility  available to drivers of vehicles emerging from the application  site, lack of visibility splay within the applicant's control and the lack of an on site turning space  resulting in a constrained parking bay that would  not provide safe and suitable access for all. The proposal is therefore  contrary  to Government  planning policy stated in Paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework  and Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted  November 2016).

Address: Trebarvah Woon Farm Trebarvah Woon Constantine TR11 5QJ
Description: Siting of mobile home within garden to provide a 1 bed holiday let (relocation of existing)
RefusalReasons: The proposal for the change  of use of land for the retention of a mobile home to be used as short term holiday  accommodation does not comprise sustainable development by reason of its rural location outside a settlement and thereby promoting a reliance on private transport for journeys to tourist venues and for everyday  essential services. Furthermore, the proposed ancillary  accommodation,  by reason  of its siting, is not well related to the principal dwelling being outside the established residential curtilage. The economic and social benefits of the proposal, do not outweigh the harm identified  above. The proposal is contrary  to policies  1, 3, 5, 7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph  79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Seaview Meadow Trenerth Road Leedstown Hayle Cornwall TR27 5ER
Description: Application for certificate of lawfulness for existing use as class C3 dwelling
RefusalReasons: Based on the evidence submitted by the applicant and having regard to other information available to the local planning authority, it is not considered that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicant's onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the building referred to as dwelling (as shown within the area outlined in red on the 1:500 Block Plan ref: 2303.01 and annotated 'dwelling) was substantially completed on the land in February 2014 and subsequently used for storage purposes and that the conversion/change of use of the building to provide residential accommodation was completed in April 2015. This fails to accord with the provisions of section 171B (2) of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 in that the change of use of shed 1 to use as a single dwellinghouse has not been proven. Furthermore, it is apparent from the Council's own records that shed 1 lacked kitchen facilities for a period of time and, therefore, did not have all the facilities reasonably required for day-to-day private domestic existence for the whole of the claimed residential period. On the basis of the evidence supplied, the Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be granted.

Address: Redundant Barn Adj To Greenbank Farm Tresowes Hill Ashton Helston Cornwall TR13 9SZ
Description: Conversion of timber agricultural barn to form dwelling & associated works
RefusalReasons: The development  proposed  will significantly alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of this timber clad, portal  frame barn that currently sits comfortably in its rural setting.  The building is not considered to be a suitably  constructed redundant  rural building that would  be considered appropriate to retain and its conversion to residential  use would clearly not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting on a site that is widely visible  from the adjacent  public  highway.  The provision of openings, glazing,  other alterations  and access works  will fundamentally  alter the perception of the building such that it will be recognised as an incongruous  residential form that will harm the strong rural characteristics of this Area of Great Landscape Value  (AGLV).   Given  the inappropriate and unsustainable  form of new housing development in the countryside, the proposed development would  raise direct conflict with policies 2, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 103, 124, 127, 130 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Sunray Palm Gannel Road Newquay TR7 2AG
Description: Works to tree namely - Monterey Cypress(T5) Fell - subjecto to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed  works  are not justified by the reasoning given in the application  due to a lack of evidence  or compelling justification to support the loss of the tree, which would  result  in a loss of public  amenity.

Address: Land Rear Of The Cuddy Polhorman Lane Mullion Helston Cornwall TR12 7JD
Description: Outline application for a dwelling with all matters reserved except access
RefusalReasons: By reason of the restricted size and access  to the plot, the proposal will represent a cramped, contrived form of development  that will result  in substandard living conditions for existing and future residents.   Increasing  building  density in the manner set out, along with the removal  of the roadside boundary hedge, will result in development that is harmful to the characteristic pattern  and layout of development and street  scene in this established residential  area.  The proposal  is therefore  contrary  to policies  2, 12 and 21 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 127 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 31 Mayfield Close St Austell PL25 3PD
Description: Works to tree namely - Oak tree branches to be trimmed back to previous pruning - 60% crown reduction subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: The proposed works are excessive   for the management of this tree which is protected by a Tree Preservation  Order, and would fail to accord with good arboricultural practice  as specified by BS 3998 - Recommendations  for Tree Work. As such it would damage the pubic amenity provided by this  tree, and would be of harm  to this suburban street scene.

Address: 7 Trenance Avenue Newquay TR7 2HH
Description: Addition of first floor accommodation to create an additional bedroom, bathroom and living space (re-submission of withdrawn application PA20/01133)
RefusalReasons: By reason of its excessive  scale, discordant  architectural form and unbalancing  of the symmetry experienced along this portion of Trenance Avenue, the proposal  is incongruous in relation to the host property and causes  unacceptable harm to the character and appearance  of the wider street scene. The development  fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 2, and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, policies D1(2.), D2, H1 and G2 of the Newquay  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030, paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Opposite Tredavas Penpont St Breward Bodmin Cornwall PL30 4QN
Description: Outline application (with all matters reserved) for a proposed new dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location, does not represent infill, or rounding off or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement of Penpont and would  instead visually extend  built form into the countryside, representing incremental development  that would  erode the character and appearance of the rural setting in this Area of Great  Landscape Value.  In the absence  of any special  circumstances  to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable  and sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence  of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November  2016)  and saved Policy ENV01 of the North Cornwall Local Plan 1999.

Address: Former Morvah Cottage Portloe Truro Cornwall TR2 5PT
Description: Erection of stables and hardstanding together with the retention of a temporary permitted field access and track
RefusalReasons: The combined impacts of the retention of the access, the access track and proposed stables would not conserver or enhance the character of the area which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, and the benefits of the scheme are not conside red to outweigh this adverse impact to which great weight should be given and which is perceived from public vantage points.  Therefore the development is considered to be contrary to policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010  - 2030, policies LA1, LA2 GP2 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030 and paragraphs 122, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Parc Mears Field Mawgan Helston Cornwall
Description: Proposed Residential Dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling will be located  in the countryside outside  of the built form of the village of Mawgan and the contemporary  characteristics of the property alongside the raised platform, extensively glazed sections, balcony enclosures and overall domestic  use of the site will represent a conspicuous  and incongruous addition to the local landscape, which displays  a strong rural character.  The site is clearly visible from the adjacent rural highway  whereby  additional  built form will result in appreciable harm  from a public perspective.  Consequently, the proposal  does not address the AONB's sensitivity and character in this location and will not conserve or enhance this nationally  important designation;  thus, the development  is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, policy 1 in the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019, policy  MD9 in the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016 -2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 170 and 172 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land To The South West Of Lyndale Guest House Greenbank Meneage Road Helston Cornwall TR13 8JA
Description: Proposed dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: The confined nature of the site is such that the development would  appear cramped, poorly integrated with existing patterns of development and would have an adverse effect  on the setting and amenity  of the area. It would  also provide a poor standard of amenity  for future residents of the building.  The proposal thus fails to accord with policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 which  indicate that it is considered proper to ensure that development  will function well and add to the overall quality of an area; that it should  be sympathetic to local character  and history.

Address: Land West Of Shears Cottage Woodford Bude Cornwall EX23 9JD
Description: Outline application (with some matters reserved) for a new dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location beyond the clearly  defined urban form of the settlement, the intrinsic, open rural character and appearance of the site and with limited physical barriers (other than hedgerows  and hedgebanks repeated beyond this site) to its south  and west, does not round off or infill the settlement. It visually extends  the built form into the countryside eroding the character and appearance of this part of the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  (AONB). In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify it, the proposed  dwelling represents an unsustainable  and sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence  of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (2a) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraphs 79, 170(b) and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Hoopers Hill Wayfield Road Mylor Churchtown TR11 5UE
Description: Proposed Parking and Turning Area Via New Vehicular Access
RefusalReasons: The proposed access would  result  in significant visual harm to the character of area which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty and harm must be given great weight.  Notwithstanding any potential improvements to highways  safety  by the creation of the new access, it is not considered to be outweighed by this harm to the natural qualities of the setting and the loss of a protected tree. The proposal  is considered contrary to Policies  2 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030, paragraphs  124 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land Adjacent To Knot Shore Restronguet Hill Mylor Bridge Cornwall TR11 5ST
Description: Proposed single dwelling and garage.
RefusalReasons: The application  involves the construction of a new dwelling in the countryside, detached from any definable settlement containing  the necessary facilities required to support day-to-day occupation, which  would encourage the use of a private motor vehicle, contrary to environment aspects of the presumption in favour  of sustainable development. New housing development in this location is not supported by Policies 3, 7 or 21 of the Local Plan. The proposal incurs significant visual harm to the immediate setting and surrounding natural  environment from the extension of the existing linear pattern of development  into the open countryside and new access, which is detrimental  to the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty. Notwithstanding the modest associated economic and ecological benefits of this single unit, they do not outweigh the unsustainable location and harm to the natural qualities of the setting. The proposal is considered contrary to Policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 122,127,170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Hill Park Egloskerry Launceston Cornwall PL15 8RY
Description: Outline planning with all Matters Reserved for erection of a log cabin for holiday use
RefusalReasons: The proposed self-contained holiday unit, by reason of its countryside location which does not infill, round off or use previously developed land or meet the tests for housing in the countryside and which is separated from nearby services, facilities and amenities, would represent unsustainable development for which no special justification or overriding locational or business need has been demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic form of development . The development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Garage Adj 75 The Ropewalk Penzance Cornwall TR18 4QH
Description: Demolition of existing garage and construction of new dwelling with alterations to existing on site parking
RefusalReasons: The proposal,  by reason  of its narrow plot size, shape  and density would  result in a cramped form of development out of character with the neighbouring  pattern  of development found within  the immediate  area. Given  the above, the proposal  is considered to be contrary to policies  1, 2, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragaraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: Land South Of Castle View Sandy Lane Redruth Cornwall TR16 5SS
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for the erection of two 3 storey detached dwellings inclusive of change of use of land to residential.
RefusalReasons: The site is beyond the existing limits of Redruth, and Sandy Lane acts as a clear barrier containing the town to the west. It is not an allocated site within the Cornwall  Site Allocations Development Plan Development (DPD),  and the proposal  would  not represent a windfall  site under  the premise of rounding off or infill. The proposal due to its location would give rise to the encroachment of residential development into the countryside which surrounds the town of Redruth thereby failing to respect  the intrinsic  character and beauty of the countryside that forms part of the Carn Marth Area of Great Landscape Value (AGLV).  For these reasons the proposal fails to accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: St Michaels Cottage Gonvena Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6DP
Description: Beech tree 894 - Fell due to continued fruiting of Honey Fungus
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed  works  are not justified by the reasoning given in the application  due to a lack of evidence  or compelling justification to support the loss of the tree.

Address: Land West Of Marsden Farm Marsden Farm Treloyan St Keverne Helston Cornwall TR12 6QP
Description: Construction of Agricultural Livestock Building / Barn
RefusalReasons: In the absence  of sufficient  supporting information,  it has not been demonstrated there is an agricultural need for such a building  of this design in this location that would be reasonably necessary for the purposes of agriculture. As a result, the building would have an adverse visual impact  on the rural appearance of the area and fail to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty (AONB) in this location.  The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 5, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 83, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and policy  MD9 in the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management  Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 3 The Elms Perranuthnoe TR20 9NA
Description: Reconstruction of farmhouse to form three flats (decision 1/74/800) with removal of condition 3
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  result  in the loss of a smaller  scale dwelling within the village that is valuable to the local community  when ensuring that the needs of groups with specific  housing requirements in Perranuthnoe Parish and that the size, type and tenure of housing  needed for different  groups are addressed. There is already a surplus  of holiday accommodation in the immediate area which can continue to fulfil the demand that is present and the loss of housing stock would not be outweighed  by the modest economic contributions a further holiday  let may bring. The proposal would therefore  conflict with paragraphs 59 and 61 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Chy-An-Godolghyn Lane To Burra Burra Farm Three Burrows Blackwater TR4 8HU
Description: Erection of a dwelling, and the formation of a new access and hardstanding
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling would be in a rural location away from any settlement and would  therefore result in sporadic development in the countryside  resulting in erosion of the rural character of the area and create a development that would  be reliant upon the private car to access services and facilities due to the distance from, and quality of the routes to, alternative  modes of transport.  The proposed  dwelling  is therefore  not be sustainably located and thus conflicts with Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 21, 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and policies E1 and E4 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Land East Of 1 Godolphin Court Godolphin Court Godolphin Bridge Townshend Cornwall TR27 6AR
Description: Construction of one residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development raises direct conflict with the requirements  of adopted policy  in the Cornwall Local Plan as the site is clearly  located in the open countryside where new homes will only be permitted  where there are special circumstances, none of which have been identified in this particular  case.  The proposed development would clearly  erode  the rural character of this location by introducing further built development  that would  result in material harm to the character and appearance of the countryside on a site that is highly visible from the adjoining public  highway.  The site is not a sustainable or accessible location for a new dwelling and the development would  therefore  be contrary to development plan policy and cause material  environmental harm to the rural character of the area, contrary  to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, policy 1 in the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019 and paragraphs 79, 108, 110, 127 and 170 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trewedna Tarrandean Lane Perranwell Station Truro Cornwall TR3 7NP
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of land as a garden
RefusalReasons: Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the use of garden (as shown outlined in red on the Site Location Plan received 05.08.2020) in connection with private dwelling house at known as Trewedna has been continuous for a period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application being received. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Land Rear Of Number 4 Trelawney Avenue Treskerby Redruth Cornwall TR15 1RH
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for the erection of a dwelling
RefusalReasons: The erection of an additional dwelling in the rear garden of no. 4 Trelawney Avenue, irrespective of its design, scale and layout, would  lead to a cramped form of development that would fail to provide continuity with the prevailing character of the existing built form.  The development would  appear overly intense and at odds with the immediate surroundings, failing  to promote local distinctiveness  and leading to unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the area. Although there has been a similar type of back land development in close proximity to the development  site, this does not provide justification for the development proposed, ultimately  intensifying  the identified landscape  harm. The proposal is therefore in conflict  with policies  1, 2, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Penolva Bungalow Mousehole Lane Mousehole TR19 6TX
Description: Extensions, Alterations and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension, due to its design, massing  and location,  would  appear overly-domineering and inappropriate  in the context of the surrounding  built and natural environment, and at odds with the local vernacular of the rural Medieval settlement within which it is located, which lies immediately adjacent  to an Area of Outstanding  Natural BeautyThe proposed works raise concerns  in relation to design and the natural and historic environment that cause harm,  and that are not balanced by other factors acting  in the public interest or benefit.The proposal  is therefore contrary  to Policies 1, 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), 23 (paragraph 1 and 2) and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Policy MD9, MD16 and SCW8.04  of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management Plan 2016 - 2021, Sections  1, 2.6, 2.9, 4.9, 7.3, 7.6-7.9 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013, and paragraphs 124, 127-128, 130, 170, 172, 184 and 192(c) of the National  Planning Policy Framework  (2019).

Address: 5 River Terrace River Street Mevagissey St Austell Cornwall PL26 6UG
Description: Planning permission for the removal of existing rear pitched roof and creation of flat roof area created intended for use as a balcony with new access French doors from Bed 1. flat roof area to be lined with black galvanised steel railings with timber handrail.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would result in an overtly  modern addition which would  erode the historic character of the property and wider roofscape.  The proposal does not provide any public benefits and therefore fails to accord  with the aims and intentions of  policies  2, 12 and 24 of the  Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), policies D1, D5 ad HC1 of the Mevagissey   Parish  Neighbourhood Development  plan 2017 and paragraphs 127, 184, 190, 192, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: 6 Fenwick Road Falmouth TR11 4DR
Description: Works to tree namely - Fell Poplar - subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the tree protected by a Tree Preservation Order is of significant amenity  value in the local landscape and contributes to the character of the local landscape and Conservation Area. There is insufficient justification for the removal of the tree and clear and convincing evidence to justify its loss has not been submitted. Its removal is therefore considered to result in a detrimental impact  upon the amenity and character of the local landscape and Conservation Area.

Address: Star Inn 1 Church Street St Erth TR27 6HP
Description: Proposed erection of two semi-detached dwellings and associated landscaping and tree planting, boundary treatments, drainage and ground works, and re-configuration of existing Public House car park (revised siting) with variation of condition 2 in relation to decision notice PA18/12087
RefusalReasons: 1 It is considered that the use of render clad blockwork and brick quoins and lintels would not reflect the vernacular in the existing  built form, it would not promote local distinctiveness nor preserve  or enhance the character or appearance of the designated Conservation  Area in which the site lies, it would  not provide any tangible public benefits and would fail to preserve the setting  of the grade II listed Star Inn. The applicant  has not submitted a Heritage Impact Assessment with this application or provided any clear or convincing justification for the proposed changes and the proposal as such fails to accord with policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030), with polices HI1 and HT3 of the St Erth Neighbourhood Plan, with paragraphs 127, 130, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the NPPF (2019) and with sections  66 (1) and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed  Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Trenance Round Ring Penryn TR10 9LA
Description: G1 Hedge row Elm trees - height reduction by 10% to a height of 10m
RefusalReasons: The proposed works are refused as they do not accord with good arboricultural practice or BS3998 and will be detrimental to public amenity  value. Thus, the works fail to accord with Policy  23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Quarry Penwerris Lane Falmouth Cornwall
Description: The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Coronavirus) (England) (Amendment) Order 2020 for Temporary extension of working hours (Request for temporary working hours Monday to Saturday 07.30hrs - 20.00 hrs in respect of decision notice PA17/01167 for the demolition of the existing workshops and replacement with student accommodation scheme with associated facilities and infrastructure).
RefusalReasons: 1 The site lies within a densely populated area and retirement care housing known as Denyer Court is located at the closest point approximately 10 metres to the North West of the site. It is noted from the submitted objection letters that there are existing complaints regarding noise and the hours of operation which appear to be prior to 7:30am and after 8pm at night. The application has not demonstrated sympathetic site management and it is considered the proposal is likely to have a significant impact on the residential amenity of neighbouring occupiers

Address: Ganges Freathy Cliff Military Road Torpoint Cornwall PL10 1JT
Description: Build a small porch onto chalet
RefusalReasons: The proposed development consisting  of an extension to the existing chalet  will have a resultant floor area exceeding  that stipulated  in Saved Whitsand Bay Chalet Policy W1 of the Caradon Local Plan first alteration  2007.  The proposal  would, by reason of its size, siting and design be harmful  to the character of the locality being  an Area of Great  Landscape Value  and is therefore contrary  to the Councils Approved Guidelines  for Development Control of the Whitsand Bay Chalets 2001, Saved Policies W1 and CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan 2007 and Policy  23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land Adj To Parc An West Red Lane Rosudgeon Penzance Cornwall TR20 9PU
Description: Erection of a Dwelling and New Vehicular Access
RefusalReasons: The proposal,  by reason  of its narrow plot size, shape  and density would  result in a cramped form of development out of character with the neighbouring  pattern  of development found within  the immediate  area. Furthermore the removal  of large sections of hedge  and mature trees to facilitate the development is considered to cause further adverse visual  impact on the character  of the area. Given the above,  the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragaraphs  8, 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: 2 East Bridge Chacewater Truro Cornwall TR4 8PX
Description: New drop curb access and parking area
RefusalReasons: The use of the proposed vehicular access  onto a busy highway  would be detrimental  to highway safety by virtue of the restricted visibility available to drivers of vehicles  emerging from the application site and the lack of an on site turning space enabling the vehicle to enter and leave the site in a forward gear.  The proposal is therefore contrary to Government planning policy stated  in Paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  and  Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 1 Sparnon Gate Cottages Old Portreath Road Bridge Redruth Cornwall TR16 4JB
Description: Retrospective planning for the change of use of part of garage to residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1.The application site is located  in the countryside and the proposal  involves the conversion of an existing garage. The proposed development does not meet any of the special  circumstances  set out in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030. The site is detached from settlements and for most occupants of the proposed  dwelling, in all likelihood, it would  not be convenient to walk or cycle on a regular basis to access the services and facilities.  As a consequence, future  residents would be largely dependent  on the private  vehicle. In this way, this site, in its countryside  location away from a village or town, would not meet with the approach in the National Planning Policy Framework  (2019) that to promote  sustainable development in rural areas,  housing should be located where it will enhance or maintain  the vitality of rural communities, as set out in paragraph 78. The proposal would result in a new unfettered dwelling  in the countryside representing sporadic  and unjustified development thereby  conflicting with the aims and intentions of Policies  1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: 141 Boslowick Road Falmouth TR11 4PY
Description: Retrospective application for single storey extension to dwelling with cladding
RefusalReasons: The existing development has an adverse impact on the streetscene  due to the use of the cladding material  and is therefore contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policy  DG2 of the emerging Falmouth  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030.

Address: Additional Plot Adj To 46 Gurnick Road Newlyn Cornwall TR18 5DG
Description: Application for Approval of reserved matters in relation to decision notice PA17/11908: appearance, landscaping, layout and scale (Plot 50)
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its siting  on raised land in close proximity to the distinctly  rural Tredavoe Lane on considerably lower ground  to the east, coupled with its design which would present  a two-storey built mass of some 11.9 metres to the highway, it is considered that the proposed dwelling would  be of an inappropriate scale, height and mass which  fails to demonstrate a clear understanding  and response to its landscape and townscape  setting. Furthermore, the impact  is not considered to be capable  of being adequately mitigated  by enhanced boundary planting. The proposal is therefore considered to represent poor quality design which unacceptably  harms the rural character and amenity of Tredavoe Lane at this point, and to conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trefusis Agar Road Truro Cornwall TR1 1JU
Description: Works to trees namely - T1 Sycamore fell to ground level - subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: The loss of the Sycamore tree would harm public amenity  value and the character of the surrounding Truro Conservation Area.  It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed  felling of the tree is not justified  by the reasoning  given  in the application,  no arboricultural  evidence  or justification has been provided  to support the loss of the tree, when alternative work could be carried out to improve the relationship  of the tree to the surrounding properties.

Address: Treza Farm Porthleven Helston Cornwall TR13 9LE
Description: Proposed development of 2 bungalows and construction of secondary means of access.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development raises direct conflict with the requirements  of adopted policy  in the Cornwall Local Plan as the site is clearly located in the countryside  where new homes will only be permitted where there are special circumstances, none of which  have been identified in this particular case. The proposed development would  erode the rural character of this location by introducing further built development onto greenfield  land that would  result  in material harm to the character  and appearance of the countryside.   Moreover, the site is not a sustainable or accessible location for new dwellings and the development would therefore be contrary to development plan policy in relation to the location of new housing development and cause material environmental harm to the rural character of the area; contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 79, 108, 110 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy  1 within  the Cornwall site allocations development plan document.

Address: Land East Of The Firs Forge Mawla Redruth Cornwall TR16 4BS
Description: Proposed siting of log cabin style mobile home for temporary residential use
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposal  is for an unfettered residential use in the countryside. The offer for a temporary use does not negate the fact that the development still constitutes unjustified residential  development  in the open countryside. The proposed development does not meet any of the special circumstances set out in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 78 and 79 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework (2019). The introduction of unjustified  residential development  in the open countryside  would  alter the character  and appearance of the site through the residential  use and associated domestic paraphernalia. This would  fail to respect the intrinsic undeveloped character  and beauty of the countryside. This would conflict with the aims and intentions of Policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework  (2019).

Address: Trebarvah Woon Farm Trebarvah Woon Constantine TR11 5QJ
Description: Change of use of land for the retention of a mobile home used for short term holiday lets and ancillary accommodation to Trebarvah Woon Farm and construction of associated raised timber decked area
RefusalReasons: The proposal for the change  of use of land for the retention of a mobile home to be used as short term holiday  accommodation does not comprise sustainable development by reason of its rural location outside a settlement and thereby promoting a reliance on private transport for journeys to tourist venues and for everyday  essential services. Furthermore, the proposed ancillary  accommodation,  by reason  of its siting, is not well related to the principal dwelling being outside the established residential curtilage. The proposal would  result in diminishment of the natural environment, particularly observed by users of the adjacent Public Right of Way, in conflict  with the aims of Policies 2(1),12 and 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies, which seek to sustain local distinctiveness and character, and protect and where possible enhance Cornwall's  natural environment.The economic and social benefits of the proposal, together  with the proposed cladding, would not outweigh  the harm to the rural environment.  The proposal is contrary  to policies 1, 3, 5, 7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030  and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Garfields Rescue Dowha Fields Troon Camborne Cornwall TR14 9JG
Description: Retrospective permission for change of use of the land for stationing of residential caravan, 2no. sheds for domestic storage, timber clad animal enclosure, and proposed agricultural shed
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed  development would result  in unjustified  residential  accommodation in the countryside. The proposal does not meet any of special  circumstances  set out in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. The residential use of the caravan,  associated structures for domestic use, and domestic paraphernalia would alter the appearance  of the agricultural land. The change in character is considered to be harmful to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside which falls within an Area of Great Landscape Value (AGLV). The need for the proposed agricultural building  has not been justified. The harm to the character and appearance  of the countryside conflicts  with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Planning Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 79, 127 and 170 of the National Policy Planning Framework 2019.

Address: Former Workshop North Of 56 Pentire Avenue Pentire Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 1PE
Description: Convert and extend garage building into a holiday let (re-submission of refused application no. PA19/07158)
RefusalReasons: The proposal,  by reason  of an overbearing  effect upon the rear bedroom and living room windows of 53 Surf View, due to the close physical proximity of the two properties,  would be unduly harmful to the residential  amenities of the occupiers of this neighbouring residence. As such, the proposal is considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010-2030  - adopted November 2016 and Section 12, particularly paragraph 127, of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Bartles Industrial Estate North Street Redruth Cornwall TR15 1FN
Description: Construction of New Dwelling & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed development would introduce a new dwelling  forward  of the established historic building  line created  by Hambly's Row (i.e. 27 - 36 North  Street). This would  be at odds with the established  character of the North Street thereby failing to respect the historical  form and development of the area. The proposed dwelling  would appear  as an incongruous feature within the streetscene thereby having  a detrimental impact on the setting of the character  and appearance of the adjacent World Heritage Site.  The proposed  development fails to preserve or enhance the setting of the adjacent World Heritage Site and does not make a positive contribution to the local character  and distinctiveness.  The harm as a result of the proposed  development is less than substantial to the significance of the World Heritage  Site and the public benefits of the scheme do not outweigh  the identified harm as set out in paragraph  196 of the NPPF (2019). The proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, Policy  P3 of the Cornwall  and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013 - 2018, and paragraphs 184, 192 and 196 of the NPPF (2019)2.The proposed development, by reason of, its siting and subsequent 10 metre  separation distance window to window would  result in overlooking and a loss of privacy for existing  occupiers  of Nos. 1 and 2 Templars Terrace  and the future occupiers of the proposed dwelling. Furthermore,  the amenity space for the proposed dwelling  would be overlooked  by the existing development  at No. 1 Templars Terrace. The development  would fail to ensure a high standard for amenity for existing and future  occupiers thereby  conflicting  with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraph 127 of the NPPF 2019.

Address: 8 Maer Down Road Flexbury Bude EX23 8NG
Description: Extension to part of the roof to provide additional residential accommodation for apartment 8, reconfiguration of the layout of the apartment and associated facade alterations
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of the increased height to four storeys on the lower, southeast end of the existing development fails to respond postively  to the prevailing height  and scale of development in the street  scene and to the topography with neighbouring development which steps down Maer Down Road. As such, it results  in an overbearing, prominent  and discordant element in the street scene contrary to Policy  12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), paragraphs 2.6 and 4.9 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013 and section I1 of the National Design Guide - Planning practice guidance for beautiful, enduring and successful places (2019).

Address: 8 Chapel Hill Ponsanooth TR3 7ET
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed demolition of existing ground floor bathroom and addition of enlarged ground floor entrance/utility/bathroom.
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension to the dwelling would fail to comply within permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A.2 (e) (i) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). This is because the proposed development is sited on the principal elevation. As such planning permission is required.

Address: Tocopilla Cottage King Charles Quay Falmouth TR11 3HQ
Description: Creation of 2nd floor with roof terrace by converting/adapting loft space.
RefusalReasons: The proposed roof terrace,  by reason of its design  and overlooking harm, would fail to respect the host dwelling,  would be an incongruous feature that would harm the character and appearance  of the Falmouth  Conservation Area and would cause significant overlooking  harm  to neighbouring  property Zawn Haven. The proposal is in conflict with Policies  DG2, DG3 and DG7 of the emerging Falmouth Neighbourhood  Development Plan 2019-2030, Policies  1, 2, 12, and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Paragraphs  124, 127, 130 and 189-202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of The Old Clayworks Leswidden St Just Penzance Cornwall TR19 7RU
Description: Application to determine if prior approval is required for erection of spec building with roller shutter doors
RefusalReasons: The proposed development detailed on the submitted plan and application forms does not represent agricultural permitted development as defined by The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 - Class A, Part 6, Schedule 2 as the building proposed is 5.5m in height within 3km of an aerodrome and therefore an application for planning permission is required.

Address: The Cabin Merrifield Trungle Paul Penzance Cornwall TR19 6UF
Description: Retrospective: Use of existing separate annexe as both ancillary to this host residence and for self-contained holiday accommodation
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would  not be in a sustainable  location,  having particular regard to the lack of accessibility  to services  and facilities available  locally. The application fails to demonstrate that the provision and expansion  of tourist and visitor facilities cannot be met by existing facilities in rural service centres  such as Newlyn or the villages within West Cornwall which provide existing  services and community facilities. The combination of the separation distance from Newlyn centre, lack of street lighting and a pedestrian  footway on the narrow rural lanes, together  with the topography that leads into and out of Newlyn, would give rise to dependence  on the private motor  vehicle  in terms  of accessing facilities and services. As such the proposal would not represent sustainable rural tourism. The proposal does not represent an appropriate location  for holiday accommodation and as such would  be contrary to policies 1 and 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 83 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Skyburriowe Mill Cottage Skyburriowe Mill Garras Helston Cornwall TR12 6LP
Description: Conversion of an existing residential outbuilding to form 1 bed annexe accommodation with garden room (Amended design PA19/08499)
RefusalReasons: The proposed annexe, by reason of the significant extension and alterations to the building are considered to be substantial  in scale; harms  the intrinsic small scale and character of the host unit and is considered to represent development far beyond a conversion. By virtue  of its siting being separated from the main dwelling by over 24m will due to its separation not appear as an ancillary structure subservient to the existing dwelling. The resultant residential use would fail to conserve the character  and appearance of the existing building which is of simple traditional  form and style whilst leading to a proliferation of paraphernalia  and domestication that would erode  the rural character and would not conserve or enhance  the area which is located in open countryside outside of any settlement such that it represents an unsustainable form of development. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 12 and 2 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty  Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land Rear Of 9 Mount Camel Mount Camel Camelford Cornwall PL32 9UW
Description: Resubmission of PA19/05202 Erection of two 2-bedroom detached dwellings.
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwellings,  by reason of their height, use of first floor roof lights, diminished distance to neighbouring  dwellings, substandard levels  of private external amenity space, and orientation, results in a cramped and contrived form of development out of character  with the pattern of neighbouring development and which introduces harmful issues  of overlooking and overbearing to neighbours, and limited outlook and a poor standard of living  conditions for future  occupants. The proposal is therefore  contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: 1A Woodland Heights, Squirrels Leap Tremorvah Crescent Truro TR1 1NL
Description: Creation of Covered Carport Security with Additional Amenity Space and Privacy Screening
RefusalReasons: The proposed terrace and carport is through its siting and large proportions to be an unneighbourly addition that is overbearing,  causes  shadowing and would  allow noise disturbance to the detriment  of neighbour amenity, fails to relate to the host building  and character of the area, and it does not constitute a safe, and legible entrance for the occupiers of the building or continue to provide parking for the house  known  as Japonica, in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 127 and 180 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and Policies E1 and E4 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030.

Address: 35 Higher Tristram Polzeath Wadebridge PL27 6TF
Description: Extension and improvements to existing balcony
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension to the existing balcony, due to its scale and mass, results  in an unacceptable increase in the intensity and immediacy of overlooking and likelihood  of increased noise disturbance  in relation to the balcony/terrace of the adjacent neighbouring dwelling 36 Higher  Tristram.  The proposal  will cause an unacceptable level of overbearing  on the neighbour through  the dominance  of the proposed  structure. The development fails to protect the amenities  of neighbouring properties through  overlooking, overbearing and noise disturbance and conflicts with policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, policy STMNDP  2.7 part (IV) of the St Minver Parishes Neighbourhood Plan 2017-2030 and paragraphs  8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Pentui Pill Lane Feock TR3 6SE
Description: Construction of a single infill dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling would, by reason of its siting, scale, conspicuousness nature, excessive glazing, height, massing and resultant loss of trees, harm the natural and distinctive qualities of a tranquil  creek side setting within an Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty.  The  limited  social, environmental  and economic benefits of the application  do not outweigh this harm and the application is contrary to the aims and intensions of Policies LS2 and D1 of the Feock  Neighbourhood  Development  Plan 2017-2030, Policies 1,2,12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs  122, 124, 125, 127, 130, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Chyryn Harris Mill Illogan Redruth Cornwall TR16 4JG
Description: Outline planning for new dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1.   The application site is located outside of the defined settlement boundary of Illogan as set out in the adopted  Neighbourhood Development Plan therefore the proposal  fails to comply  with the requirements of Policy  PH 1a of the Illogan  Parish Neighbourhood  Development  Plan (IPNDP). The development would fail to maintain and enhance  the landscape character  of the area as a result of introducing built form in the countryside thereby  conflicting with the aims and intentions of Policy  PEH1 of the IPNDP and Policies 1,  2, 3 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Polices 2010 - 2030. The proposal  is for new unfettered residential development in the countryside  which does not accord with any of the special  circumstances set out in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the NPPF (2019).

Address: Barn 1 Land South West Of Minster Farm Boscastle Cornwall PL35 0BN
Description: Change of use of agricultural building to dwellinghouse, together with associated works
RefusalReasons: The existing building as a result of its ulitarian form is not considered to represent a suitably constructed redundant rural building that is appropriate to retain  and its conversion to residential use would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate setting on a site that is widely visible from an adjacent Public Right of Way and more limited wider views.   The introduction of residential  use and the associated domestic  paraphenalia  will harm this distinctly  rural, agricultural,  open and elevated  landscape and would  fail to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty within which it sits. The proposal is therefore considered to constitute unsuitable and unsustainable  residential development in the open countryside,  contrary to Policies  2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs  8, 79, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies MD9 and SCW8.04 of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Barn 2 Land South East Of Minster Farm Boscastle Cornwall PL35 0BN
Description: Change of use of agricultural building to dwellinghouse, together with associated works.
RefusalReasons: The existing building as a result of its ulitarian form is not considered to represent a suitably constructed redundant rural building that is appropriate to retain  and its conversion to residential use would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate setting on a site that is widely visible from an adjacent Public Right of Way and more limited wider views.   The introduction of residential  use and the associated domestic  paraphenalia  will harm this distinctly  rural, agricultural,  open and elevated  landscape and would  fail to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty within which it sits. The proposal is therefore considered to constitute unsuitable and unsustainable  residential development in the open countryside,  contrary to Policies  2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs  8, 79, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies MD9 and SCW8.04 of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 101 Porthpean Road St Austell PL25 4PN
Description: Resubmission of approved application PA18/04963 for the 'Construction of a detached garage/studio/annexe' to allow for variation of condition 3 to enable use as a self contained unit for paying guests and ancillary accommodation
RefusalReasons: The change of use of this annex for Holiday use has a harmful, detrimental and adverse impact upon the living  conditions  of the occupiers of the host building,  due to the lack of amenity space to the rear of the host dwelling and the holiday  let, this would have to be shared as no separation has been shown on any plans, also this could cause a disturbance issue with regards to noise from both residential units.  As such,  the development is contrary to Paragraphs  11 and 14 of the NPPF 19 and Policies 12 subsection (2c) and 13subsection (5)  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 Adopted Nov 2016.

Address: Land Rear Of Number 65 Carn Brea Lane Pool Redruth Cornwall TR15 3DS
Description: Erection of single storey dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed development would result in the subdivision  of a plot which is an historical example of the morphology  of a mining settlement that is a key attribute that expressed  the Outstanding Universal Value (OUV) of the Cornwall  and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site. The proposal would  result in the loss in the amount  and form of historic curtilage associated  with the original  host dwelling No. 65 Carn Brea Lane.  This loss is considered to be harmful to the historical character  of the site and surrounding area. The proposal  would  introduce backland development  thereby  appearing out of keeping  with the character  of the area which is characterised by subservient  and subordinate  outbuilding which serve the associated host dwelling. For these reasons  the proposed development would result in harm  to an Outstanding  Universal Value  of the World Heritage Site and therefore the proposal  conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 192, 194, 195 and 196 of the NPPF (2019)  and Policies P3 and P6 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World  Heritage Site Management Plan 2013 - 2018.

Address: 14 Chyverton Close Newquay Cornwall TR7 2AR
Description: Extension to east end of detached dwelling, 2 storeys plus dormer to rear (south) and extension to north side of detached garage
RefusalReasons: By reason of its excessive  scale, discordant  architectural form and closing  of the gap to the eastern boundary the proposal is incongruous in relation to the host property and causes unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the wider area. The development fails to represent good design  and conflicts with policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, policies D1(2.), D2, H1 and G2 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030, paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Small Wonders Day Nursery 19 Bonython Road Newquay TR7 3AW
Description: Removal of Condition 3 of Decision Notice PA14/08815 dated 4th November 2014
RefusalReasons: 1 It has not been demonstrated that the increased use of the rear garden outside  space (condition 3 of PA14/08815) could adequately  be mitigated to avoid significant adverse noise impacts on the residential  amenity of the nearby  residential dwellings.  Whilst the proposal would provide compelling benefits,  on balance these do not outweigh the harm identified.   The application  is therefore contrary to Policies  12 sub section 2.c and 16 sub section 1. of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010-2030  and paragraph  127 f) of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 5 Old Vicarage Close Stithians TR3 7DZ
Description: G1 - Group of 6 monterey pines - fell and replace with 6 scots pines
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the trees are of significant public amenity value to Stithians village and contribute to the character of the area. The Health and life expectancy are sufficient to warrant  retention  of the trees. There is no clear and convincing evidence to justify the loss of all of the group of trees.  Removal  of the group is therefore considered to result  in a detrimental impact  upon the public amenity  of the village.

Address: 6 Upper Hillcrest Perranporth TR6 0LA
Description: Erection of two new semi-detached three bedroom dwellings to replace one five bedroom dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwellings would, due to the proposed design,  materials  and limited outdoor amenity space and parking  space, result in a cramped development with a poor level of amenity for future occupants and a building that would  be seen from public  views as a jarring  contrast to the surrounding  built form to the detriment of the character of the area. The proposals  would also introduce additional overlooking to the detriment of the  amenity  of neighbours.  The proposal is contrary to Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 policies 1, 12, and 21 and paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 6 Lower Hillcrest Perranporth TR6 0JZ
Description: Two semi-detached dwellings that seek to provide two well-considered three bedroom homes.
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwellings would, due to the proposed design,  materials  and limited outdoor amenity space and parking  space, result in a cramped development with a poor level of amenity for future occupants and a building that would  be seen from public  views as a jarring  contrast to the surrounding  built form to the detriment of the character of the area. The proposals  would also introduce additional overlooking to the detriment of the  amenity  of neighbours.  The proposal is contrary to Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 policies 1, 12, and 21 and paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Kooyong Landlake Road Launceston Cornwall PL15 9HP
Description: Proposed fully accessible dwelling for disabled accommodation
RefusalReasons: The design of the proposal as a result  of its flat roof form,  positioning and close proximity to the existing dwelling would result in a cramped and contrived form of development that would appear  incongruous  and out of character with the surrounding area, failing to provide  continuity  with the existing built form and failing  to provide good quality accommodation, where future occupiers of the new dwelling  would  be overlooked by occupiers of the existing dwelling.  The proposed development is therefore  contrary to Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030  and Paragraphs  8, 124, 127, 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Land At Chapel Meadows Chapel Meadow Porthtowan
Description: Erection of a 2 bed dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its design and layout  would  appear as a cramped and contrived form of development that would neither  relate to nor reflect the character of the surrounding built environment. The proposed development would  therefore  harm the character and appearance  of the streetscene, thus conflicting with policies  1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 which, amongst other aspects, require new development to be of an appropriate  scale, density, layout, height and mass with a clear understanding and response to its landscape.  The proposal  would also conflict with paragraphs  8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019 which require planning decisions  to ensure new developments are visually attractive as a result of good architecture and layout  and establish  and maintain  a strong sense of place.

Address: Land At Holmbush Road St Austell PL25 3HQ
Description: Construction of Petrol Filling Station and linked store (Sui generis use) and associated development
RefusalReasons: The application  fails to provide  safe and suitable access for all road users for the nature  and scale of this proposal. The significant increase in vehicle  movements would result  in long queues, obscuring views of the west bound traffic for vehicles turning right out of the development  and conflict with cyclists  and pedestrian movements as it is considered that there  will be limited opportunities to safely cross the road and negotiate queuing traffic given the traffic  levels on the A390. It is therefore considered that a safe and suitable access for all users has not been demonstrated and the proposal would  therefore introduce  an unacceptable impact on highway  safety and not represent sustainable development and is contrary  to Policies 1 and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan and paragraph, 1,7 108 and 109 of the NPPF.

Address: Land West Of Trevenen Farmhouse Trevenen Helston Cornwall TR13 0NE
Description: Full planning for construction of one dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  outside of the settlement of Trevennen  and the proposed development does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance  with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030.  The development represents an undesirable intrusion of residential  development into the adjoining countryside to the detriment of the rural,  undeveloped nature of the area. In the absence of any special  circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material  considerations which outweigh  such harm, the proposal  is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and paragraphs 8 and 127 the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Meadowgate Upton Cross Liskeard Cornwall PL14 5AX
Description: Application for the modification or discharge of a planning obligation dated 18/08/1996
RefusalReasons: The proposal would result in the loss of what is in effect a local needs low cost home for sale (a form of affordable dwelling) to the open market in a location of evidenced affordable housing  need,  without robustly evidenced justification  or secured compensatory mitigation measures.As such the proposal is in direct opposition to the major thrust of central government and local policy to house all sectors of the community  in conflict with Policy 8 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraph 59 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.    Accordingly this application is refused, as the obligation continues to serve a useful purpose.Yours faithfullyLouise WoodService Director Planning and Sustainable Developmen

Address: Lewannick Manor Poadsmill Hill Lewannick Launceston PL15 7QD
Description: Internal alterations, installation of lift, re-wiring, re-rendering, general refurbishment works including works to timber sliding sash windows. Construction of a two storey extension, minor alterations to layouts & re-surfacing of driveways, construction of oak framed garage within the grounds.
RefusalReasons: The form, style, design and materials of the proposed two storey extension would represent an alien addition to this historic building that would  result  in less than substantial harm to the character, fabric and setting of this Grade II listed building. The extension would jar with the traditional proportions and materials of the main building,  representing an incongruous addition and would result in the loss of view of a number  of existing openings and a loss of view of part of the east elevation. The harm would  not be outweighed by the public benefits of the proposed development and therefore the development is contrary to Policies  12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 184, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Chy-An-Godolghyn Lane To Burra Burra Farm Three Burrows Blackwater TR4 8HU
Description: Construction of a dwelling, and formation of a new access and hard standing
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling would be in a rural location away from any settlement and would  therefore result in sporadic development in the countryside  resulting in erosion of the rural character of the area and create a development that would  be reliant upon the private car to access services and facilities due to the distance from, and quality of the routes to, alternative  modes of transport.  The proposed  dwelling  is therefore  not be sustainably located and thus conflicts with Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 21, 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and policies E1 and E4 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Land South East Of The Lodge Trevenna Cross St Mawgan Newquay Cornwall TR8 4HA
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved (access only) for construction of two dwellings
RefusalReasons: The application  site is in the countryside and the proposed  introduction of 2 new homes,  by reasons of their siting, bulk and character, would  harm the distinctive natural beauty and character of the surrounding Area of Great  Landscape Value.
