The application is, therefore, not sustainable development  and is contrary to the aims and intentions  of policies 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030,  saved  Policy 14 of the Restormel Borough Council Local Plan 2001 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Wits End Rock Road Rock Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6LD
Description: Construction of extension to dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by virtue of the position and size of the roof terrace  to the rear of the property would if approved, introduce  a new increased and unreasonable level of overlooking  and noise disturbance into the private  outdoor amenity spaces  of the neighbouring properties known as Carn Du and Lower Cole. The proposal, if approved would therefore be contrary to policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030

Address: Land South East Of Tregonning Farm Tregonning Lane Carleen Breage TR13 9QU
Description: Restoration and extension of derelict two storey barn to give two storey residential dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed works, by reason of the significant rebuilding and alterations to the building are considered to be substantial  in scale and are considered to represent development far beyond a conversion. The proposal is located  within the open countryside where new dwellings are only permitted in special circumstances.The large site area would lead to a large domestic garden area; such that it would lead to a proliferation of paraphernalia and domestication that would  erode the rural character and would not conserve  the local landscape, such that it represents  an unsustainable form of development  in the open countryside. The proposal is therefore contrary to paragraphs 8, 79 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies 1, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030.

Address: Land East Of 17 Relistian Lane Reawla Cornwall TR27 5HE
Description: Retention of Ground Works and Construction of Self Build Dwelling and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The application  site is situated outside of the settlement boundary of Reawla, as defined  in the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Plan under Policy GGPP3  (Carnhell Green, Reawla and Wall - Settlement Boundary).  The site of the proposed dwelling is considered to form a relatively  large gap in-between a sporadic collection of dwellings/buildings in the countryside,  which contributes positively  to the rural character  of the area. To develop  the site as proposed  is considered to result in the consolidation of the sporadic built form, to the detriment  of the landscape character  of this attractive landscape. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with policies GGP Policy 3 and GGP Policy 4 of the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Development  Plan, the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030,   Policy 1 of the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019, paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and advice contained within  Chief Planning  Officer's Advice Note: Infilling/Rounding Off.

Address: 9A Treviglas Close Newquay TR7 3JJ
Description: Proposed Front Dormer Extension
RefusalReasons: The proposed development represents  a poor level of design and would  fail to respond positively to local character and the wider street  scene. Rather than adding to the overall quality of the area and creating an attractive place to live, it will have an unacceptable negative impact on the visual  amenity value  in the immediate locale. The above is contrary to policy 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030,  Policy  D1 and H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019 and paragraph 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Windy Ridge Access To Great Pinnock Farm Fowey PL23 1JZ
Description: Change of use of Annexe within domestic curtilage from family use to a holiday let
RefusalReasons: The proposed new holiday accommodation, by reason of its isolated rural location outside of a settlement and which is not accessible by a range of transport modes would perpetuate over reliance  on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic  movements. Given the lack of any special justification,  the application  is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraph 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Land East Of An Jue Green Farm House Trevalgan St Ives Cornwall TR26 3BJ
Description: Conversion of redundant agricultural barn to a single dwellinghouse.
RefusalReasons: By reason of the substantial building operations required to bring the existing  building into residential use, the utilitarian form of the building which does not warrant retention, the inconspicuous positioning of the building in the landscape, and the proposed building and associated works which would  harm and domesticate  this distinctly rural, open and windswept landscape,  the proposed development is not considered to make use of a suitably-constructed building which is appropriate to retain  and the conversion of which would lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting.  Furthermore,  the proposal  is considered to fail to at least conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty within which it sits. The proposal  is therefore  considered to constitute unsuitable and unsustainable  residential development in the open countryside, and to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies GD1 and OS1 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030;  policies  2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  paragraphs  79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019; and policies MD9 and WP7.05 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land Adjacent Ritino Carnkie Wendron Helston Cornwall TR13 0DT
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for erection of up to 3 houses on redundant agricultural land
RefusalReasons: Due to the site's position in the countryside  beyond the established settlement  limits of Carnkie, it is not well related to its physical form and its development for housing would not constitute suitable 'infill' or 'rounding  off' of the settlement  in this location.  The  development of this parcel of agricultural  land for three dwellings, which forms part of the rural landscape setting  to the village, would domesticate and harmfully erode the identified rural character and result  in significant built form and harmful urban encroachment into the countryside where there presently is none.   It is contended this would  be harmful to the character and appearance of the area and the development is thereby contrary  to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, policy 1 in the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Between Numbers 4 And 5 Dozmere Dozmere Feock TR3 6RJ
Description: Erection of new dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by reason of the restricted site area, layout and juxtaposition  with neighbouring development would appear  incongruous, inharmonious and unrelated to neighbouring development, resulting in a cramped form of development, harmful to the visual  appearance  and established pattern of residential  development in the area. The proposal is contrary to policies D1 and H1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017 - 2030, policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan  Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph  127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Known As The Bowling Green High Street St Keverne Helston Cornwall TR12 6NS
Description: Proposed erection of 14 dwellings (4 affordable), estate road, foul/surface water drainage and landscaping
RefusalReasons: By reason of the encroachment of significant built form into undeveloped farmland on the edge of the village, the development will not integrate suitably into the natural and built environment and harmfully erode the established rural character  in this location.  Development of this scale will consequently harm the natural setting of the village and fail to conserve or enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) in this location.  The proposal would therefore be contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs  8, 124, 127, 130, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies  MD9 and SCW8.04  of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Redundant Barn Adj To Greenbank Farm Tresowes Hill Ashton Helston Cornwall TR13 9SZ
Description: Conversion of Existing Agricultural Timber Barn to form Dwelling & Associated Works.
RefusalReasons: The development  proposed  will significantly alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of this timber clad, portal  frame barn that currently sits comfortably in its rural setting.  The building is not considered to be a suitably  constructed redundant  rural building that would  be considered appropriate to retain and its conversion to residential  use would clearly not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting on a site that is widely visible  from the adjacent  public  highway.  The provision of openings, glazing and other alterations  will fundamentally alter the perception of the building such that it will be recognised as an incongruous  residential  form that will harm the strong rural characteristics of this Area of Great Landscape Value (AGLV).   Given  the inappropriate and unsustainable form of new housing development in the countryside, the proposed development would raise direct conflict  with policies 2, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 103, 127, 130 and 170 in the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Braemar, Accommodation 9 Avenue Road Falmouth TR11 4AZ
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed replacement of a domestic conservatory with an orangery
RefusalReasons: The proposed rear extension to the dwelling and roof alterations would fail to comply within permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A.1of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). This is because the extension would extend beyond the rear wall of the original dwellinghouse by more than 3m. As such planning permission is required.

Address: Land North Or Rear Of 3 Pendrea Road Trythogga Hill Gulval Cornwall
Description: Retention of change of use of altered garage to provide full residential use
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  with an internal floor area of 29m2, fails to meet the Nationally Described Space Standard for dwellings and therefore provides  inadequate internal accommodation and a poor level of amenity for any future occupants  of the property. Furthermore, the plot would appear cramped for an independent dwelling and out of character with the surrounding  area.  The proposal is therefore  contrary to policies 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030,  paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and part 2, section H1, paragraph 126 of the National Design Guide.

Address: Land South Of The Old Stables Rescorla St Austell Cornwall PL26 8YT
Description: Proposed change of use of the land to a private Romani gypsy site consisting of 2 gypsy pitches with associated works including 2 mobile homes, 2 touring caravans, 2 day rooms and the installation of a septic tank
RefusalReasons: The application  site is located  within the countryside.  The proposal introduces residential  development, including  retaining structures and hard standing, which is at odds to the prevailing character of the area and therefore  would  appear incongruous to its rural setting and thereby harms  the distinctive character and natural beauty of the surrounding countryside.  The  application is, therefore, contrary to policies 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework

Address: Camelot House West End Marazion Cornwall TR17 0EH
Description: Provision of balcony structure & external staircase (Amended design to previous approval PA13/11652)
RefusalReasons: In proposing a balcony of significantly greater width, depth  and general extent than that of the previously  approved PA13/11652 , and with the structure further wrapping  around  the western corner  of the building, and including a large external wheelchair  lift extending the height of the northwest  side elevation, the development would  appear obtrusive and inappropriate in the setting, and would materially  reduce the visual quality of the streetscape. The proposed  works fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Conservation  Area, which is located  within an Area of Outstanding  Natural BeautyThe proposed works  raise design concerns that cause harm to the setting and that are not balanced by other  factors  acting in the public interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions  of Policies 12 (paragraphs  1a and 1b), 23 (paragraph  2a) and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10,  7.3 and 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 124, 127, 128, 130, 184, 185, 189, 190, 192, 193, 196 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework. The proposed  development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve  or enhance the character  and appearance of the Conservation Area.

Address: Clearwater 2 Albert Road St Ives Cornwall TR26 2EH
Description: Extension to form a self contained Maisonette with terrace and associated remodelling to the property.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would be seen as an incongruous feature that would  neither relate to nor reflect the local context in which it is situated.  The proposal would not respect the building line of the existing streetscape and would detract from the setting of the Victorian Terrace behind along  Talland Road and from the present  street  scene. The development would therefore give rise to adverse  harm to the character and appearance of the area and would be in conflict with policies GD1 and BE6 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development  Plan (2015  - 2030), policies  2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 130 and 131 of the National Planning policy Framework 2019.

Address: 6 Elm Tree Road East Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 1HY
Description: Application for dormer extension to west elevation.
RefusalReasons: The proposed installation of a box roof dormer to the front roof slope, by reason  of the siting, size and unsympathetic design fails to take account of the historic context of the application site and adjoining  terrace and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Looe Conservation Area, resulting in less than substantial harm that is not outweighed by any public benefits.  The development is therefore  contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 127, 189, 192, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Halwin Meadows Halwin Lane Porkellis Helston Cornwall TR13 0LA
Description: Discharge of Section 106 Planning Obligation in respect of decision PA99/00133/F
RefusalReasons: The local planning authority is satisfied that the Planning Obligation will continue to serve a useful planning purpose because it ensures that the affordability of the property remains in place where there is clear evidence of a current need for such accommodation. The Planning Obligation therefore continues to be necessary to make the development acceptable in planning terms in accordance with up to date housing policies in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; namely policies 3, 7 and 9. The Planning Obligation therefore accords with Government guidance set out in paragraphs 54 and 56 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the Planning Practice Guidance.

Address: Land East Of Foxdown Aldercombe Lane Kilkhampton Bude Cornwall EX23 9RT
Description: Construction of a New Build Custom Home
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling is located in a rural location  and does not represent infill or round off of a settlement  and would visually extend  the built form into the open countryside, eroding its intrinsic  character. In the absence  of any special  circumstances  to justify it,  the proposed dwelling represents a sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016)  and paragraphs 79 and 170(b) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 27 Sunnybanks Hatt PL12 6SA
Description: Fell Oak Tree which is subject to a Tree Preservation Order
RefusalReasons: The loss of the tree would result in harm to public  amenity value.  It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority  that the proposed  works are not justified by the reasoning given in the application, no compelling arboricultural  evidence or justification has been provided  to support the loss of the tree.

Address: Panorama 1 Barnoon Terrace St Ives Cornwall TR26 1JE
Description: Creation of off road parking space with electric vehicle charging point.
RefusalReasons: By acceptance of the removal of a strong, traditional, non-designated  heritage asset, a prominent feature of Barnoon Terrace to allow the creation of a modern  parking space,  the proposed works fail to maintain  a distinctive character of the streetscape and would  be of significant  detriment  to it. Having removed the wall, the further  construction of new vehicular  access is inappropriate, out of keeping and at odds with the locality. The proposal would have a significant detrimental  impact upon a distinctive feature of the streetscape that currently remains a focal point in the views from the lower section of Barnoon Hill, which are reinforced by its elevated position. The works  would allow for significant degradation  of a non-designated heritage asset and are considered to raise design concerns that are not balanced by other factors  acting in the public  interest.The proposal is therefore contrary  to Policy 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 2.6, 2.9, 4.3 and 4.9 of the Cornwall  Design Guide  2013;  the aims and intentions  of Policies GD1 and BE5 of the St.Ives Neighbourhood  Development Plan, and paragraphs 124, 126-128, 130 and 197 of the National  Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land Rear Of 57 North Parade Camborne Cornwall TR14 8BL
Description: Erection of a dwelling, access via existing shared driveway to the proposed dwelling and demolition of a garage to provide vehicular access through.
RefusalReasons: By developing the site as a separate  residential unit, the plot would  be severed from its historic functional relationship  with the host dwelling, a former mineworkers' cottage, resulting in harm  to the legibility of the site as a key attribute of the Outstanding Universal Value  of the World Heritage Site. The harm that would  result to the significance of this heritage asset is graded as less than substantial,  at the higher  end of this threshold. The resulting harm is not outweighed by any public benefits nor is the harm capable of being mitigated through amendments to the design or layout. The proposed development  would therefore conflict  with policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 127, 184, 193 and 194 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and policies  P3, C2 and C7 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining  Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013 - 2018.

Address: The Cabin Nanfant Churchtown Cury Helston Cornwall TR12 7BW
Description: Retrospective consent for the conversion of a games room building into a holiday let
RefusalReasons: The use of the permitted  games room as a holiday dwelling  would represent unsustainable new development within the open countryside  for which no special need or justification has been adequately demonstrated.  The site is therefore not deemed  to be an appropriate location for the expansion and upgrading of existing tourism accommodation at the site and moreover, the proposal represents  a form of housing in the open countryside for which no special circumstances have been identified to justify it.  Such unsustainable development in the countryside is inaccessible  by a range of transport modes other  than the private  motor car and therefore raises direct conflict  with policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7 and 27 in the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 83, 84, 103 and 110 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Cliff Cottage Porthrepta Road Carbis Bay St Ives TR26 2NN
Description: Erection of a detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed introduction of new built form in the open countryside along with associated domestic paraphernalia  and the subsequent loss of open green  area would fail to enhance  the quality of the location thus compromising existing views to and from the coast, in conflict with policies GD1 and OS9 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan (2015 - 2030), policies  2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 79, 127, 130 and 131 of the National  Planning policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of 29 Grenville Road Padstow Cornwall PL28 8EX
Description: Proposed new house
RefusalReasons: The proposed new home,  by reasons of its siting and massing,  would result in adverse overbearing impacts  to the occupier(s) of the neighbouring property  at 29 Grenville Road.  The application is, therefore, not sustainable development and is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: The Chalet Rear Of 31 Fore Street Port Isaac PL29 3RE
Description: Demolition of buildings and construction of replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling,  by reasons  of siting, bulk and a design which includes large full length windows, would  introduce a prominent new form of development at odds to attributes on development in the surrounding  Conservation Area and jarring  to the landscape of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty.   The application is, therefore, not sustainable development  and is contrary to the aims and intentions  of policies 2, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 170, 172, 184, 192, 193 194 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 27 Chainwalk Drive Kenwyn TR1 3ST
Description: Works to tree namely to remove Sycamore subject to a Tree Preservation Order (TPO)
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the tree is of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contributes to the character of the local landscape. It's health and life expectancy are sufficient to warrant  its long term retention. There is insufficient justification for the removal  of the tree and clear and convincing evidence to justify  its loss has not been submitted. Its removal  is therefore considered to result  in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape.

Address: Sunnymead Townshend Hayle Cornwall TR27 6AE
Description: Change of use of land for camping, specifically for the siting of six timber glamping pods, new access/parking area, sauna, outside communal area and the use of an existing barn for recreation.
RefusalReasons: The provision  of new tourism accommodation  is not supported in this isolated rural location as it is considered to be unsustainable and inaccessible  by a range of transport  modes other than the private motor  car.  The accumulation  of the physical works  proposed, inclusive  of the pods themselves, new access road and parking, will result in a permanent and discernible  change to the largely  undeveloped and open character of this rural landscape,  which  will be clearly visible when travelling along the adjacent highway network.  Consequently, the development will erode  the strong rural characteristics  of this landscape  resulting in harm to the character  and appearance  of the countryside in this location.  The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  policies  2010 ' 2030, policies  HT4, EP1, EP2 and EP3 in Crowan Parish  Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2018 - 2030, and paragraphs  8, 83, 84, 103, 110, 127 and 170 in the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Rear Of Linfield House High Street St Keverne Cornwall TR12 6NS
Description: Reserved matters application with access, appearance, landscaping, layout and scale in respect of PA17/06917 (Erection of a dwelling house (outline consent with all matters reserved)).
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its design, siting, scale and bulk, the proposed development will detract from the character of adjacent Linfield House and not integrate  suitably into the natural  and built environment  of this part of the village. Such development will not conserve  or enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  (AONB) contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy Framework  2019 and policies  MD9 and SCW8.04 in the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management  Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Penolva Gillan Manaccan Helston Cornwall TR12 6HG
Description: Demolition of garage and construction of single dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposal to demolish the modest structure and replace it with a detached dwelling will result in an appreciable change to the landscape and setting of Flushing  Cove causing harm to the character and tranquillity  of the area.  The increase in footprint  and height, associated parking, new domestic curtilage and excavation required by the new dwelling will result in a more conspicuous built form  from  the public vantage points  in the area and the dwelling will be particularly visible at night when  light spill from the north facing windows  will highlight the intensification of built development along the southern side of the creek. The proposal does not address the AONB's  sensitivity and character in this location and will not conserve or enhance this nationally  important designation; thus, the development is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies  CC7 and MD9 in the Cornwall  AONB Management  Plan 2016 -2030.

Address: 47 Bonython Road Newquay TR7 3AL
Description: Retrospective change of use from hobby room to 1 bedroom residential dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of the lack of adequate associated private amenity space fails to secure a good standard of amenity  for future occupants. It would result in the creation of a cramped, sub-standard  form of accommodation  that would be to the detriment  of the quality of the living  environment experienced  by future occupants and would  fail to respond  positively  to local housing densities and the character  of the wider area. As such, the proposal is considered  contrary to the aims and intentions  of paragraphs 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policy  H2 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2019.

Address: Penmere Manor Hotel Mongleath Road Falmouth TR11 4PN
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for proposed residential development of 3no. detached houses within the curtilage of the grounds of Penmere Manor Hotel.
RefusalReasons: The proposed residential development  of three detached dwellings and associated hard surfacing, boundary  treatments,  and residential paraphernalia,  will result in an unacceptable  loss of trees and open amenity area within the Penmere Manor Hotel site.  This open area and tree cover is considered to make  an integral contribution  to the setting  of the grade  II listed hotel and the spacious, sylvan  character  of the area, contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, emerging Policies DG2, DG6 and FOS2 Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019 to 2030 (Submission Version July 2019), and paragraphs 7,8, 122, 124, 127, 128, 130, 170 (b), 189, 193, and 194.

Address: Former Offshore Hotel 6 Pentire Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 1PA
Description: 7 flats including associated parking
RefusalReasons: The proposal,  by reasons  of the siting, appearance and excessive scale of the building  containing the 7 flats, would introduce a development which appears  overbearing  in the streetscene to the detriment of the character of the area.  The application is, therefore,  not sustainable  development and is contrary to the aims and intentions  of Policies G2, D1 and H2 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan and policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land To The West Of Tre Gwynsac Crelly Trenear Helston Cornwall TR13 0EX
Description: Prior approval of details in respect of decision PA19/08856 (Prior notification for a small enclosed barn (10mx 10m) to mainly store animal feed and bedding. Attached an open fronted workshop (10m x 20m) to be used to store machinery and nessesary equipment to maintain the land such as spare fencing material and tools.)
RefusalReasons: With a proposed footprint  of 30m by 10m, and the use of white  uPVC windows, the size of the building is considered  excessively large in this location.  Given the scale of the proposed agricultural  building together with the use of white  uPVC windows  the development  proposal  would dominate its setting and fail to conserve  the strong and distinctive characteristics of this rural landscape. The proposed building due to its siting, scale and external appearance would have a harmful impact  on the landscape and is therefore  considered to be in conflict  with policies  1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: King Arthurs Car And Coach Park Fore Street Tintagel PL34 0DA
Description: Change of use of land to serve as a seasonal car park - from Good Friday to 31 October each year
RefusalReasons: The proposal would result in the loss of a green and open space which provides  an important visual buffer  between existing car parks in the settlement of Tintagel. The change in the use of the land would result in the visual coalescence of the King Arthurs and Country Club car parks, resulting in a large expanse of parking  that would  be entirely out of keeping with the scale of the settlement resulting in significant harm to the character and appearance  of the area harming the landscape and scenic beauty of this part of the AONB.  Therefore,  the proposal is in conflict  with Policy  2, 12 and 23 of The Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030  (adopted November  2016),  saved  Policy  ENV1  of the North Cornwall Local Plan (1999),  policy MD9 of the AONB  Management  Plan 2016-2021 and the paragraph  172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Tamarisk Porthcothan Padstow Cornwall PL28 8LW
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for up to two dwellings following demolition of the existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed new homes, by reason of their nature and scale and the increase in density will introduce  a cramped form of development onto the application  site to the detriment of the distinctive character and quality of the area and the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The  application is, therefore,  contrary to Policy SENDP3 of the St Eval Neighbourhood  Development Plan 2017-2030,  Policies 2, 3, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 127, 130 and 172 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Belle Vue Higher Lane Egloshayle Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6HW
Description: Proposed detached house
RefusalReasons: The road junction at Tower Hill and Dowdry Lane is substandard, in terms of visibility, width and inter visible passing, and the new home proposed by this application would  materially increase vehicle movements  at this junction.  The application, therefore, fails to provide  safe and suitable access  and is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paras  108, 109 and 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Polgreen Manor Polgreen St Mawgan TR8 4AG
Description: Change of land use from unused field to domestic curtilage. Construction of a tennis court to serve Polgreen Manor.
RefusalReasons: The proposal site is located within the open countryside and development of this nature  would result in harm to character and the distinctive qualities of the Watergate and Lanherne Area of Great Landscape Value. Given the lack of any over-riding public benefits, the application does not constitute  sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12  and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030,  Policy 14 of the Restormel Local Plan 2001 and paragraphs 7, 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Toad Hall Gooseham Bude Cornwall EX23 9PH
Description: Erection of a detached single storey one bedroom holiday let building and associated car parking.
RefusalReasons: The proposed self-contained holiday unit, by reason of its countryside location which  does not infill, round  off or use previously developed land adjoining the adjoining Brownspit settlement and which is separated from nearby services, facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable development for which  no special  justification  or overriding locational  or business  need has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal therefore  represents an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic  form of development that fails to maintain  the character of the Area of Great  Landscape Value. The development  is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Pendennis Alexandra Road Penzance TR18 4LZ
Description: Change of use from a bed and breakfast to an eight bedroom house in multiple occupation for the purposes of supported accommodation.
RefusalReasons: The change of use from a guest house to the proposed use would  fail to support a mixed and balanced community and results  in the area being imbalanced by the level of similar Houses in Multiple Occupation uses in Alexandra Road, to the detriment of local amenity.   The proposal would be contrary to Policy  1 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 7 and 8 of the National Planning Policy  Framework  2019.  The comings  and goings of occupiers of the proposed use is likely to be different  from holidaymakers. The pattern is likely to be sporadic  and the incidence  of visitors  higher.  The likely pattern of movement  has the potential for increased noise and disturbance causing undue  harm to the living conditions  of neighbours including occupiers of nearby  tourist accommodation  which in the long term is likely to have an adverse impact on future occupancy rates to the detriment of the economic benefit  of the tourism  industry contrary to policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 82 and 127 of the National  Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 5 Polwithen Road Falmouth Cornwall TR11 2DT
Description: Conversion of attic space to provide an additional bedroom and shower room.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by virtue of design, size and position would  appear as large and obtrusive additions  to the roof of the property, which would  dominate the roof space appearing conspicuous  and excessive. The proposed works fail to have regard for the local vernacular or to reinforce  local distinctiveness, and the development is considered to be of a design that fails to take the opportunities available for improving the character and quality  of the area.  As such the proposal would  fail to preserve the character of the existing dwelling and the surrounding  area. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; Policies DG 2 and DG 4 of the Falmouth  Neighbourhood  Development Plan; Sections  2.9, 7.3 and 7.7 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Great Bodieve Farm Bodieve Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6EG
Description: Conversion of barn with small extensions to the rear and one side, creating a 3 bedroom dwelling with off street parking and turning.
RefusalReasons: The proposed re-development, by virtue of its scale, form and substantial extensions  required to bring the existing building into residential use is tantamount to the creation of a new dwelling on a site which is not infill or rounding off within  a recognised settlement. The proposal is therefore the creation of a dwelling  in the open countryside and the proposed scale of the resultant building and associated works  would harm and domesticate the rural and open landscape setting and would constitute  a discordant  element in the landscape that is unsympathetic to the character  of the existing historic barn which would  fail to promote local distinctiveness  and would have an adverse impact  on the barns which  would fail to enhance their immediate  setting.  In the absence  of any special circumstances  to justify this proposal,  the application  is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2,3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 79, 127, 148, 150 and 170  of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land East Of 36 Wellington Place Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 7BQ
Description: Construction of two dwelling houses and associated Works
RefusalReasons: Whilst the proposal would  provide two dwellings in a sustainable location that contribute to the housing targets  of Wadebridge,  it would  extend development and the built form of the settlement  into the open countryside  and in so doing  harm the character, appearance and integrity of this verdant river valley.  The proposal conflicts with the development plan policies that seek to protect  the natural  environment, as well as the spatial strategy pursued by this council for the location  of housing.  The benefits of the proposal are significantly outweighed  by the harm and conflict with the development plan and does not represent sustainable development. As such the proposal  is contrary to Cornwall  Local Plan Policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23.

Address: Morvargh Balwest Ashton TR13 9TE
Description: Siting of four universally accessible OmniPods for the purposes of providing accessible holiday accommodation for Cornwall's visitors who have access needs. The proposal includes provision of access and drainage.
RefusalReasons: Whilst the proposed  development would have acknowledged economic  and social  benefits, it would not have comparative environmental benefits, owing  to its relatively inaccessible countryside location other  than by private modes of transport,  and to its visual impact by encroaching  into and unduly harming a locally distinctive and valued  landscape. Given  that Policy 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 requires new holiday  accommodation  proposals to provide a well-balanced  mix of economic, social and environmental benefits,  it follows that the proposal  cannot represent sustainable development. The proposal is therefore  considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 5 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs  8, 83, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 1 Trenwith Terrace St Ives TR26 1QE
Description: Creation of Off Road Parking Space
RefusalReasons: In removing  a strong, traditional and prominent feature  of Trenwith Terracei for the creation of a modern  parking space, the proposed works fail to maintain a distinctive character of the streetscape and would be of significant  detriment to itThe removal of a section of wall and construction of new vehicular access  is inappropriate, out of keeping and at odds with the locality. The proposal would have a significant detrimental  impact upon a distinctive feature of the streetscape that currently remains a focal point in the views from the imediate vicinity. The works would allow for significant degradation  of a non-designated  heritage asset and are considered to raise design concerns that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary  to Policy 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections  2.9,  4.3 and 4.9 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013; the aims and intentions of Policies GD1 and BE5 of the St.Ives  Neighbourhood Development  Plan, and paragraphs  124, 127, 128, 130 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

Address: 41 Cliff Street Mevagissey St Austell Cornwall PL26 6QJ
Description: Application, part retrospective, to replace existing rotten pitched roof over rear extension with flat amenity area; create platform at first floor level within inner yard, with spiral staircase to amenity area; replace one rotten window with timber French doors giving access to platform; replace remaining rotten windows with timber; replace rotten lintel over back door; remove part of internal partition in rear extension.
RefusalReasons: The works carried out are considered to have materially harmed the significance  of the listed building and cause harm to the character  and appearance  of the Conservation Area, conflicting with Policy 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (the Local Plan) and the Cornwall  Design Guide  2013 and Policy HC1 of the Mevagissey Parish  Neighbourhood Development Plan. The works adversly  impact upon the amenity  of the neighbouring  property  by means of impact to existing  windows openings as a result of new overlooking and noise and disturbance through the use of the terrace area. The works conflict  the aims of Policy 12 the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 points 2 a and c and paragrpah 127 point f of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Garages Five Wells Lane Helston Cornwall TR13 8PG
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for erection of dwelling
RefusalReasons: Given the inadequacy of the submitted Flood Risk Assessment (FRA),  the proposed development is unacceptable  on flood risk grounds.  The development would therefore not pass the Sequential  or Exception Tests  at present and it has not been adequately demonstrated  that the development would  provide  wider sustainability developments  to the community that outweigh  the flood risk, nor has it been shown  that the development will be safe for its lifetime  taking account of the vulnerability of its users, without increasing flood risk elsewhere, and, where possible,  reducing  flood risk overall.  The proposal therefore  raises  direct conflict with policy 26 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 158, 160, 161 and 163 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Southend Riverside Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 1PN
Description: Extension to create additional storey of 2 storey house
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension by reason of its inappropriate height,  scale, massing  and design would result in a prominent addition  to the existing dwelling house which would be visible from the South West Coast  Path and which would  adversely  affect  the character and appearance of the area. The proposal would therefore conflict  with Policies H1, H2, D2, G2, LE1 and LE4 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019 and Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.

Address: Land West Of Palverna High Street Cornwall PL26 7SP
Description: Outline planning (With Some Matters Reserved) for residential development
RefusalReasons: The proposed residential use of the site is not considered compatible with the neighbouring commercial dogs kennels use by reason  of the location and relationship of the site with the existing dogs kennels.  The existing dogs kennels use would result an adverse impact upon residents  of the proposed  dwellings  from noise pollution  from barking dogs which cannot be adequately mitigated against.  Increased activity from the proposed  residential use of the site is also likely to increase disturbance of the dogs at the neighbouring dog kennels that would increase  barking  and be detrimental to the amenity of the occupants of existing nearby  residential  properties.  The proposal  would  thereby be contrary to policies 12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 adopted 2016 and paragraphs  180 and 182 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Former Workshop North Of 56 Pentire Avenue Pentire Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 1PE
Description: Convert and extend domestic garage into a holiday let dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of overlooking  from the two first floor living room windows on the north  elevation,  leading to an unacceptable erosion of privacy to the balcony  and upper floor area of 54 Surf View and an overbearing effect  upon the rear bedroom and living room windows of 53 Surf View, due to the close physical  proximity of the two properties, would be unduly harmful to the residential  amenities of the occupiers of both these neighbouring  residences. As such,  the proposal is considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010-2030 - adopted November 2016 and Section 12, particularly  paragraph 127, of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 22 Rivendell Wadebridge PL27 7JN
Description: Single storey extension to side of property
RefusalReasons: The site lies within  Flood Zones 2 and 3 and a Critical Drainage  Area. The application has been assessed by Cornwall Councils Lead Local Flood  Authority (LLFA) alongside the provided Flood Risk Assessment. The LLFA are not satisfied  that the development  is necessary or will remain safe for its lifetime. It is considered that the application would  increase the risk of flooding elsewhere if built and that the extension would  itself be at risk from flooding.  This is a material  consideration which is sufficient to warrant refusal of the application on the basis that it has the potential to cause harm to increase the risk of flooding, thereby causing harm to both neighbouring residents  and occupiers of 22 Rivendell. The application is therefore contrary to Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 155 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Beerwolf Books 3 - 4 Bells Court Market Street Falmouth Cornwall TR11 3AZ
Description: Works to remove an existing Juliet Balcony and introduce a free standing raised decking area as a break-out space from the first floor bar whilst still maintaining the existing natural ventilation to the first floor area.
RefusalReasons: The Noise Impact  Report and additional  information  does not satisfactorily demonstrate that the potential  noise impacts from the proposed development will not have a detrimental effect  on the health and quality of life of nearby residents. Therefore, the proposal could result in unacceptable  amenity impacts contrary to Policies 12 (2), 13 (5) and 16 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 170 e) and 180 a) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Sandbank House 51 Upton Towans Hayle Cornwall TR27 5BL
Description: Relaxation of condition 7 of 80/P/0749, condition 3 of 73/42899, and condition 1 of 68/27529 to allow all year round occupation, without compliance with condition 2 of application number 99/P/0150/FD
RefusalReasons: In the absence  of adequate justification for the proposed lack of an affordable housing planning contribution, the proposal is considered  to conflict  with the aims, intentions and requirements of policies 8 and 10 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. Consequently, it is considered that condition 2 of planning permission W1/99/P/0150  continues to fulfil the tests for conditions, set out in paragraph 55 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 142 Henver Road Newquay Cornwall TR7 3EQ
Description: Variation of condition 2 (development to be built in accordance with the approved plans) of decision no. PA15/06934 (conversion of hotel and restaurant into 4 flats and an A3 restaurant) dated 13.11.2015 to allow for the installation of a roof mounted extraction fan system
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of the unacceptable levels of odour and noise levels being experienced  by the occupiers  of the neighbouring residential property at 144 Henver Road, is considered to be materially harmful to their residential amenities and, as such,  is contrary to  the aims and intentions of Policies 12 & 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies  2010-2030 - adopted  November 2016 and Section 12, particularly paragraph 127, of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land To The West Of Venton Arriance Trewoon Road Mullion TR12 7DT
Description: Proposed agricultural building
RefusalReasons: In the abscense of any sufficent  evidence to suggest otherwise,  the proposed agricultural building for the accommodation of livestock in close proximity to the dwellings known as Venton Arriance would, if permitted, result  in a development that would result in an unjustified harmful and detrimental impact to the occupants of the said properties by reason of the noise, odour,  flies and general disturbance associated with the use of the building. The development is therefore in conflict with policies  1, 12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs  8, 127, 170 and 180 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019, which seek to protect individuals  and property from unreasonable noise and disturbance.

Address: 15 Church Street Falmouth TR11 3DR
Description: Retrospective application for the installation of an extract flue
RefusalReasons: 1.In the absence of the submission of a combined noise assessment,  it is not possible to ensure  the existing amenities  currently enjoyed by the occupiers of neighbour properties are safeguarded against  noise impacts which may have a detrimental impact  on their health and quality of life, contrary  to the aims and intentions of Policies 13 and 16 of Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 180 of National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Carruan Farm Quakers Road St Minver Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6QT
Description: Request extension of working hours re PA19/06777
RefusalReasons: having carefully considered the impact of the proposed development on the amenity of all nearby premises, the Council as local planning authority is unable to agree the temporary change to construction working hours conditions. The site lies within 400m of an active campsite which has a site license until 31st October. Users of the site (a local business) are considered high sensitivity receptors that would as campers have a reasonable expectation of a low noise environment and who would be highly vulnerable to increases to noise, particularly given the nature of the accommodation (tents). It is not considered that methods of attenuating noise are likely to effectively overcome the potential harm. It is not considered appropriate to potentially expose occupiers to noise beyond the 10 hours already permitted on weekdays, nor allow construction activities on Saturday afternoons given that weekends are key periods in the shoulder of the season. The site is additionally in proximity to residential properties within 300m to the north east of the site.

Address: Land And Buildings North Of Lea Cottage Hillhead Road Kergilliack Cornwall TR11 5PA
Description: Proposed development of a single, self-build dwelling and associated works following demolition of an existing storage building / workshop.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the development of a new unfettered open market dwelling on previously undeveloped land in the open countryside  and within an identified Green Buffer separating the main towns of Falmouth  and Penryn, contrary  to the development plan's strategy for the location  of new residential development,  the protection of the open countryside  and the preservation of the gap between Falmouth  and Penryn. The site is in an elevated  and visually  prominent  location that is visible in multiple public views and the proposed development  would result in harm to the character of the area by reason of the introduction  of built development  on a previously undeveloped site and that would result in adverse visual  and landscape  impacts including because  the dwelling would be visible above the skyline and the significant areas  of floor to ceiling glazing proposed would result in increased light pollution at night.  The proposed development  would be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, Policy 1 of the Cornwall  Site Allocations Development Plan Document, Policies  H2, H3 and H4 of the emerging Budock Neighbourhood Development Plan, and paragraphs 8, 127, 170 and 180 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development fails to demonstrate  a safe and suitable  means  of access due to the constrained  nature  of the access by reason of its sub-standard visibility for emerging drivers and its narrow width  at the point of access that does not allow two vehicles to pass. The increased  number  of vehicle movements associated with the proposed additional dwelling would  be likely to result  in increased adverse highway safety  impacts due to the increased use of the sub-standard access. The proposed  development  would be contrary  to Policies  1 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, and paragraphs  8, 108 and 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Chy Dewetha Trenance Mawgan Porth Cornwall TR8 4BY
Description: Outline planning (with all matters reserved except access) for the construction of two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  be within the open countryside as it is sited outside of the physical boundary of the adjacent  settlement  of Trenance which  has a clear form and shape.  The  development is not rounding off as the existing properties 'Chy Dewetha' to the south of the site and 'Halwyn'  on the eastern side of the B3276  form a clear end to the settlement.  Furthermore the site is in an elevated position within an exposed coastal  landscape  designated for its aesthetic  and sensory quality. The proposal would therefore, visually  and physically  extend building into the open countryside  and would  not maintain the character and distinctive landscape quality of the area and is therefore contrary to the aims and objectives of Policies  1, 2, 3 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; Saved Policy 14(2) of the Restormel Local Plan 2001 and paragraph 8, 77, 78 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Polstangey Praze Road From Junction South Of Polstangey Bungalow To Polstangey Bridge Ruan Minor TR12 7LS
Description: Change of use of recreational paddock to mixed use of recreational paddock and the stationing of two shepherds huts for additional holiday accommodation to support the existing letting business. (Resubmission of PA20/00837 to confirm removal of mobile home)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of the site for two holiday letting units by reason  of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced  from nearby  services, facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable new residential development for which no special justification  has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents  an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic  form of development that would  be harmful  to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside  and would  neither  conserve or enhance the area which is designated  an Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  . The development is therefore  contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies MD6 and MD9 of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land South West Of Lower Penquite St Ive Cornwall PL14 3NE
Description: Permission in principle for conversion of a rural building to a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal seeks to convert a simple timber building which is not considered suitably constructed, worthy of retention or suitable for residential use, and is therefore not acceptable  for conversion to a dwelling in principle, contrary to the requirements of the policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Chywidden Oak Tree Lane Trescowe Common Germoe TR20 9RU
Description: Conversion of Existing Outbuilding to Form Holiday Accommodation
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed holiday  letting dwelling would be located in the countryside  where the nearest bus stop is not within a safe and convenient walking distance. The use of the development  would thus rely on private  transport  and fails to maximise the use of sustainable transport modes  contrary to policy 5(3) and 27(2) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and contrary to Paragraphs 83 and 84 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 2 In the absence of sufficient information to support the application where there is considered to be impacts  upon the World  Heritage Site designation, it has not been demonstrated what impacts are caused by the development and fails to demonstrate how any harm will be avoided, minimised  or mitigated. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of policy 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 189 and 190 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) 3 In the absence of an adequate ecological survey,  the application  fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance protected species  and biodiversity. As such,  this proposal is contrary to Policy 23(4)  of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016)  and the aims and intentions  of Paragraphs 118 (b) and 170 (a) of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 4 In the absence of an adequate structural survey, the application fails to demonstrate that the proposal would reuse a suitably constructed building.  As such, this proposal is contrary  to Policy 7(3) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016) and the aims and intentions of Paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 5 The building  is not appropriate  to retain and its conversion to residential use would not lead to an enhancement to its immediate setting. As such, this proposal is contrary  to Policy 7(3), 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016) and the aims and intentions of Paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Belle View Crowntown Helston Cornwall TR13 0AB
Description: Construction of Single Storey Self Build Eco Dwelling & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the settlement  of Crowntown and the proposed development  does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance  with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.  The development represents an undesirable  intrusion of residential development into the adjoining countryside  to the detriment  of the rural, undeveloped nature of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal  represents an unsustainable  and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence  of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November  2016)  and paragraphs 8 and 127 the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Homeslink Wesley Road Cubert Cornwall TR8 5HB
Description: Application for permission in principle for the construction of up to 5 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal does not constitute infill or rounding off because  it is not enclosed  by a boundary or physical  feature that would prevent further growth and it would physically extend  the settlement  into a large gap between existing and permitted  development to the detriment  of the rural character of the area contrary to policy 3 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Orchard Lodge Chapel Hill Farm Plantation Troon Camborne Cornwall TR14 9JP
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of Orchard Lodge as a dwelling house
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, that 'Orchard Lodge' has been used for self-contained residential accommodation for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: Land At Wheal Jane Baldhu Cornwall TR3 6EE
Description: conversion of 2 redundant water storage tanks into 2no dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed alterations and conversion of the existing water tanks would  not lead to an enhancement of their immediate setting  and would  result  in the creation of two new dwellings in an unsustainable  location for which there is no special justification. The proposals are therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 9, 78 and 79, 102, 103, and 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: North Barn Boquio Farm Farms Common Wendron Helston Cornwall TR13 0JH
Description: Demolition of existing agricultural building and erection of two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is located  outside  of any defined  settlement,  such that it is located within the open countryside  where new residential units are only permitted in special circumstances. It is considered that the proposal  does not comply  with any of the special  circumstances  and would not maintain the character  of the area within a countryside setting due to the proposed residential use and associated domestic paraphernalia and is therefore  contrary  to policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Goonlaze Field Goonlaze St Agnes Cornwall
Description: Conversion of redundant agricultural store to a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The building is not appropriate to retain and its conversion to residential use would not lead to an enhancement to its immediate setting. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policy 10 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraphs 8, 9, 78, 79, 127, and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Two Acres Trevillick Tintagel PL34 0DN
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the siting and residential use of the residential mobile home and domestic outbuilding at Two Acres, Trevillick PL34 0DN, as identified on Plan 1
RefusalReasons: 1 The Local Planning Authority does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the mobile home and adjoining outbuilding at Two Acres, Trevillick has been used as a dwelling for residential purposes, for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: Flexbury Hall Poughill Road Poughill Bude EX23 8NX
Description: Erection of single dwelling house on land south west of Flexbury Hall (resubmission of previously refused application no. PA19/03237)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal has failed to demonstrate the proposed access to serve  the dwelling would be safe and suitable for all peoples, including pedestrians.  The proposal  therefore fails to accord with policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Off Goonown Lane Goonown Lane Goonown St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0UX
Description: Erection of agricultural buildings (resubmission of withdrawn application no. PA19/10415)
RefusalReasons: 1 Contrary to policy  27 of the Cornwall Local Plan a safe and suitable  access  to the site of the proposed  development cannot be achieved owing  to the lack of emerging visibility onto the U6073 presenting a danger  for emerging vehicles  as well as a situation where  two vehicles meeting  in the lane could  result  in blind reversing manoeuvres onto the U6073.

Address: Land South Of Rosevale East Taphouse Cornwall PL14 4NQ
Description: Proposed residential development for one self-build dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its isolated location, detached from any settlement or built form,  introduces  new development into the countryside, eroding the character  and appearance of the rural setting.  In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  it, the proposal represents  an unsustainable and sporadic form of development  in the countryside  and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016). 2 The proposed development would increase the amount of vehicular  traffic  accessing and egressing to and from the site which  is located on the inside of a bend on the strategic A classified A390 highway.  The access is substandard due to its limited visibility  to the south west and north  east for drivers exiting the site with visibility  splays located  outside the applicant's ownership. The increased usage would contribute to an increased risk of collision  and reduction  in highway  safety to both occupants  and members of the public.  The application, therefore, fails to provide safe and suitable access and is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 - 110 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Tamarisk Lodge Calstock Road Gunnislake Cornwall PL18 9AA
Description: Outline application for the construction of a dwellinghouse with all matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is located in a rural area, divorced from nearby services, amenities,  employment and public transport links and would  in this location,  represent  unsustainable, sporadic new residential  accommodation where no overriding justification has been submitted. Future  occupiers of the proposed dwelling would  be mainly, if not solely reliant  on private vehicles  to go about their daily lives and as such the development would fail to contribute  towards minimising waste  and pollution, would fail to mitigate and adapt to climate  change  and would fail to support the move to a low carbon  economy.   The proposed development is therefore contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016) and Paragraph 8 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development would result in the unjustified  closure  and loss of the current rural business site, Barracott Plants,  and therefore fails to generate and sustain economic activity contrary to Policies 1,2 5(2) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016.

Address: The Coach House St Thomas Street Penryn TR10 8JP
Description: Replace single glazed casement windows with UPVC double glazed heritage sash windows.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed replacement sash windows, by reason of the material used i.e. UPVC would appear  as modern fixtures which would  fail to maintain  the special character and appearance of the Penryn Conservation  Area.  Clear and convincing justification for the works  has not been provided  and there is no clear level of public  benefit that would offset  the identified harm. The proposal  therefore fails to satisfy the aims and intentions  of Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010-2030,  the Penryn Conservation  Area Management Plan (April 2010) and paragraphs 189, 193, 194 and 197 of the NPPF (February 2019).

Address: Plot Of Land Between Trevennel Old Cottage And Homelands St Just In Rosleand TR2 5HY
Description: Removal of outbuildings and concrete hardstandings and erection of an open market infill dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, in providing a single open market residential unit on a site outside  of the defined  settlement boundary for the village of St Just in Roseland, would fail to deliver an affordable housing unit as a rural exceptions development and without  significant  and robust evidence to justify this stance on viability grounds the proposal would  be in conflict  with Policies GP1, GP3, HO3 and HO4 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2015, Policies 1, 2, 3, and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies and paragraphs 77 and 78 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land South East Of The Porges Road From Foxcote To The A3047 At Whitecross Wheal Rose Scorrier TR16 5DA
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed erection of a detached dwelling and the provision of a sewage treatment plant in line with decision PA16/09587 dated 05 Dec 2016 (confirmation of material start)
RefusalReasons: 1 The mining remediation works which involved capping an existing mine shaft found within the site, and ground contamination works do not fall within the definition of a material operation in Section 56(4) subsection (2) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. In addition, the submitted report on Rotary Percussive Drilling Investigation serves to confirm that the development has not commenced. Therefore, based on the evidence submitted by the applicant and having regard to other information available to the local planning authority, it is not considered that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully demonstrate that a material start has been made on the development approved under application reference PA16/09587 dated 05 Dec 2016.

Address: Land North Of Former Dune House Ramoth Way Perranporth Cornwall TR6 0BY
Description: New build dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling would not represent  a rounding-off  of the settlement but would result  in an extension of the urban form into the countryside thus the proposal would  not comply  with Policies 2 and 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, which set out the spatial strategy for the delivery of housing. The proposal would constitute  new housing development in the countryside, and also fails to meet the special  circumstances  set out at Policy 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2010-2030. 2 The proposed dwelling,  by virtue of its scale and siting  adjacent to the three dwellings under construction would, when seen in combination, result in a grouping of development whose massing would be uncharacteristic of this part of Perranporth and harmful to the setting  of the settlement  which in this location is dominated by the dunes  and smaller scale dwellings.  The proposal is thus contrary to Policies  2(1), 12 and 23(1,2)  of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030. 3 Due to the lack of an ecology  survey the local planning authority  has been unable to assess the potential for impacts on protected species contrary to Cornwall Local Plan policies 22 and 23(3c).

Address: Copper Mine Lodge Chapel Hill Farm Plantation Troon Camborne Cornwall TR14 9JP
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of Copper Mine Lodge as a dwelling house
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, that 'Copper Mine Lodge' has been used for holiday letting purposes for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: Land At OS Field 2319 School Hill Coverack Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Construction of 4 Dwelling Houses and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development represents an extension into undeveloped,  open countryside beyond the built form of Coverack.  The site is not allocated for residential development via an adopted  Neighbourhood Plan, is not previously  developed land and does not represent infill or rounding off development.  The proposal therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic form of residential  development in the countryside which  would  result in harm to the intrinsic character and beauty of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.   In the absence  of any other  material considerations which  outweigh such harm,  the proposal is contrary  to  Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs  79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy  MD9 of the Cornwall  Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 In the absence of adequate ecological  survey, the application fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance habitat and biodiversity. As such, this proposal is contrary to Policy  23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016)  and the aims and intentions  of Paragraphs 118 (b) and 170 (a) of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Cowslip Cottage Tresean Cubert Cornwall TR8 5HN
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for the construction of a single dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal site falls outside the Settlement  of Tresean,  is not substantially enclosed by existing built development, would  not represent a logical extension to the hamlet and would extend development beyond the current built-form to the detriment  of the rural character of the area contrary to policy  3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030.

Address: Land West Of Tregarth Whitehall Scorrier Redruth Cornwall TR16 5BB
Description: Construction of a new residential dwelling and detached garage within the garden curtilage
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of any established  settlement  and does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 2030 because Whithall  is a low density straggle of dwellings with no clear definable  boundary and is not part of a network of settlements  and the proposed development would  result in unsustainable development detrimental to the rural character and appearance of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary  to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and policy  HN1 of the Chacewater  Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2018-2030. 2 By reason of the loss of openness of the plot and the insertion of a dwelling  and garage readily visible from the road and of a design not consistent with that found in this part of the WHS, the historic  authenticity and integrity of the site's relationship to the primary residence of Tregarth  would  be harmed by the proposal. The proposed development therefore  fails to conserve or enhance  the historic character of the World  Heritage  Site in this location contrary to policy 24 the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, and policy  HE2 of the Chacewater Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030.

Address: Perranwood Carclew Road Mylor Bridge Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5UN
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of land as residential curtilage
