RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the use of garden (as shown outlined in red on the Site Location Plan received 23.06.2020) in connection with private dwelling house at known as Perranwood has been continuous for a period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application being received. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Land South East Of The Old Chapel Carleen Breage Cornwall TR13 9QR
Description: Reserved matters of access, appearance, landscaping, layout and scale following outline consent PA17/06804 dated 27/092017 for erection of up to three dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by virtue of its design, siting and use of materials would appear  prominent  and inappropriate  in the setting, and would  materially reduce the visual  quality of the streetscape.  The proposed works  fail to conserve or enhance the character and appearance of the World  Heritage Site. The proposed works  raise design concerns that cause harm to the setting and that are not balanced by other  factors acting  in the public interest or benefit.  The proposal is therefore contrary  to the aims and intentions  of polices 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030,  paragraphs  124, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies C2 and C7 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management  Plan 2013 - 2018.

Address: Homestead Carnarthen Carn Brea TR14 9AT
Description: Conversion of Existing Agricultural Barns To Form Dwelling and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The remains of the building, by reason of their scale, condition  and appearance,  would require  significant  reconstruction, rebuilding and extension in order to facilitate a residential use; without such work, it would  not be capable of being converted into a habitable dwelling.  Therefore the development would  constitute the erection of a new dwelling in an unsustainable  location in the open countryside, for which no special justification  has been presented. The proposed use with the associated domestic paraphernalia  in this rural context would  fail to enhance the immediate setting and as such, the special  qualities and attributes of this historic  rural landscape would be harmed  contrary to the aims of policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 124, 127, 170, 192 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Kelly Park St Dominick Saltash Cornwall PL12 6SQ
Description: Demolition of garden store and erection of self-contained annexe with garden store / garage and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by way of the level of accommodation  that it would provide and its visual appearance would effectively create, and present  as, a new dwelling in an inappropriate rural location and, as such, it would  represent unsustainable development in a manner  that would  conflict with Policies 2,3,7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and with Paragraph 79 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of 16 Hawthorn Avenue Bude Cornwall EX23 8PZ
Description: Outline Planning Application for a new dwelling with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  introduce a form of back land development behind the prevailing building line that would diminish space  to common  boundaries  with neighbours.  The proposed  development of the site with a dwelling by reason  of the location, size and positioning of the plot would  result in an awkward and contrived development that would be discordant  with the established  pattern, form and spacing of dwellings in the locality  and which would  fail to promote continuity with the existing built form, whilst also failing to respond  positively to local character or add to the overall  quality of the area.  The development  is therefore contrary  to Policies 1, 2, and 12 of  the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy 3(b) of the Bude-Stratton Neighbourhood Development Plan 2010-2030, Sections 4.8, 4.9, 4.10 of the Cornwall  Design Guide 2013 and paragraphs  8, 124 and 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Watergate Lodge Tregurrian Hill Tregurrian Newquay TR8 4AD
Description: Removal of condition 3 (holiday restriction) in respect of decision notice PA18/08941 (Single holiday dwelling with variation of condition 2 (approved plans) in respect of decision PA17/03241 dated 07.07.17 to allow amended position of dwelling)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  conflict with Policy G1(c) of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019 as the development  would not amount  to the re-development  or replacement of an existing dwelling. The site is located outside  of the confines  of any settlement and is considered to be the countryside  for the purposes  of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.  The development  would   not constitute  infill or rounding off for the purposes of Policy  3 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016. The proposal does not accord  with any of the special circumstances for new dwellings in the countryside listed  in Policy  7 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016. The development would not be sustainably located and would  not accord with Policy 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.  It would, therefore, conflict with Policy G1(c) of the Newquay  Neighbourhood Plan 2019 and Policies 3 and 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, which seek to ensure that development proposals  can be considered sustainable development.

Address: Land At Forder Hill Cawsand Torpoint Cornwall PL10 1LE
Description: Construction of one dwelling and associated works, including access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of the development of a gap which contributes positively to the character and significance of the characterful hamlet of Forder, would result  in harm to the setting, significance and character  of the settlement,  the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  and the setting of the Area of Great Landscape Value. The excessive size of the dwelling, contemporary design features, building form, and immediately  visible position within the plot would further exacerbate the harm by failing  to take account of the landscape and built-form contexts. The proposal therefore  fails to accord with policy  5 of the Rame Peninsula Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030  (Adopted 21st June 2017),  policies 1, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies (adopted November 2016), saved policy  CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan first Alteration 2007, and policy  MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management  Plan 2016 - 2021.

Address: Land Off Forthvean Road Porthtowan Cornwall TR4 8AY
Description: Proposed residential development of 4 residential dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 because it would extend development  into the countryside  beyond the current built-form of Porthtowan and by reason  of its urbanising impact and extension of built development into the countryside would be detrimental to the rural character and appearance  of the area.  In  addition, occupants of the proposed dwellings would be reliant  on the private vehicle  owing to the lack of a safe pedestrian route to the village centre. Therefore  the proposal does not represent sustainable development  and is contrary  to policies  1, 2, 3 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Nissen Hut On Land South Of Lower Trevivian St Clether Launceston Cornwall PL15 8PS
Description: Removal of Nissen Hut and construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling is not considered to be located in a suitable and sustainable location for new housing development and does not represent 'rounding-off or infilling'; the dwelling with domestic garden would cause harm to the character an appearance of the area and would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate setting. The scheme conflicts with policies 3,7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Land West Of The Old Barn Greenbottom Truro Cornwall TR4 8QN
Description: The construction of a single dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling is located within the countryside and does not represent infill or the rounding  off of a settlement and would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding its intrinsic character. In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  it, the proposed dwelling represents  a sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraphs 79 and 170(b) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 Due to the constrained emerging visibility onto the C723 and the lack of deliverable visibility  splays safe and suitable  access to the development for all people is therefore not provided  and the application is contrary  to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 The site lies within a Critical  Drainage Area, insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate that the proposed development will not increase  flood risk within the site or elsewhere. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy E2 of the Truro and Kenwyn  Neighbourhood Plan, Policy  26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 163 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Nablus Castle Drive Praa Sands TR20 9TG
Description: Proposed Replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its layout, mass and design together  with its use of metal  cladding, will introduce an incongruous  feature in the streetscene, sitting forward of the building  line which would be out of character with the area, and contrary  to Policies 2 and 12 and of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs  122 (d and e), 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of Dobwalls Primary School Dobwalls Cornwall PL14 4LU
Description: Outline application for an affordable housing led, rural exceptions development of up to 24 units with all matters reserved except access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed residential development  of the site would result in the urbanisation of undeveloped  agricultural land that comprises the best and most versatile  land, thereby reducing the existing and/or  potential economic and food production productivity associated with the land, whilst resulting in the encroachment of built form into undeveloped  countryside, harming the natural character and beauty of the area.  The  proposed  development  is therefore  contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030. 2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of affordable housing;  on-site and off-site public open space contributions;  off-site financial contributions towards educational  infrastructure; and biodiversity net gain, the proposal  is contrary to Policies  1, 2, 9, 12, 13, 16, 23, 25 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Cornwall  Council Guidance on S106 Planning Obligations for Education Provision  2018.

Address: Little Meadows Arbour Road From Toldish Road To Moorland Road Toldish Indian Queens TR9 6HG
Description: Proposed change of use to private gypsy/traveller site comprising of 6 pitches with associated works including 6 mobile homes, 6 touring caravans, 2 pairs of semi-detached day rooms, hardstandings and the installation of a septic tank
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  appear  as incremental encroachment into the open countryside and have an urbanising  effect on the rural location,  poorly  integrated with the wider settlement of Toldish. This would  be significantly harmful to the spacious rural character of the area and erode its open qualities in context  with the adjacent  land uses and low density of development  and be out of character  with its existing distinctive beauty  and character  of the undeveloped countryside especially when viewed cumulatively  with the previously permitted  6 pitches.  The proposal would thereby be contrary to policies 1,2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 adopted 2016 and policy  Landscape 2 of the emerging St Endoder Neighbourhood Plan.

Address: Land West Of Grove Cottage Red Lane Rosudgeon Cornwall
Description: Two dwellings and alterations to existing access.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  neither  round-off the settlements  of Rosudgeon or Perran Downs, nor infill a small gap in their built form and would therefore  constitute development in the open countryside.  The larger green gaps along Red Lane are considered to add significantly to its character and to allow a residential development of the site and the removal of a significant  section of the existing Cornish hedge boundary to form the new access  and associated visibility splay requirements and access track would represent further, incremental  urbanisation of a pleasant, rural lane, thereby unacceptably  harming the character and setting of Rosudgeon  and Perran  Downs and the surrounding countryside in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1,  2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The land was in use by a person/persons  with mining connections  and that as such would be regarded  as a mineworker's smallholding, of which this area has many. As such,  the field would be regarded  as an attribute that expresses the Outstanding Universal Value (OUV) of the World  Heritage  Site. It is acknowledged that the southern  field boundary has been lost, but the site and wider environs still retain an open and undeveloped rural character. The proposed development,  that would  be readily visible from the road to the north  east and north  west,  is considered to erode  some of that character which would  neither conserve nor enhance the remaining legibility of this historic land-use contrary to Policy  24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies and paragraph 184 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Two Stiles Treyarnon Lane St Merryn Padstow Cornwall PL28 8JT
Description: Outline application for the construction of 5 houses and associated works with diversion and relocation of Public Right of Way
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development for 5 new homes and associated works with diversion and relocation of  Public Right of Way, is assessed  to be remote  from the settlement of St Merryn; located within a prominent location along the skyline and likely to cause unacceptable harm to the designated landscape of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty. This conflicts with the aim of conserving and enhancing the landscape and scenic  beauty of this designation  that carries the highest status of protection,  to which great weight  is accorded as a material planning consideration. This submitted  scheme does not meet a specific need for housing in the countryside  and is not judged to be infilling  or rounding off an existing settlement, conflicting with Policies 1, 3, 7, 9 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030;  saved policy  ENV1 of the North Cornwall District Local Plan; and guidance contained within  the NPPF(2019). 2 The submitted scheme does not demonstrate safe access/egress for each proposed property  within  the scheme onto the C57 Treyarnon Lane, nor from the junction of the C57 Treyarnon Lane onto the B3276, which in the opinion of the Local Planning  Authority could give rise to conflict  with other  users  of the highway. The location  of this site is likely to encourage pedestrians  to use the B3276 which is a rural lane with no pavements.  The proposed  footpath diversion  route is assessed to be unlikely  to address day to day needs  for residents of the application site, and overall it is assessed  that the development will encourage  short journeys by private car.  The proposed location of this development would encourage pedestrians  and cycle movement in conflict with motorised traffic giving rise to increase  danger for all users and creating an unacceptable  highway  safety impact. As such the development  is assessed to conflict  with Policies  16 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030.

Address: Land Adjacent To 1 Camel Valley Cottages Dunmere Road Bodmin Cornwall
Description: Four bedroom dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is clearly divorced from any settlement  with poor accessibility to necessary daily services  and facilities  which would perpetuate over reliance  on the private vehicle  and unsustainable traffic movements.  In  the absence of any special circumstances  to justify  residential development in this rural location,  the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2,3, 7, 12, 21 and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 91 102, 103, 110, 127, 148 and 150 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The proposed access arrangement  fails to demonstrate a safe and suitable access for the proposed  dwelling and, if permitted, would  be detrimental  to highway safety as a result of the introduction of vehicular movements onto the A389, substandard visibility, observed traffic speeds and volume of traffic using  this main road.  It is considered therefore that the development is not sustainable and contrary  to Policies 2, 12 and 27 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 and the aims and intentions  of 108, 109 and 110 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Off Tregenna Fields Camborne Cornwall
Description: Full planning permission for 23 dwellings, including affordable housing, landscape, access and associated infrastructure
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed design  would result in a form of development that fails to reflect and respond  to the existing surrounding development due to the mix of house types, layout and density.  It would be out of character  due to the poor relationship between  the established dwellings and the new development resulting in an unacceptable  visual impact.  The site is not allocated for development and the Council  has a five year supply of housing  land.  As such there is no justification or need to develop the site.  It would therefore be contrary to Policies  1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, advice in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, paragraphs 124 and 127 and Policy 1 of the Cornwall Sites Allocation Development Plan Document.

Address: Rosehill Nurseries Landulph Saltash Cornwall PL12 6NF
Description: Construction of 29 dwellings (15 Affordable and 14 Open Market), Shop & Flat (A1) and Associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not located within a main town identified in Policy  3 of the Cornwall Local Plan as a suitable settlement  to accommodate the county's strategic housing growth.  The site's location and scale of development  does not constitute infill development or rounding off nor utilise previously developed  land and the site is not allocated for residential development  in the Landulph Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2018-2030.   The settlement  is considered suitable for housing on a rural exceptions basis where housing development is responsive to local circumstances  in reflecting local housing  needs and be affordable housing led.  However  the scheme  is not considered to be a suitable rural exceptions development  as the scale of the development and the number of dwellings proposed  in relation to the very low evidence of identified housing need in the Parish goes beyond  what is considered appropriate.   Furthermore, the submitted information has not demonstrated  that the level of market housing  proposed is essential for the successful delivery of the scheme.  The scheme  also fails to demonstrate that the proposed affordable housing meets the Nationally Described Space Standards and that 25% of the affordable units will comprise accessible homes.  The positioning of the affordable  dwellings across  the site, together with the limited garden spaces  serving  a number  of the affordable units will also fail to create a scheme where the affordable units are indistinguishable from the open market  dwellings, which in contrast comprise large, detached properties (generally) sited in the southern half of the plot, benefiting from generous garden spaces  and garaging.   The proposal is therefore  not considered to constitute sustainable  development  as defined  by the Development  Plan as it conflicts specifically with Policies  1, 3, 9 and 13 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted  November 2016; Cornwall Council Housing Supplementary Planning Document  2020 and guidance within paragraphs  8, 11, 15 and 77 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal, by reason of its scale,  density, layout and location,  fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty  (AONB).  The proposed development represents major development within the AONB without sufficient evidence of exceptional circumstances and that the development is in the public interest.  The development as proposed  would erode the special qualities and features in this part of the AONB and is therefore contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan, paragraph 172 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 and the Tamar Valley AONB  Management  Plan 2019-2024. 3 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of affordable housing;  public open space on site including  future management and maintenance in perpetuity; offsite financial contributions towards  educational infrastructure and off-site financial contributions to manage the increased recreational impacts on IDOX/the Plymouth  Sound and Estuaries SAC Natura 2000 site the proposal  is contrary to Policies  1, 2, 9, 12, 13, 16, 22, 23, 25 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and CC Guidance on S106 Planning Obligations for Education Provision 2018.

Address: Land Adjacent To 71 Eliot Drive St Germans Saltash Cornwall PL12 5NL
Description: Outline Application for the construction of a bungalow
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of it appearing cramped and incongruous in its setting would fail to protect  and enhance the character and appearance of the immediately adjacent  St Germans  Conservation Area;  and it would  fail to respect and enhance the attractive, open quality  of its wider locality.  As such the proposed development  would conflict with Policies  2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the advice within paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.   2 The proposal would  fail to provide private garden areas of sufficient size and amenity for occupants of both the proposed  and host dwellings.  As such the proposed development  would conflict with Policies  12 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016;  the advice at Section 5.5 of the Cornwall  Design Guide 2013;  and the advice of the National Design Guide 2019 at paras 129 - 130.

Address: Land Adj To Chy An Elow Harris Mill Illogan Cornwall TR16 4JG
Description: Outline application for:-Proposed development of 6 residential dwellings.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the established  settlement  of Illogan  and does not represent infill or rounding  off as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030.  The development therefore represents  an undesirable and sporadic  extension of the built form into the countryside  which will lead to the erosion  of the character and appearance  of the natural environment. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify  residential development in this context, the proposal would not provide a suitable site for housing because  of the conflict with the policies of the development plan and the harm to the character and appearance of the area. In particular the proposal would conflict  with Policies 1,2, 3, 7, 9, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 -2030 and policies Policy PH 1a, Policy  PH 1b, Policy  PH3 and Policy  PEH1 of the Illogan Parish Neighbourhood  Development plan and paragraphs 11, 127, 130 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 which seek in this respect, amongst other things, to ensure that proposals maintain and respect the special  character of areas, recognising  that all urban and rural landscapes, designated  or undesignated,  are important.

Address: Land South East Of Wringsdown Yeolmbridge Launceston Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved: Erection of detached dwelling (access)
RefusalReasons: 1 This proposal, by causing the loss of a tall section of stone-clad earth bank (i.e. a 'Cornish Hedge') adjacent  to an historic  sunken lane, and its replacement with an engineered suburban-style layby and vehicular access,  would  harmfully degrade local landscape character and distinctiveness.  As such the proposal conflicts with Policies 2, 12, 23  of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2016.

Address: Cove View Riviere Towans Phillack Hayle Cornwall TR27 5AF
Description: Construction of Extension, Alterations & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development comprises the conversion of a modest  two-bedroom  chalet into a two-storey four-bedroom dwelling. The site parameters are extremely constrained with vehicle  and pedestrian access passing the living quarters of the neighbouring  property which  immediately  adjoins the access. The proposed parking provisions  would not allow sufficient space  for the parking and turning of occupants and visitor's vehicles leaving,  resulting in vehicles  having to reverse in excess of 60 metres  along a shared private  access road. The intensified residential  use would  result in an increase in the number of vehicle  movements and pedestrian activity along this road harming the living  conditions of the occupiers  of neighbouring  properties with particular reference to No. 32 Cove View. The proposal  would therefore  conflict  with policy  SD2 of the Hayle  Neighbourhood Plan 2014 - 2030, policies 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 170 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 which  together seek to provide adequate parking; protect individuals and property  from unreasonable  noise and disturbance by creating places with appropriate  densities  which are safe, inclusive and accessible; and promote  health and well-being with a high standard of amenity for existing and future users. 2 The proposed development includes  an extension of the hard standing situated within the rear garden  to accommodate an increased number  of vehicles using the site. Due to the sloping  topography, the enlarged parking area and parked vehicles would be elevated above the wide stretch of incredibly scenic open coastline to the north-west of the site appearing extremely  prominent from the public right of way route code 102/29/4 which is positioned  on land below and to the rear of the development  site. The rear gardens  serving  the dwellings along Riviere Towans  are characterised by their long and unobstructed  rear gardens  which provide panoramic views over the coastline  below. The inclusion of the low hedge which attempts to conceal the harmful  urban appearance of the enlarged vehicle parking  area would adversely impact the openness  of this garden,  appearing at odds with the prevailing landscape character. The proposed development would therefore  fail to respond positively to its setting,  adversely  impacting the character  and appearance of this attractive landscape in conflict with policies  SD2 and NE3 of the Hayle Neighbourhood  Development  Plan 2014 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Arundell The Avenue Truro Cornwall TR1 1HT
Description: Erection of a single storey flat roof extension with two solar panels mounted on the roof.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, which is visible from public vantage points  from within  the Truro Conservation Area, would by virtue of the introduction of modern solar panels in conjunction with the flat roof, fail to respond positively to the historic local character and distinctiveness of the streetscene  resulting in harm to the character and appearance of the conservation  area contrary to Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990. The harm identified would not be outweighed by the public benefits to carbon reduction  or the economy through construction and would also be contrary to policy  C1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan, policies  2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph  127 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Barn Braggs Hill Boyton PL15 9RG
Description: Outline application (with all matters reserved) for construction of two residential dwellings (demolition of barn/storage sheds)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings, by reason of their location  outside of any defined settlement, do not round  off or infill a settlement and visually extend the built form into the countryside eroding the character and appearance of this part of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal  represents an unsustainable  and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence  of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 (November  2016).

Address: Tregantle Kimberley Park Road Falmouth TR11 2DF
Description: Conversion of loft to provide kitchen, dining and living room for top floor flat by extending ridge and forming gable
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the introduction of a gable end roof elevation to 'Tregantle'  (51 Dracaena Avenue) which is the end property of a uniform terrace  of 9 dwellings currently book ended  by hipped roofs at no 35 Dracaena Avenue  and 'Tregantle', would have a detrimental  visual impact on the immediate streetscene,  contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies  DG2 on design (Development generally) and DG8 (Development within the setting of a Conservation Area) of the emerging Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan, as well as Policy 12 of the Cornwall LocaI  Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Crift Farm Lanlivery Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5DE
Description: Retention of building for use for storage of garden machinery and equipment and as a children's play room
RefusalReasons: 1 The playroom/garden  store by reason of its scale, design and siting extends the built form of the nearby  sporadic form of dwellings into the countryside  to the detriment of the distinctive natural beauty and character of the Area of Great Landscape Value.  The application  is, therefore, contrary  to the aims of Policies  1, 2,  12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 12,  130 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019,  saved Policy  14 of the Restormel Local Plan and Policies LGEN1- presumption  in favour of sustainable development,  Gen2 - Design  and Character  - LLNE1- Local Landscape Character and LLNE2-  Biodiversity of the Lanlivery  Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Land Off B3285 Trevellas St Agnes TR5 0XX
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for proposed residential development up to no. 11 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by virtue of its lack of integration with Trevellas, scale and prominent  location would result in an unacceptable  level of harm to the character of the rural setting and this harm  would not be outweighed  by the benefits of the provision of open market or affordable  housing  and their associated economic and social benefits.  The proposal  thus conflicts with Cornwall Local Plan policies  1, 2, 3 and 12, St Agnes  Neighbourhood Development Plan policy 10 and paragraphs 170 (b) and 173 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The submitted information is insufficient  to enable  the local planning authority to assess the impacts on protected species or to determine whether  the site is contaminated and is thus unable to ensure the site is remediated to a standard suitable for residential  occupancy. The proposal  thus conflicts with Cornwall  Local Plan 2010-2030 policies 23 and 13, policy  12 of the St Agnes  Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraphs  175 and 178 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 3 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of affordable housing, off site education  infrastructure, contributions towards  the Strategic  Access Management and Monitoring Measures for the Penhale Dunes SAC for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal  is considered to be contrary to policies 8, 9, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan, guidance contained within  paragraphs 34, 54, 56,57, 62, 175 and 176  of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Wheal Owles Lane Truthwall Botallack TR19 7QN
Description: Construction of a single affordable dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 Whilst the development is considered to be affordable housing-led on balance,  it is considered  to be poorly-related to the physical form of Truthwall and to be inappropriate in scale and character,  given that it does not directly  adjoin the built form of the settlement and would contribute towards  a coalescence of the sporadic collection of buildings  to the west with the settlement. The proposal  is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 2, 9 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 2 By reason of occupying an exposed and prominent position in the local landscape which would consolidate the sporadic built form extending westward from Truthwall, the proposal is considered to neither conserve the landscape and scenic beauty  of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty, nor take into account the sensitivity and capacity  of the landscape asset. The proposal  is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019; and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management  Plan 2016 - 2021. 3 By reason of occupying a site which forms part of a large, undeveloped gap between the remnants  of the Wheal Owles mine to the west and the mining settlement of Truthwall  to the east, the proposal is considered to contribute towards a coalescence  of these two, distinct groupings of historic buildings, in turn harming  their setting and significance,  as well as the setting of the Botallack and Truthwall Conservation  Area and St Just Mining  District World  Heritage Site. The proposal is therefore  considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of S72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings  and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 184, 192, 193 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019; and policies  P3 and C7 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape  World Heritage Site Management  Plan 2013 - 2018. 4 In the absence of an ecological assessment (or similar)  which explores whether  the site and its natural boundaries  provide, or could provide, a suitable  habitat  for protected  species, the proposal is considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981, the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017; policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 17, 109 and 118 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Chace End House Truthwall Lane Truthwall St Just TR19 7PS
Description: Change of use from a workshop into a holiday let single bedroom
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would not be a sustainable location,  having particular regard to accessibility and development within  the open countryside, nor would  it conserve and enhance the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Heritage Coast.  The proposal fails to accord with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 108, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Carnkie Farm Carnkie Wendron Helston Cornwall TR13 0DU
Description: Proposed Agricultural Building
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of sufficient supporting information, it has not been demonstrated that the need for such a building of the scale and design proposed is reasonably necessary for the purposes  of agriculture. As a result, the building would  have an adverse visual  impact on the rural appearance of the area and fail to conserve the landscape and scenic  beauty  of the open countryside, which is not outweighed by the need.  The proposal is therefore contrary  to policies  1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragrap  127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of Hamilton Close Hamilton Close Truro Cornwall
Description: Residential development for the construction of six new dwellings and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal to introduce six new dwellings does not constitute  'infill' or 'rounding-off' development  in relation to the existing settlement  edge of this part of Truro and would  represent the unjustified  expansion of the built form into the surrounding countryside  which, through the sporadic  increase in built development and accompanying  paraphernalia,  would  be harmful  and erosive  to the intrinsic character  and visual amenities of the natural rural environment. In the absence  of any special  circumstances to justify it, and in the absence of any other material  considerations  which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016), Policies  E1, E4, E6 and H1 of the Truro  and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030 and paragraph 170(b)  of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Redundant Barn Hellangove Farm Gulval Penzance Cornwall TR20 8XD
Description: Conversion of agricultural barn to form dwelling house
RefusalReasons: 1 The remains of the former  Nissen hut, by reason of their scale,  condition and appearance would require significant reconstruction  in order  to facilitate  a residential use; without  such work, it would not be capable  of being  converted into a habitable dwelling. For these reasons the proposed development would  constitute the erection of a new dwelling in an unsustainable  location  in the open countryside, for which no special justification  has been presented. The proposed design with associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context would  neither preserve or enhance  the countryside  setting which  is within an AONB,  a nationally designated  landscape. The proposal  therefore  conflicts with Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 78, 127, 170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The occupiers  of the existing dwelling to the north-west at present enjoy a large garden area which is not overlooked. The proposed upper  floor windows together  with their close proximity  to the boundary  of the said property will result  in unacceptable overlooking to the detriment of the residential amenities of the occupant's contrary  to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Land North Of 42 Brockstone Road Brockstone Road St Austell Cornwall
Description: Reserved matters application for access, appearance, landscaping, layout and scale following outline approval PA16/10872 for a single dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1  The new dwelling proposed by this application, by reason of its siting, design and elevated massing,  would result  in harmful  overbearing impacts to the occupier(s) on the neighbouring property  to the west at 44 Brockstone Road.  The application  is therefore contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 The new dwelling proposed  by this application, by reason of its siting, design,  elevated massing and proximity  to nearby bungalows,  would  appear discordant and cramped within the street  scene.  The application would  therefore  harm the character of the area and is contrary  to policies  2, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 20102030 and paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Parc An West Red Lane Rosudgeon Cornwall TR20 9PU
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved: Construction of single dwelling and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  neither  round-off the settlement of Rosudgeon, nor infill a small gap in its built form, due to three of the four site edges adjoining undeveloped land with the fourth boundary adjoining an access track,  separating the existing buildings  to the north  from the application  site and would therefore constitute development in the open countryside.  The larger green  gaps in Red Lane are considered to add significantly to its character  and to allow a residential development of the site would represent further, incremental urbanisation  of a pleasant, rural lane, thereby  unacceptably  harming the character and setting of Rosudgeon and the surrounding countryside  in conflict  with the aims and intentions of policies  1,  2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The land was in use by a person/persons  with mining connections  and that as such would be regarded  as a mineworker's smallholding, of which this area has many. As such,  the field would be regarded  as an attribute that expresses the Outstanding Universal Value (OUV) of the World  Heritage  Site. It is acknowledged that the field boundary has been lost, but the site and wider environs still retain an open and undeveloped  rural character.  The development is considered  to erode some  of that character which  would  neither  conserve nor enhance the remaining legibility  of this historic land-use contrary to Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies and paragraph  184 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Pidgeon Lofts Wheal Kitty St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0RF
Description: Proposed replacement of an existing building to provide a single dwelling with detached double garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The development  results in the provision of a substantial  new dwelling in a prominent location within the St Agnes Mining District  World  Heritage Site and on a Heritage Coast. The form, scale and appearance of the proposed unit will result  in a significant urbanising impact which will detract from the character and visual amenities of the historic,  mining  landscape, and further fails to demonstrate an understanding of the setting. There  are no clear public benefits to the scheme sufficient to outweigh  the demonstrable  harm to the natural and historic environment. The development  therefore fails to accord  with policies 6, 10 and 11 of the St Agnes  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policies  12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 170, 192 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019.

Address: 41 Cliff Street Mevagissey St Austell Cornwall PL26 6QJ
Description: Listed building application, part retrospective, to replace existing rotten pitched roof over rear extension with flat amenity area; create platform at first floor level within inner yard, with spiral staircase to amenity area; replace one rotten window with timber French doors giving access to platform; replace remaining rotten windows with timber; replace rotten lintel over back door; remove part of internal partition in rear extension.
RefusalReasons: 1 The works carried out are considered to have materially harmed the significance  of the listed building  and resulted in the loss of irreplaceable historic fabric. Clear and convincing justification  for the works has not been provided and there is no clear level of public  benefit that would offset the identified harm. As a result of the character, form and materials  used the works are found to harm the character and appearance of the Mevagissey  Conservation Area. Therefore  the works are considered  contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Polices 2010-2030 and paragraphs 193 to 196 of the NPPF (February  2019).

Address: Land At Hilton Road Marhamchurch Cornwall
Description: Erection of 20 dwellings (including 30% affordable housing), public open space, access and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings visually  extend building into the open countryside beyond the built form of Marhamchurch. The site is not allocated for residential development via a made Neighbourhood Plan, is not previously developed land and does not represent infill or rounding off development. The proposal  therefore represents an undesirable  and incremental  form of residential development which erodes the character and appearance  of the countryside. In the absence of any other material  considerations  which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2(1) 3, 7, 9 and 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016). 2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of on-site affordable  housing, public open space  and off site educational financial contribution to mitigate impacts, the proposal is considered to be contrary to guidance  contained within Policies 8, 13 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraph, 54 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Connings Farm Germoe Cross Roads Penzance TR20 9RA
Description: Construction of bungalow and septic tank.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is located  outside  of any defined  settlement,  such that it is located within the open countryside  where new residential units are only permitted in special circumstances. It is considered that the proposal  does not comply  with any of the special  circumstances  and would not maintain the character  of the area within an Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty due to the proposed residential use and associated domestic paraphernalia and is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty Management  Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Garden Plot Brambleside Newquay Road Buckshead Truro Cornwall TR1 1TQ
Description: Proposed residential park home (re-submission of PA18/10099)
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside and clearly  divorced from any defined settlement.  The  proposal will introduce a new dwelling with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which  would  perpetuate over reliance on the private  vehicle  and unsustainable traffic  movements.  In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify residential  development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary  to Policies 2, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030  and paragraphs 8 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Nanturras Way Goldsithney TR20 9DG
Description: Change of use of land to campsite, erection of one ablution block and reception building.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  result  in the provision of a reception/shop/cafe building and hardstanding area to serve the carpark which would  compromise the rooting  areas of the trees on site and place pressure  for tree removal or extensive crown reduction works  in the longer  term.  This would  therefore give rise to a detrimental change in character thereby harming  the rural character and intrinsic  beauty of the immediate surrounding countryside.  The application is, therefore, not sustainable  development and is contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 83, 84, 127 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The application submissions fail to demonstrate how adequate  visibility splays for the recorded approach speeds can be achieved  taking into account the gradient on the westbound approach and its effect  on the sight stopping  distance (i.e. approaching on a downward gradient increases  the distance needed to stop a car). In the absence  of such information, the proposed development fails to demonstrate a safe and suitable access.   This would  exacerbate an existing hazardous situation for pedestrians and drivers and is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 (adopted  November 2016), Paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019 and Government guidance in the Manual for Streets.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Gwedna Cottage 64 Bosence Road Townshend Hayle Cornwall TR27 6AL
Description: Change of use of existing field to domestic curtilage and replacement two storey extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extension due to its size and design would be out of scale with the existing cottage and so harm the character and appearance of it to such a degree that it is amounts to a poor design.  Further  the cottage is a former  miners  smallholding and so contributes  to the Outstanding  Universal Value  of the World Heritage Site. The scale and design of the extension has an unacceptable impact on the original form to such a degree that it has unacceptable impact on the World Heritage Site.   It would therefore be contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2016),  advice in the National Planning Policy Framework, paras  11, 127, 184, 193 and 196, the Cornwall  Design Guide 2013, World Heritage Site Management  Plan 2013 - 2018 and World  Heritage Site SPD 2016.

Address: Eglos Cottage Access Track To Meadowvale Ludgvan Cornwall TR20 8HQ
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of land for a garden
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the use of garden (as shown outlined in red on the Site Location Plan received 30 January 2020) in connection with private dwelling house at known as Eglos Cottage has been continuous for a period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application being received. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Tregoin Lodge The Green Trewoon PL25 5TA
Description: Change of Use of detached garage (as approved in decision PA11/09377) to residential use for private rental purposes.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  introduce a new home, with its access and egress,  within Flood Zone 3 and there are alternative  sites within  the St Austell and Mevagissey Community Network Area with a lower level of flood risk which exist to provide  for the single  home  proposed  by this application.   The proposed development would not provide wider sustainability benefits to the community that outweigh flood risk and is therefore contrary  to the guidance set out within the paragraphs 155, 158 to 160 and 163 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 2, 16 and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Sheldon House Nursing Home Sea View Road Falmouth TR11 4EF
Description: Demolition of the existing building and development of 34 residential apartments (Use Class C3) with external landscaping, access, car parking and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its excessive height and unsympathetic  design the proposed building would be harmful to the character  of the Falmouth Conservation  Area contrary to Policies  1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, the requirements  of Sections  12 and 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy  DG7 of the emerging Falmouth  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030 (Submission  Version  July 2019).

Address: Wheal Rose Roche Road Bugle PL26 8PP
Description: Eight 3-bedroom semi-detached affordable houses (Plots 27-34).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed scheme would fail to be affordable housing led on a rural exception site due to the low discount  percentage proposed for the intermediate  sale dwellings and the dwellings would not be of an appropriate  size, mix and tenure to meet the range and diversity of evidenced local housing  needs  and to create a balanced sustainable community.   The proposal  would be contrary to Policy A1 of the Roche Neighbourhood Plan 2017, Policies 3, 6 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 adopted  2016 and the advice contained in the Housing SPD adopted February 2020. 2 The proposal has not been accompanied by the necessary  and relevant Phase 1 contamination and mining  report to evidence  that the future occupants of the proposed dwellings would not be at risk from ground contamination or past mining activity.  The proposal would thereby be contrary to Policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 adopted 2016. 3 The proposal has not been accompanied by an up to date ecology  survey that is relevant to the application site, setting  out if protected  species  would  be affected  by the proposal and any mitigation and recommendations necessary to avoid  adverse impacts  upon biodiversity.  The proposal would thereby be contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 adopted  2016.

Address: Land East Of Plen An Merther Radnor Road Radnor TR16 5EL
Description: Construction of single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its positioning in the direct setting  of the Grade  II listed Wheal  Peevor engine houses, which also form a Scheduled Ancient Monument and are within the Wheal Peevor World Heritage Site (WHS), coupled with its uncharacteristic design with asymmetric and excessively large openings on its principal (south)  elevation,  the proposed development would, when looking  through the site access gateway, erode the undeveloped  foreground and compete with the setting  of the engine houses  from this important public  viewpoint, thereby  causing harm. Whilst the harm caused  is considered to be less than substantial, the public benefits of a single  residential dwelling  are not considered to outweigh  this. Consequently, the proposal is considered to fail to at least preserve  the setting  of the listed engine  houses, Scheduled Monument  and WHS, and to conflict  with the aims and intentions  of S66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990;  policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  and paragraphs 127, 184, 192, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Chenhale Farm Chenhale Carharrack Redruth Cornwall TR16 5RB
Description: Retention of sand school, retention and completion of earthworks to raise ground levels and formation of earth bunds, retention and erection of stables, and continued use of land as car park and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The operational  development associated with the proposed intensification of the equestrian use of land would fail to conserve  the environmental quality and scenic beauty  of the open countryside. The inclusion of the large detached stables building  east of the existing indoor riding school are not considered to be reasonably necessary  owing to the existing redundant stables  buildings which are situated in a more discrete location, well related  to the existing built form; opportunities exist with the relevant permissions to make more efficient use of land by re-using or replacing  the existing stable  buildings. The extension to the vehicle parking  area through the provision  of a hardstanding fails to commensurate with the scale of the existing authorised  equestrian enterprise.  The outdoor  sand school  to the north of the indoor riding  school  further contributes to the urbanisation of this landscape.  When considered as a whole, the development  would harmfully urbanise the landscape by reason  of the encroachment of the built environment into the open countryside. The benefits to the existing business and the rural economy would not outweigh the significant  landscape harm identified,  failing to accord with policies EJ3, EJ7, GQD1,  GQD2 and LL4 of the Gwennap Parish  Neighbourhood  Development  Plan 2019 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 83, 84, 117, 118, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The noise associated with proposed extension of the Class D2 of the Schedule to the Town and Country  Planning (Use Classes)  Order 1987 (as amended)  land use resulting from the riders, spectators  and tanoy  systems would  adversely  impact  the residential amenities of the occupiers  of the nearby residential  dwellings. The proposal thereby fails to accord  with policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 -2030 and paragraphs 127, 170 and 180 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Mill Lawn Calstock Road Gunnislake Cornwall
Description: Hedgerow Removal Notice: To widen an existing gateway by 4 metres RHS; To move existing gateway by 2 metres LHS for better access to both fields.
RefusalReasons: 1 The hedgerows in question are considered to be important as they have existed for over 30 years and meet criteria 5(bii), 7 and 8 of Part II of Schedule 1 of the Hedgerows Regulations 1997. The removal of any section of this hedgerow will have a significant adverse impact on the natural character of the area (designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty), which is not outweighed by any clear benefit. The removal of the hedgerow would erode the landscape beauty and character, negatively impacting on the experience for users of the public footpath. The removal of the hedgerow therefore fails to comply with policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and paragraphs 170, 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Reen Cross Farm, Road From Rose To Reen Cross Goonhavern TR4 9JS
Description: The conversion of existing agricultural implement and food store to a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The building  is not appropriate  to retain and its conversion to residential use would not lead to an enhancement to its immediate setting. Given  the lack of any special justification, the application  is not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7,  21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, and paragraphs 8, 9, 78, 79, 127, and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: 12 East Close Helston TR13 8LG
Description: Construction of a single infill dwelling and formation of a new vehicle access onto adjacent highway.
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its layout and design which would  fail to respond positively to the local character and distinctiveness in this location, coupled with its close relationship in relation to neighbouring  residential development,  the proposal is considered to constitute  a poor quality form of development which would fail to take the opportunity for improving the character  and quality  of the surrounding  area and the way it functions. The proposal would therefore  conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019; and guidance  provided in section  7 of the Cornwall Design Guide. 2 By reason of its proposed  parking layout being located in close proximity to the dwelling of 12 East Close,  the proposed development is considered to unacceptably harm the outlook for the occupiers of that neighbouring  dwelling. The proposal is therefore  considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraph 127 of the National Planning  Policy Framework  2018.

Address: Halonmoor Farm Penwethers Kea Truro Cornwall TR3 6EA
Description: Temporary five year siting of touring caravan to provide shelter while working on smallholding
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of the special justification that is required for development in the open countryside, the proposed siting of a touring caravan on the site is not sustainable development  and is contrary to Policies 1, 5 and 7 the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 14 Laregan Hill Penzance TR18 4NY
Description: Proposed Alterations and Extensions to Dwelling- amended scheme of PA20/04493 to incorporate balconies.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is considered to cause significant  and demonstrable harm to the living conditions of the occupiers of the neighbouring property to the south known as The Retreat with particular  regard to overlooking and loss of privacy. The projecting balconies are considered  to significantly increase the level of overlooking  to an unaccpetable degree and the proposal  is therefore  considered to conflict with the aims and intetnions  set out within  Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Chywoon Farm B3293 Between High Street And St Keverne Beacon St Keverne TR12 6NT
Description: Outline planning permission (all matters reserved) for construction of a 2-bedroomed bungalow, replacing remains of derelict farm building on land to the west side of Chywoon Farm's garden and within the curtilage of the property.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is located  outside  of any defined  settlement,  such that it is located within the open countryside  where new residential units are only permitted in special circumstances; the proposed development  does not represent rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030 and it is considered that the proposal does not comply with any of the special circumstances  of policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030 and would harm the rural character of the area which is within an Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty; due to the proposed residential use and associated domestic paraphernalia and is therefore  contrary  to policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding  Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021

Address: Panorama 1 Barnoon Terrace St Ives Cornwall TR26 1JE
Description: Application for Certificate of Lawfulness for proposed works to boundary wall under Section 192 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) -Demolition of section of boundary wall and outbuilding.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is not considered to be permitted under the Schedule 2, Part 11, Class C of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). This is because the proposed works are for the maintenance, improvement or other alteration of the wall, and in pursuance of the powers conferred by the St Ives Article 4 Direction, permission granted for such works by the Schedule, Part 11, Class C of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, does not apply

Address: Land South East Of Chy Noweth Peguarra Close St Merryn Padstow Cornwall PL28 8PA
Description: Outline application for the construction of a single detached dwelling including access, appearance, layout and scale
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its design and layout would appear  as a cramped and contrived form of development that would neither  relate to nor reflect the character of the surrounding built environment. The proposed development would therefore  harm the character and appearance of the streetscene, thus conflicting with policies  1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 which, amongst  other aspects, require new development to be of an appropriate scale, density,  layout, height and mass with a clear understanding  and response to its landscape.  The proposal would also conflict with Paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 which require planning  decisions to ensure new developments  are visually  attractive  as a result  of good architecture and layout and establish and maintain  a strong sense  of place. 2 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its siting and scale would  have significant impacts upon the residential amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring dwellings 'Chy Noweth' and 'Cobble Stones'  by reason  of overshadowing and overbearing impacts and is therefore in conflict with Policy 12 and Policy 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of Elm Farm Nancekuke Redruth Cornwall TR16 5UF
Description: Application for permission in priciple for self build single family dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 177 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019, insofar as the policy and paragraph seek to prevent development which would  give rise to adverse effects  on the SAC. 2 The proposal lies within  an area of countryside outside of a settlement  and is not adjacent to existing  development  forming part of a settlement.  It therefore does not constitute infill or rounding off development and in the absence  of any special justification, the proposal  is not sustainable  development and is contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Gears Cottage East Gears Lane Goldsithney Cornwall TR20 9LD
Description: Construction of Detached Dwelling, Garage and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is outside of the physical boundaries of the existing settlement of Goldsithney and is therefore situated within the open countryside  as defined under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposed  development would  therefore constitute the erection of a new dwelling in the open countryside, for which no special justification has been presented. The site has a distinctly rural character which is derived from the narrow width  of the unmade access  lane which  is bound by trees and hedgerows and the absence  of footpaths  along  much of its length, as well as fields to the east, north, south-west  and beyond the applicants property  to the west.  The introduction of a new dwelling and its associated domestic paraphernalia would fail to protect the open countryside  and the significance  of the World  Heritage Site. The proposed development  conflicts with the aims and intentions  set out within Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 127, 170 and Section 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Paul Lane Bungalows, Land Adj To 6 Paul Lane Bungalows Mousehole Lane Mousehole TR19 6TR
Description: Two semi-detached 3 bedroom dwellings with off road car parking
RefusalReasons: 1 Whilst the proposed development  would result in an efficient  use of land in a sustainable village location, at a time where there remains a national  need to significantly boost the supply of homes, the proposed gardens  to serve  these family-sized dwellings are considered to be disproportionately small  and would not provide functional  or attractive  areas for domestic  recreation  for adults or children (particularly dwelling B). The proposal  is therefore  considered to result in a cramped form of development which  fails to provide high-quality private spaces and in turn healthy living environments  for prospective occupants, in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 117 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 Whilst the proposed development  has attempted to respect the existing  building  line along the north-eastern side of Mousehole Lane, it would nonetheless  project  slightly forward of 1 Lynwood Cottages to the north-west.  Taken together  with its two-storey scale and gabled  north-west elevation, coupled  with the amount of parking/hardstanding to its south-west elevation  which could not reasonably  be mitigated by planting, it is considered that the proposal  would  unacceptably harm the characteristically open and soft landscaped aspect presented to the public domain when  travelling  south-eastward along Mousehole Lane towards  the village centre. The proposal is therefore considered to be of an inappropriate scale, layout, height and mass which fails to demonstrate  a clear understanding and response to its townscape  setting, in conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Starling Barn Fiddlers Green St Newlyn East Cornwall TR8 5NJ
Description: Permission in Principle for a proposed construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is not a form of development  for which Permission in Principle can be granted because it is Habitats  Development  in the context of the Conservation of Habitats  and Species Regulations 2017  and is explicitly  excluded  under paragraph 5B.'(1) b) of the Town and Country Planning (Permission in Principle) Order 2017 (as amended).

Address: Land North Of Sunrays Old Mine Lane St Anns Chapel Cornwall PL18 9HN
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the continued use of storage of fairground equipment and vehicles base for travelling fair operators.
RefusalReasons: 1 The Local Planning Authority does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land at Land North Of Sunrays, Old Mine Lane, St Anns Chapel, Cornwall, PL18 9HN has been used for the storage of fairground equipment and vehicles base for travelling fair operators, for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: 2 Rose Hill Rosehill Goonhavern TR4 9JU
Description: The phased development of 2no 3bed and 1no 4bed detached dwellings within the garden of the existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill because Rose Hill does not meet the definition of a settlement under policy 3 as defined in paragraph 1.68  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030.  In  addition, occupants of the proposed  dwellings  would be reliant on private vehicles owing to the lack of a safe pedestrian route to the nearest settlement  of Goonhavern, and it has not been demonstrated that a safe and suitable access  to the proposed development could be provided. Therefore  the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary  to policies 1, 2, 3, 21 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Chy Karenza North Pool Road Illogan Redruth Cornwall TR15 3JQ
Description: Retention and completion of two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The change in design and the increase in the scale of the dwellings is at odds with its surroundings and neither  relates to nor reflects  the local context  in which it is situated.  The dwellings are very prominent  and are highly conspicuous in the area.  The development  has an unacceptable  impact on the character and appearance of the area and therefore conflicts  policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 130 and 131 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 2 The dwellings by reason of their bulky design,  increase in height and close proximity to the neighbouring  properties have a significant overbearing and dominant impact to the neighbouring properties  to the north  east and the south west.  The development has a poor relationship prop with the neighbouring properties and therefore fails to accord with, policy  12 of Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 3 Insufficient evidence has been provided with regards to soil contamination to demonstrate that the site is suitable for the occupation of the dwellings.  In  the absence of this information, it has not been adequately demonstrated  that the potential risk of contamination on site to the health of future residential occupants of the proposal can be adequately mitigated,  contrary to policies 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 -2030  and paragraphs 178 and 179 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of 2 Slades Road Slades Road St Austell Cornwall PL25 4EX
Description: Proposed new 2 bedroom house
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its massing, siting and form,  is shoehorned  into the plot which would lead to a building that appears  cramped and at odds with the prevailing character  of the area and a development which fails to provide sufficient  useable amenity space for a family home and the host dwelling.  The proposal,  therefore,  would result in a detrimental impact to the setting of the site and a failure  to provide sufficient amenity space for its likely and existing occupiers.   As such the application  is contrary to adopted policies  12 (1 a & b) 16 (3) and 21 (c) of the Cornwall Local Plan (2016) and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Land North East Of Three Acres Black Cross Newquay Cornwall TR8 4LU
Description: Outline planning permission for the erection of a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement. The dwelling proposed would result in the partial loss of the woodland area and introduction of built form and domestic  chattels  that would  harm the intrinsic verdant character and appearance of the site and the contribution it makes to the surrounding landscape,  and would provide residential occupiers  poor accessibility  to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance  on the private  vehicle and unsustainable  traffic movements. In the absence  of any special circumstances that justify a dwelling in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 91 102, 103, 110, 127, 148, 150, 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Porthpean Reservoir Road From Porthpean Road To Lobbs Shop Porthpean St Austell Cornwall PL26 6AZ
Description: Proposed conversion of reservoir to dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed application site, by reason of its location outside of the clearly defined built form of a settlement,  is considered to fall within  the open countryside. The proposal does not represent infill, rounding-off or make use of previously developed land within a sustainable  location and would  visually extend  the built form into the countryside,  which would  erode  and harm the intrinsic rural character and appearance  of the rural setting. In the absence  of any special circumstances to justify  residential development in this rural location,  the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2,3, 7 and  21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 79, 91, 102, 103, and 110  of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.. 2 The access to the proposal has poor visibility to the north, due to the limited land ownership and physical  constraints, large boundary hedges,  it remains unclear whether adequate  visibility could be provided.  In the absence of information indicating otherwise, the proposed  development  fails to demonstrate a safe and suitable access  can be achieved  for all users; therefore, the proposal is contrary to policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 108 of the National  Planning Policy Framework.
