Address: Trevaunance Manor Farmhouse Rocky Lane St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0NA
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for the construction of up to three dwellings following demolition of existing domestic outbuildings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is not a form of development  for which Permission in Principle can be granted because it is Habitats  Development  in the context of the Conservation of Habitats  and Species Regulations 2017  and is explicitly  excluded  under paragraph 5B.'(1) b) of the Town and Country Planning (Permission in Principle) Order 2017 (as amended).

Address: Gover Farm, The Stables Access To Gover Farm Mount Hawke TR4 8BQ
Description: Proposed conversion of garage to holiday let
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would introduce new holiday accommodation into the open countryside and due to the isolated location, future occupants of the development would be reliant upon the private vehicle  to access services, goods and facilities. The proposal  would represent an unjustified  dwelling in the countryside thereby  giving rise to sporadic and unsustainable development. The proposed development  therefore does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy 19 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development  Plan and paragraphs  79 and 83 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Cove View Riviere Towans Phillack Hayle Cornwall TR27 5AF
Description: Construction of Extension(s) & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development comprises the conversion of a modest  two-bedroom  chalet into a two-storey four-bedroom dwelling. The site parameters are extremely constrained with vehicle  and pedestrian access passing the living quarters of the neighbouring  property which  immediately  adjoins the access. The intensified residential  use of the property would result in an increase in the number of vehicle movements and pedestrian activity  along this road harming the living  conditions of the occupiers of neighbouring properties  with particular reference to No. 32 Cove View.  The proposed  development would therefore  conflict with policy SD2 of the Hayle Neighbourhood  Plan 2014 - 2030,  policies 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 170 and 180 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019 which together seek to protect individuals  and property from unreasonable noise and disturbance by creating  places  with appropriate  densities  which  are safe, inclusive and accessible, and promote health  and well-being  with a high standard of amenity for existing and future users. 2 The dwellings along Riviere  Towans are characterised  by their long and unobstructed rear gardens which provide panoramic views over the coastline below. The proposed  inclusion of planting  which is suitably  substantial  so as to conceal the harmful urban appearance  of the enlarged vehicle parking area would adversely impact the openness of this garden,  appearing as an alien feature at odds with the prevailing landscape  character. The proposed development would therefore  fail to respond positively to its setting,  adversely  impacting the character  and appearance of this attractive landscape in conflict with policy SD2 and NE3 of the Hayle Neighbourhood  Development Plan 2014 - 2030 policies  1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Store Rosecraddoc Mill Cottage Tremar Liskeard Cornwall PL14 5BU
Description: Development of a two storey self build dwelling with garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, outside of the defined settlement boundaries set out within the St Cleer Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030. The proposed dwelling therefore represents unjustified and sporadic development within the open countryside with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. The proposed new home, by reason of its siting and location and the domestification of the site that would occur would result in harm to the distinctive natural character of the surrounding Area of Great Landscape Value. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010- 2030, Policies 1 and 15 of the St Cleer Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030, Saved Policy CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan First Alteration 2007 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Chy-An-Hewas Trungle Paul Penzance Cornwall TR19 6UF
Description: Construction of annexe to replace garages
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is not considered to have a functional link with nor be of a subservient  scale to the principal dwelling  therefore failing  to represent ancillary development.  The proposed development,  by virtue  of its size, design and location fails to appear  in keeping  with the character  and appearance of the surrounding area which is designated as an Area of Great Landscape  Value. The proposal dominates  the street scene and blocks views of Trunglemoor Cottages thereby detracting from the character and appearance  of the designated  heritage asset neither preserving nor enhancing the surrounding Conservation Area. The proposed development  conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990, Policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 170 and Section 16 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019, in particular  paragraph  196 as the identified  less than substantial harm is not outweighed  by public benefits.

Address: Land South East Of Moorview Highgate Hill Indian Queens Cornwall TR9 6LQ
Description: Planning in Principle for the construction of five dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is in the countryside, some 100 metres from the nearest designated development envelope of Indian Queens, and the 5 new proposed homes, by reason of their inevitable  character and bulk, would  harm the distinctive rural character of the area.  In the absence of special  justification  to permit housing in this location, the application is contrary  to policies  1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and Housing Policy  2, Housing  Policy 3 and Housing Policy  4 of the St Enoder  Parish Neighbourhood Plan 2018-2030.

Address: Land East Of Chyvogue House Chyvogue Lane Perranwell Station Truro Cornwall TR3 7JX
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would  result  in the construction of a single dwelling  in the countryside outside the settlement of Perranwell  Station which would have an adverse urbanising effect  to the detriment of the rural character  of the location. The proposal would therefore represent an unsustainable form of development and conflict with Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030  Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 21 and the environmental sustainability aims at Section 2 and paragraph 170(b) of the National Planning Policy Framework to protect the intrinsic  value  of the countryside. 2 The proposed development would conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 177 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019, insofar as it seeks to prevent development which  would give rise to adverse effects on the SAC.

Address: Cumbletor Farm Cumble Tor Lane Trematon Saltash Cornwall PL12 4RU
Description: Variation of condition 2 of application no. PA17/07149 dated 20/09/17. Conversion of barn (formerly a dwelling) into dwelling with parking and installation of new septic tank and stock proof fence around the plot.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed conversion requires  extensive additions and alterations to enable the creation of a habitable  dwelling considered to be of a scale substantially different from the one which has been approved.  Furthermore the extensive  extensions as a result of their design and scale would  diminish  the existing simplistic form and character of the dwelling as approved under PA17/07149,  whilst harming  the character and appearance of the original barn and failing  to enhance the immediate setting of the site.  It is therefore considered that the proposed amendments to the approved scheme specifically relating to the size of the two storey  extensions, is contrary to Policies 7 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan and Paragraphs 79, 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of September Lodge Wheal Hope Goonhavern Cornwall
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for residential development of 5 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal lies within  an area of countryside outside of the urban form of a settlement and is not adjacent to existing development forming  part of a settlement. It therefore does not constitute infill or rounding off and in the absence of any special justification,  the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 3, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030, and paragraph  79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adjacent Prospect Cottage 107 Bodmin Road Truro Cornwall TR1 1BQ
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved (access and layout to be decided) for proposed dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in unacceptable harm to the sylvan character of this part of Bodmin Road by reason of the loss of and harm to trees of high visual amenity  value including the mature  Monterey Pine protected under Tree Preservation  Order C1/CK20  and the loss of visually important green space  between the existing building and the road. The proposed  development  is therefore contrary  to the relevant provisions  of Cornwall Local Plan policies 2, and 23 and Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood  Development Plan policies E4, E6 and H1.

Address: 48 Wellington Terrace Falmouth TR11 3BL
Description: Change of use from general family usage eg. storage/hobby/workshop to residential accommodation.
RefusalReasons: 1 The devlopment, would result in a material impact on the amenities of the neighbouring property  due to overlooking  resulting from the position of the building and the inclusion  of windows along the elevation  overlooking the private rear amenity  space of 49 Wellington Terrace.  The application is, therefore,  not sustainable development  and is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019. 2 The development, by reason of its design, use of colourful  cladding and uPVC fenestration neither conserves or enhances the Conservation Area. The proposal fails to accord  with Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 124 and 189-202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North East Of Woodbine Cottage Kestle Mill Newquay Cornwall TR8 4PU
Description: Permission in Principle for conversion of double garage into a single one bedroom dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The existing building lies within the open countryside, is not appropriate  to retain and its conversion to residential use would not lead to an enhancement to its immediate setting. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable  development and is contrary  to the aims and intentions  of Policies 1, 2, 7,  21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs  8, 9, 78, 79, 127, and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Rising Sun Nurseries Harrowbarrow Callington Cornwall PL17 8JD
Description: New detached three bedroom dwelling with garage and rooftop amenity space.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, in seeking the erection of a dwelling  in what is considered to be a rural location outside of any clearly  defined  settlement would fail to accord  with the Council's strategy for the delivery  of housing. As such it conflicts with Policies 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016. 2 The proposal, by reason of its large mass relative to its modest  plot size, together with its conspicuous  extensive  glazing, would  appear cramped and unsympathetically urban in appearance. As such it would fail to respect the distinctive character of its rural location or to accord with Policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.

Address: Lower Treluswell Farm Lower Treluswell Penryn TR10 9AT
Description: Conversion and extension of existing barn to dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of an ecological assessment,  which should include information on the existing wildlife interest of the site and adjacent land plus the possible impacts on them, the application fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance habitat and biodiversity.  As such, this proposal  is contrary to the aims and intentions  of Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the aims and intentions of Section 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed conversion of this former barn (cart shed)  into a dwelling in its current form is not appropriate to the setting and character  of this mid C19 building, particularly within the context of the adjacent  Listed buildings to the west, and it would not lead to an enhancement to the immediate  setting  with its extended curtilage, thus the proposed development  does not meet the aims and intentions of Policies 7 and 24 of Cornwall Structure Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and the requirements  of NPPF Sections 79, 193, 194, 196, and 197.

Address: Unit 3 & 4 Cambridge Barn New Portreath Road Redruth Cornwall TR16 4QL
Description: Reposition of approved extended dwellings known as Unit 3 & 4 Cambridge Barn (resubmission of PA20/02254)
RefusalReasons: 1 The scheme by reason of its reorientation and proposed arrangement, is at odds with the characteristic rural setting. The scheme results  in a prominent and dominant built mass on the hillside which would have a detrimental effect  on the character and appearance of the countryside setting. The scheme results in a proposed arrangement which  is contrived and does not enforce the principles of high-quality inclusive design for future occupiers  or reflect the characteristics evident in the area. The proposal would  therefore  be contrary  to Policy  7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030, Section 12, paragraph 127 and Section 15, paragraph 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the guidance  within  the Cornwall  Design Guide.

Address: Land West Of Tredar Trewint Altarnun Launceston Cornwall PL15 7TG
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for proposed local needs affordable dwelling (resubmission of previous application PA19/06499 dated 03.01.2020)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed local needs affordable dwelling  would  represent unsustainable new residential development in the open countryside that is not well related  to the physical form of the settlement of Trewint;  and would not conserve and enhance the character and distinctive landscape  quality of a large, undeveloped field within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The development is therefore  contrary to Policies  9 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Sweet Thunder Cliff Street Mevagissey PL26 6QH
Description: Listed Buidling Consent to install replacement windows to front of property
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal results in the removal of historic fabric from this grade II listed building in the conservation area that is important  to the significance of the building. The loss of this historic  fabric  has not been justified  in a clear and convincing manner  and will result in harm to the significance  of the heritage asset that is not outweighed by the public  benefits of the scheme. This would fail to  accord with the contents and intentions  of Paragraphs  184  and 192-196  of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019, Policy 24  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016)   and Policy  HC1 of the Mevagissey Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017 2 The  introduction  of new materials, the use of thicker glazing bars and double glazing,  and the overall  uniform manufactured  appearance of the proposed  windows, would cause them to appear alien, reflective,   and out of keeping with the front elevation of this historic  group listed building which itself sits in a prominent position within  the conservation area. This would  lead to a loss of character and appearance not only to the listed  buildings frontage  , but also to its surroundings and the overall Conservation Area. This would fail to accord with the contents and intentions  of Paragraphs  184  and 192-196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019,  Policy 24  of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016)  and Policy HC1 of the Mevagissey Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017

Address: Sweet Thunder Cliff Street Mevagissey PL26 6QH
Description: INSTALL REPLACEMENT WINDOWS TO FRONT OF PROPERTY
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal results in the removal of historic fabric from this grade II listed building in the Conservation Area that is important  to the significance of the building. The loss of this historic  fabric  has not been justified  in a clear and convincing manner  and will result in harm to the significance  of the heritage asset that is not outweighed by the public  benefits of the scheme. This would fail to accord with the contents and intentions of Paragraphs  184  and 192-196 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019, Policy 24  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016)   and Policy  HC1 of the Mevagissey Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2017 2 The  introduction  of new materials, the use of thicker glazing bars and double glazing,  and the overall  uniform manufactured  appearance of the proposed  windows, would cause them to appear alien, reflective  and out of keeping  with the front elevation of this historic  group listed building which itself sits in a prominent position within  the Conservation  Area. This would lead to a loss of character and appearance not only to the listed  buildings frontage,  but also to its surroundings and the overall Conservation Area.  This would  fail to accord with the contents and intentions  of Paragraphs  184  and 192-196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019,  Policy 24  of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted  22nd November 2016) and Policy HC1 of the Mevagissey Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017

Address: Land SW Of Treamble Chapel Amble Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6EW
Description: Proposed new dwelling on land adjacent to the approved dwelling Piggy Whidden.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement which would result in residential accommodation with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which  would  perpetuate over reliance on the private  vehicle  and unsustainable traffic  movements.   In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify residential  development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary  to Policies 1, 2,3, 7 and  21  of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 79, 91, 102, 103, 110, 148, 150 and 172  of the National Planning Policy Framework..

Address: 36 Hazelwood Road Callington Cornwall PL17 7EU
Description: Proposed rear extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in a material reduction in the amount of daylight reaching  the immediate  neighbouring property and its scale and massing would be unacceptably  imposing upon  the patio outdoor seating  area and living room outlook  of that neighbouring  property, leading to unacceptable detrimental impact on the amenities of neighbouring occupants through  the effects of overshadowing and overbearing  impact.  As such,  the proposed  development fails to accord with the provisions,  aims and intentions of Policies 12, 13 and 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, with particular  reference  to paragraphs 127 and 8.

Address: Land At Trenow Farm Kenegie Hill Gulval Cornwall TR20 8YN
Description: Construction of a terrace of 6 garages and driveway to link with existing approved access to road.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development will result  in the extension of the urban form in the countryside, for a domestic use unrelated  to any countryside use. The size of the garage building together with the long access drive and parking  and turning  areas would have an adverse  impact  on the character and appearance of the area. It would not enhance the natural and local environment and would  not protect the intrinsic  character and beauty of the countryside. The proposal  is contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8, 127 and 170 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development is likely to generate an increase in pedestrian traffic  on a highway lacking adequate  footways, therefore  does not provide  safe and suitable access  for all users The proposal would therefore  be contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108, 109 and 110 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: 1 Lewarne Road Newquay TR7 3JR
Description: Remove detached garage building and erect a detached annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is not viewed  as being compliant  with the Cornwall  Council Annexe  Guidance Note through its scale, massing and design.  Moreover, the proposal represents a cramped and sub-standard form of residential accommodation that fails to respond positively to local character and the wider  street scene. Rather  than adding to the overall  quality of the area and creating  an attractive place to live, it will have an unacceptable negative  impact on the visual amenity value in the immediate  locale. The above  is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2010-2030, H1 of the Newquay  Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019. 2 The proposed development, through its scale, form and massing  and proximity to the neighbouring property  '91 Porth  Bean Road'  shall incur an unreasonable  impact upon living  accommodation for '91 Porth  Bean Road'  by introducing an unacceptable level of over-bearing and loss of outlook to windows on the North Eastern elevation of 91 Porth Bean Road. This is contrary  Policy 12 Part 2(B) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030,  H1 of the Newquay  Neighbourhood  Development Plan and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Trevaz Darite Liskeard Cornwall PL14 5JL
Description: Construction of 2 dwellings with parking and turning areas.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the two storey appearance of the proposed buildings and height of the properties in contrast to the existing  neighbouring bungalow  properties along this visible frontage, would  significantly harm the pleasant character and consistent  appearance of the streetscene. The introduction of larger and taller building  forms would not sit well within the frontage which is immediately  visible on the main road through Darite,  resulting a dominant and conspicuous form of development  which fails to take account  of the neighbouring built context. The proposal therefore fails to accord with policies 8 and 15 of the St Cleer Parish Neighbourhood  Development  Plan 2020 to 2030 (July 2020) and policy  12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). 2 The proposed development, by reason of the increased  built form and close proximity of development  to the neighbouring property Chylowen, would  give rise to an unacceptable loss of light and result in an overbearing and oppressive impact to the windows  and recessed entrance  located on the western elevation  of the property. The proposal would therefore  lead to a loss of amenity to the occupiers of the neighbouring  residential property  and would  fail to accord with policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted  November 2016).

Address: Land Adjacent 50 Drump Road Redruth Cornwall TR15 1PR
Description: Outline Planning Application to erect a dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 A dwelling at this location would fail to respond positively to the local character  and historic  distinctiveness in this location, the proposal is considered to constitute a poor quality  form of development  which would fail to take the opportunity for improving the character  and quality  of the surrounding area and the way it functions. The proposal would result in coalescence between the historic built forms disrupting the historic  legibility of the area. The proposal would therefore conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2 and 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  paragraphs 127, 130, 190 and 192 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019;  and guidance provided in section 7 of the Cornwall Design Guide. 2 In the absence of sufficient information to support the application where there is considered to represent flooding concerns, it has not been demonstrated that the proposal would  minimise, reduce or where possible eliminate  flood risk on site and in the area. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 118 (b) and 149 of the National Planning Policy  Framework (2019)

Address: Land Known As Simons Yard Harrowbarrow Cornwall
Description: Outline application for the residential development of upto 4 dwellings with all matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed application site, by reason of its location outside of the clearly defined built form of Harrowbarrow, is considered to fall within  the open countryside. The proposal does not represent infill, rounding-off or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement, and would visually  extend  the built form into the countryside, eroding the character  and appearance  of the rural setting. The proposal also has the potential to detrimentally impact and urbanise  this section  of the World Heritage Site and has not been accompanied by a Heritage  Assessment. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify  it, or detailed information to confirm the site as an affordable housing led rural exception  site under policy 9, the proposal represents an unsustainable  and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence  of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary  to Policies 1, 3, 7, 9, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016). 2 The application has failed to demonstrate safe and suitable  access  to the site is achievable, with particular  regards to visibility and gradients, contrary  to the requirements of Policy  27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies  2010-2030 (adopted November 2-16)  and paragraphs 108 - 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Cobblers Cottage St Tudy Bodmin Cornwall PL30 3PX
Description: A single low-carbon self/custom build dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is divorced from the settlement with poor accessibility to necessary daily services  and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle  and unsustainable traffic movements. Furthermore, a dwelling  in this location would  introduce a new dwelling  into this part of the countryside which would be harmful to the distinctive rural character  of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances  to justify residential  development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary  to Policies 1, 2,3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 91 102, 110, 127, 148, 150 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 12 East Close Helston TR13 8LG
Description: Construction of a single detached single storey self-build infill dwelling and formation of a new vehicle access onto highway.
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its layout and design which would  fail to respond positively to the local character and distinctiveness in this location, coupled with its close relationship in relation to neighbouring  residential development,  the proposal is considered to constitute  a poor quality form of development which would fail to take the opportunity for improving the character  and quality  of the surrounding  area and the way it functions. The proposal would therefore  conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2018; and guidance  provided in section  7 of the Cornwall Design Guide. 2 By reason of its proposed  parking layout being located in close proximity to the dwelling of 12 East Close,  the proposed development is considered to unacceptably harm the outlook from, this neighbouring dwelling. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030;  and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

Address: Land West Of Field Of Birds School Lane Gulval Cornwall TR18 3BG
Description: Erection of a house and garage and associated access works
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of substantially  extending beyond any land which could potentially be described as 'previously developed' into undeveloped land at the edge of the village of Gulval, the proposal is not considered to constitute  the development of previously developed land at the edge of the settlement; rather, it is considered to physically and visually extend  development  into the open countryside without  any special  justification. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions  of policies 3(1) and 7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, and Policy  1 of the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document. 2 Owing to the large scale, height and massing  of the proposed  dwelling; its siting  on rising  ground near the highest point of the site; and the proposed works  to the access which would in turn open up views of the dwelling, access driveway and surrounding domestic  curtilage  from the public  highway, it is considered that the proposal would be inappropriate in design and layout and would unacceptably harm the distinctly rural/agricultural  character at the edge of the settlement. The proposal is therefore considered to fail to demonstrate  a clear understanding and response to its landscape setting, in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Candron Water Gweek Helston Cornwall TR12 6TX
Description: Application for Temporary retention of container at location on Land at Candon Water for 3 years which is used to store domestic goods.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is located  outside  of any defined  settlement,  such that it is located within the open countryside. It is considered that the proposal would not maintain the character of the area within  an Area of Great  Landscape Value  due to the proposed container with its domestic use introducing  development which  would be harmful to the character  of the area. The development is therefore  contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Willow Court Mornick Callington Cornwall PL17 7LU
Description: Outline application for the construction of a dwelling-house, garage and amenity with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location outside of any land considered to form the settlement of Mornick, does not represent infill, rounding-off or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining  the settlement, and would visually extend the built form into the countryside, eroding  the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special  circumstances to justify  it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development  in the countryside  and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and policy H1 of the South Hill Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030 (adopted February 2018).

Address: Seaview Holiday Village Polperro Road West Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 2JE
Description: Extension and improvements to Seaview Holiday Village caravan park, comprising use of land for the siting of 15 no. additional lodges/caravans (static caravans) for holiday use; access and parking, landscape planting and associated infrastructure.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of its loss to development of approx. 0.67ha of grassed field and the introduction of a further 15 static  caravan pitches onto prominent sloping land which  is visible from public viewpoints would  fail to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the South Coast  Eastern  section of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty.  As such it would conflict with Policies  3(4) and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2016; Policies 1 and 9 of the Polperro  & Lansallos  Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030;  and paragraphs  170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 5 Tyringham Place Tyringham Road Lelant St Ives Cornwall TR26 3LH
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for replacement of existing self contained annexe and creation of a new dwelling - resubmission of PA19/08227
RefusalReasons: 1 The large rear gardens to the rear of Tyringham Place form an important part of the Conservation Area and are recognised  as being  part of the older properties within the settlement of Lelant and within the Historic Core Boundary  as identified in the St Ives Neighbourhood  Development Plan.  There are a number  of rear gardens of similar  lengths and widths along the terrace. The addition of further fencing, parking  spaces  and additional domestic  paraphernalia  associated with the separate residential  unit proposed  would  result  in two smaller plots with very formal separation  which would substantially alter the grain of the long rear gardens seen along  Tyringham  Place and is considered  to harm the character  and appearance of the Conservation Area which would not be outweighed by the limited benefits of the proposal,  contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted  November 2016), the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019 as a whole, in particular Section 16, Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed  Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and policies BE13(a) and BE17 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2015-2030.

Address: 3 Warwick Close St Merryn Padstow Cornwall PL28 8LH
Description: Loft extension
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its excessive scale, discordant architectural form and unbalancing  of the uniformity experienced  within Warwick Close,  the proposal  is incongruous in relation to the host property  and causes unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the wider street scene. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies   2, and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development, through its scale, form and massing  and proximity to the neighbouring properties  3 and 11 Parc Eglos  shall incur an unreasonable  impact upon living  accommodation for 3 and 11 Parc Eglos  through  over-bearing  impact resulting in such a significant increase in both height and massing  in close proximity to those properties which are already  restricted in both the size and quality of their outdoor  amenity space.  This is contrary Policy 12 Part 2(B) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Little Monkeys Nursery School At Wringford Down Hotel Hatt Lane Cawsand Torpoint Cornwall PL10 1LE
Description: Proposed conversion of storage space in roof to managers flat. Construction of balcony and external staircase.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, in seeking the creation of a new dwelling  without special justification in an isolated rural location outside  of any clearly defined settlement  would fail to accord  with the Council's  strategy for the delivery of housing. As such would be an unsustainable form of development,  in conflict  with Policies 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Old Vicarage St Clement Truro Cornwall TR1 1SZ
Description: Change of use of store to unit of accommodation ancillary to the use of The Old Vicarage without compliance of condition 3 in respect of application PA15/02826 dated 01.10.2015
RefusalReasons: 1 The development  would fail to ensure adequate  residential  amenities for the future occupiers of the subject building  and the main property known  as "The Old Vicarage". The subject building  is inappropriate  for independent occupation due to the physical relationship between  the ancillary accommodation  and the main dwelling, which would create inadequate levels of residential amenity (noting the overbearing relationship and lack of separate parking  and private  amenity space) for the occupiers of both. The development therefore fails to accord with policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030 and paragraph  127 of the National Planning Policy  Framework 2019.

Address: Residential Curtilage (Large Side Garden) To Carloggas Farm Band House Lane Stenalees St Austell Cornwall PL26 8TE
Description: Permission in principle for residential development (minimum 2 dwellings / maximum 4 dwellings)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would represent unjustified housing  in the countryside which would not relate well to an existing settlement, would not be considered as previously developed land, and would harm the character  of the open countryside. The proposal would not represent infill or rounding off, does not fall within the special circumstances listed  within  policy 7, and would  increase  building density which  would be out of character with the surrounding area which would have a detrimental  impact upon the intrinsic rural character  of the area. The proposal therefore would  be contrary to policies  3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan.

Address: Whitehall Farm Wilcove Lane Wilcove Torpoint Cornwall PL11 2PQ
Description: Construction of new dwelling and conversion of existing barn to garage/play/study area. (Demolition of existing buildings).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location detached  from the clearly  defined built form of Wilcove, does not round  off or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining  the settlement, and visually extends the built form into the countryside, eroding the character  and appearance of the rural and coastal setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify  it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development  in the countryside  and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and policy 5 of the Rame Peninsula Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030 (Adopted  21st June 2017).

Address: Whitehall Farm Wilcove Lane Wilcove Torpoint Cornwall PL11 2PQ
Description: Construction of new dwelling and conversion of existing barn to garage/play/study area. (Demolition of existing buildings).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling,  by reason of its location detached  from the clearly  defined built form of Wilcove, does not round  off or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining  the settlement, and visually extends the built form into the countryside, eroding the character  and appearance of the rural and coastal setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify  it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development  in the countryside  and, in the absence of any other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and policy 5 of the Rame Peninsula Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030 (Adopted  21st June 2017).

Address: Fawen Lerryn Lostwithiel Cornwall PL22 0ND
Description: To erect a Poly tunnel and glasshouses for growing of food produce and cut flowers, and for the harden of the existing gate entrance into the field for vehicular access and installation of drainage.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal introduces an uncharacteristic form of development within  a sensitive location, forming part of an Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty. In the absence of any overriding economic or social benefit, the harmful  impact anticipated upon the character of the AONB results  in the proposal  being considered an unsustainable form of development,  conflicting  with the aims and intentions of Policy 1,2 and 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 172 of the National Planning  Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Garages Rear Of 6 Trenoweth Crescent Penzance Cornwall TR18 4RY
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved: Single storey one bedroom dwelling (resubmission of PA19/06706) - Access
RefusalReasons: 1 The introduction of a new residential  unit within the curtilage of the dwelling known as no.6 Trenoweth Crescent  would  result in a cramped and contrived form of development that would appear out of keeping with the existing strong building lines in the surrounding area. The surrounding terraced dwellings with good sized front and rear gardens are an important  part of the character  of the area. The provision of a dwelling within this plot, together with the existing property and remaining curtilage to serve  it, would  result in two properties which would be at odds with the established character  and appearance of the area and would fail to respect its form and traditional pattern of development. The proposal is therefore considered to be harmful  to the character  and appearance  of the area and contrary  to Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs  8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 Due to the size of the plot, it is not considered an appropriate  site for residential development and would result  in a poor residential  environment for future occupants with a poor standard of amenity. The standard  of living space and amenity space  that could  be provided within  this constricted site would  not comply with the aims and intentions set out within local and national  planning policy. The proposed development conflicts with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: 75 Trelowarren Street Camborne TR14 8AL
Description: Construction of ground floor flat, upper floor maisonette and associated landscaping
RefusalReasons: 1 A dwelling at this location would fail to respond positively to the local character  and historic  distinctiveness in this location, the proposal is considered to constitute a poor quality  form of development  which would fail to take the opportunity for improving the character  and quality  of the surrounding area and the way it functions. The proposal would disrupt the historic legibility of the site and would therefore fail to preserve the character and special interest of the World Heritage Site and Conservation Area, leading to harm which would  not be outweighed by the public benefit. The proposal would therefore  conflict  with the aims and intentions  of policies 1, 2 and 12 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 127, 130, 190 and 192 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019; Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation  Areas) Act 1990; and guidance provided in section 7 of the Cornwall  Design Guide. 2 The proposal, by reason of its design and mass together with its proximity to the occupiers of adjoining neighbouring  dwellings, leads to an overbearing and overlooking impact  which constitutes a poor quality form of development, being  detrimental to residential amenities  which would  be contrary to the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 127 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 In the absence of sufficient technical  information  to support  the application where there  is considered to represent flooding concerns,  it has not been demonstrated that the proposal would minimise,  reduce or where possible eliminate flood risk on site and in the area. The proposal  is therefore  considered to conflict  with the aims and intentions of policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 118 (b) and 149 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019)

Address: 8 Cobbs Well Fowey PL23 1BP
Description: Construction of two storey extension to side of existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extension due to the eave height being the same  as the host property, the proportions,  loss of gap between no.8 and no.7 and the prospective  awkward visual relationship between the roof of no. 7 and the proposed  extension would cause harm to the character and appearance of the conservation  area. It is not considered  that this less than substantial  harm has been justified against the public benefits and as such is contrary to the intentions of Paragraph  196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policy 24 Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and Policy 2 & 8 of the Fowey Neighbourhood Development  Plan.

Address: Land North East Of Tregarrick Ox Lane St Mawgan Cornwall TR8 4EU
Description: Outline application (with all matters reserved) for construction of up to 5 affordable dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The submitted development for 5 new homes is assessed to be detached from the main settlement of St Mawgan  and to be an isolated and prominent location.  The development  is assessed to cause significant  landscape harm within  the wider landscape setting. Notwithstanding  the absence of details  to demonstrate means of vehicular and pedestrian  access to serve  the site, due to the location of the site and proximity to Ox Lane, a means  of access including  visibility splays  would result  in loss of hedgebank creating significant  harm to the landscape and historic characteristics of the western boundary, and the line of trees therein. Also, the lack of any established natural barrier around  the northern, southern and eastern boundaries of this red edged  site, is assessed to cause significant harm conflicting with the character  of the Area of Great Landscape  Value  due to the open nature of the existing  field in the wider context and associated harm that the proposed introduction  of 5 new homes onto this field would have to the distinctive natural  beauty  and character of the area.  As such the development is assessed to conflict with Policies 1, 2, 2a, 3, 7, 9 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and saved Policy  14 of the Restormel  Local Plan 2001. 2 The location of this site relies on pedestrians and cyclists using Ox Lane which is a narrow steep highway that links the site with St Mawgan village centre.  The proposed location of this development would encourage pedestrians  and cycle movement in conflict with motorised traffic giving rise to increase danger for all users and creating an unacceptable highway safety impact. As such the development is assessed  to conflict with Policies  1, 16 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North West Of Bowood Park Lanteglos Camelford Cornwall PL32 9RF
Description: Proposed development of residential units - outline with some matters reserved (access applied for)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings represent an extension into undeveloped,  open countryside beyond the built form of any settlements including Camelford. The site is not allocated  for residential development  in the emerging Neighbourhood  Plan and does not represent  infill, or rounding off development or development of previously developed land adjoining a settlement.  The proposal  would  be substantially reliant  on private vehicles  for transport and would  be unsustainable in transport terms. The proposal therefore  represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of residential development in the countryside which erodes  the character and appearance of the area and, in the absence of any special circumstances or overriding business  need to justify  it in this location or other material considerations  which  outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2(1d) 3, 5, 7, 21, 23 (1) and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016),  paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, and Policy 1A (Camelford  Development Boundary) of the Neighbourhood Development  Plan for Camelford  Parish  October 2020 (which is awaiting referendum nut can be given significant  weight  in decision-making). 2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of affordable housing, public open space, healthcare provision  and educational financial contributions to mitigate impacts, the proposal is considered to be contrary to guidance  contained within Policies 8, 13 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November  2016) and paragraph, 54 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Pendean Parc East Taphouse Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4NH
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use to legitimise the planning status of Pendean Park (the subject site)
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is subject to an enforcement notice under E2/87/07898/UCU for the cessation of the use of the land for the purposes of stationing any mobile dwelling unit, therefore the use of the land for the siting of a mobile home for residential purposes cannot be lawful.

Address: Hembal Lane Farm Hembal Road Trewoon St Austell Cornwall PL25 5TD
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for mixed residential development, affordable and open market
RefusalReasons: 1 Safe and suitable access  has not been demonstrated, and cannot be demonstrated for the scale of development proposed. The access and highways infrastructure in the area is considered  to be unsuitable  for the scale of vehicle movements associated with the proposal. The path/byway  over which access  is proposed is substandard  in terms of width, forward  visibility and inter-visible passing.  The access  from the A3058 onto the Green is also of substandard width.  The  proposal would risk conflict  between byway and highways users and there is insufficient land available to provide  mitigation against these  issues.   The proposal would  thereby be contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 The site is located in the open countryside and consists of a green field site bordered by hedgerows and trees that contributes towards the distinctive rural setting of the village and the character and appearance of the area when viewed from the Byway and Public Footpath.  The proposal would see the removal of a section of hedge and trees and loss of the green open space to development.  The site does not integrate well with the built up part of the settlement  with only a small proportion  of the site boundary adjoining  the Trewoon Settlement Boundary and the majority of the site adjoining agricultural  land and the byway.  The proposal would thereby cause significant harm to the landscape character of the area and be contrary  to policies  1, 2, 3, 9, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 adopted 2016 and Policies  2 and 11 of the St Mewan Parish Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2016-2030 adopted 2018. 3 The application fails to comply with the habitat  directives in that there is no overriding public interest  for the proposal and there would be a disturbance to foraging and commuting  bats.  The application  is therefore  contrary to policy 23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 adopted  2016;   paragraphs 174 and 175 of the NPPF 2019; the Conservation of Habitat and Species Regulations; Circular 06/2005 and Policy 3 of the St Mewan Parish Neighbourhood Development  Plan 2016-2030  adopted 2018. 4 A Section  106 legal agreement  has not been entered  into to secure the necessary affordable housing, public  open space and education contributions  to mitigate harm from this proposal. The proposal would thereby be contrary to Policies 3, 9, 13 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted 2016) and the advice within  the National Planning  Policy Framework.

Address: Land North West Of Highertown Chilsworthy Cornwall PL18 9PB
Description: Redevelopment of barn to dwelling with associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The existing building(s)/structure(s) are not considered to be suitably constructed for conversion and are considered  incapable of conversion without substantial demolition/reinforcement/rebuilding operations; and the proposed  redevelopment is therefore  considered tantamount  to the construction of a new dwelling in open countryside for which no special justification has been provided in planning terms. As such,  the proposed  redevelopment  does not accord with the provisions,  aims and intentions of Policy  7 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, with particular reference to paragraph  79. 2 The overall  design of the proposed  redevelopment does not provide a suitable response to its landscape context and, by reason of its form, scale and materials, does not reinforce the local quality and distinctiveness of this part of the World Heritage Site, nor conserve or enhance the natural  beauty  of this part of the Tamar Valley AONB,  leading to an incongruous  and less than positive addition to the landscape. As such,  the proposed redevelopment does not accord with the provisions, aims and intentions  of Policies 24, 23, 12, 1 and 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, the National  Planning Policy  Framework  2019, with particular reference to paragraphs 124, 127, 130, 170, 172, 184 and 192, Policies C2 and C7 of the Cornwall & West Devon Mining Landscape  World  Heritage Site Management  Plan 2013-2018,  and Policies 10.5.8 and 10.5.6  of the Tamar Valley Area Of Outstanding  Natural Beauty  Management Plan 2019-2024.

Address: Land North Of Pras An Mor Chymbloth Way Coverack TR12 6TA
Description: Application for reserved matter in respect of planning application PA17/01670 approval of appearance and scale.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would, due to the increase in overall height of the building result in a development that would appear  rather  bulky and prominent in appearance  in this location and detract  from the character and built form of the locality such that it is not of an appropriate height in response to its landscape and townscape setting. The proposal  would fail to preserve and enhance the local character  and distinctiveness of the Coverack  Conservation Area and would therefore  be contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 127, 170, 172, 18190, 192, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, guidance within  the sections  titled 'Design', 'Conserving  and enhancing the historic environment' and 'Natural  environment'  of National Planning  Practice Guidance, guidance within the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021  in particular Policy MD9 and guidance within the Cornwall  Council  Design Guide March 2013.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Lewannick Manor Poadsmill Hill Lewannick Launceston PL15 7QD
Description: Listed Building Consent for internal alterations, installation of lift, re-wiring, re-rendering, general refurbishment works including works to timber sliding sash windows. Construction of a two storey extension, minor alterations to layouts & re-surfacing of driveways, construction of oak framed garage within the grounds.
RefusalReasons: 1 The form, style, design  and materials  of the proposed  two storey  extension  would represent an alien addition  to this historic  building that would  result in less than substantial harm to the character, fabric and setting  of this Grade II listed building. The extension  would jar with the traditional proportions  and materials  of the main building, representing  an incongruous addition and would result  in the loss of view of a number of existing openings and a loss of view of part of the east elevation. The harm  would not be outweighed by the public benefits of the proposed development  and therefore the development is contrary  to Policies  12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and Paragraphs  184, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019.

Address: Land South Of Lower Trewedna Barn Trewedna Lane Perranwell Station Cornwall
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved for Residential development of up to 9 dwellings (access only)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed residential development  of the site would result in the loss of best and most versatile land, thereby reducing the existing and/or potential  economic and food production productivity  associated with the land and the encroachment of built form into undeveloped open countryside,  harming the natural character  and beauty of the area. It is considered  the benefits of providing affordable housing for which  the need is not fully evidenced  do not outweigh  the identified harm.  The  proposed  development  is therefore contrary to Policies 9, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 124, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of affordable housing, off site education  infrastructure, contributions towards  the Strategic  Access Management and Monitoring Measures for the Falmouth and Helford  SAC for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 8, 9, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan, guidance contained within paragraphs 34, 54, 56, 57, 62, 175 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Bealswood Cemetery Road Albaston PL18 9AJ
Description: Construction of five dwellings and extension to existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 It has not been demonstrated that the development would cause no harm to the habitat or population of bats, a species specially  protected by law. As such the development conflicts with Policy  23 of the Cornwall  Local Plan 2016 and the advice within paragraph 175 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development, by the reduction of the width of the carriageway of Cemetery Road for a length of approx.  68m that would  be caused by its entrance build-out, would impede two-way traffic and cause local traffic congestion leading to a degradation of levels  of highways safety.  Furthermore,  through  its reduction  of on-street  parking opportunities, the proposal  would  cause a significantly adverse impact upon the local road network, and in turn harmful  disruption to the operation  of: funerals at the adjacent cemetery; the Parish archive housed  in the cemetery chapel; the Parish Council's meetings in the nearby  Tamar Valley  AONB Centre; the operation of that centre itself, and the nearby Fernleigh House  Children's Centre.   As such the proposal  fails to accord with Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Square Cadgwith Ruan Minor Helston Cornwall TR12 7JX
Description: Proposed change of use from C3 dwelling (as approved PA15/04440) to a wine bar
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by virtue of its intended use as a wine bar which is within an area surrounded by residential properties  in close proximity would lead to unacceptable impacts upon the residential  amenities of neighbouring  occupiers  in terms of noise from the use of the building and odour from cooking. As such it will fail to achieve a good standard  of amenity for existing occupants contrary to policies 12 and 13 in the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030,  and paragraphs 127 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Site Of Former John Julian Depository Parka Road St Columb Road Cornwall TR9 6PF
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for residential development of up to 50 new dwellings and associated infrastructure
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not located within a main town identified in Policy  3 for the county's strategic housing growth, the site is not infill development or rounding off and is not to be sited on previously developed land. The proposal  needs to be considered as a rural exception site under  policy 9. It is considered that the proposed scale of up to 50 houses in this location  would  not be well related to the physical  form of the settlement and would  be at odds with the prevailing character in this location and would appear as inappropriate housing  encroaching  into the open landscape which would have a detrimental impact  upon the intrinsic rural character. The proposal is therefore contrary  to policy 2, 3, 9 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and policies  2, 3 and 4 of the St.Enoder Parish Neighbourhood Plan. 2 In the absence of a mechanism  to secure the provision  of affordable housing, education contributions, open space  provision onsite and off-site financial contribution, health care contributions and financial  contributions for mitigation for the Penhale  Special Area of Conservation for which there is evidence  of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 8, 13, 16, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan, guidance  contained within  paragraphs 8, 17, 61, 62, 94 and 96 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019, and CC - Guidance on s106 Planning Obligations  for Education Provision (April 2012).

Address: Flushing Methodist Church 8 Kersey Road Flushing Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5TR
Description: Conversion of former methodist church to create 3 residential apartments
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of the installation of a 1st floor structure within is a non-designated  heritage asset (NPPF  paragraph 197) which would  be visible through  existing windows from the public highway would  have a negative impact on the character and appearance of this part of the Flushing Conservation  Area contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and in addition paragraph 192 of the NPPF. 2 The proposed residential development  in the absence of any on-site  parking and minimal roadside  parking  opportunities; in a location with limited public transport opportunities to access day to day facilities and services; the proposal  development is not deemed  to be accessible in terms of satisfying  the aims and intentions of Policies 1 and 13 (3) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Rosevean Constantine Bay Padstow Cornwall PL28 8JG
Description: Permission In Principle for the demolition of a dwelling and erection of 3 dwellings with improved access from the highway
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed introduction  of 3 dwellings onto the site would result in a quantum  of development that would represent  a cramped  and overdeveloped form, where the density of development  would be out of character  and harmful to the surrounding pattern of built development in the area.  The application is therefore contrary  to Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 122, 124, 127, 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Greenhill House Delaware Road Drakewalls Cornwall PL18 9AS
Description: Application for planning permission for a residential development for a single, two-storey, 4 bedroomed, detached dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of evidence presented to demonstrate otherwise  it is not possible  to assess the full impacts of the proposed development on historic features within the site and, combined with the generic  appearance of the design and finish of the proposed  development, with little architectural  detailing  to reflect  its context in close proximity  to existing historic features, it is determined that the proposed development  would result in less than substantial harm to valuable  historic features/attributes at the site and to the Outstanding  Universal Value of the World Heritage Site to which  they make  a significant contribution,  failing to conserve or enhance this section  of the designation, and that the public  benefit  of the proposal,  being the addition  of a single dwelling to the area's  housing  stock, is not considered  sufficient  to outweigh the identified harm caused. As such, the proposed  development  fails to accord with the provisions,  aims and intentions of policies  24, 12 and 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies  C2, C6 and C7 of the Cornwall & West Devon  Mining  Landscape World  Heritage  Site Management Plan 2013-2018, Sections 4 and 7 of the Cornwall & West Devon Mining  Landscape World  Heritage Site SPD, and the National Planning Policy Framework 2019,  with particular  reference to Parts 16 and 12 and paragraphs  184, 189, 192, 199, 197, 193, 195, 196, 124, 127 and 8.

Address: Land South Of Grisdale Gardens Grisdale Gardens Illogan Cornwall TR16 4HD
Description: Application for Outline Planning permission with all matters reserved for the Construction of 3 no. dwellings.
RefusalReasons: 1 The identified application site is considered in conjunction with the adjacent  site to the north, given that, where the splitting of a site results in two sites which are physically  adjoined,  the capacity and suitability of the entire developable area will be considered for the purposes of determining  whether  it falls above or below affordable housing thresholds. In this case, in combination with the adjoining site to the north,  the scheme  exceeds the threshold for affordable housing contributions, based on floorspace, as indicated within  policy  8 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010 - 2030. In the absence of a mechanism to adequately secure the provision  of the appropriate  financial off-site contribution (in lieu of on-site provision) for affordable housing, the proposal  is considered  to be contrary to policies 6 and 8 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Southlee Nurseries Eric Road Calstock Cornwall PL18 9SH
Description: Outline application for the construction of bungalow with all matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of the location of the site in a rural location, divorced from nearby  services, facilities,  amenities, employment  and public transport,  would represent unsustainable  new residential development for which no special  need or justification has been adequately demonstrated.    Consequently, the proposal represents an undesirable  and sporadic form of residential development,  which in the absence  of any overriding justification, would undermine  and be harmful to the character and appearance of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposed development is therefore contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030  (adopted November 2016)  and Paragraphs  8, 170 and 172 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Treeve Lane Treeve Lane Connor Downs Cornwall
Description: Change of use of field to a seasonal touring caravan and camping site, including caretaker/manager and reception unit and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 Whilst the provision of a touring  caravan and camping  site may help support  the rural economy, the evidence  submitted is not sufficiently detailed to show how the identified  need is not being met by existing  facilities within the Parish.  The application is contrary  to policy 10 of the Gwinear-Gwithian  Neighbourhood Plan and the aims and intentions of policy 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 The proposal would  introduce a cluster of pitches with associated caravans, tents and cars, along  with domestic  paraphernalia which would further clutter  the site. Despite the proposals for further site landscaping,  the proposal  will result in a permanent and discernible change to the field and further detract from the character and appearance of the area. Furthermore, while the site does not fall within a designated landscape, the proposal would, nevertheless,  not accord  with the Framework policy  that decisions should contribute  to and enhance the natural and local environment by recognising the intrinsic  character  and beauty of the countryside.  The development  would result in in harm to the character  and appearance of the countryside and be contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 paragraphs 8, 83, 127 and 170 in the National Planning  Policy Framework  2019  which seek, amongst other things, to sustain local distinctiveness and the character of the landscape. 3 Insufficient evidence has been provided to demonstrate that the proposal can be adequately serviced in respect of foul and surface water  drainage arrangements.   In the absence of acceptable information,  the proposal is contrary to policies 16 and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and paragraph 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land South Of Clowance House Clowance Estate Praze An Beeble Camborne Cornwall TR14 0PT
Description: Retrospective planning for the construction of a tree house holiday accommodation unit which has been built in replacement of a previously existing tree house at Clowance Estate.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application involves the provision of a new residential unit in the countryside,  detached from any definable settlement containing  the necessary facilities required to support day-to-day occupation. The proposal therefore  represents  a sporadic form of development, which would encourage the use of a private motor vehicle, contrary  to environmental  aspects of the presumption  in favour of sustainable development. Furthermore,  the development incurs  significant harm to the immediate setting and surrounding natural  environment, which is currently absent residential  units, with existing holiday lodges  physically and visually separated from the subject  site to the north. Notwithstanding  the intended use as holiday accommodation,  the modest associated  economic  benefits  of this single unit do not outweigh the unsustainable location, also taking  into account  the clear harm to the natural  qualities of the setting. The proposal  is therefore  considered contrary to policies 1, 2, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies  HT1, HT4, EP1 and HLE1 of the Crowan  Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030  and paragraphs  83, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Jolly Park Casey Lane Pelynt Cornwall
Description: Reserved Matters application for the construction of 34 dwellings (including affordable housing). Details for Phase 1 of outline application PA12/10700 dated 26/01/2017.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed reserved matters  as a result of their poor layout, bland appearance and lack of landscaping would result in a fixed,  standardised, uniform and inward looking development  that would bear little resemblance to the more positive  aspects of existing  settlement patterns in the village, whilst also being car dominated and failing  to make effective  use of land.  The layout  offers  poor connectivity with the village, fails to integrate the route of an existing public right of way that crosses the site and fails to provide functional on-site  public open space to serve future residents.  The proposed  design of the dwellings are not locally distinctive, but instead are monotonous and characterless,  creating  a development that would lack interest and which would  fail to create a sense  of place or a development that responds  positively to local vernacular.  As such,  the proposed reserved matters are contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12, 13, 16, 21 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030; Sections 2.1, 2.3, 2.7, 2.8, 2.9, 2.10, 2.12, 4.9, 4.11, 6.5 and 7.7 of the Cornwall Design  Guide 2013 and Paragraphs 96, 98, 102, 108, 117, 124, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land And Buildings East Of The Old Carthouse Trebarvah Lane Trebarvah Perranuthnoe Penzance Cornwall TR20 9NG
Description: Erection of one dwelling together with associated works and temporary stationing of a caravan during construction
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its large scale and design which would  be at odds with the more modest and rural character of development in the historic farming  hamlet, coupled with its positioning a short distance to the south of 'The Old Potato Barn' which would give rise to unacceptable  overbearing and overshadowing impacts upon the said property, the proposal is considered to represent poor-quality design which fails to demonstrate a clear understanding  and response to its built and natural  environment  setting, in turn failing to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty  of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural  Beauty (AONB). Whilst the proposal would be situated adjacent  to a similarly  large and contemporary  dwelling in 'Seascapes'  to the south-east, this does not provide justification for further, incremental harm  to the setting  of the settlement and the AONB landscape. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies  1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 8, 127, 170, 172, 184 and 197 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019; and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall  AONB  Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Tresloe Vean Perrancoombe Perranporth Cornwall
Description: Proposed construction of two detached infill dwellings, formation of two new vehicle access points onto Perrancoombe and alterations to existing vehicle access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development does not accord with policy  12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraphs 127 and 130 of the NPPF because it would  result in the loss of and pressure to fell or prune trees within  an area of woodland protected by the Perrancombe  Tree Preservation  Order 1991 referenced C1/C91 which would harm the character of the area and biodiversity on the application site.

Address: Fleur - De - Lys Nanstallon Bodmin PL30 5LY
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for an Existing Use for a Residential Unit
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council does not consider that the evidence provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to discharge the applicant's onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land has been used for residential purposes unlawfully for a period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Indian Queens Industrial Estate, Unit 2 Lodge Way Indian Queens TR9 6TF
Description: Reinstatement of former access and formation of staff car park
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of introducing direct access  and egress  onto Moorland  Road from the Indian Queens Industrial Estate, will harm the safety of users on Moorland Road.   The application is, therefore,  contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030; Traffic Policy 1 and Traffic  Policy 3 of the St Enoder  Parish Neighbourhood Plan; and paragraphs  108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal, by reasons  of the entrance/exit  onto Moorland Road, removing part of the existing stone wall along the northern boundary of the site fronting Moorland Road and by introducing the car parking  area itself,  will harm the distinctive character of an area prominent to public view.  The application is, therefore, contrary to policies  2 and 12 of the Cornwall  Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Heckberry Barn Vollards Lane Hatt Saltash Cornwall PL12 6PT
Description: Residential development comprising 4 affordable rent 2 bed bungalows and 4 open market dwellings (two 2-bed and two 3-bed)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed residential development  of the site would result in the encroachment of the built form of the village into the undeveloped countryside, urbanising and harming  the natural character and beauty of the area.
