The proposed development  is therefore contrary  to Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030. 2 The layout of the proposed development and the open market housing types/bedroom sizes would differentiate  from the affordable  housing  and would favour the open market units and would not therefore  be affordable housing  led, and the proposed development by reason of the location of the site would  not be well related  to the physical  form of the settlement  contrary  to Policy 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and the Cornwall Council Housing Supplementary Planning Document February 2020.

Address: Land Rear Of 43 Clinton Road Park Road Redruth Cornwall TR15 2JD
Description: Construction of six residential apartments with associated parking and landscaping
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by virtue of its excessive size and design fails to demonstrate a clear understanding and respond to its setting  and would thereby  have an harmful impact on the character and appearance  of the Conservation Area, which, it follows would not be preserved or enhanced. As such the proposal  would conflict  with Section  72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Section  12 of the National  Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: Charlestown Harbour Charlestown Road Charlestown St Austell PL25 3NJ
Description: Proposed siting of a demountable timber workshop for boatbuilding and repair.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would by reason of its scale, domestic  design and its prominent siting  represent an incongruous structure within the setting of the Grade II* listed Harbour which would have a detrimental  impact upon its setting, and on the character and appearance of the Charlestown Conservation Area and would harm the Outstanding  Universal Value of the World  Heritage site. The development would represent less than substantial harm which  would not be outweighed by the public benefits. It is therefore  considered that the proposed  development does not preserve  conserve or enhance the setting  of the Grade  II* listed building  or the conservation area and therefore is contrary to Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies  2010-2030 and Paragraphs  184, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National  Planning Policy Framework  2019 and Policies P3, C2 and C7 of the World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013-2018.

Address: Land Adjacent 40 Buttlegate Downderry Cornwall
Description: Retention and completion of two dwellings, together with the provision of retaining walls to the parking/driveway and garden areas.
RefusalReasons: 1 No information has been submitted alongside this application to confirm the condition and effects of the proposed development  on the underground bunker on the site.  Furthermore, insufficient  information  has been provided in respect  of the structural  integrity of the proposed gabion basket walls and how Buttlegate  Road will be supported  on the northern boundary of the site behind  Plot 2.  In the absence  of a suitability detailed land stability  report which confirms that the proposed development  is appropriate for its location  and can be built and safely occupied without adversely impacting on the stability of the site, neighbouring land and the public highway, the application is contrary to Policies 16 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 including  Paragraphs; 108, 110, 178. 2 Insufficient information has been submitted alongside of this application to be able to make a thorough  and informed assessment  as to the height, scale,  massing, siting  and appearance of the proposed retaining structures across the entire site.  In the absence  of this information,  the proposed  development would be harmful to the character and appearance of the street  scene in this elevated and prominent  position.   The proposed  development is therefore  contrary to Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic  Policies 2010-2030, Saved  Policy CL9 of the Caradon  Local Plan First Alteration 2007 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 including Paragraph  127 and 130.

Address: 4 Peppers Court Road From Redland Mill To Baber Farm St Dominick Cornwall PL12 6TN
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for the proposed conversion of the existing attached garage to a bedroom with an en suite and dressing room.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works will not be lawful development under this certificate and will require planning permission. This is because there was a planning restriction on the original application 5/85/00586/F which removed permitted development rights. The condition stated: Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Development Orders 1977-83, no works for the enlargement, improvement or other alteration of the dwelling herby permitted (other than works which do not materially affect the external appearance of the building) shall be carried out without the express consent of the Local Planning Authority.FIRST SCHEDULE :Certificate of lawfulness for the proposed conversion of the existing attached garage to a bedroom with an en suite and dressing room.SECOND SCHEDULE:4 Peppers Court Road From Redland Mill To Baber FarmSt DominickCornwallPL12 6TN of the Parish of St. DominicPLANS REFERRED TO IN CONSIDERATION OF THIS CERTIFICATE:Existing 02.01 received 04/02/22Existing 01.001 received 04/02/22Proposed 02.02 received 04/02/22Proposed 01.002 received 04/02/22Site/location Plan 09.001 received 09/02/22NOTESAppeals to the Secretary of StateIf the applicant is aggrieved by the decision to refuse, in whole or in part (including a case in which the authority modify the description of the use, operations or other matter in the application or substitute an alternative description for that description), they may appeal to the Secretary of State under section 195 of the 1990 Act.Appeals must be made to the Planning Inspectorate using a form which can be obtained from the Planning Inspectorate at Temple Quay House, 2 The Square, Temple Quay, Bristol BS1 6PN or online at https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/planning-inspectorate A copy of the completed appeal form must also be submitted to the Council.Please Note:-If you intend to submit an appeal that you would like examined by inquiry then you must notify the Local Planning Authority and Planning Inspectorate (inquiryappeals@planninginspectorate.gov.uk) at least 10 days before submitting the appeal. Further details are on GOV.UK.(https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/casework-dealt-with-by-inquiries)

Address: Land South East Of The Cottages Binnerton Road Leedstown Cornwall TR27 6BJ
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for construction of self build sustainable dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority has acted positively and proactively in determining this application by identifying matters of concern with this proposal. On this occasion, the issues are so fundamental that it is not possible to negotiate a satisfactory way forward due to the harm that has been clearly identified within the reason(s) for refusal.

Address: Land At North Petherwin Poorhouse Hill North Petherwin Launceston Cornwall
Description: Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed Use to the siting of a mobile home structure to act as a welfare unit in relation to the commercial use of the adjacent barn. It shall be used during working hours.
RefusalReasons: Planning permission was granted for the building that is the subject of this application on the 1st of February 2017 under PA16/11657. Therefore the building cannot have legitimately changed use through Schedule 2, Part 3, Class R of the GPDO (as amended) and any proposed mobile unit of accommodation associated with a commercial use would not be lawful.

Address: Tudor Chippy Road Between Green Lane And The Square West End Marazion TR17 0EF
Description: Proposed new window and some composite timber cladding
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by virtue of its design and scale would appear prominent and inappropriate in the setting, harming the character and quality of the Marazion Conservation Area, and would materially reduce the visual quality and unique distinctiveness of the existing non-designated heritage asset. The proposed works fail to conserve or enhance the character and appearance of the existing building or the Marazion Conservation Area. The proposed works raise design concerns that cause less than substantial harm to the heritage assets but are not balanced by other factors acting in the public benefit. On this basis the proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Sections 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 8, 126, 130, 189, 195,197, 199, 200, 201, 202, 203, 206 and 207 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021; the Marazion Conservation Area Appraisal 2010 and Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 3, The Setting of Heritage Assets (2nd Edition).

Address: Roundfields Rosehill Marazion Cornwall TR17 0HB
Description: Installation of French doors and Juliet balcony on south-east elevation
RefusalReasons: The proposed Juliet balcony on the south-east gable elevation would appear totally at odds with the uniform arrangement of the fenestration previously approved. In addition, the proposed balcony is crammed into the top section of the gable end representing a poor standard of design. The proposed development is not considered to be of a high quality design nor is it considered visually attractive in conflict with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: No 1 Hill House Polgooth St Austell Cornwall PL26 7AZ
Description: Demolish existing garage and outbuilding and erect a detached bungalow with parking spaces
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its siting, massing and scale would result in development that is harmful to the character of the area and the streetscene and would appear cramped and contrived. The development is unable to provide suitable parking and amenity space for both the occupiers of the proposed dwelling and No.1 Hill House. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 (Parts 1,2) and Policy 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 124 Page 6 of 6 (d,e), 126 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy 1 of the St Mewan Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Land North Of 2 Eliot Road Truro Cornwall TR1 3TQ
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Create a building plot.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling would not integrate with the layout of the roads spurring off Hendra Road and would result in an uncharacteristic layout and density and would fail to provide continuity for the development on Carlyon Road. The proposal is thus contrary to Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010- 2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed dwelling, whether in two storey or single storey form, would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the residential amenities of the occupants of neighbouring dwellings in terms of overlooking, overbearing, overshadowing and creating an adverse sense of enclosure. The proposal is thus contrary Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and the aims at paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, the proposal would also fail to meet the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood development Plan requirement at E4 to add to the character of the area.

Address: Land Rear Of 5-7 North Parade Camborne TR14 8BJ
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for a new dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would result in the subdivision of the plots serving Nos. 5 and 7 North Parade. The extant plots act as a surviving record of the morphology of the historic mining settlement, which is a key attribute that expresses the Outstanding Universal Value of the Camborne and Redruth Mining District World Heritage Site (WHS) and makes a positive contribution to the significance of the WHS as a heritage asset. By developing the site as a separate residential unit, the plot would be severed from its historic functional relationship with the host dwellings, thereby eroding its historic character and overwriting the morphology of the historic plots to the detriment of their authenticity and legibility. The resulting harm to the significance of the WHS is graded as less than substantial, and such harm is neither wholly exceptional nor is it capable of being outweighed by any public benefit arising from the proposal. Therefore, the proposed development would conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130, 189, 197, 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies P3, C2, C9 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020 - 2025 and the guidance within the Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: Former Rojeska Tresowes Ashton Helston Cornwall TR13 9SY
Description: Demolition of dwelling and domestic garage and construction of 2 houses and domestic garages
RefusalReasons: By reason of its layout and design which would fail to respond positively to the local character and distinctiveness in this location, coupled with its close relationship in relation to neighbouring residential development, the proposal is considered to constitute a poor quality form of development which would fail to take the opportunity for improving the character and quality of the surrounding area and the way it functions. The proposal would therefore conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.The proposed development, through its scale, form and massing and proximity to the neighbouring properties of Wookham to the west and Besseys to the South would result in an unreasonable impact upon the residential amenities of the neighbouring occupiers in terms of overshadowing and overbearing impacts and overlooking and unreasonable loss of privacy. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South Of Pontsmill Cottages Pontsmill Road Pontsmill Par Cornwall
Description: The construction of an affordable detached single dwelling. Application for Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved for the construction of an affordable detached single dwelling namely access, scale and layout only.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would constitute a new dwelling in the countryside which conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policies 2, 3, 7 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 along with Policies LGEN1, GEN2 and LH1 of the Lanlivery Neighbourhood Development Plan 2218-2030. 2 The proposal would give rise to substantial harm to the significance of the World Heritage Site (WHS). As such it would be contrary to Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 which indicates that development within the WHS should accord with the Management Plan and that proposals that would result in harm to the authenticity and integrity of the Outstanding Universal Value should be wholly exceptional. It would also be contrary to paragraph 206 of the Framework where account should be taken to enhance or better reveal the significance of heritage assets along with Policy GEN2 of the Lalivery Neighbourhood Development Plan. 3 The proposal to construct a dwelling on this undeveloped space would lead to a notable degree of harm the character and appearance of the locally designated Area of Great Landscape Value. Without the benefit of a Landscape Visual Impact Assessment it cannot be demonstrated that any harm arising from the development could be mitigated. As a consequence the proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and saved Policy 14 of the Restormel Local plan along with Policies GEN2 along with Policy LLNE1 of the Lanlivery Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030. 4 Insufficient information and evidence has been provided to justify the size of the proposed dwelling and if the applicant would comply with the affordable housing occupation requirements imposed by S.106 Legal Agreement. Notwithstanding any justification provided for the size of the proposed dwelling (Homechoice does not evidence a need for this size of property), it is considered that its size would be such that it would require significant discount to be affordable for future re_x0002_sale. In light of the above assessment the proposal conflicts with Policy 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policy LH1 of the Lanlivery Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030. 5 The site falls partially within Flood Zones 2,3 and 3b and within an area susceptible to groundwater and surface water flood risk primarily due to its relationship with the Treffry Canal, Par Canal and Canal Basin running parallel with the southwest boundary. This evidence of flood risk necessitates the application of the sequential test which seeks to ensure that there are no reasonably available sites in Flood Zone 1 before the suitability of sites in Flood Zones 2 or 3 (areas with a high/highest probability of flooding) are considered, taking into account the flood risk vulnerability of land uses and applying the exception test if required. In the absence of a sequential test, it has not been demonstrated on the reasonable availability of other sites suitable for the development which are located within an area at a lower risk of flooding. As a consequence, the location of the site is not acceptable in terms of the risk of flooding, with particular regard to the sequential test. It therefore conflicts with Policies 2, 16 and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 which collectively seek to protect people from unsafe environments and potential hazards, ensure that buildings can adapt and be resilient to climate change and require development to be sited in a manner that increases flood resilience of the area, taking account of the need to avoid areas of flood risk.

Address: 2 - 4 Church Street Launceston Cornwall PL15 8AP
Description: Advertisement consent for a folded ACM with digital print to face on external elevation.
RefusalReasons: The proposed advertisement, by reason of the siting, form, design and materials would have a harmful impact on the visual amenity of the area, failing to preserve or enhance Launceston Conservation Area, whilst harming the setting of adjacent Listed Buildings.  The harm arising from the development amounts to less than substantial harm that is not outweighed by public benefits.  The application is therefore contrary to Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 126, 130, 136, 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Long Acre Binnerton Road Leedstown Hayle Cornwall TR27 6BJ
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for the erection of a dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of its location, would incrementally extend the settlement into the open countryside, harmfully urbanising the characteristics of this section of the rural landscape which contribute positively to the setting of the settlement, in conflict with the Development Plan policy concerning the location of new residential development. The proposed development therefore represents an unsustainable and undesirable form of development, unjustified by any special circumstance. In the absence of any other material considerations that outweigh the environmental harm identified, the proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of policy HT1 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of sufficient details to demonstrate that a dedicated footway can be provided to connect the site to the existing pedestrian infrastructure within the settlement, the proposal fails to provide safe and suitable access for all people to the services and facilities within the settlement and minimise the scope for conflicts between pedestrians, cyclists and vehicles. The proposed development is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of policy FAS9 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policies 1 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 110, 112 and 124 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Goonlaze Yard Ropewalk St Agnes TR5 0RB
Description: Multi use commercial building
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposes a multi-use commercial structure, with the potential for uses described as "main town centre uses" to be included, in a rural location, clearly visually and physically divorced from any established settlement. The site therefore fails to integrate effectively with any settlement and does not benefit from any range of sustainable transport modes, promoting a reliance on a private motor vehicle while also having the potential to draw visitors away from services in nearby village centres. Furthermore, the commercial use proposed is not compatible with the rural character of the area, with the proposed building and associated paraphernalia failing to conserve the landscape or demonstrate an understanding of the setting. In the absence of any overriding locational or business need for development in this context, the proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 4, 5, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies 6, 10, 14 and 15 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 84, 87 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Westpoint Droskyn Point Perranporth TR6 0GS
Description: Demolition of dwelling and erection of a replacement dwelling, parking and amenity areas
RefusalReasons: 1 The development would result in a property of significantly greater height and massing than that existing or immediately adjacent neighbouring properties, in the context of which the site is perceived. As a result, and combined with the more contemporary form and finish, the development will appear as a dominant form in the street scene which fails to demonstrate and understanding of or response to its surroundings, negatively impacting upon the character of the area. Furthermore, the increased scale and massing will cause an overbearing impact to the occupiers of the unit to the east of the site known as number 2 Droskyn Way. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South Of Greenbury Greenbury Lane Rosudgeon Cornwall
Description: Proposed commercial office and storage building
RefusalReasons: 1 The applicant has failed to demonstrate that there is an overriding locational or business need for the commercial office and storage building to be in this unsustainable countryside location, which is not widely accessible to local services, community facilities and public transport links. Such development would not encourage the use of more sustainable modes of transport such as walking and cycling. In the absence of an acceptable justification for the development in this location, the proposal would result in a modest urbanising effect on the site to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside in this location. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 5, 12, 21, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 84, 85, 110, 112, 130 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Adjacent To 1 Woodland Court Truro Cornwall
Description: Proposed construction of 3-bedroomed dwelling with off-road parking and garden amenity.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling would, by virtue of its scale and close proximity to the footway at Tremorvah Wood Lane, have an overbearing impact on part of Tremorvah Wood Lane and an adverse dominant presence within the streetscene to the detriment of the character of both Tremorvah Wood Lane and Woodland Court. The proposed windows at the north-west elevation will by virtue of their proximity to residential gardens at Monterey Gardens have detrimental impact on residential amenity through overlooking. The proposal conflicts with Cornwall Local Plan Policy 12 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The proposal would result in the partial demolition of a boundary wall which is a non-designated heritage asset of local significance to the Grade 2* listed Alverton Manor, the loss of part of the wall will have a negative impact on the evidential and social value of the wall and will detract from the streetscene as the wall forms an attractive feature at the entrance to Woodland Court. The proposal thus conflicts with Cornwall Local Plan policy 24 and paragraph 197(a) of the National Planning Policy Framework. 3 The historic wall forming the north east boundary will have a significant adverse effect on emerging visibility for vehicles leaving the site to the detriment of highways safety for pedestrians, cyclists and vehicles contrary to Cornwall Local Plan Policy 27 and paragraph 110(b) of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: The Toll House The Barns Lower Treluswell Penryn Cornwall TR10 9AT
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for construction of bungalow and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development lies in close proximity to a collection of dwellings known as 'Lower Treluswell'. The site is considered to lie within the open countryside in an unsustainable location not well served by shops and services. In addition, the proposed development when viewed from the adjacent unclassified county road to the north east would have a detrimental visual impact on the character and appearance of this area of open countryside, eroding its intrinsic character, which would outweigh the benefits of providing an open market dwelling in this location. As such the proposal would be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 80, 134 and 174 of the NPPF 2021.

Address: The Warren Buller Hill Buller Downs Redruth Cornwall TR16 6SS
Description: Retrospective planning application for a residential caravan and portable building and change of use.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would result in an unjustified sporadic residential development which has an unacceptable urbanising effect into an area that is primarily undeveloped and rural in character, undermine the character of the original dwelling, and which would have a detrimental impact upon the appearance and character of the landscape and thereby fails to protect and encourage enhancement of this particular area of countryside, contrary to Policies 2, 13 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 8, 80, 105, 126, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Part 2, Context and Built Form, of the National Design Guide Planning - practice guidance for beautiful, enduring and successful places (January 2021). 2 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement. The proposed new detached commercial unit would detached from the original dwelling and would be prominent resulting in harm to the intrinsic character of the surrounding rural setting and with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements.  Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 21 and 23 of The Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraphs 82, 84 and 85 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: The Laurels Whitstone Holsworthy Cornwall EX22 6LD
Description: Permission in Principle Application for up to 2no. Dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposal would constitute new open market residential development within a rural site and not part of a settlement.  The development cannot be considered as an appropriate form of infill as the site does not form a small gap in an otherwise continuous built-up frontage. The development is not considered to be rounding-off of a settlement. Furthermore, whilst the proposal would re-use previously developed land, the site is not within or close to a settlement or within a sustainable location. The development therefore represents an undesirable expansion of the built form into the countryside, which would lead to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. In the absence of any sufficient special circumstances which might justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 3, 7, 9 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Firste Park Winsor Lane Kelly Bray Callington Cornwall PL17 8HD
Description: Conversion of redundant former agricultural building into two dwellings, demolition of a lean-to extension and installation of a septic tank
RefusalReasons: 1 The building is not considered worthy of retention nor suitably constructed and the proposed works are considered to go beyond a conversion. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside contrary to Policies 1 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Chi An Bownder Brillwater Road Constantine Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5AJ
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the Existing use of a detached carport/garage.
RefusalReasons: 1 The erection of a detached garage at Chi An Bownder would fall under Part 1, Class E of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). As these permitted development rights on the site have been removed under Condition 8 of planning application PA15/04318, and as the garage has not been in place for four or more years, the certificate is refused and full planning will need to be applied for.

Address: Land Adj To Number 38 Cathebedron Road Carnhell Green Cornwall TR14 0NB
Description: Permission in principle for the erection of up to 2 dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposal would constitute new open market residential development in part of an agricultural field, which is read as being unmistakably rural and not part of the settlement at Carnhell Green. The development cannot be considered as an appropriate form of infill as the site does not form a small gap in an otherwise continuous built-up frontage and because it would physically extend the settlement area of Carnhell Green as defined by Map 2 of the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Plan (2016-2030), into the open countryside. The development is not considered to be rounding-off of the settlement nor would it constitute the re-use of previously developed land. Given the above, the development represents an undesirable expansion of the built form into the countryside, which would lead to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. In the absence of any sufficient special circumstances which might justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, with policy GGPP3 of the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Plan (2016-2030) and with paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 88 Meadowside Newquay TR7 2TW
Description: Demolition of existing double garage and replace with two storey dwelling complete with amenity space and parking
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposals result in significant adverse impacts to the residential amenity of the neighbouring properties known as 87 and 89 Meadowside, through loss of outlook and overbearing and overshadowing impacts. The proposals height together with its massing and position in front of and across 89 Meadowside's western elevation significantly impacts the outlook from both garden and east facing ground floor habitable rooms and by dominating their view will result in unacceptable overbearing impacts.The distance of the proposed dwelling from the existing single storey rear extension at 87 Meadowside and its height will result in both overshadowing and overbearing impacts on the garden and rear facing ground floor rooms.The scheme conflicts with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policy H2 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019-2030 which seek, amongst other matters, to ensure new development does not adversely affect the amenity of neighbouring properties. 2 The proposed scheme, by reason of its design with a flat-roof, blocky massing, and proportion of glazing on the public facing elevation, is out of keeping with its surroundings. It will create an incongruous form of development which is at odds with and detrimental to the street scene and character of the surrounding area characterised by two storey pitched roofed dwellings in a mix of brick and render, typical of 20th century estate development and the combination of limited amenity space, inadequate levels of off-road parking and failure to meet the Nationally Described Space Standards results in a proposal that is considered an over-development of the site.The proposal is contrary to and conflicts with Policies 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policies H2 and H4 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019-2030.

Address: Quay View Quay Road West Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 2ES
Description: Replacement of windows and doors to front rear and side of property.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed replacement of existing windows and doors would by reason of the use of modern, unsympathetic materials and constructional technique fail to take account of the historic context of the application site and surroundings and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Looe Conservation Area. The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016 and paragraphs 8, 130, 134, 197, 199, and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and policies TC3, TC4 and TC7 of the emerging Looe Neighbourhood Development Plan Submission Draft October 2021.

Address: Land Off Carsize Lane Leedstown Hayle Cornwall TR27 6EN
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for the erection of up to three dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its location, would incrementally extend the settlement into the open countryside, harmfully urbanising the rural characteristics of this section of the rural landscape, which contributes positively to the setting of the settlement, in conflict with the Development Plan policy concerning the location of new residential development. The proposed development therefore represents an unsustainable and undesirable form of development within the open countryside, unjustified by any special circumstance. In the absence of any other material considerations that outweigh the environmental harm identified, the proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of policy HT1 and HT4 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed development would result in the intensification of use of a narrow access lane which comprises a public byway. In the absence of sufficient technical details to demonstrate that the access lane can be improved to allow two cars to pass, the Local Planning Authority are unable to determine that safe and suitable access to the site is achievable without giving rise to increased scope for conflicts between pedestrians, cyclists and vehicles. The proposed development is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of policy FAS9 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policies 1 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 110 and 112 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 In the absence of further ecological surveys to identify the presence and impact on protected species, the Local Planning Authority are unable to assess whether the development would adversely impact on biodiversity and the ecological value of the site, with specific regard to protected species. The proposed development therefore conflicts with the aims and intentions of policy HLE1 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policies 1 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (as amended).

Address: Trevelo Farm Road From Junction Southwest Of Fern Cottage To A390 Three Burrows Blackwater TR4 8HX
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the proposed development of a conservatory.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed conservatory identified in the certificate could not be undertaken, based on the evidence submitted, on the reliance of available permitted development rights. As such, it is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed conservatory cannot be lawful, the certificate must be refused, and the applicant should apply for planning permission to undertake the proposed development.

Address: Land Rear Of Lydford Carnkie Redruth TR16 6RZ
Description: Erection of two dwellings, new access and amenity areas
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not considered to represent infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030. The scheme represents an undesirable encroachment, contrary to the linear pattern of development, and intrusion of the built form into the open, historic countryside setting to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside and setting of the Listed Buildings and World Heritage Site. The proposal would therefore fail to preserve the character and special interest of the listed buildings and World Heritage Site, leading to harm which would not be outweighed by significant public benefit. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal represents unjustified development and would be contrary to policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 120, 130, 134, 194, 195, 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Widemouth Fields Touring Park Road From A39 To Penfound Farm Poundstock Bude EX23 0NA
Description: Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for the proposed use of the site for the stationing of static caravans.
RefusalReasons: 1 The siting of static caravans is remarkably unspecific and by no means sufficiently precise to justify the grant of a lawful certificate, given the accurate and functional description of development that permits camping or touring caravans and set out within PA15/05347, and varied consent PA17/04906. On the balance of probabilities the introduction of static caravans for permanent residential use might amount to a material change to the permitted camping / touring caravan use that would require planning permission.

Address: 2 West End Square Liskeard Road Callington Cornwall PL17 7JG
Description: Erection of a garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The height and close proximity of the proposed garage to the front elevation of the neighbouring dwelling of 3 West End Square would create an overbearing sense of enclosure to the detriment of the neighbouring occupants, also creating additional overshadowing to the ground floor windows. The proposal therefore is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land West Of The Rosary Callestick Truro Cornwall TR4 9LW
Description: Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved (appearance, landscaping, layout, scale) for the proposed construction of a single dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would be within a field which, due to its rural character, is not considered to be previously developed land associated with a residential use. The development of the site, which is visible from public vantage points, would visually extend the built form of Callestick into the countryside in a location of high historic value and value to the rural setting of Callestick. The proposed development fails to meet the requirements of Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan to qualify as a Rounding-Off site and the proposed development is not supported by Policy 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan in terms of use of previously developed land or access to services. 2 The site is within the Callestick Conservation Area which is a heritage asset to which great weight should be given in ensuring that the character, appearance and setting are protected from harm. The proposed development will be visible from public vantage points and will have a harmful adverse impact on the openness of this part of the Conservation Area which contributes towards the historic setting of Callestick resulting in less than substantial harm that is not outweighed by the public benefits. The proposal will also harm the rural setting of the village due to the introduction of a dwelling and domestic setting and giving the appearance of extending the village into the countryside. The proposed development thus conflicts with Cornwall Local Plan Policies 2, 223 and 24 and paragraphs 130(a), 174(b), 189, 197 and 199 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land Between 24 And 26 St Golder Road Newlyn TR18 5QW
Description: Construction of detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The north elevation of the proposed dwelling overlooks the rear garden areas associated with two neighbouring properties known as 26 St Golder Road and 19 Quillet Road. Two balconies and a large level of glazing are proposed on the north elevation in close proximity to the boundaries of the two neighbouring properties. The balconies and glazing are considered to cause significant and demonstrable harm to the living conditions of the occupiers of the neighbouring dwellings know as 26 St Golder Road and 19 Quillet Road with particular regard to overlooking and loss of privacy in conflict with Policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Two Hoots A388 Between Dirty Lane And Junction South Of The Cardinals Hatt Carkeel PL12 6PH
Description: Change of use of workshop (general industrial class B2) to dwelling (dwelling house class C3)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by virtue of the lack of a footway or suitable crossing facility connecting the site to local services and facilities, fails to provide safe and suitable access to all users with particular regard to highway safety, resulting in conflict between pedestrians and vehicles on the highway. The application, therefore, fails to provide safe and suitable access and is contrary to Policy CON8 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020 - 2030, Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 104 - 112 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land At Pops Close Constantine Bay Padstow Cornwall
Description: Permission in Principle for the Construction of up to 5 detached dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of its location being physically separated from the defined built form of the settlement of Constantine Bay, does not round off or infill this settlement and visually extends the built form into the surrounding countryside which is designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, eroding the character and appearance of this landscape. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents additional sporadic development encroaching into the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7. 9, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016), the guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 with particular regard to paragraphs 8, 80, 174 and 176 and Policy MD9 of the AONB Management Plan 2016 - 2021.

Address: Corner Barn Access Track To Cruder Meadow Lower Boscaswell Pendeen TR19 7ER
Description: Installation of Two Timber Juliette Balcony doors with 1100mm Glazed Privacy Screen
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed enlarged openings/Juliet balconies appear incongruous and inappropriate in the context of the character and form of the existing converted barn, and the proposed works materially reduce the visual quality of the streetscape. The proposed works fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Boscaswell Conservation Area, which is located within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty The National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed Juliet balconies and associated works has been set out above. Although the private benefits and minor economic benefits of the insertion of Juliet balconies are appreciated, the proposed works would result in less than substantial harm in relation to the Conservation Area and its setting that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), 23 (paragraphs 2 , 2a and 2b) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10 and 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 126, 130, 134, 194, 197(c), 199, 202, 176, 178 and 189 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area. 2 The proposed Juliet balconies, due to their design and location, would result in an unacceptable increase in overlooking and disturbance in relation to the immediately adjacent garden area of 17 Boscaswell Village. The extremely close proximity of the proposed Juliet balconies allows for a significant increase in levels of overlooking and disturbance to the users of 17 Boscaswell Village that is considered intrusive, unreasonable and of harm beyond that of the reasonable levels of privacy currently enjoyed at this property. The proposed Juliet balconies would raise concerns relating to the impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring property that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 paragraphs 2a and 2c of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Section 2.6 (bullet point 1); Section 4.1 (bullet point 1) and Section 4.11 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 126, 130, 132 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Land West Of Faunhaven Canworthy Water Launceston Cornwall PL15 8UW
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission With Some Matters Reserve for the erection of a dwelling - all matters reserved other than access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling, by reason of its location outside of any defined settlement, does not round off or infill a settlement and visually extends the built form into the countryside eroding the character and appearance of this part of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: 8 Jubilee Place Pendeen Penzance Cornwall TR19 7SN
Description: Two storey extension with balcony.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extension, by virtue of the design, scale, orientation and materials, would appear discordant, obtrusive and inappropriate in the context of the surrounding built and natural environment. The proposed works fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Trewellard Conservation Area, which is located within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and a World Heritage SiteThe National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed two storey extension and balcony has been set out above.  Although the private benefits and minor economic benefits of the extension are appreciated, the proposed works would result in less than substantial harm in relation to the Conservation Area and its setting that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), 23 (paragraphs 2, 2a and 2b) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Policy MD9, MD16 and SCW8.04 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016 - 2021, Sections 2, 3 and 4 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; Policies AD2, AD3, AD4, BD1 and BD2 of the St Just-in-Penwith Parish Neighbourhood Plan 2021-2030; and paragraphs 126, 130, 134, 176, 178 , 189, 197(c), 199, 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.2 The proposed extension, due to its design, scale and location, results in a harmful loss of outlook in relation to the conservatory/sunroom of the adjacent neighbouring property to the southeast (9 Jubilee Place). The main northwest elevation bank of sunroom windows currently allows for a largely unhindered open outlook, with the subject two storey extension proposed to directly face the sunroom windows, and at close proximity. The currently unhindered open outlook would be replaced with a two storey blank wall and roof, with the resulting impact being regarded as detrimental to the users of the property. The proposed extension would raise concerns relating to the impact upon users of the neighbouring property that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 (paragraph 2b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Section 9 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; and paragraphs 126, 130 and 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 3 In the absence of an appropriate ecological survey, it is not possible to fully assess the potential impact of the development upon European protected species that may be present and to understand what mitigation measures may be necessary in order to address any potential adverse impacts. The application therefore fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance biodiversity, and as such is contrary to Policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the aims and intentions of paragraphs and 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land NW Of Highfield House Trewithian Portscatho Truro Cornwall TR2 5EJ
Description: Proposed erection of an agricultural building
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed barn sited within a topographically high and exposed land, through the lack of any rural business justification fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the AONB and heritage coast designated rural landscape in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 2, 5, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies LA1, LA2, GP1, GP2, CD1 and CD3 of the Roseland Local Plan 2015 and Policies MD9, SCC9.01 and SCC9.09 in the adopted AONB Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 75A Trelowarren Street Camborne Cornwall TR14 8AL
Description: Construction of ground and first floor flats, and associated landscaping
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would fail to respond positively to the historic character and distinctiveness of this location and would disrupt the historic legibility and authenticity of the site. Consequently, the proposal would result in less than substantial harm to the significance of the Camborne Conservation Area and the outstanding universal value of the Camborne and Redruth Mining World Heritage Site; the identified harm is not wholly exceptional nor is it outweighed by any substantial or overriding public benefit. It is therefore concluded that the proposal would conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2 and 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 130, 189, 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, and the guidance within the Cornwall Design Guide 2021. 2 The proposal, by reason of its design and massing together with its proximity to neighbouring dwellings, would have a harmful effect on the outlook currently enjoyed by the immediate neighbours, to the extent that the development would be overbearing. As a result, the proposal would result in a detrimental impact on residential amenity, contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Porthryn The Downs West Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 2BB
Description: Additional floor to house.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application for the creation of an additional storey to dwelling 'Porthryn' by reason of the excessive height fails to take into account the historic context of the application site and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Looe Conservation Area whilst in direct contravention of policy TC8 of the emerging Looe Neighbourhood Plan, amounting to less than substantial harm, that is not outweighed by any public benefits.  The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, the guidance within the Looe Conservation Management Plan 2009, notably section 5.1, section 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013, paragraphs 8, 126, 130, 197, 199, 200 and 201 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Heathlands Road From Lower Grumbla Road To Sancreed Road Sancreed TR20 8QP
Description: Outline application for the construction of Self Build Eco Dwelling House and Associated Works with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is located outside of the physical boundaries of any established settlement and is therefore situated within the open countryside as defined under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposed development would introduce a new unrestricted residential dwelling into the open countryside for which there are no special circumstances or justification. The dwelling would not be in a sustainable location, having particular regard to the lack of accessibility to services and facilities available locally and would give rise to dependence of future occupants on the private motor vehicle in terms of accessing such services and facilities. The proposed development would increase the urban built form and density of development on the edge of the highway within this sensitive location. The proposed increase in the urban form would neither maintain the character and distinctive landscape qualities of the Area of Great Landscape Value. Furthermore, due to the confined nature of the site, the proposal would remove the existing amenity space allocated to the neighbouring property known as Heathlands and due to the close proximity of the site to the south-east elevation of the property, the proposal would result in a poor residential environment for the occupants of Heathlands. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 13 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Land South Of The Hollies Silverwell Blackwater Cornwall TR4 8JE
Description: Conversion and extension of redundant buildings to form two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The subject buildings, by reason of their scale, are not considered suitable for conversion, given the significant extensions (proportionate to the existing buildings) required to enable the proposed residential use. Furthermore, it is not considered that the development would lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting, with the proposed form and finish, combined with paraphernalia associated with the proposed use, conversely having an urbanising effect upon the predominantly rural setting. Given the unsustainable location in the open countryside, in the absence of overriding circumstances to justify development in this context, the proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intention of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Trealwin Station Road Camelford PL32 9TX
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for an Existing Use in breach of Condition 2 (agricultural occupancy) of Application No. 21589/E (E/CM/21679) as C3 Residential Use
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the applicant has failed to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability the dwelling known as Trealwin, Station Road, Camelford has been continuously occupied in breach of the agricultural occupancy condition, for a period in excess of 10 years prior to the submission of this application.  As such a Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be granted and this application is refused.

Address: Land And Buildings Adj To Brye Cottage Sancreed Penzance Cornwall TR20 8QS
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for the Construction of a self build dwelling on previously developed land
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would not represent a suitable location for housing having regard to local and national policies, with particular regard to the effect of the proposed development on the character and appearance of the area. The application site plays a notable role in the transition from the built-up area of the village into the open countryside. As such, introducing the presence of residential built form and associated domestic paraphernalia, glazing and light pollution into this area, would considerably diminish the rural character currently provided that would not be comparable to the existing neutral and lawful use of the site. As such, the proposed development would have an adverse impact on the character and appearance of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Conservation Area designation leading to harm which would not be outweighed by any overriding public benefit and as such would conflict with Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan, Sections 1, 2, 12, 15 and 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and Policies MD5 and MD9 of the AONB Management Plan.

Address: Half Acre Mount Pleasant Boscastle Cornwall PL35 0BJ
Description: Detached two-storey building comprising a new dwellinghouse with ancillary and integral art studio. Together with visitor parking area ( 2 spaces) using existing access to highway.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, given its prominent position in the streetscene, the mass, architectural form, design and materials of the proposed dwelling, together with the layout of the proposed development which will result in signficant loss of trees which contribute to the character and appearance of the area, fails to demonstrate an understanding of or response to surroundings and local distinctiveness. The proposed development will represent a discordant and incongrous development that fails to conserve or enhance the Boscastle Conservation Area and fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the wider Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The development is therefore contrary to Policies 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016-2030 and paras 8, 130, 134, 176, 178, 194, 197 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and The Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021 2 Due to its design with large areas of glazing on the north elevation and its location in relation to neighbouring property to the north 'The Cottage', it is considered that the proposal would have significant impact upon the residential amenities of the occupiers of the property through introduced window to window overlooking contrary to expectations set out within Section 9 of The Cornwall Design Guide 2021; the The tree screening would not be sufficient to overcome this concern and as such the proposal would not accord with the Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016-203 (Adopted November 2016)

Address: Avalen St Veep Lostwithiel Cornwall PL22 0PA
Description: Redevelopment of part of former riding stables/chocolate factory to residential use including replacement of stable building with single storey dwelling over the same footprint
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would introduce new residential use into the open countryside and due to the isolated location, future occupants of the development would be reliant upon the private vehicle to access services, goods and facilities. The proposal would represent an unjustified dwelling in the countryside thereby giving rise to sporadic and unsustainable development. The proposed development therefore does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 11 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: The Longstore Charlestown Road Charlestown St Austell PL25 3NJ
Description: Retrospective permission for the retention of an existing gabion wall to include new stone cladding and raised planter.
RefusalReasons: 1 The car park structure, for which permission is sought, contains prominent features, including a gabion wall, which are strikingly modern in appearance and incongruous with the valued historic character of the surrounding Charlestown Conservation Area and World Heritage Site. The resulting harm to the identified heritage assets is not outweighed by the public benefits associated with the proposal and the application is, therefore, contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; Policies P3, P6, C2 and C8 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013-2018; Paras 7 , 17 , 57,58, 61, 136, 138, 142, 174, 175, 189, 190, 194, 195, 197- 208 of the National Planning Policy Framework 21 and Sections 66(1) and 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Minack Lodge Churchtown St Levan Penzance Cornwall TR19 6JU
Description: Construction of dwelling following demolition of existing dormer bungalow and subsequent site clearance (resubmission of application PA21/01409)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling is greater in scale and mass than the existing dwelling with a higher roofline and the inclusion of a significant level of glazing. The application site falls within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Heritage Coast and is situated on top of the western hillside of the valley in a prominent location which is readily viewed from both the surrounding road network and extensive footpath network. The increase in scale and mass of the building together with the level of glazing results in a structure which would likely draw the eye thereby intensifying the presence of the urban form within this extremely sensitive and prominent location. The proposed contemporary design is not reflective of the surrounding development and the level of glazing will highlight the development at dusk and during the hours of darkness through the very inevitable extensive lightspill/light pollution. The proposed development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty nor maintain the character and distinctive landscape qualities of the Heritage Coast in conflict with Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy MD9 and MD16 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Trewena Warbstow Launceston Cornwall PL15 8RL
Description: A new general purpose farm building and workshop
RefusalReasons: 1 Insufficient evidence has been provided to demonstrate an overriding locational or business need for a workshop and agricultural storage building in this location; and without such justification, the introduction of two buildings in this exposed and elevated field position in the countryside would not sustain local distinctiveness or character; contrary to Policies 5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016

Address: Polmenna Farm House Lane From Junction North West Of Lower Polmenna Barn To Polmenna Farm House Tregony Truro TR2 5SR
Description: Demolition of a ruined outbuilding and proposed annexe ancillary to the main house including change of use of land to domestic curtilage
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed scheme would constitute a sporadic residential development, which cannot reasonably be described as annexe accommodation due to the scale, visual and physical separation from the host dwelling, resulting in the domestication/urbanisation of the site which is located in the open countryside. The provision of a new residential unit in this circumstance, with associated paraphernalia, will result in the gradual erosion of the open countryside and significant harm to the natural, rural character of the secluded area, which is within a designated Area of Outstanding Beauty and with that harm perceived from adjacent public rights of way. With no overriding justification for development in this context, the proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies LA1, GP2, HO3 and HO9 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraphs 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Adj To Rylands Grove Lane Perran Downs Goldsithney Penzance Cornwall TR20 9HN
Description: Construction of a three bedroom dwelling with associated garden and amenities
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would appear at odds with the established character in this location thereby representing development which fails to provide continuity with the existing built form. The area is spacious and open in character and the application site is considered unable to provide a plot/building ratio which is in keeping with the prevailing character of the surrounding development. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 15 Tinney Drive Truro TR1 1AG
Description: Garage extension and drop curb
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed building will, due to its scale, height and levels differences between the site and dwelling and garden of No.11 Tinney Drive, result in a blank elevation having a harmful overbearing impact on residential amenity and resulting in a harmful level of enclosure and loss of outlook contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Crift Farm Lanlivery Bodmin PL30 5DE
Description: Application for a lawful development certificate for the existing use of the land as garden.
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability that the area of land has been continuously used for a period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application being received as garden. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Land South Of Clarenden Barn Liskey Hill Perranporth Cornwall TR6 0BB
Description: Application for outline planning permission with all matters reserved for proposed construction of up to two infill dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed outline application for two houses does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 because it would extend development into the countryside beyond the current built-form of Perranporth and by reason of its urbanising impact and built development in the countryside that is both detrimental to the rural character and appearance of the area, in an unsustainable and isolated location whos future occupiers would have high reliance on the private motor vehicle. Therefore the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 80, 134 and 174 of the NPPF 2021.

Address: Sunnydene East Taphouse Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4NQ
Description: Change of use of land for the siting of a single storey prefabricated mobile home/caravan to be used as holiday/guest accommodation
RefusalReasons: 1 The use of land for the siting of a mobile home would represent a new residential unit of accommodation/new holiday unit in the open countryside for which no special need has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents an undesirable, sporadic form of new development in the countryside. The proposal would fail to provide high quality tourist accommodation and fails to provide any environmental benefit. Furthermore, the siting of the proposed development, the resultant domestification of the site and the form, design and material finishes of a mobile home would harm the character and appearance of the Area of Great Landscape Value in which the site is located, failing to closely reflect traditional building styles, local materials and characteristic patterns of settlement. The proposal, is therefore contrary to Policies 2, 3, 5, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010 - 2030 (Adopted November 2016) and Saved Policy CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan First Alteration 2007.

Address: Land Adj To Rosemerryn St Ruan Ruan Minor Cornwall TR12 7JS
Description: Proposed construction of 4 No open market dwellings, new access, external works and landscaping.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development represents housing development outside of a main town nor would it constitute the rounding off or infill of a settlement as defined by Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 due to it comprising a large gap within the existing built form of the settlement. The proposal would physically extend St Ruan into the open countryside eroding the setting of the settlement and rural characteristics through the development of built form and loss of a part of an established boundary and natural flora to the highway verge through providing suitable levels of visibility principally from views to the South and the highway which passes through St Ruan. The proposal would result in a development that is characteristically different to the prevailing pattern and scale of development of St Ruan. Cumulatively the development would harm the landscape and scenic beauty of the AONB and would not conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty. The proposal would conflict with the aims of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 11, 80, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 23 Anthony Road Newquay TR7 2AS
Description: New single storey detached annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its design and siting, the proposed annexe would appear prominent within the existing streetscene and is at odds with the prevailing form of dwellings in the surrounding area and will be incongruous in this context. The removal of the stone boundary wall, existing planting and vegetation causes unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the wider area. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies D1, D2 and H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030, paragraphs 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposal, by reason of an overlooking impact upon the neighbouring properties 10 and 12 Anthony Road, due to the prominent siting and positioning of the first floor terrace, would be unduly harmful to the residential amenities of the occupiers of these neighbouring residences. As such, the proposal is considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010-2030 - adopted November 2016 and Section 12, particularly paragraph 130, of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Lower Trewedna Barn Trewedna Lane Perranwell Station Cornwall
Description: Outline application for proposed residential development of up to nine dwellings (revised application to PA20/03582) with some matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed residential development of the site would result in the loss of best and most versatile land, thereby reducing the existing and/or potential economic and food production productivity associated with the land and the encroachment of built form into undeveloped open countryside, harming the natural character and beauty of the area. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 126, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of affordable housing, off site education infrastructure, contributions towards the Strategic Access Management and Monitoring Measures for the Falmouth and Helford SAC for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 8, 9, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan, guidance contained within paragraphs 34, 55, 57, 58, 63, 180 and 181 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South West Of Bramble Cottage Lower Tokenbury Road Pensilva PL14 5AR
Description: Proposed new equestrian dwelling with variation of condition 3 of decision PA20/07408 dated 22/01/2021.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed revised condition would alter the nature of the development in a manner that would differ materially from the approved permission. As a result this proposal goes beyond the scope of Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and is contrary to guidance within the National Planning Practice Guidance, specifically paragraphs 001 Reference ID: 17a-001-20140306 (Revision date: 06 03 2014) and 031 Reference ID: 21a-031-20180615 (Revision date: 15 06 2018).

Address: 2 Bowglas Close Ludgvan TR20 8HH
Description: Conversion and extension of existing garage to form an annexe for holiday use
RefusalReasons: 1 The development, by virtue of its proximity to the existing dwelling, would result in unacceptable living concisions for both the occupiers of the existing dwelling and future occupants of the holiday accommodation. The provision of acceptable living conditions is a basic necessity for all dwellings, including those used for holiday accommodation. In addition, the proposed flat roofed extension would increase the size of the existing flat roofed garage in a prominent location and would not be sympathetic to the local character including the surrounding built environment. The proposed use and design would not meet a core principle of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, which requires development always to seek to secure a high quality design and good standard of amenity for all existing and future occupants of land and buildings.
