RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of its associated changes to the landscape and in turn its impact upon the existing habitats and species on the site would harm the features and function of the Notter Bridge County Wildlife Site (Ref CN9.2) as part of the wider ecological network. It is not considered that the need and benefits of the development clearly outweigh this harm. In addition, notwithstanding the submitted DEFRA Metric 3.0 computation and its inclusion of a nearby biodiversity offsetting area, the proposal fails to properly account for the loss of the wet woodland/marshy grassland priority habitat on site. Furthermore, it fails to deploy the mitigation hierarchy as required, and to specify an acceptable offsetting mechanism. As such, the proposal conflicts with Policies 1, 2, 5.3, 23(3)(c) and 23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016; Policies EM6 and GRN1 of the emergent Saltash Neighbourhood Plan; Policy G2 of the emergent Cornwall Climate Emergency Development Plan Document (Submission Version); and paragraph 174(d) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposal, through the stationing of 20 holiday lodges with associated landscape works within this wild, marshy, wet-woodland section of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty would fail to conserve and enhance the natural beauty of the landscape. As such the proposal conflicts with Policies 1, 2.1 and 23.2 (a) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraphs 176 and 177 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. There are not considered to be exceptional circumstances that override this harm. 3 In seeking to locate a more vulnerable development within Flood Zone 3b, i.e., the functional floodplain, the proposal poses an unacceptable risk to life and property from flooding in a manner that would not be resilient to climate change. This harm conflicts with Policies 2(2)b and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, emergent Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan Policy GRN4.2 (i) and (ii) and paragraphs 159 and 162 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 4 It has not been demonstrated that the existing on-site package foul drainage plant has adequate capacity to deal with the increased flows that would result from the development.  The resulting risk of contamination to the natural environment conflicts with Policies 13.5 and 16.1 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, emergent Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan Policy GRN4.2(iii)  and paragraphs 174(e) and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: 2 Council Houses Carloggas St Mawgan Newquay Cornwall TR8 4EF
Description: Proposed access and off-street parking provision
RefusalReasons: 1 The applicant does not have control over the land necessary to secure adequate visibility splays in perpetuity and no alternative practicable mechanism has been established to achieve the same. It is not therefore considered that the proposal has demonstrated that safe and suitable access can be provided and conflict therefore exists with Paragraphs 110 and 111 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Redundant Barns Trevescan Farm Trevescan Sennen Cornwall TR19 7AQ
Description: Conversion of agricultural buildings to two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 Whilst the proposed conversion of the application buildings to residential use is considered to be positively desirable, particularly in terms of ensuring the long-term viability of the vernacular granite building which has heritage value, the means by which the buildings would be converted is considered to be unacceptable in both design and amenity terms. Furthermore, the less than substantial harm caused is considered to outweigh the limited public benefits of two, open market dwellings. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 130, 189, 197 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a phase 1 contaminated land assessment (or similar), which is considered to be required in view of the former agricultural/horsicultural use of the application site and an identified contaminated land constraint, the application has failed to quantify the health risks from land contamination to the future users of the development. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 174 and 183 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: St Enodoc Golf Club Golf Course Hill Rock Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6LD
Description: Additional water storage lake.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would result in the direct loss of a sand dune habitat (biodiversity action plan habitat) for which the Camel Estuary and River System County Wildlife Site has been designated. It has not been demonstrated that the adverse impacts are unavoidable as alternatives to the loss of priority habitat have not been adequately explored. Nor has it been demonstrated that the proposed lake excavation and water abstraction will not adversely affect the hydrology of the adjacent Rock Dunes Site of Special Scientific Interest and priority habitat within the County Wildlife Site. The Phase 1 Habitat Survey identified the need for further reptile survey work which has not been submitted. Nor has the application been accompanied by the necessary invertebrate and botanical surveys undertaken in the appropriate May to October period. In the absence of the necessary survey work, there is insufficient evidence to assess the likely impact on the species and its supporting habitat. The proposal as a whole would therefore conflict with Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, the Natural Environment and Rural Communities Act 2006, the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (as amended), paragraph 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Circular 06/2005 - Biodiversity and Geological Conservation - Statutory Obligations and their Impact within the Planning System.

Address: Vellanoweth Cottage Road Between Angwinack And Lower Quarter Vellanoweth Ludgvan Cornwall TR20 8EW
Description: Partial demolition of existing conservatory and flat roof. Construction of flank extension.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extension, due to its design, scale and location, would appear as an overly-dominant, discordant and inappropriate addition that is at odds with the local vernacular, and which appears excessive and harmful in the context of an historic cottage and the settingThe proposed works raise concerns in relation to design and the historic environment that cause harm, and that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest or benefit.The proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Policy LUD7 a and b of the Ludgvan Neighbourhood Plan 2020, and paragraphs 2.1.1, 3.1, 3.2, 4.2 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021, paragraphs 130, 132, 134, 197(c) and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 2 The proposed extension, due to its design, scale and location, would result in a harmful increase in overlooking, overbearing and overshadowing in relation to the adjacent amenity area of 'Chy Lowena'By virtue of the proximity of the proposed extension relative to the adjacent garden area/summerhouse/greenhouse and patio of 'Chy Lowena', together the excessive eaves and ridge height of the structure, the proposed extension would introduce overlooking to a currently private amenity area, and would further result in a harmful increase in overbearing and overshadowing.The proposed extension would raise concerns relating to the impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring property that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is contrary to Policy 12 (paragraphs 2a and 2b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), and paragraphs 126, 130, 132 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Land At North Petherwin Poorhouse Hill North Petherwin Launceston
Description: Retrospective planning application for the Change of use of an agricultural building to use class B8 storage or distribution
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of any justification to demonstrate otherwise, there is no overriding locational or business need for a B8 storage and distribution use in this location. The proposed development does not represent sustainable development as it will contribute towards the harmful and irrevocable change to the character and appearance of the rural landscape by introducing an inappropriate scale of use in this particularly verdant and remote open countryside location. The scheme is in conflict with Policies 1,2,5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: 9 Victoria Row St Just Cornwall TR19 7LF
Description: Off-road parking area and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 In proposing the loss of, and alteration to, part of a strong, distinctive and conspicuous feature of the street scene that is of considerable historic and local interest, the proposed works result in harmful alteration to the historic form and layout of the front garden; a loss of historic fabric in the boundary wall; a reduction in the characteristic enclosure in this vicinity; a material reduction in the existing visual quality of the streetscape; and failure to preserve the character and appearance of the St Just Conservation Area, and the Outstanding Universal Value of the World Heritage SiteThe proposed removal and alteration to a substantial section of a significant wall and the construction of a vehicular access and associated parking is inappropriate, out of keeping and at odds with the setting. The proposal has a significant detrimental impact upon a strong and distinctive feature of the streetscape that would result in harm to the character and appearance of the St Just Conservation Area, and the Outstanding Universal Value of the World Heritage Site. The works are considered to raise design concerns that cause harm and that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 2 (paragraph 2.1.1), 3 (paragraphs 3.1.2, 3.2.2 and 3.3.5) and 5 (paragraph 5.8.1) of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; Policies AD2, AD3 and AD4 of the St Just-in-Penwith Parish Neighbourhood Plan 2021-2030; and paragraphs 126, 130 (paragraphs a to d), 134, 189, 197(c), 199, 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area. 2 Due to the insufficient length of the proposed parking space it is likely that a car would overhang the highway, and it would further be difficult to manoeuvre into and out of the parking space. The proposed works considered to raise highway safety concerns that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of paragraphs 110 and 112 (a) and (c) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, and Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016)

Address: Land South West Of Tregenna Barton Penstraze Chacewater Cornwall TR4 8JA
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for redevelopment of land to provide up to 2no. dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed isolated two dwellings sited on agricultural land within the countryside fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the rural landscape and represents and unsustainably located dwellings without special justification whos future occupiers would have a high reliance on the private motor vehicle as the site is not well related to public transport links, everyday shops, services and facilities in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 8, 80, 110, 112, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Policies E1, E4 and H1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015.

Address: Treetops Parklands South Drive Tehidy Camborne Cornwall TR14 0EZ
Description: Extension to existing dwelling with balcony
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of its design, scale and massing together with its proximity to neighbouring dwellings, would have a harmful effect on the immediate neighbours, to the extent that the development would be overbearing. As a result, the proposal would result in a detrimental impact on residential amenity, contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 By reason of the design, scale and massing of the extension, the proposed structure is considered to result in an overly-dominant addition to the dwelling and would appear as an incongruous feature to the detriment of the appearance of the existing dwelling, contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policy PH3 of the Illogan Neighbourhood Plan 2016-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land At Lambourne Lodge Penhallow Truro Cornwall TR4 9LQ
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for the construction of no more than two detached dwellings
RefusalReasons: The site is not within or adjacent to a settlement thus the proposal for up to two dwellings is contrary to Cornwall Local Plan Policy 3, the site is within the countryside but fails to meet any of the special circumstances set out at Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan. There would be a high reliance on the private car to access services and employment opportunities thus the site is in an unsustainable location and contrary to the sustainability aims at paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework and POlicy 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan. 2 The site is within the zones of influence for the Fal and Helford Estuaries Special Area of conservation and the Penhale Dunes Special Areas of Conservation where it is considered there would be a likely significant effect in terms of cumulative recreation pressure, when taken in combination with other plans and projects, upon these European designated sites. In the absence of a contribution or mechanism to provide a contribution to mitigate the effects of the additional recreational pressure on these special areas of conservation the proposal is contrary to Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Regulation 63 of the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017.

Address: Nero-Cane 18 The Pastures Shortlanesend Cornwall TR4 9FL
Description: Proposed roof decking and obscure glass balcony on existing flat roof extension, including formation of doorway (revised scheme of PA22/00079)
RefusalReasons: 1 The introduction of a first floor balcony of this size and design is considered to have a negative impact on the immediate character of the area. It is considered to represent poor design that fails to respect the amenity of surrounding uses, and therefore conflicts with policies 12 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 with particular regard to Section 12. 2 The development, if approved, would give rise to a detrimental impact on the neighbouring properties to the north and south of the application site namely No.16 and No.20 The Pastures, by reason of its size, siting, proximity and design. The use of the first floor as a balcony would lead to an unacceptable overbearing impact and loss of privacy to the occupants of No.20 The Pastures as well as having an overbearing impact on the amenity of the occupants of No.16 The Pastures. The level of noise and disturbance at first floor level would be significant and would affect the enjoyment of these properties, contrary to Policy 12 (2) of the CLP.

Address: Eales Barn A388 Between A38 Roundabout And Dirty Lane Carkeel Cornwall PL12 6NR
Description: Listed building consent for proposed extension to existing barn. New terraced swimming pool and garden within existing garden area.
RefusalReasons: 1 By means of it's large scale, siting and design, the proposed extension would fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Grade 2 Listed Building, being out of keeping with the features of the original building for which it was listed, and the setting of neighbouring Grade 2 Listed Building Eales Farmhouse. The excessive use of glazing and addition of domestic detailing such as the balcony detracts from the original, traditional character of the former agricultural building. The development is in conflict with the aims and intentions of paragraphs 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016)

Address: Unit 3 Penscombe Barns Road From Landue Bridge To A388 In A Southerly Direction Lezant Launceston Cornwall PL15 9NN
Description: Proposed extension to Unit 3, Penscombe Barns.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extension by reason of its scale would detract from the original proportions and simple form of this historic building which is considered to be a non-designated heritage asset resulting in an adverse visual impact upon the character and appearance of the barn. The proposal fails to lead to an enhancement of the site or its wider setting. The proposed development is therefore considered to be in conflict with Housing 1 Policy of the Lezant Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030, policies 2, 7, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Little Beckaveans Jacobstow Bude Cornwall EX23 0BN
Description: Erection of a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The scheme is not considered to represent sustainable development and is not in a suitable location for new housing development. Its introduction would result in the loss of a significant gap that provides a verdant setting between settlements; a poor, cramped and contrived housing layout of inappropriate scale that relies upon the removal of a large section of natural hedgebank, and which consequently would cause harm to the character and appearance of the Area of Great Landscape Value; contrary to policies 1,2,3,12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016 and Policy ENV1 of North Cornwall Local Plan Part 1 and Part 2 (adopted 1999).

Address: Tremearne Road Between Heamoor And Bosoljack Heamoor Cornwall TR20 8UJ
Description: The retention of an existing building used as a self-contained residential unit and storage.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not within a settlement and is therefore located in the open countryside. The proposal does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 1 and 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, or any of the special circumstances outlined in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. The building is visible from the public highway. It is sited in a sporadic location in relation to the existing development and represents an encroachment of built form into the undeveloped countryside. The presence of the building on the site with its associated domestic paraphernalia give rises to intrinsic harm to the character and beauty of the countryside. This would be at odds with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 174 of the NPPF (2021) which seek to protect the character and beauty of the countryside. Although there is a bus stop on the highway which adjoins the access lane the road is unlit and there is no pedestrian footway. The road is narrow and winding in places with no pedestrian footways and consequently is not an attractive alternative to the private vehicle. The proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 110 of the NPPF (2021). 2 The application site falls within Flood Zones 2 and 3. In the absence of a site-specific Flood Risk Assessment (FRA) the applicant has failed to demonstrate that flood risk would not be increased elsewhere, the development is appropriately flood resistant and resilient, and safe access and escape routes. The proposal fails to accord with the aims and intentions of Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 167 of the NPPF (2021). 3 The application site has been identified as potentially contaminated land. The applicant has failed to provide sufficient information to demonstrate that the site is suitable for its proposed use taking into account any risks arising from the identified contamination. The proposal fails to accord with the aims and intentions of Policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 183 and 184 of the NPPF (2021).

Address: The Old Mine Albaston Cornwall PL18 9AN
Description: Variation of Condition 2 (approved plans) and removal of Condition 11 of Application No. PA20/03591 dated 2nd December 2020 (Construction of two dwellings and associated gardens and access road)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed revision to condition 2 and removal of condition 11 of permission PA20/03591 dated 2nd December 2020 would alter the nature of the development in a manner that would differ materially from the approved permission. As a result this proposal goes beyond the scope of Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and is contrary to guidance within the National Planning Practice Guidance, specifically paragraphs 001 Reference ID: 17a-001-20140306 (Revision date: 06 03 2014) and 031 Reference ID: 21a-031-20180615 (Revision date: 15 06 2018). 2 The amended development proposed by this application to vary condition 2 and remove condition 11 of permission PA20/03591 dated 2nd December 2020 would result in an increase in the amount of vehicular traffic accessing and egressing to and from the site over the U6168/C68 priority T-junction which based on observed road speeds is substandard due to its limited emerging visibility for drivers exiting the junction and limited forward visibility for drivers approaching the junction from the south, which would contribute to an increased risk of collision and reduction in highway safety to both occupants and members of the public. The proposed application therefore, fails to provide safe and suitable access compared with the access arrangement approved and secured by condition 10 of permission PA20/03591, the proposed amended access arrangement is considered to materially diminish the quality of permission PA20/03591 by virtue of the reduced visibility splays at the proposed site access and the increased loss of hedgerow that will occur to provide visibility improvement and splays that will be detrimental to the character and appearance of the streetscene. The application and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016) and paragraphs 104 - 112, 130, 131 and 135 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 In the absence of appropriate evidence, the proposal fails to adequately demonstrate how the proposed works to the existing hedgerows to create visibility splays would impact upon any species protected by law both during and post implementation of the proposed scheme, existing trees in or adjacent to hedgerow works. In the absence of such information the Local Planning Authority is unable to assess whether adverse harm would be generated with respect to any protected species or existing trees. Hence the development is contrary to the aims of paragraphs 179-180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, guidance within the section titled 'Natural environment' of Planning Practice Guidance, together with Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: South Barn Merry Meeting Roseworthy Camborne TR14 0DS
Description: Conversion of redundant block-built workshop to form residential dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of the utilitarian form of the existing building, which does not warrant retention, together with the works associated with the development which result in the domestification of the site, the proposed development would alter and harmfully urbanise the strong rural characteristics of this section of the open countryside. As such, the proposed development fails to lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting and is therefore unjustified by any special circumstances. The proposed development is considered to give rise to a sporadic and unsustainable form of residential development within the open countryside, in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed development is accessed via a short section of unclassified highway which adjoins a Class C highway at either end. The necessary vehicular access to the site is extremely constrained due to the lack of visibility of oncoming traffic when egressing onto the Class C highway. The proposal has therefore failed to demonstrate that safe and suitable access to the site can be achieved for all users, and in view of the proposed intensification of the use of the site by vehicles, the proposed development would result in an unacceptable impact on existing levels of highway safety. The proposal is therefore contrary to policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 110 and 112 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The reason for refusal on the grounds of highway safety is in accordance with paragraph 111 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Eales Barn Carkeel Saltash Cornwall PL12 6NR
Description: Proposed extension to existing barn. New terraced swimming pool and garden within existing garden area.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extension, by reason of its size, scale and positioning within a small, restricted site would result in a dominating and cramped form of development in relation to the original dwelling/building. The proposed swimming pool and terrace would result in the extension of built form beyond the defined settlement boundary that would result in permanent built form domesticating and harming the character and appearance of the surrounding landscape and encroaching into undeveloped countryside. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy H5 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030. 2 By means of its close proximity to the boundary shared with Eales Farmhouse and it's size extending the entire length of the existing garden, the proposed extension would result in a sense of overbearing impact to the occupants of the neighbouring property, with particular reference to the outdoor amenity space. The proposed balcony, swimming pool and terrace would, by means of their position result in a degree of overlooking, resulting in a loss of privacy and due to the likely increased intensity of use and position in relation to neighbouring dwellings, the swimming pool would result in an increased level of noise and disturbance to the occupants of neighbouring dwellings over and above the existing permitted use of the land as extended domestic garden. The development fails to accord with policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016)

Address: Agricultural Building (Part Of Keverall Manor) Southshore Seaton Torpoint Cornwall PL11 3FE
Description: The siting of an agricultural livestock building.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal fails to demonstrate the site is accessible by vehicles which would be necessary in the construction and use of the building. Furthermore, the proposal would be likely to result in an increase in agricultural traffic through Keveral Gardens, leading to disruption to the immediate highway network. The proposal fails to demonstrate safe and suitable access is possible and therefore fails to accord with policies 1 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). 2 The application has failed to demonstrate that the proposed livestock building would not lead to an unacceptable impact on the amenities of neighbouring properties, with particular reference to noise, odour and flies. The proposal therefore fails to accord with policies 1, 2, 12 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). 3 The application has failed to demonstrate that there would not be an unacceptable increase in foul run-off to the nearby watercourse, which could adversely impact the bathing quality of Seaton Beach, contrary to policies 1, 2 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: The Barn New Mills Lane Truro Cornwall TR4 9EU
Description: Two-storey extension to the existing Barn at New Mills Lane.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is considered through the proposed extensions large scale, form, siting and design, would both fail to preserve the character, appearance and ethos of a non designated heritage asset of a converted barn that is not outweighed by public benefit and does not preserve the intrinsic character and natural beauty of the countryside in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Policies E1 and E4 of the adopted Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015.

Address: The Garden House The Parade Mousehole Cornwall TR19 6PP
Description: Enlargement of Existing Opening to Allow Off Road Vehicle Parking
RefusalReasons: 1 In proposing the loss of, and alteration to part of a strong, distinctive and a highly conspicuous feature of the street scene that is of considerable historic and local interest, the proposed works result in a harmful reduction in the characteristic enclosure in this vicinity; a material reduction in the existing visual quality of the streetscape; and failure to preserve the character and appearance of the Mousehole Conservation AreaThe proposed removal and alteration to a section of a highly significant wall and the construction of a vehicular access and associated parking is inappropriate, out of keeping and at odds with the setting. The proposal has a significant detrimental impact upon a strong and distinctive feature of the streetscape that would result in harm to the character and appearance of the Mousehole Conservation Area. The works are considered to raise design concerns that cause harm and that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 2 (paragraph 2.1.1), 3 (paragraphs 3.1.2, 3.2.2 and 3.3.5) and 5 (paragraph 5.8.1) of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; and paragraphs 126, 130 (paragraphs a to d), 134, 189, 197(c), 199, 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area. 2 Due to the limited width of the unclassified road that serves the proposed vehicular access; the raised concerns relating turning, manoeuvring and potentially reversing of vehicles up the narrow lane that exits onto the adjacent classified highway where visibility is constrained; and the vulnerability of these vehicles to collision, the application is considered to raise highway safety concerns that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of paragraphs 110 and 112 (a) and (c) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, and Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) 3 The proposed works would result in level changes inside the boundary wall that would cause significant damage to the roots of an adjacent Acacia tree that is one of a small number of trees within the site that remain visible from outside the garden. The proposed works would result in a detrimental impact to the provision of public amenity provided by the Acacia tree within the Mousehole Conservation Area.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of paragraph 131 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, and Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016)

Address: The Lookout Bawden Manor Farm West Polberro St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0ST
Description: Demolition of existing workshop/store and construction of replacement workshop/store including self-contained annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed scheme would constitute a sporadic residential development, which cannot reasonably be described as annexe accommodation due to the visual and physical separation from the host dwelling, resulting in the domestication/urbanisation of the site which is located in the open countryside. The provision of a new residential unit in this circumstance, with associated paraphernalia, will result in the gradual erosion of the open countryside and significant harm to the natural, rural character of the secluded area, which is within a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and with that harm perceived from adjacent public rights of way. With no overriding justification for development in this context, the proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies 1, 10 and 11 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraphs 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land To The NE Of 3 Rock Road Penzance Cornwall TR18 4PJ
Description: Proposed dwelling with attached garage and demolition of existing garage.
RefusalReasons: 1 The surrounding area is spacious and open which is due to a generous layout and low density with dwellings being served by large garden areas. The proposed dwelling would intensify the density of development which would fail to respect the existing built form and traditional pattern of development. The proposed development is cramped and contrived and will subsequently harm the character and appearance of the area in conflict with Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site falls within the Penzance Critical Drainage Area and in the absence of a Flood Risk Assessment, it has not been demonstrated that the proposed development would not result in flooding elsewhere through increase in surface water run-off in conflict with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1 and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 167 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 The proposed dwelling is sited on higher ground than the neighbouring properties to the south-east and the south-east elevation of the proposed dwelling is within close proximity to the boundaries of two neighbouring properties known as Trelorgan and Morwenna. A large protruding balcony along with window/door openings are proposed on the south-east elevation at first floor level which overlook the rear garden areas associated with Trelorgan and Morwenna. The proposed balcony and window/door openings are considered to cause significant and demonstrable harm to the living conditions of the occupiers of the neighbouring dwellings known as Trelorgan and Morwenna with particular regard to overlooking and loss of privacy in conflict with Policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Trekenning Tourist Park Access To Trekenning House Trekenning Newquay Cornwall TR8 4JF
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of land from equestrian/agricultural to leisure for Trekenning Tourist Park (Caravan Site), for a continuous period of no less than 10 years prior to the date of this application.
RefusalReasons: 1 The local planning authority considers that the applicant has failed to discharge their onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land adjacent to Trekenning Tourist Park as shown outlined in red on the Site location plan submitted to the Council on 18th March 2022 has been used as a lesiure area, continuously in excess of 10 years preceding the date of this application or more, and therefore immunity from planning enforcement has not been achieved in accordance with Section 171B (3) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Address: Land North Of Carn View Cambrose Redruth Cornwall TR16 4HT
Description: Permission in Principle: Construction of single dwelling
RefusalReasons: The application site is unmistakably rural, and visually and physically forms part of the open countryside, albeit used as garden, beyond the limits of any definable settlement. The proposed development of a single dwelling on the application site, of any form, would result in a harmful loss of the distinctively rural characteristics of the landscape character, resulting in a harmful urbanising impact, contributing to the gradual erosion of the intrinsic beauty of the open countryside. Unjustified by any overriding material considerations, the proposed development represents an undesirable and unsustainable form of development, in conflict with the aims and intentions of the Development Plan policies, which concern the location of new housing development and seek to respect landscape character, and specifically, policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policy 1 of the emerging Portreath Neighbourhood Development Plan. 2 The application site falls within the zone of influence of the Penhale Dunes Special Area of Conservation (SAC), and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to sufficiently mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which permission in principle cannot be granted. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land East Of Redway Farm Kilkhampton Bude Cornwall
Description: Permission in principle for the erection of one self build dwelling (bungalow)
RefusalReasons: The proposal would constitute new open market residential development within an unsustainable rural location which is not part of a settlement. The development cannot be considered as an appropriate form of infill as the site does not form a small gap in an otherwise continuous built-up frontage. The development is not considered to be rounding-off of a settlement. The development therefore represents an undesirable expansion of built form into the countryside, which would lead to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. In the absence of any sufficient special circumstances which might justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land North Of Polapit Farm Bungalows Werrington Launceston Cornwall PL15 9RD
Description: Conversion of Reservoir to dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works to create a dwelling require substantial building operations with the existing building not considered to be suitably constructed; and by reason of its scale and design in an exposed countryside location within the setting of an Area of Great Landscape Value, the proposal will create visually harmful built form, eroding the character and appearance of this part of the countryside. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside contrary to Policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Sunnyseven Tinners Way New Polzeath Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6UD
Description: New build replacement private residential home
RefusalReasons: 1 The site's location between two single storey pitched roof dwellings; the width of the plot; extent of proposed development; and orientation of the mono-pitched roof results in a proposal which, despite some modulation of the roadside elevation, presents a blocky aspect to the street and by virtue of its scale and massing results in a development which is disproportionate to its immediate neighbours, particularly Trevan Green and is at odds with and detrimental to the street scene and character of the surrounding area. As such, the proposal conflicts with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policy STMNDP 2.7(iv) of the St Minver Parishes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030.

Address: Land And Garage Adj To Half Moon House South Road Stithians Truro Cornwall TR3 7AD
Description: Proposed new detached dwelling to replace existing garage and subdivision of plot
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of it's form, siting and the relative location to neighbouring dwellings, does not respect the established pattern and form of development in the locality, and adversely impacts the setting of Half Moon House which is considered to comprise a non-designated heritage asset. The development will result in a discordant, incongruous and cramped form of residential accommodation, which fails to respond positively to local character or add to the overall quality of the area. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 130 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed dwelling, due to the siting, scale and massing relative to the plot and proximity to the adjacent unit to the south west, the development will result in unacceptable overbearing and overshadowing impacts to the occupiers of the neighbouring unit known as "Tremull Barns", creating an oppressive and enclosed environment. The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North West Of Rosenun Horningtops Cornwall PL14 3QE
Description: Retention of Change of Use of Land for Storage of Machinery & Parts
RefusalReasons: 1 The application fails to demonstrate that there is an overriding locational or business need for the development to be in this unsustainable countryside location, which is not widely accessible to local services, community facilities and public transport links. The scale and form of the development fails to recognise the intrinsic value and beauty of the rural landscape, designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value, and results in an industrial style development that is incongruous and out of character with the surrounding rural area, negatively impacting on the visual amenity of the area. As such the development conflicts with policies 1, 2, 5, 12, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic policies 2010- 2030, adopted November 2016, together with the provisions of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, with particular reference to Paragraphs 8, 84, 85, 110, 112 and 130.

Address: Fairfields Road Probus Truro Cornwall TR2 4HQ
Description: Conversion of existing water storage building to a residential dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed re-use of the water storage building for residential development with associated domestic curtilage, would result in harm to the natural, rural character of the surrounding area, which is characterised by a group of mature, protected trees. The subject building is not considered appropriate to retain, and the development will not enhance the setting; conversely resulting in adverse impacts to the visual amenities and character of the natural environment, given the increased prominence of the domestic form, resulting from additional openings, paraphernalia and associated movements to the site. The development therefore fails to comply with policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 79, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: 33 North Road Torpoint Cornwall PL11 2DH
Description: Change of use of store to dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed conversion and enlargement of the existing outbuilding for use as a residential dwelling is considered to represent the overdevelopment of an already compact site resulting in residential accommodation with inadequate levels of amenity space for both the host dwelling and the proposed dwelling, resulting in gardens which would have limited usability for future occupants, no outlook and would fail to provide a pleasant space for the enjoyment of the dwelling. The increased height of the building would result in a detrimental impact upon neighbour amenity in terms of overbearing impacts and overshadowing and the increased mass would result in a dominating form of development in a roadside position out of keeping with the street scene. The proposal therefore represents an overdevelopment of the site and fails to accord with paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies 2, 12, 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (Adopted November 2016) and section 9.5.7 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: 1 Luxland View Newquay Cornwall TR7 2FJ
Description: New detached garage
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its dominant scale and siting forward of the principal elevation and resulting loss of garden space the proposal will cause unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the application site and wider area, and in addition would erode highway safety conditions on the adjoining neighbour to the south. The development therefore conflicts with policies 1, 2, 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies D1a(1, and 2) and H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030, paragraphs 111, 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Ralphs Cottage, Studio Lane From Trenowth Cottage To Trenowth Trenowth Grampound Road Cornwall TR2 4EH
Description: Use of existing studio as a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside and clearly divorced from any defined settlement. The proposal will introduce a new dwelling with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 2, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 80 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which permission in principle cannot be granted. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Comprigney Comprigney Hill Kenwyn Cornwall TR1 3EF
Description: Proposed conversion and extension of former stable block to form dwelling with annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed loss of historic fabric, chosen design, orientation, proportions and siting of the extended parts of the proposal would harm the architectural and historic integrity of these listed structures associated with the listed property known as 'Comprigney' that would cause less than substantial harm that is not outweighed by substantial public benefit in conflict with accordance with the aims and intensions of Paragraphs 8, 130, 80, 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 7, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policies E1 and E4 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015. 2 The proposal has not been supported by sufficient ecological surveys to demonstrate that the proposal could maintain the favourable conservation status on European protected species in conflict with accordance with the aims and intensions of Paragraphs 8, 174(d) and 180(a) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policy 23 point 3(d) of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policy E1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015. 3 The development lies in a zone of influence of Penhale Dunes SAC and the River Fal and Helford River SAC where it is considered there would be a likely significant effect, when taken in combination with other plans and projects, upon these two European designated sites. As no completed S111 Form has been received the proposal cannot be considered to embody the principles of sustainable development, in conflict with Regulation 63 of the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017, Paragraphs 8, 170, 180, 181 and 182 of the NPPF 2021, Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, the European Sites DPD and Policy E1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015.

Address: Comprigney Comprigney Hill Kenwyn Truro Cornwall TR1 3EF
Description: Listed Building Consent for Proposed conversion and extension of former stable block to form dwelling with annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed loss of historic fabric, chosen design, orientation, proportions and siting of the extended parts of the proposal would harm the architectural and historic integrity of these listed structures associated with the listed property known as 'Comprigney' that would cause less than substantial harm that is not outweighed by substantial public benefit in conflict with accordance with the aims and intensions of Paragraphs 8, 80, 130, 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 7, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Policies E1 and E4 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015.

Address: 3 Carnon Valley, The Half Acre Road From Junction At Grenna Lane To North Grange Industrial Estate Carnon Downs Cornwall TR3 6LG
Description: Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved for construction of a live work unit dwelling on site of garden nursery.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed live work dwelling is sited within the open countryside and fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the rural landscape and represents and unsustainably located live work dwelling without special justification whose future occupiers would have a high reliance on the private motor vehicle as the site is not well related to public transport links, everyday shops, services and facilities in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 8, 80, 110, 112, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 2, 3, 5, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Policies H1 and ECON1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the River Fal and Helford River Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affects the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, ethos of European Sites Mitigation DPD 2021 and paragraphs 8 and 182 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 The proposal has not demonstrated through the provision of adequate site investigation information that the site is suitable for its proposed use taking account of ground conditions and any risks arising from contamination for the safety of future occupiers and is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 8, 174 and 183 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North Of Cairngorm Cottage Lower Treluswell Penryn Cornwall TR10 9AT
Description: Proposed erection of detached dwelling, a detached garage, the formation of a new vehicular access and the installation of a septic tank
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the provision of a new dwelling outside of an established settlement on Grade 2 agricultural land, with limited accessibility, which would promote an associated over-reliance by occupiers on a private vehicle, and for which no special justification has been presented. The proposed residential development with associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context fails to conserve or enhance the immediate setting, conversely leading to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. 3 The design of the dwelling, principally due to its proposed steep pitched 'A' framed roof and extensive use of not traditional external materials (ie dark grey profiled metal panels) would not promote local distinctiveness or be of an appropriate scale, height and mass in response to its rural setting. As a result, the proposed development would not ensure Cornwall's enduring distinctiveness and maintain and enhance its distinctive natural and historic character, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: Land North West Of Highertown Chilsworthy Cornwall PL18 9PB
Description: Conversion of barn to form dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The existing building(s)/structure(s) are not considered to be suitably constructed for conversion or appropriate to retain and are considered incapable of conversion without substantial demolition/reinforcement/rebuilding operations; and the proposed redevelopment is therefore considered tantamount to the construction of a new dwelling in open countryside for which no special justification has been provided in planning terms. As such, the proposed redevelopment does not accord with the provisions, aims and intentions of Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, HP1 of the Calstock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, with particular reference to paragraph 79. 2 The overall design of the proposed redevelopment does not provide a suitable response to its landscape context and, by reason of its form, scale and materials, does not reinforce the local quality and distinctiveness of this part of the World Heritage Site, nor conserve or enhance the natural beauty of this part of the Tamar Valley AONB, leading to an incongruous and less than positive addition to the landscape. As such, the proposed redevelopment does not accord with the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies 1,3,12,23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, HP6 of the Calstock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030, the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, with particular reference to paragraphs 126, 130, 134, 170, 174, 189 and 197, Policies C2, C9 of the Cornwall & West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020-2025, and Policies 10.5.8 and 10.5.6 of the Tamar Valley Area Of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2019-2024. 3 The submitted information as a result of the submitted Preliminary Ecological Appraisal being more than 12 months old fails to adequately demonstrate how the development would impact upon any bats, birds, or other species  that may be using the existing buildings on the site which are the subject of the proposed development. In the absence of such information the Local Planning Authority is unable to assess whether adverse harm would be generated with respect to any protected species. The development is therefore contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 179 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land West Of Mayna Parc North Petherwin Launceston Cornwall PL15 8PZ
Description: Reserved matters of access, appearance, landscaping, layout and scale following outline consent PA18/05903 dated 26.02.2019 for Residential Development for up to 6 houses (including affordable housing) with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 Outline planning permission was granted on the basis that the development would be an affordable housing led scheme, with viability to be considered at the reserved matters stage, as per an associated legal obligation. The submitted Reserved Matters proposal is not considered to be affordable housing led, by reason of the affordable housing representing less than 50% of the land take and the development not being tenure blind due to the layout, appearance, landscaping and scale of the development which results in the open market dwellings being easily discernible from that of the affordable units. In addition, notwithstanding reservations in regard to the detail and robustness of its inputs, the viability appraisal as submitted indicates that the development as proposed is financially unviable, approval of an undeliverable scheme would not constitute sustainable development. The proposal is therefore neither considered to be affordable housing led nor to constitute Sustainable Development and would conflict with Policies 1, 2, 3, 9, 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic policies 2010-2030; guidance contained within Cornwall Councils Housing Supplementary Planning Document February 2020 with specific reference to paragraphs 69, 79-81, 84 and 100-104; and the aims and intentions of paragraphs 7, 8, 58 and 78 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Trenisson Farm Road From Portloe To The Yard Portloe Cornwall TR2 5PL
Description: The replacement of an approved conversion of a former snooker hall with a new single dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling due to its scale, chosen form and design, increased curtilage and associated boundary treatments fails to successfully relate to the rural setting and existing traditional farmstead which forms a positive attribute within the Cornwall AONB and heritage coast designations.  Thereby the proposal fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and heritage character of the AONB and heritage coast zone or promote the local distinctive style of the area in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies LA1, LA2, CV1 and HO8 of the adopted Roseland Neighbourhood Plan 2015 and Policies PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P3, PD-P11 and SCC-P1 in the adopted AONB Management Plan 2022-2027.

Address: Land Adj 28A Tywarnhayle Road Perranporth Cornwall TR6 0DX
Description: Two storey, one bedroom dwelling adjoining 28A Tywarnhayle road, with the addition of a door to the second floor of 28A Tywarnhayle road.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling by reason of its contemporary design and finish would appear incongruous, inharmonious and unrelated to neighbouring development, harmful to the visual appearance and established pattern of residential development in the area. The proposal is contrary to policies 2 and 12 Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Penhale Dunes Fal Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: 10 Truro Road Lanivet Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5HF
Description: Application for Lawful Development Certificate for proposed rear first floor extension to enlarge bathroom
RefusalReasons: 1 Following assessment on the basis of the submitted documentation provided and the Local Planning Authority's own investigations, the proposed first floor extension to enlarge the existing bathroom at 10 Truro Road, Lanivet, PL30 5HF exceeds the limitations and conditions as set out under A.1 (h)(i), (i) and (j)(a) of Class A of Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended) and as such planning permission is required.

Address: 24 The Watermark Lusty Glaze Road Newquay Cornwall TR7 3AS
Description: Proposed ground floor extension to provide a new stair access and main first floor extension to create a one bedroom self-contained apartment
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal fails to provide for an evidenced need for affordable housing as required by Policy G1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030 and therefore fails to accord with this Policy. The proposal shall also, through its siting, form, massing and appearance lead to incongruous additions to the street scene to the detriment of the character of the area. The proposal shall therefore fail to accord with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, D1, D2, G2 and H2 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030 and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposal fails to provide the minimum provision for parking as set out in Policy H4 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019-2030. The proposal is therefore considered to have a negative impact on the already pressured infrastructure and road networks in the immediate area and would conflict with Policy H4 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019-2030 and Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030.

Address: Firebrand Brewing Ltd Unit 2 Southgate Technology Park Quarry Crescent Pennygillam Industrial Estate Launceston Cornwall PL15 7ED
Description: Proposal for external seating for use in association with the brewery
RefusalReasons: 1 The introduction of an area of external seating for use in association with the brewery located in an industrial estate setting is considered to conflict with the primary use of the industrial estate and is not considered to safeguard or protect the primary industrial use of the surrounding area on the Pennygillam Industrial Estate. Furthermore, the proposal would introduce a use that would be incompatible with the typical activites that occur on an established industrial estate, potentially placing patrons at risk from such activities. The proposed development is considered contrary to Policies 4, 5, 12 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and Policy LAU-E4 Pennygillam Industrial Estate of the Cornwall site allocations development plan document (adopted November 2019).

Address: Penmorva Bar Road Helford Passage Hill Mawnan Smith Cornwall TR11 5LE
Description: Replacement two storey dwelling with basement and detached garage and associated hard and soft landscape works following demolition of existing house.
RefusalReasons: 1 The development is situated in a highly prominent elevated location overlooking the Helford River and within the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) and would be visible in close views from the public highway adjacent to the site and in middle and longer distance views, in particular from the south and south east, including from the Helford River. It is considered that the proposed development would be harmful to the landscape character and natural beauty of the AONB in this highly sensitive and prominent location, by reason of its increased scale and mass when compared to the existing situation, which would result in a more conspicuous development, particularly in views from the south and south east. The large amount of glazing in the southern elevation is also likely to result in glint and glare during the daytime and light pollution when the building is lit internally during hours of darkness to a greater extent than is the case with the existing situation due to the increased amount of glazing, which would adversely affect the natural beauty of the AONB. It is considered that the proposed development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the AONB. The development is therefore considered to be contrary to Policies 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policies 4 and 5 of the Mawnan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030 - Referendum Version - January 2022, the advice in paragraphs 130, 174, 176 and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, advice contained within the Cornwall Design Guide 2021, and the aims and intentions of Policies LS-P3, PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P3 and PD-P11 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2022 - 2027.

Address: Land Adj To 1 Higher Broad Lane Higher Broad Lane Illogan Redruth Cornwall TR15 3JL
Description: Erection of a dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of it's form, siting and the relative location and shape of the plot, does not respect the established pattern, form and layout of development in the locality, and does not promote continuity with the existing built form. The development will result in a discordant, incongruous and cramped form of residential accommodation, which fails to respond positively to local character or add to the overall quality of the area. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Opposite Higher Tolcarne House Tolcarne St Day Redruth Cornwall TR16 5HA
Description: Change of use of domestic recreation and storage land to a mixed use for the stationing of a residential lodge and ancillary recreation land
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, with the introduction of a residential lodge and associated domestic paraphernalia along with the change of use of land for domestic purposes would physically and visually extend the built form into the countryside and erode the historic landscape setting thereby changing its character and appearance and lead to a degree of harm. Such harm should be outweighed by significant public benefits. The direct and attendant benefits of the proposed single open market dwelling does not result in such public benefits and the scheme fails to recognise the intrinsic character and beauty of the World Heritage Site and the rural location. The proposal does not accord with the circumstances set out in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies and would represent unjustified residential development in the countryside and fail to preserve the character and special interest of the World Heritage Site, leading to harm which would not be outweighed by significant public benefit which would harm the character and appearance of the area thereby conflicting with the aims and intentions of Policies 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 120, 130, 134, 194, 195, 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: 32 Treverbyn Road Padstow Cornwall PL28 8DN
Description: Change of Use of Land for the proposed construction of garage and public seating area
RefusalReasons: 1 The open green space that forms the site is an important asset to the area's character and has significant visual amenity value to the community, being identified within the emerging Padstow Parish Neighbourhood Plan as a 'Local Green Space' under Policy PAD5.The proposal to construct a garage, introduces built form into this area of undeveloped land and through the development of this tranquil green space erodes its sense of openness and is considered to negatively impact on the area's character and visual amenity.The proposal makes a small contribution to jobs in the construction process. However, when weighed in the round this benefit together with the benefit of providing additional parking for the property granted under PA21/05967, which already has two off-road spaces, is outweighed by the harm caused to this open, undeveloped space, to the detriment of the visual amenity and character of this part of Padstow.The development is therefore in conflict with Policies 12 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the loss of the green space contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy PAD5 of the emerging Padstow Parish Neighbourhood Plan.

Address: 17 Victoria Road Threemilestone TR3 6DJ
Description: Construction of one single storey dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its form, siting and the location and size of the plot, does not respect the established pattern, form and layout of development in the locality, and does not promote continuity with the existing built form. Conversely, the development will result in a discordant, incongruous and cramped form of residential accommodation, with minimal parking and amenity space, which fails to respond positively to local character or add to the overall quality of the area. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies E4 and H1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North Of Polsue Farm House Tregony Truro Cornwall TR2 5SW
Description: Conversion and extension of a former agricultural building to form a self-contained residential unit
RefusalReasons: 1 The combination of the scale, form, construction and resulting effects of the two storey addition would dominate the main form of the existing farm building. Accordingly, the proposed extension would read as an incongruous, tacked-on feature that would fail to respect the modest form and character of the rural building and would appear as a prominent addition, and thus it would change so much that its existing character would have less relevance and the altered main building would be subservient to the extension. For these reasons, the proposed development would harm the character and appearance of the modest, traditional rural building contrary to Policy 7 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 81 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 Policy 23 along with para 2.34 of the supporting text to Policy 7 refers to traditional vernacular buildings as part of the defining character of the Cornish countryside. The subject building is considered to be a traditional vernacular building and worthy of retention. The addition of an incongruous, tacked-on feature is unsympathetic to the local character and history of the surrounding rural environment.For these reasons the proposal conflicts with Policy 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 along with paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of financial contributions to mitigate the recreation impact on the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan.

Address: Land North Of Lanvean Tregender Lane Crowlas Cornwall TR20 8DJ
Description: Construction of two affordable and two open market dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 Whilst the application site adjoins the Crowlas/Ludgvan Settlement Area Boundary, shown on Map 6a of the Ludgvan Parish Neighbourhood Plan Referendum Version January 2020, it only adjoins the public highway to the east, with its northern and southern boundaries being set back from the adjacent residential properties to these aspects with undeveloped land in the ownership of the Applicants in-between. The proposal is therefore considered to be poorly related to the physical form of the settlement of Crowlas without a compelling case being made for the chosen siting, in conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy LUD5(a) of the Ludgvan Parish Neighbourhood Plan Referendum Version January 2020, policies 9 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of sufficient information concerning the proposed highway access junction onto Tregender Lane, which is considered to be required in view of the straight alignment of the highway and presence of hedgerows on either side of the access point which restrict emerging visibility, it has not been demonstrated that the proposal would provide safe and suitable access to the site for all people. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy LUD5(b) of the Ludgvan Parish Neighbourhood Plan Referendum Version January 2020, Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraph 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 In the absence of a Flood Risk Assessment, which is considered to be required in view of the application site falling partially within flood zones 3 and 3b, with the application site itself having historic records of flooding, it has not been demonstrated that the development could be made safe for its lifetime without increasing flood risk elsewhere, in conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy LUD5(c) of the Ludgvan Parish Neighbourhood Plan Referendum Version January 2020; Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 152, 154, 159 and 167 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North West Of Dartana Forder Cornwall PL12 4QR
Description: Conversion of redundant outbuilding into a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed site is located outside of the development boundary as defined by Policy RUR 2 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan. The proposal would not represent infill or rounding off and the existing building to which this application relates is not considered to be redundant, disused, or historic, nor is the building considered to be suitably constructed or appropriate to retain. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and harmful form of residential development in the countryside and without any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policy RUR 2 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030 and Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016). 2 A flood risk map produced by the Environment Agency has been submitted which confirms the site lies within Flood Zone 1, however insufficient information has been submitted with regard to surface water drainage for the site which lies within a Critical Drainage Area. A soakaway is proposed as indicated on plan 2021-69-ED-XX-XX-A-DR-PL-009  however a suitable Flood Risk Assessment that takes into account the requirements of the Critical Drainage Area has not been submitted, nor has a drainage strategy which should include; Percolation test results, Layout and Maintenance. Therefore the proposal does not accord with Policy GRN4 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030 and Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Blue Haze 39 Tywarnhayle Road Perranporth TR6 0DX
Description: Extensions and alterations to dwelling and replacement garage
