RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its excessive scale, height, strident material, discordant architectural form and unbalancing of the symmetry experienced along this portion of Tywarnhayle Road the proposed extensions and replacement garage are incongruous in relation to the host property and causes unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the street scene. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 - adopted November 2016 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposal adversely impacts on residential amenities, by reason of overlooking to both numbers 38 and 40 Tywarnhayle Road from the elevated proposed balcony on the eastern elevation and has an overbearing effect upon the neighbouring property of number 38 Tywarnhayle Road due to the increase in scale, chosen roof form, massing, close proximity and southerly orientation of both the rear extensions and proposed garage in relation to the neighbour. As such, the proposal is considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010-2030 - adopted November 2016 and Section 12, particularly paragraphs 8 and 130, of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Little Acre Cottage Penhale Road Penwithick PL26 8UP
Description: Outline permission with all matters reserved for up to 6 new dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its location outside of the clearly defined built form of Penwithick does not represent infill, rounding-off or fall within the definition of previously developed land and would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed vehicular access by virtue of its restricted width, lack of suitable passing places and restricted emerging visibility fails to demonstrate safe and suitable access to the site contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. 3 The application fails to provide a mechanism to deliver the minimum mitigation required as identified in the Education Infrastructure Needs Assessment for which there is an identified need, the proposal is therefore in conflict with Policy 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 4 The application fails to provide a mechanism to deliver the minimum mitigation required as identified in the Councils adopted Open Space Strategy for which there is an identified need, the proposal is therefore in conflict with Policy 13 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Wheal Down House Trenow Lane Marazion TR20 9NY
Description: Replacement dwelling and garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed replacement dwelling is significantly larger in scale than its predecessor and would not represent a replacement dwelling which is broadly comparable to the size, scale and bulk of the existing dwelling in conflict with the aims and intentions set out within Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The increase in scale would result in a dwelling with a greater physical presence within this prominent countryside location thereby failing to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policies PD-P1, PD-P2 and PD-P3 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2022-2027, Policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Pengersick Estate Pengersick Lane Praa Sands Cornwall
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for proposed residential development.
RefusalReasons: Covering around 1.4 hectares, a development of the application site would be considered major development, for the purposes of paragraph 2 of Part 1 of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), with paragraph 5B of Part 2A of The Town and Country Planning (Permission in Principle) (Amendment) Order 2017 advising that a local planning authority may not grant permission in principle, on an application to the authority, in relation to development which is (inter alia) major development. 2 The application site is considered to have a distinctly rural appearance, as emphasised in particular by its present wild, vegetated condition. Furthermore, owing to its topography which rises to the east from Pengersick Lane, coupled with the vegetation, the surrounding built form to the south, west and north is not clearly apparent from within the site and, as such, the feeling when stood within the site is of being in the countryside. It is therefore considered that a development of the site would visually extend building into the countryside as opposed to rounding off the settlement of Praa Sands, in conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 3(3) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land At Green Lane Farm, Redruth Green Lane Farm Mawla Reduth Cornwall TR16 5DW
Description: Erection of a timber mobile home to accommodate a farm worker and family on land that forms part of farming business
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed isolated dwelling sited within the countryside on a topographically high and exposed land, through the lack of agricultural business justification fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the rural landscape and represents and unsustainably located dwelling without special justification whos future occupiers would have a high reliance on the private motor vehicle as the site is not well related to public transport links, everyday shops, services and facilities in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 8, 80, 110, 112, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 2, 3, 5, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Policies 1, 10 and 13 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019.

Address: Nero-Cane 18 The Pastures Shortlanesend TR4 9FL
Description: Roof decking and obscure glass balcony
RefusalReasons: 1 The introduction of a first floor balcony of this size and design is considered to have a negative impact on the immediate character of the area. It is considered to represent poor design that fails to respect the amenity of surrounding uses, and therefore conflicts with policies 12 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 with particular regard to Section 12. 2 The development, if approved, would give rise to a detrimental impact on the neighbouring properties to the north and south of the application site namely No.16 and No.20 The Pastures, by reason of its size, siting, proximity and design. The use of the first floor as a balcony would lead to an unacceptable overbearing impact and loss of privacy to the occupants of No.20 The Pastures as well as having an overbearing impact on the amenity of the occupants of No.16 The Pastures. The level of noise and disturbance at first floor level would be significant and would affect the enjoyment of these properties, contrary to Policy 12 (2) of the CLP.

Address: Land West Of Lankelly Farmhouse Fowey Cornwall PL23 1HN
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved for the construction of 3 dwellings with associated amenity space namely access only.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its location outside of the housing development boundary of Fowey would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development and in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policy 3 of the Fowey Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030. 2 The proposed development would give rise to an unacceptable extension of residential development in the AONB on the upper slopes of this undeveloped valley that will harm the landscape and distinctive scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The social and economic benefits of the development do not outweigh the landscape harm. The proposed development is contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies PD-P1, PD-P2 and PD-PP11 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2022-2027 and Policy 6 of the Fowey Neighbourhood Development Plan 2109-2030.

Address: Land At Gears Lane Goldsithney Cornwall TR20 9LB
Description: Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved, except for access, for an affordable housing led scheme.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is outside of the physical boundaries of the existing settlement of Goldsithney and is therefore open countryside as defined under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The site has a distinctly rural character and forms part of a larger field. It also lies within the Tregonning and Gwinear Mining Districts of the World Heritage Site with a number of significant features readily visible in the immediate area. The introduction of built development and day to day activity into this open highly visible area would extend the built up area into the open countryside and would be harmful to the character and appearance of the countryside, the setting of Goldsithney and the WHS. The proposal is contrary to policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 126, 130, 174, 195, 197, 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, and policies P3, C2 and C9 of the World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020 - 2025. 2 A legal agreement has not been completed and therefore the proposal would not provide a mechanism to secure the affordable housing and ensure it remains affordable for local people in perpetuity. It would therefore be contrary to policies 2, 8 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 57 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Penvose Cottage St Tudy Bodmin Cornwall PL30 3NP
Description: Retention and change of use of structures and area of land for a micro-gin distillery, small scale retail/tasting area, office (for personal and business use) and store space together with parking (for staff and commercial vehicles) and a replacement domestic store
RefusalReasons: 1 Having regard to the size of the business; the lack of a locational requirement to be located on this site within the countryside; the limited accessibility other than by private motorised transport; it is considered that the enterprise is not appropriate to the scale and role of its location. No compelling evidence has been provided that these activities would be impractical to or could not viably be relocated. Accordingly, the proposal is considered to conflict with the spatial strategy of the development plan through conflict with Policies 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 of Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 The site is in an area subject to the highest risk of flooding. It has not been demonstrated that the development is 'necessary' on this particular site (neither operationally, nor in respect to the viability of relocating to an area of lower flood risk), nor, in the absence of a suitable Flood Risk Assessment, has it been demonstrated that it would be safe for its lifetime without increasing flood risk elsewhere. Accordingly, the proposal conflicts with Policies 2(2.b.), 12(1.d.) and 26 (2.a-d) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 159, 161, 162, 167 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 3 The proposal would increase vehicle movements using a junction that by reason of its substandard visibility and narrowness of approach lane would be unsuitable to accommodate such additional movements without prejudicing highway safety conditions. Accordingly, the proposal conflicts with Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 110, 111 and 112 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 4 The proposal would result in the retention of a significant number of wooden structures, hardstandings, and other structures and artefacts spread over the two parts of the site which creates visual clutter that distracts and detracts from the natural beauty of the area. These are visible from public realm and are of a scale, extent and appearance that are incongruous and cause harm to the verdant natural beauty of this designated Area of Great Landscape Value.  The benefits of the proposal do not outweigh this harm and conflict exists with Policies 2(1.), 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Appensleigh Pill Creek Feock Truro Cornwall TR3 6SD
Description: Replacement of domestic garage with the construction of a new dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling by reason if its scale, design and fenestration would fail to conserve and enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, contrary to Policies 2,12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies BI01, LS1, LS2 and D1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Plan and Paragraphs 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 which requires great weight to be given in the balance of considerations to harm caused to the AONB. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which permission in principle cannot be granted. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. 3 Insufficient information has been provided with regards to details of the proposed compensatory bat roost measures including details on new replacement roosting sites and also insufficient information on mitigation measures during the construction phase to ensure a favourable conservation status can be preserved.In the absence of additional information the application fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance biodiversity and mitigate impacts to protected species accordingly. As such, this proposal is contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the aims and intentions of paragraphs and 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Higher Tresithick Barn Truro Carnon Downs TR3 6JW
Description: Extension and Alterations to Existing Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extensions and alterations to the traditional converted barn through the chosen form, mass, orientation, height, proportions and design of the extensions and the other alterations to the building would harm the integrity, character and appearance of a non designated heritage asset that is a welcomed attribute to the prevailing rural area thereby the proposal fails to conserve or enhance the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside or promote the local distinctive style of the area in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies LS2, HE1 and D1 of the adopted Feock Neighbourhood Plan 2018 and Section 4 Building form within the Cornwall Design Guide 2021. 2 The proposal has not been supported by any protected species surveys to demonstrate that the proposal could maintain the favourable conservation status of European protected species and therefore is in conflict with the aims and intensions of Paragraphs 8, 174(d) and 180(a) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policy 23 point 3(d) of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policy BIO1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018.

Address: Woodgrove House Race Hill Bissoe TR4 8RH
Description: Demolition of a garage and construction of self-contained annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in a large self-contained unit of living accommodation within its own access, given its scale, degree of self-containment, and distinct separation of approximately 35 metres from the main dwelling, would be tantamount to a new dwelling in the open countryside therefore failing to represent a genuine ancillary development.  The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies H2 and H4 of the Gwennap Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030, paragraphs 8 and 130 the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Adjacent Menagissey Vean Menagissey Mount Hawke Truro Cornwall TR4 8DQ
Description: Proposed construction of new dwelling with off-road parking and garden amenity within domestic curtilage
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside and clearly divorced from any defined settlement. The proposal will introduce a new dwelling with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 2, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 80 and 124 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed development by reason of its size, massing and design would appear unsympathetic to the neighbouring Grade II Listed dwelling and as such would not preserve or enhance its setting. It has been considered that the resulting harm would be substantial and would not be outbalanced by any public benefits that the proposal would secure. The proposal is contrary to policy 11 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Develpment Plan 2018-2030 , policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraphs 130, 199 and 200 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.  3 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and Penhale Dunes Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which permission in principle cannot be granted. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Corner House Cadgwith Ruan Minor TR12 7JU
Description: Proposed Parking Area
RefusalReasons: 1 It is considered that the proposed parking space which does not include screening, has a non traditional parking surface and which removes large amounts of material that is currently overgrown with vegetation would negatively impact the setting of the host dwelling a listed building. Further removal of part of an earth and rock bank and felling a significant portion of elm re-growth is required for the formation of the proposed parking. The bank is occupied by a profusion of medium sized elm stems which have regrown from the colonial root system, this re-growth is covered by the area Tree Preservation Order. The loss of these tree stems will cause material harm to the natural character of the area located along side the grade II listed building, a public footpath to the headland, within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, Heritage Coast and Conservation Area. The social and economic benefits of the proposal are not considered sufficient to outweigh the adverse environmental impact for which great weight must be given; the proposal therefore represents an unsustainable form of development, contrary to Policies 12, 23, 24 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and guidance within paragraphs 130, 174 b), 176, 177, 178, 180, 189, 199, 200, and 201 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Corner House Cadgwith Ruan Minor TR12 7JU
Description: Listed Building Consent for proposed Parking Area
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed parking area, by virtue of its inappropriate materials, siting, and design including the removal of part of an earth and rock bank and felling a significant portion of elm regrowth would cause harm to the setting and special architectural and historic interest of the Grade II Listed dwelling Corner House. It has not been demonstrated that there is any public benefit, or other justification and as such the social and economic benefits of the proposal are not considered sufficient to outweigh the adverse environmental impact for which great weight must be given; the proposal therefore represents an unsustainable form of development. The application thereby conflicts with Policies 12, 13, and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and guidance within paragraphs 130, 189, 199, 200, and 201 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and the duty imposed under S.72(1) and S.66 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land South Of Springfield Tregony Cornwall TR2 5RU
Description: The conversion and extension to an existing, unused and part derelict barn structure to form a new three bedroom residential dwelling, becoming the applicants or applicants family's new home.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the open countryside, physically and visually divorced from any settlement. The proposal results in substantial, dominating extensions to the subject building, such that the scheme cannot be described as a genuine conversion scheme but appears more akin to a new building. The scheme would markedly change the character and appearance of the rural, historic building, with the impact also enhanced through the introduction of associated domestic paraphernalia. The overall visual effect would be detrimental to the rural character of the setting, which is partially within but all adjacent to a conservation area, and creates a new home with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements, for which no overriding justification is provided. Taking the above into account, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North Of Cobblers Cottage St Tudy Bodmin Cornwall PL30 3PX
Description: A single low-carbon self/custom build dwelling (re-submission of Application No. PA20/06748)
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is divorced from the settlement with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. Furthermore, a dwelling in this location would introduce a new dwelling into this part of the countryside which would be harmful to the distinctive rural character of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2,3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 92, 104, 112, 130, 152, 154 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 2 The application site is within the hydrological catchment of the River Camel which is designated as a Special Area of Conservation under the Habitat Regulations 2017. The designated site is considered to be in unfavourable condition due to high levels of phosphates. Insufficient details of a mitigation package has been submitted to demonstrate that this proposal would not result in an increase in phosphate levels. Given the failure of the proposal to provide any suitable mitigation, and until demonstrated otherwise, the precautionary principle must prevail in favour of nature conservation. The development is contrary to the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017, para 180 (a) of the NPPF which states that planning permission should be refused if significant harm to biodiversity cannot be avoided, or as a last resort, compensated for and policies 1, 22 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030

Address: Polpeor Farm Wheal Kitty Road Lelant Downs TR27 6NR
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the change of use of land for the siting of caravan for use as ancillary accommodation/storage to serve the residential property known as Polpeor Farm
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the Authority, it is considered that the applicant has not discharged their onus of proof, to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the area of land at Polpeor Farm, Wheal Kitty Road, Lelant Downs, Hayle, TR27 6NR (shown in red outline on the attached plan ref: NH-JH-01) has been used continuously for a period in excess of 10 years for the stationing of a caravan used for ancillary residential/storage purposes to serve the residential property known as Polpeor Farm. Consequently, a Certificate of Lawfulness cannot be issued.

Address: Briar Helston Water Bissoe Cornwall
Description: Conversion of historic dwelling forming new 2 storey 3 bedroom accommodation and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposed results in the provision of a new dwelling outside of any established settlement, in an unsustainable, inaccessible location in the open countryside, which would promote an associated over-reliance by occupiers on a private vehicle. Despite there being an existing structure on site, the proposal would result in substantial and dominating additions to said structure, such that the development would appear tantamount to a new building rather than a genuine conversion. The proposed residential structure and associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context therefore fails to conserve or enhance the immediate setting, conversely leading to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 80 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: The Royal Duchy Hotel 4 Cliff Road Falmouth TR11 4NX
Description: Demolition of existing buildings comprising garages, storage and former staff bedrooms and construction of a terrace of six residential mews houses
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its form, siting, location and proximity to the existing Hotel would result in a cramped form of residential accommodation, with minimal amenity space, which fails to respond positively to local character or add to the overall quality of the surrounding Conservation Area and would cause unacceptable residential amenity impacts. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies DG3 and DG7 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of education, open space and contributions towards the Strategic Access Management and Monitoring Measures for the Falmouth and Helford SAC for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan, the European Site Mitigation SPD (July 2021), and guidance contained within paragraphs 55,57, 95, and 98 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Bells Court Smithick Hill Falmouth Cornwall
Description: Construction of two residential buildings each containing four residential apartments
RefusalReasons: 1 The design and scale of the proposed development would result in overbearing and adverse impact on the Falmouth Conservation Area and the setting of nearby Listed Buildings (1-4 Bells Court). This harm is not outweighed by the limited benefits of 8 new dwellings. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Sections 66 (1) and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; Policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; Policies DG6 and DG7 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030; and advice contained within the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to adequately secure the provision of financial contributions towards off-site public open space provision and education infrastructure provision, for which there is evidence of an identified need, and a financial contribution towards mitigating recreational impacts upon the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation, the proposal is considered to be contrary to Policies 13, 22, 23 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 55, 92, 93, 95, 98, 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North Of The Cottage North Road Whitemoor Nanpean Cornwall PL26 7XL
Description: Outline application for the Erection of 1 two story detached dwelling house.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling is outside the definable urban form of the settlement of Whitemoor. It does not infill, round off or use previously developed land immediately adjacent to a settlement and visually extends the built form into the open countryside further eroding the intrinsic character of the wider landscape. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposed dwelling represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and paragraphs 8, 80 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposal fails to demonstrate how the development will either conserve, protect or enhance habitats and biodiversity. As such, the development would be contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Paragraphs 8 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land West Of Lakewell Touring And Camping Park Perranwell Goonhavern Truro Cornwall TR4 9NX
Description: Conversion of existing barns to form dwelling house and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, outside of any defined settlement. The proposed dwelling therefore represents unjustified and sporadic development within the open countryside with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. The alterations to the building would result in a harmful domestication of the rural character and appearance of the surrounding countryside. There would be no enhancement of the immediate setting and as such the proposal would conflict with those aims of Policies 1, 3, 7 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan, Paragraphs 11, 80 and 174, that seek amongst other things, to maintain and enhance the distinctive natural character of Cornwall. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Penhale Dunes Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affects the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Taran Edhen Road From Marble Head Cottage To The Old Barn Restronguet Point Feock TR3 6RB
Description: Erection of a dwelling and extension of existing garage with variation of condition 2 of decision PA16/02242 dated 20/01/2017
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, in this visually prominent creekside context overlooking Restronguet Creek, would fail to conserve or enhance the designated landscape of the AONB due to its design incorporating an increase in the scale and extent of external glazing to the ground floor level on the west facing elevation and the associated inevitable increase in lightspill, resulting in a more assertive visual presence on this site, contrary to Policies LS1, LS2, D1 and H1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030, Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies, Policies PD-P3, PD-P11 and SCC-P1 of the AONB Management Plan and paragraphs 130, 174, 176 and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Beechwood View Redgate Liskeard Cornwall PL14 6RU
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling and buildings and construction of three dwellings with garages
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its scale and poor-quality suburban designs, would be inappropriate for the rural context and would cause visual harm to the surrounding area to an unacceptable degree. As such the proposal would fail to take account of the landscape and built contexts, whilst also failing to conserve and enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: 13 Trelawny Close Pelynt PL13 2FF
Description: The removal of 20m long/6 feet in depthsoil banks along two sides of the garden
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed removal of approximately 20m of soilbank/hedgerow would result in the loss of hedgerow which is considered to represent an important natural visual barrier between the residential development of Trelawney Close and the agricultural land beyond. The proposed hedgerow removal, without justification would harm the natural environment and landscape character of the Looe and Seaton Valleys Area of Great Landscape Value. Furthermore, the proposed removal of the hedgerow would result in the loss of habitat that is of value in terms of bio diversity and geo-diversity.  The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016 and paragraphs 8, 174, 178 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 Insufficient information has been submitted to adequately demonstrate how the development would impact upon any bats, birds, or other species that may be using the hedgerow which is proposed to be removed. In the absence of such information the Local Planning Authority is unable to assess whether adverse harm would be generated with respect to any protected species. The development is therefore contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, Paragraphs 8 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Langton House 3 Newport Square Launceston PL15 8EN
Description: Listed Building Consent for the replacement of existing single pane sash windows with new UPVC windows to match existing.
RefusalReasons: 1 The appearance of the existing windows and doors makes an important contribution to the architectural and historic significance of the building. The harm to the designated heritage asset would be less than substantial, though the significant change to the appearance of the listed building is a matter of considerable importance and weight and consequently the scheme does not accord with Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.  Paragraph 134 of the Framework sets out that such harm should be weighed against the public benefits of the proposal and in this case, the harm is considered greater.

Address: Land NW Of Beechwood Lesnewth Boscastle Cornwall
Description: Proposed dwelling and garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling, by reason of its mono-pitch roof, extensive glazing and use of materials does not respect the vernacular of the local area and introduces a conspicuously uncharacteristic built form which fails to conserve and enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the AONB and Heritage Coast in which the site is located. The proposed development is contrary to Policies 1, 2(1.D), 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy MD9 of the AONB Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 The proposed dwelling, by reason it is scale, design, siting and proximity to the neighbouring dwelling known as 1 Beechwood would result in an unacceptable impact upon the residential amenities of the neighbouring occupiers in terms of overshadowing and overbearing impacts and overlooking and unreasonable loss of privacy. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Fieldhead Hotel Portuan Road West Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 2DR
Description: Conversion of vacant hotel to 4 no. dwellings including change of use.
RefusalReasons: 1 It has not been robustly demonstrated that the property has no viable future in holiday accommodation use. As such the proposal would result in the loss of a tourist accommodation business, to the detriment of Looe's economy and tourism offer, without robust justification, in conflict with Policies 2.3(d) and (m), and 5.2 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2016-2030 and Policy TOUR5 of the Looe Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 (Referendum version). It is not considered that this harm is outweighed by the benefits of the scheme.

Address: Angarrick Stables Angarrick Mylor Bridge Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5NX
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for existing use in respect of the use of land for the siting of a residential caravan.
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation and evidence provided in support of the application and having regard to representations, it is considered that the applicant has not discharged their onus of proof, to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, a residential caravan to provide residential accommodation, with a continuous residential use for over ten years has occurred on the land known as Angarrick Stables, Angarrick, Mylor Bridge. As such, the material change of use of land is not considered to be lawful by virtue of immunity from enforcement action in accordance with Section 171B(3) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) because the use has not occurred for a period of ten years from the date of the breach. For these reasons, the Certificate of Lawfulness application is refused.

Address: Gover Farm, The Stables Access To Gover Farm Mount Hawke TR4 8BQ
Description: Conversion of domestic garage to form ancillary accommodation to main dwelling house and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 Given the distance between the proposed annexe and the lawful residential use of the site, the local planning authority considers that the two buildings would operate separately with no functional link between the two, resulting in a new dwellinghouse in the open countryside, without justification. Due to the isolated location, future occupants of the development would be reliant upon the private vehicle to access services, goods and facilities thereby giving rise to sporadic and unsustainable development. The proposed development does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy 7 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraph 80 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Colvase Farm Widegates Looe Cornwall PL13 1QA
Description: Placement and conversion of three grain silos for use as holiday accommodation extending the existing holiday enterprise with associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would result in an isolated cluster of 3 new free-standing holiday units housed within large cylinders set upon the skyline within an attractive, locally-designated protected landscape. Together they would harmfully appear as a conspicuous, incongruent feature in the rural setting, and would fail to protect the rural character and distinctiveness of the locality. As such the proposal conflicts with Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, Saved Policies CL8 and CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan First Alteration 2007; and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land At Rosecare St Gennys Bude Cornwall EX23 0NR
Description: Proposed agricultural and forestry storage building
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development as a result of the prominent siting of the proposed building would erode the character and appearance of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty failing to conserve and enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the AONB and would not meet an identified local need.  The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Strategic Policies 2010-2030, together with Policies PD-P1 and PD-P11 of the AONB Management Plan 2022- 2027 and paragraphs 174, 176 and 178 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Land North Of Chapel Terrace Higher Bal St Agnes TR5 0ND
Description: Proposed replacement dwelling and use of previously approved dwelling for purposes ancillary to the replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposed will alter the rural, utilitarian and functional appearance of the subject building and associated land which, at present, clearly relates to the rural landscape. The building is not considered to be a suitably constructed building, appropriate to retain and its residential use would not lead to any enhancement to the immediate setting, on a site which is visible from an adjacent public right of way. The nature of domestic use and associated paraphernalia will fundamentally alter the perception of the building in the setting, such that it will be recognised as an incongruous residential form which will harm the strong, rural characteristics of this landscape of high scenic beauty, which is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The development cannot be considered acceptable as a replacement dwelling given this concern, while the form and scale of the proposal would also lead to conflict with specific guidance for replacement dwellings within development plan policy. Given the above, and with the development site also not being well related to any existing, established settlement, the development conflicts with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies 1, 6 and 10 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: The Old Stables Lower Clicker Road Menheniot Liskeard PL14 3PJ
Description: Domestic (non boarding) kennels out building (part retrospective).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development as a result of the scale of the development and the proximity to neighbouring residential occupiers would result in an unneighbourly form of development contrary to Policies 5.1(c) and 12.2 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Adjacent To Valley View Callington Road Harrowbarrow PL17 8AZ
Description: Erection of 6 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the overwriting of the historic field pattern and loss of the entire roadside Cornish hedge which would be replaced by a suburban style of residential development, would be inappropriate for the rural context and would cause visual harm to the surrounding area to an unacceptable degree. As such the proposal would fail to take account of the landscape context whilst also failing respect the setting of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site. The development is therefore contrary to policies 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and Policies LA1 and EBD2 of the Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030.

Address: Building North Of Rosevidney Barton Rosevidney Crowlas Penzance Cornwall TR20 9BX
Description: Detached dwelling with integral garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed design does not appear to be justified by the existing buildings in the immediate area nor draw on themes of agricultural buildings either in terms of building form or grouping. There is nothing distinctive about the design or layout which is typical of the form of development that could be found in an urban or suburban location. It would extend the built form beyond the existing yard area and result in a development that is not well designed for the location and area and increase the visual impact of the development. Overall it is considered that the proposal would have unacceptable impact on the character and appearance of the area and is not well designed in its own right. It would therefore be contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policy LUD7 of the Ludgvan Parish Neighbour Plan, advice in the National Planning Policy Framework, paras 126, 130, 134 and 174 and Cornwall Design Guide 2021. 2 The proposed dwelling is within the setting of the listed building.  The proposed houses would replace an existing agricultural building which are appropriate in an agricultural context.  The proposed house will be more prominent and does not reflect the agricultural context due to its size, siting and design and so would harm the setting of the listed building.  The public benefits are slight and do not outweigh the harm. The proposal will would therefore be contrary to Section 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2016), policy LUD7 of the Ludgvan Parish Neighbour Plan and advice in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, paras 189, 195, 197, 199 and 202.

Address: Killiow House, Estate Offices Road From Killiow House To Junction South East Of Watergate Cottage Killiow Kea TR3 6AG
Description: Erection of twenty lodges and construction of touring park pitches and facilities building for golfing, recreational and additional needs, care and respite purposes with variation of condition 12 of decision PA16/04275 dated 22.12.2016
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposes a form of residential accommodation which, albeit on a limited basis, would become an occupier's primary/principal place of residence. Given the location within the open countryside, isolated from any range of services/facilities required on a day-to-day basis with occupants therefore heavily reliant on a private vehicle, the proposal fails to accord with applicable development plan housing policies, with no overriding justification provided for development in this context. Furthermore, the proposal would result in the loss of provision, for at least part of the year, of a form of tourist accommodation suited to year-round use. The application is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7 and 21 and objective 2 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79 and 84 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Land North Of Lowen Meadow Lowen Meadow Upper Castle Road St Mawes Truro Cornwall TR2 5BY
Description: Permanent siting of a boat/trailer storage container
RefusalReasons: 1 The permanent siting of a storage container, by reason of its design, materials, and siting, harms the character and appearance of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, which is given the highest status of protection, the proposal is therefore contrary to Polices LA1 and LA2 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030, Policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, and paragraph 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 14 Claremont Terrace Beacon Road Breageside Porthleven Helston Cornwall TR13 9JU
Description: Proposed new dormers
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works, due to their scale, height and location, would fail to remain unobtrusive in relation to the street scene and the setting. The dormers together with the existing rear dormer would create an over heavy roof space extension, impacting the architectural style of this building due to the addition of another dormer so close to the existing dormer roof covering over the first floor window. The appearance would be inappropriate, creating an architectural addition that would result in an overly-dominant structure at odds in the context of the surrounding built environment. The proposed development is considered to be of a design that fails to take the opportunities available for improving the character and quality of the area. The National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed dormers and associated works has been set out above.  Although the private benefits and minor economic benefits of the created roof space are appreciated, the proposed works would result in substantial harm in relation to the Conservation Area and its setting that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1 and 12 (paragraphs 1a, 1b and 1e) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013, paragraphs 126, 130, 133, 135-136 and 194-208 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, the aims and intentions of Policies BE1 and HE1 of the Porthleven Neighbourhood Development Plan June 2021.

Address: Land East Of Lanjeth Farm Lanjeth High Street St Austell Cornwall PL26 7TN
Description: Construction of five residential dwellings, garages with associated landscaping and amenity areas.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its location outside of the clearly defined built form of Lanjeth does not represent infill, rounding-off or fall within the definition of previously developed land and would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of financial contributions to mitigate the recreation impact on the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan. 3 The application fails to provide a mechanism to deliver the minimum mitigation required as identified in the Education Infrastructure Needs Assessment for which there is an identified need, the proposal is therefore in conflict with Policy 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Mayfield Chymbloth Way Coverack Helston Cornwall TR12 6TB
Description: Demolition and re-construction of dwelling and detached garage with guest room. Re-submission of withdrawn application PA21/00255.
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its design which would fail to respond positively to the local character and distinctiveness in this prominent location, the proposal is considered to constitute a poor quality form of development which would fail to take the opportunity for improving the character and quality of the surrounding area and the way it functions which is designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and a Conservation Area. On balance there is not considered sufficient public benefit to justify this harm. The proposal fails to demonstrate a cultural, physical and aesthetic understanding of its location; the proposal would therefore not conserve or enhance the area and it is considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 126, 130, 130, 134, 174, 176, 197,199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021; policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021 and Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Area) Act 1990.

Address: Sunnyside Higher Middle Hill Pensilva PL14 5QN
Description: Extension and conversion of barn buildings to create a dwelling, and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The existing buildings to which this application relate are not considered to be suitably constructed or appropriate to retain, where it has not been demonstrated the buildings are capable of conversion without the need for significant rebuilding. Furthermore, the proposed design and introduction of a residential use on the site would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate setting, where the proposed link extension would introduce an incongruous feature and where the domestication of the wider site would detract from the rural character of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and harmful form of new residential development in the countryside and without any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 7, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: 44 Queens Crescent Bodmin PL31 1QW
Description: Retrospective planning application for the erection of a garage at the front of the property for storage including cars.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed scheme by reason of its scale and massing is out of keeping with its surroundings and will create a dominant and incongruous form of development which is at odds with and detrimental to the street scene and character of the surrounding area and the identified harm to the character of the area would not be outweighed by the modest benefits resulting from the provision of a larger garage.The development is therefore contrary to and conflicts with Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land South West Of Junction Between Driving Lane And Porcupine Road Driving Lane Par Cornwall PL24 2RS
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved for Two multi generation bungalows.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site sits outside of the defined settlement boundary for Tywardreath and Par and is considered to be in the open countryside. It is also divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities that would not represent sustainable new residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal, therefore, represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development that would be harmful to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside. The proposed development is contrary to Policies, 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy H1 of the Tywardreath and Par Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 and Paragraphs 8, 11, 78 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, 2 The proposal fails to demonstrate how the development will either conserve, protect or enhance habitats and biodiversity. As such, the development would be contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Paragraphs 8 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 6 Bucklawren Road Nomansland Looe Cornwall PL13 1QS
Description: Two storey extension to house
RefusalReasons: 1 This application for the construction of an extension to dwelling 6 Bucklawren Road by reason of its excessive size and incongruous form fails to take into account the character and appearance of the host dwelling and the surrounding area, and is of poor-quality design, failing to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Looe and Seaton Valleys Area of Great Landscape Value. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2016 - 2030, paragraphs 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Design Guide 2021 and the Cornwall Design Guide 2021 and saved policy CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan First Alteration 2007. 2 By reason of its poor-quality design this application for the construction of an extension to 6 Bucklawren Road fails to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Looe and Seaton Valleys Area of Great Landscape Value. The development is contrary to policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2016 - 2030 and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, and saved policies CL8 and CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan.

Address: Little Barn Bluebell Lane Golberdon Callington Cornwall PL17 7NQ
Description: Change of use from ancillary accommodation to holiday let
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would result in a new holiday unit set in an inappropriate, isolated and unsustainable location that would be heavily car dependent; the use of the unit, by the creation of harmful overlooking opportunities and increased levels of disturbance would degrade the levels of amenity enjoyed by adjacent neighbours; and through the dependence upon the use of steep, narrow and unlit access lanes - both private and public - the proposal would fail to provide a safe and suitable access for all users. As such the development conflicts with Policies 1, 2, 5, 12, 21 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the advice within paragraphs 84 and 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Swallows Reach St Veep Lostwithiel Cornwall PL22 0PA
Description: Retention of change of use of land to allow siting of shepherds hut for use as holiday accommodation.
RefusalReasons: 1 The shepherds hut is not accessible by a range of transport modes and leads to an intensification of use in the countryside where no special circumstances have been demonstrated, and with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. Consequently, the proposal is in conflict with Policies 2, 3, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Land Rear Of 43 Clinton Road Park Road Redruth Cornwall TR15 2JD
Description: Construction of two residential apartments and two semi-detached houses with associated parking and landscaping
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by virtue of its excessive size and design fails to demonstrate a clear understanding and respond to its setting and would thereby have an harmful impact on the character and appearance of the Conservation Area, which, it follows would not be preserved or enhanced. The harm to the Conservation Area and World Heritage Site is considered to be less than substantial however given the site contributes positively to the OUV of the WHS and the context in which the public benefits are weighed against the proposal would conflict with Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Section 12 and 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Hilltop And The Belfrey Budnic Hill Perranporth Cornwall TR6 0BU
Description: Demolition of existing 2 dwellings and associated structures to erect 15 flats, complete with courtyard.
RefusalReasons: 1 The development would result in a building of significantly greater bulk and massing than those existing on site or present on adjacent plots and would therefore appear as a prominent and dominant form in the street scene, failing to demonstrate an understanding or respond to the setting or provide continuity with the existing built form. Conversely, the proposal would erode the visual amenities of the area, which is characterised by a lower density of development with conspicuous green or undeveloped gaps between buildings. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to adequately secure the provision of the required financial off-site contribution (in lieu of on-site provision) for affordable housing and public open space, together with education contributions, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 6, 8, 13 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. 3 In the absence of adequate information being provided to suitably assess the impact of the development upon the integrity of the Penhale Dunes Special Area of Conservation (a European Protected Site), the Local Planning Authority is unable to fulfill the responsibility to ensure that likely significant effects, alone and in combination with other consented development, can be avoided, as required by the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations (2017) (as amended). The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 22 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North Of Penrose Farm Luxulyan Cornwall PL30 5EQ
Description: Change of use of former agricultural building to residential use (re-submission of withdrawn application PA20/10105)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, through the substantial level of re-build is not considered to be appropriate to retain or convert and tantamount's to the construction of a new dwelling within the open countryside. In addition the proposed development would not conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the countryside and given the lack of any special justification it is not sustainable development, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy LH1 of the Luxulyan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 and paragraph 8, 9, 79, 80, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposal fails to demonstrate how the development will either conserve, protect or enhance habitats and biodiversity. As such, the development would be contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Paragraphs 8 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Landulph Cross, West Coombe Landulph PL12 6NE
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for erection of two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings, which would appear visually separate from the settlement of Landulph Cross, and the proposed removal of a significant length of Cornish hedge, would result in a form of development that would be a notable erosion of the rural countryside context, thereby harming the landscape character and appearance of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposal therefore fails to accord with policy 1 of the Landulph Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030 and policies 1, 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies (adopted November 2016).

Address: High Hall Laneast Launceston Cornwall PL15 8TA
Description: Proposed reed bed and attenuation pond
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in an adverse impact upon Veteran trees by reason of the proposed incursions into the identified root protection areas through the proposed change in levels with imported fill materials up to the base of the trees and installation of pipework, along with a change is the natural drainage around the trees. This would result in the deterioration of these irreplaceable habitats. No wholly exceptional reason has been provided nor a suitable compensation strategy and as such the development conflicts with policy 23.3(e) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and guidance contained within paragraph 180(c) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Land West Of Parc An Peath Parc An Peath St Buryan Cornwall
Description: Construction of Three Dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed houses due to the height, massing and proximity to Land's End Road will be overly intrusive and prominent and will block important views of St Buryan's Church, a grade I listed building at the centre of the conservation area when approaching from the south. It would therefore have an unacceptable impact on the setting of the conservation area, the church, AGLV and the approach to the village. It would therefore be contrary to Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 c.9 section 66 and 72, policies 2, 3, 12, 13, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030), policy CC5 of the Penwith Local Plan, advice in the National Planning Policy Framework, paras 11, 92, 126, 130, 174, 180, 195, and 200 and the Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: Prince Of Wales Inn Newtown St Martin Helston Cornwall TR12 6DP
Description: Listed Building Consent for removal of pub signage, extractor chimney and external lighting
RefusalReasons: 1 The works proposed will fundamentally alter the appearance of the subject building, also taking into account internal alterations, and the way it is perceived within, and contributes to, the setting as a public house, with part of the significance of the heritage asset being derived from its historic use and community value. Given the period of time the asset has functioned as a public house and its role in contributing to the setting, it is considered that the loss or alteration of fabric associated with that use would harm the overall visual qualities of the listed heritage asset and the immediate setting. There is no public benefit to the works which outweigh the harm identified. The application therefore does not accord with polices 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan or paragraph 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: The Smithy St Ewe St Austell Cornwall PL26 6ES
Description: Change of use from holiday accommodation to full time residential.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of its countryside location detached from any definable settlement, would represent an unsustainable dwelling in the countryside for which no special circumstances have been demonstrated. The proposed unfettered dwelling would have poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8,79,103 and 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Riverside Road From Trevarren To Halloon Trevarren St Columb TR9 6PH
Description: Proposed Demolition of detached dwelling and construction of 2No detached dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site currently occupies a prominent location to the street scene and forms an attractive rural-residential setting to the edge of a settlement. The proposal, by reasons of its siting, massing and appearance, would introduce a development at odds with the established low density built forms of the immediate surrounds and a car dominated layout to the front of the site which would disrupt the continuity of the rural character of the adjoining lane.  The application would, therefore, harm the character and appearance of the surrounding area and is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; Landscape Policy 2 of the St Enoder Neighbourhood Plan 2018-2030; and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposal fails to demonstrate how the development will either conserve, protect or enhance habitats and biodiversity. As such, the development would be contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Paragraphs 8 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land At Gillyflower Farm Cott Road Lostwithiel Cornwall PL22 0HQ
Description: Gillyflower Farm Education Centre for Horticulture, Agronomy and Cookery (including ancillary cafe and retail and other associated uses), 19 holidays lodges, golf reception and new access and parking arrangements.
RefusalReasons: 1The proposal, by reason of introducing the built development and associated land use onto undeveloped and prominent land in the countryside, would harm the distinctive natural character of the surrounding Area of Great Landscape Value and the settings of the nearby Scheduled Ancient Monuments, being Restormel Castle and the Roman Fortle; the Lanhdydrock Registered Parks and Gardens; the Registered Battlefields (Battle of Lostwithiel); and the undesignated heritage asset The Deer Park. The benefits of the proposal do not outweigh the identified harm and the application is therefore not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 2, 5, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan; saved Policy 14 of the Restormel Local Plan; Policy EH2 of the Losthwihiel Neighbourhood Plan; and paragraphs 130, 174, 189, 197, 199, 200, 202 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 1 - 6 Basset Court Basset Street Redruth TR15 2EQ
Description: Replacement of existing single glazed, timber framed sash windows with traditional style PVCu windows
RefusalReasons: 1 The works proposed, by reason of the loss of traditional timber windows and the replacement with uPVC windows, will impact adversely on the character and appearance of the host building and the Redruth Conservation Area. Insufficient justification has been put forward to justify the less than substantial harm imposed on the designated heritage assets and the proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130, 134, 189, 190 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 16 (2) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land To East Of Wesley Road Cubert Cornwall TR8 5HB
Description: Residential development comprising 17 affordable units and 13 open market units. Reserved matters application for access, appearance, landscaping, layout and scale of development following outline approval PA18/08384.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed tenure and house type mix for the affordable housing provision does not meet the identified local needs for Affordable Housing for affordable rented homes, the scheme is also considered unacceptable in terms of the layout and design as it fails to be tenure blind in that the Affordable Homes are distinguishable from the Open Market dwellings and the Affordable Housing units are not properly interspersed within the proposed development as such it is contrary to Cornwall Local Plan Policies 6, 8, 9 and 10 and The Cornwall Council Housing Supplementary Planning Document.

Address: Sheldon House Nursing Home Sea View Road Falmouth TR11 4EF
Description: Demolition of the existing building and development of 28 residential apartments (Use Class C3) with external landscaping, access, car parking and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The development by reason of its cumulative massing and its height would be harmful to the character and appearance of the Falmouth Conservation Area contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy DG7 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030 (Post examination version), and the requirements of Sections 12 and 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, the benefits of the scheme, namely the potential delivery of open market dwellings and innovative design do not outweigh this identified harm. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to adequately secure the provision of financial contributions towards off-site public open space provision, education infrastructure provision and healthcare infrastructure provision, for which there is evidence of an identified need, and a financial contribution towards mitigating recreational impacts upon the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation, the proposal is considered to be contrary to Policies 13, 22, 23 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 55, 92, 93, 95, 98, 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 10 Langurtho Road Fowey Cornwall PL23 1EQ
Description: Application for a lawful development certificate for a proposed replacement extension and alterations to the existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would fail to accord with Class A of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the proposal includes the cladding of part of the exterior of the dwelling with render, and the proposed extension would extend beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse which is on Article 2(3) land, namely within an area of outstanding natural beauty.

Address: Tamaru 16 Pendennis Rise Falmouth Cornwall TR11 4LT
Description: To erect a two metre fence around the perimeter of the property to improve privacy.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development is considered to result in harm to the streetscene and the character of the area, including the character and appearance of the nearby Falmouth Conservation Area, by reason of its height, massing and style. This fails to respect the scale, character and detailing of the surrounding street scene and forms a dominant and prominent feature which is incongruous and has a negative contribution to the Page 6 of 6 street scene. The harm has been identified is not considered to be outweighed by the limited public benefits of the development. The proposed development is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policies DG 2 and DG 4 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030.

Address: 1 Farriers Way Widegates Looe Cornwall PL13 1FL
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for Proposed Use: Use of land as residential
RefusalReasons: 1 The land in question does not fall within residential use and its proposed use as residential land would not constitute permitted development and, as such, full planning permission is required.

Address: 10 Newton Park St Mawes Cornwall TR2 5BX
Description: Extension and alterations to 10 Newton Park
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal adversely impacts on residential amenities, by reason of overlooking to 9 Newton Park from the proposed balcony and fenestrations on the eastern elevation due to the close proximity, elevated position and siting in relation to the neighbour. As such, the proposal is considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010-2030 - adopted November 2016, Policy HO8 of the adopted Roseland Neighbourhood Plan 2015 and paragraphs 8 and 130, of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed roof extension and terrace is considered through its increase in scale, chosen form and design and associated light pollution fails to successfully relate to the edge of village setting within a topographically high and exposed position, thereby the proposal fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and heritage attributes of the AONB or promote the local distinctive style of the area in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies LA1, LA2, CV1 and HO8 of the adopted Roseland Neighbourhood Plan 2015 and Policies PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P3, PD-P11, SCC-P1 and SCC-P6 in the adopted AONB Management Plan 2022-2027.

Address: Hope House West Street Kilkhampton Bude Cornwall EX23 9QW
Description: ApplicationÂ forÂ aÂ LawfulÂ DevelopmentÂ CertificateÂ forÂ anÂ ExistingÂ use: Small conservatory built 2021
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation and information provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the Local Planning Authority does not consider that the conservatory on the property known as Hope House, West Street, Kilkhampton can be considered as permitted development as the conservatory extends beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwelling house and has a width greater than half the width of the original dwelling house. Additionally, as the dwelling is within article 2(3) land (a Conservation Area), the conservatory is not permitted development as it extends beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwelling house. Therefore, the conservatory does not comply with Part 1, Class A of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) sections A.1 (j) and A.2 (b).
