Notwithstanding the security concerns at the adjacent commercial site, which is considered to be a separate matter, it is not considered that there is an essential need for the applicant to live permanently on the site and would therefore not accord with Policy 7 of the Local Plan which supports the principle of new housing to accommodate full time agricultural and forestry and other rural occupations workers where there is up to date evidence of an essential need of the business for the occupier to live in that specific location. The proposed development would not represent a suitable and sustainable location for housing having regard to local and national policies, with particular regard to the effect of the proposed development on the character and appearance of the area leading to harm which would not be outweighed by any overriding public benefit. In the absence of any special justification to warrant residential development in this context, the proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Meudon Hotel Maenporth Road Maenporth TR11 5HT
Description: 10 no. holiday units (C3) (total 1,540 sqm GIA) following demolition of two units in grounds of Hotel Meudon; guest amenity building comprising swimming pool, restaurant, gym and fitness suite (C1) (total 235 sqm GIA); cycle store, greenhouse, bat roost building and substation; demolition of existing staff accommodation block, Bream House, Meudon Cottage and other ancillary garden structures; comprehensive landscaping scheme including biodiversity enhancements and planting to northern field and northern slopes of existing garden; together with other necessary infrastructure.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, which is a highly sensitive location; specifically the element of the proposal which seeks to introduce holiday units (specifically Plots 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10) into this wooded valley garden to the detriment of the natural qualities of this tranquil setting, due to their scale, design, siting and their associated residential paraphernalia, access and parking, associated engineering works, and increased light pollution. The application therefore fails to meet the aims and intentions of Policies 2, 3, 12, 21, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies 4 and 5 of the Mawnan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030 (Referendum Version January 2022), advice contained within the Cornwall Design Guide 2021, and paragraphs 8, 126, 130, 131, 174, 176 and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of a financial contribution towards the Strategic Access Management and Monitoring Measures for the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation, for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to Policies 22, 23 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, the European Sites Mitigation Supplementary Planning Document (July 2021), and advice in paragraphs 8, 55, 57, 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 It has not been demonstrated that the proposed mitigation to address the impacts of the proposed development upon bats, which are European protected species, is appropriate and effective and would ensure that the Favourable Conservation Status of the species is maintained. The proposal is considered to be contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy 6 of the Mawnan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030 (Referendum Version January 2022), and advice in paragraphs 8, 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North East Of Higher Barn Farm Trevarrian Newquay Cornwall TR8 4AF
Description: Proposed Agricultural Building
RefusalReasons: 1 The development if approved, due to its scale and design, which the local planning authority considers to be overly domestic for this rural setting would form an incongruous feature within this landscape designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value and would therefore cause harm within its rural setting contrary to policies 12 and 23 2 and 2 (b) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraphs 130 (c), 174 (a) and (b) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Belle Vue Praze Road Leedstown TR27 6DH
Description: Outline application for construction of up to five dwelling houses within redundant garden and associated works with all matters reserved except access.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is located outside of the Development Boundary for Leedstown as identified by policy HT1 in the Crowan Neighbourhood Plan and moreover, the proposal does not constitute suitable rounding off of the settlement in this location. Thus, the development conflicts with Development Plan policy concerning the location of new housing development.  The proposed development, by reason of its location beyond the development boundary, would incrementally extend the settlement into the countryside and result in the harmful urbanisation of an undeveloped site which contributes to the semi-rural character of the area and setting of the settlement. There is no further justification for market housing in this location to outweigh the environmental harm identified and the development is thereby contrary to policies HT1 and HT4 in the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018- 2030, policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.   2 The site parameters are extremely constrained with a new vehicle and pedestrian access proposed immediately between and in close proximity to the two frontage properties known as Bellevue and Perivale. The intensified residential use of the land would result in a considerable increase in the number of vehicle movements and pedestrian activity along the length of the newly formed access, which would harm the living conditions of the occupiers of the identified neighbouring properties from increased noise and disturbance. The proposed development would therefore conflict with policy HT4 in the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018- 2030, policies 12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 which together seek to protect individuals and property from unreasonable noise and disturbance by creating places with appropriate densities which are safe, inclusive and accessible, and promote health and well-being with a high standard of amenity for existing and future users.

Address: Little Acorn Farm St Keyne Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4QS
Description: Siting of temporary rural workers dwelling, erection of agricultural building, yard and ancillary development.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application fails to demonstrate a functional requirement for an agricultural worker to live on site, nor has it been demonstrated that the farming business is financially viable to an extent that would support a new dwelling. In the absence of any identified need and uncertain financial viability, the development if approved would constitute a new dwelling in the countryside to the detriment of the rural and undeveloped nature of the site, contrary to the principles of sustainability embodied in policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016) and Paragraph 80 (a) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 29A Tregony Hill Tregony TR2 5RU
Description: Proposed Construction of New Dwelling, Removal of Porch to 29A Tregony Hill and Demolition of Existing Outbuilding, Creation of new Parking Area and and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is considered to be a cramped form of development, sited between two historic buildings that would disrupt the spatial distribution of built form along Tregony Hill. This individual property would interrupt that historic rhythm and grain of built form which is a part of Tregony's particular distinctiveness and neither preserve nor enhance the Tregony Conservation Area, contrary to Paragraphs 194, 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan and sections 66 and 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 2 Managing Significance in Decision-Taking in the Historic Environment 2015 and Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 3, The Setting of Heritage Assets (2nd Edition). 2 The site is within the zone of influence for the Fal and Helford Estuaries Special Area of conservation where it is considered there would be a likely significant effect in terms of cumulative recreation pressure, when taken in combination with other plans and projects, upon these European designated sites. In the absence of a contribution or mechanism to provide a contribution to mitigate the effects of the additional recreational pressure on these special areas of conservation the proposal is contrary to Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Regulation 63 of the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017.

Address: Flat 4 Pound House Pound Street Liskeard PL14 3JS
Description: Replacement of three wooden single-glazed windows with upvc double-glazed windows.
RefusalReasons: 1 This application for the installation of UPVC windows would result in the unjustified loss of original historic fabric, failing to conserve or enhance the significance of the listed building, resulting in less than substantial harm to the fabric, character and appearance of the designated heritage asset. No overriding public benefits have been identified for the proposal. The development is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, paragraphs 197, 199 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policies H9, TC3, TC8 and TC12 of the Liskeard 2030 Liskeard Neighbourhood Development Plan August 2018.

Address: 2 Pembroke Cottages Fore Street Newlyn TR18 5JU
Description: Construction of 2 new semi-detached dwellings on adjacent vacant site, together with associated works including extension and alterations to the existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings, by virtue their height, massing and amount of glazing would appear as dominant oversized and disproportionate dwellings in relation to the modest existing dwellings known as Pembroke Cottages thereby causing unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the area. These cottages are considered to be non-designated heritage assets. The provision of two open market dwellings and the improvement works to No 2 Pembroke Cottages are not considered to be a substantial public benefit to outweigh the harm caused and therefore the proposal is considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2020-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 By reason of their substantial two-storey scales and their siting on slightly elevated land, the proposed dwellings are considered to be unreasonably overbearing upon the adjacent pair of modest cottages situated on lower ground a short distance away to the north, in particular upon the rear outlook and garden serving No 2 Pembroke Cottages. The proposal is therefore considered to fail to protect individuals and property from unreasonable overbearing impacts, in conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Flat 4 Pound House Pound Street Liskeard PL14 3JS
Description: Listed Building Consent for the replacement of three wooden single-glazed windows with upvc double-glazed windows.
RefusalReasons: 1 This application for the installation of UPVC windows would result in the unjustified loss of original historic fabric, failing to conserve or enhance the significance of the listed building, resulting in less than substantial harm to the fabric, character and appearance of the designated heritage asset. No overriding public benefits have been identified for the proposal. The development is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, paragraphs 197, 199 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policies H9, TC3, TC8 and TC12 of the Liskeard 2030 Liskeard Neighbourhood Development Plan August 2018.

Address: OS Field 4569 Bickland Hill Falmouth Cornwall
Description: Erection of 40 residential properties, which includes 14 affordable houses with associated infrastructure, access to the existing development and public open space to the west and north.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is not located in an area allocated for development or sited within a defined development boundary and is not an affordable housing led scheme. It is a sensitive and prominent site positioned next to Bickland Hill, an important route between Falmouth and Budock Water. The loss of the greenfield site would lead to the erosion of the green gap between Budock Water and Falmouth which could be exacerbated by the loss of protected trees along Bickland Hill due to the proximity of development to the canopies and root protection zones thereby increasing the visual impact of the development and harmful impact on the character and appearance of Bickland Hill. The development would also result in the loss of high quality agricultural land deemed best and most versatile. The scheme is therefore contrary to policies 2, 9, 12, 21, 23 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies H1, H3, H4 and HB2 of the Budock Neighbourhood Plan 2019-2030, advice in the National Planning Policy Framework, paras 126, 130 and 174 and the Cornwall Design Guide 2021, the benefits of the scheme do not outweigh the harm.

Address: Land North East Of Louvain Cadgwith Ruan Minor Cornwall TR12 7JY
Description: Proposed two-storey dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its layout and design which would fail to respond positively to the local character and distinctiveness in this location, coupled with its close relationship in relation to neighbouring residential development, the proposal is considered to constitute a poor quality form of development which would fail to take the opportunity for improving the character and quality of the surrounding area and the way it functions and would not conserve or enhance the Conservation Area or Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The public benefits of a single dwelling would not be outweighed by the harm that would be caused which is considered to be less than substantial but the benefits of the scheme do not outweigh the harm that would be caused. The proposal would therefore conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 130, 134, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policies PD-P1 and PD-P11 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2022-2027. In addition the proposal if permitted, would be contrary to the general duty of the local planning authority to consider the desirability of preserving or enhancing the character or appearance of the Conservation Area under Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Area) Act 1990. 2 By reason of its proposed siting and bulk being located in close proximity to the dwellings of Wellfield, Sowenna and Seagulls Cry, the proposed development is considered to unacceptably harm the outlook from, these neighbouring dwellings and lead to a sense of overbearing and overlooking. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Chi Lagas Fuller Road Perranporth TR6 0EE
Description: Proposed Application: For The Demolition Of The Outside Garden Kitchen and The Erection Of A Two Story One Bedroom Self Contained Annex For Public Renting.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is considered to represent poor design through the chosen shoehorned siting for a dwelling that provides substandard accommodation, as at an internal floor area of 25.47m2 it fails to meet the national internal space standards of 58m2 for a two storey dwelling, and creates substandard amenity with loss of privacy for both the proposed unit and the property of Chi Lagas given the close proximity of windows that serve habitable rooms and the private amenity areas that will simultaneously be overlooked by both properties in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of both the Penhale Dunes Special Area of Conservation (SAC) the River Fal and Helford River Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affects the integrity of the two SACs without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, ethos of European Sites Mitigation DPD 2021 and paragraphs 8 and 182 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Meneth Bonallack Lane Gweek Cornwall
Description: Proposed residential development of eleven dwellings (7 affordable and 4 open market)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would be located in a prominent position in the countryside, within the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty set at an elevated level above existing housing in Gweek village. By virtue of its scale and massing, it would be detrimental to the visual amenities and landscape character of this sensitive area and would not conserve or enhance the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty such that the proposal would conflict with the aims of Policies 1, 2, 3, 9,12,21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 11, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policies PD-P7 and PD-P11 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2022-2027.

Address: Land ENE Of Chywoone Farm Newlyn Cornwall
Description: Twenty-nine affordable dwellings with a mix of bungalows, flats, two- and three-bedroom houses.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development with 29 additional dwellings would result in a severe impact on the operation of Chywoone Hill, which already has problems with congestion. Also the access to and from the site via Chywoone Hill is not considered safe and suitable for all users. The impact is considered unacceptable and would be contrary to policies 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and advice in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, notably paras 92, 110, 111 and 112.

Address: Land South Of Seaways (Top Field) Harlyn Road St Merryn Padstow Cornwall PL28 8SF
Description: Certificate of Lawful Development for an existing use of land as a camping site for tents
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the evidence submitted with this application, which has not been considered sufficiently precise and unambiguous to show that, on the balance of probability, the use of the land has been used continuously for the period of 10 years during the month of August for the siting of tents at Land South of Seaways (Top Field).

Address: Land North West Of Tregea (Bottom Field) Harlyn Road St Merryn Padstow Cornwall PL28 8SF
Description: Certificate of Lawful Development for an existing use of land as a camping site for tents
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the evidence submitted with this application, which has not been considered sufficiently precise and unambiguous to show that, on the balance of probability, the use of the land has been used continuously for the period of 10 years during the period between Mid-June and Mid-September for the siting of tents at Land North West Of Tregea (Bottom Field).

Address: The Office Nightclub River Walk Truro TR1 2AF
Description: Residential conversion of the Office nightclub into 4 no. flats and associated development
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposes residential accommodation in close proximity to existing licenced premises (including but not limited to the adjacent "Vertigo Bar") which are known to play music and serve food and alcoholic drinks. The resultant environment is one in which there is significant capacity for significant noise pollution and disturbance for any future residents of the development. It has not been adequately demonstrated that noise levels within the subject building can be mitigated to a sufficient degree to ensure suitable living standards; the proposal would also, therefore, have a potential adverse impact on the adjoining businesses being able to continue to operate in their current manner. The development therefore fails to accord with policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 130, 174 and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 4 Elm Terrace St Austell PL25 5QF
Description: Listed building consent to replace two roof lights on north elevation of slate roof and addition of a third roof light. Internal works to insulate roof. Install additional partitioning on second (attic) floor. Re-open bricked-up fireplaces on ground and first floors, install register plates and hearthstones where these have been removed; install fire surrounds and mantels.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed roof lights by virtue of their design and increase in number would fail to preserve the character and appearance of the listed building. Consequently their installation would fail to accord with Paragraphs 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), paragraph 199 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. In addition because the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 sets out the general duty as respect to Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas. In considering whether to grant listed building consent for any works (within the curtilage of the Listed building), the local planning authority shall have special regard to the desirability of preserving the building or its setting or any features of special architectural or historic interest which it possesses (S16 (2)). 2 The proposed insulation material would result changes to humidity likey to causes harm to the fabric of this listed buidling. Consequently their installation would fail to accord with Paragraphs 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), paragraph 199 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. In addition because the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 sets out the general duty as respect to Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas. In considering whether to grant listed building consent for any works (within the curtilage of the Listed building), the local planning authority shall have special regard to the desirability of preserving the building or its setting or any features of special architectural or historic interest which it possesses (S16 (2)).

Address: Nancassick Barn King Harry Road Feock TR3 6QN
Description: Retention of building for agricultural and commercial storage, concrete yards, access track and associated landscaping
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of any justification to demonstrate otherwise, there is no overriding locational or business need for a Haulage Business Centre use within the agricultural building in this location. The proposed development does not represent sustainable development as it will contribute towards the harmful and irrevocable change to the character and appearance of the rural landscape within the setting of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty by introducing an inappropriate scale of use, with associated levels of activity and general disturbance from HGV movements, in this particularly verdant open countryside location. The scheme in this respect is in conflict with Policies 1, 2, 5, 16 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016) and Policies LS2 and ECON1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030 together with paragraphs 85, 130, 174, 176 and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy PD-P11 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2022-2027.

Address: Land And Buildings At Clahar Garden Clahar Garden Trewoon Road Mullion Cornwall TR12 7DT
Description: Conversion of barns to form two residential dwellings.
RefusalReasons: 1 It is considered that the proposed conversion would create an unpleasant living environment for its future occupiers due to adverse noise and odour impacts from a nearby working farmyard and livestock building, to the detriment of their living conditions. The application, therefore, fails to protect and alleviate risk from a polluted environment and is contrary to Policies 1, 12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 185 and 187 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed development would utilise a vehicular access which, due to its acute angle and restricted emerging visibility, would increase the amount of traffic utilising this access and lead to unacceptable highway safety risks to users of the access and the highway. The proposal would conflict with policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 111 and 112 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 The proposed buildings are used by up to 5 different species of Bats and the proposed mitigation shown on the plans does not accord with the recommendations in the Spalding Associates (Environmental) Ltd "Results of further bat survey work on a barn at Clahar Garden Farm, Trewoon Road, Mullion, Helston, Cornwall." The development will have an adverse impact on biodiversity and therefore conflict with policy 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraphs 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North Of Laburnum Cottage The Drang Indian Queens Cornwall TR9 6PW
Description: Change of use of detached annex into detached single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 Were the annexe to be occupied independently such an arrangement would be likely to provide inadequate levels of privacy and outdoor amenity space for those in both properties and it is far more likely that traffic and pedestrian movements to and from these properties would cause unacceptable noise and disturbance to those in both dwellings. For these reasons the proposal would be in conflict with Policy 12(1)(a) and 12(2) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Design Policy 1 of the St Enoder Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030 and Paragraph 130(a) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The applicant has not demonstrated any over-riding justification to convince the Local Planning Authority that there are special circumstances to depart from the requirements of the parking policy. The proposal fails to accord with the requirement to provide 2 parking spaces per property and therefore conflicts with Traffic Policy 2: 'Car Parking' of the St Enoder Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030.

Address: Land West Of 1 Tregolds Lane Tregolds Lane Shop Padstow Cornwall PL28 8PZ
Description: Application for Permission in Principal for a proposed single dwelling
RefusalReasons: The application site is located within the countryside, divorced from any settlement. Residential accommodation on this site would have poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2,3, 7, 9, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposal fails to provide safe and suitable access for all people to the services and facilities within the nearest settlement and minimise the scope for conflicts between pedestrians, cyclists and vehicles. The proposed development is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 110, 112 and 124 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North West Of Abercorn Noonvares Lane Townshend Cornwall TR27 6AT
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for residential development of up to 3 self-build eco homes.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would represent the provision of unsustainable housing development in the open countryside, outside of the limits of any of the defined Development Boundaries in policy HT1 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan. Such development would not contribute towards minimising the need to travel by more unsustainable transport modes and no special circumstances are evident that would justify permitting new open market homes in this open countryside location. Therefore, the development of this greenfield site for housing would clearly result in further encroachment of built development and urbanisation of the area, thus harmfully eroding its strong rural character to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside in this location. The overriding environmental harm identified is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010- 2030, policies HT1 and HT4 in the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 ' 2030 and paragraphs 8, 80, 110, 112, 130 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Huthnance Farm Pengwedna Nancegollan Helston Cornwall TR13 0AZ
Description: Lawful development certificate for proposed single storey rear extension and replacement of existing rear dormers
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed rear extension does not accord with the criteria set out at Schedule 2, Class A.4 (i) length from the original dwelling and (ii) height measured with the proposed roof light, of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) and is not permitted development, planning permission is required.The rear elevation windows described as dormers do not appear to protrude from the roof, they appear to be below the eaves of the original roof, and also are part of a flat roof rear extension, which from a history search does not seem to have been regularised previously with a planning permission. The rear section is not within the roof slope and does not finish 0.2 metres above the eaves as such this is not within the criteria set out in Schedule 2 Class B of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) and is not permitted development, planning permission is required.For these reasons the proposed works are not considered lawful and planning permission is required for the replacement first floor extension and proposed single storey extension.

Address: Barn Adj To Lower Spargo Cottage Rose Valley Mabe Burnthouse Penryn Cornwall TR10 9JF
Description: Replacement of garage and store with dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the provision of a new dwelling outside of any established settlement on previously developed land, with limited accessibility, which would promote an associated over-reliance by occupiers on a private vehicle, and for which no special justification has been presented. The proposed residential development with associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context fails to conserve or enhance the immediate setting, conversely leading to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affects the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, ethos of European Sites Mitigation DPD 2021 and paragraphs 8 and 182 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Boslowen Land East Of Tala Park Tala Hill Boyton Launceston Cornwall PL15 9RJ
Description: Change of use from agricultural land to residential, construct one self/custom-build low carbon detached dormer bungalow with detached garage and associated landscaping
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling, by reason of its location outside of any land considered to form the settlement of Boyton, does not infill, round-off or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement, and would visually extend built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development in the countryside, and in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Land At Halt Road Goonhavern TR4 9QF
Description: Construction of two dwellings, garages, landscaping and gardens and improvements to access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of two detached houses does not represent rounding off of the settlement or infill of a continuous built frontage and is not previously developed land thus fails to accord with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan in respect of the location of new residential development. The proposal, by virtue of its suburban appearance and loss of hedgerow to provide a visibility splay, within a rural setting, would have an adverse visual impact on a large green gap which has a rural appearance and is of importance to the approach to and setting of Goonhavern. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 174 (b) of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The proposal has not demonstrated that a safe and suitable vehicular access to the site can be provided contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 110(b) of the National Planning Policy Framework. 3 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the River Fal and Helford River Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and the Penhale Dunes SAC and it is considered that the proposal would when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affects the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, ethos of European Sites Mitigation Development Plan Document 2021 and paragraphs 8 and 182 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Little Orchard, Maswell Lane, St Teath, PL30 3JJ (on The Edge Of The Settlement Of Tregreenwell)
Description: Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an existing use for the use of land for recreation, stationing a caravan for occasional overnight stays and as a private amenity space and garden.
RefusalReasons: 1 ConclusionBased upon the lack of sufficiently precise and unambiguous evidence submitted in support of the application, it is not considered that the applicant has successfully discharge their onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the existing use of land for recreation, stationing a caravan for occasional overnight stays and as a private amenity space and garden, by virtue of the passage time, in accordance with Section 171B of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). Therefore, the Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be granted.

Address: Garage Building North Of 56 Pentire Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 1PE
Description: Conversion of redundant workshop to holiday occupancy restricted accommodation and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the lack of associated private amenity space, severely limited outlook, and unsurfaced and unlit pedestrian access, fails to secure a good standard of amenity for existing and future occupants. In contrast it would result in the creation of a cramped and sub-standard form of holiday accommodation. As such, the proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy D1 and H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019, Policies 2, 5, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Section 12 and in particular paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Penrowan Meadway East Looe Looe Cornwall PL13 1JT
Description: Proposed Balcony
RefusalReasons: 1 By means of the size, height and close proximity of the proposed balcony in relation to neighbouring properties, the proposed development would result in an unacceptable level of harm to the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring dwellings Polmenna and Southover, specifically with regard to overlooking and loss of privacy and overbearing impacts contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and Policy DS5 of the Looe Neighbourhood Development Plan 2022.

Address: Penria Barn Street Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4BJ
Description: Change of use and conversion of ground floor shop to form two bedroom apartment with associated works to replace shop front, construct ground floor lightwell and new external stairs with Juliette balcony and balustrade
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of the limited internal space, and the restricted natural light and outlook to the main living area of the proposed accommodation, would fail to provide an appropriate standard of amenity for future occupants. Instead, the proposal would represent a poorly designed property which fails provide a suitable standard of living accommodation contrary to Policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, section 9.3 of the Cornwall Council Design Guide 2021 and paragraph 126 of the National Design Guide. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure a contribution towards the mitigation of harmful impacts resulting from the proposal, it has not been possible for the Council, as Competent Authority, to be able to conclude that there would be no impact on the integrity of the Tamar Estuary Special Area of Conservation and Plymouth Sound Special Protection Area (the 'European Sites') as a result of the proposed development. As such the proposal conflicts with the Habitats Directive and Policies 22 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016

Address: Redundant Cottage Glebe Farm Trevarno Sithney Helston Cornwall TR13 0RT
Description: Demolition of building previously approved for conversion (PA22/02889) and construction of a new dwelling with associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The existing building to be demolished, which has the benefit of planning permission for conversion to residential use, displays a vernacular rural character in terms of its appearance, method of construction and association with this historic farmstead. The buildings significance is accentuated by its legibility from the adjacent Public Right of Way (PROW) which gives great weight to the fact that the building is clearly appropriate to retain and desirable for re-use. The building therefore has clear significance as a non-designated heritage asset within the terms of paragraph 203 in National Planning Policy Framework 2021. By reason of the schemes increase in height and bulk, along with the erosion of existing vernacular features and loss of historic/natural construction materials, the proposal to demolish and re-build with a new dwelling does not result in a better scheme in terms of building design and such harm is accentuated by the loss of a historic building that makes a positive contribution to local character and distinctiveness. The identified environmental harm to the rural landscape and historic character of the area is therefore contrary to policies 2, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174, 194, 197 and 203 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence for the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC), and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to sufficiently mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which no mitigation has been secured to protect the integrity of the SAC. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policy 22 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Blackberry Cottage Kuggar Ruan Minor Helston Cornwall TR12 7LY
Description: Two storey rear extension to existing cottage including installation of 3 conservation roof lights into existing roof without compliance with condition no. 2 of Decision Notice no. PA21/02912 dated 02/06/2021.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed variation of the planning condition to retain the window without obscure glazing but having resticted opening, would result in overlooking into the windows of Chykembro and Bay Tree Cottage and therefore would have unacceptable adverse impact on the residential amenities of the occupants of the neighbouring properties. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land West Of St Aubyns Portuan Road West Looe Cornwall PL13 2DH
Description: Application for a change of use of garage to dwelling including external alterations.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in an unsympathetic and harmful development due to the lack of cohesiveness to the historic setting in terms of its position, layout and continuity with the prevailing pattern of development in the local area. The development would fails to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Looe Conservation Area and is therefore contrary to policies H1 and TC3 of the Looe Neighbourhood Plan, policies 2, 12 and 24, of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, paragraphs 8, 126,130, 197, 199, 200, 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policy CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990. 2 The dwelling, by reason of its siting and design, would result in harmful impacts to the amenities of neighbouring occupiers. Overlooking would occur from the windows and raised deck of the proposed dwelling to rear windows serving the neighbouring flats within St Aubyns which would erode the privacy enjoyed by the occupants to an unacceptable degree. The dwelling therefore results in an unneighbourly impact, contrary to policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), policy DS5 of The Looe Neighbourhood Plan and Section 9.3.6 of the Cornwall Design Guide (2021). 3 In the absence of a mechanism to secure a contribution towards the mitigation of harmful impacts resulting from the proposal, it has not been possible for the Council, as Competent Authority, to be able to conclude that there would be no impact on the integrity of the Tamar Estuary Special Area of Conservation and Plymouth Sound Special Protection Area (the 'European Sites') as a result of the proposed development. As such the proposal conflicts with the Habitats Directive and Policies 22 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Former Uncommissioned Radio Station Pednavounder Coverack Cornwall TR12 6SE
Description: Conversion of agricultural building to form holiday let (resubmission of PA22/03701)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal represents an unsustainable form of housing/tourism development in an inaccessible open countryside location and the proposed works to convert the building to a residential use will clearly not enhance the site and its immediate setting. The combination of the revised and more conspicuous appearance of this functional, utilitarian building with its associated garden land, access, parking and domestic paraphernalia will be an uncharacteristic, alien and incongruous domestic addition to this otherwise open agricultural landscape.  Such harm will be accentuated by the prominence, from a public perspective, of this standalone building in an area of otherwise strong, open rural character. Such insensitive residential development in this protected landscape will not conserve the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) in this location, which is particularly sensitive and has limited capacity to accommodate further development due to its remote rural location. In giving great weight to conserving the landscape and scenic beauty of the AONB, the identified environmental harm is overriding in the planning balance and the proposal is thereby contrary to policies 1, 2, 5, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 80, 84, 85, 110, 112, 130, 174 and 176 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and polices PD-P1, PD-P8, PD-P11 and PD-P18 in the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2022 - 2027. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence for the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC), and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to sufficiently mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which no mitigation has been secured to protect the integrity of the SAC. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policy 22 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: St Johns Ambulance Church Road Pool Redruth Cornwall TR15 3PT
Description: Residential development of 5 dwellings on former St John's Hall site.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would appear uncomfortably cramped within its plot, exacerbated by the excessive width of the building proposed, which is emphasised by its gable ends being situated in close proximity to the boundaries, thereby visually filling the plot. The inclusion of the gable end and the encroachment of the development towards its north-east boundary, which is shared with the neighbouring dwelling known as Penlea, would result in a harmful loss of light and aspect enjoyed by the occupants and future occupants of Penlea, and adversely impact upon their residential amenity. The excessive width of the proposed building is accentuated by the monotonous appearance of the principal elevation, which lacks interest and contains overly symmetrical fenestration. Its cramped appearance is emphasised by its failure to successfully integrate the parking provision within the development, which results in its frontage being dominated by vehicle parking and thus fails to respond positively and enhance the local historical context and character. By reason of the bulk, massing, design and layout, the proposed development would: fail to be visually attractive as a result of good architecture, layout and appropriate and effective landscaping; neither integrate successfully with, nor respond positively to, the locally distinctive characteristics of the area; and result in harm to the residential amenities of occupants of Penlea. Therefore, the proposed development would conflict with the aims and intentions of sections 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, 4.2, 5.8 and 9.3 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021, policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 126 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. This reason for refusal is in accordance with paragraph 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 By reason of the insufficient emerging visibility for vehicles egressing onto the public highway from the parking area to serve the proposed dwelling on plot no. 5, the proposed development would give rise to increased scope for conflicts between pedestrians, cyclists and vehicles and result in an unacceptable impact on highway safety, in conflict with the aims and intentions of policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 110 and 112 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. This reason for refusal is in accordance with paragraph 111 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 In the absence of a mechanism to secure it, the proposal fails to provide contributions to deliver improvements to mitigate pressures on education infrastructure, and without which would be contrary to the aims and intentions of policy 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 95 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Agricultural Building Longlands St Stephens Saltash Cornwall PL12 4QH
Description: Change of use and conversion for barns to dwelling and studio and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The buildings are not considered to be suitably constructed or appropriate to retain, whilst the proposed design and introduction of a residential use on the site would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate setting which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty in which great weight must be attached to landscape and scenic beauty preservation. Furthermore, very limited information has been provided with the application to demonstrate the building is redundant. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and harmful form of residential development in the countryside and without any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 7, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016). 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure a contribution towards the mitigation of harmful impacts resulting from the proposal, it has not been possible for the Council, as Competent Authority, to be able to conclude that there would be no impact on the integrity of the Tamar Estuary Special Area of Conservation and Plymouth Sound Special Protection Area (the 'European Sites') as a result of the proposed development. As such the proposal conflicts with the Habitats Directive and Policies 22 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.

Address: Land Adjacent Hawthorn Cottage Trewedna Lane Perranwell Station Truro Cornwall TR3 7PG
Description: Convert the garage to a residential unit and adding a flat-roofed extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed residential development by reason of the restricted site area, layout and juxtaposition with neighbouring development would appear incongruous, inharmonious and poorly related to neighbouring development, resulting in a cramped form of development, harmful to the visual appearance and established pattern of residential development in the area, and it not would provide adequate living conditions for future occupants on a day to ay basis, with particular reference to internal and external amenity space, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policies 1 and 15 of the Perranarworthal Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affects the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, ethos of European Sites Mitigation DPD 2021 and paragraphs 8 and 182 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 3 Barton Mews Church Hill North Petherwin Cornwall PL15 8LR
Description: Listed Building Consent for replacement of existing white timber door with white composite door
RefusalReasons: 1 The introduction of a composite door, being of a manufactured finish with a uniform appearance and lacking the finesse and craftsmanship of a timber replacement, would fail to enhance or conserve the features, appearance and historic character of the Grade II listed building or its historic setting, and the less than substantial harm caused by the proposed development would not be outweighed by any public benefits. In addition, no justification has been provided to illustrate why this door needs to be replaced (as opposed to being repaired). As such the proposal fails to accord with the contents and intentions of Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and section 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed works would be contrary to the Council's statutory duties under sections 16 and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 to ensure that the development preserves the architectural and historic interests of the listed building and its setting.

Address: Land North Of Tregoon The Mount Par Cornwall PL24 2DA
Description: Construction of a three bedroom dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its location outside of the clearly defined settlement does not represent infill, rounding-off or fall within the definition of previously developed land and would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site is located within a Critical Drainage Area. In the absence of a Flood Risk Assessment to demonstrate that surface water run off can be successfully mitigated/managed on site the proposal does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 3 The site is within an area identified on-site or nearby (Areas of mining and mineral processing and Unspecified deposited material). The applicant submitted a desk top Landmark report which is not acceptable. The proposal does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land North East Of Briar Patch Lower Treluswell Penryn Cornwall TR10 9AT
Description: Proposed construction of detached dwelling, garage, formation of access, and the installation of a septic tank.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the provision of a new dwelling outside of any established settlement on Grade 2 agricultural land, with limited accessibility, which would promote an associated over-reliance by occupiers on a private vehicle, and for which no special justification has been presented. The proposed residential development with associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context fails to conserve or enhance the immediate setting, conversely leading to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affects the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, ethos of European Sites Mitigation DPD 2021 and paragraphs 8 and 182 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of 1 The Mallows Marine Drive Widemouth Bay Bude Cornwall EX23 0AG
Description: Proposed new one storey, 2 bedroom residential property with associated exterior landscaping.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is considered to represent the overdevelopment of an established site resulting in residential accommodation with inadequate levels of amenity space for both the host dwelling its associated annexe and the proposed dwelling, limiting the access to functional garden space by current occupants of the host dwelling and annexe and future occupants of the proposed dwelling. In addition, the proposed development will result in a discordant, incongruous and cramped form of residential accommodation, which relates poorly to the host dwelling and annexe beyond. The proposal therefore represents an overdevelopment of the site and fails to accord with paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies 1, 2, 12, 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (Adopted November 2016) and section 9.5.7 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: Greystones Marine Drive West Looe Cornwall PL13 2DJ
Description: Proposed extensions and alterations without compliance with Conditions 3 and 4 of decision notice PA16/02806 dated 09.05.2016.
RefusalReasons: 1 By means of the close proximity of the neighbouring property to the west and the position of the previously approved windows and balcony, the proposed removal of conditions 3 and 4 of associated application PA16/02806 would result in an unacceptable level of harm to the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring dwelling Yonder Hill, specifically with regard to overlooking and loss of privacy contrary to Policy DS5 of the Looe Neighbourhood Development Plan 2022, Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), Paragraphs 130, 134 and 135 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and section 9.3 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: Land At St Francis Road St Columb Road St Columb Cornwall TR9 6QG
Description: Demolition of existing retail unit and three flats and erection of four 2 bedroom flats and car parking
RefusalReasons: 1 The applicant has not demonstrated any over-riding justification to convince the Local Planning Authority that there are special circumstances to depart from the requirements of the parking policy. The proposal fails to accord with the requirement to provide 8 parking spaces per property and therefore conflicts with Traffic Policy 2 of the St Enoder Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030 2 The proposal would fail to provide each dwelling (flat) with sufficient internal space for everyday activities and to enable flexibility for future adaptations therefore conflicting with the aims and intentions of policy 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Design Policy 1 of the St Enoder Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030 and paragraph 130(f) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 which requires that development should have a high standard of amenity for existing and future users. 3 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of financial contributions to mitigate the recreation impact on the Penhale Dunes Special Area of Conservation for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030

Address: Burrell Lodge Longlands St Stephens Cornwall PL12 4QH
Description: Hedgerow removal notice to install new field gate access.
RefusalReasons: 1 The hedgerow in question is considered to be important as it has existed for over 30 years and meet criteria 5a of Part II of Schedule 1 of the Hedgerows Regulations 1997. The removal of any section of this hedgerow will have a notable adverse impact on the natural and historic landscape character of the area (designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty), which is not outweighed by any clear benefit. Two access points to the field are in existence. The removal of the hedgerow therefore fails to comply with policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and paragraphs 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Carinya West Camps Bay Downderry Cornwall PL11 3LG
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling and construction of replacement dwelling (self-build), detached garage and associated site landscaping works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The dwelling, by reason of its siting, scale and design, would result in harmful impacts to both the amenities of neighbouring occupiers and the streetscene. Overlooking would occur from the first floor of the proposed dwelling to rear windows and private garden areas serving the neighbouring properties Lowena and Pendower which would erode the privacy enjoyed by the occupants to an unacceptable degree. By siting the dwelling at the northeastern part of the site to minimise neighbour impacts, with limited separation to the highway, this in itself would result in a harmful and dominating visual impact to the streetscene when the dwelling is viewed from the B3247. The design of the dwelling therefore fails to properly address the site constraints, resulting in an unneighbourly impact and harmful visual impact, contrary to policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and Section 9.3.6 of the Cornwall Design Guide (2021).

Address: 2 Road From Penhallick To Hillside Farm Tregajorran Carn Brea Cornwall TR15 3YZ
Description: Domestic Extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The extension, by reason of its scale, height and finishes would significantly detract from the architectural merits of the original dwelling, which is considered a non-designated heritage asset. The extension would dominate the building thereby resulting in the loss of the original character and form of the dwelling which as present is an established attribute feature that expresses the Outstanding Universal Value of the Camborne and Redruth Mining District World Heritage Site (WHS) and positively contributes to the Carn Brea Conservation Area. The less than substantial harm to the Camborne and Redruth Mining District WHS and Carn Brea Conservation Area is not outweighed by any public benefits, raising direct conflict with Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development fails to protect, conserve or enhance the significance of the Camborne and Redruth Mining District World Heritage Site in conflict with the aims and intentions set out with policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 130, 189, 202 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The extension protrudes to an extent which results in overbearing impacts on the adjoining neighbouring dwelling to the south. The extension is considered to cause significant and demonstrable harm to the living conditions of the occupiers of the adjoining neighbouring dwelling to the south with particular regard to overbearing in conflict with the aims and intentions set out within policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 4 Weir Head Cottages Bealswood Road Gunnislake Cornwall PL18 9BZ
Description: New two-storey extension and internal alterations
RefusalReasons: 1 This application for the construction of an extension to 4 Weir Cottages by reason of its size compared to the host dwelling and siting protruding forward of the principal elevation is a poor quality design that fails to take into account the character and appearance of the host dwelling, surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and nearby Scheduled Monument. The proposal would result in a dominating and incongrous form of development that would appear out of character, having an adverse visual impact on the parent dwelling, surrounding terrace and wider streetscene.  The proposal fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and would result in less than substantial harm to the setting of the Tamar Canal scheduled monument and to the group of Weir Head Cottages which can be considered as a non-designated heritage asset. The less than substantial harm would not be outweighed by public benefits. The development is contrary to policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2016 - 2030, paragraphs 130, 176 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies HP6 and HE3 of the Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030, sections 3.0, 4.0 and 10.0 of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management PLan 2019 - 2024, sections 3.2, 3.3, 3,4, 4.1 and 4.2 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021, and sections C1, C2, I1 and I2 of the National Design Guide 2021. 2 In the absence of a detailed Flood Risk Assessment and Finished Floor Levels the Local Planning Authority are unable to assess whether the development is at risk from flooding or would increase flood risk within the surrounding area. Therefore, the proposal does not accord with the aims and intentions of policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Seven Acres United Mines St Day Redruth Cornwall TR16 5HX
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of land and buildings for domestic purposes
RefusalReasons: 1 The description of what is being applied for is not correct and does not have evidence to support it coupled with the conflicting evidence, on the balance of probabilities, the evidence is not clear, precise and is ambiguous and therefore the CLEUD is refused on that basis.

Address: Land Off Bodinar Road Bodinar Road Penryn Cornwall
Description: Application for planning permission for formation of new vehicular access, haul road and parking/turning area for forestry work
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed benefits of providing a new vehicular access, haul road and parking/turning area to carryout forestry work on the associated land in the manner proposed, would not outweigh the detrimental visual impact caused by the proposed works on the character and appearance of the immediate streetscene, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policy 7 of the Penryn NDP. 2 The proposed development involves significant engineering works resulting in the removal of a number of trees which could impact  upon any bats, birds, or other species, and the absence of a Phase 1 Ecological Survey the Local Planning Authority is unable to assess whether adverse harm would be generated with respect to any protected species. The development is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy 14 of the Penryn Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030 and paragraphs 179 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Trewidden Church Cove The Lizard Cornwall TR12 7PH
Description: Rear two storey extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed large two-storey rear extension to the non-designated heritage asset, whilst retaining somewhat below the ridge line of the existing dwelling is flat roofed with the roof height appreciably above the eaves height of the existing dwelling. The flat roofed nature of the extension extending fully into the rear pitch of the roof provides a substantial new presence, conspicuously at odds with the existing modest traditional cottage both through its flat roofed form, large areas of glazing, mass and curved walls to the north and west. The proposed extension would harm the simple vernacular appearance of the cottage and the distinctive character of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposal is therefore, contrary to Policies 2, 12, 13, 23 and 24 and of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); paragraphs 126, 130, 176, 177, 178, and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policies PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P11 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2022-2027.

Address: April Cottage Talland Road St Ives Cornwall TR26 2DG
Description: Planning permission for proposed demolition of garage and construction of self-contained annexe for family members and holiday use.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed two-storey side extension to the traditional host dwelling, whilst subservient, below the ridge line of the existing dwelling is a modern designed addition, with materials and finishes that are conspicuously at odds with the existing traditional cottage through the addition of zinc roof and some zinc clad walls, some clay finished render walls (pink in colour) unbalanced dark aluminium framed rectangle and arch windows of differing sizes, and glazed arched and solid square doors to the front elevation. The proposed extension would harm the simple vernacular appearance of the cottage and the distinctive visual amenities and landscape character of the surrounding area. The proposal is contrary to Policies 2, part 1, point a) and 12, of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); paragraphs 8 point c) and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies BE6 points e) and f) and GD1 points a), b) and g ) of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030 (NDP). The refusal of planning permission also accords with paragraph 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, because the proposal is not well designed.

Address: Land Adj To Sun View Eastcliff Porthtowan Truro Cornwall TR4 8AL
Description: Application for permission in principal for the construction of maximum one dwellinghouse on previously developed land adjacent to the settlement
RefusalReasons: The application site is located outside of the definable limits of the settlement of Porthtowan and does not represent an acceptable form of infill or rounding off, as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policies 1 and 7 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030. The site is previously developed land but is not in a location where access other then by private car is convenient or attractive given the steeply sloping land, unmade ways and lack of street lighting. The proposal would make more prominent and intensify the residential use of the site to the detriment of the adjoining countryside, which would lead to visual harm through the erosion of the landscape character of the sensitive and visually prominent settlement edge to the village of Porthtowan. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policies 1, 6 and 10 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030,  together with paragraphs 8, 80, 130, 174 and 178 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Penhale Dunes Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, ethos of European Sites Mitigation supplementary planning document 2021 and paragraphs 8 and 182 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Nettle Cottage Germoe Penzance Cornwall TR20 9QX
Description: Erection of local needs dwelling and installation of septic tank without compliance with condition 1 (plans) of decision notice PA22/01460 dated 11/05/2022.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed revision to the plans condition of PA22/01460 (dated 14.02.2022) an amendment for PA08/00346/F (dated 27.02.2008) can not be approved as the original planning permission pre-commencement conditions were not discharged. As a result the original permission has not been complied with and the dwelling is an unauthorised development.  The breached pre-commencement conditions are considered to go the heart of the original planning permission.

Address: Quoit Cottage Quoit St Columb Cornwall TR9 6HY
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of land as a domestic garden forming part of the extended residential curtilage to Quoit Cottage
RefusalReasons: 1 1. The available evidence does not precisely and unambiguously demonstrate, on the balance of probabilities, that a material change of use requiring express planning permission has occured in respect of the use of the subject land.2. If in the event that a material change of use of the land has occured, which is not accepted on the basis of the available evidence, that evidence does not precisely and unambiguously demonstrate that the use has occured for a continuous period of ten years prior to the time of the application.As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Land West Of Plantation Chapel Plantation Troon Cornwall TR14 9JW
Description: Retention of residential caravan
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would result in an unjustified unsustainable sporadic form of residential development which has an unacceptable urbanising effect into an area that is primarily undeveloped and rural in character and conflicts with the aspirations of the Carnmenellis Area of Great Landscape Value designation. The scheme thereby fails to conserve and enhance this particular area of countryside, contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 12, 13 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 8, 80, 105, 126, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Part 2, Context and Built Form, of the National Design Guide Planning - practice guidance for beautiful, enduring and successful places (January 2021). 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of financial contributions to mitigate the recreation impact on the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraphs 174, 180 and 181 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Land South Of Hilton Farmhouse Marhamchurch Bude Cornwall EX23 0HE
Description: Demolition of an agricultural building, erection of a dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling, by reason of its scale, massing, design and domestic appearance in an exposed countryside location, will create visually harmful built form, eroding the character and appearance of this part of the countryside. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and is contrary to Policies 1,2,3,7,21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Chi Trevasa 48 Hilgrove Road Newquay Cornwall TR7 2QT
Description: Proposed two-storey rear extension, previously approved but recently lapsed without starting.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development represents a poor quality extension to the existing form of the dwelling which is significant in scale, bulk and insubordinate to the host dwelling which would fail to respond positively to local character and the wider street scene. Rather than adding to the overall quality of the area and creating an attractive place to live, it will have an unacceptable negative impact on the visual amenity value in the immediate locale. The proposal is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, Policy H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed development shall lead to an unacceptable amenity impact upon the occupiers of the dwelling known as '46 Hilgrove Road' by incurring unacceptable and significant levels of over-bearing and over-shadowing to the dwelling, its rear windows and rear external area. Due to this, the proposal is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, Policy H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Hilltop St Mewan St Austell Cornwall PL26 7DT
Description: Retrospective development for change of use from previously undefined/variable use to C3(a), comprising of two linked converted jackleg cabin mobile homes as permanent dwellings and retention of associated drainage and wooden outbuildings for the keeping of chickens and general storage.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its location outside of the development boundary of Polgooth with Trelowth as defined in Appendix 3, Map 3 of the St Mewan NDP and would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting.
