RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of valid survey(s) to demonstrate otherwise and when undertaking a precautionary approach, the Local Planning Authority cannot be satisfied that this scheme will not harm protected species, including but not limited to bats, and hence the development is inconsistent with the aims of Policies E1 and E5 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030, Policies 1 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of affordable housing, transport infrastructure, air quality impacts, education infrastructure, public open space, flood defence infrastructure, primary healthcare, police infrastructure and contributions towards the Strategic Access Management and Monitoring Measures for the Fal and Helford and Penhale Dunes SAC for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to Policies E1, LC1, LC4 and T1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030, Policies 1, 2, 8, 13, 16, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and guidance contained within paragraphs 55, 57, 63, 73, 92, 93, 95, 97, 98, 104, 110, 167, 174 and 186 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 In the absence of information regarding the proposed method of foul drainage disposal the scheme has failed to demonstrate that the development would not create any potential risks from pollution that may cause environmental, amenity or public health harm. The proposal is therefore considered contrary to Policies E1 and E3 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030, Policies 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 4 In the absence of a suitable Flood Risk Assessment the scheme has failed to demonstrate that appropriate measures to mitigate any residual risk of flooding from the development are available and would be deliverable. The proposal is therefore considered contrary to Policies E1 and E2 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030, Policies 13 and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 167 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 3 The Terrace, Fern Cottage Cox Hill Cocks TR6 0AT
Description: Proposed rear and side extensions and alterations to existing dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The extension and dormer extension, by reason of its scale, height and design would significantly detract from the architectural merits of the original dwelling, which is a Grade II Listed Building. The extension and dormer extension would dominate the rear of the building thereby resulting in the loss of the original character and form of the dwelling. The less than substantial harm to the Grade II Listed Building is not outweighed by any public benefits, raising direct conflict with Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The rear extension due to its height, would result in overbearing impacts on the adjoining neighbouring dwelling to the east. The extension is considered to cause significant and demonstrable harm to the living conditions of the occupiers of the adjoining neighbouring dwelling to the eastwith particular regard to overbearing in conflict with the aims and intentions set out within policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 3 The Terrace, Fern Cottage Cox Hill Cocks TR6 0AT
Description: Listed Building Consent for proposed rear and side extensions and alterations to existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The extension and dormer extension, by reason of its scale, height and design would significantly detract from the architectural merits of the original dwelling, which is a Grade II Listed Building. The extension and dormer extension would dominate the rear of the building thereby resulting in the loss of the original character and form of the dwelling. The less than substantial harm to the Grade II Listed Building is not outweighed by any public benefits, raising direct conflict with Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Rear Of 20 North Street Redruth Cornwall TR15 1HJ
Description: Conversion and change of use of domestic garage into a residential premises.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the subdivision of the plot serving 20 North Street. The extant plot acts as a surviving record of the morphology of the historic mining settlement, which is a key attribute that expresses the Outstanding Universal Value of the Camborne and Redruth Mining District World Heritage Site (WHS) and makes a positive contribution to the significance of the WHS as a heritage asset. By developing the site as a separate residential unit, the plot would be severed from its historic functional relationship with the host dwelling, thereby eroding its historic character and overwriting the morphology of the historic plots to the detriment of their authenticity and legibility. The resulting harm to the significance of the WHS is graded as less than substantial, and such harm is neither wholly exceptional nor is it capable of being outweighed by any public benefit arising from the proposal. Therefore, the proposed development would conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130, 189, 197, 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies P3, C2, C9 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020 - 2025 and paragraph 3.2.1 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021. 2 The proposed development, by reason of its cramped and contrived form, would fail to provide an acceptable standard of useable and functional private amenity space amenity for future occupiers. As such, the proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and paragraphs 9.3.5 and 9.5.7 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021, which together seek to achieve a good standard of residential amenity. 3 The application site falls within the zone of influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC), and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to sufficiently mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development and no mitigation has been secured. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Roydon Pendoggett Road St Kew Bodmin Cornwall PL30 3HH
Description: Proposed demolition of existing dwelling and construction of replacement dwelling to include a garage and car port and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The dwelling, by reason of its siting, scale and massing, would result in harmful impacts to the amenities of neighbouring occupiers. The proposal would result in an overbearing development oppressive to the outlook from and result in an unacceptable loss of light to the neighbouring properties to the east. The proposal therefore doesn't comply with policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Tamar Ridge Coxpark Gunnislake Cornwall PL18 9BD
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling and proposed replacement detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of a suitable Phase 1 Land Contamination Report which properly determines and evaluates the existence or otherwise of contamination, its nature and extent, and the risks it may pose to receptors, it has not been possible to conclude that the proposal would not result in harm to future occupants or the natural environment. As such it cannot be confirmed the proposal could be made safe and the proposal conflicts with policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: The Old Boatyard Maenporth Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5HN
Description: Proposed Demolition of Existing Boatyard Buildings and Construction of Single Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the provision of a new dwelling outside of an established settlement and within the open countryside, with limited accessibility which would promote an associated over-reliance by occupiers on a private vehicle. Due to the excessive scale and massing of the proposed dwelling, combined with its contemporary design and associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context, the proposed development would not conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the AONB, and given the lack of any special justification it is not sustainable development, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies 1, 4, and 5 of the Mawnan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030 (Approved Final Version - June 2022), PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P3, PD-P11 and SCW-P4 in the adopted AONB Management Plan 2022-2027 and paragraphs 8, 9, 79, 80, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed dwelling, due to its siting in close proximity to the adjacent neighbouring residential dwelling known as 'Cranny' (not yet constructed, but implemented under planning permission no PA17/09674), combined with its overall height, scale and design is likely to an overbearing impact, as well as unneighbourly impact in terms of overlooking, on the amenities to be enjoyed by future occupiers of the 'Cranny'. In summary, the proposed development is considered to cause significant and demonstrable harm to the living conditions of the future occupiers of the neighbouring dwelling known as 'Cranny' with particular regard to overbearing and overlooking in conflict with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 3 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC) and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which permission in principle cannot be granted. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Centernhay Cottage 1 Tregoney Court Mevagissey PL26 6RN
Description: Proposed demolition and replacement of existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The development, by reason of its size and scale, with additonal massing at the western end and increased ridge height, along with fenestration details considered unsuitable would fail to suitably respond to its setting and would be harmful to the character and visual amenities of the locale, which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The works are found to conflict with the aims of policy D1 and D5 of the Mevagissey Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017 - 2032, policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and section 15 paragraphs 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 13 Regent Square Penzance Cornwall TR18 4BG
Description: Listed building consent for replacement of two windows at the rear of the property
RefusalReasons: In proposing the introduction of modern double glazed UPVC units in lieu of traditional single glazed timber, the proposed replacement windows are considered an inappropriate and harmful addition to the publicly visible main rear wall of the Grade II listed building located in a Conservation Area.The proposed works result in the loss of characteristic timber fenestration and a material reduction in the existing visual quality and historic integrity of the property. The proposed installation of inappropriate modern double glazed windows to a Grade II listed building located in the Penzance Conservation Area is considered to lead to less than substantial harm to the significance of a designated heritage asset. The proposed works fail to preserve the special character of the Grade II listed building, and the character and appearance of the Penzance Conservation AreaThe National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed UPVC double glazing has been set out above. The proposed works would raise concerns relating to the historic environment that are not balanced by factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10, 7.3, 7.6 and 7.7 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; and paragraphs 130, 134, 189, 194, 197, 199, 200, 202, 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The works fail to accord with the Council's statutory duties under sections 16(1) and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 in that the Listed Building and the character and appearance of the Conservation Area will not be preserved

Address: Land Off Couchwell Lane Lostwithiel Cornwall PL22 0BQ
Description: Application for outline planning permission with all matters reserved for construction of a single dwelling house
RefusalReasons: The proposed development is outside of, but immediately adjoining the development boundary as defined in Figure 2.1 of the Lostwithiel Neighbourhood Development Plan and does not meet the criteria of Policy HH2 of the Neighbourhood Development Plan in that it is for a single open market dwelling and therefore does not provide at least 50% affordable housing. Notwithstanding other policy considerations within the Cornwall Local Plan 2016-2030 and National Planning Policy Framework 2021, the Lostwithiel NDP does not support housing development in this location under any other circumstances. The proposal is therefore Contrary to Policy HH2 of the Lostwithiel Neighbourhood Development Plan (December 2018) and the guidance contained within the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 with particular regard to paragraphs 12 and 14.

Address: Blujenn Consols Road Carharrack Redruth Cornwall TR16 5RA
Description: Application for works to trees under a Tree Preservation Order (TPO) to 13 veteran monterey pine trees that all require sectional dismantle to base
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the Monterey Pine trees are of significant public amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the local landscape. There is insufficient justification for the removal of these trees and clear and convincing arboricultural evidence to justify their loss has not been submitted. Their removal is therefore considered to result in a detrimental impact upon the public amenity of the local landscape and contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 13 Regent Square Penzance Cornwall TR18 4BG
Description: Replacement of two windows at the rear of the property
RefusalReasons: In proposing the introduction of modern double glazed UPVC units in lieu of traditional single glazed timber, the proposed replacement windows are considered an inappropriate and harmful addition to the publicly visible main rear wall of the Grade II listed building located in a Conservation Area.The proposed works result in the loss of characteristic timber fenestration and a material reduction in the existing visual quality and historic integrity of the property. The proposed installation of inappropriate modern double glazed windows to a Grade II listed building located in the Penzance Conservation Area is considered to lead to less than substantial harm to the significance of a designated heritage asset. The proposed works fail to preserve the special character of the Grade II listed building, and the character and appearance of the Penzance Conservation AreaThe National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed UPVC double glazing has been set out above. The proposed works would raise concerns relating to the historic environment that are not balanced by factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10, 7.3, 7.6 and 7.7 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; and paragraphs 130, 134, 189, 194, 197, 199, 200, 202, 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The works fail to accord with the Council's statutory duties under sections 66(1) and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 in that the Listed Building and the character and appearance of the Conservation Area will not be preserved

Address: 6 Lowenna Manor Rock Road Rock Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6NP
Description: Single storey rear extension
RefusalReasons: By reason of its excessive scale, discordant architectural form and unbalancing of the uniformity experienced along this terrace, the proposal is incongruous in relation to the host property and causes unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the wider terrace. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policies STMNDP 1.3 and STMNDP 2.7 of the St Minver Parishes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017- 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 8 Fernhill Road Newquay Cornwall TR7 1LE
Description: Rear 1st floor extension, dormers to loft and separation of dwelling to form 2 separate dwellings
RefusalReasons: Policy supports the principle of residential development in this location however, the proposals for an additional dwelling at this site fail to provide an adequate standard of internal and external living conditions or safe and suitable pedestrian access and off-street parking for future occupants and as such the proposed development is considered to be an overdevelopment of the site and contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policies H2 and H4 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019-2030.The social and economic benefits of the proposal through the contribution to deliver housing in a sustainable location in the context of a housing crisis do not in this instance outweigh the identified harm and conflict with policy and there are no other considerations, including the provisions of the National Planning Policy Framework, that indicate that a decision should be taken other than in accordance with the development plan.

Address: 17 Meadowside Road Falmouth Cornwall TR11 4HH
Description: Works to trees covered by a TPO - the trees are a prominent landmark of the area, they are are also encroaching on the property and surrounding properties. The imediate areas below suffer from lack of light, it is suggested that a crown raise will help with this. Crown raise to approx 6m with nothing over 100mm removed.
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to the 2 English Oaks and 1 Copper Beach trees (Crown raised by approximately 6 metres) would significantly detract from the trees public visual amenity value and the character of the street scene. It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works are not justified by the reasoning given in the application, when alternative work could be carried out to reduce the visual impact on the local landscape. The proposed tree works would therefore result in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Beaufort Menheniot Liskeard Cornwall PL14 3RG
Description: Application for discharge of a planning obligation attached to E2/92/00599/F dated 09.11.1992.
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority is satisfied that the Planning Obligation will continue to serve a useful planning purpose because it restricts the occupation of the development granted planning permission as a self-contained 'parents flat'. The Planning Obligation therefore continues to be necessary to make the development acceptable in planning terms given that the removal of the obligation would result in a unit of accommodation tantamount to an unrestricted residential dwelling in the open countryside; contrary to Policy 1 of the Menheniot Neighbourhood Development Plan and policies 1, 2, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). The Planning Obligation therefore accords with Government guidance set out in paragraph 57 the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Spindrift Trolver Croft Feock Truro Cornwall TR3 6RT
Description: The complete demolition of the existing dwelling and the construction of a new 4 bedroom replacement dwelling with associated landscaping works
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would, due to the replacement dwelling being sited appreciably further southeast combined with the increased mass, uncharacteristic form and extensive glazing, result in a conspicuous addition to the local landscape including giving rise to appreciable light spill into the creek-side nightscape. When taken as a whole the proposal will add to the cumulative erosion of the character of the creek and fail to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Cornwall AONB contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies D1, LS1 and LS2 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030, paragraphs 8, 11, 126, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P11 and SCC-P1 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2022-2027 and paragraphs 3.4.2 and 4.2.2 of the Cornwall Design Guide. The limited benefits of the scheme do not outweigh the extent of harmful impact to the AONB to which great weight must be given.

Address: Land West Of 13 College Green College Green Penryn Cornwall TR10 8FL
Description: Application for tree works within a TPO: Three sycamore trees heavily leaning towards property in college green from network rail land
RefusalReasons: The proposed works are not accurately specified but are understood to seek felling of the subject trees. Such works are not supported given the continued contribution of the trees to the visual amenities and character of the area. It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the work is not justified by the reasoning and information set out in the application.

Address: Titania Treloyhan Park Road St Ives Cornwall TR26 2AH
Description: Alterations and Extensions to Existing 1960s dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The modern contemporary design, including flat roofs, excessive amounts of glazing and other non-traditional materials such as copper cladding, would be conspicuously at odds with its surroundings and would neither relate to nor reflect the local context in which it is situated. The proposed extensions and alterations would harm the simple vernacular appearance of the existing bungalow and the distinctive visual amenities and landscape character of the surrounding area. The development would therefore give rise to adverse harm to the character and appearance of the area and would be in conflict with policies BE6 and GD1 the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan (2015 - 2030), policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land West Of Treravel Farm St Ervan Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 7RS
Description: Conversion of agricultural building from C1 use (aparthotel with six apartments) to C3 (two residential dwellings).
RefusalReasons: The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement. The proposed new dwellings would represent new homes with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. The proposal would not accord with the housing policies of the development plan and represents a departure. Given the lack of any special justification or over-riding material consideration, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 8 and 80 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 2 Tregeseal Terrace Tregeseal St Just Penzance Cornwall TR19 7PL
Description: Application for a lawful development certificate for proposed use to create a new access from the highway (an unclassified road) into the front boundary of the property. Within the property's curtilage, the owners would like to lay a hardstanding for the parking of vehicles.
RefusalReasons: The proposed creation of a new vehicular access into the front boundary of the property, and the laying of hardstanding for the parking of vehicles is not considered to be permitted development under the Schedule, Part 1, Class F and Part 2, Class B and Part 11, Class C, C1 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). This is because the demolition of the wall, which is located in a Conservation Area, is "relevant demolition" as per the Conservation Areas (application of section 74 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990) Direction 2015

Address: 1 The Hollies Trerise Road Camborne Cornwall TR14 7HB
Description: Conversion of Existing Garage to Annexed Accommodation to Provide Ancillary and Holiday Use Accommodation. Conversion of Storage Area to Garage.
RefusalReasons: The development, by virtue of its proximity to the host and neighbouring dwelling, the relationship of the parking and turning areas to the units of accommodation and the total number of units within the site would fail to provide adequate living conditions for both existing and future occupiers of both the holiday unit and existing dwellings. For that reason, the proposal cannot be supported as providing high quality tourist accommodation that accords with Policy 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and conflicts with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, which together seek to achieve a good standard of residential amenity.

Address: Land West Of White House Farm And South Of Trepool Ruan Minor Helston Cornwall TR12 7JS
Description: Construction of workshop, parking and landscaping
RefusalReasons: The application site is located in the countryside outside of the established built form of the village of Ruan Minor and it has not been adequately demonstrated in the submissions that there is an overriding locational and business need for the workshop and sculpture business to operate from this rural location.  In the absence of any overriding justification and by reason of the site being in the countryside and not well integrated with the village, the proposal will not conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) in this location due to the buildings excessive scale, bulk and prominence from public viewpoints in the local area. In giving great weight to conserving the landscape and scenic beauty of the AONB in this location, the identified environmental harm is overriding in the planning balance and the proposal is thereby contrary to policies 1, 2, 5, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 84, 85, 130, 174 and 176 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policies PD-P1 and PD-P11 in the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2022 - 2027.

Address: Trenoweth Treloyhan Manor Drive St Ives Cornwall TR26 2AN
Description: Application for Tree works within a TPO area: T1 Copper Beech. Reduce canopy by one third .
RefusalReasons: Reduction of the canopy by one third is not supported. The tree in question is an excellent specimen in early maturity with considerable potential to become a much more significant tree within the local landscape in the fullness of time. The proposal to carry out what amounts to a very heavy crown reduction in order to preserve the exact shrub composition close to the tree is neither a sensible nor viable long term management strategy. The proposed work would therefore be detrimental to public amenity.

Address: Footway Of Trenance Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 2LX
Description: Prior notification of proposed development by telecommunications code system operators for installation of telecommunications monopole and equipment cabinets.
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority has had regard to the requirements to improve telecommunications networks and recognises that there is increasing pressure on the network providers to improve the telecommunication infrastructure. However, this has to be balanced against the visual impact. It is considered that the development would appear incongruous and conspicuously tall within the streetscene, resulting in overriding harm to the character and appearance of the area and immediate neighbouring property. The application is therefore refused due to its conflict with policies 1, 2 12 and 13(5) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy D1(2) of the Adopted Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan; and paragraphs 8, 115 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Woodleigh Caravan Delaware Road Drakewalls Cornwall PL18 9EY
Description: Works to trees subject to a Tree Preservation Order (TPO), works include Fell turkey oaks identified as oak1 and oak2, Remove lower limb on oak 3
RefusalReasons: These trees are protected by a Tree Preservation Order, because of their contribution to the character and amenity of the area. Paragraph 6.45 of 'Tree Preservation Orders: A Guide to the Law and Good Practice' advises that an applicant needs to advance sound reasons before consent to fell trees should be granted. In this instance the applicant has failed to provide clear and convincing evidence to demonstrate sound arboricultural reasons for the felling of the two Turkey Oaks. Therefore due to this lack of sufficient evidence the works cannot be considered reasonable or necessary and the carrying out of these works would greatly impact upon the amenity of the local landscape, contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Adjacent To Tamarisk St Mawgan Newquay TR8 4EJ
Description: Construction of a new family dwelling with assocated access and landscaping
RefusalReasons: The proposal would, by reason of the important undeveloped and natural character of its site, its prominence, the size of the gap, when viewed in connection with the adjoining site to the south, and lack of clear visual barrier/edge, not constitute an 'infill scheme or 'rounding off'. A new dwelling in this location would adversely alter the character of the site and harm the natural and distinctive qualities of the area and Watergate and Lanherne Area of Great Landscape Value. The limited social and economic benefits of the application do not outweigh this harm and the application is contrary to the aims and intensions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.2.In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of financial contributions to mitigate the recreation impact on the Penhale Dunes Special Area of Conservation for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraphs 174, 180 and 181 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Trefellyn B3289 Between Halvarras Road And Waterloo Plantation Penelewey Feock Cornwall TR3 6QU
Description: Application for tree works in a Tree Preservation Order (TPO) including: Removing of a Turkey Oak tree
RefusalReasons: This Turkey Oak tree is protected by a Tree Preservation Order, because of its contribution to the character and amenity of the area known as the former Wellington Plantation. Paragraph 6.45 of 'Tree Preservation Orders: A Guide to the Law and Good Practice' advises that an applicant needs to advance sound reasons before consent to fell trees should be granted. In this instance the applicant has failed to provide clear and convincing evidence to demonstrate sound arboricultural reasons for the felling of the Turkey Oak tree. Therefore due to this lack of sufficient evidence the works cannot be considered reasonable or necessary and the carrying out of these works would greatly impact upon the amenity of the local landscape and likely to lead to pressure for significant tree removal in the area, to the determent of its verdant character, contrary to Policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies BIO2 and LS2 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan - April 2018 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 23 Roskear Camborne Cornwall TR14 8DG
Description: Listed Building Consent for replacement of failed scantle roof covering and removal of cement mortar pointing to be replaced with a lime mortar.
RefusalReasons: All bats and their roosts are fully protected under the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (as amended by the Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000) and are further protected under the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017.Whilst it is acknowledged that the proposal is not likely to give rise to an unacceptable level of visual harm to the character of this listed building, in the absence of an appropriate ecological survey, it is not possible to fully assess the potential impact of the development upon European protected species that may be present and to understand what mitigation measures may be necessary in order to address any potential adverse impacts. The application therefore fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance biodiversity, and as such is contrary to Policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the aims and intentions of paragraphs and 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Hendra Farmhouse Hendra Lane Ashton Cornwall TR13 9TX
Description: Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for a Proposed conversion of roof with front rooflights and rear facing dormer, forming second floor accommodation
RefusalReasons: On the basis of the submitted documentation provided and the Local Planning Authority's own investigations, the Local Planning Authority considers that the proposed loft conversion with front rooflights and rear facing dormer at Hendra Farmhouse, Ashton, would require planning permission as the works do not fall within the conditions of Permitted Development as set out under Class B of Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended). This is because the site is within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.

Address: 12 Crinnis Wood Avenue Carlyon Bay Cornwall PL25 3QD
Description: To fell 3 Sycamore trees subject to a TPO.
RefusalReasons: These trees are protected by a Tree Preservation Order, because of their contribution to the character and amenity of the area. Paragraph 6.45 of 'Tree Preservation Orders: A Guide to the Law and Good Practice' advises that an applicant needs to advance sound reasons before consent to fell trees should be granted. In this instance the applicant has failed to provide clear and convincing evidence to demonstrate sound arboricultural reasons for the felling of the three Sycamore trees. Therefore due to this lack of sufficient evidence the works cannot be considered reasonable or necessary and the carrying out of these works would greatly impact upon the amenity of the local landscape, contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 9 Higher Whiterock Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 7DU
Description: Proposed extensions and internal alterations.
RefusalReasons: By reason of the scale, discordant architectural form and that it would represent a significant departure from an otherwise unified roofscape within the cul-de-sac, the proposal would result in a visually dominant and incongruous form of development in relation to the host property and its surroundings which would cause an unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the area. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 5 Lowenna Manor Rock Road Rock Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6NP
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed single storey rear extension
RefusalReasons: The proposed works will not be lawful development under this certificate and will require the benefit of planning permission. This is due to a planning condition on the original application E1/2003/02135 which removed permitted development rights. The condition stated:Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order) no development within Classes A - E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of that Order shall be carried out without the express consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To retain control over future development which could be prejudicial to the character and appearance of the building and locality.

Address: Land South Of Cudna Bungalow Cudna Lane Crowntown Helston Cornwall TR13 0AD
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for proposed construction of up to 3 dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would physically and visually extend beyond the definable built form and shape of the settlement of Crowntown and harmfully impact upon the rural and undeveloped character and appearance of the site, which, at present, positively contributes to the setting of the settlement and adds to the character of the area; the proposal is not therefore considered to constitute infill development, nor would it be seen to round off the settlement. The proposed development constitutes an unsustainable form of development that would contribute to the incremental erosion and urbanisation of the pleasant rural landscape character, unacceptably harming the character, identity and setting of the settlement of Crowntown and the surrounding open countryside, in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and section 3 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: Orchard Cottage Pink Moors St Day Cornwall TR16 5PG
Description: Construction of side and rear extensions and installation of a new septic tank to replace existing system.
RefusalReasons: The extensions, by reason of their scale, bulk, massing and materials would significantly detract from the architectural merits of the original dwelling, which is considered a non-designated heritage asset. The extensions would dominate the building thereby resulting in the loss of the original character and form of the dwelling which as present is an established attribute feature that through its current level of authenticity and integrity expresses the Outstanding Universal Value of the Gwennap Mining District World Heritage Site (WHS). The less than substantial harm to the Gwennap Mining District WHS is not outweighed by any public benefits, raising direct conflict with Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development fails to protect, conserve or enhance the significance of the Gwennap Mining District World Heritage Site in conflict with the aims and intentions set out with policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 130, 189, 202 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North Of Oakwell Cottage Carwynnen Camborne Cornwall TR14 9LR
Description: Planning permission for the erection of a wooden cabin.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would result in a large self-contained unit of living accommodation with its own access. Due to its scale, degree of self-containment, and distinct separation of approximately 75 metres from the principal dwelling, the proposed development would be tantamount to a new dwelling in the open countryside within the Carnmenellis Area of Great Landscape Value, therefore failing to represent a genuine ancillary development. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 80, 130 and 174 the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Glyngwelva 71 Launceston Road Callington Cornwall PL17 8DS
Description: Works to a tree subject to a Tree Preservation Order for T1, English Oak, to reduce significantly due to excessive shading, proximity to dwelling and stability concerns.
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to the tree have not been adequately justified through an arboricultural report completed by a suitably qualified arboricultural professional. Furthermore, the proposed works to the tree have not been specified in accordance with best practice as set out in BS3998 Recommendation For Tree Work. Consequently, it is likely that the proposed works would have a detrimental impact upon the physiology of the tree, adversely impacting its short and long term amenity contribution.

Address: Old Lanwarnick, Over The Moon Road From The B3254 At The Rectory To Junction South Of Colhender Wood Duloe Cornwall PL14 4QF
Description: Proposed side extension to create a garden room, porch, garage and store at ground level and a bedroom, study, shower room and balcony above.
RefusalReasons: By reason of its scale, design, appearance, architectural form and materials, the proposed development would represent an incongruous and dominant addition to the host property and would fail to recognise the intrinsic value and beauty of the rural landscape, designated as an AGLV, and the local built form and would result in a development that would appear incongruous and out of character with the surroundings, negatively impacting on the visual amenity of the area. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, Saved Policy CL9 of the Caradon District Local Plan First Alteration (adopted August 2007), paragraphs 8, 126, 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and the guidance within Sections 3.1, 4.2 and 4.3 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: Land South Of 246 Henver Road Henver Road Newquay Cornwall TR7 3EH
Description: Proposed erection of a single, self-build, low impact and highly sustainable, dwelling house
RefusalReasons: Having regard to the existing sub-standard parking situation where vehicles must reverse onto or from this busy highway and across a primary cycle route, the lack of suitable alternative arrangements for the parking of vehicles, and the increased pressure on the parking area that the proposal would cause, the proposal conflicts with Policy H4 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019-2030 and also fails to ensure safe and suitable access to all as required by Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The social and economic benefits of the proposal through the contribution to deliver housing in a sustainable location in the context of a housing crises do not in this instance outweigh the identified harm and conflict with policy and there are no other considerations, including the provisions of the National Planning Policy Framework, that indicate that a decision should be taken other than in accordance with the development plan.

Address: Land East Of 39 New Road Port Isaac Cornwall PL29 3SD
Description: Proposed demolition of disused garages and construction of three bed cottage.
RefusalReasons: Due to the size of dwelling proposed at the site the development fails to provide an adequate level of private amenity space for use by future occupants and as such the proposed development is considered to be an overdevelopment of the site and contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policy 1 of the St Endellion Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030.

Address: The Old Stonemasons Yard Tram Cross Lane Lanner Redruth Cornwall TR16 5SZ
Description: Erection of dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would adversely impact upon the authenticity and the legibility of the historic use of the site as a former coal yard which is considered to be a non-designated heritage asset due its visual, physical and vital functional relationship with the adjacent historic mineral tramway which is incorporated within Camborne and Redruth Mining District World Heritage Site (WHS). By reason of the scale and proportions of the dwelling proposed, it would result in a marked change to the character, appearance and function of the site, detracting from its low-key and utilitarian character, which is symbolic of its historic industrial use. Furthermore, as a result of its scale and proportions, the development would be perceptible from immediate and wider views, creating a more built up appearance within the rural landscape and contributing to the incremental harm to the intrinsic character and beauty of the open countryside. Unjustified by any overriding public benefits, the proposed development would result in substantial harm to the significance of the non-designated heritage asset and less than substantial harm to the significance and outstanding universal value of the WHS, and also detract from intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside. The proposed development would therefore conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 6, 7 and 13 of the Lanner Neighbourhood Plan 2017 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130, 189, 197, 199, 202 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies P3, P8, C2 and C9 of The Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020-2025 and the Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: Pednolver Terrace 9 Pednolver Terrace St Ives Cornwall TR26 2EL
Description: Construction of basement level, construction of sunroom and terrace to front elevation, demolition of rear utility room to create parking space and construction of a first-floor bedroom extension, construction of rear porch and extension to rear dormer.
RefusalReasons: The development, by virtue of its design, scale and siting, is considered to represent incongruous development that fails to demonstrate a clear response to the dwelling and its setting. The proposals fail to reflect the distinctive character and form of the dwellings along Pednolver Terrace such that they harm the overall architectural character and essential elements of the buildings in this prominent and important location of St Ives. Notwithstanding this, the proposed front terrace and rear dormer, by reason of their position and scale, have the potential to harm the residential amenities of neighbouring occupiers of Pednolver Terrace with particular regard to overlooking and loss of privacy. The development would therefore, be contrary to policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies GD1 and BE5 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Trefagus Coxpark Latchley Cornwall PL18 9BB
Description: Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for a proposed sun room extension to rear of property
RefusalReasons: The permitted development rights of the dwelling Trefagus have been removed under planning permission 5/89/00878/F meaning that the dwelling cannot benefit from the permitted development rights set out within the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015. As such, planning permission is required.

Address: Owls Cottage Killiganoon Carnon Downs Cornwall TR3 6JT
Description: First floor extension to dwelling and construction of detached garage.
RefusalReasons: The development would, through the proposed scale, form and mass, result in the simple form and proportion of the original cottage element of the property being completely subsumed so that it could not be read in terms of its scale, form and character. The loss of the original cottage which is of locally distinctive character and considered to be a non-designated heritage asset, would ensure the proposal could not be considered as enhancing its appearance. For these reasons the proposed development is considered to be contrary to the aims of Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies D1 and HE1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030, paragraphs 126, 130, 197 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and section 4.2 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021.

Address: 38 Edward Street Truro Cornwall TR1 3AJ
Description: Listed building consent for Proposed new external signage to Listed Building.
RefusalReasons: The proposed advertisement would, due to its size and prominence, harm the appearance of the listed building and detract from the visual amenity of the immediate locality contrary to the aims of paragraphs 136, 194, 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy C5 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030, sections 66 and 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 2 Managing Significance in Decision-Taking in the Historic Environment 2015 and Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 3, The Setting of Heritage Assets (2nd Edition).

Address: Former Piggery North Of Roseworthy Barton Gwinear Road Connor Downs Cornwall TR27 5JQ
Description: Conversion of Former Piggery to Residential Dwelling & Associated Work
RefusalReasons: The remains of the building, by reason of the scale, condition and appearance, would require significant demolition, reconstruction, and rebuilding in order to facilitate a residential use; without such work, it would not be capable of being converted into a habitable dwelling.  Therefore the development would be tantamount to a new dwelling in an unsustainable location in the open countryside, for which no special justification has been presented. The proposed use with the associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context would fail to enhance the immediate setting and as such, the special qualities and attributes of this historic rural landscape would be harmed contrary to the aims of policies GGP Policy 9 of the Gwinear Gwithian Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016-2020, policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 80, 126, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Trewoone Farm 11 Strawberry Lane Hayle Cornwall TR27 5JS
Description: Demolition of existing barn and construction of sustainable farm house and associated works.
RefusalReasons: The application site is situated in a countryside location where new residential development is only permitted in special circumstances. In this instance it is not considered that the development proposal complies with any of those special circumstances set out in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. Furthermore, notwithstanding the fall-back position that the existing barn on the site can be converted to a residential use under Class Q of Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), the domestic appearance and two-storey scale of the proposed scheme relative to the existing single-storey agricultural building is such that it would have a significantly greater presence at the site, which is very prominent in the public domain and would constitute an undesirable form of development that would not respond well to its landscape setting, that is not locally distinctive in its design and that would not protect, maintain or enhance the predominantly rural character of the area. The development as such is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, with policy NE3 of the Hayle Neighbourhood Plan (2014-2030) and with paragraphs 8, 80, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Morwenstow Methodist Church Shop Morwenstow Bude Cornwall EX23 9SL
Description: Works to trees subject to a Tree Preservation Order (TPO), works include felling of various trees on the hedgerow next to the cemetery
RefusalReasons: These trees are protected by a Tree Preservation Order, because of their contribution to the character and amenity of the area. The applicant has failed to demonstrate sound arboricultural reasons for the proposed works due to a lack of clear and convincing supporting evidence. The trees are not considered to be dangerous, nor do they pose a current threat. Therefore the works to these trees would greatly impact upon the amenity of the local landscape, contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Leys Cottage Road From Penzance Road To St Just Road The Green St Buryan Cornwall TR19 6DS
Description: Replacement roof covering on rear roadside roof slope.
RefusalReasons: The proposed removal of the existing cement washed scantle slate roof and its replacement with an inauthentic slate will neither preserve nor enhance the special interest of the listed building or the Conservation Area nor does it sustain the local distinctiveness of Cornwall. The proposed works fail to preserve the special interest, authenticity or heritage values of the Grade II Listed Building. It has not been demonstrated that there is any public benefit and as such the social and economic benefits of the proposal are not considered sufficient to outweigh the adverse impact on the historic environment for which great weight must be given; the proposal therefore represents an unacceptable form of development. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; and paragraphs 130, 134, 189, 194, 197, 199, 200, 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The works fail to accord with the Council's statutory duties under sections 16(2) and 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 in that the Listed Building would not be preserved and there would be an adverse impact upon the character of the Conservation Area.

Address: Land East Of Flora Cottage Trevena Lane Ashton Helston Cornwall TR13 9RY
Description: Erection of a Tractor Shed
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, unjustified by any special circumstances or agricultural justification, would be a sporadic, undesirable and unsustainable form of development which harmfully urbanises the intrinsically rural character and appearance of the open countryside. By reason of its prominent siting and scale, the building would have an adverse visual impact on the strong rural character of the area and fail to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Godolphin and Tregonning Hills Area of Great Landscape Value in this location. The proposed development is therefore be contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Basset Road Farm Bassett Road North Country TR16 4BE
Description: Proposed extensions.
RefusalReasons: By reason of its design, scale and massing, the proposed extensions are considered to result in an overly-dominant addition to the dwelling and would appear as an incongruous feature to the detriment of the appearance of the existing dwelling, contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 25 Chute Lane Gorran Haven Cornwall PL26 6NU
Description: Works to trees subject to a Tree Preservation Order (TPO), works include removal of 2 x sycamore
RefusalReasons: These trees are protected by an area Tree Preservation Area, because of their contribution to the character and amenity of the area. No justification has been presented for the removal of these assets to public amenity, other than to aid private amenity. Their removal  would result in harm to the amenity of the area and a precedent likely to lead to pressure for significant tree removal in the area, to the determent of the character of this AONB settlement.

Address: Agricultural Barn NW Of Hillcrest Barn Croft Common Troon Camborne Cornwall TR14 9HT
Description: Prior notification for construction of an agricultural barn
RefusalReasons: The proposed agricultural building would be situated in an undeveloped area, adjacent to a bend within the highway which connects two nearby settlements. In this area, the building would be prominent and exposed, seen in an elevated position on land which is sloped above the hamlet of Bolenowe. In view of the land available to the applicant, the position of the building, in a prominent position adjacent to the highway, is unjustified as opportunities appear to exist to reposition the building in a more discreet and less visually impactful location. The information submitted does not offer any methods to assist in reducing the prominence of the building through excavation work or landscaping, and the finish of the building in green metalled cladding would fail to soften the appearance of the building and give rise to an undesirable industrial appearance. When considered as a whole, the proposed development, by reason of its siting, scale and external appearance would have a harmful impact on the undeveloped rural landscape character. As such, the development is considered in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. Prior approval of the proposed development is hereby refused.

Address: 5 Old Paul Hill Newlyn Cornwall TR18 5BT
Description: Replacement of existing sash windows with UPVC vertical sash slider windows
RefusalReasons: In proposing the replacement of traditional timber sliding sash windows with overtly modern UPVC alternatives, the proposed works are considered to be of demonstrable harm to the highly and intimately visible principal elevation of a predominantly well-preserved iconic terrace of cottages, and to the surrounding Conservation Area.The proposed works result in the loss of characteristic timber fenestration and a material reduction in the existing visual quality and historic authenticity of the streetscape that make an important contribution to the character of the cottage, and the historic terrace in which it is located. The proposed works fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Newlyn Conservation Area. The works are considered to raise design concerns that cause harm and that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 2 (paragraph 2.1.1), 3 (paragraphs 3.1.2, 3.2.2 and 3.3.5) and 4 (paragraph 4.3.1) of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; and paragraphs 126, 130 (paragraphs a, c and d), 132, 134, 189, 197(c), 199, 202 and 206 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.

Address: Land At Dinas Dinas Padstow Cornwall PL28 8LU
Description: Outline application for the erection of up to five dwellings including access with all other matters reserved
RefusalReasons: The development if approved would be contrary to Policies 3, 7 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and Policy PAD7 (4) of the Padstow Neighbourhood Development Plan (NDP) 2018-2030 in that the site falls outside the settlement boundary as shown on Padstow Map 9 of the NDP and in open countryside where development is strictly regulated and based on identified local needs. The development is not affordable led and nor has it been supported by any evidence to demonstrate how it would respond to the most up to date assessment of housing needs for the parish as shown on the Cornwall Council's Housing Needs register (Homechoice). It therefore fails to demonstrate how it meets local needs or provide for the most needed affordable housing in the parish in perpetuity. In conflicting with the Padstow NDP it would also be contrary to the guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 with particular regard to paragraphs 12 and 14.

Address: Little Borea Farm Access Track To Georgia Farm Borea Farm And Upper Croft Todden Nancledra Cornwall TR20 8AZ
Description: Construction of 3 bedroom dwelling and removal of existing mobile home as approved under Certificate of Lawfulness PA13/11585 dated 3rd July 2014
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would result in a dwelling with a greater physical presence than the existing structure in a sensitive countryside location. The dwelling by reason of its design, scale and massing is not sympathetic to the local and landscape character. The expansive glazing on the South West and South East elevations, together with 3 no. roof lights, is likely to result in light pollution when the building is lit internally during hours of darkness to a greater extent than is the case with the existing situation due to the significantly increased amount of glazing, which would adversely affect the natural beauty of the AONB and the tranquillity of the West Penwith International Dark Sky Park. The proposal would also result in an increase of domestic paraphernalia at the site including a new tarmac access road and would result in the loss of an existing Cornish Hedge. This cumulative harm, paired with the harm of the proposed dwelling, mean that the proposal fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the AONB. The development is therefore considered to be contrary to the aims and intensions of Policies LUD2, LUD6 and LUD7 of the Ludgvan Neighbourhood Development Plan, Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, the advice in paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, and the aims and intentions of Policies PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P3, PD-P11 and LS-P3 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2022-2027.

Address: Chez Nous Pennance Road Lanner Cornwall TR16 5TF
Description: Part-retrospect: Demolition of front garden wall and changes to ground level in front garden to create new off-road parking space
RefusalReasons: The use of the proposed vehicular access onto a classified highway would be detrimental to highway safety by virtue of the restricted emerging visibility available to drivers of vehicles emerging from the application site. The proposal is therefore contrary to national planning policy stated in paragraphs 110 and 111 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policies 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Trevilla Manor Trevilla Road Feock Cornwall TR3 6QG
Description: Resubmission for proposed extensions and redesign of roof to provide additional and enhanced accommodation
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by reason of its modern design and fenestration would not demonstrate an aesthetic understanding of its location and would fail to conserve and enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and setting of the Listed Building in which the public benefits do not outweigh the harm. The proposal would be considered contrary to contrary to Policies 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies BI01, LS2, HE1 and D1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Plan, Paragraphs 130, 174 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy PD-P11 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2022-2027.

Address: Mount Whistle Farm Mount Whistle Road South Tehidy Cornwall TR14 0HU
Description: Siting of touring caravan to be used as holiday accommodation
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of its location within the open countryside, which is inaccessible by a range of modes of transport, would increase the reliance on the private vehicle and hence increase carbon emissions, and fail to promote sustainable travel modes that limit future car use. Further environmental harm would arise through its contribution to the incremental erosion of the rural landscape through the permanent presence of a caravan and the associated domestic paraphernalia. The proposed development would lead to an intensification of a residential use in the open countryside where no special circumstances have been demonstrated. Consequently, the proposal is in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies PH3 and PEH1 of the Illogan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016-2030, policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 84, 85, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Hepworth House 27 Edgcumbe Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 2NJ
Description: Change of use from dwelling/B&B to HMO and 3 self-contained studio apartments (including removal of single storey extensions)
RefusalReasons: The proposal would provide an additional House of Multiple Occupation (HMO) that in conjunction with existing HMOs in the area will exceed the level established within the development plan at which a sustainable, inclusive and mixed-use community can be sustained. The application, therefore, fails to comply with the aims and intentions of Policy H3 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019.

Address: Penolva Bungalow Mousehole Lane Mousehole Penzance Cornwall TR19 6TX
Description: Extensions, alterations and associated works with variation of Condition 2 in respect of decision PA20/10650 dated 18.02.21
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed extension, due to its further increased ridge height and the introduction of a wrap-around balcony and roof garden, would appear overly_x0002_domineering, conspicuous and inappropriate in the context of the surrounding built and natural environment, and at odds with the local vernacular of the rural Medieval settlement within which it is located, which lies immediately adjacent to an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposed works raise concerns in relation to design and the natural and historic environment that cause harm, and that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest or benefit. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), 23 (paragraph 1 and 2) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010- 2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Policies PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P3 and PD-P11 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2022- 2027, paragraphs 2.1.1, 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 4.2, 4.4 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021, and paragraphs 130, 132, 134, 174, 176, 189 and 197(c) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Westpoint Droskyn Point Perranporth Cornwall TR6 0GS
Description: Demolition of dwelling and erection of a replacement dwelling, parking and amenity areas
RefusalReasons: The development would result in a building of a significantly greater height and massing than that existing or immediately adjacent neighbouring properties, in the context of which the site is perceived. As a result, and combined with the more contemporary form and finish, the development will appear as a dominant feature in the street scene and fails to demonstrate an understanding of or acceptable response to its surroundings resulting in a negative impact upon the character of the area. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South Of Carruan Bungalow Quakers Road St Minver Wadebridge Cornwall
Description: Use of land for the siting of six glamping pods, formation of parking area and additional landscaping.
RefusalReasons: The site lies outside of the designated Settlement Development Areas as identified by the St Minver Neighbourhood Development Plan and is therefore within a countryside location. It does not form part of an existing tourist accommodation site. The site is elevated and highly visible within the surrounding landscape and from various public vantage points. The development if approved would lead to sporadic development in the open countryside that is contrary in principle to the policies of the St Minver Neighbourhood Development Plan, would fail to make the best use of land and would cause landscape harm by reason of its elevation and prominence and would therefore fail to meet the tests of sustainability as embodied in Policies STMNDP 2, (sub policies STMNDP 2.1 and STMNDP 2.6) and STMNDP 4.5 of the St Minver Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030 and Policies 1, 5, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030.

Address: Porthilly Meadow Porthilly Lane Rock Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6JX
Description: Outline Application for a single detached residential dwelling with all matters reserved without compliance of condition 3 in relation of decision notice PA17/02672 dated 17/07/2017.
RefusalReasons: The information submitted with this application fails to demonstrate that the existing dwelling is no longer required within the wider agricultural community. In the absence of an adequate evidence, the applicants have not shown that the occupancy condition is no longer reasonable and necessary to protect the agricultural housing stock and prevent the proliferation of unrestricted residential properties in the countryside. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 3 and 7 Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2016-2030, policy STMNDP2.1 of the St Minver Parishes Neighbourhood Plan 2017-2030 and paragraph 80 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Bos Lowen Tripp Hill St Neot Liskeard Cornwall PL14 6NF
Description: Application for discharge of a planning obligation pursuant to E2/06/00286/FUL dated 04.01.2007.
RefusalReasons: The local planning authority is satisfied that the Planning Obligation continues to serve a useful planning purpose because it restricts the occupation of the development granted planning permission as a low-cost dwelling in perpetuity to qualifying persons with a local connection in an area of evidenced affordable housing need. Discharging the Section 106 would result in the loss of this affordable dwelling to the open market without robustly evidenced justification. As such the proposal is in direct opposition to the major thrust of central government and local policy to house all sectors of the community, in conflict with Policy 8 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraph 60 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Roosters Roost Tregiffian St Buryan Penzance Cornwall TR19 6JB
Description: Resubmission of planning application PA21/07530 (Proposed Balcony and Formation of Landscape Window to Side Elevation of Barn) for construction of rear balcony.
RefusalReasons: The proposed balcony appears as a conspicuous, domesticated, modern addition that is wholly inappropriate to a converted barn located within a sensitive rural landscape. The proposed works materially reduce the visual quality of the host building and the setting, which is located within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, to which the National Planning Policy Framework affords the highest status of protection. The National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed balcony has been set out above. Although the private benefits and minor economic benefits of the provision of the balcony are appreciated, the proposed works would result in less than substantial harm in relation to a non-designated heritage asset and its setting, that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), 23 (paragraphs 2 , 2a and 2b) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10, 7.6 and 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; Policies PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P3, PD-P11 and PD-P18 (bullet point 4) of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2022-2027; and paragraphs 126, 130, 134, 194, 197(c), 199, 203, 176 and 178 and of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Former Trevalsa Court Hotel School Hill Mevagissey Cornwall PL26 6TH
Description: Change of use of former hotel to dwelling
RefusalReasons: The applicant has failed to demonstrate that there is no market demand for the Trevalsa Court Hotel through active and continued marketing for at least a period of 9 months before submitting a planning applicant to change the use from a C1 use (Hotel) to a C3 use (dwelling). The change of use of the hotel to a single dwelling would provide no employment space or provide a mixed use scheme. The change of use of the hotel to a dwelling would not result in the provision of a community facility. The applicant has failed to demonstrate that the loss of the hotel is due to environmental considerations. The proposal therefore conflicts with Policy 5(2)(i)(ii)(iii) and (iv) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Little Trerank,The Lodge Access Road To Little Trerank Roche Cornwall PL26 8EU
Description: Proposed replacement dwelling with variation of condition 2 of decision PA14/10722 dated 12.03.2015
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling, by reason of its siting, massing and height, is prominent in the landscape to the detriment of the distinctive natural beauty of the surrounding countryside. The application is, therefore, contrary to policies 1, 2,12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan; Polices A1, G1 and H2 of the Roche Parish Neighbourhood Plan and paragraph 177 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: 13 Radnor Close Bodmin Cornwall PL31 2BZ
Description: Works to a tree subject to a tree preservation order, works are to T1 (Sessile Oak) for crown reduction, reduce the height of tree by 1.5m to leave at 12.5m and radial crown spread on all sides by 1.5m to leave 4.5m. No cuts to be greater than 30mm diameter, taken back to suitable growth points.
RefusalReasons: The applicant has failed to demonstrate sound arboricultural reasons for the proposed works due to a lack of clear and convincing supporting evidence and the proposed works not being in accordance with industry best practices and unacceptable amenity impacts, contrary to paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Kerris Vale Kerriers Road Inches Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5LR
Description: Removal of Condition 5 relating to agricultural occupancy on application 6/87/0720/OOP granted 6th July 1987.
RefusalReasons: Condition 5 of the original permission, despite the certificate that has been granted, still holds a planning purpose. As such, the proposal to remove condition 5 and subsequently the agricultural tie, would be against the aims and intentions of Policy 7 of the CLP and paragraph 80 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Rear Of 25 Loscombe Road Four Lanes Cornwall TR16 6QA
Description: Outline application for erection of a single dwellinghouse with all matters reserved, except access
RefusalReasons: By reason of the location of the development, outside of the definable limits of the settlement, the proposed development would give rise to the intrusion of residential development into the open countryside, unjustified by any special circumstances. Contrary to the Development Plan policy concerning the location of housing, the proposal would contribute to the harmful urbanisation of the rural landscape, to the detriment of the intrinsic rural character and appearance of the open countryside. The proposed development would therefore result in overriding conflicts with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Rear Of 25 Loscombe Road Four Lanes Cornwall TR16 6QA
Description: Outline application for erection of a single dwellinghouse with all matters reserved, except access
