RefusalReasons: By reason of the location of the development, outside of the definable limits of the settlement, the proposed development would give rise to the intrusion of residential development into the open countryside, unjustified by any special circumstances. Contrary to the Development Plan policy concerning the location of housing, the proposal would contribute to the harmful urbanisation of the rural landscape, to the detriment of the intrinsic rural character and appearance of the open countryside. The proposed development would therefore result in overriding conflicts with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 8 Broad Lane Illogan Cornwall TR15 3HY
Description: Proposed new detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: By reason of its form, proportions and appearance, the proposed dwelling would appear as a discordant feature in its context, failing to respond positively to the locally distinctive character of the streetscene. The proposed development would ultimately harm the character and appearance of the streetscene, in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 119, 126 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and the Cornwall Design Guide 2021. The recommendation for refusal is in accordance with guidance contained within paragraph 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 124 Cuddra Road St Austell Cornwall PL25 3GB
Description: Works to trees subject to a Tree Preservation Order (TPO), works include works to an oak and sycamore.
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to the trees hereby referred to are considered to be not in line with industry best practice and the current British Standard. This would have a negative impact on the physiological and structural condition of the trees, as well the long term contribution to amenity and the local landscape character to the detriment of the area.

Address: 10 Pengelly Way Threemilestone Truro Cornwall TR3 6DP
Description: Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for Proposed Use on the grounds that the existing domestic property and alterations fall within permitted development.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development of a single story rear extension and associated works requires prior approval under the Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A (f)(i) and (g) of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). This is because the proposed extension would extend beyond the rear wall of the original dwellinghouse by more than 3 metres, but not more than 6 metres. The submission of an application for prior approval is therefore required.

Address: Radio Mast And Cabinet Cripplesease Nancledra Penzance Cornwall TR20 8NG
Description: Telecommunications Prior Notification: Electronic communications base station comprising 20m mast and associated radio equipment cabinets
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority has had regard to the requirements to improve telecommunications networks and recognises that there is increasing pressure on the network providers to improve the telecommunication infrastructure. However, this has to be balanced against the visual impact. It is considered that the development by virtue of its height and siting in a prominent rural setting on a verge adjacent to a highway would be highly conspicuous and an incongruous addition in the rural landscape which would be detrimental to the character and distinctive landscape qualities of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The application is therefore refused due to its conflict with policies 1, 2 12 and, 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 115, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policies MD8 and MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Belhaven Mount Royal Close Chyandour Cliff Penzance TR18 3LQ
Description: Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for Proposed Use of two small single storey buildings to operate as a workshop and a shed.
RefusalReasons: The proposed use of two single storey buildings to operate as a workshop and a shed are not considered to be permitted development under the Schedule, Part 1, Class E of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). This is because the proposed workshop and shed would be situated on land forward of a wall forming the principal elevation of the original dwellinghouse.

Address: The Buccaneer, Accommodation At Fore Street Polperro Cornwall PL13 2QR
Description: Replacement of two timber highway facing window frames in the flat above the restaurant with timber effect frames
RefusalReasons: The proposed installation of UPVC windows, by reason of their unsympathetic design, materials and appearance and the loss of historic fabric fails to take account of the historic context of the application site and surroundings and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the building and the Polperro Conservation Area. The proposed development would result in less than substantial harm to the Conservation Area, which is not outweighed by public benefits.  The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy 7 of the Polperro and Lansallos NDP, paragraphs 130, 134, 194, 197, 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land North Of Pempwell Pempwell Stoke Climsland Callington Cornwall PL17 8LN
Description: Installation of a septic tank and appropriate systems
RefusalReasons: In the absence of any overriding justification for the septic tank and associated systems in this location, the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development introducing permanent infrastructure that is considered harmful to the undeveloped greenfield land within an Area of Great Landscape Value contrary to Policies 1,2,5,12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies, 2010-2030, adopted November 2016, Policy ENV1 of the North Cornwall Local Plan and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Treloquithack Farm Treloquithack Wendron Helston Cornwall TR13 0NH
Description: Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for Proposed Use for the creation of a bedroom with ensuite bathroom on the first floor and library/music room on the ground floor.
RefusalReasons: The proposed conversion of the separate unit to additional ancillary accommodation works would result in a material change of use contrary to section 55 (1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. Therefore the proposed works are not lawful, and planning permission is required.

Address: Ralphs Cottage (aka Ralph's Barn) Trenowth Grampound Road Truro Cornwall TR2 4EH
Description: Discharge of planning obligation in respect of decision C1/LC15/1072/98/S dated 13.04.99.
RefusalReasons: By reason of the annex's location divorced from the main dwelling and given the unit would be considered unsuitable for permanent residential occupation the Local Planning Authority therefore refuses to Discharge the Planning Obligation as it continues to serve a useful planning purpose and therefore meets the tests set out in paragraph 57 of the National Planning Policy Framework.  The Obligation remains necessary to make the development acceptable in planning terms; is directly related to the development and is fairly and reasonably related in scale and kind to the development.

Address: 2 Chapel Close Kehelland Cornwall TR14 0DB
Description: Retention of boundary wall and fence
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would harmfully impact upon the character and appearance of the area, giving an adverse urban appearance and disrupting the sense of openness within the streetscene, thereby failing to respond positively to the locally distinctive characteristics of the area. The proposal therefore conflicts with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and the Cornwall Design Guide 2021. The recommendation for refusal on these grounds is in accordance with paragraph 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, which states that development that is not well designed should be refused.

Address: Land To The North Of The Seavista Hotel Mawgan Porth Newquay Cornwall
Description: Construction of 3 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed development does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic policies 2010 to 2030. The development shall visually extend built form into the countryside which would be to the detriment to the character and appearance of the distinctive qualities of the rural landscape and Watergate and Lanherne Area of Great Landscape Value. In the absence of any affordable housing provision or any other special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and would be contrary to Policy 14 of the Restormel Local Plan 2001, policies 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.2.The proposal has not been supported by sufficient ecological surveys to demonstrate that the proposal could maintain the favourable conservation status on nationally protected species in conflict with accordance with the aims and intensions of Paragraphs 8, 174(d) and 180(a) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy 23 point 3(d) of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 1 Penina Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 2LE
Description: Loft conversion through raising ridge height with associated works.
RefusalReasons: The development would result in a loss of privacy due to the overlooking opportunities from the proposed first floor Juliet balconies which would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the residential amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties to the northwest and northeast, particularly the neighbours at No. 26 Trevemper Road and 3 Penina Avenue. The development is contrary to Policy H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan, Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 2 Regent Square Penzance Cornwall TR18 4BG
Description: Listed Building Consent for installation of a photovoltaic (PV) array to the rear elevations
RefusalReasons: The proposed installation of highly conspicuous, inappropriate modern solar panels to an important roofscape of a Grade II listed building located in the heart of the Penzance Conservation Area is considered to lead to less than substantial harm to the significance of a designated heritage asset. The proposed works fail to preserve the special character of the Grade II listed building, and the character and appearance of the Penzance Conservation Area The National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed photovoltaic array has been set out above. Although the proposed works may be considered to result in some public benefit by way of green energy, employment and associated benefits to the local economy, these benefits are limited and the proposed works would raise concerns relating to the historic environment that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10, 7.3, 7.6 and 7.7 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 130, 134, 189, 194, 197, 199, 200, 202, 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The works fail to accord with the Council's statutory duties under sections 16(1) and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 in that the Listed Building or the Conservation Area would not be preserved

Address: Land South East Of Treneglos Sancreed Road Sancreed Cornwall TR20 8QS
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved for the construction of two detached dwelling houses.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would not represent rounding off under Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan but, rather, would result in the undesirable extension and intrusion of residential development into the countryside to the detriment to the distinctive natural beauty and character of the surrounding semi-rural countryside. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Saved Policy CC-5 of the Penwith Local Plan 2004 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South East Of Willow Barn Lower Bodwen Redmoor Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5AT
Description: Application for Certificate of Lawful development for an existing use namely use of building as a separate self-contained residential dwelling unit.
RefusalReasons: Based on the documentation provided in support of the application, and having regard to other information available to and received by the Local Planning Authority, it is considered that the applicant has failed to demonstrate, on the 'balance of probability', that the building outlined in red of the submitted plan 21535-SK-00-01 submitted on the 18th February 2022 has not attained any current lawful use as an residential dwelling for a continuous period of 4 years prior to the submission of this application.  The Council, therefore, does not consider that the use of the building is lawful by virtue of immunity from enforcement action under Sections 171B (2) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended), and refuses to grant the Certificate of Lawful Use (existing use) being applied for.

Address: 56 Bedowan Meadows Tretherras Newquay Cornwall TR7 2SW
Description: Remove existing rear conservatory and form a ground floor rear extension.
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension, by reason of its siting, scale, height and massing and its close proximity the eastern boundary, results in an unacceptable overbearing and tunnelling effect that would be oppressive to the amenity of the neighbouring dwelling 54 Bedowan Meadows. Additionally due to the height, projection and siting of the proposed extension and its location to the immediate west of number 54 Bedowan Meadows, the proposal is considered to result in an unacceptable overshadowing impact to the rear garden of that property. The development fails to protect the amenities of neighbouring properties through overbearing and overshadowing, and conflicts with policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policy H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Seven Acres United Mines St Day Cornwall TR16 5HX
Description: Retention and completion of extension to agricultural building
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, unjustified by any special circumstances or agricultural justification, would be a sporadic, undesirable and unsustainable form of development which harmfully urbanises the intrinsically rural character and appearance of the open countryside in this location, neither preserving nor enhancing the locally distinctive landscape qualities or sense of place. The proposed development is therefore contrary to policies GQD1, GQD2 and LL4 of the Gwennap Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: The Beeches School Hill Budock Water Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5DD
Description: Works to trees subject to a Tree Preservation Order (TPO), works include two Beech trees at the front of the property crown lifted to keep them off the footpath and road. Also carry out a 2m reduction to keep overall balance.
RefusalReasons: The tree is protected by a Tree Preservation Order, because of its contribution to the character and amenity of the area. The tree is prominent in public views, particularly from the adjacent public highway, and makes a valuable contribution to public amenity. In the absence of clear and convincing supporting evidence to justify the physiological and amenity impacts of the proposed works it is likely that the proposed works would have a detrimental impact upon the physiology of the tree, adversely impacting its short and long term amenity contribution, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: 72 Marine Apartments, Flat 4 Lostwithiel Street Fowey Cornwall PL23 1BQ
Description: Removal of two existing windows to south elevation and creating one large window.
RefusalReasons: The windows in the historic buildings in this part of the Fowey Conservation Area are predominantly of traditional design and vertical in alignment. But the proposal is to replace two such traditional windows of vertical emphasis with one larger window of horizontal emphasis ,in the upper floor of this building and within the public viewpoint. This window, because of its scale, proportions and horizontal emphasis will appear out of keeping with its historic context and surroundings, resulting in harm to the character and appearance of this part of the Fowey Conservation Area, and failure to accord with Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) Policy 8 of the Fowey Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030 and paragraphs 199, 200 and 206 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 46 Carbis Bay Holiday Park Laity Lane Carbis Bay St Ives Cornwall TR26 3HW
Description: Replacement Hedge, Clear parking area and pave with blocks
RefusalReasons: The use of the proposed vehicular access onto a classified highway would be detrimental to highway safety by virtue of the restricted emerging visibility available to drivers of vehicles emerging from the application site. The proposal is therefore contrary to national planning policy stated in paragraphs 110 and 111 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policies 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land South East Of Little Trewoon Cottage Nancledra Cornwall TR20 8NB
Description: Construction of self build traditional dwelling house and associated works.
RefusalReasons: The site is shown by the Council's mapping to lie within the indicative Zone 3 (b) functional floodplain where new build development is strictly controlled. National Planning Policy Guidance advises that new development in Zone 3 (b) functional floodplain is limited to essential infrastructure only. In line with the above, the Environment Agency (EA) have raised an objection in-principle to the development proposal. The applicant has submitted a site specific Flood Risk Assessment (FRA) but the EA do not consider that it has adequately demonstrated that the site is not within the Zone 3 floodplain. In the absence of a FRA that accurately identifies the level of flood risk it is not clear that the development would not increase flood-risk elsewhere, that it would be appropriately flood resilient or that there is safe access/egress during a 1 in 100 year flood event. The development proposal thus does not satisfy the sequential test and conflicts with the aims and intentions of paragraphs 162 and 167 of the NPPF (2021) and policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030).

Address: Trewoone Farm 11 Strawberry Lane Hayle Cornwall TR27 5JS
Description: Demolition of existing barn and construction of Sustainable Farm House & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The application site is situated in a countryside location where new residential development is only permitted in special circumstances. In this instance it is not considered that the development proposal complies with any of those special circumstances. Furthermore, notwithstanding the fall-back position that the existing barn on the site can be converted to a residential use under Class Q of Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), the domestic appearance and scale of the proposed scheme relative to the existing building is such that it would have a significantly greater presence at the site, which is very prominent in the public domain and would constitute an undesirable form of development that would not respond well to its landscape setting, that is not locally distinctive in its design and that would not protect, maintain or enhance the predominantly rural character of the area. The development as such is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, with policy NE3 of the Hayle Neighbourhood Plan (2014-2030) and with paragraphs 8, 80, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Adj To Bosworgy Turnpike Road Marazion Cornwall TR17 0DQ
Description: Outline application for erection of up to 4 dwellings/domestic garages with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1. The proposed development would result in the introduction of residential built-form beyond the limits of the existing settlement. The proposal does not represent rounding off as set out in Policy 3 of the CLP. The development would result in the loss of undeveloped agricultural land that makes a positive contribution to the setting of Marazion between the sea and Turnpike Road. The change in character and appearance would harm the intrinsic character and beauty of the site and would fail to conserve and enhance the landscape and natural beauty of the AONB. The proposed development would fail to accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 12, 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policies PD-P1, PD-P2, PD-P11 and Objective SCW-Ob3 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2022 - 2027 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the NPPF (2021).2. The application has failed to demonstrate that a safe and suitable vehicular access can be achieved due to inadequate emerging visibility and therefore the proposal would conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 110 and 112 of the NPPF (2021).

Address: The Mouse House 3 Cave Lane Mousehole TR19 6SW
Description: New external steps to access parking area (Revised design)
RefusalReasons: The proposed steps, due to their design and location, would result in an unacceptable increase in overlooking in relation to the amenity area and rear window openings of 1 Merlin Place to the east. The close proximity and elevated nature of the proposed steps allows for an increase in levels of overlooking and disturbance to the users of 1 Merlin Place that is considered intrusive, unreasonable and of harm beyond that of the reasonable levels of privacy currently enjoyed at this property. The proposed steps would raise concerns relating to the impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring property that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 paragraphs 2a and 2c of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Section 9 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; and paragraphs 126, 130, 132 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Land North East Of Treen Farm Campsite Treen St Levan Cornwall TR19 6LG
Description: Change of use of agricultural land to private holiday site for siting of 2 caravans, 2 tents and the formation of parking area, part retrospective
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposal would result in the creation of new tourist accommodation on a greenfield site in the countryside. It would not involve the expansion of existing, well-established tourist accommodation. The site is not considered to be in a sustainable location in respect of public transport accessibility. The presence of caravans, tents, access track and associated paraphernalia would result in undesirable and uncharacteristic levels of domestication. This would be to the detriment of the unspoilt open undeveloped character and wild nature of the greenfield site in the open countryside which is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Heritage Coast landscape thereby failing to conserve and enhance the designated landscape. The proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 -2030, policy M9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016 - 2021 'Place and People' and paragraphs 80, 130 and 176 of the NPPF (2021).

Address: 82 Fore Street Newquay TR7 1EY
Description: Weather shelter to existing outside seating area.
RefusalReasons: The proposal shall, through its siting, form, massing and appearance, lead to incongruous additions to the street scene to the detriment of the character of the host property and wider area. The proposal shall therefore fail to accord with Policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030; Policies D1, D2 and HC1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030; and Paragraphs 130 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Touring Park Treeve Lane Connor Downs Hayle TR27 5BN
Description: Proposed replacement of touring pitches with 23 static caravans.
RefusalReasons: Whilst the application site benefits from planning permission for a holiday site with a similar number of pitches to the current application, it is considered that replacing caravan and camping pitches with 23 static caravans together with associated infrastructure would give rise to a harmful visual impact when viewed from Treeve Lane which is incapable of adequate mitigation by enhanced soft landscaping. This environmental harm is not considered to be commensurate with the economic and social benefits of the proposal and therefore the proposal is considered to represent unsuitable and unsustainable development. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 84 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North West Of Aldercombe Cottages Kilkhampton Bude Cornwall EX23 9RP
Description: Erection of alpaca shelter (retrospective)
RefusalReasons: In the absence of an overriding business justification, it has not been demonstrated there is an overriding need for the proposed Alpaca shelter building and its associated use for purposes of agricultural use to be sited in this location. As a result, and by reason of its siting, the building would have an adverse visual impact on the strong rural character of the area, harming the intrinsic undeveloped character of the countryside.  The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 5,12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land West Of Aldercombe Cottages Kilkhampton Bude Cornwall EX23 9RP
Description: Erection of outbuilding. Retrospective
RefusalReasons: In the absence of any overriding justification for the building in this location, the proposal would result in additional and visually harmful new development in the countryside that would neither conserve nor enhance its setting, contrary to Policies 2, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies, 2010-2030, adopted November 2016 and paragraphs 8, 79, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North West Of Aldercombe Cottages Access To Aldercombe Kilkhampton Bude EX23 9RP
Description: Retrospective consent for the construction of a rainwater harvesting shelter.
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of any overriding justification for the building in this location, the proposal would result in additional and visually harmful new development in the countryside that would neither conserve nor enhance its setting, contrary to Policies 2, 5,12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies, 2010-2030, adopted Page 6 of 6 November 2016 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 5 Hodders Way Cargreen PL12 6NY
Description: Works to tree subject to Tree Preservation Order namely crown reduce T1 Oak tree to maintain weight stability of the tree, and remove all deadwood
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the Oak tree (T1) forms an important part of the wider tree preservation order area (reference E2/06/TPO/00040), which collectively are of amenity value within the local landscape. It is apparent that pruning works have been carried out on the tree without permission from the Local Planning Authority. These works have had a significant negative impact upon both the physiological condition and amenity value of the tree. The tree is now recovering from these works, and as such the proposed works should not be allowed to go ahead whilst the tree continues to recover. In addition, there is insufficient justification for the works. The proposed works would therefore result in further detriment to the physiological condition and amenity value of the tree, contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: The Ranch Trevarrian Mawgan Porth Hill Mawgan Porth Newquay Cornwall TR8 4AJ
Description: Retrospective planning for change of use of land to domestic curtilage by extending the red line boundary of the existing 'Ranch' dwelling and permit the construction of a garage/office (the "garage") space, and a below ground level outdoor pool (re-submission of Application PA20/08097)
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reasons of subdivision of a field to create extended domestic curtilage together with the associated paraphernalia including a new outbuilding and swimming pool, extends the existing home into the countryside. The proposal includes also an earth bank/bunding of a scale and nature that is alien to the area.  The proposed retention of the said new curtilage, outbuilding, swimming pool and earth bank/bunding would therefore be to the detriment of the distinctive natural character of the surrounding Area of Great Landscape Value.  Accordingly, the application is contrary to the aims and intentions of saved Policy 14 of the Restormel Borough Local Plan 2001; Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; and paragraphs 8, 126, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: The Ranch Trevarrian Mawgan Porth Hill Mawgan Porth Newquay Cornwall TR8 4AJ
Description: A 10kW solar installation and revision of the original access track that serves the approved dwelling 'The Ranch'.
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reasons of introducing solar panels in a field, entrance gates with massing of the associated walls and realignment of an access drive to a more prominent location on the application site away from a boundary hedgerow, harms the distinctive natural character of the surrounding Area of Great Landscape Value. The application is, therefore, contrary to the aims and intentions of saved Policy 14 of the Restormel Borough Local Plan 2001; Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; and paragraphs 8, 126, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: 3A Rosehill Mylor Bridge Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5LZ
Description: Works to a tree under a Tree Preservation Order, works to include the felling of T1 Oak to ground level.
RefusalReasons: The applicant has failed to demonstrate sound arboricultural reasons for the proposed works due to lack of clear and convincing supporting evidence and proposed works not being in accordance with industry best practices and unacceptable amenity impacts, contrary to paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Carne Cottage Zennor St Ives Cornwall TR26 3BU
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for the proposed development of: an extension to the rear of the dwelling; an art studio/home office/home gym; an outbuilding; a double garage, plant and store room; and a solar PV array.
RefusalReasons: The local planning authority considers that the applicant has failed to discharge their onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the proposed development would be permitted development by virtue of Schedule 2, Part 1, Classes A and E, and Part 14, Class B of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, as amended.

Address: Heatherlea Quay Road St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0RP
Description: Works to trees subject to a Tree Preservation Order (TPO), works include felling 5 x Monterrey pines
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the cohesive line of Monterey Pines forms an important feature which collectectively, are of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the wider streetscene. The proposed removal of trees T1-T5 would therefore result in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape, contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Woodlands 6 Trevingey Road Redruth Cornwall TR15 3DG
Description: Works to trees in a tree preservation order (TPO), works to include: T1 (Sycamore) - crown reduce by 1.5m; T2 (Sycamore) - fell; and T3 (Sycamore) - crown reduce of less than 0.5m to give shape, it will then be lightly pruned on a 4 yearly basis.
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to the Sycamore trees would significantly detract from the trees public visual amenity value and the character of the street scene. It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works are not justified by the reasoning given in the application, when alternative work could be carried out to reduce the visual impact on the local landscape.

Address: Land South East Of 2 Steamers Hill Steamers Hill Angarrack Cornwall TR27 5JB
Description: Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved for up to 2-dwellings.
RefusalReasons: The site is shown by the Council's mapping to lie fully within the indicative Zone 3 (a) 1 in 100-year floodplain and partially within the indicative Zone 3 (b) functional floodplain, where new build development is strictly controlled. National Planning Policy Guidance advises that new development in Zone 3 (b) functional floodplain is limited to essential infrastructure only. Having regard to the above the Environment Agency (EA) have raised an 'in-principle' objection to the development proposal and also object as it has not been demonstrated that the development would not interfere with the operation of a flood alleviation culvert running close by to the site. The site also lies within a designated Critical Drainage Area and in the absence of a site-specific Flood Risk Assessment (FRA) that accurately identifies the level of flood risk, it is not clear that the future occupiers of the development would be safe from flooding, that the development would not increase flood-risk elsewhere, that it would be appropriately flood resilient or that there would be safe access/egress in a 1 in 100-year flood event. The development proposal thereby conflicts with the aims and intentions of paragraphs 162 and 167 of the NPPF (2021) and with policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030).

Address: Trenant Point Devoran Truro Cornwall TR3 6NJ
Description: Works to trees subject to a Tree Preservation Order (TPO), works are to x2 mature lime trees for either a full pollard or a heavy reduction down to previous pollard cut points whilst keeping a level of canopy.
RefusalReasons: The heavy pollarding of the two Lime trees would harm public amenity value and the character of the street scene. It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works are excessive and would lead to a detrimental impact on the public visual amenity value of the trees.

Address: Land ESE Of Tarkas Rest Sandy Lane Trevone Padstow Cornwall
Description: Proposed residential development with amenity space and infrastructure
RefusalReasons: The application site is located outside of the settlement of Trevone and the proposed development does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic policies 2010 to 2030. The development represents an undesirable extension and intrusion of the settlement into the adjoining countryside which would be to the detriment to the character and appearance of the rural landscape and Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. In the absence of any affordable housing provision or any other special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and would be contrary to policies 3,7,12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 130 and 176 and section 5 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land At Trevenna Cross St Mawgan Cornwall TR8 4HB
Description: Outline application for construction of up to two dwellings with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: The application site is located outside of the settlement of Trevenna Cross and the proposed development does not represent infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic policies 2010 to 2030. The development represents an undesirable extension and intrusion of the settlement into the adjoining countryside which would be to the detriment to the character and appearance of the rural landscape and distinctive qualities of the Area of Great Landscape Value. In the absence of any affordable housing provision or any other special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and would be contrary to saved Policy 14 of the Restormel Borough Local Plan 2001, Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 8, 80, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Glencree House 2 Mennaye Road Penzance TR18 4NG
Description: Retrospective application for the demolition of wall and formation of parking area.
RefusalReasons: In removing a strong, traditional and prominent feature of the street scene in lieu of the creation of an expanse of concreted car parking space, the proposed works result in a harmful reduction in the characteristic enclosure in this vicinity; a material reduction in the existing visual quality of the streetscape; and failure to preserve the character and appearance of the Conservation AreaThe proposed removal of a significant wall and the construction of a vehicular access and associated parking is inappropriate, out of keeping and at odds with the setting. The proposal has a significant detrimental impact upon a strong and distinctive feature of the streetscape that would result in harm to the character and appearance of the Conservation Area. The works are considered to raise design concerns that cause harm and that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 2 (paragraph 2.1.1), 3 (paragraphs 3.1.2, 3.2.2 and 3.3.5) and 5 (paragraph 5.8.1) of the Cornwall Design Guide 2021; and paragraphs 126, 130 (paragraphs a to d), 134, 189, 197(c), 199, 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.

Address: Land And Buildings East Of The Old Carthouse Trebarvah Lane Trebarvah Perranuthnoe Penzance Cornwall TR20 9NG
Description: Construction of Dwelling House, Landscaping and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: By reason of the part of the proposed dwelling on a north-west - south-east axis presenting a full height, two-storey mass along most of The Old Potato Barn's south-east boundary at a relatively close distance (around 3.3 metres away), coupled with its uncharacteristically bulky plan form which is accentuated by its hipped roof, the proposal is considered to constitute poor-quality design which fails to demonstrate a clear understanding and response to its built environment setting, and to result in unreasonable overbearing impacts to The Old Potato Barn's main outside area. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Penpell Row, Land West Of Penpillick Farm Road From Penpillick Farm To Penpell Farm Penpillick Par PL24 2RT
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved for the construction of a single dwellinghouse and garage namely access and layout.
RefusalReasons: The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from anysettlement. The proposal would result in harm to the intrinsic character of a surroundingrural and historic setting within a World Heritage Site. The proposal would introducehousing in a location with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilitieswhich, in turn, would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements.  Given the lack of any special justification, the application is therefore not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; Policies H1 and E5.4 of the Tywardreath and Par Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030 and Paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Twinbrook Park Goldenbank Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5BH
Description: Works to trees namely:- Oak(T20) Pollard - Oak(T30) remove 1xlow limb -Oak(58)crown reduce - Oak(62)Pollard-subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: The applicant has failed to demonstrate sound arboricultural reasons for the proposed works due to lack of clear and convincing supporting evidence and proposed works not being in accordance with industry best practices and unacceptable amenity impacts, contrary to paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land North East Of Chyanoweth Gear Hill Newmill Cornwall TR20 8UT
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved for the construction of residential dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The site is located outside of the physical boundaries of any established settlement and is therefore situated within the open countryside as defined under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposed development would introduce a new unrestricted residential dwelling into the open countryside, within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Heritage Coast, for which there are no special circumstances or justification. The dwelling would not be in a sustainable location, having particular regard to the lack of accessibility to services and facilities available locally and would give rise to dependence of future occupants on the private motor vehicle in terms of accessing such services and facilities. The proposed development would increase the urban built form and density of development within this sensitive location. The proposed increase in the urban form within this sensitive, countryside location would fail to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty nor would it maintain the character and distinctive landscape qualities of the Heritage Coast. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy MD9 and MD16 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Polgrain Turning Polgrain Barn Gypsy Corner Road St Wenn Bodmin PL30 5PR
Description: Application for a Lawful Development Certificate for the Existing use of a building as a self-contained residential dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority considers that the evidence provided in support of the application is not sufficiently precise and unambiguous to discharge the Applicants' onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, that the building has been used as a self-contained dwelling for a period of 4 years or more, and that this planning breach was continuous. As such, it is not considered that the development is immune from enforcement action and as a result a CLEUD cannot be issued.

Address: Land North East Of Dean House Leedstown Cornwall TR27 6DL
Description: Erection of 3 No. Detached Dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of its location, would incrementally extend the settlement into the open countryside, harmfully urbanising the rural characteristics of this section of the rural landscape which contributes to the setting of the settlement, in conflict with the Development Plan policy concerning the location of new residential development. In addition paragraph 7.4 of the Crowan Neighbourhood 2018 - 2030 states that any development outside the defined boundaries are deemed exception sites and these will only be permitted where a proven demand is acceptable to both Crowan Parish and Cornwall Council. The proposed development therefore represents an undesirable form of development, unjustified by any special circumstance. In the absence of any other material considerations that outweigh the environmental harm identified and the lack of affordable housing, the proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies HT1 and HT2 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Lowertown Farm Barn, The Annexe Road To Lowertown Farm Barn From Junction South Of Chalcotts Farm Lower Rose Rose TR4 9PL
Description: Proposed use of existing annexe as a separate dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed change of use of the existing residential annexe to a separate dwelling would create additional open market dwelling in the countryside, divorced from any settlement and with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities; perpetuating an over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. The existing building has been in use as an annexe for less than 10 years and would conflict with guidance set out in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 for the re-use of buildings, as this seeks to avoid the circumvention of policies designed to limit new housing in the countryside. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location,or other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to policies 1, 2, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016 and paragraphs 8, 11, 12 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Higher Hendra Farm Rose Truro Cornwall TR4 9PS
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved (Access) for construction of dwelling in lieu of residential caravan.
RefusalReasons: The development, by reason of its proposed siting, represents an undesirable extension into the countryside in a prominent part of the site which would be to the detriment of the character and appearance of the rural landscape. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Tregenna Steps Studio Tregenna Terrace St Ives TR26 2DL
Description: First floor extension with associated works and windows to east elevation.
RefusalReasons: The development proposal would harm the residential amenities of neighbouring occupiers at No. 17 Tregenna Terrace with particular regard to overlooking. It would therefore conflict with policy GD1 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Plan 2015 - 2030, policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, which together seek to achieve a good standard of residential amenity by, amongst other things, ensuring that development proposals protect individuals and property from overlooking and unreasonable losses of privacy.

Address: Sea View B3285 Between Budnic Hill And Newquay Road Rose TR4 9PF
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: The application site is located within the countryside and clearly divorced from any defined settlement. The proposal will introduce a new dwelling with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 2, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 80 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Chestnut View Fore Street St Mabyn Bodmin PL30 3BG
Description: Second storey extension to form extra bedroom with ensuite
RefusalReasons: By reason of its scale, massing and siting, the proposal would form a dominating and incongruous structure in the streetscene harmful to the character and appearance of this part of the settlement. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Long Meadows Constantine Bay Padstow Cornwall PL28 8JQ
Description: Application to revoke S106 agreement in respect of Decision Notice E1/2006/02401
RefusalReasons: The local planning authority is satisfied that the Planning Obligation continues to serve a useful planning purpose because it restricts the occupation of the development granted planning permission as a low-cost dwelling in perpetuity to qualifying persons with a local connection in an area of evidenced affordable housing need. Discharging the Section 106 would result in the loss of this affordable dwelling to the open market without robustly evidenced justification. As such the proposal is in direct opposition to the major thrust of central government and local policy to house all sectors of the community, in conflict with Policy 8 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraph 60 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Manare Barn Manare Farm Portloe Truro Cornwall
Description: The proposed conversion of the redundant former agricultural barn into a dwelling, the installation of a sewage treatment plant and the construction of a bat roost
RefusalReasons: The barn proposed for conversion and its proposed curtilage is in a prominent location adjacent to a public right of way and is within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, Conservation Area and Heritage Coast the scenic beauty, and heritage significance of which should be protected from harm. The proposed development will result in a harmful change from a natural rural setting of the barn to a managed domestic curtilage which will harm the rural character of the location to the detriment of the scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Heritage Coast as well as eroding the significance of this part of the Portloe Conservation Area through the introduction of an out of keeping domestic setting. Nor has it been demonstrated that the barn is capable of conversion without significant rebuilding. The proposal is contrary to Cornwall Local Plan policies 2, 7,12, 23, and 24, Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan polices LA1, LA2, CV3, GP2, HO3 and CD2 as well as being contrary to paragraphs 130, 174(a, b, c), 176, 178, 189 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework and policy MD9 of the AONB Management Plan.

Address: Worthyvale Manor Slaughter Bridge Camelford Cornwall PL32 9TT
Description: New steel framed machine storage building with associated entrance.
RefusalReasons: In the absence of sufficient supporting information, it has not been demonstrated there is an overriding need for the proposed building and its associated use for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwelling to be sited in this location, so far divorced from the dwelling.  As a result, and by reason of its prominent siting and substantial size, the building would have an adverse visual impact on the strong rural character of the area, harming the intrinsic undeveloped character of the countryside. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Azia Beach Harlyn Bay Road Harlyn Padstow PL28 8SB
Description: Removal of Condition 7 of Application No. E1/2004/02715 dated 20th January 2005 (Revised design, siting and external appearance for an alternative extension to that approved under application number 2003/0206)
RefusalReasons: 1 The lifting of Condition 7 of Application No. E1/2004/02715 dated 20th January 2005 if approved would give rise to hazardous highway safety conditions due to a combination of the restricted visibility at the junction of the access lane to the highway in both directions, the camber of the access lane at the junction and the position of the Coastal Footpath access opposite. Intensifying the number of vehicles using this access lane would therefore be contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and the guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 with particular regard to paragraphs 110 (b) and 111.

Address: Ennis Farm Chyenhal Penzance TR19 6AN
Description: Outline planning application with all matters reserved: Demolition of existing outbuilding and erection of a detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: The site is located outside of the physical boundaries of any established settlement and is therefore situated within the open countryside as defined under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposed development would introduce a new unrestricted residential dwelling into the open countryside, within an Area of Great Landscape Value and Heritage Coast, for which there are no special circumstances or justification. The dwelling would not be in a sustainable location, having particular regard to the lack of accessibility to services and facilities available locally and would give rise to dependence of future occupants on the private motor vehicle in terms of accessing such services and facilities. The proposed development would increase the urban built form and density of development within this sensitive location and would not maintain the character and distinctive landscape qualities of the Area of Great Landscape Value or Heritage Coast. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Saved Policy CC-5 of the Penwith Local Plan 2004 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 2 Coswinsawsin Lane Carnhell Green Camborne Cornwall TR14 0LW
Description: Siting of a single shepherd's hut for use as a holiday let
RefusalReasons: Notwithstanding that no substantial evidence has been submitted to demonstrate any need for additional tourism facilities the proposal is not of an appropriate scale having regard its siting relative to any existing settlement or its accessibility by a range of transport modes. The development as such would not represent sustainable rural tourism and would be contrary to the aims and intentions of policy 10 of the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Plan (2016-2020), policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) and paragraphs 8, 84, 112, 152 and 154 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Riverford House St Stephens Hill St Stephens Launceston Cornwall PL15 8HN
Description: Ground Floor and First Floor extension to the rear of property and internal re-modelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed scheme by reason of its siting, mass and height of the proposed extension would have an overbearing/dominant effect and give rise to overshadowing and loss of light to the amenity and habitable rooms to the neighbouring dwelling 3 St Stephens Hill, impacting on the occupants' enjoyment of their property and amenity areas. The scheme would conflict with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, which seek, amongst other matters, to ensure new development does not adversely affect the amenity of neighbouring properties.

Address: Land South West Of Little Skewjack St Levan Penzance Cornwall TR19 6NB
Description: Erection of 5 glamping cabins, car port and storage room, with associated amenity space
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would add to the existing built form within this rural countryside location and would result in the undesirable extension and intrusion of residential development to the detriment of the distinctive natural beauty and character of the surrounding rural countryside. The proposed development would not be in a sustainable location, having particular regard to the limited accessibility to services and facilities available locally. As such the proposal would not represent sustainable rural tourism. The proposal does not represent an appropriate location for holiday accommodation and therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Saved Policy CC-5 of the Penwith Local Plan 2004 and paragraphs 8, 84, 112, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Little Salena Wendron Helston TR13 0EA
Description: Listed Building Consent for conversion of detached former barn within curtilage of Little Salena Farmhouse to annexe/holiday accommodation
RefusalReasons: The works proposed, by reason of the addition of the incongruous balcony feature to the buiding, and to a lesser degree the rooflights, will impact adversely on the architectural significance and character of the barn and the setting of the adjacent and nearby Listed buildings. Insufficient justification has been put forward to justify the less than substantial harm imposed on the designated heritage assets and the proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130, 134, 197, 199 and 202 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 16 (2) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Little Salena Wendron Helston TR13 0EA
Description: Conversion of detached former barn within curtilage of Little Salena Farmhouse to annexe/holiday accommodation
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of the addition of the incongruous balcony feature to the buiding, and to a lesser degree the rooflights, will impact adversely on the architectural significance and character of the barn and the setting of the adjacent and nearby Listed buildings. Insufficient justification has been put forward to justify the less than substantial harm imposed on the designated heritage assets and the proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130, 134, 197, 199 and 202 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 66(1) and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (the Act).

Address: Prow Park Business Village, Soweni Unit 3 Treloggan Industrial Estate Newquay TR7 2SX
Description: Variation of condition 3 (hours of operation) of Decision no. PA18/11346 dated 27th September 2019 (Retrospective consent for extension to main shed and proposed use of site and building for B1/B2/B8 purposes)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed increase to opening hours (Condition 3) is not acceptable due to the absence of a suitable noise assessment to assess the impact on the residential properties to the west of the application site. Without the appropriate assessment to prove otherwise, it would be deemed that the increase would cause significant noise harm to neighbouring residential properties which would be considered unacceptable. The application is therefore contrary to Policies 12 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010-2030 and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of An Jue Green Farm House Road From Trevalgan Road To Trevalgan Trevalgan TR26 3BJ
Description: The conversion of a disused agricultural barn to an eco friendly dwelling house, together with associated works including the erection of a double garage and the inclusion of a wild grass/flower meadow
RefusalReasons: By reason of the substantial building operations required to bring the existing building into residential use, the utilitarian form of the building which does not warrant retention, the inconspicuous positioning of the building in the landscape, and the associated external works which would harm and domesticate this distinctly rural, open and windswept landscape, the proposed development is not considered to make use of a suitably constructed building which is appropriate to retain and the conversion of which would lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting. Furthermore, the proposal is considered to fail to at least conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty within which it sits. The proposal is therefore considered to constitute unsuitable and unsustainable residential development in the open countryside, and to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies GD1 and OS1 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030; policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 8, 80, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021; and policies MD9 and WP7.05 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 1 Granville Terrace Bude EX23 8JZ
Description: Replacement of current UPVC double glazed windows, at the front of the building, with 2 full length side windows & central set of french doors.
RefusalReasons: The change from a window to French doors with side windows would be considered to alter the appearance of the property and to alter the uniformity of the terrace of properties, thus failing to preserve the character and appearance of the Bude Conservation Area. The public or economic benefits of the proposed development would  not be outweighed by this harm. The proposal is therefore contrary to Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990;  Policy 23 of the Bude-Stratton Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030; policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 130 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North West Of Godrevy Park Gwithian Towans Gwithian Cornwall TR27 5BL
Description: Surf therapy and education facility consisting of: classrooms; communal space; WCs and changing facilities; offices and meeting space; kitchen facilities; and indoor storage. Associated development includes: landscaping; biodiversity enhancements; renewable energy and heating systems; car parking; and drainage.
RefusalReasons: By reason of its relatively large scale and siting in a distinctly rural location which is devoid of significant built development and clearly visible from several parts of the public domain, the proposal is considered to fail to be sensitive to its surroundings or respect the character of the countryside. Furthermore, this significant environmental harm is not considered to be offset by the acknowledged economic and, in particular, social benefits and, as such, the proposal is not considered to deliver a well-balanced mix of these three, core benefits. The proposal is therefore considered to represent unsuitable and unsustainable development in the open countryside, and to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 84, 85 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: The Old Orchard Ropewalk Lane Charlestown St. Austell PL23 3PA
Description: Formation of detached dwelling
RefusalReasons: The residual harm arising from the loss of the existing open verdant space and erosion of the semi-rural character of the lane, which are considered to be positive characteristics of the Conservation Area conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, St Austell Bay Neighbourhood Development Plan Policies D1, D2, HE1 and HE3 and Paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Rosevear St Hilary Penzance Cornwall TR20 9DQ
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for construction of dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: By reason of its siting on the north-west side of the B3280 public highway which provides a clear physical and logical boundary to the built-up area of Perran Downs to the south-east, in an area which is considered to have the appearance of being in the countryside as opposed to part of said settlement, the proposal is not considered to result in the small-scale rounding-off of Perran Downs; rather, it is considered to visually extend building into the countryside. Furthermore, there is considered to be reasonable doubt that the site could be developed in a manner which is appropriate to the character of the surrounding natural environment, and which would at least preserve the setting of the important, semi-rural approach to St Hilary Churchtown along The Avenue which falls within the St Hilary Churchtown Conservation Area. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of S72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 100, 174, 189, 194, 197 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land West Of Treven Cottage St Clether Launceston Cornwall PL15 8PT
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved Proposed Single Cottage Dwelling within residential curtilage of Treven Cottage
RefusalReasons: The proposed development lies within a straggle of dwellings in the open countryside which is detached from any clearly definable or recognisable settlement, or services and facilities. The proposed new home would introduce residential accommodation at a location with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. The proposal represents an undesirable, unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside for which no special circumstances have been demonstrated. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 23 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 104, 112, 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Riverside Cottage Forder Saltash Cornwall PL12 4QR
Description: Listed Building Consent for removal of section of boundary wall and formation of new parking bay.
RefusalReasons: The proposed removal of a section of walling and the creation and subsequent use of a new off-road parking space within the front garden of this Grade II listed cottage would result in less-than-substantial harm to the appearance, character and setting and significance of listed heritage assets and their contribution to the historic environment within this part of the conservation area which is considered to outweigh the perceived public or social benefit of creating one more off-road parking space. As such, the proposed development conflicts with the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies 24, 12 and 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy ENV6 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030, and the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, with particular reference to paragraphs 8, 130, 189, 194, 195, 197, 199, 200 and 202

Address: Riverside Cottage Forder Saltash Cornwall PL12 4QR
Description: Removal of section of boundary wall and formation of new parking bay.
RefusalReasons: The proposed removal of a section of walling and the creation and subsequent use of a new off-road parking space within the front garden of this Grade II listed cottage would result in less-than-substantial harm to the appearance, character and setting and significance of listed heritage assets and their contribution to the historic environment within this part of the conservation area which is considered to outweigh the perceived public or social benefit of creating one more off-road parking space. As such, the proposed development conflicts with the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies 24, 12 and 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy ENV6 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030, and the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, with particular reference to paragraphs 8, 130, 189, 194, 195, 197, 199, 200 and 202.

Address: Boslowick Inn Prislow Lane Falmouth TR11 4PZ
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for demolition of public house enabling a residential development of up to 10 dwellings
RefusalReasons: The harm caused by the proposed development resulting from the loss of the non-designated heritage asset, namely the public house building, is not outweighed by the benefits of the scheme. The proposal is therefore considered to be contrary to Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030, paragraph 203 if the NPPF and Policy DG6 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Plan.

Address: Land Adj To Fair View Harmony Terrace Bassett Road Illogan Cornwall TR16 4SS
Description: Reserved matters following outline consent PA18/04738 (Appeal Ref APP/D0840/W/18/3210910) dated 12/03/2019 for a development of 9 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The site occupies a prominent location on the north side of Bassett Road and forms an attractive rural setting to the edge of the settlement in this location. The proposed layout of the scheme in the manner set out would be at odds with the established linear pattern of development on the north side of Bassett Road.  Thus, the development of this parcel of land with nine modern dwellings with gable ends would not integrate suitably into the established built form and therefore, would cause material harm to the character and appearance of the natural and built environment in this edge of settlement location. The development would therefore cause material environmental harm to the character and appearance of the area which raises direct conflict with policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policy PH3 in the Illogan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: North Coast Holiday Cottages New Portreath Road Redruth TR16 4QL
Description: Use of two unfettered dwellings as holiday lets and use of two holiday lets as unfettered dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of its open countryside location, detached from any definable settlements, represents an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic form of open market residential development. This form of unjustified residential development in the open countryside would be contrary to development plan policy concerning the location of residential development. The proposal would introduce two open market dwellings in an open countryside location and would generate domestic paraphernalia which contributes to the erosion of the character and appearance of the rural landscape. In the absence of any overriding social or economic public benefits resulting from scheme, the proposal is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, the guidance within the Cornwall Design Guide and Part 2 (Context and Identity) of the National Design Guide (Planning practice guidance for beautiful, enduring and successful places, January 2021).

Address: 18 Southfield Road Bude EX23 8DN
Description: Retrospective application to extend 1st floor external staircase landing to create a decking area.
RefusalReasons: The raised platform, as a result of its position, size, projection and height introduces additonal harmful overlooking towards the private rear amenity space of nos. 14 and 16 Southfield Road, Bude and towards windows and side garden of 40 Fairfield Road, Bude to the south. The loss of privacy that occurs is harmful to the living conditions that were enjoyed by these occupiers prior to the erection of the structure without consent. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 Adopted 22nd November 2016 and paragraph, and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Penlowen Road From Trebean To Parc Minys Restronguet Point Feock TR3 6RB
Description: Proposed summerhouse
RefusalReasons: The proposed summerhouse by reason if its size and elevated position would represent a significant visual intrusion in the landscape which would increase light spill and as a result would fail to conserve or enhance the landscape character and scenic beauty of the AONB which would be contrary to Policies BI01, LS1, LS2 and D1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030, Policies 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land To South Of Little Hallaze Penwithick Cornwall PL26 8YW
Description: Proposed use of the land as a private Romani gypsy site consisting of four pitches including 4 mobile homes, 4 touring caravans and hard standings
RefusalReasons: The application, by reasons of introducing the proposed pitches on undeveloped land and when viewed in association to and comparison with the neighbouring site which already contains pitches for gypsy/traveller accommodation, would harm the distinctive natural character of the area and dominate the nearby settled community at Little Hallaze. It would also result in the loss of best and most versatile agricultural land. The application is therefore contrary to policies 2, 11, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Swallows Reach St Veep Lostwithiel Cornwall PL22 0PA
Description: Construction of extension to existing building to create holiday accommodation.
RefusalReasons: The proposed holiday use and unit would not be accessible by a range of transport modes and would lead to an intensification of use in the countryside where no special circumstances have been demonstrated, and with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. Consequently, the proposal is in conflict with Policies 2, 3, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Swallows Reach St Veep Lostwithiel Cornwall PL22 0PA
Description: Retention of change of use of existing residential annex to allow use as self-contained holiday accommodation.
RefusalReasons: As a unit of holiday accomodation the site is not be accessible by a range of transport modes and would lead to an intensification of use in the countryside where no special circumstances have been demonstrated, and with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. Consequently, the proposal is in conflict with Policies 2, 3, 5, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: 6 Cobbs Well Fowey PL23 1BP
Description: Proposed Amendments to planning approval ref PA20/09103, including additional rooflights, concealed roof terrace and removal of condition 8.
RefusalReasons: The proposed rear additions through their design features including use of large flat roof area, incongourous spiral stair case and glass balustrading is not found to be sympathetic to the form and character of the property and the works through the introduction of a raised terrace area visible from Rose Hill, Daglands Road and Cobbs Well, and prominent and would fail to maintain the special character and appearance of the Conservation Area. The works are not considered to have suitable regard to the existing built form and respect or work with the natural and historic environment contrary to Policies 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan and the Fowey Heighbour Development Plan at Policies 2 and 8 and section 16 paragraphs 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
