Address: Land East Of Sandoes Gate King Harry Road Feock Cornwall TR3 6QN
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for erection of 1 dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling would be on a parcel of land not forming residential curtilage or Previously Developed Land. It would be located in the countryside outside of the built form of a hamlet or settlement, as identified by the village settlement boundaries at Appendix 2 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017 - 2030. Such unjustified housing development in the countryside would be contrary to development plan policy concerning the location of housing development, discourage the use of more sustainable modes of transport and erode the strong rural character of the area to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside and neighbouring sensitive land designations . The site is clearly visible from the adjacent rural highway whereby additional built form will result in appreciable harm from a public perspective as will the significant loss of hedgerow which contributes to the rural character of the location. Consequently, the proposal raises direct conflict with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policy H1 in the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030, policy 1 in the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019 and paragraphs 8, 79, 112, 130 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.The site is adjacent to a Grade II Listed Building whose conservation is given great weight. The proposal fails to provide sufficient detail to understand or mitigate the potential impacts upon the significance and setting of the Grade II listed Sandoes. The proposal fails to accord with Cornwall Local Plan Policy 24, Feock Neighbourhood Development plan HE1 or paragraphs 189, 197 and 199 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Anchorage 28 North Parade Falmouth TR11 2TD
Description: Demolition of existing building and erection of 4 dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of the increased number of units, design, layout, height, scale and massing, will result in an over-development of the site and will be incongruous in the streetscene, contrary to Policies DG2 and DG4 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021-2030, Policies 2 and 12 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 126, 130, 132, and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land At Tremayne Farm Tremayne St Martin Helston Cornwall TR12 6DA
Description: New agricultural workers dwelling on land at Tremayne.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development raises direct conflict with the requirements of adopted policy in the Cornwall Local Plan as the site is clearly located in the open countryside where new homes will only be permitted where there are special circumstances. In this case, it has not been adequately demonstrated that there is evidence of an essential need of the farming business for an agricultural worker to reside in a permanent dwelling in this location. In the absence of such justification, the site is not a sustainable or accessible location for new residential development and the proposal would clearly erode the strong rural character of the area by introducing further built development onto open agricultural land within the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB). The development is therefore isolated and unsustainable and would cause material environmental harm to the landscape and scenic beauty of the AONB in this location, thus it is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policy PD-P11 in the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2022-2027, and paragraphs 8, 80, 110, 112, 130, 174 and 176 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 3 Broadhurst Fore Street Grampound Truro Cornwall TR2 4QR
Description: Listed building consent to replace 4no. existing timber windows with new UPVC double glazed windows and replace existing timber front door with new UPVC double glazed residential front door
RefusalReasons: The proposed UPVC windows and door by reason of their material, double glazed panes, profile and spacer bars would appear as modern fixtures which materially dilute and degrade the building's historic and architectural character, thereby undermining the integrity, authenticity and setting of the listed building.  The proposal would therefore fail to preserve the fabric, character and special interest of the listed building. The proposed works would therefore be contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 130, 194, 200 and 201 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The work would also be contrary to the Council's duties as local planning authority under section 16 (2) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 to ensure that development preserves the architectural and historic interests of the listed building and its setting.

Address: 45 Passage Street Fowey PL23 1DE
Description: The proposal includes a second-storey extension above the existing kitchen/utility space to accommodate a new office and shower room.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, through its scale, form and massing and proximity to the neighbouring property '43 Passage Street' shall incur an unreasonable impact upon the living accommodation of that property in respect to loss of light and an overbearing impact, to windows on the southwest rear elevation and to the amenity area of that property. This is contrary Policy 12 Part 2(B) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraph 130 point f of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Buildings At Tregoon Farm Gweek Downs Gweek Helston Cornwall TR12 7AF
Description: Construction of two dwellings, improvements to approved conversion of blockwork barn and conversion of stone barn to dwelling
RefusalReasons: By reason of its pattern, layout and scale, the proposed development would give the impression of a new, albeit small, suburban housing development in the countryside. The site and existing buildings do contribute to the strong rural character of the area and the development as proposed, in its suburban form and layout with domestic paraphernalia encompassing the entire site, will result in a harmful erosion to this strong rural character which is clearly visible from the site access and nearby public rights of way. The proposal as set out would therefore result in overriding harm to the character, distinctive open quality and appearance of the countryside in this location, which is designated an Area of Great Landscape Value (AGLV).  The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Treloyan Cottage Steeple Lane St Ives TR26 2AY
Description: Demolition of Existing Dwelling and Outbuildings & Construction of Self Build Eco Dwelling, with Attached Garage, Separate Garden Studio & Associated Works (revised design).
RefusalReasons: The development, by virtue of its scale and bulk, modern contemporary design and prominence in the public domain is at odds with the character of the existing form of built development in the local vicinity and would appear as a discordant, uncharacteristic element in the street scene that is not locally distinctive or sensitive to its surroundings and would  have an undesirable, dominating impact that would be to the detriment of the overall quality of the area. Having regard to the above and the loss of the existing dwelling, which is a non-designated heritage asset, it is not considered that the harm caused by the development would be outweighed by any substantial public benefits and the proposal thereby raises conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030), with policies GD1 and BE6 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan (2015-2030) and with paragraphs 130, 197 and 203 of the NPPF (2021).

Address: Srahan Trevenson Road Trencreek Newquay Cornwall TR8 4NP
Description: Construction of single residential dwellinghouse on infill plot
RefusalReasons: By reason of its scale, massing, and architectural form the proposal would, if permitted, result in an incongrous and incohesive form of development which does not respect the character of the surrounding area. Furthermore the proposal would have an overbearing and dominant presence on the surrounding resdential dwellings resulting in loss of light. The proposal would therefore be contrary to policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and policies G1 and D1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030 and paras 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Land North West Of Trevere Rosudgeon Penzance Cornwall TR20 9PA
Description: Construction of Three Detached Dwellings, Two Detached Garages & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The proposed development provides insufficient visibility splays relative to the recorded road speed and thus fails to demonstrate safe and suitable access onto this busy A-road. In light of the above, the proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 110, 111 and 112 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Garage Store East Of 56 Causewayhead Penzance Cornwall TR18 2SS
Description: Change of Use of Class E Garage/Store (formerly Class B1 light industry & Class B8 storage & distribution) to Class F1 Dance Studio (formerly Class D1 - recreation and leisure)
RefusalReasons: Significant weight is afforded to the provision of a new community space in a highly sustainable location in the centre of the town. The proposal would provide a community benefit in providing a dance/yoga studio for nearby residents to utilise and exercise which in turn would bring social interaction and associated social benefits. There would also be short-term economic benefits during the construction/renovation works and longer-term economic benefits to both the owner and the teachers. However, the noise and disturbance, associated with proposed conversion of an existing garage/store building to form a dance and yoga studio within this enclosed, predominantly residential location, would adversely impact the residential amenities of the occupiers of the nearby residential dwellings. In the absence of any technical information to address the concerns or a sufficient scheme for acoustic mitigation, the identified harm is overriding. The proposal thereby fails to accord with policies 12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 -2030 and paragraphs 130, 174 and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Usembli Carthew Way St Ives Cornwall TR26 1RJ
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling and construction of a replacement three bedroom family dwelling (revised design).
RefusalReasons: Owing to its overly complex and contemporary design in an area containing dwellings of simpler designs which exhibit a shared/collective built character, it is considered that the proposed dwelling would be an incongruous feature in the street scene that fails to demonstrate a clear understanding and response to its setting. The proposal is therefore considered to represent poor quality design, in conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy GD1 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030, Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 4 Elm Terrace St Austell PL25 5QF
Description: Replace two roof lights on north elevation of slate roof and addition of a third roof light. Internal works to insulate roof. Install additional partitioning on second (attic) floor. Re-open bricked-up fireplaces on ground and first floors, install register plates and hearthstones where these have been removed; install fire surrounds and mantels.
RefusalReasons: The design of these roof lights and their increase in number will fail to conserve and preserve the heritage asset by reason of an increase in visual prominence and erosion of the historic fabric. This would not accord with Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) and paragraphs 130 and 199 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. Also because the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 sets out the general duty as respect to Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas. In considering whether to grant listed building consent for any works (within the curtilage of the Listed building), the local planning authority shall have special regard to the desirability of preserving the building or its setting or any features of special architectural or historic interest which it possesses (S16 (2)).

Address: Moor Farm Titchsborough Hill Otterham Station Camelford PL32 9SW
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use for use of land to a mixed use as a dwellinghouse and for the stationing of 2 caravans, each for independent living.
RefusalReasons: Based on the documentation and information provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently robust, precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the stationing of the caravans referred to as 'Caravan A' and 'Caravan B -'The Lodge' for residential use, on land at Moor Farm, Otterham Station, Camelford, PL32 9SW (as shown with the red line plan 'Drawing 3 - Site Plan' received 04/02/2021) have been used for residential accommodation for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application being received. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: Land North Of Higher Rosewarrick Lanivet Bodmin Cornwall
Description: Change of use of land to a private Gypsy site (Re-submission of PA20/09223)
RefusalReasons: The proposed development located within an isolated area of open countryside will result in a sporadic and unwarranted form of development that would have a detrimental visual impact upon the character and appearance of the countryside and its intrinsic character. Harm will also arise through the residential use of the buildings and subdivision of the field to create domestic curtilage together with the associated paraphernalia. The proposal is within an unsustainable and inaccessible location away from any defined settlement and community and infrastructure facilities which would result in a unsustainable development. The proposal is viewed to be against the aims and intentions of Policy 2, 7, 11, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030,  paragraph 8, 79, 80, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and advice contained within Planning Policy for Traveller Sites 2015 notably Para 13 and 25.

Address: Land North West Of Fairview Farm Pennance Road Lanner Redruth Cornwall TR16 5TF
Description: Conversion and extension of existing domestic stables into a residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: The site is located outside of the settlement boundary for Lanner as identified by policy 2 in the Lanner Neighbourhood Plan, thus, the development conflicts with Neighbourhood Development Plan policy concerning the location of new open market housing development. The proposed development, by reason of its location beyond the settlement boundary, would incrementally extend housing development further into the countryside and intensify and extend existing built development on a site that is beyond the defined continuous built form of the village. Such development would result in the harmful urbanisation of a site which contributes to the semi-rural character of the area and setting of the settlement. The environmental harm identified would also fail to maintain the character and landscape qualities of the Carnmarth Area of Great Landscape Value (AGLV), which comprises a distinctively exposed upland area of sporadically and largely undeveloped countryside to the north of the village.  There is no further economic or social justification for market housing in this location to outweigh the environmental harm identified and the development is thereby contrary to policies 2, 6 and 7 in the Lanner Neighbourhood Plan 2017 - 2030, policies 2, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: The Cottage Trevarrian Newquay Cornwall TR8 4AH
Description: Proposed extension and internal alterations.
RefusalReasons: The proposed first floor extension, by reason of its sting, massing and scale, would introduce harmful overbearing impacts to the occupier(s) of the neighbouring dwelling Goose Cottage. The application is, therefore, contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan.

Address: Land SW Of Joannies Avenue Halsetown Road St Ives Cornwall
Description: Outline planning application with some matters reserved (access/layout) for the demolition of existing structures and development to provide an 80 bedroom hotel with associated facilities, 63 holiday villas, a community hub (providing reception facilities and an ancillary shop), associated infrastructure, landscaping, access and parking.
RefusalReasons: The site is significant in terms of its landscape character. It is designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value (AGLV) and also has a high value in providing a setting to St Ives and the AONB. Paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 defines open countryside as the area outside of the physical boundaries of existing settlements (where they have a clear form and shape). The proposed holiday accommodation would result in the existing built form of the settlement extending beyond its current limits into the countryside and would result in the significant loss of Grade 3a agricultural land. It would be readily visible in views to and from the AONB and its rural characteristics are an important component of the wider setting of the AONB landscape and the setting of the town.  The introduction of built development upon it will, through the loss of the existing transitional character, unduly harm the AGLV and setting of the AONB and the town.  This harm is not outweighed by the benefits of the proposal in its submitted form and is therefore considered contrary to Policies 1, 2, 5, 7, 23 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies GD1, OS1, OS5, OS8, OS9 and BE16 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030, policy CC-5 of the Penwith Local Plan (2004), paragraphs, 8, 120, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Porth Avallen Hotel 51 Sea Road Carlyon Bay PL25 3SG
Description: Tree works to fell 4 x Monterey Pine Trees subject to a TPO.
RefusalReasons: Without overriding justification, the complete removal of these protected trees would constitute a significant loss to public amenity. But the application fails to demonstrate that these protected trees constitute a danger that can only be resolved by their complete removal, as required by paragraph 16 of the Town and Country Planning (Tree Preservation)(England) Regulations 2012, and without such information it is not agreed that their complete removal is essential.

Address: 6 Tremena Road St Austell Cornwall PL25 5QG
Description: Proposed summerhouse
RefusalReasons: The proposal by means of the introduction of a new building at the front of the properties curtilage, visible from the street and due to its design and form would fail to suitably respond to the established character and pattern of development of undeveloped front gardens in this part of the Conservation Area. The works would fail to maintain the special character and appearance of Conservation Areas and are found to conflict with the aims of policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and section 16 paragraphs 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South Of Oatley Relubbus Hill Relubbus Penzance Cornwall TR20 9EN
Description: Construction of Two Dwellings and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The application site and the access thereto fall within Flood Zone 3b, with the proposed 'more vulnerable' development of 2 dwellings being incompatible with this flood zone, as set out in tables 2 and 3 of the section of Planning Practice Guidance titled, 'Flood risk and coastal change'. Furthermore, when applying the sequential test, it is considered that there are myriad sites in the West Penwith Community Network Area where the site is located which could accommodate 2 open market dwellings, including sites allocated in the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document. The proposal is therefore considered to constitute inappropriate development in an area at risk of flooding, and to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 159, 161 and 162 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021; and guidance contained in the section of Planning Practice Guidance titled, 'Flood risk and coastal change'.

Address: Chapmans Field Pendoggett Road St Kew Bodmin Cornwall PL30 3HH
Description: Outline application for residential development for up to 8 houses with all matters reserved except access.
RefusalReasons: 1)The proposal would introduce new homes onto an undeveloped field and remove part of an existing roadside boundary hedgerow to the detriment of the distinctive and natural character of the site and surrounding Area of Great Landscape Value. It would also introduce homes on a location with poor accessibility to services and facilities for daily needs other than by private motor car and, in the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise, result in the loss of best and most versatile agricultural land.  The application is therefore not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan, saved policy ENV1 of the North Cornwall Local Plan and paragraphs 105, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land West Of Number 17 Relistian Lane Gwinear Hayle Cornwall TR27 5HE
Description: Permission in Principle for the construction of a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site lies outside of the settlement of Reawla, the site is therefore considered to be in the open countryside and would not represent sustainable new residential development. Despite the classification of land as 'Previously Developed' the siting of a residential dwelling in this location together with its associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context, would fail to conserve or enhance the immediate setting; conversely leading to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of policies GGPP3 and GGPP 4 of the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Plan 2016-2030, policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 80 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land On The North Side Of Lake Lane Liskeard Cornwall
Description: Change of use of land to domestic curtilage to serve plots 186,187,188,189 and 190 of wider residential development.
RefusalReasons: 1 It has not been possible to conclude that the extension of the series of adjacent domestic garden areas as here sought would not conflict with and impede the use of the land by pedestrians following Public Right of Way, Footpath 615/3/2. In the absence of such certainty, and in accordance with the precautionary principle, the development  would conflict with Policies 12 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, and National Planning Practice Guidance Paragraph: 004 Reference ID: 37-004-20140306, Revision date: 06 03 2014.

Address: Westholme A30 Between Whitecross And The Lamb And Flag Canonstown TR27 6ND
Description: Proposed summer house replacing existing timber shed
RefusalReasons: 1 The replacement summerhouse is much larger in scale significantly reducing the amount of amenity space available to serve the existing dwelling. The summerhouse has a greater physical presence within this relatively constricted site and the built form/garden ratio is not considered appropriate. The proposal would result in an intrusive form of development which would be harmful to visual and residential amenity by reason of its cramped and contrived form. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policy LUD6 of the Ludgvan Neighbourhood Development Plan, Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South Of Pax Huic Domui Kehelland Camborne Cornwall TR14 0BS
Description: Conversion and extension of existing barn to form dwellinghouse.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside, would represent new residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. It has not been demonstrated that the building is suitable for conversion and the building is not a redundant or disused building which would be considered appropriate to retain, and its conversion to residential use would not lead to a site enhancement. Instead, it will alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of the existing building and associated land which, at present, clearly relates to this rural landscape. The addition of new openings and introduction of domestic paraphernalia on associated land will fundamentally alter the perception of the building in the setting, such that it will be recognised as an incongruous residential form which will harm the rural characteristics of this landscape. Given the inappropriate and unsustainable form of new housing development in the countryside, the proposed development fails to enhance the landscape character in this location. As such, it conflicts with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 80, 105, 126, 130 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 12 Mounts Bay Terrace Porthleven TR13 9ED
Description: Proposed Garage and Extension and the addition of two terraces on the South West Elevation.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works to remove the boundary wall and develop a garage, would fail to remain unobtrusive in relation to the street scene and the setting. The garage together with the terrace above by reason of its increase in height and mass it would result in a prominent building at odds with its immediate surroundings and would fail to respect the aesthetic understanding of its location.  The proposed development is considered to be of a design that fails to take the opportunities available for improving the character and quality of the area neither conserving or enhancing the area which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 (paragraphs 1a, 1b and 1e) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013, paragraphs 8, 126, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and the aims and intentions of Policy BE1 of the Porthleven Neighbourhood Development Plan June 2021. 2 The proposed vehicular access onto Loe Bar road an unclassified highway would be detrimental to highway safety as it is considered the access will result in vehicles protruding into the highway prior to being able to observe approaching vehicles at a distance that would give them adequate space to stop and avoid collision. Emerging vehicles would have minimal visibility of passing pedestrians until the car emerges so that the driver is past the garage door, this is likely to be approximately 2m of car protruding into the pavement. This is considered to leave pedestrians vulnerable to collision.The proposed access arrangements are not considered to be safe or suitable for all users.The proposal is therefore contrary to Government planning policy stated in Paragraph 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Land Adj Green Bank Green Bank Zelah Truro Cornwall TR4 9HY
Description: Outline permission for construction of a single detached self-build dwelling house and formation of a new vehicle access onto the highway to round off existing settlement.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 because it would extend development into the countryside beyond the current built-form of Zelah and by reason of its urbanising impact and extension of built development into the countryside and chosen siting that conflicts with the existing form of the village would be detrimental to the rural character and appearance of the area. Therefore the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 134 and 174 of the NPPF 2021.

Address: 15 Fairfield Road Falmouth Cornwall TR11 2DN
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed use for Loft conversion.
RefusalReasons: 1 On the basis of the submitted plans, the Local Planning Authority considered that the proposed altering of the roof of the existing dwelling at 15 Fairfield Road would require planning consent. Submitted plans indicate that the proposed roof would protrude more than 0.15 metres beyond the plane of the slope of the original roof when measured from the perpendicular with the external surface of the original roof, and therefore fails to accord with criteria C.1(b) of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class C of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Address: Land North West Of Dartana Forder Cornwall PL12 4QR
Description: Permission in principle for erection of a single storey sunken dwelling and use of existing access.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed site is located outside development of the development boundary as defined by Policy RUR 2 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan. It would represent housing development in the open countryside which would not relate well to an existing settlement, would be in an unsustainable location and would harm the character of the open countryside. The proposal would not represent infill or rounding off, does not fall within the special circumstances listed within policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan, and would increase building density which would be out of character with the surrounding area and divorced from services and facilities. The proposal would therefore be contrary to policy RUR 2 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development plan and Policies 3, 7, 9 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Plymouth Sound and Estuaries Special Area of Conservation (SAC), and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which permission in principle cannot be granted. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Gwendra Greenwith Hill Perranwell Station TR3 7ND
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved proposed construction of up to two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would not be rounding off or an infill of a settlement as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, as it is considered that the proposal would constitute development into the open countryside and would not form a part of the built-form of Perranwell Station.  By reason of its urbanising impact and extension of development into the countryside would be detrimental to the rural character and appearance of the area, eroding its intrinsic character. Therefore the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 134 and 174 of the NPPF 2021. 2 The submitted scheme does not demonstrate safe access/egress for the proposed development from the existing byway onto Greenwith Hill, where drivers of vehicles would encounter substandard visibility when exiting the byway, thus giving rise to increased danger for all road users and creating an unacceptable highway safety impact. As such the development is assessed to conflict with Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 110 and 111 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Jasyl Castle Drive Praa Sands TR20 9TF
Description: Demolition of existing garage and proposed extensions with internal alterations to form bedrooms in roof space.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed increase in height would create an overbearing sense of enclosure to the detriment of the occupants of the neighbouring property also creating additional over shadowing. The use of the rear balcony would raise concerns relating to the impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring property through overlooking that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest. The proposal therefore is contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The resulting proposed development by reason of its increase in height and mass together with the additional glazing would result in a prominent building at odds with its immediate surrounding of traditional bungalows located on the edge of Praa Green and would fail to respect the aesthetic understanding of its location. It would neither conserve or enhance the area which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposal, therefore, is contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 14 Centenary Row West Camborne TR14 8HU
Description: Construction of First Floor Extension and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by virtue of its design, siting, bulk and use of materials would appear prominent and inappropriate in the setting, obscure the historic front of a traditional miners cottage which is considered a non-designated heritage asset, harming the character and quality of the Camborne Conservation Area, the outstanding universal value of the World Heritage Site, and would materially reduce the visual quality of the streetscape. The proposed works fail to conserve or enhance the character and appearance of the World Heritage Site or the Camborne Conservation Area. The proposed works raise design concerns that cause less than substantial harm to the heritage assets but are not balanced by other factors acting in the public benefit. On this basis the proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Sections 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 8, 126, 130, 189, 195,197, 199, 200, 201, 202, 203, 206 and 207 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021; policies C2 and C9 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020 - 2025; the Camborne Conservation Area Appraisal & Management Strategy - 2010 and Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 3, The Setting of Heritage Assets (2nd Edition).

Address: Land South Of Ashcroft Buller Hill Buller Downs Cornwall TR16 6SS
Description: Application for Permission in principle for construction of new single storey detached dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any defined settlement. The site is unmistakably rural in character and is considered to be in the countryside and is not considered to represent previously developed land. The proposal, through the introduction of the new dwelling, would result in harm by virtue of its poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. Given the lack of any adequate justification, the introduction of unjustified residential development in the countryside would harm the character and appearance of the area conflicting with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of financial contributions for mitigation for the Penhale Special Area of Conservation and the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan

Address: Lamburn Cottage Penhallow Truro TR4 9LS
Description: Change of use of a first floor studio apartment from a workshop to residential and holiday use.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed new holiday accommodation and dwelling in the open countryside is in an unsustainable location that is isolated from everyday facilities, services and public transport placing a reliance on the private vehicle without special justification is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 21 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Paragraphs 8, 80, 84, 85, 152 and 154 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South Of Wilben Cottage Carloggas St Austell Cornwall PL26 8YS
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for construction of New dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would represent an unjustified dwelling in the countryside thereby giving rise to sporadic and unsustainable development. The proposed development therefore does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: New House Widegates Looe Cornwall PL13 1PZ
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the proposed siting of mobile home (legally defined as a caravan) within the curtilage of the dwelling for use for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of that dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the information available, the land upon which the proposed mobile home is to be sited does not comprise residential curtilage to the dwelling known as New House. Consequently, the proposed development would require the benefit of planning permission.

Address: 4 Station Court Culver Road Saltash Cornwall PL12 4DR
Description: Construction of 6 residential apartments, together with car parking and associated site works without compliance with Condition 3 of decision notice E2/05/00899/FUL dated 07.10.2005
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed removal of condition 3 of E2/05/00899/FUL would result in overlooking to an area of private and enclosed land serving the adjacent property, 28 Culver Road, which would erode the privacy enjoyed by the occupants. The proposal therefore results in an unneighbourly impact and fails to secure an appropriate standard of amenity, contrary to policy 12.2a of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Land At Moorland View Golberdon Cornwall PL17 7NN
Description: Planning in principle for the construction of a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling, by reason of its location outside of any defined settlement, does not round off or infill a settlement and visually extends the built form into the countryside eroding the character and appearance of this part of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and Policy 1 of the South Hill Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016-2030. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Plymouth Sound and Estuaries Special Area of Conservation (SAC), and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which permission in principle cannot be granted. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land East Of Mill Lawn Calstock Road Gunnislake Cornwall PL18 9AA
Description: Improve access into the two fields and between the fields.
RefusalReasons: 1 The hedgerows in question are considered to be important as they have existed for over 30 years and meet criteria 5(bii), 7 and 8 of Part II of Schedule 1 of the Hedgerows Regulations 1997. The removal of any section of this hedgerow will have a significant adverse impact on the natural character of the area (designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty), which is not outweighed by any clear benefit. The removal of the hedgerow would erode the landscape beauty and character, negatively impacting on the experience for users of the public footpath. The removal of the hedgerow therefore fails to comply with policies 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and paragraphs 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Little Menheer Farm Higher Ninnis St Day TR16 5HD
Description: Redesign of the conversion of three barns (previously approved under reference PA15/11778) to two dwellinghouses.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works will result in a necessity for substantial extension, demolition and rebuilding of the existing buildings on the site to form two dwellinghouses. The development would therefore go beyond the scope of the re-use of suitably constructed redundant or disused buildings in the countryside for residential use. This would represent an unsustainable form of housing development in the open countryside and by reason of its design, form, scale and functional appearance, the works would not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting and harm the character and appearance of the countryside in this location. Finally, and by reason of the scale of the proposal and inappropriate site layout, the development would result in substandard living conditions for future occupants of the two bedroom unit in terms of the inadequate provision of recreational and functional outside space. The proposed development is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 13, 16, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 134 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) 2021.   2 In the absence of up to date ecological survey work to identify the potential presence of European and UK protected species, the proposal fails to adequately demonstrate how the development would impact upon species protected by law. In the absence of up to date ecological survey work, the Local Planning Authority is unable to assess whether adverse harm would be generated with respect to protected species and hence the development is contrary to the aims of policies 2 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 174 and 180 in the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) 2021.

Address: Nissen Hut Land South Of Lower Trevivian St Clether PL15 8PS
Description: Proposed custom build home.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling is not considered to be located in a suitable and sustainable location for new housing development and does not represent 'rounding-off or infilling'; the dwelling with domestic garden would cause harm to the character an appearance of the area and would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate setting. The scheme conflicts with policies 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Kenwyn House Kenwyn Road Truro Cornwall TR1 3SG
Description: Change of use of existing dwelling to preschool nursery and improvements to existing access and car parking
RefusalReasons: 1 The scheme to widen the existing vehicular access and introduce the improved visibility splay to the left when exiting the site onto Kenwyn Road fails to satisfactorily address the poor and heavily restricted visibility to the right for drivers exiting the site onto Kenwyn Road. This would exacerbate an existing hazardous situation for pedestrians and drivers with the increase in traffic generation and vehicle movements to and from the site inevitably associated with the use of the existing dwelling as a children's pre-school nursery. In the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise, safe and suitable access to the development for all people is therefore not provided and the application is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 110 and 111 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed development would result in the substantial loss of an existing stone-faced hedgebank and associated mature Sycamore tree and landscape structure along the existing site roadside frontage on the south western side of Kenwyn Road, which is considered to contribute positively to the character and appearance of the Truro Conservation Area. Having regard to paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, the proposal is therefore considered to result in less than substantial harm to the significance of the Conservation Area as a designed heritage asset, with the public benefits of the proposal in terms of the provision of a new children's pre-school nursery and associated access improvement works not outweighing this harm. It follows that the proposal would conflict with the aims and intentions of S72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; Policies 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; Policies E1, E4, C1 and C3 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 131, 197, 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land SE Of 5 Ridgegrove Hill Ridgegrove Hill Launceston Cornwall
Description: Outline planning application with all matters reserved for up to 62 residential dwellings (C3) and an extra care scheme of up to 75 units (C3) and associated works (resubmission of PA20/10722)
RefusalReasons: 1 The outline application represents a cramped overdevelopment of the site; and does not include sufficient land and detail including a comprehensive masterplan and concept plan to safeguard the delivery of the required estate road, pedestrian and cycle links between Kensey Valley Meadow and Newport Industrial Estate to create a safe and suitable access; to deliver open space requirements; to protect and enhance onsite biodiversity and the woodland priority habitat at the western edge of the allocation; and to ensure slope stability and ground water levels are acceptable, contrary to Policy LAU-H3 of the Cornwall site allocations development plan document, adopted November 2019; and Policies 1,2,3,16,23,26 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 adopted November 2016. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure it, the proposal fails to provide affordable housing; public open space contributions; off-site financial contributions to deliver improvements to mitigate pressures on education; managed and maintained biodiversity net gains, transport or air quality contributions. The proposal is therefore considered to be contrary to policies 8, 12, 13, 16, 23, 27 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010, adopted November 2016. 3 Insufficient information has been provided in relation to the level of activity and presence of dormice across the site to establish whether a favourable conservation status of European Protected Species can be maintained; contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: The Radjel Inn Boscaswell Terrace Pendeen TR19 7DS
Description: Construction of a single detached 2 storey dwelling with variation of condition 2 in relation to decision notice PA21/02359
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would introduce render into an area which is made up predominantly of stone-built properties. Rendered gable ends would represent the first addition of its kind within this section of the street scene and as a result the coherence that currently exists would be lost. The specific finishes proposed would appear out of keeping with the character of the area and detract from the neighbouring development which has been identified as historically significant within the Pendeen Conservation Area Appraisal. The proposal is considered to represent poor design as buildings should be read as a whole and the use of render on the gable elevations would result in a building with a confused identity. The proposed development would harm the character and appearance of the surrounding area and the private benefits of the proposal are not considered benefits which outweigh this identified harm with particular regard to paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development fails to preserve and enhance the character and appearance of the Pendeen Conservation Area and St Just Mining District World Heritage Site in conflict with the aims and intentions set out within Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021, Policies AD2, AD3, AD4 and BD1 of the St Just-in-Penwith Parish Neighbourhood Plan 2021-2030, Policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174, 176 and Section 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Meadow Grove Liskeard Cornwall PL14 3NN
Description: Removal of condition 9 (agricultural occupancy condition) in respect of decision 93/0676/FUL for erection of agricultural workers dwelling to replace existing
RefusalReasons: 1 It has not been convincingly demonstrated that there is no longer any need for this agricultural tied dwelling in the local area. The applicants have not shown that the occupancy condition is no longer reasonable and necessary to protect the agricultural housing stock and prevent the proliferation of residential properties in the countryside. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 -2030 (adopted November 2016) and Paragraph 56 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

Address: 16 Castle View St Stephens PL12 4RD
Description: Addition of second storey to existing single storey rear extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, through its introduction of massing at, and increased overlooking opportunities from first floor level, would harmfully degrade levels of privacy, and levels of sunlight and daylight receivable, and create an overbearing impact for occupiers of the adjacent dwelling No.14 Castle View. As such, the proposal conflicts with Policy 12.2 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016; Policy H5 of the emergent Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan, and the guidance within paragraph 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and the National Model Design Code Part 2 Guidance Notes, (Section H.2.i, para 188, p74 - Lighting, Aspect and Privacy).

Address: Land South Of Number 20 Lanuthnoe Estate St Erth Hill St Erth Hayle Cornwall TR27 6HU
Description: Permission in principle for proposed development of single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site does not fall within the settlement boundary of St Erth, shown on Map 2 of the St Erth Neighbourhood Plan 2017 - 2030, nor is it situated on an allocated site for residential development in said Plan. The site does not immediately abut existing residential development within the settlement due to the intervening access lane, which acts as a clear barrier to further development. Notwithstanding the presence of domestic kennels/hardstanding along its western boundary, the site is in the main Greenfield Land and the proposed development would appear as a discordant feature constituting an encroachment of residential development into the countryside that would not be well related to the existing form of development in the locality. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies HI 2 and HT 2 of the St Erth Neighbourhood Plan 2017 - 2030, policies 1, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and with paragraph 8 of the NPPF (2021).

Address: Beatons Park Bray Shop Callington Cornwall PL17 8QN
Description: Hedgerow Removal Notice: Moving of hedgerow to widen 9' lane, to make better suited to modern agricultural vehicles (15')
RefusalReasons: 1 The hedgerow is considered to be important for the purposes of Section 97 of the Environment Act 1995 as it has existed for more than 30 years, and meets criteria 5 (a) and (bii) and 7 of Part II of Schedule 1 of the Hedgerows Regulations 1997. The removal of this hedgerow would have a detrimental impact on the landscape character and historic field pattern of the area for which no further information has been received that indicates a special justification for the removal of the important hedgerow. The removal of the hedgerow therefore fails to comply with policies 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and paragraphs 174, 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Trekennick House Altarnun Launceston Cornwall PL15 7SL
Description: Conversion of former barn to dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal building is not considered to be suitably constructed or appropriate to retain; and the introduction of a residential use would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate setting which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of residential development in the countryside and without any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Trevean Farm Access To Trevean Farm St Merryn Padstow PL28 8PR
Description: Change of use of two detached barns to two dwellings without complying with condition 7 of decision 91/1238 dated 23/08/1991
RefusalReasons: 1 Condition 7 of decision notice 91/1238 cannot be varied under Section 73 legislation of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 due to the current condition and appearance of the two barns which since the grant of decision 91/1238 have deteriorated to a sufficient degree that the amount of rebuilding work now required would go beyond that approved under 91/1238. It therefore constitutes development that is substantially different from the development approved under 91/1238 contrary to the guidance within Paragraph 017 of the Planning Practice Guidance and cannot be considered a minor amendment under Section 73 Town and Country Planning Act 1990. 2 Condition 7 of decision notice 91/1238 cannot be varied under Section 73 legislation of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as it has not been demonstrated that the development approved under 91/1238 was lawfully commenced and therefore remains extant. Section 73 (4) is explicit that this section does not apply if the previous planning permission was granted subject to a condition as to the time within which the development to which it related was to be begun and that time has expired without the development having been begun. Condition 1 of decision 91/1238 requires commencement of work before the expiration of five years from 20 May 1991. Due to the age of the consent, the lack of progress on site and the requirements of paragraph 4, the local planning authority is of the opinion that a valid commencement of work needs to be formally demonstrated prior to any amendment being undertaken under Section 73 Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Address: 12 Inner Tide Lane Newquay TR7 2FA
Description: Application for a lawful development certificate for the construction and use of an existing domestic garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The garage detailed in this submission is not considered to constitute permitted development as defined in Class E, Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, as amended as it doesn't comply with paragraphs (d) and (e). Development not permitted:(d) the building would have more than a single storey;(e) the height of the building, enclosure or container would exceed,(ii) 2.5 metres in the case of a building, enclosure or container within 2 metres of the boundary of the curtilage of the dwellinghouse.As the proposal is not considered permitted development, and has not been in place for four or more years then the certificate is refused and full planning will need to be applied for.

Address: Blakes Keiro Farm Access To Blakes Keiro Farm St Minver Wadebridge PL27 6RP
Description: The proposal is for a Park Home on the grounds of an existing Campsite and Farm.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site lies in open countryside for the purposes of planning and outside of a defined settlement. No overriding need has been demonstrated for a rural location. The site has no safe pedestrian route to services and facilities and would be reliant on private vehicle for day to day needs. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, including compelling evidence of an essential need in this specific location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies STMNDP2 and STMNDP 2.6 of the St Minver Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030 and paragraphs 80, 92, 104, 112, and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Blakes Keiro Farm Access To Blakes Keiro Farm St Minver Wadebridge PL27 6RP
Description: The proposal is for a Park Home on the grounds of an existing Campsite and Farm.
RefusalReasons: 1 The site lies in open countryside for the purposes of planning and outside of a defined settlement. No overriding need has been demonstrated for a rural location. The site has no safe pedestrian route to services and facilities and would be reliant on private vehicle for day to day needs. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, including compelling evidence of an essential need in this specific location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies STMNDP2 and STMNDP 2.6 of the St Minver Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030 and paragraphs 80, 92, 104, 112, and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Fir Tree Farm Coxpark Latchley Gunnislake Cornwall PL18 9BB
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved for the erection of 2 x 3 bed affordable self build bungalows
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings are not related to any settlement identified in the Calstock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030 (Post-examination Submission Draft August 2021), and would visually extend built form into the countryside, incrementally eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting which forms part of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development. Without any other material considerations to outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Policies HP1 and HP4 of the Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030 Post-examination Submission Draft August 2021.

Address: 3 Alexandra Terrace Penzance TR18 4NX
Description: Conversion and Raised Roof Extension of Garage to provide a 1 Bed. Apartment on land at rear of No.3. Alexandra Terrace. Penzance. TR18 4NX.
RefusalReasons: 1 The rear of Alexandra Terrace is characterised by single storey garages and the wider area has a spacious and open appearance. The proposed conversion and upward extension of the existing single storey garage to create a two-storey one-bedroom dwelling would be at odds with the established character and appearance of the area and would fail to respect its form and traditional pattern of development. The proposed dwelling would appear intrusive and overbearing on the rear of Alexandra Terrace and the neighbouring property immediately to the west known as 2 Laregan Hill thereby harming the residential amenities of the area. In addition to the impact on the amenities of the existing dwellings, the proposed dwelling would not be served by an appropriate level of amenity space resulting in a poor residential environment. The application site is not considered appropriate for residential development due to the resulting harm upon the visual and residential amenities of the area in conflict with Policies 1, 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Moorgate Higher Road Pensilva PL14 5NJ
Description: Erection of a timber single storey granny annexe for ancillary use to the main dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in a large self-contained unit of living accommodation within its own garden and, given its scale, degree of self-containment outside the main domestic curtilage, and distinct separation of approximately 25 metres from the main dwelling, would be tantamount to a new dwelling in the open countryside therefore failing to represent a genuine ancillary development. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8 and 130 the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Moorgate Higher Road Pensilva PL14 5NJ
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed use for siting of a mobile home.
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the information available, the land upon which the proposed mobile home is to be sited does not comprise residential curtilage to the dwelling known as Moorgate. Consequently, the proposed development would require the benefit of planning permission.

Address: Sunningdale Nurseries St Dominick Saltash Cornwall PL12 6TG
Description: Application for reserved matters following outline approval of PA19/10111 dated 25.05.2020 - outline planning for up to 5 residential dwellings and provision of vehicular/pedestrian access with all other matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its scale and suburban designs, would be inappropriate for the rural context and would dominate the settlement and immediate context to an unacceptable degree. As such the proposal would fail to take account of the landscape and built contexts, or the character and appearance of the Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: 20 Trevenson Road Pool TR15 3PQ
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of property as a House of Multiple Occupation (HMO)
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the Local Planning Authority, the Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land and property known as '20 Trevenson Road Pool TR15 3PQ' has been used as a House of Multiple Occupation occupied by more than six people for a period in excess of 10 years preceding the date of this application. As such, the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: 1 Skidden Gardens Skidden Hill St Ives TR26 2DX
Description: Proposed external alterations, conversion of walled courtyard to create a breakfast room, balconies to the east and north elevation. Amended scheme of PA20/10738
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed balconies, due to their design and location, would result in an unacceptable increase in overlooking and disturbance in relation to the immediately adjacent windows of 4, 4A and The Tide House of Skidden Hill. The extremely close proximity of the proposed balconies allows for a significant increase in levels of overlooking and disturbance to the users of 4, 4A and The Tide House of Skidden Hill that is considered intrusive, unreasonable and of harm beyond that of the reasonable levels of privacy currently enjoyed at this property. The proposed balconies would raise concerns relating to the impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring property that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The propsal is therefore contrary to policy GD1 and BE1 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan 2015 - 2030, policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, which together seek to achieve a good standard of residential amenity by, amongst other things, ensuring that development proposals protect individuals and property from overlooking and unreasonable loss of privacy. 2 The proposed works, due to their scale, height and location, would fail to remain unobtrusive in relation to the street scene and the setting, and would result in an overly-dominant structure at odds in the context of the surrounding built environment. The proposed development is considered to be of a design that fails to take the opportunities available for improving the character and quality of the area. The National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed balconies and associated works has been set out above.  Although the private benefits and minor economic benefits of the terraces are appreciated, the proposed works would result in less than substantial harm in relation to the Conservation Area and its setting that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1 and 12 (paragraphs 1a, 1b and 1e) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections  of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013, paragraphs 126, 130, 133, 135-136 and 194-208 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, the aims and intentions of Policies BE1, GD1 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030.

Address: Land Known As Simons Yard Harrowbarrow Cornwall
Description: Outline permission with some matters (appearance, landscaping and scale) reserved for for the residential development of up to two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed application site, by reason of its location outside of the clearly defined built form of Harrowbarrow, is considered to fall within the open countryside. The proposal does not represent infill, rounding-off or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement, and would visually extend the built form into the countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. The proposal would urbanise this section of the World Heritage Site, eroding the rural context which contributes positively to the overall post-industrial mining landscape. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 9, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and Policies HP 1, HP 2 and HE 3 of the Calstock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2021 - 2030 (Submission Draft June 2020).

Address: Goonvrea Barton Goonvrea Road St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0NX
Description: Revised application of PA20/04192 (Demolition of existing agricultural building and erection of two rural workshops (B1Use Class))
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed workshops, that do not have a site specific justification to be located on agricultural greenfields would both irreversibly harm the natural beauty and intrinsic character of the designated heritage coast landscape within the countryside and fail to maintain the outstanding universal value of the prevailing Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site, with no sufficient substantial public benefits provided to outweigh the harm of these buildings that have furthermore been designed with industrial references rather than agricultural which conflicts with the surrounding a pastoral landscape  in conflict with the aims and intensions of Policies contained within paragraphs 8, 11, 84, 85, 130, 174, 199, 200, 202, 206 and 208 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 1, 2, 2a, 3, 5, 12, 21, 23, and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies 10, 11 and 15 of the St Agnes NDP 2019 and policies P3, C2, C8 and C9 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape Management Plan 2020-2025.

Address: Fairbank Cottage Fore Street West Looe PL13 2HA
Description: Loft conversion with dormers
RefusalReasons: 1 The application for the construction of two dormer extensions by reason of the modern, unsympathetic design, scale and massing fails to take account of the historic context of the application site and surrounding traditional vernacular and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Looe Conservation Area and the adjoining Grade II listed Cobblers Cottage, amounting to less than substantial harm, that is not outweighed by any public benefits.  The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, the guidance within the Looe Conservation Management Plan 2009, notably section 5.1, section 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013, paragraphs 8, 126, 130, 197, 199, 200, 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: St Catherines Road From Junction With A38 At Wainsford To Sina Hill Two Waters Foot PL14 6HT
Description: Proposed conversion of workshop/garage into a residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The building proposed to be converted, is not redundant, disused or historic, contrary to the requirements of policy 7.3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). The works would not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting and would instead result in harm to the character and appearance of the surrounding area. Furthermore, the dwelling would be in an unsustainable location, leading to an increased reliance on private motor vehicle usage. As a result, the proposal fails to comply with Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Moorcott Road From Junction North Of Highmoor Cottage To The B3254 Between Meadowside And North Beer Lane Boyton Launceston PL15 8NU
Description: Proposed new single storey dwelling with attached garage, parking and amenity space.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, in seeking the erection of a dwelling in what is considered to be a rural location in the open countryside outside of any clearly defined settlement does not represent infill, rounding-off or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining a settlement, and would visually extend the built form into the countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016). 2 In the absence of a Heritage Impact Assessment, an Archaeological desk-based assessment and, where necessary, a field evaluation, the Local Planning Authority is unable to assess the potential impacts of the development on heritage assets within the immediate vicinity including the suspected Chelsfield Barrow Group Scheduled Ancient Monument. The proposal is therefore contrary to paragraphs 194, 199 and 200 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 1 Windsor View Fore Street St Cleer Liskeard Cornwall PL14 5DF
Description: Creation of parking space for one vehicle
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed removal of a proportion of the hedge and front garden to create a parking area would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the historic core of the village, setting of the cottages (identified as non-designated heritage assets) and the Area of Great Landscape Value. The subsequent positioning of a car on the front garden area would further erode the integrity of the properties' historic frontage and urbanise the semi-rural and historic context. This would conflict with policies 2,12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy 7 of the Cleer Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020 to 2030. 2 The development would erode the already limited front amenity space resulting in inadequate provision for current and future residents of the host dwelling. The positioning of a car would also harm the neighbouring dwelling's ability to enjoy their amenity space and result in unacceptable loss of privacy as a result of hedge removal and uneighbourly impact. The application is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 126 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and section 5.5 of the Cornwall Council Design Guide March 2013. 3 Insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate that the site is able to provide sufficient manoeuvring space off road, to allow vehicles to turn with ease in order to access and exit the site safely. There is a possibility vehicles would manoeuvre directly adjacent to this C classified road to the detriment of highway safety. Accordingly, the proposal would conflict with policies 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) and paragraphs 110 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Roosters Roost Tregiffian St Buryan Penzance Cornwall TR19 6JB
Description: Proposed Balcony and Formation of Landscape Window to Side Elevation of Barn
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed balcony and landscape window appear as overly-dominant, domesticated modern additions wholly inappropriate to a converted barn located within a sensitive rural landscape. The proposed works materially reduce the visual quality of the host building and the setting, which is located within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, to which the National Planning Policy Framework affords the highest status of protection. The National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed balcony and associated works has been set out above. Although the private benefits and minor economic benefits of the provision of the balcony are appreciated, the proposed works would result in less than substantial harm in relation to a non-designated heritage asset and its setting, that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), 23 (paragraphs 2 , 2a and 2b) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10, 7.6 and 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; paragraphs 126, 130, 134, 194, 197(c), 199, 203, 176 and 178 and of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, and the advice of the Cornwall Council Domestic Alterations and Extensions Guide 2017 (pg 12).

Address: Land East Of Cherrymeadow Mousehole Lane Paul Penzance Cornwall TR19 6TY
Description: Application for outline planning permission with all matters reserved for the Construction of Residential Dwelling & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is outside the physical boundaries of any established settlement and is therefore situated within the open countryside as defined under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposed development would introduce new development into the open countryside for which there are no special circumstances for justification. The proposed development and associated domestic paraphernalia would neither conserve nor enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Tredinnick Fields Access To Tredinnick Fields Luxulyan PL30 5DT
