In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposed dwelling represents a sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies E1, E4, E6 and H1 of the Truro and Kenwyn NDP 2016-2030, Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and paragraphs 79 and 170(b) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development would conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 insofar as it seeks to prevent development which would give rise to adverse effects on both the Penhale Dunes SAC and the River Fal SAC and paragraph 177 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Jamaica Inn Bolventor Launceston Cornwall PL15 7TS
Description: Development of existing field adjoining Jamaica Inn into high quality touring caravan and camping field, with access road and facilities building. The development will be capable of occupying 20 touring caravans and 10 tents.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of its scale and introduction of colourful tents and white caravans, associated paraphernalia, hardstanding and increased human activity onto prominent sloping land which is visible from a number of public viewpoints would fail to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Bodmin Moor section of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.  The social and economic benefits of the proposal are not considered sufficient to outweigh the adverse environmental impact for which great weight must be given; as such the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development, contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, saved policy ENV1 of the North Cornwall Local plan 1999, Policies CC1, MD6, MD9, MD13, BM12.06 and BM12.10 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021 and guidance within paragraphs 8, 11, 84, 174, 176 and 185 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Rear Of 9A Upton Towans Upton Towans Hayle Cornwall TR27 5BJ
Description: Proposed new single detached eco-bungalow
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development for the siting of a dwelling in this location would result in the loss of an existing traditional garden plot associated with a dwelling which is considered to erode the character of the area. The development would be seen as an incongruous feature that would neither relate to nor reflect the local context in which it is situated and would therefore fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of area of Upton Towans. The proposal is therefore contrary to policy GGPP7 of the Gwinear-Gwithian Neighbourhood Plan 2016-2030, policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land West Of Todden Coath Farm Sheffield Paul Cornwall TR19 6UQ
Description: Conversion of Barn to Form Dwelling House and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is located outside the boundaries of a defined settlement and is within the open countryside. Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 sets out the special circumstances in which residential development within the open countryside will be considered acceptable. It has not been demonstrated that the building is suitably constructed for its intended residential use, nor is the building redundant, disused or a historic building that is considered appropriate to retain and would lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting. Furthermore, there is insufficient information to determine that the existing building and the proposed works would meet the requirement that the building is capable of being converted to a dwelling without substantial rebuilding operations. The application building is prominent when viewed from the road. The building reads as a simple and functional agricultural building that relates to the adjacent field and surrounding rural character of the area, the type of building which Is expected in a rural setting and as such does not appear out of place. The proposal would introduce large areas of glazing giving the building a new domestic character which would significantly alter the appearance of the building. The proposed development is not considered to lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting, which is open and rural, which would be eroded by the conversion works, associated domestic paraphernalia and subdivision of the open field to the south and west of the application building and as such would have an adverse impact on the character and appearance of the area. It is therefore concluded that the proposal would not accord with Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Penwethers House Killerton Road Bude EX23 8EW
Description: Proposed redevelopment of backpackers' hotel into 6no apartments and 2no. dwellings - Variation of Condition 2 in relation to decision notice PA20/06538
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed design, by reason of its use of render on the first floor of the property, would harm the character and appearance of the period property, and the surrounding area, representing an undesirable and harmful design in the context of the surrounding built form. As such the proposal would fail to take account of the townscape setting or promote local distinctiveness and would be contrary to policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016). Furthermore, the quality of development would be materially diminished as a result of changes being made to the permitted scheme through an inappropriate use of materials, contrary to paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 17 Lusty Glaze Road Newquay Cornwall TR7 3AE
Description: Extension to ground and first floor with associated remodelling works. Creation of additional balcony to the north west elevation
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its excessive scale, strident material, discordant architectural form and unbalancing of the symmetry experienced along this portion of Lusty Glaze Road the proposal is incongruous in relation to the host property and causes unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the wider area. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies D1(7) and H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030, paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal, by reason of an overbearing effect upon the neighbouring property 18 Lusty Glaze Road, due to the scale, form, massing and proximity, would be unduly harmful to the residential amenities of the occupiers of this neighbouring residence. As such, the proposal is considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010-2030 - adopted November 2016 and Section 12, particularly paragraph 127, of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Merryn Lower Bostraze Newbridge Penzance Cornwall TR20 8PU
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed use for a small 2 berth caravan for use for holiday let and family/friends
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not considered to have a lawful use as a garden and as Bed and Breakfast accommodation falls within Class C1 the proposal amounts to a material change of use and constitutes development as defined in Section 55 (1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Address: Land West Of Wheal Prussia Dry Wheal Prussia Treleigh Redruth Cornwall TR16 4BG
Description: Retrospective: Change of use of land for residential use and stationing of a residential caravan
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the location to the north side of the A3047, which is open countryside, is severed from nearby services, facilities, amenities and employment. As such, it would represent unsustainable, new residential development, for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic form of development that would be contrary to the provisions of paragraphs 7, 8 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies 1, 2 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 2 The proposal would result in an unjustified sporadic residential development which has an unacceptable urbanising effect into an area that is primarily undeveloped and rural in character, which would have a detrimental impact upon the appearance and character of the landscape and thereby fails to protect and encourage enhancement of this particular area of countryside, contrary to Policies 2, 13 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Part 2, Context and Built Form, of the National Design Guide Planning - practice guidance for beautiful, enduring and successful places (January 2021).

Address: Land NE Of Bosvine Sennen Cornwall
Description: Residential dwelling with detached garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would not represent rounding off under Policy 3 of the Local Plan but, rather, would result in the undesirable extension and intrusion of residential development into the countryside to the detriment to the distinctive natural beauty and character of the surrounding semi-rural countryside. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Blue Anchor Scredda St Austell Cornwall PL26 8XP
Description: Retention of residential chalet as a self-contained annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site sits outside of the defined settlement boundary for Scredda and would not represent infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030. The proposal physically extends the built envelope of the nearby settlement into the adjoining countryside to the detriment of the landscape character, where the development would reduce the relatively green gap between the village and the nearby town of St Austell, harming the landscape setting of these settlements, representing an intrusion into the undeveloped countryside. In the absence of any functional need and evidence that the Caravan/annex is justified to be on the land, or any other special circumstances to justify the development as a whole in this context, the application is not considered to represent sustainable development and would be contrary to the guidance contained in Paragraphs 8, 11, 79 and 80 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 2 In the absence of appropriate evidence, the proposal fails to adequately demonstrate how the development would impact upon any species protected by law both during and post implementation of the proposed scheme. In the absence of such information the Local Planning Authority is unable to assess whether adverse harm would be generated with respect to any protected species and hence the development is contrary to the aims of paragraph179, 180 and181and 182 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, guidance within the section titled 'Natural environment' of Planning Practice Guidance, together with Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Natural England and DEFRA - Protected Species: How to review planning applications 2016.

Address: 1 Levant Close Trewellard Pendeen Penzance Cornwall TR19 7TG
Description: Loft conversion with rear balcony
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dormers and integral rear balcony, due to their design, scale and location, appear obtrusive, excessive and conspicuous in the setting, which is located adjacent the Trewellard Conservation Area and lies within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposed works would raise concerns relating to design and visual impact that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is considered contrary to Policy 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 2.9, 4.1 (bullet point 1), 4.11 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 124, 127, 128, 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2 The proposed rear dormer/balcony, due to design, scale and location, would result in a significant and harmful increase in overlooking in relation to the rear amenity areas of the adjoining 2 Levant Close, and the adjacent 19 Trewellard RoadThe proposed balcony is located in close proximity to the aforementioned dwellings and would result in a significant increase in the intensity and immediacy of overlooking of their respective rear amenity areas, that would otherwise enjoy a reasonable degree of privacy. The proposed balcony raises concerns relating to impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring property that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is considered contrary to Policy 12 paragraph 2a of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Section 2.6 (bullet point 1); Section 4.1 (bullet point 1) and Section 4.11 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework

Address: Gribben View Cottage 61 Laura Drive St Austell Cornwall PL25 3EQ
Description: Construction of a new Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The scheme to sub-divide the residential curtilage of 'Gribben View Cottage' to introduce an additional dwelling would result in a development that would appear cramped and at odds with the character of the established pattern of development and streetscene. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of Policies 2, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 126 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed scheme to introduce an additional dwelling at the site is considered to result in a cramped form of development for the occupiers of the existing and proposed dwelling with limited usable or private amenity space to the detrimental of the health and wellbeing of occupiers. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of Policies 12, 13 and 16(3) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and the Chief Planning Officer's Advice Note: Good Design in Cornwall.

Address: Springfield Stratton Bude Cornwall EX23 9TG
Description: Conversion of existing agricultural building into up to 3 holiday lets
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed holiday lets would not enhance the immediate setting, they would not be accessible by a range of transport modes and would lead to an intensification of a residential use in the countryside where no special circumstances have been demonstrated. The building is less than 10 years old and insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate it is suitably constructed; consequently the proposal is in conflict with Policies 5,7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016 and Policy 4 of the adopted Bude-Stratton Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030.

Address: Land South Of 1 West Seton West Seaton Camborne Cornwall TR14 0AH
Description: Full application for proposed new dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside, would represent new unfettered residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal would result in an undesirable and sporadic form of development to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside. Further harm to the environment would occur as a result of the failure to limit reliance on the private vehicle. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the public benefits gained through a modest contribution to the local housing stock and local employment throughout the construction period do not outweigh the harm. The proposal is unsustainable and fails to accord with policy 1 of the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019, policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of sufficient technical information to support the application, it has not been demonstrated that the proposed drainage systems would minimise, reduce or where possible eliminate flood risk on site and in the area, and prevent the new development from contributing to water pollution. The proposal is therefore in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 16 and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 120, 167 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North East Of Prince Of Wales Inn Newtown St Martin Cornwall TR12 6DP
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved for the proposed construction of two dwellings on previously developed land.
RefusalReasons: 1 The provision of residential development on the indicated site would significantly reduce the vehicular parking area available for patrons of the adjacent public house, by extent negatively impacting upon the attractiveness of the public house as a visitor destination. Given the location of the public house, adequate parking is essential to enable any opportunity for future success of the business. In the absence of sufficient, available parking, the development will negatively impact upon the viability of the business resulting in the potential loss of a valued community facility. The development is therefore contrary to policies 1, 4 and 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 84 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Mitchells Cottage Shutta East Looe PL13 1LT
Description: Install replacement windows to front and side of property
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed installation of wood effect UPVC windows, by reason of their unsympathetic design, materials and appearance fail to take account of the historic context of the application site and surroundings and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Looe Conservation Area. The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 127, 130, 189, 192, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land Adj To The Mount Carne Manaccan Helston Cornwall TR12 6HD
Description: Construction of a single detached two storey dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The introduction of new built development to this prominent and sensitive creekside position would harmfully erode its strong rural character and clearly not conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) in this location.  Moreover and by reason of its siting, design and use of material finishes, the proposal would not integrate suitably into the historic built environment and would result in less than substantial harm to the setting of the adjacent and nearby Grade II Listed buildings. This remote rural site, which does not form part of an established settlement, is not a sustainable or accessible location for new housing and the development would therefore be contrary to development plan policy in relation to the location of new housing development and cause material environmental harm to the strong rural character of this protected landscape and the setting of designated heritage assets. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 80, 110, 112, 130, 134, 174, 176, 197, 199 and 202 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, policies MD9 and SCW8.04 in the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021 and the requirements of Section 66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990. 2 The application site is located within tidal Flood Zones 2 and 3 at present and wholly within tidal Flood Zone 3 when climate change is considered in relation to tidal flood levels over the lifetime of the development.  In the absence of any other wider sustainability benefits, the proposal would fail the Sequential Test and the site would therefore be an inappropriate location for new housing having regard to flood risk. The proposal is therefore contrary to policy 26 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 159, 162 and 163 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Colliford Lake Park St Neot Liskeard Cornwall PL14 6PZ
Description: Discharge of Section 52 Agreement dated 16.09.1988
RefusalReasons: If the obligation were to be discharged important social and environmental objectives for planning and the achievement of sustainable development would be frustrated. There would likely be increased vehicular movements; increased pollution and greenhouse gas emissions; an undermining of efforts to combat climate change; the creation of unrestricted dwellings in the open countryside without special justification; and an erosion of the rural character of the area (in conflict with the aims and intentions of Policies 1,7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and paragraphs 8, 80, 93 and 104 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021).    Accordingly this application is refused, as the obligation continues to serve a useful purpose.

Address: Land South West Of Vordors St Breward Bodmin Cornwall PL30 4ND
Description: Application for Outline Planning Permission for Construction of a proposed dwelling with some matters reserved (access only)
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is considered to make a positive contribution to the rural character and setting of the settlement of De Lank. The proposed development of the site would represent further incremental growth of the built form extending the existing settlement into the countryside, eroding the rural character of the area. The benefits of the scheme do not outweigh the development plan position and the harm to the rural character of the area. The proposed development is therefore considered to be contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Saved Policy - ENV1 - Protecting the countryside and landscape character and guidance contained within paragraphs 8, 79, 117 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 Insufficient information has been submitted to demonstrate that this proposal would not result in an increase in phosphate levels which would further adversely affect the current unfavourable status of the River Camel Special Area of Conservation. In adopting a precautionary approach, the Local Planning Authority is not satisfied that the proposal will not adversely affect the integrity of this Special Area of Conservation and the application is contrary to Regulation 63 of the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017; Policies 1, 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; and paragraphs 8, 11, 170, 175 and 177 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Wayside Pill Lane Feock Truro Cornwall TR3 6SE
Description: Demolish two-storey extension and conservatory build new two-storey contemporary extension and refurbish existing house.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its scale, width and modern fenestration and features, would harm the significance of the non-designated heritage asset and its setting, and fail to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, contrary to Policies 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies HE1, LS2, BIO1, and D1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Plan 2017-2030, and Policies MD9, SCC9.01, and SCC9.08 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land Adj To Rylands Grove Lane Perran Downs Goldsithney Penzance Cornwall TR20 9HN
Description: Construction of a three bedroom dwelling with associated garden and amenities
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would appear at odds with the established character in this location thereby representing development which fails to provide continuity with the existing built form. The area is spacious and open in character and the application site is considered unable to provide a plot/building ratio which is in keeping with the prevailing character of the surrounding development. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Stenor Polmark Beach Cottages Harlyn Bay Road Harlyn Bay Padstow Cornwall PL28 8SB
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for proposed use: Minor amendments to the fenestration around the property.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed alterations identified in the certificate could not be undertaken, based on the evidence submitted, on the reliance of available permitted development rights. As such, it is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works cannot be lawful, the certificate must be refused, and the applicant should apply for planning permission to undertake the proposed works.

Address: 2 Trethannas Gardens Praze An Beeble TR14 0LJ
Description: Construction of single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The scheme to sub-divide the application site to introduce an additional dwelling does not respond positively to the character of the area and results in a cramped form of development which would appear at odds with the character of the host dwelling, established pattern of development and streetscene and would substantially infill the site harming the character of the setting. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 124, 125 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) 2 The proposed scheme to introduce an additional dwelling at the site is considered to result in a cramped form of development for the occupiers of the existing and proposed dwelling with limited usable or private amenity space to the detrimental of the health and wellbeing of occupiers. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 124, 125 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and the Chief Planning Officer's Advice Note: Good Design in Cornwall

Address: Land And Building South Of Bosanath Farm Bosanath Valley Mawnan Smith Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5LL
Description: Conversion of existing agricultural barn to form dwelling house
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, through the substantial level of re-build is not considered to be appropriate to retain or convert and tantamount to the construction of a new dwelling within the open countryside. In addition the proposed development would not conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the AONB, and given the lack of any special justification it is not sustainable development, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraph 8, 9, 79, 80, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 1 Park Allen, Curlew Cottage Lewannick Road Cubert TR8 5HL
Description: NEW DWELLING
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal for a new dwelling would result in a cramped form of development out of keeping with the location to the detriment of the rural character of the countryside setting and would result in an unacceptably low standard of residential amenity for both the new dwelling and Curlew Cottage in terms of useable outdoor amenity space and outlook for occupants as well as creating a parking arrangement that would neither be safe or convenient in terms of manouevering vehicles onto the highway. The proximity of the proposed dwelling would have a harmful overbearing impact on the residential use of the garden of No.2 Park Allen. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land East Of Moor End Altarnun Launceston Cornwall PL15 7RR
Description: Outline application for the erection of 2 'drive thru' fast food and drink premises
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposals are contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 paragraphs 108 and 109 in that they will increase turning movements at an existing junction on a high-speed network with a known collision history. This constitutes an unacceptable impact on highway safety which the applicant cannot cost effectively mitigate to an acceptable degree. The proposals are contrary to DfT Circular 02/2013, paragraphs 9 and 10 as the development will add traffic to an existing junction on a high-speed network which already experiences road safety issues and would thereby increase the frequency of road safety issues occurring which is considered to constitute an unacceptable impact on highway safety.The proposals are contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, as the development cannot provide safe and suitable access to the site for all people as access to the development will increase turning movements through an existing junction which currently experiences highway safety issues and which would represent a significant adverse impact on the local and strategic road network, that cannot be managed or mitigated by the applicant to an acceptable degree.

Address: 4 Chywoone Grove Newlyn Penzance Cornwall TR18 5NU
Description: Creation of a vehicular access with turning and parking area
RefusalReasons: 1 The removal and cutting back of the existing boundary to provide an access with sufficient visibility splays would harm the character and appearance of the open countryside. The proposed access is not considered to be justified as the dwelling is currently served by a safe and suitable access and therefore there is no overriding need to provide a new access which would result in harm to the character of the area in conflict with Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Wheal Burrow Mithian Downs St Agnes Cornwall TR5 0PZ
Description: Erection of agricultural dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is in an unsustainable rural location away from any settlement and the proposed dwelling would be visible within the rural context and would detract from the open countryside character through the introduction of built development. The evidence provided has not demonstrated that there is a functional need for an agricultural worker to live on site, nor has it been demonstrated that the farming business is financially viable to an extent that would support a new dwelling. The proposal thus fails to accord with Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan and without there being an essential need to live at the site the harm to the countryside character is not outweighed thus the proposal also fails to accord with Cornwall Local Plan Policy 23, St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan Policy 10 or paragraph 174(B) of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Cryor Farm Newbridge Penzance Cornwall TR20 8PT
Description: Construction of detached self-contained holiday unit to replace existing out-building.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would add to the existing built form within this rural countryside location and would result in the undesirable extension and intrusion of residential development to the detriment of the distinctive natural beauty and character of the surrounding rural countryside. The proposed development would not be in a sustainable location, having particular regard to the lack of accessibility to services and facilities available locally. As such the proposal would not represent sustainable rural tourism. The proposal does not represent an appropriate location for holiday accommodation and therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 84, 130 and 174 and section 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Entrance To Killiganoon Manor And Owls Cottage Killiganoon Manor Killiganoon Carnon Downs TR3 6JT
Description: Construction of localised entance boundary walls and access gates to the private drive serving Killiganoon Manor and Owls Cottage
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed loss of historic fabric and realignment of the boundary walling would harm the architectural and historic integrity of this listed estates main planned entrance and would cause less than substantial harm that is not outweighed by public benefit in conflict with accordance with the aims and intensions of Paragraphs 127, 192, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policies 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies HE1 and D1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018.

Address: Land East Of 47 And 49 Cliff Street Cliff Street Mevagissey Cornwall PL26 6QJ
Description: Construction of a one bedroom dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling by reason of its scale, design and siting, would introduce significant built form onto the plot . The proposed dwelling would result in a negative and harmful impact to the character and appearance of the area with the erosion of the open space and historic and traditional designs of the nearby dwellings. The impact on the character and appearance of the Conservation area and AONB  is considered to outweigh any benefits of this proposal and therefore the proposal does not comply with Policies 1, 2, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraph's 8, 11, 14, 79, 104, 157, 179, 180, of the NPPF 21, Mevagissey NDP policies HC1, D1 and D5 and Policy MD9 of the Area of Outstanding Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 7 Glen Park Pensilva Liskeard Cornwall PL14 5PN
Description: Construction of bedroom over garage including a balcony
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the two storey appearance of the proposed garage in contrast to the existing neighbouring bungalow properties along this visible frontage, would harm the character and consistent appearance of the streetscene and the host property. The introduction of larger and taller building form with a first floor balcony on the front facing elevation would not sit well within the frontage which is immediately visible from the public realm, resulting in a dominant and conspicuous form of development which fails to take account of the neighbouring built context. The proposal therefore fails to accord with Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and Paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 6 North Terrace The Stennack St Ives TR26 1QL
Description: Car parking space to front garden, with permeable paved surface
RefusalReasons: 1 It has not been demonstrated that the site is able to provide sufficient manoeuvring space off road, to allow vehicles to turn with ease in order to exit the site in forward gear or to be able to provide the visibility splays neccessary to make the access safe. This is likely to result in vehicles reversing direct onto the Class B road to the detriment of highway safety. Accordingly the proposal would conflict with policies 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 2 By the removal of a strong, traditional, non-designated heritage asset, a prominent feature of North Terrace to allow the creation of a modern parking space, the proposed works fail to maintain a distinctive character of the streetscape and would be of significant detriment to it. The further construction of new vehicular access is inappropriate, out of keeping and at odds with the locality. The proposal would have a significant detrimental impact upon a distinctive feature of the streetscape.The works would allow for significant degradation of a non-designated heritage asset and are considered to raise design concerns that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); the aims and intentions of Policies GD1 and BE1 of the St.Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan, and paragraphs 124, 127, 130 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land East Of Pembroath Farm Trembroath Stithians Cornwall TR3 7DT
Description: Permission in Principle for construction of a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 Although the application site is situated amongst a concentration of buildings, they are irregularly orientated in a straggled pattern, separated by gaps and access tracks which gives a sense of permeability between the buildings and surrounding fields. As such, Trembroath is not considered to have a clear form and shape, nor definable boundaries; instead, it reads as evolved farmsteads intrinsically linked to the countryside. Therefore, regardless of the level of access to services and facilities in nearby Stithians, Trembroath is not considered to be a settlement under the terms of Policy 3(3) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (CLP). Furthermore, the proposal would not comply with any of the exceptions for new residential development in the open countryside, set out in Policy 7 of the CLP. As such, the proposal is considered to constitute unjustified residential development in the open countryside. 2 The application site falls within the Zone of Influence of the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation (SAC), and it is considered that the proposal would, when considered in combination with other plans and projects, adversely affect the integrity of the SAC without the ability to mitigate. Consequently, the proposal would represent Habitats Development for which permission in principle cannot be granted. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land Adjacent 1 Woodland Court Truro Cornwall
Description: Construction of 3-bedroomed house with off-road parking and garden amenity area
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling would, by virtue of its scale, design and materials as well as siting, fail to integrate with Woodland Court and due to the scale and close proximity to the footway at Tremorvah Wood Lane would have an overbearing impact on part of Tremorvah Wood Lane and an adverse dominant presence within the streetscene to the detriment of the character of both Tremorvah Wood Lane and Woodland Court. The proposal conflicts with Cornwall Local Plan Policy 12 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The proposal would result in the partial demolition of a boundary wall which is a non-designated heritage asset of local significance to the Grade 2* listed Alverton Manor, the loss of part of the wall will have a negative impact on the evidential and social value of the wall and will detract from the streetscene as the wall forms an attractive feature at the entrance to Woodland Court. The proposal thus conflicts with Cornwall Local Plan policy 24 and paragraph 192(a) of the National Planning Policy Framework. 3 The proposed obscure glazed bay window at the north -west elevation will by virtue of its proximity to the boundary with dwellings at Monterey Gardens and their rear windows have detrimental impact on residential amenity through the perception of overlooking and through the poor standard of accommodation in terms of outlook and lack of natural lighting for the occupant of the bedroom. The proposal thus conflicts with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 127(f) of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land West Of Chenhale Farm Chenhale Carharrack Cornwall TR16 5RB
Description: Erection of four new dwellings.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in the loss of a relatively large parcel of land occupied by redundant stable buildings associated with a well-established equestrian centre. The redevelopment of the land for housing is likely to result in the future pressure to develop the adjoining area of open countryside to the north-east, which is borne out by the unauthorised erection of a new stables and planning application to further expand the business currently under consideration by the Local Planning Authority. The application fails to demonstrate that the loss of this site for equestrian and other associated uses would not result in an adverse impact on the existing business and give rise to further pressure to development the open area to the north-east. While also putting pressure on the development of the open countryside, the scheme itself would result in an adverse impact to the character of the area by reason of its poor layout, finish and landscaping, including the loss of the existing Cornish hedge boundary. As a whole, the development would fail to create the conditions in which the existing business can expand and adapt without harming the character and appearance of adjoining open countryside and would fail to promote local distinctiveness and preserve the existing landscape qualities. The proposed development therefore results in conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 5, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 81, 84, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The alignment of the boundary hedge to the west of the proposed access precludes forward visibility of the access for approaching vehicles, and the emerging visibility from the access onto the highway is inadequate taking into account the speeds of passing vehicles. In the absence of sufficient visibility splays provided at the access to the site, the proposal fails to demonstrate that safe and suitable access to the site can be achieved for all users and would result in an unacceptable impact on highway safety. The proposal is therefore contrary to policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The reason for refusal on the grounds of highway safety is in accordance with paragraph 111 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Cornwall Council Public Conveniences Callington Road Saltash Cornwall PL12 6LW
Description: Construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling would, as a result of the small size and enclosed nature of the proposed private amenity space, provide an unsuitable garden space which would have limited usability for future occupants, no outlook and would fail to provide a pleasant space for the enjoyment of the dwelling. The unsuitable external amenity space, combined with the lack of outlook and natural light internally to the west elevation of the ground floor of the dwelling would result in poor quality living accommodation contrary to Policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and section 5.5 of the Cornwall Council Design Guide March 2013.

Address: Vogue Farm Pink Moors St Day TR16 5NL
Description: Outline Planning Permission for Construction of Self Build Dwelling for Family Member
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the definable limits of the established settlement of St Day and does not represent an acceptable form of infill or rounding off, as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. The development therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic extension of the built form into the adjoining countryside, which would lead to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land North Of Merrymeeting Farm Tresarrett Blisland Cornwall PL30 4QH
Description: Erection of a Para 79(e) dwelling (re-submission of Application No. PA20/00297)
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the open countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement. The introduction of a new home, by reason of its design and character, onto an undeveloped grassed field will harm the distinctive natural beauty and character of the site and its setting.  The identified harm would not contribute to the conservation and enhancement of the Areas of Great Landscape Value and nor would it reinforce the visions and objectives of the Bodmin Moor Landscape Character Area. The proposed new home would also introduce residential accommodation at a location with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. In the absence of special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 80, 104, 112, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South West Of Newham House Newham Lane Newham Cornwall TR13 0SA
Description: Construction of two new dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposed results in the provision of two new dwellings outside of any established settlement, in an unsustainable, inaccessible location in the open countryside, which would promote an associated over-reliance by occupiers on a private vehicle, and for which no special justification has been presented. The proposed residential structures and associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context, particularly taking into account the form and finish which more accurately reflects and urban rather than rural environment, fails to conserve or enhance the immediate setting; conversely leading to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 80 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of The Firs The Saltings Lelant Cornwall TR26 3DW
Description: Permission in Principle for construction of one dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is read as part of the formal garden area lying to the east of the Firs and is considered an important element in the setting of that property and those neighbouring properties immediately adjacent to it. The existing building line lies to the west of the site and clearly defines the boundary of the built form at this edge of settlement location. The subdivision of the garden and its development for new residential purposes would represent an undesirable eastwards extension of the built form that would unbalance the symmetry of the existing pattern of development in the immediate locality to the detriment of local distinctiveness and sense of place.  Furthermore, the site is very prominent when viewed from the public domain to the east and its development would introduce a discordant element in the landscape that would be harmful to the character and visual amenities of the area. The proposal as such fails to accord with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030), with policies GD1, BE13 and BE17 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan (2015-2030) and with paragraphs 8 (c) and 127 of the NPPF (2019).

Address: Land East Of Ellen Close Ellen Close Mount Hawke Truro Cornwall TR4 8TX
Description: To replace an existing building used for business operations with a work/live unit within the site of the growing gardens.
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposed results in the provision of a new residential unit outside of the definable boundaries of an established settlement and therefore in the open countryside. The site is not well-related to the existing built form and cannot be considered an appropriate form of infill or rounding off due to the pattern of adjacent development, and further does not constitute previously developed land. Given the above, the development represents an undesirable expansion of the built form into the open countryside, which leads to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment and unsustainable development. Notwithstanding the proposal seeking a live/work unit, the benefits of the scheme are not considered to outweigh the conflict with development plan policy directing the provision of new residential accommodation. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies 1, 7, 10 and 14 of the St Agnes Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trekennick House Road From Junction North Of Hurden To Junction North East Of Penhallow Manor Hotel Altarnun Launceston PL15 7SL
Description: Conversion of former Barn to dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works are considered to go beyond a conversion and represent a fresh build that is not considered suitable for conversion or appropriate to retain; and the introduction of a residential use would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate setting which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and without any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Land North West Of Cleswyth (Wheelwrights Plot) The Old Sawpits Langore Road St Stephens Launceston PL15 8LD
Description: New dwelling (further to extant approval PA19/05869).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would not be of an appropriate scale, height and mass with a clear understanding and response to its townscape, or promote local distinctiveness; contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016) and Policy 6 of the adopted St Stephen By Launceston Rural Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018-2030.

Address: Land South Of Linton Rise Summercourt Cornwall TR8 5AE
Description: Permission in Principle for construction of one dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not considered to be at or well related to Summercourt. The site is unmistakably rural and is considered to be in the countryside and is not considered to represent previously developed land. The proposal would result in unjustified residential development in the countryside, which would be largely dependent on the private vehicle due to its unsustainable location and poor connectivity. The introduction of unjustified residential development in the countryside would harm the character and appearance of the area conflicting with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and policies H2, H3 and H4 of of the St. Enoder Neighbourhood Plan and paragraphs 8 and 170 of the NPPF (2019) which seeks, amongst other things, to maintain the distinctive natural character of the countryside. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of financial contributions for mitigation for the Penhale Special Area of Conservation and the Fal and Helford Special Area of Conservation for which there is evidence of an identified need, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan

Address: Land South Of The Shippen Downgate Callington Cornwall PL17 8JX
Description: Erection of agricultural storage building with associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed building and its large scale within a small parcel of verdant land is not considered to be reasonably necessary for the purposes of agriculture; and will not maintain and respect the special character of the rural Cornish landscape; contrary to Policies 2 (1), 5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: 26 Pydar Close Newquay Cornwall TR7 3BS
Description: Full application for proposed first floor extension to existing dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its excessive scale, visual prominence and dominant architectural form, the proposal is incongruous in relation to the host property and causes unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the wider area. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies D1(2.), D2, H1 and G2(c.), paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Field House Lanteglos Camelford Cornwall PL32 9RF
Description: Permission in Principle for the erection of up to two dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development as a result of the location of the site would represent unjustified and sporadic housing in the open countryside which would not be well related to an existing settlement.  The site is not allocated for residential development via Site Allocations of the Camelford Neighbourhood Plan and does not represent infill or rounding off development. The proposal does not comprise use of previously developed land, would not represent infill or rounding off and does not fall within the special circumstances listed within Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan. The proposal would increase building density which would be out of character with the surrounding area and would have a detrimental impact upon the intrinsic rural character of the area. The proposal is not sited within Camelford Development Boundary as set out within the Camelford NDP. The proposal would therefore be contrary to Policies 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Policy 1 of the Camelford NDP.

Address: Land South Of Anneth Cor-Yn Trelash Warbstow Launceston Cornwall PL15 8RL
Description: Permission in Principle for up to five new dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings, by reason of their location outside of any defined settlement, do not round off or infill a settlement and visually extends the built form into the countryside eroding the character and appearance of this part of the area. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Land North Of Southview Perrancoombe Perranporth Cornwall
Description: Outline permission for new access and entrance road together with up to five detached dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The site by virtue of its scale, context of narrow lanes and hedgerow boundaries is rural in character and visually distinct from the adjacent dwellings of Perrancoombe which in combination with the rural character of the settlement results in the site having a greater affinity with the open countryside and thus does not result in the infill, or rounding off of a settlement. The proposal would thus fail to accord with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and in the absence of any accordance with the exceptions set out at Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 also conflicts with Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030.

Address: Post Office 2 The Quay Portscatho TR2 5HF
Description: Change of use of ground floor from retail to residential, and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would result in the loss of commercial space in a prime waterfront location within this rural settlement, reducing the stock of suitable facilities available to local businesses to the detriment of the economic and social vitality of Portscatho. The proposal therefore fails to accord with policy GP1 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 and policies 1 and 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: The Quarry Leat Road Boscaswell Downs Pendeen Cornwall
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use: Storage (Use Class B8)
RefusalReasons: Based on the documentation provided in support of the application and having regard to other information available to the authority, the Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the onus of proof for the Applicant to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land known as 'The Quarry', Leat Road, Boscaswell Downs, Pendeen (as shown marked in red on the Site Location Plan received 25 February 2021) has been used for a B8 storage use for a continuous period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application being received. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: 2 Eliot Road Truro Cornwall TR1 3TQ
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for subdivision of garden to form a building plot
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling would not integrate with the layout of the roads spurring off Hendra Road and would result in an uncharacteristic layout and density and would fail to provide continuity for the development on Carlyon Road. The proposal is thus contrary to Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed dwelling, whether in two storey or single storey form, would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the residential amenities of the occupants of neighbouring dwellings in terms of overlooking, overbearing, overshadowing and creating an adverse sense of enclosure. The proposal is thus contrary Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and the aims at paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, the proposal would also fail to meet the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood development Plan requirement at E4 to add to the character of the area.

Address: Land Off Trewiston Lane St Minver Wadebridge Cornwall
Description: Self Build Moderately Priced Local Residence
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is contained within SDA1 of the St Minver NDP which requires housing development be delivered as an affordable led exception site. The dwelling proposed in this application is neither affordable or part of a wider affordable led housing scheme. Whilst the delivery of housing (including that this would be a self-build unit) is given positive weight in the planning balance and other economic benefits would result, the proposal fails to accord with the strategy for the delivery of housing in the development plan and does not amount to sustainable development. Accordingly the proposal fails to represent sustainable development and conflicts with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and policies STMNDP 2.2, 3.2 and 3.4 of the St Minver Parishes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030.

Address: Aurigny Trewartha Veryan Truro Cornwall TR2 5QJ
Description: Replacement dwelling and replacement garage.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed replacement dwelling by reason of the height and massing associated with the enlarged part two-storey form, would represent a significant visual intrusion in this rural fringe context of the existing small hamlet settlement, harmful to the established landscape character of this section of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, contrary to Policies 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies LA1, CV1, GP1, GP2 and HO8 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030, Policy MD16 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021 and Paragraphs 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed replacement dwelling, with the adoption of a large, part two-story form in close proximity to the boundary with the neighbouring dwelling, would represent a dominating and overbearing form of development that would be harmful to the established residential amenities of neighbouring dwellings, contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy CV1 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030, Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 4.11 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013.

Address: Pebble Cottage Rosevine Portscatho Truro Cornwall TR2 5EN
Description: Demolition of existing residential dwelling and construction of replacement dwelling and external landscaping works
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is within a Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty for which great weight should be given to preserving and enhancing the landscape and its scenic beauty. The proposed development by virtue of its scale will become a prominent feature which in itself and in cumulation with existing neighbouring large scale dwellings will have a harmful impact on the natural beauty of the landscape. The proposal thus is contrary to Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 policies 7 and 23, Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan policies, LA1. LA2 and HO8 and paragraph 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land West Of 14 Victoria Victoria Lostwithiel PL22 0AX
Description: Proposed construction of a detached dwelling and the formation of a vehicular access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling, by reason of its siting, design, materials, external appearance, fenestration, massing and height, would replace an existing open space with an unduly dominant building within the street scene to the detriment of the character of the surrounding Conservation Area. The proposal would also result in the loss of part of the existing stone boundary wall fronting the site, to the detriment of the Conservation Area. The public benefits of the proposal do not outweigh the identified harm to the Conservation Area and the application is contrary to Policies 2, 12, 21 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan; Policy EN2 of the Lostwithiel Neighbourhood Plan; and paragraphs 130, 199, 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: The Log Cabin 4 Nanpusker Road Angarrack TR27 5JX
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use as a residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The applicant contends that the property known as 'The Log Cabin' 4 Nanpusker Road Angarrack Hayle TR27 5JX has been used for residential purposes since its construction in 2012. As such, a Certificate of Lawfulness for Existing Use cannot be issued as it fails to accord with the provisions of section 171B (3) of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990, in that it has not been utilised as a self-contained, permanent dwelling for a period in excess of 10 years.

Address: Land West Of Dobwalls Primary School Dobwalls Cornwall PL14 4LU
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for an affordable housing led, rural exceptions development of up to to 24 units, to include new access (for determination), parking and associated infrastructure
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed residential development of the site would result in the urbanisationof undeveloped agricultural land that comprises the best and most versatile land,thereby reducing the existing and/or potential economic and food productionproductivity associated with the land, whilst resulting in the encroachment ofbuilt form into undeveloped countryside, harming the natural character andbeauty of the area. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies1, 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision of affordable housing; onsite and off-site public open space contributions; off-site financial contributions towards educational and health care infrastructure; and biodiversity net gain, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 9, 12, 13, 16, 23, 25 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Cornwall Council Guidance on S106 Planning Obligations for Education Provision 2018.

Address: The Stables Greenbottom Truro TR4 8QN
Description: The construction of a single dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling is located within the countryside and does not represent infill or the rounding off of a settlement and does not meet the definition of Previously Developed Land referred to in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. The proposal would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding its intrinsic character. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposed dwelling represents a sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and paragraphs 79 and 170(b) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 Due to the constrained emerging visibility onto the C723 and the lack of deliverable visibility splays safe and suitable access to the development for all people is therefore not provided and the application is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 The site lies within a Critical Drainage Area, insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate that the proposed development will not increase flood risk within the site or elsewhere. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy E2 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan, Policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Barns At The Grouses Sithney Helston Cornwall TR13 0AF
Description: New detached dwelling to replace existing barn that benefits from permitted development right to convert to a dwelling with planning reference: PA20/07275
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development represents the construction of a dwelling in the open countryside outside of any settlement. The proposed dwelling by reason of the loss of the traditional stone built building and by reason of its proposed scale and design will comprise a form of development that will not be an appropriate scale and character to their location in conflict with policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The development would erode the rural character and would not conserve the local landscape, such that it represents an unsustainable form of development in the open countryside. The proposal is therefore contrary to paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies 1,2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Upper Deck Fore Street Kingsand PL10 1NA
Description: Replacement of 6 painted soft wood timber sash windows (painted matt black externally) with Heritage grade timber alternative upvc vertical sliding sash windows.
RefusalReasons: 1 The Local Planning Authority has acted positively and proactively in determining this application by identifying matters of concern with this proposal. On this occasion, the issues are so fundamental that it is not possible to negotiate a satisfactory way forward due to the harm that has been clearly identified within the reason(s) for refusal. 2 This installation of UPVC windows, by reason of their material, appearance and form would result in harmful impact to the character and appearance of the designated Conservation Area. This harm is considered to be less than substantial, but is not outweighed by any public benefit. The proposed works would therefore be contrary to the Council's duty as local planning authority under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted November 2016) and Government policy in paragraphs 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Gwel Teg 47 Laflouder Fields Mullion TR12 7EJ
Description: Change of use from office to ancillary accommodation and occasional holiday let
RefusalReasons: 1 The development results in a new unit of residential accommodation on the boundaries of the existing site in close proximity to neighbouring units. The effect will be an expected increase in the intensity of the use of the site, with increased numbers utilising the existing space and by extent resulting in increased levels of noise and disturbance to neighbouring occupiers. The development is therefore contrary to policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Agricultural Shed At Tideford Cross Cornwall
Description: Outline application for construction of two dwellings and associated works with all matters reserved (Resubmission of PA20/08555)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its location outside of any land considered to form the settlement of Tideford Cross, does not represent infill or rounding-off, nor does it make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement, and would visually extend residential built form into the countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development in the countryside leading to harmful incremental growth of the settlement, and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016). 2 In the absence of a suitable Phase 1 Land Contamination Report which properly determines and evaluates the existence or otherwise of contamination, its nature and extent, and the risks it may pose to receptors, it has not been possible to conclude that the proposal would not result in harm to future occupants or the natural environment. As such it cannot be confirmed the proposal could be made safe and the proposal conflicts with policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Land At Harewood Lodge Eric Road Calstock PL18 9SQ
Description: The proposed demolition of the greenhouse and storage building, the erection of a detached dwelling and ancillary works
RefusalReasons: 1 As a consequence of the significant weight now given to Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan and the application site now being located outside of the re-introduced village Development Boundary, the proposed development is rendered unacceptable in principle, expanding the built form of the village into the open countryside, beyond the established development limit, harming the appearance and character of the surrounding landscape through visual and domestication impacts, contrary to the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies HP1(1), HP1(3) and LA1 of the Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030.

Address: Land Rear Of Rose Cottage North Road Goldsithney Cornwall TR20 9JY
Description: Detached two storey dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling by virtue of its gable-end facing the roadside, the site layout with the dwelling being set-back from the existing built form and the eaves and ridge heights would result in a dwelling that would appear incongruous within its setting, disrupting the uniform layout and key characteristics of the established building line along the western front of North Road. Furthermore, due to the scale and site layout, the proposal would result in unacceptable overbearing and overshadowing impacts upon the south facing windows of the neighbouring dwelling known as Penney Cottage, 3 North Road. It does not demonstrate a cultural, physical and aesthetic understanding of its location and does not preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the area which is designated as being within the Goldsithney Conservation Area and the Tregonning and Gwinear Mining Districts World Heritage Site. The proposed development would harm the character and appearance of the surrounding area and the modest contribution to the housing stock and small economic gain through the construction of the dwelling are not considered benefits that outweigh this identified harm with particular regard to paragraph 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development fails to preserve and enhance the character and appearance of the Goldsithney Conservation Area and the Tregonning and Gwinear Mining Districts World Heritage Site and would give rise to residential amenity harm in conflict with the aims and intentions set out within policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and paragraphs 8, 130, 134 and section 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The application is for a two-bed dwelling with an absence of adequate parking provisions. Given that the location of the settlement is such that sustainable transport options are infrequent, and residents would be reliant on private motor vehicles to access service and facilities. The absence of adequate parking would lead to the exacerbation of existing on-street parking issues in the locale of the site and is against the aims contained within Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan. As a result, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and would be contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and sections 2, 8 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 (NPPF).

Address: Injustice Whitstone Holsworthy Cornwall EX22 6TZ
Description: Proposed new semi-detached dwellings following demolition of existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise; including whether adequate visibility splays can be provided, and whether parking and turning can be provided on the site to enable vehicles to enter and exit in a forward gear, a safe and suitable access to the development has not been demonstrated and the application is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 2 In the absence of full information relating to domestic wind turbines on the site it has not been demonstrated that there would be no neighbour impact from noise or disturbance and the application is contrary to Policy 12 (2) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030

Address: The Queens Arms Inn, Land South Of The Queens Arms St Aubyns Square Breage TR13 9PD
Description: Erection of 2 x detached dwellings and creation of new vehicular accesses
RefusalReasons: 1 The siting of two dwellings on this parcel of land by virtue of their proposed siting, design with large areas of glazing and balconies would be excessively prominent in the immediate and wider setting of the Conservation Area and World Heritage Site and would lead to the adverse impact on an element of the Conservation Area which makes a significant positive contribution to the Breage Conservation Area; through being an open area at the centre of the village which also forms part of the setting of the nearby Grade I Listed Church, the conservation of which should be afforded great weight. The proposal would have substantial harm upon the designated heritage assets and this harm is not outweighed by the limited benefits of 2 new dwellings.The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Sections 66 (1) and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 8, 130, 189, 195, 197, 199, 200, 201, 202, 206 and 207 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021; and guidance contained in section 6 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020-2025, the Breage Conservation Area Appraisal & Management Strategy ¿ 2010, sections 66 and 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 3, The Setting of Heritage Assets (2nd Edition).

Address: Edgemoor Enniscaven St Dennis St Austell Cornwall PL26 8DE
Description: Lawful development certificate for existing use of land as a small touring campsite
RefusalReasons: 1 The applicant has not discharged their onus of proof, to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land at Edgemoor, Enniscaven, St Dennis (operating at Goss Moor Touring and Camping) as shown outlined in red on the Site Location Plan '01' submitted to the Council on 15th February 2021 has been used as a caravan and camping site for holiday purposes incorporating five gravelled pitches for campervans, motorhomes or caravans and a large field for up to 20 tents, continuously in excess of 10 years preceding the date of this application.  In view of this, it is recommended that the Lawful Development Certificate should not be granted.
