Address: Land East Of Tresco Helston Water Bissoe Truro Cornwall TR4 8TD
Description: Demolition of existing abandoned dwelling, replaced with new dwelling and double garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposed results in the provision of a new dwelling outside of any established settlement, in an unsustainable, inaccessible location in the open countryside, which would promote an associated over-reliance by occupiers on a private vehicle, and for which no special justification has been presented. The proposed residential structure and associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context fail to conserve or enhance the immediate setting, conversely leading to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Barn Penpol Farm Penpol Hill Penpol Crantock Cornwall TR8 5RL
Description: Demolition of barn and erection of dwelling (replacing barn conversion under Part Q decision PA20/10482)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal by reason of its scale, design and domestic appearance would erode the rural character and appearance of this part of the countryside resulting in harmful development within an Area of Great Landscape Value. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and policies H1 and PV1 of the Crantock Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Land East Of Cherrymeadow Mousehole Lane Paul Penzance Cornwall TR19 6TY
Description: Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved: Construction of Residential Dwelling and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is outside the physical boundaries of any established settlement and is therefore situated within the open countryside as defined under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposed development would introduce new development into the open countryside for which there are no special circumstances for justification. The proposed dwelling and associated domestic paraphernalia would neither conserve nor enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. In addition, in the absence of a Flood Risk Assessment, it has not been demonstrated that this location for residential development is appropriate with regards to flooding. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 23 and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 155, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Quarry Farm Kerley Chacewater Cornwall
Description: Conversion of existing former water storage building to a residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed re-use of the water tower for residential development with associated domestic curtilage, would result in harm to the rural and historic character of the surrounding area, which is within the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site. The subject building is not considered appropriate to retain, and the development will not enhance the setting; conversely resulting in adverse impacts to the visual amenities of the rural setting and the character of the historic landscape. The development therefore fails to comply with policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies BIO1, HE1, HE2, LGOS1, LGOS5 and QD1 of the Chacewater Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, paragraphs 79, 127, 170, 184, 192, 193, 194, 196, 200 and 201 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Sennen Rise Mayon Farm Sennen Penzance Cornwall TR19 7AD
Description: Construction of two holiday units in the garden
RefusalReasons: 1 Mayon Farm is considered a farmstead intrinsically linked to the countryside and not a settlement. The proposal does not represent rounding off under Policy 3 of the Cornwall local Plan but, rather, would result in the undesirable extension and intrusion of residential development into the countryside that would be prominent to the detriment to the distinctive natural beauty and character of the surrounding semi-rural countryside.  The proposed development would not be in a sustainable location, having particular regard to the lack of accessibility to services and facilities available locally. The application fails to demonstrate that the provision and expansion of tourist and visitor facilities cannot be met by existing facilities in rural service centres such as Sennen Cove which provide existing services and community facilities. The combination of the separation distance from Sennen Cove, together with the topography that leads into and out of Sennen Cove, would give rise to dependence on the private motor vehicle in terms of accessing facilities and services. As such the proposal would not represent sustainable rural tourism. The proposal does not represent an appropriate location for holiday accommodation and as such would be contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 83 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal would result in the undesirable extension and intrusion of built form into the countryside that would be prominent to the detriment to the distinctive natural beauty and character of the surrounding semi-rural countryside. For the above reasons, the proposal would have an adverse visual impact on the character of the area and would be contrary to policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: Land At Little Upton Farm Upton Cross Cornwall
Description: Variation of conditions 5 and 6 of decision PA17/04850 dated 25/06/2018 Housing development of six dwellings, including three affordable, with associated access and parking.
RefusalReasons: 1 The loss of the proposed footway secured under condition 5 of application PA17/04850 would result in a demonstrably worse development than that which was approved, leaving the development to be functionally detached and poorly related to the services and facilities of Upton Cross. This would result in occupants accessing Upton Cross via unsafe, unsuitable and dangerous alternative routes. The proposal would therefore fail to provide safe and suitable access, contrary to policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Higher Tynes Farm Access To Higher Tynes Farm St Teath Bodmin PL30 3LR
Description: Change of use of part of agricultural field to form campsite and erection of ancillary toilet block
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed change of use of the site to a campsite by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposed development with its conspicuously uncharacteristic form detracting from the open agricultural landscape fails to respond to the primary purpose of the AONB and would be harmful to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside and would neither conserve or enhance the area which is designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Heritage coast. The proposal would also cause harm through noise and disturbance to neighbouring properties by reason of its close proximity. The development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 5, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 84, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policies MD5, MD 6 and MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021

Address: Ennis Vale Sancreed Penzance Cornwall TR20 8QP
Description: Replacement of existing double garage with new residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is outside the physical boundaries of any established settlement and is therefore situated within the open countryside as defined under paragraph 2.33 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposed development would introduce a new unrestricted residential dwelling into the open countryside for which there are no special circumstances for justification. The dwelling would not be in a sustainable location, having particular regard to the lack of accessibility to services and facilities available locally and would give rise to dependence of future occupants on the private motor vehicle in terms of accessing such services and facilities. The proposed development would create a significantly larger and more substantial building with a greater physical presence within this sensitive location. The proposed increase in height and mass would result in a significantly more dominant structure on the edge of the highway within the open countryside. The proposed increase in the urban form would neither conserve nor enhance the AONB, Heritage Coast or Area of Great Landscape Value. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Pengersick House Pengersick Lane Praa Sands Penzance Cornwall TR20 9SJ
Description: Proposed dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 Taking into account the density and layout of surrounding residential properties, the proposal will appear as a cramped form of accommodation which fails to respect the pattern of existing development in the locality. This impact is enhanced by the siting and scale of the proposal where it will appear as a prominent, conspicuous addition to the setting, negatively impacting upon the character of the area, which is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The development therefore conflicts with policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016 - 2021.

Address: Land North Of Mole Hill Farm Woodhill St Gluvias Penryn Cornwall TR10 9AE
Description: Change of use from agricultural land to campsite with erection of 2no. sheds to house water treatment system and shower/toilet facilities, siting of a storage container and associated tracks/hardstandings and drainage works
RefusalReasons: 1 Whilst the proposed development would support the local tourism economy and is not considered to give rise to an adverse landscape and visual impact, these positive aspects are considered to be diminished by the poor accessibility of the site other than by private vehicle and the adverse impact which caravans and larger motorhomes could have upon the local highway network leading to and from the application site. The proposal is therefore considered to fail to provide a well-balanced mix of economic, social and environmental benefits, and to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 5 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 84 and 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: 1 And 2 Sea View Cottages Oates Road Marazion Cornwall TR17 0AN
Description: Change of use from 2 dwellings in to 1 single dwelling, construction of single storey extension with roof terrace, insertion of conservation rooflights, construction of external garden wall and gate to North, removal of hard paved area surface to form soft planted area.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal by reason of its scale, form, design and use of materials fail to respond positively to the character of the existing building and the special character and appearance of surrounding Conservation Area. The proposal is also considered to result in unacceptable overlooking impacts, upon the neighbouring dwelling known as 3 St Michaels Reach through the installation of the roof terrace above the extension due to its scale and proximity to the neighbouring boundary. As a result, the proposal is considered to constitute a poor-quality form of development which would fail to conserve or enhance the Marazion Conservation Area, the character of the building which is considered a non-designated heritage asset, and would cause unacceptable residential amenity impacts contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 134 and Sections 15 and 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Clifden Polurrian Cliffs Mullion TR12 7EW
Description: Proposed Demolition of Existing Dwelling and Erection of 2 Dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of occupying an exposed and prominent position in the local landscape which by reason of the proposed massing, height and design of the proposed dwellings it is considered to neither conserve nor enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, nor take into account the sensitivity and capacity of the landscape asset. The proposal is therefore considered harmful to the appearance and character of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and it does not promote or reinforce local distinctiveness. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019; and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016 - 2021.

Address: Brannel Cottage Access To Brannel Cottage Coombe St Austell PL26 7LG
Description: Two new plots with one dwelling on each plot
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site lies in the open countryside outside the settlement of Coombe and would not represent infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030.  The proposal would physically extend the built envelope of the nearby settlement into the adjoining countryside to the detriment of the landscape character, where the development would reduce the relatively green gap between the site and the nearby hamlet of Coombe harming the landscape setting of the settlement, representing an intrusion into the undeveloped countryside. In the absence of any functional need or any other special circumstances to justify the development as a whole  in this context, the application is not considered to represent sustainable development and would be contrary to the guidance contained in Paragraphs 8, 11, 78 and 79 and Sections 5, 12 and 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policies 3 (3), 7 (4 and 5), 21(a,b,c,) and 23(2,) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and guidance contained within the Cornwall Design Guide 2013. 2 In the absence of appropriate evidence, the proposal fails to adequately demonstrate how the development would impact upon any species protected by law both during and post implementation of the proposed scheme. In the absence of such information the Local Planning Authority is unable to assess whether adverse harm would be generated with respect to any protected species and hence the development is contrary to the aims of paragraph 175 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, guidance within the section titled 'Natural environment' of Planning Practice Guidance, together with Policies 22 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Natural England and DEFRA - Protected Species: How to review planning applications 2016 and the Fal and Helford SAC.

Address: Land At Comfort Wartha Constantine Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5AZ
Description: Revocation of Section 52 Agreement in respect of decision W2/84/00297/0 - 28/08/85 for construction of 8 dwellings
RefusalReasons: The Section 52 Agreement still serves a useful purpose in protecting against the loss of an area of public open space which has not been demonstrated to be surplus to requirements. As such the retention of the Agreement would meet the tests set out under paragraph 56 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. Furthermore, the proposal is contrary to Policies 13, 16 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 97 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Pt Os 4647 Frogwell Road Callington Cornwall
Description: Siting of a temporary (three years) caravan and building to house dog daycare and boarding facility including septic tank and relevant services and change of use of the land to allow for a secure dog paddock for hire
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of the necessary robust special justification with regards to the essential functional need for a presence on the site and the lack of compelling evidence in respect of the need and viability for the proposed business that such dwelling would serve, the proposal, in seeking the creation of a new dwelling (albeit temporary) in an isolated rural location outside of any clearly defined settlement would fail to accord with the Council's spatial strategy for the delivery of housing. As such it would be an unsustainable form of development which would erode intrinsic undeveloped nature of the countryside, in conflict with Policies 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 60 Boscathnoe Way Heamoor TR18 3JS
Description: Demolition of existing single storey domestic extension and replacement with one new dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within a residential estate that has a strong, prevalent character. The estate has a spacious and open appearance which has arisen from a generous layout and low density with dwellings being served with front and rear gardens. The proposed development would be at odds with the established character and appearance of the estate and would fail to respect its form and traditional pattern of development. The proposed development is considered an intrusive and overbearing form of development which would result in harm to visual and residential amenity by reason of its cramped and contrived form. The standard of living space and private amenity space that could be provided within this constricted site would be poor. In addition the proximity of the windows on the eastern elevation as indicated on drawing no J80711 to the rear garden of number 60 would result in unacceptable overlooking of the host dwelling. As such, the site is not considered suitable for residential development. The proposed development fails to comply with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed access is located in the inner curve of a bend in the carriageway with 20m visibility splays identified emerging to the right in the direction of oncoming vehicles. The visibility splay would only apply should a vehicle reverse into the space and exit in a forward gear something that cannot be controlled as part of this planning application. A radar class speed survey adjacent to the access on the carriageway recorded 85th% speeds of 21mph southbound, equivalent visibility splays of 26m. Based on the lack of control over exiting the access in a forward gear and the substandard visibility splay the proposal is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Tregerles Farm Road From Tregerles Farm To Junction South Of Tredinnick Farm Cottage Mitchell TR8 4PW
Description: Conversion of remainder of agricultural building into two houses. One part has permission already.
RefusalReasons: 1 The building, by reason of its design, construction and extent of works required, is not appropriate to retain and its conversion to residential use would not lead to an enhancement to its immediate setting. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 8, 9, 78, 127, and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Truscott Reservior Trewithick Lane Egloskerry Launceston Cornwall
Description: Conversion and extension of existing water reservoir to a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling, by reason of its scale and design in an exposed countryside location within the setting of an Area of Great Landscape Value, will create visually harmful built form, eroding the character and appearance of this part of the countryside. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and Policies 2, 6 and 8 of the adopted St Stephens by Launceston Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Higher Kenneggy Farm Higher Kenneggy Rosudgeon TR20 9AU
Description: Conversion of barn into a residential family home
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposed will significantly alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of the subject barn and associated land which, at present, clearly relates to this rural landscape. The building is not considered to be a suitably constructed, redundant, rural building which would be considered appropriate to retain, and its conversion to residential use would clearly not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting on a site which is visible from the nearby rural highway. The addition of new openings and further domestic paraphernalia on associated land will fundamentally alter the perception of the building in the setting, such that it will be recognised as an incongruous residential form which will harm the strong, rural characteristics of this landscape of high scenic beauty, further detracting from the character and appearance of the traditional residential dwellings and conversion schemes in the vicinity. Given the inappropriate and unsustainable form of new housing development in the countryside, the proposed development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty in this location. As such, it conflicts with policies 2, 7, 12, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 79, 103, 127, 130, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies MD9 and SCW8.04 in the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 In the absence of an adequate ecological survey, the application fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance biodiversity and avoid impact to protected species. As such, this proposal is contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the aims and intentions of paragraphs and 170 and 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 In the absence of a suitable Phase 1 Land Contamination Report which properly determines and evaluates the existence or otherwise of contamination, its nature and extent, and the risks it may pose to receptors, it has not been possible to conclude that the proposal would not result in harm to future occupants or the natural environment. As such it cannot be confirmed the proposal could be made safe and the proposal conflicts with policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 178 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land And Building South Of Hillcrest Church Coombe Redruth Cornwall TR16 6RT
Description: Restoration of derelict dwelling to form new one bedroom property and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the substantial rebuilding and structural operations required to convert the ruinous remains, would go far beyond the re-use and conversion of an existing building, being tantamount to a new build in the open countryside.  Unsupported by any special circumstances, the provision of a new dwelling in this location represents an undesirable and sporadic form of unsustainable development which would harmfully domesticate the distinctive rural landscape character. The site is subject to special protection through its designation within the Camborne and Redruth Mining District World Heritage Site, and the remains of the existing structure are an attribute of the heritage asset. The works, which go far beyond consolidation, would result in harm to the authenticity of the attribute, leading to harm to the Outstanding Universal Value of the World Heritage Site. The resulting harm to the authenticity and integrity of the Outstanding Universal Value of the World Heritage Site would not be wholly exceptional nor would there be any overriding public benefits. In the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to policy 1 of the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan (adopted November 2019), policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 119, 130, 174, 189, 197, 199, 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policies P3, C2 and C9 of The Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020-2025. 2 The application fails to demonstrate that the site can be made suitable for its proposed use taking account of ground conditions and any risks arising from contamination without resulting in detrimental harm to the trees which form the boundary to site and, as a collective group, make a positive contribution to the landscape character. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12, 16 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 183 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Opposite Meadowside Farm Goonhavern Truro Cornwall TR4 9FD
Description: Erection of two holiday letting units and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is in a countryside location away from the settlement of Goonhavern and without a safe and convenient pedestrian access thus is considered to be in an unsustainable location that will rely on the private car for access to services. The benefits to the tourist economy do not outweigh the harm due to the unsustainable location in terms of access or the harm to the rural character of the lane through the introduction of built development and associated domestic paraphernalia. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 5, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local PL an and paragraph 170(b) of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Little Inside Farm Feock Truro Cornwall TR3 6RU
Description: Formation of three holiday pods
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of the site for three holiday letting pod units, by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities with poor accessibility by a range of transport modes, would represent unsustainable new residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal represents an unsustainable form of development that would be harmful to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside and landscape character of the locality. The development would also result in the loss of Best and Most Versatile Land. The development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies LS2, D1 and H1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030 and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Known As The Ground W Of Treen Villas Mousehole TR19 6RH
Description: Erection of a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 as the development would not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as set out within the aforementioned policy. The development of the site would diminish the green rural character edge to Mousehole which has been identified as playing a significant role in the transition between the settlement and the rural landscape beyond. The proposed development would create a more substantial building with a greater physical presence in this sensitive location and this together with the subsequent domesticating influence would fail to conserve and enhance the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and fail to preserve or enhance the character of the Mousehole Conservation Area. The proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021, Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 170, 172 and Section 16 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To 1 Railway Terrace Railway Terrace Portreath Cornwall TR16 4LD
Description: Permission in Principle for residential development of a minimum of 3 and a maximum of 5 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application will involve the provision of additional residential units on land outside of the definable limits of any established settlement. The site is not well related to the existing form of the settlement and cannot be considered an appropriate form of infill or rounding off due to the pattern of adjacent development and lack of enclosing features. Furthermore, the site does not constitute previously developed land. Given the above, the development represents an undesirable expansion of the built form into the adjoining countryside, which would lead to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment as well as failing to demonstrate an understanding of the setting. In the absence of any sufficient special circumstances which justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposal will incur harm to the setting of a grade II listed heritage asset as well as impacting upon the character and special interest of the World Heritage Site. In the absence of any heritage impact assessment to demonstrate the extent of this harm, it cannot be determined that the public benefits of the proposal are sufficient to outweigh the level of harm incurred, and furthermore cannot be confirmed that the proposal will have special regard to the desirability of preserving the setting. The application is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 127, 184, 189, 192 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the duty under Section 66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended).

Address: The Dolphins Bay Street Looe Cornwall PL13 1BZ
Description: Retention of replacement double glazed windows (previously single glazed), new front stable door (previously door with window) and new back door to replace previous stable door
RefusalReasons: 1 The retrospective application for the installation of UPVC window(s) and composite door by reason of the modern, unsympathetic design and material fails to take account of the historic context of the application site and surrounding traditional vernacular and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Looe Conservation Area, amounting to less than substantial harm, that is not outweighed by any public benefits.  The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016, the guidance within the Looe Conservation Management Plan 2009, notably section 5.1, section 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013, paragraphs 8, 124, 127, 192, 193, 194, 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Trelens B3289 Between Halvarras Road And Waterloo Plantation Penelewey Feock TR3 6QY
Description: Proposed 2 storey rear oak framed extension
RefusalReasons: 1 The rear extension, by reason of the mass, bulk, design would be overbearing by reason of its close relationship with immediate neighbouring dwellings, in particular Penelewey Cottage, and give rise to significant adverse impacts to the living conditions of its occupants and be in conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2015 - 2030. 2 The mass, bulk, design and location of the proposed development would appear prominent and uncharacteristic in form, glazing and materials especially when viewed from the category Gold Public Right of Way which immediately borders the application site, thus the proposal would be in conflict with the aims and intentions of Policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2015 - 2030).

Address: Land East Of Edmore Park Caravan Site Edgar Road Wainhouse Corner Bude Cornwall EX23 0BJ
Description: New dwelling to replace agricultural building.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling to replace the agricultural barn is in a rural location not within or adjacent to the definable urban form of the Wainhouse Corner settlement. It does not infill, round off or use previously developed land immediately adjacent to a settlement and visually extends the built form into the open countryside further eroding the intrinsic character of the wider landscape. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposed dwelling represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the open countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and paragraphs 79 and 170(b) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Methodist Church Peverell Road Porthleven Helston Cornwall TR13 9DH
Description: Construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, as a result of the contemporary form and finish, would be incompatible with the character of the streetscape, and fails to demonstrate an understanding or response to surroundings or promote local distinctiveness. Conversely, the development will result in a discordant feature causing detrimental harm to the historic setting, including the setting of the adjacent grade II listed heritage asset. There are no public benefits sufficient to outweigh this demonstrable harm. The development therefore fails to comply with policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 127, 170, 172, 184, 192 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and sections 66(1) and 72(1) of the Town and Country Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Kea Downs Business Park Three Burrows Blackwater Cornwall TR4 8HU
Description: Redevelopment of existing sawmills site and the erection of seven industrial/warehouse units - use classes B1 & B8 without compliance with condition 16 of decision PA04/0962/06/B dated 07.09.2006
RefusalReasons: 1 The removal of condition 16 would risk an unacceptable adverse impact, resulting from noise and disturbance outside of normal working hours, to the occupiers of properties adjacent to the site, including the properties known as Holly Farm and Primrose Farm. Furthermore, the expected increase in vehicular movements outside of the existing restricted hours of operation would cause additional disturbance on the public byway which enables vehicular access to the site, negatively impacting upon the character of the byway and the experience for users of said byway in the rural location. The development is therefore contrary to policies 12, 16 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies QD1 and EJ7 of the Chacewater Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 170 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Homestead Carnarthen Carn Brea Camborne Cornwall TR14 9AT
Description: Conversion of Existing Agricultural Barns To Form Dwelling & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The remains of the building, by reason of their scale, condition and appearance, would require significant reconstruction and rebuilding (as well as a small extension) in order to facilitate a residential use; without such work, it would not be capable of being converted into a habitable dwelling. Therefore, the development would constitute the erection of a new dwelling in an unsustainable location in the open countryside, for which no special justification has been presented. The proposed use with the associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context would fail to enhance the immediate setting and, as such, the special qualities and attributes of this historic rural landscape would be harmed. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 124, 127, 170, 192 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Stone House 22A Goonown Lane Goonown St Agnes TR5 0UX
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for use of land adjacent to the dwelling as garden
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate, on the balance of probability, that a material change in use of the land to a garden has occurred and that this use has continued for a period in excess of 10 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: Springfield Barn Reskivers Hill Tregony Truro TR2 5RU
Description: Conversion of existing barn into a 3 bedroom dwelling, along with constructing a 3 space car port
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the open countryside, physically and visually divorced from any settlement. The proposal results in substantial, dominating extensions to the subject building, such that the scheme cannot be described as a genuine conversion scheme but appears more akin to a new building. The scheme would markedly change the character and appearance of the rural, historic building, with the impact also enhanced through the introduction of associated domestic paraphernalia and an associated detached structure which would also be prominent on the site. The overall visual effect would be detrimental to the rural character of the setting, and creates a new home with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. Taking the above into account, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Nw Of Tranquil Cross South Drive Tehidy TR14 0EZ
Description: Outline Planning Permission with some matters reserved for a purpose built accessible dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application will involve the creation of a new residential unit on land outside of the definable limits of any established settlement. The site is not well related to the existing form of the settlement and cannot be considered an appropriate form of infill or rounding off due to the pattern of adjacent development and lack of enclosing features. Given the above, the development represents an undesirable expansion of the built form into the adjoining countryside, which would lead to visual harm through the erosion of the sylvan character and appearance of the natural environment as well as failing to demonstrate an understanding of the setting. In the absence of any sufficient special circumstances which justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1,2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies PH 1a, PH3 and PEH1 of The Illogan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of The Cottage Harris Mill Illogan Cornwall TR16 4JF
Description: Permission in Principle for construction of a dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not considered to be at or well related to Redruth or Illogan. The site is unmistakably rural and is considered to be in the countryside. The proposal would result in unjustified residential development in the countryside, which would be largely dependent on the private vehicle due to limited street lighting and omission of footway along the highway. The introduction of unjustified residential development in the countryside would harm the character and appearance of the area conflicting with policies 1, 2, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 170 of the NPPF (2019) which seeks, amongst other things, to maintain the distinctive natural character of the countryside.

Address: Trolver Barn Trolver Hill Feock TR3 6RP
Description: Formation of revised access and balcony with window replacement
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is considered through the proposed alterations to the traditional converted barn through the loss of the external stone staircase, alterations to fenestrations and the introduction of a large balcony would harm the integrity, character and appearance of a non designated heritage asset that is a welcomed attribute to the prevailing AONB designation, thereby the proposal fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the locality or promote the local distinctive style of the area in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 127, 170, 172 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policies 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies LS2, HE1 and D1 of the adopted Feock Neighbourhood Plan 2018 and Policies MD9, NH4, SCC9.01 and SCC9.09 in the adopted AONB Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 4 Tom Lyon Road Liskeard PL14 3UJ
Description: Lawful development certificate for proposed demolition of existing rear conservatory and construction of a single storey rear extension.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works will not be lawful development under this certificate and will require the submission of a planning application. This is because there was a planning restriction on the original application 88/0850/O which removed permitted development rights. The condition stated:Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Development Order, 1988 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order), no works for the enlargement, improvement or other alteration of the dwelling (s) herby permitted (other than works which do not materially affect the external appearance of the building) shall be carried out without the express consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Address: Seaview Holiday Park Sennen Penzance Cornwall TR19 7AD
Description: Use of existing Managers Residential Unit as dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would, if permitted, create an open market dwelling in an unsustainable countryside location where such housing is strictly controlled without any overriding justification to disregard the development plan. The proposed development is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development, if permitted, would result in an unrestricted open market dwelling within an existing holiday complex which would give rise to unsatisfactory living conditions for future occupants by reason of the noise and disturbance from the occupants of the holiday units. The proposed development is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions set out within Policies 12 ,13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Roslyn Higher Road Breage TR13 9PJ
Description: Conversion of Existing Domestic Garage, Link Extension, Construction of Replacement Extensions & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed porch design of the existing building, linking extension that infills the historic separation space between buildings, extension and conversion of the former 'Smithy' fails to preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the Conservation Area and the setting of the associated non-designated heritage asset. The introduction of the porch, linking extension, extended and converted outbuilding would be harmful to this defined and designated area and the provision of additional living space is not of enough public benefit to outweigh this harm. On this basis the proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of polices 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 paragraphs 190, 192,193, 195 196, and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990. 2 The proposed development, by virtue of its design, siting and use of materials would appear prominent and inappropriate in the setting, and would materially reduce the visual quality of the streetscape. The proposed works fail to conserve or enhance the character and appearance of the World Heritage Site. The proposed works raise design concerns that cause harm to the setting and that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest or benefit. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of polices 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 124, 192, 193, 194, 196 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies C2 and C7 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020 - 2025.

Address: Land Adjacent To The Retreat Harewood Road Calstock PL18 9QN
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for the construction of one dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, as a consequence of being sited outside the re-introduced development boundary in this part of the settlement, expands the built form of the village into the open countryside, beyond the established development limit, harming the appearance and character of the surrounding landscape through visual and domestication impacts, and as such it fails to accord with the provisions, aims and intentions of Policy HP1 of the Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030 and as such is considered unacceptable in principle. 2 The application as submitted fails to provide sufficient evidence to demonstrate that the proposed new dwelling and its access will be safe from flood risk and not pose an increased flood risk elsewhere over its lifetime, with further information required to properly assess flood risk and the efficacy of drainage arrangements proposed. As such, the proposed development fails to accord with the provisions, aims and intentions of policies 26, 12 and 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies FLD1, FLD2, FLD3 and FLD4 of the Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030, and the National planning Policy Framework 2021, with particular reference to paragraphs 166, 8 and 159.

Address: Oystercatcher St Ives Road Carbis Bay TR26 2SF
Description: Change of use from a Bed and Breakfast to a residential property (holiday let)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, being a change of use from a Bed and Breakfast to a residential dwelling allowing for holiday use, would conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy H2 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030, which requires new open market housing to be restricted as a Principal Residence Only, in the interest of mitigating the impact of dwellings used for holiday accommodation on the local housing market.

Address: Pedna Cottage Trelion Grampound Road TR2 4ES
Description: Replacement of a domestic recreational stable building with a dwellinghouse that includes relinquishing of the existing residential use of the property known as Pedna Cottage
RefusalReasons: 1 The Local Planning Authority has acted positively and proactively in determining this application by identifying matters of concern with this proposal. On this occasion, the issues are so fundamental that it is not possible to negotiate a satisfactory way forward due to the harm that has been clearly identified within the reason(s) for refusal. 2 The application site sits outside of the settlements of St Stephens in Brannel and Trelion. The site is therefore considered to be in the open countryside. It is also divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities that would not represent sustainable new residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposed dwelling and associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context, fails to conserve or enhance the immediate setting; conversely leading to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 80 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land At Pelean Cross Pelean Cross Ponsanooth Truro Cornwall TR3 7JE
Description: Construction of up to 5 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site does not form part of the built form of Ponsanooth and Pelean Cross is not considered to constitute a settlement. The site is therefore considered to be in the open countryside. It is also divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities that would not represent sustainable new residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal, therefore, represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development that would be harmful to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside. The proposed development is contrary to Policies, 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 27 of the CLP and Paragraphs 2, 7, 8, 11, 79 and 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.   2 The proposal fails to demonstrate how the development will either conserve, protect or enhance habitats and biodiversity. As such, the development would be contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Paragraphs 8 and 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Blue Lagoon Sennen Cove Penzance Cornwall TR19 7DF
Description: Demolition of cabin and construction of annexe
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development is not considered to have a functional link with nor be of a subservient scale to the principal dwelling therefore failing to represent ancillary development. The proposed development, by virtue of its size, design and location would fail to conserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and the Heritage Coast. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 190 Callington Road Saltash Cornwall PL12 6LL
Description: Vehicle crossing
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed vehicular access from the classified highway leads to a parking space that is not of a size large enough to accommodate the standard area required for a perpendicular/echelon parking space. In addition parked vehicles would likely encroach upon the adjacent footway (restricted in width) forcing pedestrians to walk onto the carriageway to pass. This would increase the risk of conflict between vehicles and pedestrians, compromising highway safety for all. As such a safe and suitable access has not been demonstrated and therefore this proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted 22nd November 2016) and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Agricultural Building Longlands St Stephens Saltash Cornwall PL12 4QH
Description: Change of use and conversion for barns to dwelling and studio and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The existing buildings to which this application relate are not considered to be redundant, disused, or historic, nor are the buildings considered to be suitably constructed or appropriate to retain. The proposed design and introduction of a residential use on the site would not lead to an enhancement of the immediate setting which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty in which great weight must be attached to landscape and scenic beauty preservation. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and harmful form of residential development in the countryside and without any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 7, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Land At Tregorrick Farm Tregorrick Road Tregorrick St Austell PL26 7AG
Description: Ground mounted Solar PV Farm with battery storage and associated infrastructure.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would introduce built development onto an undeveloped green field in the countryside and within the setting of an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB). The proposal would appear as an incongruous industrial form within its rural context and, therefore, harm the distinctive natural qualities and scenic beauty of the surrounding landscape character, including the setting of the nearby AONB. It would also result in the temporary loss of agricultural land, including Best and Most Versatile agricultural land. The benefits associated with this renewable energy proposal do not outweigh the identified harm. The application is, accordingly, not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12, 14, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 There is a likelihood that the proposal, by reason of its siting, will harm buried heritage assets. In the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise and when adopting a precautionary approach, the application will therefore harm heritage assets and, accordingly, is contrary to Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 189, 194, 197 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land At Former Piggery Halsetown St Ives Cornwall TR26 3LY
Description: Conversion of Former Piggery to Form Residential Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The remains of the building, by reason of the scale, condition and appearance, would require significant reconstruction, rebuilding and extension in order to facilitate a residential use; without such work, it would not be capable of being converted into a habitable dwelling. Therefore the development would be tantamount to a new dwelling in an unsustainable location in the open countryside, for which no special justification has been presented. The proposed use with the associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context would fail to enhance the immediate setting and as such, the special qualities and attributes of this historic rural landscape would be harmed contrary to the aims of policies GD1 and BE15 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030, policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 124, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 3 The Mews Road From Perran Lane To Church Farm Perranuthnoe TR20 9NB
Description: Alterations to Existing Roof Structure, Internal Refurbishment & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The partial extending of the roof would be wholly at odds with and would be seen in stark contrast to the single storey roof of the existing dwelling. The step down in the roof height would be seen as an awkward and incongruous addition that would neither reflect nor respect the form of the existing dwelling. The proposal would cause less than substantial harm to the special interest and significance of Conservation Area. In these circumstances, paragraph 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 (NPPF) states that the harm should be weighed against the public benefits of the proposal. The benefit of a partial raising of the roof would not sufficiently offset the adverse impacts upon the character of the Conservation Area. The proposal would therefore fail to preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the Conservation Area. The proposed development is in conflict with Policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 127, 130 and 131 and section 16 of the National Planning policy Framework 2019 and contrary to the duty of the local planning authority stipulated by Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.The proposed development would also be detrimental to the character of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and therefore is in conflict with Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 The partial extending of the roof by reason of its design and relationship to the neighbouring properties would give rise to an overbearing impact to the occupiers of the properties either side of the proposed development resulting in a significantly diminished unsatisfactory outlook.  In addition, there would be significant overshadowing of neighbouring properties and of the courtyard. The proposal represents poor design in terms of resultant roof shape and the poor relationship between neighbouring properties gives rise to a poor level of amenity and substandard living environment for all occupiers.  The proposal therefore fails to accord with policy 12 of Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Lower Scadgehill Kilkhampton Bude Cornwall EX23 9HN
Description: Proposed construction of a new dwelling (to replace extant Class Q Prior Approval Consent)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling, by reason of its scale and domestic appearance in an exposed countryside location within the setting of an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, will create visually harmful built form, eroding the character and appearance of this part of the countryside. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Land East Of Dutson Road Launceston
Description: Outline planning application with all matters reserved except access comprising up to 105 units for retirement living and up to 40 Dwellings (both Class C3 Use) including a proportion of affordable housing, a 64-bed Care Home (Class C2 Use) and up to 1,275sqm Administration and Communal Facilities Building, a Commercial Unit of up to 300sqm (Class E Use) with associated drainage infrastructure and open space.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is not of an appropriate scale and is not allocated for strategic growth as set out in the St Stephens by Launceston Neighbourhood Development Plan ,Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (CLP) or the adopted Site Allocations Development Plan Document. Although the proposal offers social and economic benefits through housing delivery including affordable units in this edge of town location (which are positive material considerations supported within the NPPF) these do not outweigh or justify a departure from the spatial strategy pursued by the Development Plan. The proposal is therefore not considered to constitute sustainable development as defined by the Development Plan as it conflicts specifically with Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure it, the proposal fails to provide affordable housing; public open space contributions; off-site financial contributions to deliver improvements to mitigate pressures on education; managed and maintained biodiversity net gains,or air quality contributions. The proposal is therefore considered to be contrary to policies 8, 12, 13, 16, 23, 27 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 adopted November 2016. 3 Insufficient information has been provided in relation to the level of activity and presence of reptiles across the whole site (during the reptiles season when the cattle are not present) to establish whether a favourable conservation status of European Protected Species can be maintained; contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016. 4 Insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate a safe and suitable access can be achieved with particular reference to traffic movements on Newport Square; and a safe and suitable access is not demonstrated at the northern Dutson road site entrance; contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016 and paragraph 12.49 of the adopted Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document, adopted November 2019.

Address: Parc Rowland Trewartha Veryan Truro Cornwall TR2 5QJ
Description: Proposed demolition of existing hallway and garage and erection of new 2 storey extension to include recessed balcony on part of East elevation
RefusalReasons: 1 The revised proposal, through its increase in prominence, mass, proportions, orientation, form and design, fails to successfully relate to the existing bungalow, and its rural setting within a hamlet that is a heavily designated landscape of the heritage coast and AONB, thereby the proposal fails to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the locality or promote the local distinctive style of the area in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies LA1, LA2, CV1 and HO9 of the adopted Roseland Neighbourhood Plan 2015 and Policies MD9, SCC9.01 and SCC9.09 in the adopted AONB Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 32 Hobbs Crescent Saltash PL12 4JJ
Description: First floor extension to dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by means of its increased height, introduction of first floor windows and proximity to the neighbouring properties 8 and 10 Hobbs Crescent, would result in an unacceptable impact upon neighbour amenity, specifically due to loss of privacy as a result of overlooking. The development therefore conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 By reason of its height, design, discordant architectural form and unbalancing of the uniformity experienced within the existing row of bungalows in Hobbs Crescent, the proposal is dominant and incongruous in relation to the host property and causes unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the wider street scene. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy H5 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Portholland West Car Park West Portholland Portloe Truro Cornwall TR2 5PU
Description: Advertisement consent for signage in association with use of car park to inform users of car park Terms and Conditions and use of ANPR camera
RefusalReasons: The proposed signage scheme, by reason of the number of signs and their siting, would have an unacceptable and harmful impact on the visual amenity of the area, including the landscape character and scenic beauty of the AONB in which the site lies and the setting of the adjacent listed historic lime kiln structure. The proposed advertisements are therefore in conflict with Policies LA1, LA2, CV2, GP1 and CD1 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030, Policies 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies MD9 and SCC9.02 of the AONB Management Plan 2016-2021 and paragraphs 8, 130, 174, 176 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Former Unit H Bartles Industrial Estate North Street Redruth Cornwall TR15 1HR
Description: Construction of new dwelling & amendment to the existing car parking arrangement
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would introduce a new dwelling forward of the established historic building line created by Hambly's Row (i.e. 27 - 36 North Street). This would be at odds with the established character of the North Street thereby failing to respect the historical form and development of the area. The proposed dwelling would appear as an incongorous feature within the streetscene thereby having a detrimental impact on the setting of the character and appearance of the adjacent World Heritage Site. The proposed development fails to preserve or enhance the setting of the adjacent World Heritage Site and does not make a positive contribution to the local character and distinctiveness. The harm as a result of the proposed development is less than substantial to the significance of the World Heritage Site and the public benefits of the scheme do not outweigh the identified harm as set out in paragraph 196 of the NPPF (2019). The proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy P3 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013 - 2018, and paragraphs 184, 192 and 196 of the NPPF (2019)

Address: The Beach House Finnygook Lane Portwrinkle Torpoint Cornwall PL11 3BP
Description: Construction of one dwelling without compliance of Condition 10 of PA20/07129 dated 1st October 2020 Non material amendment to E2/06/01798/FUL to add condition to decision notice
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development seeks to change the design of the dwelling approved via, E2/06/01798/FUL, from an irregularly-shaped boldly modernist dwelling to a dual-pitched alpine lodge style dwelling. The application site occupies a highly prominent and sensitive coastal plot. The proposed revised design completely alters the nature of the development and would result in a development that would differ materially from the approved permission. As a result this proposal goes beyond the scope of Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and is contrary to guidance within the National Planning Practice Guidance, specifically paragraph 001 Reference ID: 17a-001-20140306.

Address: Oak Cottage Cox Hill St Day Redruth Cornwall TR16 5QE
Description: Demolition of existing car port and formation of self contained annex accommodation
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed annexe as a result of its large size, siting located outside of the existing residential curtilage, together with the level of accommodation it would provide, would offer a fully self contained unit of residential accommodation, that would not have a functional link with the principal dwelling known as Oak Cottage. The proposed annexe as a result of these factors would effectively create, and present as, a new dwelling in the open countryside that is isolated from everyday facilities, services and public transport, without special justification. Furthermore, the chosen scale, design and form of the annex would fail to preserve or enhance the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside or successfully relate or compliment the non designated asset of Oak Cottage. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, policies BIO1, HE1, LGOS1, LGOS3 QD1, HN1 and GA1 within the Chacewater Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019 and Paragraphs 79, 127, 170 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Hooked On The Rocks Swanpool Road Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5BG
Description: Demolition of the existing restaurant and replacement with a new restaurant and apartment and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by reason of its flat roof design, appearance, bulk, massing and scale would result in development that is harmful to the character of the area and the street-scene and on the adjacent Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010-2030, paragraphs 124, 126 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy MD9 of the AONB Management Plan 2016-2021

Address: Bracken Bank Churchtown Porthcurno Penzance Cornwall TR19 6JS
Description: Extensions and alterations
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in a dwelling with a greater physical presence than the existing structure in a sensitive and prominent location which is designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Heritage Coast. The proposed increase in height and proposed level of glazing fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the AONB and maintain the character and distinctive landscape qualities of the Heritage Coast. The development conflicts with Policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021, Policies 1, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adjacent To Church Park St Mellion Cornwall
Description: Outline application for construction of up to two dwellings with all matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwellings, by reason of the location of the site outside of any land considered to form the settlement of St Mellion, would not represent infill or rounding-off, or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement, and would visually extend built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting and the Area of Great Landscape Value in which the site is located. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable and undesirable form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and saved policy CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan first Alteration 2007.

Address: Tamwith Redmoor Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5AR
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of Dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council was provided a statement by the applicant which states that the building was erected as a dwelling and whilst anecdotally two statements provided states that it was not deemed to require building regs and that the 'applicant moved into the shed' there is not sufficient information to question the declaration of the application by the application form and the statement that he erected a dwelling and moved in. Section 171B (3) states that "In the case of any other breach of planning control, no enforcement action may be taken after the end of the period of ten years beginning with the date of the breach"The statements submitted demonstrates a continuous 4-year period, but the required 10 years has not been demonstrated.As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: Creek Bank Road From Marble Head Cottage To The Old Barn Restronguet Point Feock TR3 6RB
Description: Proposed First Floor Extension, External Alterations and Formation of a Vehicular Access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would not conserve or enhance the designated landscape of the AONB due to its design, scale and massing in combination with Lower Creek Bank in conflict with policies LS1, LS2 and D1 of the Feock NDP, Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, Policies MD9, MD16, SSC9.01 of the AONB Management Plan 2016 and paragraphs 127, 170 and 172 of the NPPF 2019.

Address: 11 Trewirgie Road Redruth Cornwall TR15 2SX
Description: Householder application for proposed new vehicular access
RefusalReasons: 1 The scheme would have a detrimental impact upon the streetscene and the local landscape due to an undesirable alteration to a well-defined boundary treatment and undermine the health and life expectancy of a prominent tree which has significant amenity value. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify the scheme, the proposal is contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Pendarves A3078 Between Windmill Hill And Chy Mor St Just In Roseland TR2 5HY
Description: Erection of bungalow and cons of access without complying with condition 1 of decision 53/5245 dated 31/08/1953
RefusalReasons: 1 The application fails to demonstrate that the existing dwelling is no longer required in connection with an existing holding or within the wider agricultural community. In the absence of an adequate marketing exercise, the applicant has not shown that the agricultural occupancy condition is no longer reasonable and necessary to protect the agricultural housing stock and prevent the proliferation of unrestricted residential properties in the countryside. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policy GP3 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030 and paragraphs 55 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Whitesands Hotel Sennen Nr Lands End TR19 7AR
Description: Demolition of extensions and construction of new two-storey extension to contain owner's/manager's flat and one holiday let flat
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of eroding an important gap between the existing hotel building (a non-designated heritage asset) and the neighbouring terrace of six dwellings to the south-east which serves to distinctly separate and contrast the asset and this contemporary development, together with the necessary removal of a side (south-east) extension to the asset which appears to date back to at least the early 1900s and the design of the proposed extension which unsympathetically projects forward of the principal (south-west) elevation of the asset, the proposal is considered to cause unacceptable harm to the character and setting of the host non-designated asset which is not outweighed by its limited public benefits. The proposal is therefore considered to fail to respect and work with the historic environment, in conflict with policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 117, 127, 184 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 In the absence of a suitable mechanism to secure a financial contribution in lieu of on-site provision of affordable housing, the proposal is considered to fail to provide for the housing needs of the local community, in conflict with Policy 8 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: 2B Bedford Road St Ives TR26 1SP
Description: Certificate of Lawful Development for an existing use namely for the entire property to be used as a residential dwelling house
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the application site property has been used soley as a single residential unit for a continuous period in excess of 4 years prior to the date of this application. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing use is refused.

Address: Land SE Of 5 Ridgegrove Hill Ridgegrove Hill Launceston Cornwall
Description: Outline planning application with all matters reserved for up to 100 residential dwellings (C3), a care home (C2 or C3) of up to 120 beds and a 10 unit apartment block for adults with learning disabilities (C2), and associated works.
