RefusalReasons: 1 The outline application represents a cramped overdevelopment of the site; and does not include sufficient land and detail including a comprehensive masterplan and concept plan to safeguard the delivery of the required estate road, pedestrian and cycle links between Kensey Valley Meadow and Newport Industrial Estate to create a safe and suitable access; to deliver open space requirements; to protect and enhance onsite biodiversity and the woodland priority habitat at the western edge of the allocation; and to ensure slope stability and ground water levels are acceptable, contrary to Policy LAU-H3 of the Cornwall site allocations development plan document, adopted November 2019; and Policies 1,2,3,16,23,26 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 adopted November 2016. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure it, the proposal fails to provide affordable housing, public open space contributions, off-site financial contributions to deliver improvements to mitigate pressures on education, managed and maintained biodiversity net gains, and transport or air quality contributions. The proposal is therefore considered to be contrary to policies 8, 12, 13, 16, 23, 27 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010, adopted November 2016. 3 Insufficient information has been provided in relation to the level of activity and presence of dormice across the site to establish whether a favourable conservation status of European Protected Species can be maintained; contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Fernlodge Boarding Kennels And Cattery Golberdon Road Pensilva Liskeard Cornwall PL14 5RW
Description: Application for Permission in Principle for 5 dwellings, together with the removal of all existing buildings including two units of residential accommodation
RefusalReasons: 1 The site lies within the Zones of Influence for the Plymouth Sound and Estuaries Special Area of Conservation (SAC). Under Article 5B of the Town and Country Planning (Permission in Principle) Order 2017 (as amended) (the Order), Permission In Principle must not be granted for development which is Habitats Development in the absence of appropriate mitigation within the Framework of an Appropriate Assessment. It follows that the development falls within the definition of Habitats development under Paragraph 5B (1)(b) of the Order for which PIP may not be granted. The scheme would conflict with Policy 22 of the Cornwall Local Plan insofar as it seeks to prevent development which would give rise to adverse effects on the Special Area of Conservation. 2 The proposal to construct 5 open market dwellings on this site would represent an undesirable incursion into open countryside beyond the built form of any settlement of Pensilva. The site is not allocated for residential development in an emerging Neighbourhood Plan and does not represent infill, or rounding off development or development of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining a settlement. The proposal would be substantially reliant on private vehicles for transport and would be unsustainable in transport terms. The proposal therefore represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of residential development in the countryside and in the absence of any special circumstances or overriding need to justify it in this location or other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 21 and and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016), paragraph 78 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Old Farm House Condolden Farm Tintagel Cornwall PL34 0HJ
Description: Demolition of garage/workshop and shed and construction of attached two storey holiday let
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would introduce new holiday accommodation into the open countryside and due to the isolated location, with the exception of the adjacent Tintagel Brewery, future occupants of the development would be heavily reliant upon the private vehicle to access services, goods, facilities and attractions. The proposal would represent an unjustified dwelling in the countryside thereby giving rise to sporadic and unsustainable development. The proposed development therefore does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 The proposed extension as a result of its size, design and form would alter and harm the simple character of the existing building, representing an incongruous addition that would be harmful to the host building and the character and appearance of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016) and Section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and paragraphs 8, 124, 127, 130 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South West Of Riverside Close Church Hill Ludgvan Cornwall TR20 8EF
Description: Construction of Local Needs Dwelling and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal by reason of its scale, form, design and due to the confined nature of the site fails to respond positively to the character and appearance of surrounding area and would result in a poor residential environment for future occupants. The proposal would provide a poor standard of living and amenity space both internally and externally within the constricted site and is poorly designed resulting in visual harm. As a result, the proposal is considered to constitute a poor-quality form of development which would have an adverse visual impact and would result in a poor residential environment for future occupants contrary to the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8 and 130 of the NPPF 2021 and Policies LUD5 and LUD7 of the Ludgvan Neighbourhood Development Plan. 2 The proposal by reason of the allocated parking being to utilise the existing garage across the other side of the B3309 from the application site would fail to demonstrate safe and suitable access. The proposal would increase the vehicular use of a parking space, currently used for storage, with significant highway safety concerns to users of the B3309 heading in a northeast direction, by virtue of the absence of emerging visibility to the southwest, forward visibility to the northeast and lack of onsite turning. In addition to the safety concerns the proposal would also require users to cross the B3309/C167/U6102 staggered crossroads junction on a regular basis. In light of the above, the proposed development conflicts with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 110, 111 and 112 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policies LUD5 and LUD16 of the Ludgvan Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Treskinnick Cottage Road From The A39 Between Boxs Shop And Treskinnick Cross To New Mills Road Treskinnick Cross Bude EX23 0DT
Description: Listed Building Consent for replacement of existing windows and doors.
RefusalReasons: 1 The introduction of double glazed UPVc windows and doors does not conserve, enhance the design, character or appearance of the listed building leading to less than substantial harm to the listing, with no overriding public benefit; contrary to Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) and paragraph 196 of the 2019 National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land Adjacent Bridge View Harrowbarrow Cornwall
Description: Outline application for construction of two dwellings with all matters reserved except access.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, as a consequence of being sited outside the re-introduced development boundaries in the Neighbourhood Development Plan area, would expand the envelope of built form of the settlement into the open countryside, and close the rural gap between development boundaries, harming the appearance and character of the surrounding landscape through visual and disturbance impacts resulting from more intensive domestication of the site, and fails to meet the special circumstances specified in Policy 7 of the CLP for new dwellings in the open countryside. As such it fails to accord with the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies HP1, HP2 and LA1 of the Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030, Policies 7, 23 and 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 The proposed two-dwelling development would represent over-development of the site, out of keeping with the prevailing density of residential development in the immediate area, manifesting itself in more harmful visual and disturbance impacts from more intensive domestication of the site, and would be detrimental to the amenities and appearance and character of the surrounding area. As such, the proposed development fails to accord with the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies HP6 and LA1 of the Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030, Policies 12, 1 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Behaven Idless Truro Cornwall TR4 9QT
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for up to 5no. four bedroom detached properties each with detached garage
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is in the countryside and Area of Great Landscape Value the character of which should be protected from harm, the site is also in a location away from any settlement and without safe or convenient access to public transport thus is an unsustainable form of development contrary to Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 policies 3 and 23 and policies H1 and E1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The proposal has failed to assess the impacts on protected species and biodiversity more generally thus conflicts with Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 policy 23 and paragraphs 170 and 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 3 The access roads to the site, by virtue of their narrow carriageway widths with limited passing places and constrained visibility, do not provide a safe or suitable access contrary to Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 policy 27.

Address: Land To Rear Of 1 Grenville Road Truro Cornwall TR1 3TJ
Description: Proposed self-build dwelling (single-storey)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its siting and the location of the plot, does not respect the established pattern, form and layout of development in the locality, and does not promote continuity with the existing built form. Conversely, the development will result in a discordant, incongruous and cramped form of residential accommodation, with insufficient private amenity space, which fails to respond positively to local character or add to the overall quality of the area. Furthermore, the close proximity of the proposed unit to the adjacent existing property to the south will result in overbearing and overshadowing impacts to the future occupiers of each unit. The development therefore fails to accord with policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies E4 and H1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Minerva Guest House 2 - 3 The Crescent Newquay Cornwall TR7 1DT
Description: Remove pitched roof structure and form a new third floor level to provide 7 letting rooms and two balconies
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, through its form, architectural language, massing and bulk, will harm the character and appearance of the host property as well as the roofscape of this terrace through interrupting the stepping down of bulk and heights along the street scene. The proposal is considered to constitute poor design that fails to appropriately respond to its townscape setting and is in conflict with Policy G2 (c), D1 (a. 1 and 2) and E5 (b) of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019, Policy 12 (1a. and b.) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development, by reason of the impact it will have to neighbouring plots fails to secure a good standard of amenity. The proposal, through its additional massing, height and form, shall lead to an unacceptable loss of light and outlook to neighbouring windows to the north and south, shall significantly increase the levels of over-bearing for properties to the south and north and will significantly impinge upon the level of amenity through additional over-looking to the second and third (top) floor apartments and over-bearing to the apartments to the west. The proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy E5 (b.) of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019, policy 12 (2.) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Cranfield, Flat 3 Atlantic Terrace New Polzeath Wadebridge PL27 6UG
Description: To erect an extension and alterations to create external amenity spaces
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its scale, massing, and architectural form the proposal would if permitted result in an incongrous and incohesive form of development which does not respect the character of the host dwelling or surrounding area. The proposal would therefore be contrary to policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and policy STMNDP 2.7 of the St Minver Parishes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030

Address: Land At Bodieve Bodieve Wadebridge Cornwall
Description: Outline application for residential development including access of up to 245 new homes (to include 30% affordable homes), new relief road from Ball Roundabout to B3314, new public open space (including play area and community orchard and cycle path/amenity walkway), extensive new tree planting and new habitat creation (including 1.75ha. of new woodland planting and 0.25ha of new wildlife ponds).
RefusalReasons: 1 Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan states that the delivery of housing in main towns will be managed through site allocations in order to ensure that growth is genuinely plan-led. The application site is not an allocated site for residential development and nor does not constitute windfall development, rounding-off of a settlement, infill development or fall within the exceptions for residential development in the countryside under Policy 7. Planning applications must be determined in accordance with the development plan unless material considerations indicate otherwise. The development would bring forward significant benefits including the provision of housing, with much needed affordable homes, economic benefits, the link road and its associated benefits. However, given the presence of a five-year housing supply and up to date Development Plan, there is no overriding requirement or justification that these benefits should be delivered on this particular site in advance of allocation within a neighbourhood plan, particularly given the harm that this proposal would cause to the environment as detailed in reason 2 below. The proposed development is contrary to Policies 1, 3 and 7 and of the Cornwall Local Plan; the aims and intentions of paragraphs of paragraphs 2, 12, and 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework; and the long standing fundamental of the UK planning system namely utilising a plan led approach to development 2 The northern housing site and link road would intrude into the open countryside harming the distinctive landscape character and visual amenity of the area. The A39 currently forms a strong edge limiting the spread of the built-up area of the settlement. The development breaches this clearly defined edge. The northern housing site would relate to Bodieve Village rather than Wadebridge and viewed in that context, would be significant in its scale. This harm is not outweighed by the benefits of the proposal in its submitted form and is therefore considered contrary to Policies 2, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and saved policy ENV1 and the aims and intentions of paragraphs 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 3 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the long-term provision of affordable housing, open space, educational infrastructure, primary care contributions for which there is evidence of an identified need, and on and off-site highways works, the proposal is considered to be contrary to the CC Document - Guidance on s106 Planning Obligations for Education Provision (April 2012), a guide to planning contributions and health care provision in relation to primary care premises, and Cornwall Local Plan Policies 8, 13, 16, 27, and 28; and paragraphs 8, 62, 91, 94, 96, 102, 103, 108 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 4 The application fails the statutory derogation tests as it would introduce a disturbance to foraging and commuting bats and there is no imperative reason of overriding public interest for the development. The application is therefore contrary to Policy 23(3.d) of the Cornwall Local Plan and the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017 (as amended) and amendments; Schedule 5 of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981; paragraphs 98 and 99 of Circular 6/2005 and government guidance (updated 7 January 2021) Protected Species and development:advice for local planning authorities.

Address: Land To The North-East Cobb Cottage Wheal Anna Goonhavern Truro Cornwall TR4 9NU
Description: Use of land for siting of shepherds hut for holiday purposes
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside. The proposal represents unjustified and sporadic development within the open countryside with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements.  The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 5 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: St Michaels Retail Park Eastern Green Penzance TR18 3FH
Description: Extension to Unit 2, removal of internal mezzanine (Unit 2 only) and reconfiguration of parking area and associated works. Increase in floor area permitted to be used for the sale of food.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would result in an unrestricted retail use at a site that is outside Penzance town centre when there are sequentially preferable sites available. It is also considered that given recent out of centre developments and permissions that the proposal could have a significant adverse impact on the town centre. It would therefore be contrary to advice in para 91 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy 4 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2130. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the off-site financial contributions to deliver highway improvements, the proposal is contrary to policy 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2130 and paragraph 57 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trevanson Farm Trevanson Road Wadebridge PL27 7HP
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed elevational treatments
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed alterations identified in the certificate would constitute a breach of Condition 2 of PA20/00743 and additionally could not be undertaken on the reliance of available permitted development rights. As such, it is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works cannot be lawful, the certificate must be refused, and the applicant should apply for planning permission to undertake the proposed works.

Address: Oldthorns Road From Chapel Hill To Prentice House Little Polgooth St Austell PL26 7DD
Description: Change of use of barn with use Class B1(b) to C3 dwelling house
RefusalReasons: 1 The development proposed will significantly alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of this barn with its timber cladding and lack of fenestration that clearly relates to this rural landscape. The building is not considered to be a suitably constructed rural building that would be considered appropriate to retain and its conversion to residential use would clearly not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting on a site that is widely visible from the public highway. The extensive glazing and raised balcony proposed in the conversion will fundamentally alter the perception of the building such that it will be recognised as an incongruous residential form that will harm the strong rural characteristics of this landscape. The proposed development fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character in this location. As such, it conflicts with policies 2, 7, 12, and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 130, 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 54 Hilgrove Road Newquay TR7 2QT
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved for a new dwelling to the south of 54 set in the garden.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of the plots size and location, would fail to respond positively to local housing densities and the character of the wider area. As such, the proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of paragraphs 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, policies 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policy D1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019.

Address: Taran Edhen Restronguet Point Feock Truro Cornwall TR3 6RB
Description: Erection of a dwelling and extension of an existing garage with variation of condition 2 of appeal decision PA16/02242 dated 20.01.2017
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, in this visually prominent creek side context overlooking Restronguet Creek, would fail to conserve or enhance the designated landscape of the AONB due to its design incorporating an increase in the scale and extent of external glazing to the ground and lower ground floor levels on the south and west facing elevations and the associated inevitable increase in lightspill, resulting in a more assertive visual presence on this site, contrary to Policies LS1, LS2, D1 and H1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030, Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies MD9 and SSC9.01 of the AONB Management Plan 2016 and paragraphs 127, 170, 172 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: To Rear Of 75 Treverbyn Road St Austell Cornwall PL25 4EW
Description: Proposed extension to existing B1/B8 Industrial warehouse building and formation of new vehicle access and parking area.
RefusalReasons: 1 Policy 3 'Role and Functions of Places' of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 (the Development Plan) states that the delivery of growth in main towns will be managed through site allocations in order to ensure that growth is genuinely plan led. The application site is not identified as an employment site within the Allocation Development Plan Document. Furthermore the proposed expansion of the existing industrial business would be of a scale that would not be appropriate for its location. The scale of the extension and the associated access road, pavement, storage and turning areas would extend urban built development into what is considered the countryside and would appear incongruous in its setting thereby harming the rural character of the area. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 3, 5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan strategic policies 2010-2030 and the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document.

Address: Land At United Downs TR16 5HU
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved (layout, appearance, scale and landscaping) for mixed-use zero carbon employment development comprising a state-of-the-art rum cask maturation biome (Use Class B8); heat and power connection to existing off-site geothermal energy source; geothermal energy centre; and visitor centre including ancillary shop and cafe (Use Class E) and bar (Use Class sui generis); with associated site remediation, drainage (including attenuation pond and pumping station), landscaping, footbridge, bin store, access, car parking and electric vehicle charging infrastructure.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development is deemed to be EIA development following the issuing of a positive screening direction by the Secretary of State dated 1st June 2021. In the absence of the submission of an Environmental Statement (ES), the application is deemed to have been refused under Regulation 11 of the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 2017.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Land East Of Reflections Brenton Road Downderry Cornwall PL11 3JA
Description: Construction of dwelling with garage and parking spaces.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development, by reason of its scale and design, would dominate the surrounding built forms and landscape, representing an overdevelopment of the site, and would appear unduly conspicuous within its elevated setting above the neighbouring properties of Brenton Road. As such the proposal would fail to take account of the coastal and built contexts, or the character and appearance of the Area of Great Landscape Value. The development is therefore contrary to policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and saved policy CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan 2007.

Address: Towan Valley Phase 3 Towan Valley Porthtowan Cornwall
Description: Development of up to 32no. holiday lodges and a reception/leisure building of up to 300sqm - outline with some matters (appearance, landscaping, layout and scale) reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its scale and density, the development of this valley site for new holiday letting accommodation would cause material harm to the natural beauty of the landscape on rising ground to the east of Porthtowan. The application site has a valley setting comprising bare ground and evidence of past mining features, which is highly prominent from neighbouring public highways and footpaths. The development of the site for further holiday accommodation, extending eastwards beyond the established limits of Porthtowan, would result in the harmful urbanisation of this land on the village fringe to the detriment of its open character and attractive valley setting. Furthermore, the development of this land, which is designated as open access land, would reduce the publics ability to freely utilise this site, thereby harming the public enjoyment of this amenity. Consequently, the development is not of an appropriate scale to its location and raises direct conflict with policies 1, 2, 5, 12, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010 - 2030, policies 6, 10, 11, 13 and 19 of the St Agnes Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 84, 130, 174 and 189 the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Former Pig Farm Higher Fraddon Fraddon Cornwall
Description: Outline application for the use of land for siting 16 holiday units with all matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed holiday units would be on land allocated as employment Land within the St.Enoder Neighbourhood Development Plan. It is considered that holiday units would not constitute a suitable employment use. The 16 units would not be of an appropriate scale to their location and would appear at odds with the prevailing character of the area. The proposal would represent unjustified development within the countryside which would harm the intrinsic rural character of the area. The proposal therefore is contrary to policies 2,3, 5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Employment policies 1 and 5 of the St. Enoder Parish Neighbourhood Plan. 2 The application fails to comply with the habitat directives in that there is no overriding public interest for the proposal and there would be a disturbance to foraging bats. The application is therefore contrary to policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 adopted 2016;  paragraphs 174 and 175 of the NPPF 2019; the Conservation of Habitat and Species Regulations; Circular 06/2005

Address: Millside Perrancoombe Perranporth Cornwall TR6 0JQ
Description: Construction of up to 14 holiday units and associated infrastructure - outline with some matters (appearance, landscaping and scale) reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of the special justification that is required for development in the open countryside, the proposed new holiday accommodation by reason of its countryside location on a site not accessible by public transport and unrelated to an existing tourism or other business is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 5 and 7 the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010- 2030 and policy 19 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018- 2030.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Land South Of Boscaswell Village Pendeen Penzance TR19 7EJ
Description: Demolition of existing garage, construction of bungalow and associated works and alteration to layout of application PA12/09446 (Construction of affordable flats with off-road parking and garden/amenity areas)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed bungalow by reason of its siting and design would not integrate with the surrounding context. Whilst the bungalow would be of limited scale, its positioning to the rear of the site and absence of any positive street frontage would result in a cramped and discordant form of development that fails to reflect the prevailing pattern of development of the surrounding area. The development would therefore provide little positive contribution to the Conservation Area or Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Furthermore the proposal would result in a poor standard of amenity for future residents of the bungalow and the flats. The proposal thus fails to accord with policies 1, 2, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land Rear Of Lydford Carnkie Redruth Cornwall TR16 6RZ
Description: Construction of 5 affordable detached houses with garages and garden amenity area
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed affordable dwellings are not considered to represent infill or rounding off in accordance with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030 or be well related to the physical form of the settlement of Carnkie to comply with Policy 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030; and would represent an undesirable extension and intrusion of the built form into a historic countryside setting to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside and setting of the Listed Buildings and World Heritage Site leading to harm which would not be outweighed by any public benefit. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal represents unjustified development and would be contrary to policies 2, 3, 7, 9, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127, 130, 192, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 2 The submitted scheme does not comply with the tenure or space standards for the size/bedspace of affordable dwellings to meet the identified need as set out by the affordable housing team. The scheme proposed is 100% affordable with all five units proposed for sale however a S.106 legal agreement has not been entered into to secure the necessary affordable housing. It is therefore considered that the scheme is not affordable housing led and furthermore also fails to reflect the identified local need as the affordable dwellings are proposed to be for sale without the means of securing them as affordable local needs homes in perpetuity. As such the proposal fails to comply with policy 3 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 77 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 59 Carbeile Road Torpoint PL11 2HP
Description: Drop the curb at the front of the house to create off-road parking.
RefusalReasons: 1 The Local Planning Authority has acted positively and proactively in determining this application by identifying matters of concern with this proposal. On this occasion, the issues are so fundamental that it is not possible to negotiate a satisfactory way forward due to the harm that has been clearly identified within the reason(s) for refusal. 2 The proposed vehicular access from the classified highway leads to a parking space that is not of a size that would allow a vehicle to turn onsite. This would result in any vehicle attempting to enter or leave this access having to reverse into or out of the site onto the carriageway to the detriment of other road users. The development would not provide a safe and suitable access for vehicles. This proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted 22nd November 2016) and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Foxgloves Tremellick St Cleer Cornwall PL14 6RP
Description: Construction of agricultural barn for the purposes of housing cows
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of a demonstrable essential business need for the proposed building, the scheme represents unsustainable development within an open countryside setting designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value (AGLV), where the proposed development of the site without justification would be harmful to the intrinsically undeveloped character of the surrounding countryside and AGLV designation contrary to Policies 2, 5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016 and saved Policy CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan First Alteration 2007.

Address: 10 Woodland Avenue Tywardreath Par Cornwall PL24 2PL
Description: To create off-street parking for one car and a new safer pedestrian access.
RefusalReasons: 1 It has not been demonstrated that the site is able to provide sufficient manoeuvring space off road, to allow vehicles to turn with ease in order to exit the site in forward gear. This is likely to result in vehicles reversing direct onto this C class road to the detriment of highway safety. Accordingly the proposal would conflict with policies 12 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) and paragraphs 108 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 2 The proposed removal of the side garden, original granite pedestrian steps and lengths of historic stone rubble boundary walls to create a parking area would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the conservation area. The new retaining wall and parking area would additionally partially erode the integrity of the properties frontage as the work would extend up to the front boundary wall. This would conflict with policies 2,12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), paragraphs 127 and 200 and 201 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the aims and intentions of the Cornwall Council Tywardreath Conservation Area Character Appraisal and Management Proposals March 2010

Address: Land North East Of Little Hallaze Carbis Moor St Austell Cornwall PL26 8YJ
Description: Proposed change of use of the land to a private Romani gypsy site consisting of 4 gypsy pitches with associated works including 4 mobile homes, 4 touring caravans, 2 semi-detached day rooms, the provision of a new vehicular access and the installation of a sewage treatment plant.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would introduce a scale of development which is out of keeping with the character of the area. The proposal would extend the built form into the countryside which is designated Cornwall Wildlife Site and a Biodiversity Action Plan BAP listed as a deciduous woodland priority habitat, thus eroding the character of the area and having an urbanising effect on the rural location. The proposed development would be at odds with the prevailing character of the area and would appear incongruous in its rural setting and thereby harms the distinctive harm character and natural beauty and biodiversity of the surrounding  area contrary to 2, and policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and 174 and 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The application fails to provide safe and suitable access for all road users for the nature and scale of this proposal. It is therefore considered that a safe and suitable access for all users has not been demonstrated and the proposal would therefore introduce an unacceptable impact on highway safety and not represent sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 11 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph, 1,7 108 and 109 of the NPPF.

Address: Land East Of Joymond Trevanson Road Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 7HD
Description: Proposed New Build
RefusalReasons: 1 The development if approved would lead to the artificial separation of a larger developable site which would consequently limit the ability of the Local Planning Authority to secure the necessary mitigation, infrastructure, affordable housing provision and a safe and suitable access. The development is not sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 8,12, 27 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 64, 102, 108, 110, 111, 117, 122, 123, 127

Address: Land West Of Nirvana Trevanson Road Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 7HD
Description: Proposed New Build
RefusalReasons: 1 The development if approved would lead to the artificial separation of a larger developable site which would consequently limit the ability of the Local Planning Authority to secure the necessary mitigation, infrastructure, affordable housing provision and a safe and suitable access. The development is not sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 8,12, 27 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 64, 102, 108, 110, 111, 117, 122, 123, 127

Address: Anneth Lowen Trenoweth Lane Mabe Burnthouse Penryn Cornwall TR10 9HZ
Description: Change of use for two shepherd huts and one teepee tent to be used as holiday lets
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of the site for two shepherd huts and one tepee to be used as holiday lets by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable new residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic form of development that would be harmful to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside. The development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (CLP) and paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 (NPPF). 2 The proposed access arrangement fails to demonstrate a safe and suitable access for the proposed holiday units and, if permitted, would be detrimental to highway safety as a result of the introduction of additional vehicular movements onto the U6031 and subsequent C7/U6031 priority T-junction. It is considered therefore that the development is not sustainable and contrary to Policies 2, 12 and 27 of the CLP and the aims and intentions of paragraphs 108, 109 and 110 of the NPPF.

Address: Land North Of Tregunwith Wood Tregunwith Mylor Bridge TR11 5SU
Description: Installation of a mobile home for a temporary worker's dwelling and erection of an agricultural building
RefusalReasons: 1 The application involves the construction of a new temporary workers dwelling in the countryside, detached from any definable settlement containing the necessary facilities required to support day-to-day occupation, which would encourage the use of a private motor vehicle and is not considered to be sustainable development. New housing development in this location is not supported by Policies 3, 7 or 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (CLP). The proposal would incur significant visual harm to the immediate setting and surrounding natural environment from the construction of a dwelling and agricultural building in the open countryside resulting in landscape and visual harm to the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Notwithstanding the modest associated economic benefits of this proposal, they do not outweigh the unsustainable location and harm to the natural qualities of the setting. The proposal is considered contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the CLP, paragraphs 122, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 (NPPF) and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 The location of this site relies on access along a public right of way which includes narrow sections with no passing places. The proposed location of this development would encourage conflict between pedestrians and motorised traffic giving rise to increased danger for all users and creating an unacceptable highway safety impact. As such the development is considered to conflict with Policies 1, 16 and 27 of the CLP and paragraph 108 of the NPPF. 3 The submitted information is insufficient to enable the Local Planning Authority to assess the impacts on protected species and does not provide any information in relation to Biodiversity Net Gain. The proposal thus conflicts with CLP policy 23 and paragraphs 172 and 175 of the NPPF.

Address: Garages Opposite 1 Gloucester Place Newlyn TR18 5DR
Description: Construction of Dwelling House, Duplex Flat and Parking Facilities (Previously Approved PA19/07574)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal by reason of its restricted plot size constitutes a cramped and contrived form of development unacceptably detracting from the character and appearance of the local area. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: The Park Office Langurtho Road Fowey PL23 1EQ
Description: Demolition of existing A1/B1 commercial building and construction of a one-bedroom residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed new dwelling by way of its scale, design and size of plot will have a cramped and shoehorned appearance which would harm the character and appearance of the area. It would fail to conserve or enhance the landscape and scenic beauty of the AONB and provide sufficient useable amenity space of its likely occupiers. As such the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 12 (1a and b), 21(c) and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 Adopted Nov 16 Policies 2 and 6 of the Fowey Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraphs 127 and 172 in the National Planning Policy Framework (Framework).

Address: Land West Of Lavender Cottage Bray Shop Cornwall PL17 8PZ
Description: Outline application (with some matters reserved) for a new dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling, by reason of its location outside of any land considered to form the settlement of Bray Shop, does not infill, round-off or make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement, and would visually extend built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development in the countryside, contributing to undesirable ribbon development, and in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Sunshine Meadows Mithian St Agnes TR5 0QD
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of land for stationing of a residential mobile home
RefusalReasons: 1 On the basis of the evidence submitted documentation provided in respect of application PA20/07926 and the Local Planning Authority's own investigations the Local Planning Authority considers that residential use of the succession of two mobile homes on the provided site plan reference received on the 16th September 2020 has either been subject to concealment or has not accrued the necessary the time period in which to gain immunity from enforcement action under section 171B of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Address: 2 The Terrace Pentewan St Austell PL26 6DE
Description: New timber framed and timber clad self contained annex building
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, by reason of its siting and bulk, would harm the character of an area which is within a conservation area and an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The application is, accordingly, contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land Addjoining Kerensa Gardens Goonown St Agnes TR5 0YX
Description: Reserved matters application for approval of appearance, landscaping, layout and scale following outline permission PA17/08394 for residential development of up to 8 houses with access
RefusalReasons: 1 Outline permission was granted on the basis that the development would be an affordable led scheme, with viability to be considered at the reserved matters stage, as per an associated legal obligation. The current submission does not demonstrate that a greater number of affordable units, with an associated greater land take, could not viably be provided on-site. It is not therefore clear that the market housing, at the ratio proposed, is essential for the successful delivery of residential development on the indicated site. The proposal therefore fails to accord with policy 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policy 2 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and guidance within Cornwall Councils Housing Supplementary Planning Document February 2020.

Address: Land At Boskennal Farm Cottage Ludgvan Penzance Cornwall TR20 8AR
Description: Proposed erection of holiday lodge
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would not be in a sustainable location having particular regard to the accessibility by a range of transport modes. No evidence has been submitted to demonstrate that the proposed development would constitute farm diversification. The proposal fails to accord with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 5 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 83 and 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The application site lies in an attractive area of open countryside. The proposed development would represent an urbanisation of the area through the provision of an additional building used for residential purposes. For anyone using the public right of way through the application site or the highway which passes the application site, the proposal would have an urbanising effect. In addition, there would be the parking of cars from those staying in the holiday unit. The proposed development would add to and extend the existing built form in a countryside location thereby eroding the rural character and failing to enhance the natural environment. The proposal fails to accord with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies LUD1, LUD7 and LUD20 of the emerging Ludgvan Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Lynden House East Hill Blackwater Cornwall TR4 8HW
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for the existing use of land for stationing of a caravan for human habitation and for recreational domestic use
RefusalReasons: 1 The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicants onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land in question has ever been used for the stationing of a caravan for human habitation for a continuous period in excess of 10 years. As such the application for a Lawful Development Certificate for an Existing Use is refused.

Address: 59 Higher Lux Street Liskeard Cornwall PL14 3JY
Description: Erection of ground and first floor extensions at higher ground level. To provide additional accommodation for large family
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its discordant design, appearance and architectural form, the proposal is incongruous and dominant in relation to the host property and causes harm to the character and appearance of the wider street scene. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 124, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: South Broadmoor Elmgate Saltash Cornwall PL12 4QX
Description: Listed Building Consent for for reinstatement of porch with open oak frame, changing the windows and doors from white uPVC tilt and turn to timber casement in green colour, and removal of the old pointing to the south/west/north outside stone walls and replacement with lime mortar.
RefusalReasons: 1 The installation of casement replacement windows, painted green, would fail to enhance or restore/preserve the features and fabric and appearance and historic character of this Grade II listed house described in its 1984 listing description, and the less than substantial harm caused by the proposed development would not be outweighed by any public benefits . As such, the proposed development conflicts with the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies 24, 12 and 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, with particular reference to paragraphs 184, 189, 192, 193, 194, 196, 124, 127 and 8.

Address: Land South West Of Penwinnick Farm Penwinnick Road St Agnes Cornwall
Description: Full detailed application for a cross subsidy exception site residential development comprising 39 dwellings (22 affordable), access roads and landscaping
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is within the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site which is a heritage asset of international importance thus is afforded the greatest level of protection. The proposed development cumulatively with the new neighbouring residential development at Fordh Tobmen to the north will, by virtue of its modern residential design and layout, scale and materials, result in an unsympathetic and incongruous urban extension into this sensitive historic landscape and would be detrimental to the setting of the historic town of St Agnes. The proposal will result in less than substantial harm to the significance of the World Heritage Site and this harm is not outweighed by the public benefits of the provision of affordable housing and the associated economic benefit from construction of the development. The proposal thus conflicts with Cornwall Local Plan Policies 2, 24, St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan Policies 10 and 11 and the aims at paragraphs 189, 197, 201 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policies P3, C2 and C9 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020-2025. 2 The proposed development will, by virtue of its location would result in an unsatisfactory pedestrian accessibility for residents to public amenities, including equipped areas of public open space. The proposal would thus conflict with Cornwall Local Plan policy 27, Policy 13 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraph 92 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land At OS Grid Ref 187424 65942 St Mawgan Cornwall
Description: Application for planning in principle for the construction of one dwelling.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is defined as being Habitats Development and as such the Permission in Principle cannot be granted. 2 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly outside the form of any settlement. The proposed development would through the erection of built form for residential use and subdivision of the field to create domestic curtilage together with the associated paraphernalia, result in significant change to the verdant undeveloped character of the area and harm to this open, distinctive and historic landscape. The erosion of this historically undeveloped gap impedes the understanding of the historic evolution of the settlement and results in harm to the Conservation Area. Consequently, the proposal would fail to preserve or enhance the Conservation Area nor maintain the distinctive character of the area and Area of Great Landscape Value and as such, the distinctive qualities and attributes of this historic rural landscape would be harmed, contrary to the aims of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, saved policy 14 of Restormel Local Plan and paragraphs 8, 79, 124, 127, 170, 192 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. The limited benefits of the proposal do not outweigh the harm and the proposal does not constitute sustainable development.

Address: Land Opposite Camel Valley Cottages Dunmere Road Bodmin PL31 2RD
Description: Full planning for a 1x 2 bedroom dwelling and 1x 3 bedroom dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal introduces two new households on a location where the shortest, direct and most convenient pedestrian route to the nearby public house, bus stops and more distant services and facilities in Bodmin is via a pavement link that is not continuous and on a busy road (A389).  This route, on the section between site and pub, includes requirement for pedestrians to cross a bridge which in narrow in width and provides no place for refuge. An alternative and longer route is provided for pedestrians via a pavement proposed along the front of the site, dismantled railway, Camel Trail and pub but this route is much more convoluted, longer in distance and less desirable. This scheme would create a desire line for pedestrians that is not suitable and safe for all users, including those with mobility constraints such as wheelchairs and pushchairs, which is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The application site is divorced from any settlement in a location with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities.  Occupiers of the new homes would therefore be heavily reliant on accessing services and facilities by private car, particularly having regard to the unsafe pedestrian route along the A389 where there is no continuous pavement. This conflicts with the objectives of enhancing active travel patterns, improving access to public transport, and encouraging a modal shift away from private motor vehicles in the interests of reducing resource consumption, air quality improvement and maintaining highway safety conditions. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this countryside location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 16 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan and the aims and intentions of paragraphs 8, 91, 102, 103, 108, 110, 127, 148 and 150 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 3 The proposed introduction of two new homes and associated infrastructure on undeveloped land will harm the distinctive natural character of a site within an Area of Great Landscape Value that is prominent to public view from users of the nearby A389 at a gateway location to a Main Town. The application is, therefore, contrary to policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 4 Insufficient information has been submitted to demonstrate that this proposal would not result in an increase in phosphate levels which would further adversely affect the current unfavourable status of the River Camel Special Area of Conservation. When adopting a precautionary approach, the Local Planning Authority is not satisfied that the proposal will not adversely affect the integrity of this Special Area of Conservation and the application is therefore contrary to Regulation 63 of the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017; Policies 1 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; and paragraphs 170, 175 and 177 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Penvores Farm Gilly Hill Nantithet Cury TR12 7RB
Description: Proposed siting of 2no. bespoke glamping units
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development of the site for two holiday letting units by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable new residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic form of development that would be harmful to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside and would neither conserve or enhance the area which is designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty . The development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 4 Gwel Park Gwallon Lane Marazion TR17 0HW
Description: Construction of Dormer Windows, Loft Conversion and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dormers appear as overly dominant additions to the roof of the existing dwelling. The result is that the dwelling appears top heavy and the dormers, given their size and design would create a discordant feature in the street scene which can be viewed from several public vantage points. The proposed development would therefore conflict with Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of West View Southern Road Callington Cornwall PL17 7ES
Description: Construction of new dwelling, demolition of garden store and greenhouse and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would intensify the vehicular usage of an unsuitable junction from Southern Road to Hangmans Lane which is constrained by a tight turning circle when travelling in a north east direction. Submitted tracking information requires a widening of the northern side of Hangmans Lane (likely to be on land outside of the ownership of the applicant) and would still fail to provide safe and suitable access for larger vehicles which would be unable to complete the manoeuvre in one turn without crossing the centre line of Southern Road. This would contribute to an increased risk of collision and reduction in highway safety to both occupants and members of the public. The improvements proposed as part of the scheme, namely the stopping up of another constrained access and the widening of Hangmans Lane, would not outweigh the harm identified. The application, therefore, fails to provide safe and suitable access and is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 - 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Curlew Lodge Old Tram Road Devoran TR3 6NF
Description: Demolition of existing flat roof extension attached to the south elevation and construction of a replacement extension beneath a pitched roof.
RefusalReasons: 1 The revised proposal is considered through its siting, proportions, form, materials and design to harm one of the attributes of outstanding universal character attributed to the prevailing Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site, namely a former industrial building associated with transportation of mineral ore that was in operation at the time of the WHS inscription, and fails to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Devoran Conservation Area through harm to the legibility of the building and therefore the proposal in conflict with the aims and intensions of paragraphs 194, 196 and 200 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan - Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy HE1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019, Policies P3, C2 C3, C8 and C9 of the adopted WHS Management Plan 2020-2025 and the adopted World Heritage Site SPD 2017.

Address: 10 Wellington Street Torpoint Cornwall PL11 2DE
Description: Householder application for proposed office/workshop
RefusalReasons: 1 The orientation, height and asymmetric design of the proposed development would be uncharacteristic and incongruous in form resulting in a negative impact upon the appearance of the street scene. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 2 The proposed development, by means of the introduction of a first-floor window facing the neighbouring properties of Wellington Street at a distance of less than 25m and overlooking the private amenity space serving these properties would result in an unacceptable impact upon neighbour amenity, specifically due to loss of privacy as a result of overlooking to 8 and 12 Wellington Street. The development therefore conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and section 4.11 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013.

Address: Land Off Eddystone Rise Liskeard Cornwall
Description: Construction of single dwelling and associated parking area. (Resubmission of application no. PA19/05517 dated 16/01/20).
RefusalReasons: 1 The creation of a detached dwelling within the land off of Eddystone Rise would result in a scheme that fails to reflect the prevailing pattern of development in the local area, namely that of detached or semi-detached residential properties with modest rear gardens and would result in an undesirable access arrangement. The proposal would appear as a cramped form of development which would be out of keeping with and harmful to the character of the area, would fail to respond, and be detrimental to, the local layout and would conflict with Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, paragraph 23 of the Design section of the Planning Practice Guidance 2015 and section 4.10 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013.

Address: Wheelgate Cottage East Hill Blackwater Truro Cornwall TR4 8EG
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for the erection of an adaptable disability bungalow on recreational garden at Wheelgate Cottage.
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located outside of the definable limits of the established settlement of Blackwater, and does not represent an acceptable form of infill or rounding off as defined in policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030. The development therefore represents an undesirable and sporadic extension of the built form in the adjoining countryside, which would lead to visual harm through the erosion of the character and appearance of the natural environment. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the proposal does not represent sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies BIO1 and HN1 of the Chacewater Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Stack View Lower Condurrow Condurrow Camborne Cornwall TR14 9AP
Description: New dwelling and change of use from agricultural to domestic curtilage
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed residential dwelling by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside would represent new unfettered residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal would result in an undesirable and sporadic form of development into the countryside to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this context, the public benefits of the scheme do not outweigh the harm caused contrary to policies 2, 3, 7, 9, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 11, 12, 79, 127, 130, 184, 189 and 192 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. By the same actions the proposal would harm the Outstanding Universal Value of the World Heritage Site contrary to Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030.

Address: Land South East Of Rock Cottage Pentewan St Austell Cornwall PL26 6BU
Description: Erection of Garage Hardstanding and Crossover
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would introduce development within Flood Zone 3. The proposed development would not provide wider sustainability benefits to the community that outweigh flood risk and is therefore contrary to the guidance set out within the paragraphs 155, 158 to 160 and 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies 2 and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 The proposal is not considered to conserve or enhance the character and beauty of the sensitive location which forms part of an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. In the absence of any overriding economic or social benefit, the harmful impact anticipated upon the character of the AONB results in the proposal being considered an unsustainable form of development, conflicting with the aims and intentions of Policy 1,2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South East Of Otterham Mill Mill Road Otterham Camelford Cornwall PL32 9YR
Description: The siting of a mobile home on agricultural land for use as an agricultural worker's supervisory dwelling for a period of three years
RefusalReasons: 1 The application fails to demonstrate a functional requirement for a further new residential unit in connection with the agricultural enterprise in this location. In the absence of any identified need, the development if approved would constitute a new dwelling in the countryside to detriment of the rural and undeveloped nature of the site, contrary to the principles of sustainability embodied in policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010-2030 (adopted November 2016). 2 The application fails to demonstrate the proposed accommodation would not be at risk from flooding, contrary to policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Land And Buildings Adj To 2 Dukes Plot Dukes Plot Primrose Hill Goldsithney Penzance Cornwall TR20 9JS
Description: Conversion of a garage (more recently used as a workshop/store) to bed and breakfast accommodation
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would not be sustainably located having particular regard to accessibility and its location within the open countryside. The proposal therefore fails to accord with the aims and intentions set out within Policies 1 and 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 83 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Retreat Tredragon Road Mawgan Porth Newquay TR8 4DF
Description: Demolition of dwelling and construction of replacement dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed new home, by reason of its siting, height, scale, design and overall appearance, fails to promote local distinctiveness and would appear as a prominent, discordant and jarring feature within the context of the surrounding settlement. The application is therefore not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 122, 127 and 130 and 131 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: St Mellion Estate St Mellion PL12 6SD
Description: Outline application with all matters reserved except access for the construction of assisted living/extra care village (restricted to over 65) comprising 30 independent living homes, 68 independent living apartments, 64 bed nursing home (to include ancillary building incorporating office, reception, one doctor GP surgery, pharmacy, lounge areas (Class C2). Combined holiday lodge reception (to include office, exhibition, farm shop, post office, cafe, microbrewery, artisan bakery, site security, holiday lodge laundrette and bike hire/storage compound uses, wc/shower block). Kitchen Market Garden, glamping field for 12 glamping pods. Construction of new golf driving range shelter (to include toilet block) and new golf catch net (demolition of existing golf driving range). Sports building to include swimming pool and associated facilities, climbing wall, badminton court, creche and zipwire. 10 holiday lodges, St Mellion Foundation Building and repair store, shop and cycle hire and St Mellion Open sided Community Open Air Learning Hub. Visitor/staff car parking to include other associated infrastructure (electric charging points, drop off/pick up points and new village green). Demolition of existing staff bungalow.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would result in a significant quantum of residential development, divorced from population centres in a location primarily dependent upon the use of private motor vehicles.  As such it is considered to conflict with the spatial strategy in place for Cornwall and to be fundamentally unsustainable in nature. On a site with a history of non-implemented or part-implemented permissions, no financial substantiation has been received to indicate the proposal's deliverability and viability. As such the proposal conflicts with Policies 1,2,3,4, 7 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016. 2 The proposal, by introducing a large quantum of built form into the land north of the Grade I St Mellanus Church would harmfully degrade the setting of that asset. Similarly (although to a lesser degree) through increasing the density of development on 2 sides of the Grade II listed Horsepool Farmhouse, its once isolated rural setting would be further degraded. Through these harmful impacts - to which great weight must be afforded - the proposal conflicts with Policies 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016. 3 No mechanism has been secured to ensure mitigation against the otherwise harmful impacts of the proposal upon existing infrastructure, with particular regard to the provision of affordable housing and of primary healthcare facilities. As such the proposal conflicts with Policies 8 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016. 4 In the absence of a mechanism to secure contributions towards mitigation of harmful impacts resulting from the proposal, it has not been possible for the Council as Competent Authority to be able to conclude that there would be no impact on the integrity of the Tamar Estuaries and Plymouth Sound habitat sites as a result of the proposed development. As such the proposal conflicts with the Habitats Directive and Policies 22 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016.

Address: Kerris Farm Access To Kerris Paul TR19 6UY
Description: Milking parlour and cow kennels buildings, slurry lagoon and farm tracks
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of further in-combination assessments together with consideration of possible mitigation options to reduce ammonia emissions, the application has failed to demonstrate that it would not have a significant adverse effect on the interest features of the nearby Chyenhal Moor Site of Special Scientific Interest. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 174 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a heritage assessment (including the results of a geophysical survey) to explore whether the site contains buried archaeology from medieval and earlier periods, the application has failed to demonstrate that the proposal would not lead to substantial harm to heritage assets of the highest significance. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 189 and 194 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Dev_Type: All other small scale major developments

Address: Windy Ridge Road From Junction At Lyndale To Carnkief Perranwell Goonhavern TR4 9PB
Description: Application for 1no additional mobile home on existing Traveller site
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement, and does not represent an easily and safely accessible site for all intended occupants and visitors, through the lack of any vehicular access and the constraints of the 145m length of a public footpath that is narrow, bending, on a steep gradient, undulated surfacing with loose materials rocks and roots and is not equipped with any lighting. The proposed unit of accommodation would, therefore, not represent sustainable development and would result in harm to the intrinsic character of the surrounding rural setting given its excessive scale and siting on the opposite site of the footpath to the existing structures on site, in conflict with the aim and intensions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 11, 12, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 4, 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and paragraphs 4, 13 and 25 of the Planning Policy for Traveller Sites 2015.

Address: Chyreen Road From Marble Head Cottage To The Old Barn Restronguet Point Feock TR3 6RB
Description: Proposed repairs to the seawall and the construction of a replacement boathouse
RefusalReasons: 1 The site is within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty which is a designated landscape afforded the highest level of protection and should be protected from harm. Due to the prominence, scale, design and amount of glazing of the boathouse within the waterfront landscape, the proposal would harmfully add further to the cumulative erosion of the tranquillity of the shore line, especially from light spill in the nocturnal landscape. The proposal will, therefore result in harm to the character of the AONB contrary to Policies BIO1, LS1 and LS2 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan, Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 173 National Planing Policy Framework and Policy SCC09.1 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan.

Address: Land North Of St Agnes School Trelawney Road St Agnes Cornwall
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for the residential development of three dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site does not represent an acceptable form of rounding off or infill as defined in Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan and would result in an undesirable extension of the built form into the adjoining countryside to the detriment of the rural character and appearance of the area contrary to policies 3 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and policies 1, 6, 7, and 10 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030. 2 The proposed development by reason of the potential infilling and overwriting of a field which may to relate to a 'mineworkers' smallholding could substantially and irrevocably harm the legibility and integrity of this attribute within the WHS resulting in possible unacceptable detrimental impact upon one of the seven landscape attributes of the World Heritage Site that are, in this instance, rare survivals within the immediate environs of St Agnes causing substantial harm to the designated heritage asset. Therefore in the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise the proposals do not accord with the aim and objectives of policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010- 2030, policy 11 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030 and Section 16 of the NPPF 2019. 3 In the absence of adequate information regarding the potential impact on ecology, it is not possible to assess the impact and effects on the proposed residential development in respect of protected species or whether a net gain in biodiversity could be achieved. Consequently the proposal is contrary to paragraphs 175 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policies 22 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010- 2030 and policy 12 of the St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030. 4 In the absence of adequate information regarding potentially contaminated land, it is not possible to assess the impact and effects on the proposed residential development in respect of the safe occupation of the proposed dwellings. Consequently the proposal is contrary to paragraphs 178 and 179 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010- 2030.

Address: Crooked Inn (Managers Dwelling) Liskeard Road Trematon Saltash PL12 4RZ
Description: Variation of condition 5 of decision PA13/03126 dated 11/10/2013 Alterations and variations to extant consented managers dwelling (under construction) and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The information submitted with this application has failed to convincingly demonstrate that the permitted managers accommodation is no longer required in association with the existing business and that there is sufficient and lawful space within the existing Crooked Inn premises to accommodate a manager.
