The marketing campaign of the property is not sufficiently robust, in particular, the confidential nature of the marketing, in combination with the high price point the property was advertised at, has failed to establish that the condition restricting the occupancy of the dwelling to a manager or proprietor of the Crooked Inn is unreasonable and unnecessary, with reference to the requirements of paragraph 55 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. The proposal would therefore effectively result in the creation an open market dwelling in an unsustainable, open countryside location contrary to policies 1, 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016).

Address: Land North East Of Florence Mews Florence Hill Callington Cornwall PL17 8DZ
Description: Outline application for residential Development (up to 9 dwellings) with all matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development due to its countryside position which is beyond the established built form of Callington is not well related to the town. The development would result in unjustified development of undeveloped fields which would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the area and to the setting of Tamar Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. In the absence of the special circumstance to justify development in this location, this proposal does not represent sustainable development and would be contrary to Policy 3 subsection 1, policy 7, policy 12 subsection 1 and policy 23 subsections 2 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraphs 8, 11, 174, 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. 2 In the absence of a mechanism to secure the provision off-site financial contributions towards educational infrastructure; and off-site financial contributions towards European Site Mitigation the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 22 and 28 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Cornwall Council Guidance on S106 Planning Obligations for Education Provision 2018.

Address: Tresarran Cottages School Hill Herodsfoot PL14 4QX
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the retention of mobile caravan for residential purposes.
RefusalReasons: 1 The evidence submitted in support of this application and the evidence in the possession of the Local Planning Authority fails to demonstrate, on the balance of probability, that the mobile home as identified on Location Plan (ref. TQRQM20094170025794) and Block Plan (ref. TQRQM20094165136338), received on the 24th June 2020 has been sited and used as permanent residential accommodation for in excess of 10 years.

Address: Trevone Quarry, The Forge Trevone Mabe Burnthouse TR10 9JQ
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use for 1. Mixed use of blacksmiths forge/artist studio/office/residential dwelling and 2. Ancillary domestic use/sound recording studio/workshop/office
RefusalReasons: 1 Based on the documentation provided in support of the application, and having regard to other information available to and received by the Local Planning Authority, it is considered that the applicant has failed to demonstrate, on the 'balance of probability', that building 1 on drawing no. 001 (Site Plan) has been used as a mixed use of blacksmiths forge/artists studio/office/residential dwelling for a continuous period of ten years prior to the submission of this application, and that building 2 on drawing no. 001 (Site Plan) has been used for an ancillary domestic use/sound recording studio/workshop/office for a continuous period of ten years prior to the submission of this application. The Council, therefore, does not consider that the use of the buildings are lawful by virtue of immunity from enforcement action under Sections 171B (3) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended), and refuses to grant the Certificate of Lawful Use (existing use) being applied for.

Address: Shangri La 4 Winsor Estate Pelynt Looe Cornwall PL13 2JY
Description: Outline application for construction of dwelling and vehicular access with all matters except access and layout reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The visibility sight lines proposed are substandard based on actual road speeds, and cannot be achieved as they overrun third party land outside the control of the applicant. The application therefore fails to demonstrate that a safe and suitable access to the development can be achieved and is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 110 and 111 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 9 Boscundle Close Boscundle St Austell Cornwall
Description: Proposed Woodland Holiday Lodges and associated works
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would introduce new holiday accommodation, with its access and egress, within Flood Zone 3 and there are alternative sites within the Par and St Blazey Community Network Area with a lower level of flood risk which exist to provide for the development proposed by this application. The proposed development would not provide wider sustainability benefits to the community that outweigh flood risk and is therefore contrary to the guidance set out within the paragraphs 155, 158 to 160 and 163 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policy 2, 16 and 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. 2 The proposed development of the site for three holiday letting units by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable new holiday development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic form of development that would be harmful to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside.  The development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 3 The proposed siting of the Holiday lodges in this location is considered to be harmful by virtue of the loss of trees and green space and the creation of a new access, which are features which contribute positively to the setting of the wider woodland. The development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 4 In the absence of adequate ecological survey, the application fails to demonstrate that the proposal would conserve and enhance habitat and biodiversity. As such, this proposal is contrary to Policy 23(4) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) and the aims and intentions of Paragraphs 118 (b) and 170 (a) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Chypons Residential Home Clifton Hill Newlyn Penzance Cornwall TR18 5BU
Description: Change of use with external and internal alterations of existing two storey building to provide 4no. Sheltered/Extra care flats (Use Class C3(a)). Revised Design of previous application PA19/05355. Construction of third floor extension to provide a Sheltered/extra care flat (Use Class C3(a)). Extension of existing external fire escape vertically to proposed third floor. 5no Sheltered/Extra Care flats in total (Use Class C3(a)).
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal by virtue of the increase in height, mass and elevations, resulting in the loss of the stepped roofscape and loss of views across Newlyn Conservation Area, neither preserves or enhances the Newlyn Conservation Area. Whilst the proposal would provide some public benefits through the provision of housing, this does not outweigh the identified less than substantial harm. The proposal fails to comply with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 184, 189 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. The proposal is also contrary to Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 2 Managing Significance in Decision-Taking in the Historic Environment 2015 and Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 3, The Setting of Heritage Assets (2nd Edition) and Cornwall and Scilly Urban Survey 2003, Newlyn.

Address: 15 Polkirt Hill Mevagissey PL26 6UR
Description: Demolition of structurally unsafe dwelling and construction of new dwelling on same footprint
RefusalReasons: 1The proposal, by reason of the complete demolition of the existing building and associated loss of historic fabric/character and the increased ridge height of the replacement dwelling, would result in harm to attributes of the surrounding conservation area and setting of nearby Grade II listed buildings.  This harm is not outweighed by the public benefits associated with the proposed reinstatement of a home within a settlement and the application is, therefore, contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan; Policy HC1 of the Mevagissey Neighbourhood Development Plan; paragraphs 193, 194 and 196 of the NPPF; and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land Adjacent To Rame Cottages Rame Head Torpoint PL10 1LH
Description: Development of a detached two storey agricultural dwelling with garage and parking
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development as a result of its siting, scale, materials and design will result in a prominent and incongruous addition to the coastal plateau that will harm the landscape and distinctive scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and Heritage Coast. The social and economic benefits of the development do not outweigh the landscape harm.  The proposed development is contrary to Policy 5 of the Rame Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030 (made 28th June 2017), Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021 and paragraphs 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land West Of The Hermitage Bodieve Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6EG
Description: Outline application for a proposed new dwelling with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would deliver open market housing that through domestication of the site erodes the natural verdant qualities of the site and adversely impacts upon the character of the open countryside and provide constrained non-vehicular accessibility to services and facilities to future occupiers.  The proposal does not accord with the spatial strategy pursued by this Council in the development plan and accordingly the proposal fails to comply with the development plan provisions contained within policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21, or 23 and saved policy ENV1 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The limited economic and social benefits of the development including the delivery of housing to support the role and function of the settlement, the construction jobs that would be created, do not outweigh the environmental harm nor the conflict with the development plan and the proposal is not considered to represent sustainable development.

Address: Land South Of The Cottage Trelana Northcott Mouth Road Poughill Bude Cornwall EX23 9EL
Description: Outline planning for a two storey dwelling with all matters except access reserved
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would increase the amount of vehicular traffic accessing and egressing the site, which due to limited visibility for drivers would require dangerous manoeuvres into or from the highway. The proposed development fails therefore to provide a safe and suitable access. Whilst this could be overcome through a revised access arrangement; this would necessitate the removal of a section of an historic wall on the western boundary of the site. This would result in a compromise to the wall which is considered to represent a non-designated heritage asset. The wall appears on historic mapping, and is one of a number of wall features that are referenced as enclosures within the Poughill Conservation Area Management Plan 2010. The wall arrangement functions as a clear distinction, narrowing from the newer development to the north of the settlement, down into the historic core of Poughill.  The loss of walling required to facilitate a safe access would result in the loss of historic fabric and its appearance would not be akin to the established local trend and will erode the historic enclosure failing to preserve the character and appearance of the Poughill Conservation Area. The benefits of the proposed development would  not be outweighed by this harm. The proposal is therefore contrary to Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990;  Policy 23 of the Bude-Stratton Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030; policies 24 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 127 and 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: St Johns Ambulance Garage Rawlings Lane Fowey PL23 1DT
Description: Addition of a one bed apartment above garage to include raising of ridge height and addition of balcony and access staircase to the east elevation
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed works would, with the addition of the first floor and balcony area would add additional raised massing, increasing the scale of the building, and add an alien feature to the street scene in the form of the spiral staircase, constituting a design that would be materially harmful to the character and appearance of the area. The works would be contrary to Policy 2 and 12 point a of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010, NDP Policies 2, 6 and 8 and section 12 paragraph 127 point a and b of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The raised balcony area with associated screening and the increase elevated massing of the proposal would have an adverse overbearing and overlooking impact on the neighbouring property Drakenhuis, Rawlings Lane, Fowey. The works would be contrary to Policy 2 and policy 12 point 2 a of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010, NDP Policies point 7.7 and paragraph 127 point f of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Fishermans Rest Nancherrow St Just TR19 7PW
Description: Construction of 8 Dwelling Houses, Creation of Parking, Landscaping and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1 Whilst the proposed development is considered to be more reflective of the prevailing character of Nancherrow/Tregeseal and would be set lower in the site compared to the previous refused scheme (PA18/03982), its increased density with large areas of associated parking and hardstandings which would continue to be visible above and through the neighbouring dwellings to the south, coupled with its siting to the rear (north) of an existing low-quality development in the Conservation Area which would further diminish the characteristic linear settlement pattern, is considered to harm the character and appearance of the Nancherrow and Tregeseal Conservation Area and the St Just Mining District World Heritage Site, and fail to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Furthermore, the level of harm is considered to be substantial and to not be outweighed by substantial public benefits. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of S72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; paragraphs 8, 127, 170, 172, 184, 192, 193 and 195 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019; policies C2 and C7 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013-2018; and Policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 Whilst the proposed dwellings would be set lower in the site compared to the previous refused scheme (PA18/03982), the increased number of dwellings which would continue to rise fairly significantly above the neighbouring dwellings to the south in Old Foundry Close from a relatively close distance, thereby diminishing the benefits of their height reduction, coupled with the lack of space for meaningful mitigation planting, is considered to result in a continued imposing visual impact upon these neighbouring dwellings, to the detriment of their residential amenities. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Ivanhoe, Flat 2 52 Edgcumbe Avenue Newquay TR7 2NJ
Description: Remove front garden wall to form off road parking with new crossover to 52 - 54 Edgcumbe Ave
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development comprises of the creation of a single off-road parking space, resulting in the undesirable loss of two on-street spaces. The lack of adequate space shall lead to vehicles parking over a proportion of the pavement and the space, as shown on plan, does not amount to 4.8m long and will consequently also have the potential to obstruct main access to the property. Public benefits do not outweigh the highway safety concerns and the proposal is not sustainable development and conflicts with Policy D1 and H4 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019, Policy 2 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraph 8 and 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The proposed development shall represent a poor design that harms the character and appearance of the area through the removal of the front enclosure and introduction of vehicles parked on the front courtyard area that would be incongruous to the prevailing character of the surrounding area. It would displace two public on-street spaces for the creation of one substandard space that will increase conflict between pedestrians and vehicles. The proposal is contrary to Policy D1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan, Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Flat 3 Ashley House 14 Esplanade Fowey Cornwall PL23 1HY
Description: Removal of existing chalet containing ancillary domestic accommodation and construction of new building containing ancillary accommodation. Replacement windows.
RefusalReasons: 1 The outbuilding proposed by this application, by reasons of its use, scale, siting and design, would appear cramped within its immediate setting and overtly modern in appearance. The application, therefore, harms the surrounding conservation area and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan; policies 2 and 8 of the Fowey Neighbourhood Development Plan; paragraphs 124, 127, 130, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework; and Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: 78 Carn Brea Lane Pool TR15 3DS
Description: Demolition of single detached dwelling and replacement with student accommodation.
RefusalReasons: 1 The development involves the demolition of an existing property which makes a significant, important contribution to the setting and the outstanding universal value of the World Heritage Site, with this contribution arising not only from the physical form and visual appearance of the structure but also the association with historic mining activity. The harm incurred to the historic environment through the loss of this building is not outweighed by any clear justification or demonstrable overriding public benefit. The proposal is therefore contrary to policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 189, 197, 200 and 201 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Loveton Vollards Lane Hatt Cornwall PL12 6PT
Description: Construction of four detached bungalows with private drive access
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal, in seeking to erect 4 dwellings in an open countryside location beyond the clearly demarcated boundary of a village itself lacking in facilities and services would conflict with the spatial strategy of Cornwall's development plan; it would be an unsustainable form of development; and it would degrade the rural character of the locality. As such the proposal conflicts with Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the advice within paragraphs 79 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Building Rear Of 39 Trevethan Road Five Fields Lane Falmouth Cornwall TR11 2LL
Description: Demolition of existing garage and erection of new dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling by reason of its excessive scale and massing, constructed on a restricted site in close proximity to Five Fields Lane, would have a visually prominent and detrimental impact on the character and appearance of this part of the Five Fields Lane street scene contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies and Policies DG1, DG2 and DG4 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030.

Address: Carrick House Pydar Street Truro TR1 1DT
Description: Outline planning application with all matters reserved for up to 320 dwellings, up to 400 student bed spaces, up to 21,000sqm of floor space to include leisure, office, hotel, community, small retail, education/innovation and food and beverage units and associated works including Environmental Impact Assessment.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would, due to the proposed scale and massing of the buildings, result in a development that is too large and obtrusive upon the streetscape and out of character with the City of Truro and the adjoining Truro Conservation Area, obscuring the city's bowl skyline and the setting of Listed Buildings such as the Cathedral, Viaduct and Brunel Piers.  As such, the proposal would fail to preserve and enhance the character and appearance of Truro Conservation Area and wider appreciation of Truro whilst also harm the setting and appearance of designated heritage assets namely Truro Cathedral, the Viaduct and Brunel Piers. The less than substantial harm identified would outweigh the benefits of the proposal and the development would be contrary to the aims of Policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policies E4, EJ2 and C1 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030, paragraphs 8, 124, 127, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, guidance within the Truro Conservation Area Management Plan 2010 and Sections 66 and 72 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Area) Act 1990. 2 The proposed development would, due to the loss of car parking to serve Truro City Centre combined with the absence of any suitable replacement provision, restrict access to the City Centre for residents and visitors contrary to the aims of Policies E1, EJ1, EJ2 and T3 of the Truro and Kenwyn Neighbourhood Plan 2015-2030, Policies 1, 2 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Os Field 9019 Crava Lane Ashton TR13 9SE
Description: Change of use and conversion of redundant agricultural building to form a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would not result in the reuse of a suitably constructed disused rural building which is considered appropriate to retain by reason of its rudimentary construction and small size, and if converted, it would not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting due to the introduction of domestic paraphernalia within the open countryside and its increase roof mass, contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 78, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South West Of Ouistreham Indian Queens Cornwall TR9 6QS
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved for the construction of a new dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1 The new home proposed by this application, by reasons of the restricted shape and size of the application site, would appear cramped within the context of the site and surrounding properties to the detriment of the character of the area. The application is, therefore, contrary to policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan; Design Policy 1 of the St Enoder Neighbourhood Development Plan; and paragraphs 124, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 1 Beach Road Newquay TR7 1ES
Description: Conversion of bar and night club into 5 No. residential flats and 2 No. retail units (re-submission of refused application no. PA18/08239)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal by reasons of its vertical scale and overall bulk would not have an acceptable visual relationship with the buildings to which it is attached and would be materially harmful to the character and appearance of the area. The lack of architectural detailing, or articulation of the primary elevations, exacerbates the imposing mass of the dominating faÃ§ades. It would be contrary to Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Paragraph 124 of the National Planning Policy Framework along with Policy G2 (c) of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030 insofar as they seek high quality design which shows an understanding of townscape. 2 The proposed residential units have been designed with large windows opening onto two of the busiest night-time economy streets in Newquay. It is considered that the residential amenities of the occupiers of such units could suffer, particularly from excessive noise disturbance. The information contained within the noise impact assessment supplied with the application is considered to be insufficient to adequately demonstrate that a significant adverse effect upon the amenity of future occupiers of the proposed residential units would be unlikely to occur. As such, the proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Mullion Gallery Nansmellyon Road Mullion TR12 7DQ
Description: Proposed Demolition of former gallery to form 3 dwellings
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development by reason of its scale, massing and design, would result in an inappropriate form of development that, if permitted, would fail to respect the scale, character and appearance of the surrounding area and hence not respect local distinctiveness. The proposal is accordingly contrary to Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: St Columb Minor Methodist Church Church Street St Columb Minor Newquay TR7 3ES
Description: Conversion of Grade II listed former chapel into two apartments. Demolish flat roof extension and erect six apartments
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed change of use would cause less than substantial harm to the Grade II Listed Church. This harm would be at the higher end of the scale due to the loss of significant fixtures and fittings and the enclosure of the open, grand and atmospheric character of the interior. It has not been sufficiently demonstrated that other, less harmful uses for the building are not possible. The benefits of the proposal do not outweigh the identified harm which has been given considerable weight and importance in the planning balance. The proposal would therefore conflict with Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016; Policy HC1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019; paragraphs 193, 194 and 196 of the NPPF; and Section 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990. 2 The proposal does not provide 2 parking spaces per unit in an area where on street parking is not readily available, and services and facilities required for day to day living are not easily accessible other than by car. In addition, it has not been demonstrated that a proposal for less residential units on the site is not viable. The proposal therefore conflicts with Policy H4 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan 2019. 3 The proposed site does not provide sufficient amenity space to meet the functional and recreational needs of the future occupants. The proposal would therefore conflict with Policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, and the guidance contained with the Cornwall Design Guide 2013.

Address: Land Off Mill Lane Charlestown Road Charlestown Cornwall
Description: Residential Dwelling to include associated site works and alteration/formation of vehicular/pedestrian access.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed dwelling would result in a negative and harmful impact on the character and appearance of the area with the erosion of the open space and agricultural fields and scrubland, the impact on the character and appearance of the Conservation area and World Heritage Site is considered to outweigh any benefits of this proposal and therefore the proposal does not comply with Policies 1, 3 7, 12, 21, and 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph's 8, 11, 14, 79, 104, 153, 159, 174 179, 180, of the NPPF 21 and the Charlestown Conservation Area Appraisal Management Plan. 2 The application site is outside of the settlement of Charlestown and is considered within the open countryside and would weaken Charlestown's identity as a significant historic place distinct from the neighbouring settlements of St Austell, Duporth and Carlyon Bay. Furthermore, the siting, scale, massing, design, form and use of materials of the proposed dwelling would be alien to the historic character of Charlestown and would fail to enhance or better reveal the significance of the setting of the Charlestown Conservation Area and World Heritage Site, the proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 3, 7 12, 13 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 179, 180, 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, the recommendations on page 59 of the Charlestown Conservation Area Character Appraisal and Management Plan and Policies P3 and C7 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013. 3 The application fails to comply with the habitat directives in that there is no overriding public interest for the proposal and there would be a disturbance to foraging and commuting bats. The application is therefore contrary to policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 adopted 2016;  paragraphs 179 and 180 of the NPPF 2021 the Conservation of Habitat and Species Regulations and Circular 06/2005

Address: Weir Cottage Restronguet Weir Mylor Bridge Cornwall TR11 5SS
Description: New boathouse and slipway
RefusalReasons: 1 The application involves the construction of a new boathouse and slipway in the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty however, the proposal would incur significant visual harm to the immediate setting and surrounding natural environment resulting in landscape and visual harm to the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposal is considered contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the CLP, paragraphs 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 (NPPF) and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021. 2 The submitted information is insufficient to enable the Local Planning Authority to assess the impacts on protected species. The proposal thus conflicts with CLP policy 23 and paragraphs 176 and 180 of the NPPF. 3 The proposal does not sustain the cultural distinctiveness and significance of Cornwall's historic rural, urban and coastal environment by protecting, conserving and where appropriate enhancing the significance of designated and non-designated assets and their settings. It is therefore considered that the proposed development is not consistent with Policy 24 of the CLP and the duty under Section 66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended) nor meet the requirements of NPPF paragraphs 200 and 203).

Address: Land South West Of Woodlands Barton Wireless Road Tremoddrett Roche Cornwall PL26 8LW
Description: Proposed change of use from agriculture to B8 storage and distribution, hard-surfacing, installation of CCTV and siting of three portable buildings
RefusalReasons: 1 Policy 3 'Role and Functions of Places' of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 (the Development Plan) states that the delivery of growth will be managed in main towns through site allocations document and outside of main towns through the identification of sites through Neighbourhood Plans. The application site is not identified as an employment site within the Roche Neighbourhood Development Plan. The proposed introduction of an industrial business project into the countryside would appear incongruous in its setting thereby harming the rural character of the area. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 3, 5 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan strategic policies 2010-2030 and Policy C1 of the Roche Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Land East Of Sea View Terrace Sea View Terrace Whitcross Hill Carn Brea Cornwall TR15 3YD
Description: 2 new houses
RefusalReasons: 1 The application site is located within the countryside, outside of any defined settlement. The proposed dwellings therefore represent unjustified and sporadic development within the open countryside with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements.  The proposed new dwellings, by reason of their siting and design would result in harm to the distinctive character of the area and would appear incongruous within the countryside and the World Heritage Site. The public benefits of the scheme are limited in providing two new dwellings to the local housing stock but this does not outweigh the identified harm. The application is not sustainable development and is considered to be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 130, 174, 189, 197, 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Off Bodiniel Road Bodmin Cornwall
Description: Construction of a single dwelling and ancillary site works (re-submission of refused application no. PA18/08575)
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal would result in some overlooking and likely perception of overlooking from the proposed garden area, to the garden area of no. 6 Flaxmoor Terrace. It is concluded that this could not be mitigated to an acceptable extent through the use of conditions. This loss of privacy to the largely private garden area, would have a significant and adverse impact on the living conditions of the occupiers of no. 6 Flaxmoor Terrace. It is concluded that the proposal would conflict with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 which requires development proposals to protect individuals and property from overlooking and unreasonable loss of privacy. In coming to this view, the Council have taken account of the Human Rights Act 1998, and the Public Sector Equality Duty contained in the Equality Act 2010. Having regard to the special circumstances of the case, the interference would be to such an extent that the proportionate response is that the proposal should not be approved. The proposal would not accord with the development plan when considered as a whole and there are no material considerations that outweigh the identified harm and the associated development plan conflict. 2 The submitted ecological appraisal and bat activity surveys were undertaken in 2017. The survey work is out of date. In the absence of up to date survey work, it has not been demonstrated that the proposal would not adversely affect protected species. The proposal therefore conflicts with Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981.

Address: Land North West Of Meadowside Gorran St Austell Cornwall PL26 6HN
Description: Erection of 17 dwellings (10 affordable dwellings and 7 open market dwellings) and associated access road, parking and open space
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposal is not affordable housing led, with open market dwellings occupying more land on the application site than affordable dwellings; in the absence of evidence to demonstrate otherwise, the proposal would result in the loss of best and most versatile agricultural land; and the proposed introduction of 17 new homes with associated infrastructure onto an undeveloped field would harm the distinctive rural character of the area to the detriment of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The application fails to provide special justification to allow new homes in the countryside, is not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 7, 9, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; paragraphs 100, 101, 103 and 104 in the Cornwall Council Housing Supplementary Planning Document; and paragraphs 8, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework. 2 The proposal would result in less than substantial harm to the setting of a Grade II* Listed Building, St Gorran Church, by introducing the proposed 17 new homes and associated infrastructure onto a nearby undeveloped field. The public benefits associated with the proposal do not outweigh this harm and the application is therefore contrary to polices 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Tregoddick Farm Vingoes Lane Madron TR20 8SS
Description: Residential development of up to 17 dwellings (outline with all matters reserved)
RefusalReasons: 1 In the absence of a satisfactory s106 Legal agreement the proposal fails to make satisfactory provision for on-site affordable housing, and off-site improvements to public open space and education facilities and is therefore contrary to the relevant requirements of Cornwall Local Plan policies 9 and 28.

Address: Seaskape Penberthy Road Portreath Redruth Cornwall TR16 4LR
Description: To demolish existing Mundic bungalow and build four flats.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed development would increase the number of dwellings within Flood Zone 3a in a location where the only access to the site is within Flood Zone 3b. The proposal has not demonstrated that there are no other appropriate sites at a lower flood risk where the residential development could be sited thus the proposal does not pass the sequential test and is contrary to Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 policy 26 and paragraphs 155, 158 and 163 (e) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. 2 The site is within the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site the Outstanding Universal Value of which should be protected form harm and is seen within the context of two Grade II Listed Buildings the settings of which should be protected from harm as required by Section 66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990. The proposed building by virtue of its prominent location and unsympathetic design which does not have regard to the historic context will erode the setting of the listed buildings and fail to preserve the setting of the Methodist Church and thus does not conserve or enhance the character of this part of the World Heritage Site. The proposal is thus contrary to paragraphs 184, 192, 193, 194 and 195 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and policies C2 and C7 of the World Heritage Site Management Plan.

Address: 4 Casebourne Mews Bude EX23 8EG
Description: Lawful development certificate for a proposed loft conversion.
RefusalReasons: Class C (other alterations to the roof of a dwellinghouse) of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) rights for property are removed by way of Condition 4 of planning permission E1/2004/01804. Therefore as permitted development rights have been removed by the above, planning permission will be required for the proposed roof alterations to 4 Casebourne Mews.

Address: Land East Of Greenhills Egloskerry Launceston Cornwall PL15 8SG
Description: Telecommunications prior notification for proposed pole and antenna
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority has had regard to the requirements to improve telecommunications networks and recognises that there is increasing pressure on the network providers to improve the telecommunication infrastructure. However, this has to be balanced against the visual impact. It is considered that the development by virtue of its height, location on a verge and proximity to highways would be highly conspicuous and an incongruous addition in the rural landscape which would be detrimental to the character and distinctive landscape qualities of the Area of Great Landscape Value and would obscure visibility to the East when egressing the agricultural field gateways. The application is therefore refused due to its conflict with policies 1, 2 12, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 115 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 7 Coronation Way Newquay Cornwall TR7 3JL
Description: Two storey flat roof rear extension and internal alterations
RefusalReasons: The proposed scheme by reason of its siting and height would result in an unacceptable loss of light to the rear facing ground floor habitable rooms of 5 Coronation Way. The height and siting of the proposed extension would also have an overbearing/dominant effect on this neighbouring dwelling impacting on the occupants' enjoyment of their property. The scheme would conflict with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, which seek, amongst other matters, to ensure new development does not adversely affect the amenity of neighbouring properties.

Address: Marlborough House Silverdale Road Falmouth Cornwall TR11 4HW
Description: Works to trees namely:- removal of 8 Beech Trees within G3 - subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: The trees are of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the local area. The proposed felling and subsequent loss of the trees would result in a detrimental impact upon the local landscape. The reasons given for felling the trees does not comprise clear and convincing evidence necessary to justify the extent of works as proposed. These trees have high amenity value, providing an important contribution to the character and appearance of the area. Replacement planting would not adequately replace the amenity that would be lost for a number of years.

Address: Polgrain Turning, Polgrain Barn Gypsy Corner Road St Wenn Bodmin PL30 5PR
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of a building as a self contained residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority considers that the evidence provided in support of the application is not sufficiently precise and unambiguous to discharge the Applicants' onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, that the building has been used as a self-contained dwelling for a period of 4 years or more, and that this planning breach was continuous. The Council, therefore, does not consider that the use of the building is lawful by virtue of immunity from enforcement action under Sections 171B (2) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended), and refuses to grant the Certificate of Lawful Use (existing use) being applied for.

Address: Land At Former Piggery Halsetown St Ives Cornwall TR26 3LY
Description: Conversion of Former Piggery to Form Residential Dwelling Subject to H2 Restrictions.
RefusalReasons: The remains of the building, by reason of the scale, condition and appearance, would require significant reconstruction, rebuilding and extension in order to facilitate a residential use; without such work, it would not be capable of being converted into a habitable dwelling.  Therefore, the development would be tantamount to a new dwelling in an unsustainable location in the open countryside, for which no special justification has been presented. The proposed use with the associated domestic paraphernalia in this rural context would fail to enhance the immediate setting and as such, the special qualities and attributes of this historic rural landscape would be harmed contrary to the aims of policies GD1 and BE15 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030, policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 80, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 6 Daws Meadow Camelford Cornwall PL32 9PX
Description: Works to trees subject to a Tree Preservation Order: fell Ash tree because of ash die back and replace with anything other than ash.
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the trees are of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the local area.  There is insufficient justification for the removal of the tree and clear and convincing arboricultural evidence to justify the removal of the trees has not been submitted. The proposed removal of the trees would therefore result in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape, contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Bosliven Farm Access To Bosliven Bosliven St Buryan TR19 6BD
Description: Listed Building Consent for removal of the existing Scantle roof slates, replacing it with a dry laid small uniform Spanish natural slate.
RefusalReasons: The proposed removal of an historic wet-laid Cornish Scantle slate roof and its replacement with a lesser, inauthentic slate that fails to replicate or mimic the variable widths and the diminishing coursing of the existing roof is considered to lead to less than substantial harm to the significance of a designated heritage asset. The proposed works fail to preserve the special character of the Grade II listed building The National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed replacement roof covering has been set out above. Although the works necessary to undertake the works may be considered to result in some public benefit by way of employment and associated benefits to the local economy, the proposed works would raise concerns relating to the historic environment that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10, 7.3, 7.6 and 7.7 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 130, 134, 189, 194, 197, 199, 200, 202, 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The works fail to accord with the Council's statutory duties under sections 16(2) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 in that the Listed Building would not be preserved

Address: Tower View Quarry Lane St Germans PL12 5LL
Description: To fell a single self sown / non-native eucalyptus that is A) at risk for splitting and damaging property, B) has already damaged a grade 1 retaining wall and C) has rendered a path unusable / unsafe.
RefusalReasons: Current Government guidance for Tree Preservation Orders that advises that an applicant needs to advance sound reasons before consent to fell trees should be granted. The submitted evidence does not constitute substantive reason to remove a tree in its entirety. Clear and convincing evidence to justify the felling of the subject tree has not been presented in support of this application. Due to the lack of substantive evidence the application is refused.

Address: Higher Laity Farm Access To Higher Laity Farm Old Portreath Road Redruth TR16 4HY
Description: To erect a two storey Dayroom, utility, w.c. and bedroom extension
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension, by reason of its bulk, positioning, design and finish, would dominate and detract from the traditional character of the original building which, at present, contributes positively to the distinctive character and appearance of the Cornish countryside landscape. The proposal would therefore conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Local Plan, paragraphs 126, 130 and 174 of the Framework and the Cornwall Design Guide 2013. This reason for refusal is in accordance with guidance contained within paragraph 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: East Helscott Farm House East Helscott Marhamchurch Bude Cornwall EX23 0ND
Description: Two-storey rear extension to dwelling.
RefusalReasons: Insufficient information has been provided in relation to the level of activity and presence of bats to establish whether a favourable conservation status of European Protected Species can be maintained; contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Kerrier Way Camborne TR14 8DB
Description: Prior Notification for the proposed installation of a 15.0m Phase 8 Monopole C/W wrapround Cabinet at base and associated ancillary works.
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority has had regard to the requirements to improve telecommunications networks and recognises that there is increasing pressure on the network providers to improve the telecommunication infrastructure. However, this has to be balanced against the visual impact. It is considered that the development would appear incongruous and conspicuously tall within the streetscene, resulting in overriding harm to the character and appearance of the area. The application is therefore refused due to its conflict with policies 1, 2 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 115 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Tower View Quarry Lane St Germans PL12 5LL
Description: Request for work to a tree with a TPO - remove eucalyptus tree TPO10/00031
RefusalReasons: Current Government guidance for Tree Preservation Orders that advises that an applicant needs to advance sound reasons before consent to fell trees should be granted. The submitted evidence does not constitute substantive reason to remove a tree in its entirety, which provides a significant contribution to the amenity of the area. Clear and convincing evidence to justify the felling of the subject tree has not been presented in support of this application. Due to the lack of substantive evidence the application is refused.

Address: Outbuilding South Of Under Lane St Mabyn Bodmin Cornwall PL30 3DG
Description: Conversion and extension of redundant agricultural building to form a residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: The site is within the countryside and divorced from services and facilities where residential development would not ordinarily be supported other than in accordance with the special circumstances set out in policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The extent of the physical alterations to the building would be of detriment to its intrinsic character and appearance and the domestication of its curtilage and removal of landscape features would not amount to an enhancement to its immediate setting as required by policy 7 and the proposal would not conserve landscape character. Accordingly, the proposal conflicts with policies 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposal does not amount to sustainable development and conflict also exists against policies 1, and 2 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 130, and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. All other maters have been considered but none override the harm identified.

Address: Land Adj Navarino Bungalow Navarino North Petherwin Cornwall PL15 8GW
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for proposed dwelling
RefusalReasons: In the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise; including whether adequate visibility splays can be provided, a safe and suitable access to the development has not been demonstrated and the application is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 12 Essa Road Saltash Cornwall PL12 4ED
Description: Conversion of original villa into two dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed external alterations to the existing building, including the roof terrace to the south elevation and the extension to the north elevation, by reason of the scale, design and discordant architectural form, would result in an unsympathetic and incongrous form of development that would unbalance the uniformity experienced within the existing row of properties in Essa Road, causing unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the wider street scene. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (adopted November 2016), paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policy H4 and ENV1 of the Saltash Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030.

Address: Land Rear Of The Regent Cafe And Gift Shop The Square The Lizard Cornwall TR12 7NZ
Description: Proposed Construction of 2 No dwellings, access and associated external works.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would, due to the siting, proximity and bulk of Plot 1 relative to neighbouring properties, most notably Chy An Hunros situated to the North, result in adverse amenity harm through overbearing and overshadowing impacts.  Further, the presence of primary living accommodation at first floor level within Plot 1 results in first floor openings and a roof terrace being situated in close proximity to neighbouring properties, notably Chy An Hunros, Farley and Beaconsfield, which in combination with the relative siting, proximity or orientation of Plot 1 results in overlooking, or the perception of being overlooked, upon these respective properties and their occupants. For these reasons the proposal would be contrary to the aims of Policies 1 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 126 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and guidance within the Cornwall Design Guide March 2013.

Address: 15 Crinnis Wood Avenue Carlyon Bay PL25 3QD
Description: Oak - reduce in height by two thirds down to lower branches.
RefusalReasons: The work would fail to accord with current best arboricultural practice, as defined in BS 3998:2010 Tree Works-Recommendations and would have a detrimental impact on the trees physiological health, with a high likelihood of the operations resulting in tree death and a resultant loss of public amenity. Given it has not been possible to demonstrate that there is adequate reason for the work using a Quantified Tree Risk Assessment, the work is regarded as harmful to the amenity of the area and an erosion of the area TPO of which this tree forms a part.

Address: Takapuna Callington Road Liskeard PL14 3HA
Description: Works to a tree subject to a TPO: T1 - Sycamore - remove as supressed/overtopped by the Beech (T2). Replace with Hawthorn as an understorey tree.
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the Sycamore tree (T1) forms an important feature of the existing canopy of trees subject to the Tree Preservation Order, which collectectivly, are of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the streetscene.  There is insufficient justification for the removal of the tree and clear and convincing arboricultural evidence to justify the removal of the tree has not been submitted. Felling of the tree will remove the companion shelter provided to the group, leading to the potential of branch failure. The proposed removal of T1 would therefore result in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape, contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Coombe Hill House Coombe Hill Bissoe TR4 8RQ
Description: Proposed conversion & extension of outbuilding to form holiday let
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would result in the conversion of an existing low-key utilitarian building which at present does not detract from this section of the rural landscape. The development, by reason of the proposed extension, external alterations, access track, parking area, domestic curtilage and the domestic paraphernalia that would result around the building, would alter and harmfully urbanise the strong rural characteristics of this section of the open countryside. Further environmental harm would result from the development through the uplift in private vehicle usage, contrary to policies seeking environmental gains and to limit reliance on the private vehicle. The proposal would provide some limited economic benefits in offering single unit of accommodation, but such benefits would not be significant to the wider tourism economy as a whole in this part of Cornwall. Ultimately, the proposal is for an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic form of tourism development that would fail to preserve or enhance the intrinsic character and beauty of this section of open countryside. As such, the proposed development conflicts with policies H4, EJ7, GQD1, GQD2 and LL4 of the Gwennap Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 84, 85, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 23 Serpells Meadow Polyphant Launceston Cornwall PL15 7PR
Description: Works to trees subject to a Tree Preservation order, namely T1 - Ash which has already rotted out and tree fell in storms last winter T2 and T3 are very large Sycamores which require coppicing.
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the trees are of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the local area.  There is insufficient justification for the removal of the tree and clear and convincing arboricultural evidence to justify the removal of the trees has not been submitted. The proposed removal of the trees would therefore result in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape, contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land South Of Treslow Farm Perrancoombe Perranporth Cornwall TR6 0HY
Description: Replacement dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling would represent unsustainable new development within the open countryside for which no special need or justification has been adequately demonstrated.  There has been no concrete evidence provided showing a lawful residential use on this land and it is likely that this use has been abandoned. The building to be replaced is an overgrown shed, which is not considered appropriate to retain. The proposal would therefore be tantamount to the creation of a new dwelling in the open countryside, which would be unsustainable and not encourage the use of more sustainable modes of transport. Moreover, the proposed works will fundamentally alter the perception of the building such that it will be recognised as an incongruous and sporadic residential form intruding into the rural setting, which would be accentuated by modern additions such as balconies and glazing at first floor level. Given the inappropriate and unsustainable form of new housing development in the countryside, the proposed development would raise direct conflict with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 11, 80, 112, 124 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Stone Park Woodville Road Woodford Bude Cornwall EX23 9JA
Description: Outline application with some matters reserved for a single dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of its location outside of any land considered to form the settlement, does not represent infill or rounding-off, nor does it make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement, and would visually extend residential built form into the countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting, which is within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development in the countryside leading to harmful incremental growth and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Warrens Bakery 7 Market Square St Just TR19 7HD
Description: Retrospective application for the retention of air conditioning unit
RefusalReasons: The proposed air conditioning unit appears inappropriate and insensitively located in the context of the character and appearance of the St Just Conservation Area, and the setting of the adjacent/surrounding Grade II listed buildings. The proposed works materially reduce the visual quality of the streetscape and fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Conservation Area, and the setting of the adjacent/surrounding Grade II listed buildings, which are located within a World Heritage Site and an Area of Outstanding Natural BeautyThe National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed retention of the air conditioning unit has been set out above. Although the private benefits of the retention of the air conditioning unit are appreciated, the proposed works would result in less than substantial harm in relation to the Conservation Area and its setting that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2 (paragraphs 1a to 1d), 12 (paragraphs 1a), 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 2.6 and 2.9 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 126, 130, 134, 176, 178, 189, 197, 199, 200, 202 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021. The proposed development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.

Address: Steppes Access To Low Tide Polzeath Wadebridge PL27 6ST
Description: Proposed replacement dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposal if permitted would constitute overdevelopment of the site which would lead to a loss of amenity for the neighbour at Sunnydale by reasons of height, scale, design and proximity resulting in massing on the boundary and subsequent overbearing impact, overshadowing, loss of outlook, loss of privacy and potential noise. This impact cannot be mitigated by condition and would cause an unreasonable level of harm for this neighbour to a degree that would spoil the enjoyment of this property contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016-2030 and Policy STMNDP 2.7 (iv) of the St Minver Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030. It would also be contary to paragraph 130 (f) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 regarding amenity.

Address: Helyglowarth Swanpool Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5BA
Description: Works to trees covered by a TPO - G4 and T35 comprising 4 x oaks
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the four Oak Trees (G4 and T35) are of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the local landscape. The reasons given for seeking to undertake pruning to the trees does not comprise clear and convincing evidence necessary to justify the extent of works as proposed. Furthermore, there is insufficient justification for the removal of any of the trees, nor clear and convincing arboricultural evidence to justify their loss. The proposal is considered to result in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape and contrary to Policies 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, FOS4 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Plan 2021-2030, and paragraph 174 (b) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Trenoweth Farm Road From Trevaylor To Trannack Lane Gulval TR20 8UR
Description: Retrospective: Retention of four camping platforms
RefusalReasons: The platforms are very prominent in the public domain and appear as discordant features in the landscape that are not locally distinctive. The continued siting/use of the platforms at this location has a harmful and unsustainable visual impact on the setting of the otherwise undeveloped rural character of the site and raises conflict with the aims and intentions of with policy 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which sets out a presumption in favour of sustainable development, with policy 2 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which advises that development should demonstrate a physical and ascetic understanding of its location and protect and enhance the natural landscape, with policy 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which advises that new sustainable tourist facilities and accommodation will be supported where they would be of an appropriate scale to their location and with policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which advise that development should sustain local distinctiveness and character and protect the natural environment. The proposal would also conflict, with paragraphs 84 and 85 of the NPPF (2021) as it does not constitute sustainable rural tourism which respects the character of the countryside and is not sensitive to its surroundings and with paragraph 174 of the NPPF (2021) which advises that planning decisions should contribute to and enhance the natural environment by recognising the intrinsic beauty of the countryside.

Address: Prospidnick Farm Crowntown Helston TR13 0AA
Description: Conversion & extension of existing redundant agricultural building to create three bedroom Residential Dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed works to this redundant rural building will require a combination of substantial demolition, extension and rebuilding operations well beyond its existing single storey structure. The development will therefore fundamentally alter the perception of this historic, single storey redundant barn such that it will be recognised as an incongruous and sporadic residential form intruding into the rural setting, which would be accentuated by its scale, appearance and formalised parking and amenity areas. The building is highly visible from the adjacent rural highway and there would be clear public perception of the erosion of the strong rural character of the area identified. Given the inappropriate and unsustainable form of new housing development in the countryside, which would not encourage the use of more sustainable modes of transport, the proposed development would raise direct conflict with policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 80, 110, 112, 130, 134 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Govail A30 Between Higher Drift Farm And Drift Crossroads Higher Drift Buryas Bridge TR19 6AE
Description: Reduced Scheme Resubmission For Proposed Change of Use of Part of Adjacent Field to Form Extension of Residential Curtilage Parking and Turning Area Via New Access Off A30
RefusalReasons: The removal of a significant section of the existing substantial Cornish hedge boundary to form the new vehicular access and associated visibility splay requirements along with the access track and hardstanding to form the parking area would harm the character and appearance of the open countryside which is designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value and Heritage Coast. The proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 7 Crescent Rise Constantine Bay Padstow Cornwall PL28 8JE
Description: Proposed demolition of existing dwelling and detached garage and erection of a replacement dwelling with integral garage with variation of condition 2 (approved plans) in respect of decision PA20/05247.
RefusalReasons: The proposed balcony by virtue of its siting and size would cause an unacceptable overlooking impact to the residential amenity of surrounding dwellings. The proposal would therefore conflict with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2016-2030 and Paragraphs 126, 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Clonmany Burngullow Lane High Street PL26 7TQ
Description: Demolition of garage and construction of a holiday let.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would introduce new holiday accommodation into the open countryside and due to the isolated location, future occupants of the development would be reliant upon the private vehicle to access services, goods and facilities. The proposal would represent an unjustified dwelling in the countryside thereby giving rise to sporadic and unsustainable development. The proposed development therefore does not accord with the aims and intentions of Policies 3, 5 and 7, 21 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraph 85 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Woodland View Goonvrea Perranarworthal TR3 7PN
Description: Works to trees namely:- (T1) and(T2) Turkey Oaks, reduce crown - subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: The proposed tree works to reduce the crowns of both turkey oak trees by approx. 10% (with a mind of carrying out further future reductions) and slightly more (15-20%) on the longer end weighted limbs, and to remove selected small diameter low limbs affecting property and road, would harm the public amenity value of the area. It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works are not justified by the reasoning given in the application, no arboricultural evidence or justification has been provided to support such tree works, when more suitable tree works could be supported.

Address: Land East Of Tonemar Park Bolventor Launceston Cornwall PL15 7TS
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1.The application site is within a prominent location within the Bodmin Moor Section of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) and is considered to make a positive contribution to the rural character and setting of the settlement of Bolventor. The proposed residential development of the site, by reason of its location outside of the clearly defined linear urban form of this part of the settlement and with no physical barrier to its south and east, does not round off or infill the settlement. The proposal would represent further incremental growth of the built form, extending the existing settlement further into the countryside, eroding the distinctive rural character and natural beauty of this area of the AONB. The benefits of the scheme do not outweigh the development plan position and the harm to the rural character of the area and AONB. The proposed development is therefore considered to be contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policies MD5 and MD9 of the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021 and guidance contained within paragraphs 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Higher Parsonage St Mawgan Newquay Cornwall TR8 4EZ
Description: Demolition of stable, to be replaced by a single unit holiday lodge accommodation
RefusalReasons: The proposed holiday unit would make a small contribution to local economy through tourist spend and construction activities. Against this the proposal is within the open countryside, provides constrained accessibility to a range of transport modes which weighs against the environmental dimension of sustainability and does not accord with the spatial strategy for the delivery of tourism accommodation.  The limited economic benefits of the proposal do not outweigh the conflict with the spatial strategy and does not constitute sustainable development.  The proposal conflicts with policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: 47 Cliff Street Mevagissey St Austell Cornwall PL26 6QJ
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed use - the construction of a single storey building in accordance with Class E of the General Development Order for Permitted Development
RefusalReasons: The proposed development fails to accord with paragraph (h) of Class E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town andCountry Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) in that the structure includes raised platforms and consequently planning permission is required.

Address: Land Between Numbers 4 And 5 Dozmere Dozmere Feock Cornwall TR3 6RJ
Description: Erection of new dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by reason of the restricted site area, layout and juxtaposition with neighbouring development would appear incongruous, inharmonious and unrelated to neighbouring development, resulting in a cramped form of development, harmful to the visual appearance and established pattern of residential development in the area and setting of the AONB. The proposal is contrary to policies D1 and H1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017 - 2030, policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 130 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land South East Of Chyvounder Trenance Mawgan Porth Cornwall TR8 4BT
Description: Outline Application for the construction of detached dwellinghouse, and provision of new vehicular access (all other matters reserved)
RefusalReasons: The application site is in the countryside, separated from the nearby settlement by the B3276. The proposed introduction of a new home onto the application site, by reasons of its access (with associated loss of hedgerow), character and inevitable massing, would harm the distinctive character and beauty of the site and surrounding area. In the absence of special circumstances to justify a new home in this rural location, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to policies 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Blujenn Consols Road Carharrack Redruth Cornwall TR16 5RA
Description: Proposal to fell 12 Monterey Pines
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the Monterey Pine trees are of significant public amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the local landscape. There is insufficient justification for the removal of these trees and clear and convincing arboricultural evidence to justify their loss has not been submitted. Their removal is therefore considered to result in a detrimental impact upon the public amenity of the local landscape and contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Church Of St Nivet(Graveyard) Church Road Lanivet Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5HA
Description: Works to trees namely:- Sycamore Trees(T42 and T43) to be removed - subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works are not justified by the reasoning given in the application due to a lack of evidence or compelling justification to support the loss of the tree.

Address: Farewell Rectory Road St Buryan TR19 6BB
Description: Replacement dwelling and associated works.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development is not locally distinctive in its form, scale or appearance and would constitute a discordant element in the street scene which would fail to preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the designated Conservation Area in which the site lies and would also harm the setting of nearby listed buildings, notably the grade II listed Corner House and the grade I listed St Buryan's Church to the west. The harm to those aforementioned assets would be less than substantial but is not outweighed by any public benefits of the proposed development. The scheme would also provide inadequate on-site amenity areas for future occupiers of the proposed dwelling and the development on balance fails to accord with policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030), with paragraphs 8, 130, 189,195, 197, 199, 200 and 202 of the NPPF (2021) and with sections 66 and 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings & Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Tregenna Steps Studio Tregenna Terrace St Ives TR26 2DL
Description: First floor extension with associated works and windows to east elevation.
RefusalReasons: The development proposal would harm the residential amenities of neighbouring occupiers at No. 17 Tregenna Terrace with particular regard to overlooking. It would therefore conflict with policy GD1 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Plan 2015 - 2030, policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, which together seek to achieve a good standard of residential amenity by, amongst other things, ensuring that development proposals protect individuals and property from overlooking and unreasonable loss of privacy.

Address: 35 Chirgwin Road Truro Cornwall TR1 1TS
Description: Application for works to a tree subject to a TPO: To coppice Sycamore (T1) to fence height.
RefusalReasons: The proposed pruning of the Sycamore tree would significantly detract from the tree's public visual amenity value and the character of the street scene and would cause harm to the health of the tree.
