It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works are not justified by the reasoning given in the application, when alternative work could be carried out to improve the relationship of the tree to the surrounding properties.

Address: Bell Cottage Churchtown St Merryn Padstow Cornwall PL28 8ND
Description: Application for certificate of lawfulness for a listed building in relation to proposed re-roofing using reclaimed Delabole slate and copper nails.
RefusalReasons: Having regard to the extent of fabric that is proposed to be replaced, the visual legibility of the change, and the potential extent of any associated joinery works undetailed in the submission, the proposal is deemed to affect the character of the listed building such that the proposed works would require Listed Building Consent.

Address: 16 Egerton Road Padstow PL28 8DJ
Description: Application for a lawful development certificate for a proposed single storey extension to rear of property.
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension to the dwelling would not fall within permitted development under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 due to the height of the extension exceeding the permitted height (under parts (f) and (g)) and therefore full planning permission is required and the Certificate of Proposed Development is refused.

Address: 19 Kings Avenue Falmouth TR11 2QJ
Description: Hip to Gable loft conversion
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension and alterations are unacceptable in their scale and design, which unbalance the pair of dwellings, and are out of keeping with the surrounding area generally, contrary to policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 124, 127, 128 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, and emerging policy DG4 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030.

Address: Land Adj To Number 1 Dolcoath Avenue Camborne Cornwall TR14 8RY
Description: Erection of a three-bedroom detached dwellinghouse on land which has been vacant for numerous years.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would, by virtue of its scale, form, appearance and layout, appear cramped within the context of the site, discordant with the immediate built form, and hence contrary to the local distinctiveness. The cramped nature of the proposal would result in the gable-end of the proposed dwelling being situated in close proximity of the first-floor bedroom window on the east elevation of the neighbouring dwelling. The outlook from this neighbour's window would be lost, resulting in a harmful sense of enclosure within a habitable room. The proposal would therefore conflict with policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, and the recommendation for refusal is in accordance with paragraph 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: The Shed Ox Lane St Mawgan TR8 4EU
Description: Construction of two open market dwellings with associated amenity space and parking
RefusalReasons: The proposal makes a small contribution to housing delivery in the community network area, supporting in minor way services and facilities in nearby settlements, and jobs in the construction process. Additional Trees will be incorporated on site too. Against this, the proposal provides two dwellings which are deemed to be outside the settlement and will visually encroach into the open countryside replacing the existing natural and rural grassland with domestic built form to the detriment of the distinctive character of the Area of Landscape Value and countryside. The limited additional economic and social benefits of the proposal do not outweigh the harms identified within the report and the proposal does not constitute 'rounding off' or sustainable development.  The proposal conflicts with Policy 14 of the former Restormel Local Plan 2001, policies 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 68, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Barley House Mornick Callington Cornwall PL17 7LU
Description: Application for planning consent for the expansion of existing camping use
RefusalReasons: The application site is located within the countryside. The proposal represents unjustified and sporadic development within the open countryside with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. The proposal will result in a permanent change to the site that would erode the distinctive natural character of the surrounding. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 5, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 127 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 18 Pellew Road Falmouth Cornwall TR11 2NS
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed loft conversion with dormer to provide additional bedroom and en-suite
RefusalReasons: On the basis of the submitted documentation provided and the Local Planning Authority's own investigations, the Local Planning Authority considers that the proposed loft conversion with dormer at 18 Pellew Road, Falmouth would require express planning consent as the works do not fall within the parameters of Permitted Development as set out under Class B of Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended) providing the works are carried out wholly in accordance with the submitted details.

Address: Rear Of 60 Edgcumbe Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 2NJ
Description: Conversion of a former store into a one bedroom holiday let
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of the lack of associated private amenity space, severely limited outlook, and unsurfaced and unlit pedestrian access, fails to secure a good standard of amenity for existing and future occupants. In contrast it would result in the creation of a cramped and sub-standard form of holiday accommodation. As such, the proposal is considered contrary to the aims and intentions of Policy D1 and H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019, Policies 2, 5, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Section 12 and in particular paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land East Of Plen An Merther Radnor Road Radnor TR16 5EL
Description: Proposed construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: By reason of its positioning in the direct setting of the Grade II listed Wheal Peevor engine houses, which also form a Scheduled Ancient Monument and are within the Wheal Peevor World Heritage Site (WHS), the proposed development would, when looking through and above the site access gateway, erode the undeveloped foreground and compete with the setting of the engine houses from this important public viewpoint, thereby causing harm. Whilst the harm caused is considered to be less than substantial, the limited public benefits of a single residential dwelling are not considered to outweigh this. Consequently, the proposal is considered to fail to at least preserve the setting of the listed engine houses, Scheduled Ancient Monument and WHS, and to conflict with the aims and intentions of S66(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990; policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 130, 189, 197, 199 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 15 St Annes Road Newquay TR7 2SA
Description: Demolition of Existing Garage and Proposed Dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling, by reason of its massing, siting and form, is shoehorned into the plot which would lead to a building and overall new home that appears cramped and at odds with its setting to the detriment of the character of the surrounding area. The application is, therefore, contrary to Policies 2, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030; Policies D1 and H2 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Plan; and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Taranto Stud The Stables Idless Lane Truro Shortlanesend TR4 9DE
Description: Proposed erection of a rural workers dwelling, a detached garage including a home office and the installation of a septic tank
RefusalReasons: The proposed development raises direct conflict with the requirements of adopted policy in the Cornwall Local Plan.  The site is located in the open countryside where new homes will only be permitted where there are special circumstances.  The elements of the business which provide for the essential requirement to live on site have not yet been established, whilst the existing business has not yet achieved an evidenced financial viability. No justification has been provided to justify the size of the dwelling proposed which is not considered to commensurate the size of the holding or proposed business.   In the absence of such justification and evidence permission should not be granted for a permanent dwelling of the scale proposed.  The development would harm the rural character of this location by introducing significant  built development of a domestic appearance that would result in harm to the character and appearance of the open countryside.  The development is therefore unsustainable and would cause material environmental harm to the rural character of the area, contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 80 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Taranto Stud The Stables Idless Lane Truro Shortlanesend TR4 9DE
Description: Proposed erection of a rural workers dwelling, a detached garage including a home office and the installation of a septic tank
RefusalReasons: The proposed development raises direct conflict with the requirements of adopted policy in the Cornwall Local Plan.  The site is located in the open countryside where new homes will only be permitted where there are special circumstances.  The elements of the business which provide for the essential requirement to live on site have not yet been established, whilst the existing business has not yet achieved an evidenced financial viability. No justification has been provided to justify the size of the dwelling proposed which is not considered to commensurate the size of the holding or proposed business.   In the absence of such justification and evidence permission should not be granted for a permanent dwelling of the scale proposed.  The development would harm the rural character of this location by introducing significant  built development of a domestic appearance that would result in harm to the character and appearance of the open countryside.  The development is therefore unsustainable and would cause material environmental harm to the rural character of the area, contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 80 and 174 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Land Rear Of Woodlands Praze Road Praze An Beeble Camborne Cornwall TR14 0PR
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Erection of dwelling east of woodlands
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of its location within the open countryside, detached from any definable settlements, represents an undesirable and sporadic form of unsustainable development. Unsupported by any special circumstances, the proposal would be contrary to development plan policy concerning the location of housing development and fail to promote sustainable travel modes which limit the reliance on a private motor vehicle. Sporadic forms of development of this sort result in incremental harm to the remote and intrinsic character and appearance of the open countryside and harm the environment through the necessitated reliance upon unsustainable travel movements. In the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to policy HT1 in the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policy 1 in the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019, policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 112, 119, 124, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 81 Pollards Way Saltash Cornwall PL12 6UJ
Description: Works to Oak tree (SLTA011) subject to a Tree Preservation Order, namely remove deadwood in excess of 30mm diameter and reduce crown over garden by 3 - 4m laterally and reshape upper crown retaining natural flowing form
RefusalReasons: The aggressive nature of the proposed works would not be in line with industry best practice and the current British Standard. This would have a negative impact on the physiological and structural condition of the tree as well the long term contribution to amenity and the local landscape character.For the above reasons this application should be refused. The tree does have some minor/moderate dead wood associated with it which can be removed under exception.

Address: Devoran House 1 Devoran Lane Devoran Truro Cornwall TR3 6PA
Description: Monterey pine in SW corner of the properly is severely damaged in recent storms with broken and hanging branches. Would look to fell as tree is so badly damaged.
RefusalReasons: The loss of the Monterey Pine and would lead to a high level of wind loading and increased failure of limb and tree failure within the wider group of Monterey Pines which would harm public amenity value and the character of the street scene.  It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed works are not justified by the reasoning given in the application, no arboricultural evidence or justification has been provided to support the loss of the tree, when alternative work could be carried out to improve the relationship of the tree to the surrounding properties.

Address: Kestrel Road From Silverdale Road To Swanpool Road Via The West Side Of Swanpool Swanpool Falmouth TR11 5BD
Description: Works to trees namely - 2 Monterey Pine trees(T1 and T2) - fell - subject to a Tree Preservation Order (TPO)
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the Monterey Pine trees (T1 and T2) are of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the local landscape. There is insufficient justification for the removal of these trees and clear and convincing arboricultural evidence to justify their loss has not been submitted. Their removal is therefore considered to result in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape and contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Silvertrees Rescorla St Austell Cornwall PL26 8YT
Description: Single storey dwelling with integral garage parking for two cars.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by reason of its location outside of the clearly defined built form of Rescorla does not represent infill, rounding-off or fall within the definition of previously developed land and would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 17 Scarne Side Grove Launceston Cornwall PL15 9FG
Description: Works to Oak tree (T1) covered by a Tree Preservation Order, namely reduce the upper crown vertical height by upto 3.5 m, cutting no greater than approx. 4 inch diameter, to natural growth points where possible and reduce lateral growth upto 3.5 meters, cutting no greater than 6 inch diameter on the South, West and North West sides leaning toward the property. Remove lowest branch on South side at approximately 4 meters cutting back to the stem leaning over shed. Clear off small branches and epicormic growth from the stem up to a height of 5m.
RefusalReasons: The proposed works are not in line with industry best practice for the management of this tree which is protected by a Tree Preservation Order, and would fail to accord with good arboricultural practice as specified by the current British Standard BS 3998. As such the works would damage the public amenity provided by this tree and have a negative impact on its physiological condition.

Address: 28 Grovehill Crescent Falmouth Cornwall TR11 3HR
Description: Proposed use of approved garage as additional living accommodation / holiday let including changes to approved doors and windows
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of its size, location and proximity to neighbouring properites, would create sub-standard accommodation and would cause unreasonable noise and disturbance and would be unduly harmful to the residential amenities of the occupiers of this neighbouring residence. As such, the proposal is considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 2, 5, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraphs 124, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 20 Bay View Park St Austell Cornwall PL25 3TR
Description: Demolition of existing side extension and erection of 2 storey side extension inc Ff extension above garage to form self contained ancillary accommodation
RefusalReasons: The proposed scheme by reason of its siting and height would result in the loss of sunlight and daylight reaching the rear habitable rooms of No 21 particularly in the afternoon. Similarly, the development would have an overbearing/dominant effect upon the rear garden of No.21 as a result of the height and siting of the proposed building adjacent to the common boundary. The scheme would conflict with Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 which seek, amongst other matters, to ensure new development does not adversely affect the amenity of neighbouring properties.

Address: Land North West Of Spardene Cracky Hill Tregadillett Launceston Cornwall PL15 7EX
Description: Change of land use to residential including construction of two detached dwellings with garages and alteration to existing vehicular access
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of its location outside of any land considered to form the settlement of Tregadillett, does not represent infill or rounding-off, nor does it make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement, and would visually extend residential built form into the countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting, which is within an Area of Great Landscape Value.  In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development in the countryside leading to harmful incremental growth of the settlement, and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Stargazy Inn Bay Hotel 1 The Terrace Port Isaac Cornwall PL29 3SG
Description: Demolition of existing substandard building and erection of 4 no luxury letting rooms
RefusalReasons: The development if approved would be harmful to the visual amenities of the area and the wider character and appearance of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty by reason of its design which fails to respect the character, appearance, proportions and features of the existing hotel and would appear as a discordant and harmful feature within both the townscape and wider landscape setting. It would therefore be contrary to Policies 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, Policies 6, 6H and 8 of the St Endellion Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030, the guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 with particular regard to paragraphs 130, 174 and 176 and the Supplementary guidance contained within the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021 with particular regard to paragraph MD9.

Address: Tredrizzick House St Minver Wadebridge PL27 6PB
Description: To create a new access and construct a new entrance track to Tredrizzick Barn including a turning and parking area.
RefusalReasons: The development proposed will extend the built form of development outside of the established residential curtilage and into the open countryside resulting in diminishment of the surrounding natural environment, in particular, the south west and south eastern boundaries to the wider agricultural field which are considered to represent a clear and physical separation between the open countryside and the built form of the wider settlement. The proposed access and access track would clearly not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting and would be widely visible from the adjacent public highway with some further views possible from the Public Right of Way system surrounding the site. The economic and social benefits of the proposal would not outweigh the harm to the rural environment. The proposal is contrary to policies 2(1),12 and 23 (1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies, which seek to sustain local distinctiveness and character, and protect and where possible enhance Cornwall's natural environment, Paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies STMNDP 1, STMNDP 2 and STMNDP 2.7 (vi) of the St Minver Parishes Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: 5 Riverside Crescent Newquay TR7 1PJ
Description: Erection of Summer House
RefusalReasons: Due to its scale, underbuild, proximity to the cliff-edge, glazing (and potential light-spill at night) would be at odds with and would erode the sparesely developed verdant qualities that have been identified within an up to date development plan as meriting protection. Accordingly the proposal would result in a form of development that would fail to protect or enhance the character of the area. The development conflicts with policies 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies D1(2.), D2, H1, H2(c) and LE2 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030, paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. All other matters have been considered but none override the harm identified.

Address: 2 Channel View St Austell PL25 3BT
Description: Certificate of Lawful Development for a proposed rear extension under permitted development rights.
RefusalReasons: The development would accord with the requirements of Class A of Part 1 of Schedule two of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (as amended) in respect of permitted development rightsBut condition 7 of planning permission ref C2/03/01897 dated 07.10.03. states:-Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted development) Order 1995 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order (with or without modification) no extensions or roof extensions or any other roof alterations (other than expressly authorised by this permission) shall be constructed.Therefor to erect the extension without planning permission would be a breach of this condition. Consequently a planning application is required.

Address: Land North Of The Gate House Coswarth Newquay Cornwall TR8 4LZ
Description: Outline application for a new dwelling including access (all other matters reserved)
RefusalReasons: The site lies in open countryside for the purposes of planning and outside of a defined settlement. It is not safely served by regular public transport or by other sustainable means of transport and has no safe pedestrian route to services and facilities. It would therefore be heavily reliant on private vehicle to access services and facilities. The development if approved therefore represents an unsustainable location that would be contrary to the principles of sustainability embodied in policies 1, 2, 3, 7 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the guidance contained within the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 with particular regard to paragraphs 8 and 79.

Address: Little Park Farm Road From Junction East Of Marston To Junction North East Of Park Farm St Clement TR1 1SX
Description: Conversion of Existing Barn to Form Dwelling House & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The proposal is located within the open countryside where new dwellings are only permitted in special circumstances. The existing barn is not considered appropriate to retain, owing to its utilitarian form and appearance, or considered to be suitably constructed to enable its re-use without a significant level of structural work. The proposed residential development would not therefore conserve or enhance the AONB in its immediate setting and in the absence of any special circumstances to justify the creation of a new dwelling, the application is not considered to be sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Coth Bean Carlidnack Road Mawnan Smith Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5HD
Description: Listed Building Consent for construction of an entrance porch, demolition and rebuild of single storey rear extension and material change to a garage roof
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension by virtue of it's mass and length would cause less than substantial harm to the Grade II Listed Building and the public benefits of the proposal do not outweigh the identified harm. The proposal would therefore conflict Policies 12, 13, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2016-2030, Paragraphs 124, 127, 172, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policies 5 and 6 of the emerging Mawnan Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Coth Bean Carlidnack Road Mawnan Smith Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5HD
Description: Construction of an entrance porch, demolition and rebuild of single storey rear extension and material change to a garage roof
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension by virtue of it's mass and length would cause less than substantial harm to the Grade II Listed Building and the public benefits of the proposal do not outweigh the identified harm. The proposal would therefore conflict Policies 12, 13, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2016-2030, Paragraphs 124, 127, 172, 193, 194 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policies 5 and 6 of the emerging Mawnan Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: 10 Basset Street Falmouth TR11 2LN
Description: Extension to third floor including a Juliet balcony to be built on existing two storey structure and installation of bay window
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension by virtue of its mass and height would cause significant overbearing harm to the neighbouring property 9 Basset Street, Falmouth, and its design would not enhance the Falmouth Conservation Area. The proposal would therefore conflict with Policies 12, 13 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2016-2030, Paragraphs 124, 127, 189-202 of the National Planning Policy Framework and emerging Policies DG2, DG3 and DG7 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020 to 2030 (Post Examination Version March 2020).

Address: Land At Rookery Farm Porthtowan Redruth TR16 5UG
Description: Change of use to private gypsy site with 2no mobile homes, 2no touring caravans and 2no day rooms
RefusalReasons: The proposed development site is located within an exposed area of open countryside and the scheme would result in a sporadic and unacceptable form of development that would have a detrimental impact upon the character and appearance of the rural landscape. The site lies at a relatively inaccessible location away from any defined settlement and community facilities and the proposal would result in an unsustainable development that would be heavily dependent on the use of the private motor vehicle. The development is as such viewed to be contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 11, 12, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030), paragraphs 8, 110, 112, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and advice contained within Planning Policy for Traveller Sites (2015), notably paragraphs 13 and 25.

Address: 1 Otter Vale Church Town Road Otterham Camelford PL32 9TA
Description: Sub-division of dwelling into two dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed sub-division of the extended dwelling would create additional open market housing in the countryside, divorced from any settlement and with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities; perpetuating an over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. The proposal building is less than 10 years old and would conflict with guidance set out in Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 for the sub-division of dwellings, as this seeks to avoid the circumvention of policies designed to limit new housing in the countryside. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location,or other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to policies 1, 2, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: White Wings Harbour Terrace Falmouth Cornwall TR11 2AW
Description: Renovation and extension works to an existing dwelling including removal of an existing garage.
RefusalReasons: The development by reason of its design, in particular the proposed dormer windows size and materials, would have a harmful impact on the character and appearance of the area which forms part of the Falmouth Conservation Area and thereby would be contrary to Polices DG 3 and 7 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Plan, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies and para 197 of the NPPF

Address: Former Play Area Creeping Lane Newlyn Cornwall TR18 5QE
Description: Two storey apartment building with 2 no. 1 bed units and 2 no. 2 bed units.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development due to the lack of off-street parking will unacceptably exacerbate existing parking pressures in the area to the detriment of the occupiers of surrounding properties. The proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Beachcroft Valley Road Carbis Bay St Ives Cornwall TR26 2QS
Description: Change of Use from Bed and Breakfast Guesthouse to Single Dwelling with non compliance with condition 3 in relation to decision notice PA16/06996
RefusalReasons: 1 Planning permission was granted under reference PA16/06996 for a change of use of an existing non-residential building to provide new market housing subject to a condition (condition 3) limiting occupancy in accordance with policy H2 of the St Ives Neighbourhood Development Plan (2015-2030) which is clear that new market residential development, with the exception of replacements for existing lawful dwellings, should be subject to a principal occupancy restriction. Although the policy and preamble are silent in respect of whether it should apply to the change of use of existing buildings, it is considered that the intention is clear and that it is implicit in the reading of the policy that this relates to all new market housing, including that brought about by a change of use of an existing non-residential building where that change of use does not otherwise fall within the realms of permitted development or has resulted from the grant of a lawful development certificate. None of the representations made in this application alter this and the condition continues to serve a planning purpose and is enforceable.

Address: Land West Of Knot Shore Restronguet Hill Mylor Bridge Cornwall TR11 5ST
Description: Proposed single dwelling and garage.
RefusalReasons: The application involves the construction of a new dwelling in the countryside, detached from any definable settlement containing the necessary facilities required to support day-to-day occupation, which would encourage the use of a private motor vehicle, contrary to environment aspects of the presumption in favour of sustainable development. New housing development in this location is not supported by Policies 3, 7 or 21 of the Local Plan. The proposal incurs visual harm to the immediate setting and surrounding natural environment from the extension of the existing linear pattern of development into the open countryside, which is detrimental to the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Notwithstanding the modest associated economic and ecological benefits of this single unit, they do not outweigh the unsustainable location and harm to the natural qualities of the setting. The proposal is considered contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 122,127,170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 76 St Peters Way Porthleven TR13 9BB
Description: Proposed first floor extension above garage and porch to rear access with non compliance of condition 2 in relation to decision notice PA18/03742
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed lifting of the planning condition to retain the side window as fixed closed with obscure glazing would result in the occupiers of the property having the opportunity for significant levels of overlooking and therefore would have unacceptable adverse impact on the residential amenities of the occupants of neighbouring properties. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Potters Lodge Trenance Road Tredinnick St Issey Wadebridge PL27 7QY
Description: Construction of 4 dwellings and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposal makes a small contribution to housing delivery in the community network area, supporting in minor way services and facilities in nearby settlements, and jobs in the construction process. Against this the proposal provides four dwellings which is deemed disproportionate to the scale and role of the settlement and would represent a visually incongruous density at odds with the verdant and spacious character of the urban grain of this part of the settlement. The limited additional economic and social benefits of the proposal beyond that previously consented does not outweigh the harm and the proposal does not constitute sustainable development.  The proposal conflicts with policies 2, 3, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Clitters Farm House Clitters Stoke Climsland Callington Cornwall PL17 8HP
Description: Proposed extensions to rear of dwelling with alterations and new roof structure and finish.
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension does not introduce substantial public benefits, and by reason of its unsympathetic design, large scale, bulk and massing, would generate unjustified harm to the distinctive historic character and appearance of the non-designated heritage asset; contrary to Policies 2 (1),12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Morven 35 Launceston Road Callington PL17 7DP
Description: Works to tree namely - Beech(T1) Fell - subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: The tree is of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contributes to the character of the local area. The proposed felling and subsequent loss of the tree would result in a detrimental impact upon the local landscape. The reasons given for felling the tree does not comprise clear and convincing evidence necessary to justify the extent of works as proposed. The proposed works would therefore be contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Stansville Boscawen Road Falmouth Cornwall TR11 4EN
Description: Erection of dwellinghouse and garage and associated landscaping
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling, by reason of its location, which extends beyond the existing pattern of residential development, together with the intensification of the use of this site, will cause less than substantial harm to the Falmouth Conservation Area. Paragraph 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework requires that where proposals lead to less than substantial harm to the significance of the heritage asset, this harm should be weighed against the public benefits of the proposal, including where appropriate, securing its optimum viable use. In terms of the public benefits, the community have clearly demonstrated that their view is that the development of this site does not offer a public benefit as it is considered to result in the loss of a key open space identified as having a high amenity value. The proposal is considered to be contrary to Policies 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 122, 124, 127, 130, 189, 190, 192, 193, 194, and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, and emerging Policies FOS1, DG4, DG6, and DG7 of the Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020 to 2030 (Post Examination Version March 2020).

Address: Land West Of Marsden Farm Treloyan St Keverne Helston Cornwall TR12 6QP
Description: Proposed general purpose agricultural shed
RefusalReasons: In the absence of sufficient supporting information, it has not been demonstrated there is an overriding agricultural need for the building in this location that would be reasonably necessary for the purposes of agriculture. As a result and by reason of its prominent siting, appearance and use of materials, the building would have an adverse visual impact on the strong rural character of the area and fail to conserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) in this location.  The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 5, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 83, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy MD9 in the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Mangos 5-7 Church Street Falmouth Cornwall TR11 3DP
Description: Advertisement consent to display 1no projecting sign, various fascia signs inc floodlights and lanterns.
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of its design, materials, colour, siting and illumination would have an adverse impact upon the setting of the Falmouth Conservation Area and nearby listed buildings. The proposal is in conflict with Policies DG 5 and DG 7 of the emerging Falmouth Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019-2030, Policies 1, 2, 12, and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and Paragraphs 124, 127, 130, 132, 193 and 195 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Green St Petry Goldsithney Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Construction of up to Two Dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwellings would have an unacceptable effect on the character and appearance of the area. The existing green space complements the built form, as was originally intended when the street layout was originally granted planning permission.  The development would therefore conflict with Policy CW3 of the Draft Perrnauthnoe Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030, Policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Walhalla Quoit St Columb TR9 6HY
Description: Outline application for the erection of a single dwelling with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: The site lies in open countryside for the purposes of planning and outside of a defined settlement. It is not safely served by regular public transport or by other sustainable means of transport and has no safe pedestrian route to services and facilities. It would therefore be heavily reliant on private vehicle to access services and facilities. The development if approved therefore represents an unsustainable location that would be contrary to the principles of sustainability embodied in policies 1, 2, 3 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016 and the guidance contained within the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 with particular regard to paragraphs 8 and 79.

Address: Unit 2 Indian Queens Industrial Estate Lodge Way Indian Queens TR9 6TF
Description: Construction of four commercial units B8 use class.
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reasons of the proposed entrance/exit onto Moorland Road, removing part of the existing stone wall/Cornish hedge along the northern boundary of the site fronting Moorland Road and by introducing the new industrial buildings themselves, will harm the distinctive character of an area prominent to public view.  The application is, therefore, contrary to policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Land Adjacent To Harewood Lodge Eric Road Calstock PL18 9SQ
Description: Erection of a detached dwelling and ancillary works
RefusalReasons: As a consequence of the significant weight now given to Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan and the application site now being located outside of the re-introduced village Development Boundary, the proposed development is rendered unacceptable in principle, expanding the built form of the village into the open countryside, beyond the established development limit, harming the appearance and character of the surrounding landscape through visual and domestication impacts, contrary to the provisions, aims and intentions of Policies HP1(1), HP1(3) and LA1 of the Calstock Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020-2030.

Address: Land To The North East Of Grenville Gardens Grenville Gardens Troon Cornwall TR14 9DU
Description: Conversion of existing granite barn to form dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: The domestic alterations proposed to the building and its wider setting, to facilitate a residential use, will clearly result in overriding harm to the Outstanding Universal Value (OUV) of this relict, post-industrial World Heritage Site (WHS) mining landscape and the special qualities of the non-designated heritage asset, being the building itself.  Given the scale and nature of the proposal, the harm identified is considered to be less than substantial, however, the limited public benefits of the proposal are not considered to outweigh the environmental harm identified. The proposal would also result in harm to the character and appearance of the countryside in this rural setting beyond the edge of the settlement. The relict mining landscape in this location provides an attractive setting to the settlement and the proposed development would clearly result in a harmful erosion of this rural character. Ultimately, the proposal for the conversion of this building into a dwelling will not lead to an enhancement to the site and its immediate setting and is therefore contrary to policies 2, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 80, 130, 134, 174, 197, 199, 202, 203 and 207 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 13 Lemon Hill Mylor Bridge TR11 5NA
Description: Listed building consent for replacement of rotted or unsuitable windows with traditional designed windows fitted with heritage approved sealed units.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed replacement double glazed timber windows at No 13 Lemon Hill, Mylor Bridge, by reason of the timber windows being double glazed, would fail to maintain the special character and appearance of this part of the Mylor Bridge Conservation Area. No 13 Lemon Hill is at the northern end of a terrace of three Grade II Listed Buildings abutting the back pavement edge of Lemon Hill, as a result, the majority of the proposed replacement double glazed timber windows would be easily viewed from the public realm, thus causing significant harm to the Mylor Bridge Conservation Area and the setting of this terrace of three Grade II Listed Buildings. Clear and convincing justification for the works has not been provided and there is no clear level of public benefit that would offset the identified harm. The proposal therefore fails to satisfy the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Polices 2010-2030 and paragraphs 194, 195, 197, 199, 200 and 207 of the NPPF (July 2021).

Address: Land East Of The Roundhouse Lower Amble Farm Chapel Amble Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6EW
Description: Outline application for the erection of a dwelling together with use of the existing access serving the land (all other matters reserved)
RefusalReasons: The proposal would deliver open market housing which is located within the countryside,clearly divorced from any settlement which would result in residential accommodationwith poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuateover reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements.  In theabsence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rurallocation, the proposal is not sustainable development. The limited economic and socialbenefits of the development including the delivery of housing to support the role andfunction of the settlement, the construction jobs that would be created, do not outweighthe environmental harms nor the conflict with the development plan. The proposal doesnot accord with the spatial strategy pursued by this Council in the development plan andaccordingly the proposal fails to comply with the development plan provisions contained within policies 1, 2, 3, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: General Office Atlantic Reach Carworgie Newquay Cornwall TR8 4LX
Description: Prune and maintenance of trees and removal of dead Ash tree
RefusalReasons: The tree works application forms are supplied with comprehensive guidance notes that give a clear indication of the level of information that should be supplied to allow the Council to make an informed decision. Without this level of information the Council can often not determine exactly what tree works are proposed. Detail such as annotated photographs marking where the pruning limits will be, or specification detailing in meters the amount of material to be removed or remaining heights of trees post pruning will be required before this application can be properly assessed.

Address: 23 Riverside Avenue Newquay Cornwall TR7 1PN
Description: Proposed first floor extension, plus balconies to rear and front porch
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, through its scale, form and massing and proximity to the neighbouring property '21 Riverside Avenue' shall incur an unreasonable impact upon the living accommodation of that property in respect to loss of light and outlook both to windows on the southern elevation and to the amenity area of that property. This is contrary Policy 12 Part 2(B) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, H1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Minack Lodge Road From The Valley To St Levan Churchtown St Levan TR19 6JU
Description: Proposed construction of replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would result in a dwelling with a greater physical presence than the existing structure in a sensitive and prominent location. The dwelling by reason of its contemporary design, scale and massing is not sympathetic to the local character.  The expansive glazing on the Eastern elevation together with the first floor balcony across almost the full width of the elevation, is likely to result in light pollution when the building is lit internally during hours of darkness to a greater extent than is the case with the existing situation due to the significantly increased amount of glazing, which would adversely affect the natural beauty of the AONB. The proposal fails to conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the AONB nor maintain the character and distinctive landscape qualities of the Heritage Coast. The development is therefore considered to be contrary to the aims and intensions of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, the advice in paragraphs 8, 130, 174 and 176 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, advice contained within sections 2.9, 2.10, 7.3 and 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013, and the aims and intentions of Policies MD9 and MD16 and of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: The Old China Clay Building And Pergola Mount Pleasant Road Porthleven TR13 9JS
Description: Construction of covered roof extension over existing terrace and conversion of pergola roof into a terrace and outdoor seating area
RefusalReasons: The proposal will result in the provision of further built development within the immediate setting of the adjacent Grade II Listed building and Grade II Listed quay walls. The visual impact of creating the increased seating area and first floor extension with considerable glazing, in such a prominent harbourside location, will impact adversely on the setting of the adjacent and nearby Listed buildings and harm the character and appearance of the Conservation Area. The less than substantial harm identified to the designated heritage assets is not outweighed by public benefits in particular the loss of two existing trading units. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130, 134, 197, 199 and 202 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 66(1) and 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (the Act).

Address: The Old China Clay Building And Pergola Mount Pleasant Road Porthleven TR13 9JS
Description: Listed Building Consent for construction of covered roof extension over existing terrace and conversion of pergola roof into a terrace and outdoor seating area
RefusalReasons: The impact of the works proposed in creating the increased seating area and first floor extension with considerable glazing, in such a prominent harbourside location, will impact adversely on the setting of the adjacent and nearby Listed buildings; namely the Grade II Listed Old China Clay Store and Grade II Listed quay walls. The less than substantial harm identified would not preserve the special architectural and historic interests of the impacted Listed buildings and would be contrary to policies 2, 12 and 24 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 130, 197, 199 and 202 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Section 16 (2) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: 34 Growan Road St Austell Cornwall PL25 3JP
Description: Works to a tree subject to a TPO to trim overhanging branches of Oak (T5).
RefusalReasons: Because of the extent of proposed pruning, the proposed works would heavily impact on the public amenity provided by this Tree Preservation Order protected tree, its structural integrity, and it health. It would also fail to accord with British standards. Consequent it would result in harm to the amenity of the area.

Address: Land Adj To Maen Veor Barn Hill Cadgwith Ruan Minor Helston Cornwall TR12 7JU
Description: Outline planning application with all matters reserved for the construction of an affordable dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposal for an affordable dwelling in this location raises direct conflict with the requirements of adopted housing policy in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 as the site is clearly located in the countryside beyond the established limits of the nearby settlements of Cadgwith and Ruan Minor. As such, the site is not deemed to be an appropriate location for a rural exception site scheme to deliver an affordable dwelling as it is not within or immediately adjacent to an existing settlement. The introduction of new built development to this prominent and undeveloped landscape would clearly not conserve and enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) in this location. Moreover, the site is not a sustainable or entirely accessible location for a new dwelling and the development would therefore be contrary to development plan policy in relation to the location of new housing development and cause material environmental harm to the strong rural character of this protected landscape; contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 79, 108, 110, 127, 170 and 172 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies MD5 and MD9 in the Cornwall AONB Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: The Stables Caravan Park Pit Lane Higher Fraddon Fraddon TR9 6LG
Description: Agricultural building that has been erected on the site at some point in time in 2009
RefusalReasons: Based on the documentation provided in support of the application, and having regard to other information available to and received by the Local Planning Authority, it is considered that the applicant has failed to demonstrate, on the 'balance of probability', due to intervening uses in March 2016 (commercial garage/car repairs), followed by the commencement of a use as a domestic garage, culminating in the purported reintroduction of the original agricultural use in January 2021 the building outlined in red of the submitted plan 2032-101 has not attained any current lawful use as an agricultural building for a continuous period of four years prior to the submission of this application. The Council, therefore, does not consider that the use of the building is lawful by virtue of immunity from enforcement action under Sections 171B (1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended), and refuses to grant the Certificate of Lawful Use (existing use) being applied for.

Address: Land North Of Anns Cottage Polzeath Wadebridge Cornwall
Description: Second floor extension to accommodate additional storey to existing permitted holiday apartments on first floor for holiday use not residential.
RefusalReasons: The development, if approved, would give rise to a detrimental impact on the neighbouring properties namely Marford, Ann's Cottage (Unit 3) and Tides Reach by reason of its proximity, increased massing, height and window positioning. In respect of Marford the development would result in an oppressive and overbearing structure when viewed from the flats within Marford that would block outlook and result in a loss of light to the living areas of these flats. In respect of Ann's Cottage (Unit 3) the flank gable wall of the development would give rise to an oppressive mass when viewed from the principal windows of the flat and in respect of Tides Reach the additional height and gable wall would create a dominating mass that would be overbearing and overlook the private amenity area serving this dwelling. The impact would be to an extent that the enjoyment of these properties would be harmed.In so doing the proposal is considered to represent poor design that fails to respect the amenity of surrounding uses, and therefore conflicts with policies 12 (2) and 13 (5) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016, Policy STMNDP 2.7 of the St Minver Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017 and the guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 with particular regard to Section 12.

Address: Fiddlers Green 5 Upper Castle Road St Mawes TR2 5BZ
Description: Works to trees namely - row of Elm trees - subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: The trees are of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the local landscape, a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, the character and natural beauty of which should be protected from harm. The proposed works to the trees would result in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The reasons given for seeking to undertake pruning to the trees do not comprise clear and convincing evidence necessary to justify the extent of works as proposed. Further there is insufficient justification for the removal of any of the trees and clear and convincing arboricultural evidence to justify their loss has not been submitted. The proposed works would therefore be contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy LA2 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Nanblegan Lamorna Penzance Cornwall TR19 6XL
Description: Outline application, with all matters reserved, for a new private house.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would neither round-off the settlement of Lamorna, nor infill a small gap in its built form, due to three of the four site edges adjoining undeveloped land with the fourth boundary adjoining an access track, separating the existing buildings to the north east from the application site and would therefore constitute development in the open countryside and does not accord with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. Notwithstanding the above the site comprises an undeveloped parcel of land which contributes positively to the rural character of this area which is designated as being within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposed development would not represent a suitable location for housing having regard to local and national policies, with particular regard to the effect of the proposed development on the character and appearance of the area. The proposal would increase the built form and fail to preserve the landscape and scenic beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, leading to harm which would not be outweighed by any overriding public benefit contrary to policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. In the absence of any special justification to warrant residential development in this context, the proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 117, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Mouse House 3 Cave Lane Mousehole TR19 6SW
Description: New external steps to access parking area.
RefusalReasons: The proposed steps, due to their design and location, would result in an unacceptable increase in overlooking and disturbance in relation to the amenity area and rear window openings of 1 Merlin Place to the east. The close proximity and elevated nature of the proposed steps allows for an increase in levels of overlooking and disturbance to the users of 1 Merlin Place that is considered intrusive, unreasonable and of harm beyond that of the reasonable levels of privacy currently enjoyed at this property. The proposed steps would raise concerns relating to the impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring property that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 paragraphs 2a and 2c of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Section 2.6 (bullet point 1); Section 4.1 (bullet point 1) and Section 4.11 (bullet point 1) of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 124, 127, 128 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework

Address: Anneth Lowen Carthew St Austell Cornwall PL26 8XG
Description: Felling of a beech tree at rear of Anneth Lowen T2
RefusalReasons: The application does not adequately demonstrate that the removal of the tree is necessary at this time for the purposes of safety or good arboricultural practice. Consequently its removal would fail to accord with the aims and intentions of Policy 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: Land At Trecarne Higher Trecarne St Mawgan Cornwall TR8 4HB
Description: Outline Planning for the erection of detached agricultural dwelling with attached single garage. with all matters reserved
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling lies in the open countryside for the purposes of planning policy and separated from the services and facilities of the nearest settlement such that occupiers would be heavily reliant on private modes of motorised transport. The application has failed to satisfy the financial tests applied to essential agricultural workers dwellings and it has not been demonstrated that the business will remain viable in its own right for the foreseeable future such that it can support a new permanent dwelling. In the absence of an overriding agricultural justification for the dwelling under part 5 of policy 7 residential development in this rural location is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 with particular regard to paragraphs 7, 80a) and 104c) by creating a new dwelling in the countryside for which no rural justification has been shown demonstrated.

Address: Gratton Lodge 119 Mount Wise Newquay Cornwall TR7 1QR
Description: Proposed change of use from Guest House and attached owner's accommodation to house of multiple occupation (sui generis)
RefusalReasons: The proposal would provide an additional House of Multiple Occupation (HMO) that in conjunction with existing HMOs will exceed the level established within the development plan at which a sustainable, inclusive and mixed-use community can be sustained. The proposal is consequently in conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy H3 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019, and no overriding benefits are considered to outweigh this conflict.

Address: Melrose Barn Gilly Gabben Helston TR12 6BB
Description: Conversion and extension of redundant agricultural building into dwelling
RefusalReasons: The building is not considered to be a suitably constructed redundant rural building that would be appropriate for conversion, given that the works will require substantial demolition, extension and rebuilding operations beyond its existing skeletal structure.  The proposal would therefore be tantamount to the creation of a new dwelling in the open countryside, which would be unsustainable and not encourage the use of more sustainable modes of transport. Moreover, the proposed works will fundamentally alter the perception of the building such that it will be recognised as an incongruous and sporadic residential form intruding into the rural setting, which would be accentuated by formalised parking and amenity areas and the removal of sections of natural roadside hedge required to accommodate the access visibility splay. The building is highly visible from the adjacent highway and there would be clear public perception of the visual harm identified. Given the inappropriate and unsustainable form of new housing development in the countryside, the proposed development would raise direct conflict with policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 108, 110, 124, 127, 130 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Lloyds View Lloyds Road The Lizard Helston Cornwall TR12 7PL
Description: Modification of planning obligation dated 02 August 2004 relating to decision PA03/00348/O
RefusalReasons: No evidence has been provided to demonstrate that the property has been valued and marketed to prove its lack of suitability or affordability as an intermediate affordable home. Without such evidence being provided the Local Planning Authority considers that the Section 106 Planning Obligation still serves a useful planning purpose through the existing property meeting a local housing need by virtue of its restriction to first time buyers. There is no justification or evidence to show that there is not a housing need in the local area, or that the property in question is not affordable to eligible local people. Therefore the application would thereby be contrary to Paragraph's 56, 61, 62 and 77 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the Section titled 'Rural Housing' of National Planning Practice Guidance and Policies 3 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030.

Address: Higher Chygwins Farm Tresowes Ashton Helston Cornwall TR13 9SY
Description: New build holiday letting unit to replace existing traditional style block and slate stables and storage buildings
RefusalReasons: The proposed holiday dwelling would represent unsustainable new development within the open countryside for which no special need or justification has been adequately demonstrated. The site is therefore not deemed to be an appropriate location for the provision of new tourism accommodation and moreover, the proposal represents a form of housing in the open countryside for which no special circumstances have been identified to justify it. Such unsustainable development in the countryside is largely inaccessible by a range of transport modes other than the private motor car and would result in overriding environmental harm balanced against modest economic benefits. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 83, 84, 108 and 110 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Treetops Richards Lane Illogan Redruth Cornwall TR16 4HA
Description: Construction of 2 storey dwelling
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposal would result in the subdivision of an existing plot which would give rise to a cramped and contrived form of development. The proposed dwelling with the position forward of the established building line, ridgeline positioned perpendicular to the neighbouring properties Tree Tops and Franbeth, and building to plot ratio less than the neighbouring dwellings, would fail to respect the character and appearance of the area. The proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policies PH3 and PH4 of the Illogan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the NPPF (2019).

Address: Additional Plot Adj To 46 Gurnick Road Newlyn Cornwall TR18 5DG
Description: Application for approval of reserved matters following Outline Planning Approval PA17/11908: Appearance, Landscaping, Layout and Scale
RefusalReasons: 1 By reason of its large scale with a high proportion of glazing, coupled with its positioning well within 21 metres of neighbouring residential property on considerably lower ground to the east ("Rosevean"), the proposed dormer window is considered to give rise to unacceptable overlooking/loss of privacy impacts upon said property, notably its outside space to this aspect which the present occupants enjoy sitting in. Whilst the proposal includes some mitigating planting along the eastern boundary of the site, as demonstrated on submitted drawing no 420-05H Rev D, this is likely to take several years to establish fully and thus is not considered to overcome the unacceptable harm identified. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the Cornwall Design Guide.

Address: Tree Nook Farm St Ives Road Lelant TR26 3EU
Description: Change of use of an agricultural paddock to a mixed use for agriculture and the sighting of four shepherd huts for short term holiday accommodation.
RefusalReasons: The siting of new residential development (albeit for holiday use) at this rural location raises in-principle conflict with policies 3 and 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030). Further to the above, the siting of 4 holiday caravans at this Greenfield site would, as a consequence of its prominence in the public domain, have a harmful and unsustainable visual impact on the otherwise rural character of this undeveloped agricultural land. The proposal would as such conflict with policy 1 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which sets out a presumption in favour of sustainable development and with policy 2 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which advises that development should demonstrate a physical and ascetic understanding of its location and protect and enhance the natural landscape. The proposal would conflict with policy 5 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which advises that new sustainable tourist facilities and accommodation will be supported where they would be of an appropriate scale to their location and with policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030) which advise that development should sustain local distinctiveness and character and protect the natural environment. The proposal would also conflict with policies GD1 and LED 9 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan (2015-2030) as it would tangibly impact on and harm the character of the open-countryside, with paragraphs 83 and 84 of the NPPF (2019) as it does not constitute sustainable rural tourism which respects the character of the countryside and is not sensitive to its surroundings and with paragraph 170 of the NPPF (2019) which advises that planning decisions should contribute to and enhance the natural environment by recognising the intrinsic beauty of the countryside.

Address: Penmarric East End Turnpike Road Marazion TR17 0BQ
Description: Removal of existing first floor studio and construct new studio at first floor
RefusalReasons: In proposing the replacement of a relatively modest and unassuming existing first floor studio with a highly contemporary, top-heavy, box-like structure, the resulting development would appear discordant, obtrusive and inappropriate in the setting, and would materially reduce the visual quality of the streetscape. The proposed works fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Conservation Area, which is located within an Area of Outstanding Natural BeautyThe National Planning Policy Framework requires harm to be weighed against the public benefit of the proposals. In this case the harm of the proposed removal of an existing first floor studio and the construction of a new studio at first floor level has been set out above. Although the private benefits and minor economic benefits of an enlarged and redesigned studio are appreciated, the proposed works would result in less than substantial harm in relation to the Conservation Area and its setting that are not balanced by these factors or other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), 23 (paragraphs 2 and 2a) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Sections 1, 2.6, 2.9, 2.10, 7.3 and 7.6 to 7.10 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 124, 127, 130, 189, 192(c), 193, 196 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework. The proposed development does not accord with the local planning authority's statutory duty under section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 because it would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.

Address: Coombe Barn Babis Lane St Stephens PL12 4ET
Description: Proposal to fell T1 and T2
RefusalReasons: There is insufficient convincing arboricultural evidence to justify the loss of the trees, it is therefore contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 33 North Road Saltash PL12 6BD
Description: Construction of walled hardstanding to provision off-road parking to existing dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed vehicular access from the classified highway leads to a parking space that is not of a size that would allow a vehicle to turn onsite. This would result in any vehicle attempting to enter or leave this access having to reverse into or out of the site onto the carriageway to the detriment of other road users. The development would not provide a safe and suitable access for vehicles. This proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (adopted 22nd November 2016) and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Rosudgeon Farm Prussia Cove Road Rosudgeon TR20 9AX
Description: The provision of two holiday pods
RefusalReasons: The proposed development of the site for two holiday letting units by reason of the location of the site in the open countryside, divorced from nearby services, facilities and amenities would represent unsustainable new residential development for which no special justification has been adequately demonstrated. The proposal therefore represents an unsustainable, undesirable and sporadic form of development that would be harmful to the intrinsic character and beauty of the countryside and would neither conserve or enhance the area which is designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policies MD5, MD 6 and MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: 9 Gurnick Road Newlyn TR18 5DG
Description: Two Storey Extension and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension, due to its design, scale and location, results in a harmful increase in overbearing, loss of light and loss of outlook in relation to the amenity areas and north-facing living room windows of the immediately adjacent neighbouring properties to the northwest (11 Gurnick Road) and southeast (7 Gurnick Road). The proposed two storey rear extension would result in a loss of outlook and loss of light in relation to the rear-facing living room windows of No. 7 and No. 11 Gurnick Road, and would further result in overbearing and loss of ambient light and sunlight in relation to the southern section of the rear gardens and patio areas of these properties. The proposed works have a detrimental impact upon the main living areas and the primary amenity areas of No. 7 and No. 11 Gurnick Road, that are currently enjoyed by users of these properties.The proposed two storey rear extension would raise concerns relating to the impact upon the occupiers of neighbouring properties that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest.The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 12 (paragraph 2b) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016);  Sections 2.6 (bullet point 1), 4.1 (bullet point 1) and 4.11 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013; and paragraphs 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: 9A New Hill Estate Grampound Truro Cornwall TR2 4RA
Description: Proposed formation of access and parking area.
RefusalReasons: The proposed access would not demonstrate an aesthetic understanding of its location and would result in the loss of an important landscape feature, which contributes to the rural charm and character of the village and to the character of the Area of Great Landscape Value. The proposal would be contrary to policies 2,12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, saved policy 14 of the Restormel Local Plan 2001 and paragraphs 8,127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 36 Mount Bennett Road Tywardreath Par Cornwall PL24 2QX
Description: Remove existing ground floor conservatory and replace with a flat roofed extension of the same width but longer.
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of its proportions, siting and overall design, would fail to respect the character and appearance of its surroundings and consequently fail to accord with Policies 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), Policy EH 2 of the Tywardreath and Par Neighbourhood Development Plan 2020 -2030 and Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Land North Of Moorfield House Moorfield Praze An Beeble Cornwall TR14 0LG
Description: Outline planning application to construct one dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling will be located in the countryside outside of the built form of the village of Praze An Beeble, which is identified by the village settlement boundary in the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan. Such unjustified housing development in the countryside would be contrary to development plan policy concerning the location of housing development, discourage the use of more sustainable modes of transport and erode the strong rural character of the area to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside. The site is clearly visible from the adjacent rural highway whereby additional built form will result in appreciable harm from a public perspective.  Consequently, the proposal raises direct conflict with policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policy HT1 in the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policy 1 in the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan Document 2019 and paragraphs 8, 79, 110, 127 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Greenbury Greenbury Lane Rosudgeon Cornwall
Description: Construction of Carpentry Workshop
RefusalReasons: The applicant has failed to demonstrate that there is an overriding locational or business need for the commercial carpentry workshop to be in this unsustainable countryside location, which is not widely accessible to local services, community facilities and public transport links. Such development would not encourage the use of more sustainable modes of transport such as walking and cycling.
