In the absence of any justification for the development in this location, the proposal would result in a modest urbanising effect on the site to the detriment of the character and appearance of the countryside in this location. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies 2, 5, 12, 21, 23 and 27 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 83, 84, 108, 110, 127 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Chalet The Carnes Boat Cove Lane Perranuthnoe Penzance
Description: Certificate of lawfulness for existing use of the building for holiday purposes
RefusalReasons: Based on the documentation provided in support of the application, and having regard to other information available to and received by the Local Planning Authority, it is considered that the applicant has failed to demonstrate that, on the 'balance of probability', that the use of the building known as The Chalet (as shown on submitted plan 1221-01 ) as holiday accommodation has taken place for a continuous period of ten years before the application was validated by the Council on the 22 December 2020.

Address: Land Rear Of Number 1A Greenfield Terrace Sunnyvale Road Portreath Cornwall TR16 4LY
Description: Bespoke self-build family home
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would result in the subdivision of the long residential garden serving an historic terraced dwelling within the Camborne and Redruth Mining District with Wheal Peevor and Portreath Harbour World Heritage Site (WHS). The well-preserved plot acts as a surviving record of the morphology of the historic settlement, which is one of the key attributes that expresses the Outstanding Universal Value of the WHS and makes a positive contribution to the significance of the heritage asset. The harm that would result to the significance of this heritage asset is graded as less than substantial, at the higher end of this threshold. The harm to the authenticity and integrity of the WHS is not wholly exceptional nor is it outweighed by any substantial public benefits. Furthermore, the sizeable three-storey dwelling would tower over the historic terraced dwellings, dominating the streetscene, and failing to promote local distinctiveness and respond positively to its landscape. In the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh the identified harm, the proposal is contrary to policy 1 of the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan (adopted November 2019), policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 8, 119, 130, 174, 189, 197, 199, 200 and 202 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and policies P3, C2 and C9 of The Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020-2025.

Address: Land To The South East Of Trenance Rose Cornwall
Description: Construction of an affordable self-build dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed local needs affordable dwelling would represent unsustainable new residential development in the open countryside that is not well related to the physical form of any settlement. The proposal is not sustainable development because it has poor accessibility to services and facilities thus occupants would be reliant upon the private vehicle to assess services, goods, facilities and employment. The development is therefore contrary to Policies 2, 3, 7 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, adopted November 2016.

Address: Land To The East Of Summercourt Tremaine Launceston Cornwall PL15 8SA
Description: Construction of a single, detached single storey dwelling with garage
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of its location outside of any land considered to form the settlement of Tremaine, does not represent infill or rounding-off, nor does it make use of previously developed land within or immediately adjoining the settlement, and would visually extend residential built form into the countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposal represents an unsustainable form of development in the countryside leading to harmful incremental growth of the settlement, and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016).

Address: Polhawn Fort Polhawn Torpoint Cornwall PL10 1LL
Description: Discharge of S106 Planning Obligation relating to planning decision 595/0229/F dated 03/11/1995
RefusalReasons: 1 This application has failed to demonstrate that the Section 106 Agreement dated 3rd November 1995 is unnecessary, not directly related to the development and not fairly and reasonably related in scale and kind to the development. This proposal would result in an unencumbered dwelling in an exposed, prominent, rural, cliff top location which is located within the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and would be contrary to Policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 adopted November 2016 and paragraphs 56 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: 22 Vicarage Road St Agnes TR5 0TL
Description: Cladding of front elevation in grey cedral cladding. Retrospective.
RefusalReasons: The building is of traditional construction and form and is located within the St Agnes Conservation Area the character and appearance of which should be protected from harm and within the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site the Outstanding Universal Value of which should be protected form harm. The proposed use of Cedral cladding would, by virtue of its modern appearance machine finished texture, profile and colour, would result in the addition of an unsympathetic material to a non-designated heritage asset in a prominent location within the Conservation Area and streetscene which contributes towards the significance of the World Heritage Site. The proposal thus conflicts with Cornwall Local Plan policy 24, St Agnes Neighbourhood Development Plan policies 6 and 11 or paragraphs 192, 193, 196 or 197 of the NPPF and is contrary to policies C2 and C7 of the WHS Management Plan. The proposal also fails to preserve the character and appearance of the St Agnes Conservation Area thus is also contrary to Section 72(1) if the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Wheal Dream Public House Redruth Road Wendron TR13 0LR
Description: Proposed New Managers Accommodation without compliance with condition 3 in respect of Planning application PA15/05050
RefusalReasons: The information submitted with this application fails to demonstrate that the existing dwelling is no longer required in connection with the existing business known as Wheal Dream Public House and consequently, there remains an essential need for the occupants of the restricted dwelling to live permanently at their place of work in this countryside location. The removal of the condition would result in the proliferation of an unrestricted residential property in the countryside that would be contrary to the thrust of development plan policy which aims to protect the countryside and only permit new residential development in exceptional circumstances. The proposal is therefore contrary to policy 7 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 55 and 79 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Between Woodland View And Tremaen Maen Valley Park Pennance Hill Roscarrack Falmouth TR11 5HJ
Description: Erection of two dwellinghouses
RefusalReasons: The application site is located within the countryside, divorced from any settlement. The dwellings proposed by this application would result in harm to the intrinsic character and beauty of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and would provide residential occupiers poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 102, 103, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land North Of Woodcocks Roost Barriper Camborne
Description: Outline Planning with access reserved for the permission of 5 proposed dwelling houses
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposal would be located on land beyond the existing limits of the settlement. The application site forms part of a larger undeveloped agricultural field and has been artificially subdivided. The proposal is not proposing affordable housing and no viability information has been provided at this stage or a mechanism to undertake this at reserved matters stage has been put forward. The intrusion of built form in the undeveloped countryside adjacent to the settlement would harm the intrinsic character and appearance of the countryside. The proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 9 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.2.In the absence of a ecological assessment/report on the site it cannot be concluded that the development would avoid adverse impact on existing ecological features which may be present on site. The application conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policies 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Pines Bar Road Helford Passage Hill Mawnan Smith TR11 5LF
Description: Works to trees namely - to remove a goup of 6 interwoven Monterey Pines subject to a Tree Preservation Order(TPO)
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the trees are of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contribute to the character of the local landscape. There is insufficient justification for the removal of these trees and clear and convincing arboricultural evidence to justify their loss has not been submitted. Their removal is therefore considered to result in a detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape and contrary to Policy 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land On Gannel Road Newquay TR7 1QS
Description: Prior Notification for the installation of a new 20.00m monopole supporting 6 no. antennas with a wrap around equipment cabinet at the base of the column
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority has had regard to the requirements to improve networks and recognises that there is increasing pressure on the network providers to improve the telecommunication infrastructure, however, this has to be balanced against the potential amenity impacts relating to the siting of new infrastructure. Given the insufficient information submitted regarding noise it has not be demonstrated that the proposal in respect to its siting and close proximity to noise sensitive receptors would not result in an unacceptable adverse impact upon the residential amenity of those receptors in respect to noise contrary to policies 12, 13 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 115 and 127(f) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South West Of 4 Tregajorran Carn Brea Redruth Cornwall TR15 3YZ
Description: Proposed development of a self-build dwelling following demolition of an existing stable block and removal of a static caravan.
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of its open countryside location, detached from any definable settlements, represents an undesirable and sporadic form of unsustainable development. Unsupported by any special circumstances, the provision of a new dwelling in this location would harmfully urbanise the distinctive rural landscape character which is subject to special protection through its designation within an Area of Great Landscape Value, Carn Brea Conservation Area and Camborne and Redruth Mining District World Heritage Site. The proposal would infill and overwrite a substantial section of a field which is a former mineworkers' smallholding, substantially and irrevocably harming the legibility and integrity of this attribute, resulting in an unacceptable detrimental impact upon one of the seven key attributes of the Mining World Heritage Site. The resulting harm to the authenticity and integrity of the Outstanding Universal Value of the World Heritage Site would not be wholly exceptional nor would there be any overriding public benefits. In the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policy 1 of the Cornwall Site Allocations Development Plan (Adopted November 2019), Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 117, 127, 170, 184, 192, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, policies P3, C2 and C9 of The Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2020-2025 and Section 72 (1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: 12 Ridgewood Close St Austell PL26 6AT
Description: Tree works to reduce the height/prune 3 x Sycamore trees and 1 x Beech tree subject to a TPO.
RefusalReasons: The works proposed exceed the advice for good arboricultural practice as specified by BS 3998 (Recommendations for Tree work). This will reduce the amenity value which these trees can provide to the detriment of public amenity and without adequate justification.

Address: North Rocks Sunny Corner Lane Sennen TR19 7AX
Description: Proposed first floor extension over existing footprint
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension, due to its design, scale and location, would appear overly-domineering and inappropriate in the context of the surrounding built and natural environment, which is located within an Area of Outstanding Natural BeautyThe proposed works raise concerns in relation to design and the natural and historic environment that cause harm, and that are not balanced by other factors acting in the public interest or benefit.The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 12 (paragraphs 1a and 1b), 23 (paragraph 1 and 2) and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016); Policy MD9, MD16 and SCW8.04 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016 - 2021, Sections 2.6, 2.9, 7.3 and 7.8 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013, paragraphs 127, 130, 170, 172 and 173, 192(c) of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019)

Address: Land Adjacent Trewargas Trevanson Road Wadebridge PL27 7HP
Description: Outline application for the construction of a single dwellinghouse with parking and amenity with all matters reserved.
RefusalReasons: The application site does not fulfill the criteria of infill or rounding off of a settlement andas such is located within the countryside.  The home proposed by this application wouldresult in harm to the intrinsic character and beauty of the surrounding Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The site has poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle andunsustainable traffic movements. In the absence of any special circumstances to justifyresidential development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainabledevelopment and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall LocalPlan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 80, 91 104, 112, 127, 174 and 176 ofthe National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Address: Nilgiris 6 Carrick Way St Mawes TR2 5BB
Description: Extensions and alterations to main house to provide an additional guest bedroom and a larger master bedroom to include a balcony,a new kitchen and a new entertainment room with a new stepped deck area to the front on the house facing South. New landscaping to form a parking area separate from the house. New landscaping including an outbuilding the rear of the property within the enclosed garden.
RefusalReasons: The development due to its bulk, scale and massing would have an adverse impact on the character of the area, which forms part of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty,  and is therefore contrary to Policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016) and Policies LA1, CV1 and HO9 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030.

Address: Little Hendra Boskerris Road Carbis Bay TR26 2NQ
Description: The development proposed is demolition of existing dwelling and redevelopment of the site to provide 7no new dwellings and 1no replacement dwelling not in compliance with Condition 2 attached to Planning Permission APP/D0840/W/19/3232355 (PA18/07686)
RefusalReasons: The overall scale of the development is considered to be unacceptable as it would fail to integrate successfully with the surrounding context and would be detrimental to the character of the area. The proposal would fail to reflect local distinctiveness, nor would it integrate satisfactorily with the built environment. The siting, mass and scale would unacceptably impair the outlook from within the rear facing rooms and gardens of the occupiers of Boskerris Crescent and Hendras Parc. The proposal is in conflict with policies GD1, BE12 and BE17 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan (2015 - 2030), policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 130, 131 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Kate Cant Farm St Minver Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6RL
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for a proposed extension
RefusalReasons: The proposed extension to the property, which is sited on article 2(3) land does not constitute permitted development as it fails to comply with Class A.2 (b) of Part 1 of Schedule 2 the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (as amended), as the proposed extension extends from a wall forming a side elevation of the dwelling.

Address: Land Rear Of Homeland Marias Lane Sennen Cove Penzance Cornwall TR19 7BX
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: One, two storey, three bed house, and change of use of additional land to create access
RefusalReasons: The terrace of former coastguard cottages with their west facing linear alignment set within uniform plots reflects the characteristic of development in this location. The proposal to introduce "backland" development will interrupt this pattern and give rise to an uncharacteristic addition and would neither conserve or enhance the landscape character and natural beauty of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 1 The Oaks Lewannick Launceston PL15 7FN
Description: Application for tree works: works to trees subject to a tree preservation order (TPO) Application: T1 - Sycamore - reduction for aesthetic and safety concerns. Approximately 4 - 5 meters reduction to specific branches at top of crown outside marked area to bring crown down in height and reduction of lateral branches to come inside the marked line area. 2 limbs road side to be removed to collar. 1 specified branch with die back to be removed to collar.
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the tree is of significant amenity value in the local landscape and contributes to the character of the this landscape. It's health and life expectancy are sufficient to warrant its long term retention. The extent of the works proposed would be considered to result in a detrimental impact upon the visual public amenity of the local landscape and to harm the tree physiologically such that it may reduce it longevity and long-term visual amenity

Address: Land Adj To Marazion Bypass Marazion Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission with all matters reserved: Construction of Dwelling on Commercial Land.
RefusalReasons: Previously developed land (PDL) is defined as "Land which is or was occupied by a permanent structure, including the curtilage of the developed land.". It also states that where the remains of the permanent structure or fixed surface structure have blended into the landscape it is excluded from the definition of PDL. The LPA considers the site does not meet the definition of PDL and in any event has blended into the landscape. It is considered that the site is not immediately adjoining any settlement and therefore does not accord with Policy 3 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposed development would not represent a suitable and sustainable location for housing having regard to local and national policies, with particular regard to the effect of the proposed development on the character and appearance of the area leading to harm which would not be outweighed by any overriding public benefit. In the absence of any special justification to warrant residential development in this context, the proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 117, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Gwel Teg Rosenannon Bodmin Cornwall PL30 5PJ
Description: Siting of static caravan for living and office space with regards to running horticultural business and bee keeping
RefusalReasons: In the absence of any special justification, the proposal would create an unsustainable new dwelling in the open countryside in conflict with the spatial strategy of the development plan. In addition, the proposed caravan/unit, through its introduction into an agricultural, rural and predominantly undeveloped locality would degrade the rural character of the site and wider area. As such the development conflicts with Policies 1, 2, 7, 12, 21 and 23 (1, 2) of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030 and the advice within paragraphs 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Coombe Paradise Road Boscastle Cornwall PL35 0BH
Description: Demolish existing conservatory and construction of replacement sunroom, together with balcony above and associated works.
RefusalReasons: 1 The proposed balcony as a result of its position, size, projection and height would increase overlooking and loss of privacy to the adjacent neighbouring dwellings known as Sarum and Bolans Ridge, causing an unacceptable loss of residential amenity that would be harmful to the living conditions currently enjoyed by these occupiers. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 Adopted 22nd November 2016.

Address: Velansaga Barton Farm Tregadgwith St Buryan Penzance Cornwall TR19 6BS
Description: Construction of additional holiday unit
RefusalReasons: Tregadgwith is considered a farmstead intrinsically linked to the countryside and not a settlement. The proposed development would add to the existing built form within this rural countryside location and would subsequently have a detrimental impact on the local distinctiveness and character and appearance of the surrounding landscape. The proposal would consequently erode the rural character and natural beauty of the area and would not maintain the character and distinctive landscape qualities of the Area of Great Landscape Value and Heritage Coast. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to policies 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 83, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Parc An West Red Lane Rosudgeon Penzance Cornwall TR20 9PU
Description: Erection of a dwelling and new vehicular access - amended scheme
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of its narrow plot size, shape and density would result in a cramped form of development out of character with the neighbouring pattern of development found within the immediate area. Furthermore, the removal of a section of hedge and the cutting back of the remaining roadside hedge to create adequate highways visibility to facilitate the development is considered to cause further adverse visual impact on the character of the area. Given the above, the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: Cape View House Chapel Road St Just TR19 7HS
Description: Demolition of existing and construction of new garage with first floor amenity area and associated works
RefusalReasons: The flat roof and parapet wall above the garage would be wholly at odds with and would be seen in stark contrast to the bonnet hip roof of the existing dwelling. Whilst the proposed 'box like' form would clearly be different and thus distinct from the original dwelling, It would be seen as an awkward and incongruous addition that would neither reflect nor respect the form of the existing dwelling. The proposal would cause less than substantial harm to the special interest and significance of Conservation Area. In these circumstances, paragraph 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 (NPPF) says that the harm should be weighed against the public benefits of the proposal. The benefit of a replacement garage and roof terrace would not sufficiently offset the adverse impacts upon the character of the Conservation Area. The proposal would therefore fail to preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the Conservation Area. The proposed development is in conflict with Policies 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, paragraphs 127, 130 and 131 and section 16 of the National Planning policy Framework 2019 and Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Bests Blisland Bodmin PL30 4LH
Description: Replacement dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would, through the encroachment of development and domestic curtilage within the open countryside together with the associated paraphernalia, subdivision of the field and loss of an established hedgerow shall result in significant change to the character of the area and harm to this open landscape and the distinctive qualities of the Camel & Allen Valleys Area of Great Landscape Value. Consequently, the proposal would be contrary to the aims of policies 1, 2, 7, 12, and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 124, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Marlaes Broch Mount Whistle Road South Tehidy Camborne Cornwall TR14 0HU
Description: Application for tree works within a Tree Preservation Order: Two Oaks trees to fell
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the proposal to fell two Oak trees is not justified on arboricultural grounds as there are no safety reasons, significant arboricultural defects or disorders present within the trees. The loss of the two Oak trees would cause significant detrimental impact upon the amenity of the local landscape.

Address: The Stitch Old Tram Road Point Devoran Truro TR3 6NQ
Description: Proposed Dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed dwelling is located within the countryside and does not represent infill or the rounding off of a settlement and would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding its intrinsic character. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it, the proposed dwelling represents a sporadic form of unsustainable development in the open countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policy H1 of the Feock Neighbourhood Plan 2017-2030, Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 (November 2016) and paragraphs 79 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Celtic Park Lower Metherell Callington Cornwall PL17 8BX
Description: Outline application (with all matters reserved) for construction of dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposed development by reason of its location outside of the clearly defined built form of Lower Metherell does not represent infill, rounding-off or fall within the definition of previously developed land and would visually extend the built form into the open countryside, eroding the character and appearance of the rural setting. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify it the proposal represents an unsustainable and sporadic form of development in the countryside and, in the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such harm, the proposal is contrary to Policies 1, 3, 7 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Tamarisk 23 Penmare Terrace Hayle TR27 4PH
Description: Change of use from residential dwelling to a House in Multiple Occupation for Supported Housing Accommodation and minor alterations to the garage, including replacement of doors with windows to match those on the existing house
RefusalReasons: The proposed development is situated in a predominantly residential area, with dwellings bordering the site to several aspects. With that in mind, coupled with the likely high volume of comings and goings associated with the development which could in turn give rise to noise and associated disturbances, the proposal is considered to be incompatible with its surroundings and to likely harm the residential amenities of the neighbouring properties. The proposal is therefore considered to be inappropriate for its location, taking into account the likely effects on the living conditions of the neighbours, in conflict with policies 1, 2, 12 and 16 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 127, 170 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Building North East Of Rose Cottage Grass Valley Treswithian Downs Cornwall TR14 0BP
Description: Certificate of existing lawful use of log cabin for domestic use consisting of one living room/bedroom
RefusalReasons: Based on the evidence submitted by the applicant and having regard to other information available to the local planning authority, it is not considered that the documentation provided in support of the application is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicant's onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the building referred to as 'log cabin' (as shown within the area outlined in red on the 1:400 and annotated 'log cabin') has been used for domestic use. The 'log cabin' does not contain any bathroom facilities and therefore does not have all the facilities reasonably required for day-to-day private domestic existence, is not on land with the curtilage of Rose Cottage, and is not on land considered to be garden and therefore is not incidental to Rose Cottage. The application for a certificate of lawfulness for the use of the building for domestic use fails and therefore is refused.

Address: Redundant Barn Adj Homelands Constantine Falmouth Cornwall TR11 5QA
Description: Conversion of Barn for Residential Dwelling and Landscaping of Surrounding Areas.
RefusalReasons: The building is not appropriate to retain and its conversion to residential use would not lead to an enhancement to its immediate setting. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 7, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 8, 9, 78, 79, 127, and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Polita Bridge Farm St Columb Major Cornwall TR9 6BX
Description: Proposed retention of existing engineering operations and use of land for storage and distribution (Use Class B8).
RefusalReasons: The site is in the open countryside and fails to provide suitable pedestrian accessibility to the nearest settlement or public transport interchanges. The use of the land for storage and distribution purposes and the re-profiling of the land will introduce human influences that will erode the undeveloped natural characteristics of the land and the contribution it makes to the character of the countryside. No compelling over-riding justification has been provided to grant permission in this location, the proposal is not considered to represent sustainable development and conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policy 2, 5, 12, 23, and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan and paragraphs 8, 83, 102, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: New Build South East Of Bre Pen Farm Mawgan Porth Hill Mawgan Porth Newquay Cornwall TR8 4AL
Description: Retrospective planning change of use of land to domestic curtilage by extending the red line boundary of the existing Ranch development and the construction of a garage/office space and pool. This application also seeks to regularise the small solar array, relocation of the access track which services the property and bund which has been repositioned and slightly extended.
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reasons of subdivision of a field to create extended domestic curtilage together with the associated paraphernalia including a new building, extends the existing home into the countryside to the detriment of the distinctive natural character of the surrounding Area of Great Landscape Value. The application is, therefore, contrary to the aims and intentions of saved Policy 14 of the Restormel Borough Local Plan 2001; Policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030; and paragraphs 8, 124, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Number 25 Church Road Penponds Camborne Cornwall TR14 0QE
Description: Outline application for a dwelling with all matters reserved except access
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed development would result in the intensification in the use of a substandard access, between No. 21 and No. 33 Church Road, which is significantly constrained in emerging visibility and is considered blind in both directions. The on-street parking of vehicles along Church Road adjacent to the access further restrict the forward visibility of the access for vehicles. Furthermore, the access lane is single width with limited passing places such that a vehicle may be required to reverse unsighted on the highway. The proposal would not have a safe and suitable access and therefore conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policies 1 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 108 and 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

Address: Rose Villa Farm, The Garage Penberthy Road Portreath TR16 4LW
Description: Conversion and extension of existing garage to provide residential apartment with variation of condition 2 and removal of conditions 4 and 5 of decision PA19/00355 dated 13/08/2019
RefusalReasons: The degree of overlooking resulting from the use of the proposed balcony without suitable privacy screening and the outlook provided from the first floor rear bedroom window and any subsequent windows installed in the rear elevation of the development permitted as a consequence of the removal of conditions 4 and 5, would result in unreasonable losses of privacy to the occupiers of Greenfield House in conflict with policy 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land East Of Littlewood Farm Under Lane St Mabyn Bodmin Cornwall PL30 3DG
Description: Conversion and extension of redundant agricultural building to form a residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: The site is within the countryside and divorced from services and facilities where residential development would not ordinarily be supported other than in accordance with the special circumstances set out in policy 7 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The extent of the physical alterations to the building would be of detriment to its intrinsic character and appearance and the domestication of its curtilage and removal of landscape features would not amount to an enhancement to its immediate setting as required by policy 7 and the proposal would not conserve landscape character. Accordingly, the proposal conflicts with policies 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030. The proposal does not amount to sustainable development and conflict also exists against policies 1 and 2 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 127, and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. All other maters have been considered but none override the harm identified.

Address: Land South East Of 8 Wesley Terrace Bodmin Road Bilberry Bugle Cornwall PL26 8QT
Description: The proposed erection of three detached dwellings and the formation of new vehicular access.
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of introducing 3 new homes onto undeveloped land on a prominent location at the entrance of a settlement, would harm the distinctive character of the surrounding area including the setting of the nearby terrace of homes at Wesley Terrace. The application is, therefore, not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 122 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land At St Just St Just In Roseland Cornwall
Description: New agricultural access and track with associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposal would result in a significant level of reprofiling work to the hedgebank to create the visibility splays and access ramp with gate within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty which is afforded the highest level of landscape protection and should be protected from harm. The works would appear as an artificial hedgebank with an engineered profile and result in the loss of hedgebank which contributes to the rural character of the Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and the setting of the village of St Just In Roseland and results in a harmful impact on landscape character. Insufficient information has been submitted to demonstrate that the impact can be mitigated to an extent that the economic benefits and benefit of relocating the access from Harbour View of the proposal will balance the environmental harm. The proposal therefore fails to accord with policies 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies LA1, LA2 and CV1 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015 - 2030 and paragraphs 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 together with Policy MD9 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Land East Of Leat Farmhouse Chapel Drive Launceston Cornwall PL15 8NH
Description: Proposal for a new general purpose agricultural shed
RefusalReasons: It is not considered that there is a functional need for a building for the purposes of storage of vintage tractors, a camper van, grass mower and garden tools for hobby use in this rural location. As the proposal lacks justification, the construction of a building for such a purpose would represent undesirable and unsustainable sporadic development in the open countryside which would unnecessarily erode the rural appearance of the area, failing to conserve the scenic beauty of the Area of Great Landscape Value. The proposed development is, therefore, contrary to policy 2 (1) and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and section 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019

Address: Land Adj To Wenappa Bassett Road Voguebeloth Illogan Cornwall TR16 4EX
Description: Construction of four dwellings & associated works
RefusalReasons: The site occupies a prominent location between Bassett Road to the south and the Public Right of Way to the north and forms an attractive rural setting to the edge of the settlement in this location. The development of this parcel of land with four modern dwellings would clearly erode the rural character of this location and cause material harm to the amenities of the area through adverse urbanisation.  The development would therefore cause material environmental harm to the rural character of the area on the edge of the settlement, which is contrary to policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, policies PH3 and PH4 in the Illogan Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Gonew View Lelant Downs Hayle Cornwall TR27 6NH
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for existing use for the retention of land for domestic purposes in association with the residential property known as Gonew View
RefusalReasons: Based on the documentation and evidence provided in support of the application and having regard to representations and contradictory evidence received against the application and other information available to the Authority, it is considered that the applicant has not discharged their onus of proof, to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability, the land shown outlined in red on the submitted 1:1250 site location plan (received 15.02.2021) has been used solely and continuously for purposes incidental to the residential occupancy of the property known as Gonew View for a period in excess of ten years. As such, the material change of use of land is not considered to be lawful by virtue of immunity from enforcement action in accordance with Sections 171B (3) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). For this reasons, the Certificate of Lawfulness application is refused.

Address: Govail Higher Drift Buryas Bridge TR19 6AE
Description: Proposed Change of Use of Part of Adjacent Field to Form Extension of Residential Curtilage Parking and Turning Area Via New Access Off A30
RefusalReasons: The cutting back and removal of a significant section of the existing substantial  Cornish hedge boundary to form the new vehicular access and associated visibility splay requirements along with the access track and hardstanding to form the parking area would harm the character and appearance of the open countryside which is designated as an Area of Great Landscape Value and Heritage Coast. The proposal is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Chycara House Chyreen Lane Carnon Downs Truro TR3 6LN
Description: Change of use of approved covered store to function room (retrospective) with variation of conditions 2 and 3 in respect of decision PA18/06110
RefusalReasons: 1 The applicants have not demonstrated that the increased number of functions over the next 2-3 years and later deadline for ceasing amplified music would not cause harm to local residents from increased noise and disturbance at the venue, nor have they demonstrated that adequate mitigation can been provided, in conflict with policies 12(2), 13(5) and 16(1) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, together with paragraphs 170 and 180 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adj To Number 1 St Crewenna Terrace Hayle Road Leedstown Hayle Cornwall TR27 6DD
Description: Erection of dwelling
RefusalReasons: The proposal would, by virtue of the scale, form, appearance and layout intended, appear cramped within the context of the site, discordant with the immediate built form and hence contrary to the local distinctiveness. The cramped nature of the proposal would result in a poor standard of residential amenity for its future occupants whilst also adversely impacting upon the residential amenities of the occupants of the neighbouring dwelling, as a result of overbearing relationships. As such, the proposal would be contrary to the aims and intentions of policies HT1 and HT4 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2018 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: 80 Pendarves Road Falmouth TR11 2TP
Description: Convert detached garage into holiday studio home
RefusalReasons: The proposal, by reason of its location and proximity to neighbouring properites, would cause unreasonable noise and disturbance and would be unduly harmful to the residential amenities of the occupiers of this neighbouring residence. As such, the proposal is considered to be contrary to the aims and intentions of Policies 5, 12 and 13 of the Cornwall Local Plan: Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and Paragraph 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land At Florrick Down Maker Lane Millbrook Cornwall
Description: COU Continued change of use of the land for holiday accommodation comprising four camping pitches and a shepherd's hut (caravan) with associated guest facilities comprising a compost toilet block, shower block and kitchen/dining space in a bus with a side lean-to.
RefusalReasons: The application site is located within the countryside. The proposal represents unjustified and sporadic development within the open countryside with poor accessibility to necessary daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. The proposal will result in a permanent and discernible change to the site that would result in harm to the distinctive natural character of the surrounding Area of Great Landscape Value. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 5, 21, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, Policy 5 of the Rame Peninsula Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2030, Saved Policy CL9 of the Caradon Local Plan First Alteration 2007 and paragraph 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Woodlands Praze Road Praze An Beeble Camborne Cornwall TR14 0PR
Description: Change of use of land to domestic curtilage
RefusalReasons: Insufficient evidence has been provided to demonstrate that the proposal would not adversely impact the 'Clowance House and Park' County Wildlife Site and the Biodiversity Action Plan habitat identified as woodland. No sufficient information has been submitted to confirm that the development would preserve and enhance the biodiversity of the valued landscape. In the absence of such information, the need and benefits of the development are not considered to clearly outweigh the potential loss of habitat and species and the coherence of the local ecological network. The proposal is therefore contrary to policy HLE1 of the Crowan Neighbourhood Plan 2018 - 2030, policies 1, 2, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030, and paragraphs 8 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land North Of Oak Tree Farm Coombe Hill Bissoe Cornwall TR4 8RQ
Description: Demolition of existing dilapidated barn and proposed erection of new dwelling and detached garage
RefusalReasons: The proposed development, by reason of its open countryside location detached from any definable settlements, represents an unsustainable form of development in the countryside for which no special circumstances have been demonstrated. The development would harmfully urbanise the strong rural characteristics of this area of open countryside and therefore representing an undesirable and sporadic form of development. In the absence of any other material considerations which outweigh such environmental harm, the proposal is contrary to policies GQD1, GQD2, H3, H4 and LL4 of the Gwennap Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019 - 2030, policies 1, 3, 7, 12, 23 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 108, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Lucky Barn Ruthvoes St Columb TR9 6HS
Description: Removal of a S106 Agreement in respect of Decision Notice C2/09/00308 (Conversion of barn into dwelling)
RefusalReasons: The Section 106 Planning Agreement still serves a useful planning purpose as evidenced by the level of local housing need. The modifications proposed reduce the level affordability to occupiers and do not therefore serve the original purpose of the Section 106 'equally well'. Accordingly, the application would thereby be contrary to paragraphs 56, 61 and 62 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Ow Crow Sunny Corner Portloe Truro Cornwall TR2 5RB
Description: Proposed residential dwelling for family use on land adjacent to Ow Crow, within the existing residential curtilage.
RefusalReasons: The Local Planning Authority has acted positively and proactively in determining this application by identifying matters of concern with this proposal. On this occasion, the issues are so fundamental that it is not possible to negotiate a satisfactory way forward due to the harm that has been clearly identified within the reason(s) for refusal.The proposed open market dwelling would lie outside of the settlement boundary for the village of Portloe, as defined by the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan 2015-2030, encroaching upon the open countryside and harming the distinctive character and beauty of an area that is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, to the detriment of the setting of the village. In the absence of any affordable housing provision or any other special circumstances to justify the dwelling in this context, the application is not considered to represent sustainable development and is contrary to the guidance contained in paragraphs  8, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, Policies 1, 2, 7 , 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and Policies LA1, LA2, H04, GP2 and GP3 of the Roseland Neighbourhood Development Plan May 2015 -2030.

Address: Specky Wood Trevothen Coverack Helston Cornwall TR12 6SD
Description: Application to revoke S106 agreement in respect of decision notice W2/92/00579/F
RefusalReasons: The local planning authority is satisfied that the Planning Obligation will continue to serve a useful planning purpose because it ultimately restricts the occupation of the development granted planning permission as a low-cost dwelling in perpetuity to qualifying persons with a local connection. The Planning Obligation therefore continues to be necessary to make the development acceptable in planning terms and the removal of the Obligation would result in an unfettered open market property in a rural location; contrary to policies 3, 7 and 9 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 61, 62, 77 and 79 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019. The Planning Obligation therefore accords with Government guidance set out in paragraphs 54 and 56 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and the Planning Practice Guidance.

Address: Land West Of Great Brightor Brighter Lane St Kew Highway Bodmin Cornwall PL30 3DR
Description: Outline planning permission for construction of a residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: The application site is clearly divorced from any settlement with poor non-vehicular accessibility to key daily services and facilities which would perpetuate over reliance on the private vehicle and unsustainable traffic movements. In the absence of any special circumstances to justify residential development in this rural location, the proposal is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 102, 103, 110, 127f), 148 and 150 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Address: Land Adj To 10 Treberran Gardens Tolvaddon Camborne Cornwall TR14 0HB
Description: Construction of a 3 bedroom semi-detached domestic property.
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would fail to provide one off-road parking space for each bedroom within the proposed dwelling and the dwelling to be retained. Taking into account the existing parking problems, the provision of an additional dwelling on site would result in inadquate parking provisions for the occupants of the existing and proposed dwelling, unjustified by any site specific circumstances and Cornwall Council's parking standards, thereby exacerbating the existing on-street parking problems and resulting in unacceptable highway safety issues in the locality, in conflict with policy TT2 of the Illogan Neighbourhood Development Plan 2016 - 2030, policies 13 and 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Cottage 50 Treskerby Redruth TR16 5AG
Description: Proposed demolition of existing cottage and erection of pair of semi detached houses
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed development would result in the demolition of a mineworkers cottage which formed part of a mineworkers smallholding. Mineworkers smallholdings have been identified as one of the seven key attributes that expressed the Outstanding Universal Value (OUV) of the Cornwall and West Devon World Heritage Site, which is a heritage asset of international significance. The demolition of the existing cottage would result in the total loss of historic fabric which currently maintains the integrity and authenticity of the World Heritage Site. The significance of the historic cottage would not be better revealed or enhanced. The limited public benefits of one additional dwelling and improved quality of living accommodation would not outweigh the identified harm. The proposed development would be considerably higher than the existing dwelling, and although the surrounding area does include dwellings of a modern design and similar height to that of the proposal it does not negate the fact that the development would result in the loss of an irreplaceable building. The proposed design does not outweigh the harm that would be caused by the total loss of the existing cottage. The proposed development would conflict with the aims and intentions of Policies 2, 12, 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 127, 194 and 195 of the NPPF (2019) and Policies P3, C2 and C7 of the adopted Cornwall and West Devon World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013 - 2018 and the guidance set out in and the adopted Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Supplementary Planning Document (SPD) 2017.

Address: Land West Of Trethurffe Manor Ladock Cornwall TR2 4PJ
Description: Proposed residential development comprising a cross subsidy scheme for 28 dwellings (17 affordable), estate roads, open space and landscaping
RefusalReasons: The scale of the proposed development in cumulation with the commenced development granted consent under permission reference PA17/01277 would result in a scale of development out of proportion to the size of the settlement and harmful to the character of this modest settlement which has a limited level of services and facilities. The proposal is thus contrary to Policy 2 and 9 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030.

Address: Lower Barn Court Land North Of 5 Lower Barn Court Priory Road St Columb Minor Newquay TR7 3HX
Description: Construction of a pair of semi-detached cottages
RefusalReasons: The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement. The proposed new dwelling would, therefore, result in harm to the intrinsic character of the surrounding rural setting. Given the lack of any special justification, the application is not sustainable development and is contrary to Policies G1, D1, D2 and H2 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan, Policies 1, 2, 3, 7, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 7, 8, 79, 127 and 170 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land NE Of Fir Tree Cottage Green Lane Wheal Rose Scorrier Cornwall
Description: Outline planning permission with some matters reserved for one residential dwelling
RefusalReasons: The access proposed by this application is constrained by the lack of width to allow two cars to pass along the northern route of Green Lane and poor visibility to the right for drivers exiting Green Lane onto the adjoining road. In the absence of information to demonstrate otherwise, safe and suitable access to the development for all people is therefore not provided and the application is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.The access proposed utilising the southern route is constrained by the very narrow width of the access past the dwelling known as Meadowside which does not allow safe or suitable passing or manoeuvring space and lacks forward visibility, nor would the access permit passage of larger delivery vehicles resulting in off-site parking and a likelihood of obstruction of Green Lane for other users. The proposed access along the southern route does not demonstrate a safe or suitable access for all users result in conflict with Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Trewoon Cottage Access Track To Melynjy Nancledra TR20 8NB
Description: Construction of Self Build Traditional Dwelling House and Associated Works
RefusalReasons: The site is shown by the Council's mapping to lie within the indicative Zone 3 (b) functional floodplain where new build development is strictly controlled. National Planning Policy Guidance advises that new development in Zone 3 (b) functional floodplain is limited to essential infrastructure only. In line with the above, the Environment Agency (EA) have raised an objection in-principle to the development proposal. The applicant has submitted a site specific Flood Risk Assessment (FRA) but the EA do not consider that it has adequately demonstrated that the site is not within the Zone 3 floodplain. In the absence of a FRA that accurately identifies the level of flood risk it is not clear that the development would not increase flood-risk elsewhere, that it would be appropriately flood resilient or that there is safe access/egress in a 1 in 100 year flood event. The development proposal thus does not satisfy the sequential test and conflicts with the aims and intentions of paragraphs 162 and 167 of the NPPF (2021) and policy 26 of the Cornwall Local Plan (2010-2030).

Address: Little Hendra Boskerris Road Carbis Bay TR26 2NQ
Description: Demolition of existing dwelling and redevelopment of the site to provide 7no. new dwellings and 1no. replacement dwelling along with associated parking and amenity.
RefusalReasons: The overall scale of the development is considered to be unacceptable as it would fail to integrate successfully with the surrounding context and would be detrimental to the character of the area. The proposal would fail to reflect local distinctiveness, nor would it integrate satisfactorily with the built environment. The siting, mass and scale would unacceptably impair the outlook from within the rear facing rooms and gardens of the occupiers of Boskerris Crescent and Hendras Parc. The proposal is in conflict with policies GD1, BE12 and BE17 of the St Ives Area Neighbourhood Development Plan (2015 - 2030), policies 1, 2 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 127, 130, 131 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Old Smithy Gummows Shop Summercourt TR8 4PP
Description: Certificate of Lawfulness for existing use to confirm the lawfulness of the uses of the buildings and land at The Old Smithy.
RefusalReasons: The Council does not consider that the documentation provided in support of the application at The Old Smithy, Gummows Shop, Summercourt, TR8 4PP is sufficiently precise and unambiguous to successfully discharge the applicant's onus of proof to demonstrate that, on the balance of probability: o The caravans shown as Units C and G now constitute dwellings and have been used as self-contained residential accommodation for a continuous period in excess of 4 years prior to the date of this application;  o Unit D (Double Garage) has been used in association with Unit C caravan; o Unit H has been used as a storage unit in association with the residential occupation of Unit G; o Unit B as a touring caravan used incidental to the main dwelling (Unit A); o Unit J is used for domestic equestrian use; o Units E and F are in use as commercial kennels; o Unit K are units associated with the equestrian use; o The use of rear section of the Site for a mix of uses of equestrian and agricultural. As such the application for existing uses to confirm the lawfulness of the uses of the buildings and land at The Old Smithy, as listed above is refused.

Address: Land Adj To Springfield Rice Lane Gorran Haven St Austell Cornwall PL26 6JD
Description: New 2 bedroom bungalow
RefusalReasons: The proposal by reason of the site size and development scale is considered a cramped form of development which would represent an inappropriate increase of building density at odds with established character of the surrounding area. The scheme would not represent development that would improve the character and quality of the area in conflict the aims of Policies 2, 12, 21 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and and section 2 paragraph 8, section 12 paragraph 127 point a - e, and paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land And Buildings South Of Carhart Farm St Breock Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 7HZ
Description: Proposed conversion of existing building to residential dwelling.
RefusalReasons: The application site is located within the countryside, clearly divorced from any settlement. It contains a large portal framed building which is simple in form, utilitarian in appearance and very much part of a surrounding rural landscape that is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The proposed conversion of this building to a new home will result in the building retaining the majority of its significant scale together with a much more domestic appearance alongside with a domestic curtilage and associated paraphernalia; all to the detriment of the immediate setting of the building and the distinctive character of the valued landscape. The application, therefore, fails to provide special justification to allow a new home in the countryside, is not sustainable development and is contrary to the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 7, 12 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 8, 124, 127, 170 and 172 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land Adjacent Cobble Lane My Lords Road Fraddon St Columb TR9 6JT
Description: Application for planning permission for the erection of storage building.
RefusalReasons: The proposal is located outside of any defined settlement, such that it is located within the open countryside and no overriding locational and business need has been demonstrated. The development of this parcel of agricultural land would erode the identified rural character. As such the works are not supported by policy 1, 2, 3, 5 and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 to 2030, paragraphs 8, 11, 81 a, and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and employment Policy 1: Development of employment land of the St Enoder Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: Boxx 3 Foundry Lane Hayle Cornwall TR27 4HD
Description: Demolition of existing store and re-construction on a larger footprint.
RefusalReasons: The application is not considered to be supported by sufficient information within the Heritage Impact Assessment in order to understand the significance of the existing building as a local heritage asset. Therefore, the demolition of the non-designated heritage asset within the Hayle Conservation Area, the Port of Hayle World Heritage Site and adjacent to a scheduled monument to the west is not considered justified. The development fails to comply with S72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Policy HB1 of the Hayle Neighbourhood Plan 2014 - 2030, policies 2 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, and paragraph 194 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 13 Riverside Avenue Newquay TR7 1PW
Description: Proposed carport
RefusalReasons: The proposal shall lead to limited public benefits through the construction of the development and the enhanced enjoyment of the site. However, the proposal, through the loss of the existing wall which forms part of a wider frontage, shall adversely impact upon the existing character of the site and wider area. Moreover, the proposal, due to its siting and use shall lead to the removal of a single public parking space which would represent an undesirable loss. The harm and public impact is considered to outweigh the limited public benefits outlined and the proposal would not represent sustainable development. Accordingly, the proposal conflicts with Policy 1, 2, 12 and 21 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2010-2030, Policy D1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan and Paragraph 8 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: 7 Polkirt Heights Mevagissey St Austell Cornwall PL26 6TT
Description: Retrospective permission for a shed and lower deck area
RefusalReasons: Due of their siting, when viewed from the historic heart of the village the structures would be perceived as part of the built environment of the host building which erodes the open space separating these modern houses from their historic neighbours. Consequently they would have a negative visual impact on an historic asset and become a part of a protected landscape. This would conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 2,12, 23 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 (Adopted 22nd November 2016), Policies D1, D5 and HC1 of the Mevagissey Parish Neighbourhood Development Plan 2017-2032 policies D1, D5 and HC1, and paragraphs 172, 190, 192, 193 and 196 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and policy CC1 of the Cornwall Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty Management Plan 2016-2021.

Address: Cleswyth Creegbrawse St Day Redruth Cornwall TR16 5QF
Description: Proposed two storey extension to the existing cottage
RefusalReasons: By reason of it being out of scale with the host dwelling and through the use of an overtly modern/industrial design language and materials, not reading as a subservient addition to the dwelling and this combined with its out of keeping design does not conserve or enhance the historic character and form of the dwelling which contributes towards the Outstanding Universal Values of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site the heritage significance of which draws the highest level of protection. The development fails to represent good design and conflicts with policies 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, paragraphs 8, 127 and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 and Policies P3, C2, C3, C8 and C9 of the adopted WHS Management Plan 2020-2025 and the adopted WHS SPD 2017.

Address: Land South Of School House Sancreed Road Sancreed Cornwall TR20 8QS
Description: Construction of dwelling and associated works
RefusalReasons: The proposed development would increase the amount of vehicular traffic accessing and egressing to and from the site, which due limited visibility for drivers exiting the junction with the main road would increase the risk of a collision.   The application, therefore, fails to provide safe and suitable access and is contrary to Policy 27 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010-2030 and paragraphs 108 - 110 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Land South Of Rosevear Trembrase Sennen Cornwall TR19 7BN
Description: Erection of 3 dwellings
RefusalReasons: The proposed development has made some positive changes since the previous refusal, notably the reduction in the scale of development and the retention of most of the existing trees. However, the proposed dwellings would nonetheless be situated in very close proximity to the trees, which would likely give rise to issues of overshadowing and other nuisances associated with trees in close proximity and would in turn increase pressure for their felling. In this eventuality, the benefits of the trees - both as a rare grouping of preserved trees in this harsh, exposed landscape and which soften the built form to the north-east (not to mention the proposed development itself) - would be diminished if not lost altogether and, consequently, the proposal would give rise to a significant adverse effect on the rural character of the area. This environmental harm is not considered to be commensurate with the relatively modest economic and social benefits arising from three, open market dwellings, and therefore the proposal is not considered to represent sustainable development. The proposal is therefore considered to conflict with the aims and intentions of policies 1, 2, 12, 23 and 25 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030; Policy CC-5 of the Penwith Local Plan 2004; and paragraphs 8, 130, 131 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Address: Barn North West Of Tredrizzick House Tredrizzick St Minver Wadebridge Cornwall PL27 6PB
Description: Conversion and extension of traditional farm building to a residential dwelling together with the creation of a new access track and entrance
RefusalReasons: The development proposed by virtue of the proposed access will extend the built form of development into the open countryside resulting in diminishment of the surrounding natural environment, in particular, the south west and south eastern boundaries to the wider agricultural field which are considered to represent a clear and physical separation between the open countryside and the built form of the wider settlement. The proposed access and access track would clearly not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting and would be widely visible from the adjacent public highway with some further views possible from the Public Right of Way system surrounding the site. The economic and social benefits of the proposal would not outweigh the harm to the rural environment. The proposal is contrary to policies 2(1),12 and 23 (1 and 2) of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies, which seek to sustain local distinctiveness and character, and protect and where possible enhance Cornwall's natural environment, Paragraphs 8, 130 and 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and Policies STMNDP 1, STMNDP 2 and STMNDP 2.7 (vi) of the St Minver Parishes Neighbourhood Development Plan.

Address: St Columb Minor Methodist Church Church Street St Columb Minor Newquay TR7 3ES
Description: Listed Building Consent for conversion of Grade II listed former chapel into two apartments. Demolish flat roof extension and erect six apartments
RefusalReasons: The proposed change of use would cause less than substantial harm to the Grade II Listed Church. This harm would be at the higher end of the scale due to the loss of significant fixtures and fittings and the enclosure of the open, grand and atmospheric character of the interior. It has not been demonstrated that other, less harmful uses for the building are not possible. The benefits of the proposal do not outweigh the identified harm. The proposal would therefore conflict with Policy 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan 2016; Policy HC1 of the Newquay Neighbourhood Development Plan 2019; and paragraphs 193, 194 and 196 of the NPPF; and Section 16 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Address: Land Rear Of 6 Carnyorth Terrace Carnyorth Terrace Carnyorth St Just Cornwall TR19 7QE
Description: Construction of Single Dwelling & Associated Works
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed development would infill an existing gap within the settlement, which is considered to contribute to the character and appearance of the World Heritage Site (WHS) and Conservation Area (CA) in Carnyorth. As such the development of the site would fail to preserve its current character. This would result in harm to the landscape character and significance of the WHS and Conservation Area. The degree of harm is considered to be less than substantial. Paragraph 196 of the NPPF requires such harm to be weighed against the public benefits of the proposal. The proposal would offer a unit of residential accommodation to the settlement, which has wider economic and social benefits. However, these benefits are considered to be modest and would not outweigh the loss of the existing gap which contributes to the character and appearance of the WHS and CA in Carnyorth. The proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2, 12 and 24 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Policies C2 and C7 of the Cornwall and West Devon Mining Landscape World Heritage Site Management Plan 2013 - 2018, paragraphs 8, 127, 192 and 196 of the NPPF (2019), and Section 72(1) of The Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended.

Address: Beech Cottage St Breward Bodmin Cornwall PL30 4NU
Description: Proposal to fell Beech Trees T1 and T2
RefusalReasons: It is the opinion of the Local Planning Authority that the trees are of significant public amenity value to the village of St Breward and contribute to the character of the area sufficient to warrant retention of the trees. There is no clear and convincing evidence to justify the loss of the trees.  Removal is therefore considered to result in a detrimental impact upon the public amenity of the village.

Address: Land East Of 31 Hawks Tor Drive Lewannick Launceston Cornwall PL15 7QY
Description: Construction of a single dwelling with parking and a garden.
RefusalReasons: The proposal would represent a cramped form of development. The proposed development of the site with a dwelling, by reason of the location and depth of the plot, and location of the dwelling in relation to properties to the west, would result in an awkward and contrived development that would be discordant with the established pattern, form and spacing of dwellings in the locality, and fail to respond positively to local character or add to the overall quality of the area. The development is therefore contrary to Policies 1, 2, and 12 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030, Sections 4.8, 4.9, 4.10 of the Cornwall Design Guide 2013 and paragraphs 8, 124 and 127 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: Redundant Barn And Land West Halabezack Farm Halabezack Porkellis Cornwall TR13 0LD
Description: Conversion of a disused former agricultural building to a single dwellinghouse
RefusalReasons: The development proposed will significantly alter the utilitarian and functional appearance of this barn which clearly relates to this rural landscape and its agricultural setting. The building is not considered to be a suitably constructed redundant rural building that would be considered appropriate to retain and its conversion to residential use would clearly not lead to an enhancement to the immediate setting on a site that is widely visible from the nearby Public Right of Way (PROW). The extensive glazing and domestic alterations proposed in the conversion will fundamentally alter the perception of the building such that it will be recognised as an incongruous residential form that will harm the strong rural characteristics of this landscape and detract from the character and appearance of the adjoining approved development of residential barn conversions. Given the inappropriate and unsustainable form of new housing development in this rural area, the proposed development will be detrimental to the character and appearance of the countryside in this location. As such, the proposal conflicts with policies 2, 7, 12 and 23 in the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 79, 108, 110 127, 130 and 170 in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Address: The Old Nursery Higher Penponds Road Penponds Camborne Cornwall TR14 0QG
Description: Erection of two dwellings and formation of new access
RefusalReasons: 1.The proposed development would result in the loss of an undeveloped greenfield site within the settlement. The construction of two dwellings on site would alter the character and appearance of the site which provides an important green setting for Penponds and holds a visual amenity value as an open space area. The proposal conflicts with the aims and intentions of Policies 1, 2 and 23 of the Cornwall Local Plan Strategic Policies 2010 - 2030 and paragraphs 8, 127 and 170 of the NPPF (2019).
